58.description: Everything was great (especially the pot pie) except the scary clown at the bar. Why is that a thing!? Im going to have nightmares of that clown.

56.description: This tasty treasure is across the street from my hotel. From the person who answered the phone to the precious young woman who delivered my meal to my room, the experience was terrific. The caesar salad was cold and fresh and the lobster macaroni and cheese was hot and cheesy. YUM! From the time I placed the order to the delivery, it took 18 minutes. Attention guests of The Rafaello: Call them!!!!!!!

29.description: I have been a big fan until tonight.  A night of many apologies, all I wanted was a good meal. It was thanksgiving night, the dry turkey didn't give me reason to give thanks.  My wife's well done, "medium rare burger didn't add to the experience.  The managers lame excuse of new broiler cook was sad. My apologies was an often heard phrase that night.  We were offered dessert, the chocolate chip cookies which should have been nice and gooey on the first bite was hard and tough to eat.  The extra star was for the jalapeño cornbread which was very good. Less apologies and more attention to plates coming out of the kitchen.

42.description: We loved this place!!!  Brought out family of four - two teenagers.   The burger was outrageously HUGE!  Ingredients very fresh and service was friendly.  We were there on a gorgeous afternoon and the patio was perfect.  A very nice way for us to end our trip in Chicago last week.   Glad we found it.

23.description: Came to Chicago on a business trip.  After checking in to the Westin, I was looking for someplace close. This place won the toss.  I wish I went through the Yelp reviews because the people always get it right.  First off the place was packed.  I wish we walked out but didn't feel like getting in a cab.  I went with the breakfast buffet (24.00), and truthfully wasn't worth the price at all.  The eggs were definitely not fresh but from a carton. Really? The potatoes were dry and lacked flavor.  The bacon and sausage was ok but going back to the 24.00 price tag.  No good bread, or crusty rolls.  My daughter got the breakfast taco, which again used the carton fake eggs, crumbled chorizo which we couldn't find, and a hot sauce.  Very small portion, and not worth the price. Gave 2 stars cause I was feeling generous.  Wouldn't go back again.

47.description: Outstanding value! Quality is excellent and prices are about half of all of the surrounding restaurants. Can't do better on the million dollar mile for value. Service is excellent, outdoor seating is a pleasure.

8.description: I recently moved in around the corner from this spot and the Yelp reviews looked good so I decided to try it out! I went for breakfast with a friend of mine and we weren't impressed. Upon looking at the menu I noticed the prices were high (which is common for the neighborhood) but what was bothersome was the lack of options. The menu doesn't allow you to have pancakes and eggs without paying for their $25 buffet. They also don't have an option to order a side of eggs or a side of pancakes to add to your meal (or sub your toast for a pancake).When our food arrived (after taking 30 min) it was warm and the portions were large. However, my friends order was wrong (she asked for bacon but got ham) and my eggs were extremely runny. The hash brown "cake" that came with the meal was also very peculiar. Honestly, it seemed like the food we were served came from the buffet.The entire time we were there, carts of dishes and linens were being wheeled back and forth which was disruptive. Our server was really nice and attentive which was a positive. I'll give it another shot for a different meal, but not breakfast.

31.description: I arrived in Chicago kind of late and this was connected to the Hilton where I was staying, so I decided it was convenient enough. When I was looking at the menu outside of the restaurant, a local told me it was good. It seems like a bar/restaurant for the local after work folks because it seemed like the bar tenders knew everyone's name. The clientele and staff were extremely friendly and baseball was on every TV..what more can you ask for!?I ordered a burger and asparagus and wow was it delicious! It was probably the best burger I've ever had and I've had a lot of burgers. I was told that they get their beef every morning from a local Chicago butcher. I'd like to say that I eat for function not for flavor, so I am not easily impressed with food and rarely need to visit a restaurant twice. I would highly recommend coming to this restaurant if you're near the magnificent mile and I will definitely be returning. Five stars without a doubt!

34.description: I am from California and staying at the hotel for 4 days. I waited 40 mins to get my to-go order at the bar. The server/bartender did not even mention that that they have so many clients and orders might take a little bit longer. The manager Ryan mentioned that he will take care of my order next time. And order time should be 20-25 mins usually. What makes he think I am going to eat there again? So disappointed.Managers should be able to assess and manage late serving and start yelling customers if they are willing to wait.

16.description: Not really as great as Yelp makes it out to be. I went for lunch and had a sampling of everything - soup, salad, and sandwich. Sandwich and salad were subpar, but the chicken noodle soup was absolutely excellent. The waiter was friendly, but sparse and took a long time to take our orders despite the restaurant being empty aside from two other tables. For the location and the price, you can do much better than The Local.

13.description: Very cozy and unpretentious restaurant with lots of comfort food. Coveys a very neighborhood, local feel that is good for a nightcap, dinner or just a bar to stop and watch a game before heading home. We stopped for dinner and everything we ordered was good. I had a burger with fries, and side salad and everything was good. Nothing fancy but all good. The service was prompt and friendly. Next time I would love to try breakfast here.

11.description: We stopped by on a Sunday evening for dinner without reservations. Seated by a very friendly hostess. Our server, Jake was excellent and on top of his game. We had to try the famous Cornbread and this alone was worth the stop. Wifey had the Roasted Beets Salad and says it was one of the best she's ever had. I tried the Catch of the Day-Seabass and this was fantastic as well. One thing that I really liked about the Local, after we were served our dinners, our server picked up a group of 13 people. This usually means everyone else suffers while the huge group gets started. Not here, the Manager actually appeared and covered the tables while our Server was tied down. Great service. Highly recommend The Local.

39.description: it was middle of the road. not bad, not great. worth a quick bite,  but not worth going out of the way for.

37.description: Yummy is the best word to describe my fantastic lobster roll! The bread was fresh and soft; the amount of lobster salad provided was overflowing; and the French fries were perfectly cooked! The service was impeccable and everyone were friendly and welcoming. I sat on the outside patio which offered plenty of people watching and warm breezes! When I have the opportunity to return to the beautiful city of Chicago, this will be on my place to visit!

0.description: Full disclosure: I only came in here for drinks, so I can't comment on the food.  My review is solely based on my night cap experiences.  (I was staying at the attached hotel).They have a great full bar selection with some random off-the-wall offerings.  One of the bartenders introduced me to roasted pecan infused vodka, so I'm happily making my own now.  :)  I'll dock a star for the sometimes slow service, which happens some late nights when bigger groups come in.  So, it wasn't perfect, but I would definitely come back if I were in the area.  Not sure I'd seek it out without knowing it first now, just because it feels like it's part of the hotel and not its own entity, but that's not really a ding against them.Great service when they aren't super busy, friendly staff, and great drink selection.  Oh, and this is the first place where I ever had Malört.  Take that for what it's worth.

38.description: I needed a place close to my hotel and the menu was somewhat limited so I got macaroni and cheese along with the pot roast, the carrots and potatoes were under cooked and now one ever asked how my food was.I asked for the chocolate chip cookie to go and since it was $9 and even verified that it was hot and when I got to my hotel it was cold.  What a disappointment and it didn't taste fresh at all.  Another tip is do not sit near the bar closest to the kitchen, all you can hear are the cooks calling out their orders and the servers yelling at them for taking to long.

51.description: My waitress couldn't care less about my lactose intolerance. I came in with my group on Saturday for lunch and asked about the ingredients on the menu which she proceeded to give me a gluten-free menu that she said also 'works' for dairy allergies. I was confused and asked her if that means that the chocolate mousse under desserts is made without dairy which she brushed away and said yes. She obviously didn't care. I tried to order an item from that menu and then she said it was no longer being served. I gave up on the gluten free menu that she was insisting me to use and asked her to ask the kitchen about a couple of items from the regular menu. When I was finally able to make my order, I kindly asked her to make sure the order came without cheese. She served the salad to me with cheese which she took back to the kitchen for a second and they took out the cheese from the top. I could still see bits of it in the salad but I was annoyed I had to not eat my salad. I would never come back even if I had a different waitress bc the manager was there but never came to my table to help the clueless waitress with my ordering.

27.description: The local is a great little place to have drinks, dinner, or a combination thereof. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I was staying at the Hilton for the days leading up to our wedding and the friendly bartenders were very good to me and all the guests coming into town. They made Chicago proud and helped create indelible memories during a very magical time. Thanks guys!

32.description: We stopped by on a Sunday evening for dinner without reservations. Seated by a very friendly hostess. Our server, Jake was excellent and on top of his game. We had to try the famous Cornbread and this alone was worth the stop. Wifey had the Roasted Beets Salad and says it was one of the best she's ever had. I tried the Catch of the Day-Seabass and this was fantastic as well. One thing that I really liked about the Local, after we were served our dinners, our server picked up a group of 13 people. This usually means everyone else suffers while the huge group gets started. Not here, the Manager actually appeared and covered the tables while our Server was tied down. Great service. Highly recommend The Local.

54.description: Ugh worst breakfast/lunch place ever. It's called the local but all the food tastes like it got exported from IHOP. I'm pretty sure my smoked chicken omelette came from a carton and my boyfriends basic egg plate was unappetizing as well. Never again.

48.description: Great menu, too.  Visiting Chicago, we were delighted to find this place.   Thankyou, Yelp!

44.description: Since our hotel was right around the corner we ended up eating here a couple of times. Twice we had breakfast and we tried the buffet once. The food here is tasty and you get plenty of it. We felt eating here was a very good way to start our day and we wouldn't be hungry for quite a while. The staff is very friendly. If I visit Chicago again I'll definitely swing by The Local Chicago for breakfast. Needles to say I recommend this place.

24.description: The food and service were good.  It's not as casual as the reviews indicate, and while the kids liked the food, I wouldn't describe this as a family/ kid friendly restaurant.  The fish stew was great though and even the kids liked it.  Recommend for a casual date night.

7.description: The Local.  Hmmmmm . . . . . .it's located in a hotel which seems to scream not local, but who am I to judge??  I'll go and check it out for myself.While it is the restaurant for the Hilton Hotel that it sits in, the Local does a pretty good job of catering to the local neighborhood as well.  And knowing that the roots to this casual environment are soundly rooted in Chicago Cut and C Chicago, you know that the food is going to be high quality as well as having a really well stocked bar.I was meeting some friends which is always my favorite way to check out a new spot as I get to taste a wide range of the menu.  While there is a separate dining room, we choose to just grab a booth in the bar which are "first come first served".A couple of must haves are the jalapeno cornbread (and if it isn't decadent enough they spread some kind of maple pecan butter over the top . . .be still my waistline!) and the blue cheese fondue chips.  Our server described those as a sort of "nacho" with blue cheese and truffle oil but trust me.  Other than there is a cheesy sauce on chips any similarity is a stretch.  These things were amazing!We ordered simple entrees of the pot pie, the ribs and a burger.  All were very tasty and were served by a team of people who did a nice job in making us feel welcome.  And the bartender poured an excellent drink.  Another plus in my book is that they have a range of wines by the glass. They are quick to tell you their house, but offer a couple of upgrades if you are interested.You can tell that "table touching" is inherent even in this low end of their brand as I have seen it in their fine dining restaurants as well.  The manager stopped by to make sure we were all taken care of which is always a nice touch.So while the name still is a bit confusing for a restaurant in a hotel, The Local did a good job of convincing this local girl that another visit to try out more of that "comfort food" menu would be in order.See you at The Local!

49.description: Good service and good food. Nice selection of beers! Jalapeño corn bread is definitely worth trying.

40.description: Great food as always, vanilla french toast was amazing, and the buffet was also quite nice. I keep coming back

53.description: We stayed at the Hilton hotel and were hungry before going to bed. So we went to the Local downstairs. The food was really good! We got the fish and chips and my brother got the TLC burger. The food came in large portions - my girlfriend and I split the fish and chips and it was plenty of food for the both of us. At first I thought the food was really overpriced - but the quality of the food and the amount of food served made up for it. The service was terrible, which is why I am not giving it 4 stars. Our waiter was incredibly rude and never asked if we wanted refills and we felt as if we were bothering him the whole time. All we wanted was for him to do his job, but it seemed as if he was angry with us the entire time even though we were polite throughout our meal. Also, they don't give you enough ketchup. They fill the cup not even half way and we had to ask several times for more ketchup and each time he brought a cup that was barely full. Boo that waiter. Props to the chef.

30.description: after a night of dinner and drinks at another restaurant, my husband and I stopped by to just grab a quick cocktail before seeing the last of the navy pier fireworks this summer. it wasn't too busy around 9:30pm, which was actually nice. the problem came when the bartender looked annoyed with us and was rushing us to place an order. the other problem? the drinks were terrible. mind you, these are their "specialty cocktails" and they were unbearable. we paid 13/drink (which I'm learning is becoming the standard) and left it at the table after taking 2 sips. I couldn't even make myself finish it, it was THAT Terrible. I wish our waiter could have come to our table to check on us, but he looked like he could have cared less.

46.description: Amazing service, bacon wrapped dates and deviled eggs are a must!! Had the best experience there for dinner. Quality food.

1.description: This place is completely disreputable.  I was researching places near the drake for Valentine's Day dinner.  We selected this place based on the menu and prices posted on the website.  This reservation was made late January early February.  On February 11 I get a phone call telling me that the restaurant will only be serving a fixed price menu at 60 dollars per person.  When I expressed annoyance about the late notice the manager was extremely rude, brusque and disrespectful.  It is NOT acceptable to practice such bait and switch tactics.  In this day and age in that market it is inexcusable to make such a decision at the last minute.  Everyone knows when Valentine's Day is and this should have been planned.

55.description: Not the slightest bit impressed. The pot roast was passable and the chicken was rubbery. We were seated outside on a beautiful night but the table was warped kind of like a hill. When the drinks were set down, they looked as if they were about to fall off.

9.description: The food is great. The service is really good. The coffee is average at best, but the Applewood bacon is delicious. Norma provides outstanding customer service; and the manager, Alex Estefan, is a class all his own, excellent manager. If you're hungry for breakfast, I'd definitely recommend that you eat here.  Thumbs up.

26.description: Ordered the cornbread everydayyyy while here on conference. Luckily it comes as room service for Hilton so got my fix in the comfort of my bed while watching people freeze outside looking for a bite. The Oreo mint pie is also great if you're into chocolate/mint dessert.

25.description: I recently moved in around the corner from this spot and the Yelp reviews looked good so I decided to try it out! I went for breakfast with a friend of mine and we weren't impressed. Upon looking at the menu I noticed the prices were high (which is common for the neighborhood) but what was bothersome was the lack of options. The menu doesn't allow you to have pancakes and eggs without paying for their $25 buffet. They also don't have an option to order a side of eggs or a side of pancakes to add to your meal (or sub your toast for a pancake).When our food arrived (after taking 30 min) it was warm and the portions were large. However, my friends order was wrong (she asked for bacon but got ham) and my eggs were extremely runny. The hash brown "cake" that came with the meal was also very peculiar. Honestly, it seemed like the food we were served came from the buffet.The entire time we were there, carts of dishes and linens were being wheeled back and forth which was disruptive. Our server was really nice and attentive which was a positive. I'll give it another shot for a different meal, but not breakfast.

12.description: I want to start off by saying that the food and waiters here are excellent... I can always count on the food being fresh and servers being very friendly and informative. I do however want to complain about a manager who worked yesterday morning. I cannot believe how unprofessional, aggressive and demeaning he is. I don't appreciate his business card being shoved in my face, or how he talks to the employees. Talk about power trip! I heard him talking down screaming at the staff and chef. If it weren't for this obnoxious person, I would rate this restaurant the highest rating!Please do something about this guy before you lose business.

59.description: Staff is fantastic, food is mediocre, ambiance is fun - this is for dinner and after hours. Staff gets it all the stars.Don't go for breakfast, no bueno - better for drink appetizers on the evening.

21.description: My big bro was in town for work and staying at the Hilton.  This was a perfect choice after traveling and putting in a full day.Our server was quite attentive and promptly started us off with some cocktails.  The menu is very user friendly, with approachable options along the comfort food route.I had a one of the specials which was a generous portion of savory sweet short ribs and potatoes.  Oomph...big filling portion!And the perfect ending?  Free Hoosier Mama pie for everyone!

17.description: Visited Chicago at the end of March and got to experience some snow. That is awesome to a Las Vegan, but my thin desert blood can't handle it. Needed to pop into a place and drink to warm up.We were very happy to stumble into this place. Although we were not going to be eating here, the drinks and the customer service made this a perfect place for us.It is attached to a hotel and some of the clientele were quite a bit older than us. The bartenders remembered everybody's name that came in and out of there, which provided a more regular or local atmosphere (LOCAL IS IN THE NAME!)Super attentive service, a couple of local brews on tap, and access to clean bathrooms made this a perfect place for us to grab a drink. Our bartender gave us so many tips on places to see (and places we actually wanted to check out, not just tourist traps). I can tell when bartenders or wait staff are being forceful in their customer service, but the service and helpfulness came from sincerity.

10.description: Came here late night for dinner and it was worth the drive. The corn bread is a must. Everything off the menu was great food was a high priced but what would you expect downtown Chicago. The service was great food came out right away the dinner menu was limited though. I definitely would come back to try breakfast.

5.description: Shout-out to The Local for being open on Thanksgiving.Shout-out to them for having the option to order their Thanksgiving menu or their regular menu.Shout-out to the friendly and attentive waitress...didn't catch her name, think she had reddish hair. And shout-out to that meatloaf and mashed potatoes. Yes, you want to order it. You sure do. All in all, no complaints here!

3.description: I got the turkey club sandwich and the portion was huge! I was so stuffed after eating half of it. Very generous on the meat and chips! The wheat bread they use was very hearty too. Bursting with grains.My dad got their burger and he said it was good. Prices are definitely worth how much they give you. I feel like they give too much chips and fries though; it gives somewhat of a "quantity over quality" vibe. Luckily, the quality of the food was ok. Service was very attentive, but then again, the place is practically empty when we came in for lunch. This is a great casual spot that's near the hotels. If I happen to be the area again, I might stop by here again.

35.description: I had the pot roast which was FANTASTIC. The service was really and my server was,excellent.  He was very attentive but not enough to irritate.

19.description: Fantastic food and service! Our hotel recommended the restaurant and we were not disappointed! The service with Sean was fabulous (great recommendations) and we were very impressed the manager Peter took the time to visit our table to make sure we were enjoying our meal. Great conversation and atmosphere. We will be recommending the restaurant to all friends and family in and out of the area.

28.description: There are few if any restaurants that would get one star from me. This one deserves Zero stars.Here is what happened: last Sunday I had a guest so we walked the one block to brunch at 11:50. Walked in and one hostess told us the brunch buffet was done. Another host/manager said that it wasn't. So I asked if we could get brunch. Oh yes, they said. ?What? So the hostess walked us to an outside table. We ordered brunch: my guest ordered eggs Benedict and I ordered one blueberry pancake, and one order of bacon.The Eggs Benedict came & the waitress said, "Here are your poached eggs" and there was one small drop of Hollandaise on one of the eggs. They were not well poached but very misshapen. My one pancake came, it was fine (a little curled up on the ends-but okay). I got cold syrup, and asked for some warm syrup, butter and my bacon, and extra Hollandaise. Okay, I see our waitress walk away, joke with another server, hang over the counter laughing...no bacon, no syrup, no butter, no extra Hollandaise. I see her go to a table and talk to customers, now my pancaked is cold. My guest finds a hair in her eggs Benedict!!!! We are still waiting....we get up and decide to leave when our bacon comes out, and butter. No syrup. No Hollandaise. We told them we were leaving.  Bye-bye! Some way to run a restaurant. Wow. There was no one in the restaurant while all others are packed. That should have been our first clue!! Won't go again. The owners also have Chicago Cut which is great. Too bad they have lost interest in The Local!

45.description: We spent the weekend at the Hilton Suites for Bryn's birthday. little did we know it was the air and water show when we made the reservations. Anyhow, we had a great time with the thousands of other tourists swarming the streets. On Sunday when it was time to leave we woke the girls up early (10:30 by their standards) and went down to the hotel lobby to eat at The Local. We were REALLY surprised with the quality and prices at The Local. I had breakfast tacos, Mellody and Bryn each had the salmon plate and Ami had the Belgian waffle and bacon (she can do that, she's skinny). All in all the food was fresh, tasty and the service was professional and right on top of things. I highly recommend this for breakfast if you find your self in the area after you awake.cheers,

33.description: Came here late night for dinner and it was worth the drive. The corn bread is a must. Everything off the menu was great food was a high priced but what would you expect downtown Chicago. The service was great food came out right away the dinner menu was limited though. I definitely would come back to try breakfast.

43.description: Great breakfast pork belly was good, lobster eggs bendict great, food was good but expensive, they also had a great selection of hot tea, outdoor eating area was nice....would def come back

2.description: First I want to say if I could give this place a 3.5, I would.  The service was quick and good and the ambiance was nice for dinner.  My boyfriend and I were here on vacation and went on a Sunday night.  It was pretty empty, but we weren't concerned because it was Sunday after all.  We ordered a bottle of wine, a chicken pot pie, and a steak salad.  The chicken pot pie was piping hot when it came out (I was warned by the waiter), and when it cooled down, it was delicious. It was a huge portion, very rich, very comforting.  The steak salad was also very good.  The portion there could be bigger for price, but it was cooked very well.The reason I am giving this place a "3.5" is because of a mishap we had with the wine.  We ordered a bottle of Malbec that was around $30, and the waiter brought us a Malbec that was around $50.  It seemed like an honest mistake, so we were not too upset, but when the check came out we were still charged for the $50 bottle that we did not order, but they gave us a free dessert (worth around $8).  The gesture was nice, and the oreo cookie cake was incredible, but it was a kind of awkward situation to be in.

18.description: We stayed at the Hilton hotel and were hungry before going to bed. So we went to the Local downstairs. The food was really good! We got the fish and chips and my brother got the TLC burger. The food came in large portions - my girlfriend and I split the fish and chips and it was plenty of food for the both of us. At first I thought the food was really overpriced - but the quality of the food and the amount of food served made up for it. The service was terrible, which is why I am not giving it 4 stars. Our waiter was incredibly rude and never asked if we wanted refills and we felt as if we were bothering him the whole time. All we wanted was for him to do his job, but it seemed as if he was angry with us the entire time even though we were polite throughout our meal. Also, they don't give you enough ketchup. They fill the cup not even half way and we had to ask several times for more ketchup and each time he brought a cup that was barely full. Boo that waiter. Props to the chef.

41.description: Great food and service. Sean and the manager on duty (David I think) were wonderful. My daughters 10th bday and they made her feel like a princess. Food was fantastic. We will be back. Thank you!

52.description: The food and service were excellent. We had the mussels appetizer, the Cioppino stew, the marinated skirt steak, and a chocolate chip cookie for dessert.

50.description: Good food but AMAAAAZING service. Our waitress was cracking us up!! The place is big, clean, well lit, and the workers are great.Kinda pricey for breakfast though. But j have to say, the Belgian waffle and the hasbrowns are awesome.

4.description: Great food - service was great as usual . We frequent this restaurant and a coupe others that they have and always have a great time. The 1/2 steak sandwich and soup - salad combo , the local box , was awesome. I will continue to go to all of the restaurants that they own, especially The Local!

6.description: It was the only place nearby that wasn't $$$ or more open after 10pm.  So, I opted for a Chicken Pot Pie, a side salad, and a beer.  I added dessert because the meal was "ok", and I felt the place needed a chance.First, the salad was crisp, fresh, and made of nutritional greens, tomatoes, carrots, and fresh cheese.  The house vinaigrette was delicious.  The Chicken Pot Pie was my issue.  It looked great!  Yeah, looked.  The pastry was flaky on top, but still a bit gummy.  The pot was rather deep, so the pastry never really touched the filling, which was only half filled in the pot.  The filling was flavorful, but quite a bit was burned to the bottom of the pot.  It was rather dissappointing.Dessert was delicious.  I have the Oreo Mint Ice Cream Cookie.  It was somewhat of a decomposed ice cream sandwich.  The ice cream was awesome, the cookie (hidden under whipped cream) was still crunchy and tasted great.  And the whole thing sat on cookie crumbs and chocolate syrup.  Oh boy.

22.description: The Local.  Hmmmmm . . . . . .it's located in a hotel which seems to scream not local, but who am I to judge??  I'll go and check it out for myself.While it is the restaurant for the Hilton Hotel that it sits in, the Local does a pretty good job of catering to the local neighborhood as well.  And knowing that the roots to this casual environment are soundly rooted in Chicago Cut and C Chicago, you know that the food is going to be high quality as well as having a really well stocked bar.I was meeting some friends which is always my favorite way to check out a new spot as I get to taste a wide range of the menu.  While there is a separate dining room, we choose to just grab a booth in the bar which are "first come first served".A couple of must haves are the jalapeno cornbread (and if it isn't decadent enough they spread some kind of maple pecan butter over the top . . .be still my waistline!) and the blue cheese fondue chips.  Our server described those as a sort of "nacho" with blue cheese and truffle oil but trust me.  Other than there is a cheesy sauce on chips any similarity is a stretch.  These things were amazing!We ordered simple entrees of the pot pie, the ribs and a burger.  All were very tasty and were served by a team of people who did a nice job in making us feel welcome.  And the bartender poured an excellent drink.  Another plus in my book is that they have a range of wines by the glass. They are quick to tell you their house, but offer a couple of upgrades if you are interested.You can tell that "table touching" is inherent even in this low end of their brand as I have seen it in their fine dining restaurants as well.  The manager stopped by to make sure we were all taken care of which is always a nice touch.So while the name still is a bit confusing for a restaurant in a hotel, The Local did a good job of convincing this local girl that another visit to try out more of that "comfort food" menu would be in order.See you at The Local!

15.description: My big bro was in town for work and staying at the Hilton.  This was a perfect choice after traveling and putting in a full day.Our server was quite attentive and promptly started us off with some cocktails.  The menu is very user friendly, with approachable options along the comfort food route.I had a one of the specials which was a generous portion of savory sweet short ribs and potatoes.  Oomph...big filling portion!And the perfect ending?  Free Hoosier Mama pie for everyone!

57.description: Wonderful spot!!!  We were so happy to find that there was a place open late in our hotel.  Food was AMAZING!!!   My boyfriend and I both got the pot pies.  However, PLEASE remove the frightening clown statue that looks like he's about to get a facial at the bar!!!!  Furthermore, being in the industry myself, I do NOT understand the ridiculous outfits worn by the staff.  Please know the value of these wonderful individuals and don't parade them around like random 17 year olds that work at Friday's. "Drop mic!"

20.description: Just saw a review by "Shelly." Not sure what the axe is being ground, but the review could not be more WRONG!I have been coming here several times a week for more than a year. The staff, bartenders, servers, managers, chefs could not be more welcoming, accommodating or friendly. I always feel welcome and stay for at least a couple hours. I have never felt unwelcome. The cocktails are fast, generous and perfect tasting. The food is first-rate. In the hundreds of meals I have have never sent a meal back; I have throughly enjoyed them all. Highly recommend devil eggs, salmon patties and perch- but there is nothing on the menu I would not recommend.  I think "Shelly" just can't be happy. Ignore her review, read my earlier review and all the other 4* and 5* reviews.

36.description: Our server at The Local, Adam, was the only bad thing about our experience. He was extremely rude and seemed annoyed that we had kids despite the fact that we were racking up a good size bill. He never shared any specials with us (assuming it was because we had kids) yet the table of all adults next to us was told about them. He never put our appetizer order in so my husband wasn't able to try the bacon wrapped dates, and he was just plain rude. We would have had dessert and more drinks had it not been for him. Food was pretty good - I had a burger and my husband had pork shoulder. The place was a little dingy, hoping it gets a renovation soon. The other waitstaff and bartender was extremely nice and helpful.

14.description: Really liked this place!  Thought it was part of the Hilton but come to discover that it is independent from the hotel.  Generally don't like to eat in chain hotels.Had the prime filet breakfast which was very tasty and well prepared and my only gripe was the the portion which really was tiny for 26.  Had a bite of daughters TLC burger and that was large and tasty.  Fresh squeezed OJ was tasty but could have been colder.Staff here was great, very helpful and accomodating.  Will come back!

58.description: You know that scene in 'When Harry Met Sally' where she orders dessert? It goes something like this: "I'd like the apple pie a la mode. But I'd like the pie heated, but I don't want the ice cream on top, I want it on the side. I'd like strawberry instead of vanilla if you have it. If not, just whip cream but only if it's real, not out of a can." Yeah, I'm kind of like that. On the side is very big for me. That's why I was thrilled to discover Freshii. I get to pick exactly what I want and the exact ingredients that will be involved without feeling like I'm completely high-maintenance. You get a little clip board (which is fun and somehow makes you feel like you are important) that you can choose if you want a salad, wrap, or bowl...and then all the different ingredients you can think of. All of it is pretty healthy (although I'm sure if you're on a mission to beast-out you can get the job done here too) and fresh...it's not just a clever title. The servings are substantial, regardless of what you get, and I'm sure they will fill you up for lunch. All the guys that work there are really helpful, so if you don't know what's going on you don't want to feel like an idiot, they are more than happy to answer any questions. They also serve breakfast (wraps, yogurt parfaits, oatmeal) and heaping helpings of frozen yogurt, but I have yet to try them. But you can bet your tush I'll be back to give them a whirl. Bonuses: *Their website allows you to build what you want and learn what the nutritional information is, that way you don't have to keep your fingers crossed that you are eating something good for you...that is much appreciated. *They also sell healthy snacks like protein bars (I found multiple different kind of Clif bars that I didn't know existed, yay!), almonds, dehydrated fruit, etc.

56.description: I've been here on the 20 side of 15 times.  Its quick, tasty, not too expensive and you could eat here for the rest of your life and never have the same thing  twice.  I think.  What do I look like, a Mathematician? (Note: I couldn't even spell Mathematician, I had to look it up and by look it up I mean use auto spell-check) The Bliss Bowl is incredible yet a little pricy (save money by creating your own bowl or wrap...avoid premium items) but you get a lot of food.Why 3 stars?Twice I've been served a bowl that was stone cold.Once I was served a Bliss Bowl without the goat cheese or avocado it was supposed to come with.Once I was served a Bliss Bowl with blue cheese instead of goat cheese.  I tell you what my friend, if you are expecting goat cheese and get a mouthful of the blue, you'd be upset to.

29.description: Delicious tea.  Nice honey.  Friendliest staff. I love Freshii. Proud to be a customer.

42.description: Menu looks delicious with fresh ingredients, but unfortunately they load up your salad or wrap with the inexpensive items like rice & lettuce and skimp on things like chicken, steak and avocado.  I tried a BBQ Chicken Salad and a Grilled Steak Burrito another day.  The salad sounded awesome but it had like 4 cubes of avocado, and 8 cubes of chicken.  Same thing happened with the burrito, tons of rice, but not much steak.  Pretty good place that has potential, but not great.

23.description: I really like their muesli, but ordered soup today which was disappointing. For $8 it was almost all broth and had no flavor to it. Even after customizing my ingredients, maybe I just need to visit Freshii for breakfast only.

47.description: If you're allergic, beware....I specifically spoke to someone before ordering a salad about my food allergy, and then discovered some in the bottom of my salad after I'd eaten half of it! When I brought the salad back to show the manager, he could only offer a replacement salad...um, hello....if i get really sick from eating a contaminated salad once, why would I want to come back?! If I'd found a cockroach in the bottom, I'm sure he wouldn't have sent me away just because I'd eaten some already. I think a refund would have been fair, but he laughed at me for even asking. Rude...I won't be returning!

8.description: Ok I come back here because it's supposed to be "healthy", it's supposed to be "fast", but more importantly, it's really really close to me. With that said, this place is kind of inconsistent. Sometimes it's really fast and they get your orders right, sometime it took forever, and they forgot to put stuff in. One thing that's consistently good is their breakfast wrap--it's part of my new routine on Saturday mornings now: wake up, walk the dog to Water Tower, get the bacon/egg wrap, eat in front of the dog, then go back home to sleep.

31.description: I come here at least 4 times a week now since the place opened, but think that will now begin to change. This place is just very inconsistent. One day I will order the grilled steak salad and it will be SO GOOD that I think about it over the weekend and look forward to lunch on Monday so that I can order it again, just to receive said order and find that the salad is a huge disappointment. No consistency.Also, there have been multiple occasions when ingredients have been left off of my orders (either the make-your-own or the set options- happened with both). Not the end of the world, but rather annoying when you're getting charged for "premium toppings" (ex. avocado or cheese) and it then is left out of the order. Hoping these are just growing pains... we shall see.

34.description: Give me crap food once, shame on you.  Give me crap food twice, shame on me.Tried again this afternoon.  2 items- one burrito, one bowl.  Asked for no ranch on the burrito, but they decided to but no ranch on EITHER.  I did one of the pre-made bowls- the warrior chicken bowl.  basically a chinese take-out box full of rice, with about 15 black beans, 15 kernels of corn, some shredded carrots, and 7 pieces of chicken.  Great.  $8 for a box of brown rice.  Delicious.  And without the ranch- bland as hell.

16.description: Super cheap for nutritious, healthy food on the go. Imagine only $2 to add tofu to anything. I had the Kale Effect Bowl. A little too much rice and not enough kale but had a surprisingly spicy in a good way. Interesting snacks and drinks... picked up a Jimmy bar that made a good breakfast.

13.description: I am a fairly new Freshii customer, and have been exploring the menu trying various wraps, bowls, salads, and breakfast items. The proportions are great and the prices are fair for a healthy, freshly prepared meal. However, they never fail to mess up any sort of special request I make. Today I ordered the falafel bowl with no beet slaw and the sriracha on the side. When my order came up I looked at it to make sure everything was correct, and there was a little container of sriracha on the side, and no sign of beets, as requested. You can imagine my shock when I returned to my office and began to eat my food, and there was a whole mound of beet slaw hidden beneath all the other ingredients! Seriously?! How hard is it go get someone's order right? Answer: not very. Even McDonald's has mastered it. It's like they were purposely hiding the beets from me.The system for ordering is also pretty disorganized. Sometimes you write what you want on the form, sometimes you just order through the person at the register, there are people milling about and you can't tell who's ordered and who hasn't. And the menu posted on the wall is the only place you can read the descriptions of things, but a lot of times it's obstructed by employees or there are too many customers milling about to get a good enough angle to read it. For this reason I usually look at their website and decide what I want ahead of time.I will probably continue to frequent this place, because it's super convenient and a good healthy option. But there are definitely some issues that have them stuck at "meh" rather than "omgsogood."

11.description: The Vegan Warp? It's supposed to include: "SPINACH, AVOCADO, CARROTS, BROCCOLI, CUCUMBERS, SWEET CORN, CHICKPEAS, SUNDRIED TOMATOES, EVOO & AGED BALSAMIC VINEGAR"I am currently sitting at my desk with a pile of dyed spinach in a tortilla. There is a single slice of avocado, maybe 10 shreds of carrot, a decent amount of raw broccoli, one cucumber slice, 5 kernels of corn, 3 chickpeas, and 0 sun-dried tomatoes.Walk 5 blocks to the Trader Joe's on Ohio and make your own. $7-something for this? Nah.

39.description: Yum! Yum! Yum! Efficient, convenient (for shoppers and Northwestern employees alike), and did I mention fresh(ii)? You may be a vegetarian, you may be a vegan, you may be afraid of phony, rubbery chicken. If you are any of those things, you should eat at Freshii. Oh, and if you like filling salads, wraps, and rice bowls, you might want to stop by too. I love Freshii because their employees are friendly, each lunch comes with a piece of chocolate, and they pair every salad with a pita-like bread that doesn't come packed with carbs. For the health and delicious-conscious, visit Freshii!

37.description: So so.  Confusing ordering process - picking out what you want is an exercise in "fill in the bubble" ala your favorite standardized test.  Personally, I'd rather just speak to someone.  The Asian Chopped Salad was good, but the lettuce was a bit on the soggy side.  Also, they're trying really hard for that shiny, clubby, "chic" vibe.  Visually, the place is appealing and definitely says "we care that our food is healthy."  Blaring techno music was a bit over the top.  Especially when said music is coming from speakers out of a 9 foot ceiling.  Not very far from speaker to eardrum.  I found the result to be obtrusive.I will say that the girl who helped me negotiate the ordering process and the other one who gave me my salad were both very friendly, and definitely enriched the experience.  All in all - OK healthy food.  And I'll probably go back.

0.description: I got many juices from this place. The staff was always pleasant. They always allowed me to customized my juices. This was also in a great location. I had a great experience here. They have yummy healthy food as wellA+

38.description: I like the idea of Freshii, but the execution was just bad. I threw away half of a $9 salad because it was soggy only 5 minutes after it was made. That is unacceptable.

51.description: LOVE THIS PLACE.  Fresh, organic, fast, customizable, tasty.  No complaints here!  Large portions on the bowls too!  Love.

27.description: Freshii got my morning off to a pretty annoying start. First, they have the Worst Coffee in the World. I took a sip, paused, and then took another sip to see if my taste buds were not functioning properly. Could this coffee really taste like it's been sitting on a too-hot burner for two weeks? Why yes. Yes it could and did. Into the garbage you go. Grrrr.They also forgot to give me my friend's breakfast wrap so we had to turn around and run back in. The guy behind the counter actually shrugged when I told them that they only gave me one wrap. The proper response to your error may be one of many things but this does not include shrugging. Especially when I haven't had enough coffee. You, sir, are sailing *perilously* close to the wind. (An early morning nod to Downton Abbey.)We didn't get the second wrap because they hadn't actually made it and we were short on time. They instead gave us a *coupon* for a wrap. Ahem. It's your mistake so you should offer two coupons: one for the wrap we didn't get and one for your mess up. However, one coupon is one more than I need because I will never come back.

32.description: I love this place.  I've been going for dinner recently when I don't have time to go grocery shopping but want something healthy and not full of salt and fat.Freshii to the rescue!   My favorite is the rice noodle bowl, and I just get the basic one, I don't add any meat or cheese which keeps the price at 5.99 .  I get it with tons of veggies and chickpeas, black beans AND edamame and the get the spicy lemongrass dressing on the side (this pulls the whole thing together, if the dressing was bad this meal might also be bad).This thing is HUGE, easily enough for two meals or one filling meal.  I've also tried their salad which was also delicious and massive.  (bonus! dinner here= completely empty, I've never had to wait in line or wait more than 5 minutes for my food)

54.description: I stopped here after a Dr. appointment to pick up a quick healthy lunch to go.  Not being familiar with the concept I was happy to have a young helpful enthusiastic employee standing right in the front of the ordering form stand.  At first.  He quickly explained how the ordering process works and I thanked him and began to read the options on the card.  I love an enthusiastic employee, I really do.  But he then proceeded to keep adding suggestions, and comment on the all the options.  After initially thanking him, I thought I could have a moment to read the menu and decide what I wanted, so I just avoided eye contact and edged away from him to focus on reading all offerings.  He continued to talk at me while I was almost completely turned away from him, and was approaching people as they walked towards the order stand with the same fervor.  I felt pressured and didn't care for it.I made my decision and moved inside so I could be done with him, and even then he grabs my little check list out of my hands and checks that I have filled it out correctly.My food was delicious btw, but the high pressure help was weirdly off putting.

48.description: It has a nice concept, fill in your own order (choose or create your own) and give them the sheet, and your food will be ready in less than 10 minutes. Pretty healthy stuff. The flavor isn't all there though. It is kind of eh, but still interesting? They have organic, wheat, health nuts, veggies, etc. I've tried their salad, rice bowls, wraps, and oatmeal and I feel full but definitely not satisfied. And I rate my satisfaction on flavor. Of course you can always add salt & pepper, but why add more sodium when you're trying to eat healthy right? It's conveniently located in the Watertower mall if you're in the area and there's some outdoor tables set up for the warmer temps outside.

44.description: Freshii's Chicken Apple Crunch Wrap is my favorite wrap in the city!  It's delicious and not entirely bad for me!  Made fast and fresh with great service.  First time I went to Freshii I was a bit confused on how to order but once I got through my first time ordering, it all made sense!  Definitely not as confusing as it looks!  I'm a pretty  bland eater, but they show no signs of frustration when I customize a menu item!  Now I eat there about five times a week!Love it!

24.description: I love this company. The people are so polite; the cashiers are kind and know their product. They offer a delivery service when it is too cold to walk there. I really appreciate that they post their nutritional content for everyone to see how many calories they are consuming (their website has a nice calorie content section as well).

7.description: Freshii employees:  when someone orders a coffee please fill the cup all the way to the top.  Unless I specify to leave room for cream, please fill the cup to the top.  I have this issue here more often than not.  Keep up the good work with the yummy food.

49.description: I came here when it first opened and tried their Bangkok burrito. I liked it okay. Reminded me a little bit of Crisp's Seoul Sensation burrito but with a Thai twist to it. I came back a few days ago and got their warrior chicken bowl. Meh. I guess I didn't know that the ranch dressing would be mixed in it. Tasted something between a carrot-raisin-salad (the actual name of this salad slips my mind) and a Mexican rice dish. Strange. Nope, I cannot see why this is their most popular rice bowl.I think I'd rather spend my money at Foodlife.

40.description: The coffee is pretty good. But . . . a non-self serve salad bar?Freshii FAIL.

53.description: i like you freshii BUT for lunch, you are wayyyy too expensive! i enjoy eat vegetarian during the week, so i was so happy to see the brown rice bowl and the add-ons at no-charge...but being charged $2 for tofu...that i could hardly find amongst the brown rice...was not cool! i did like the option of choosing how heavy or light you want your sauce on it. and i can't help but love this place because it is healthy. hey mag mile chicago, you could learn something for freshii...get more healthy lunch options...but don't rob me!

30.description: I found the ordering process here to be pretty disorganized, which is slightly ridiculous for a fast food joint. I ordered the signature burrito. It definitely didn't taste fresh(ii). In fact, it was closer to disgusting, and I ended up throwing it out after 3 bites. Never again.

46.description: I used Freshii to cater a corporate lunch (15 men)  earlier this week.  Everyone really liked the food (we did the wrap platter, 2 salads and cookies).  The service was great.  I was really impressed by the delivery person as  they took real care to set up the table display.  They fanned all the napkins, chocolates and even helped me carry our own food to our kitchen.  I'd definitely use them again.  A great healthy sandwich alternative.  Also they were really flexible with their catering menu.

1.description: I used to get Freshii often when I worked in the loop. The service at this location has kept me from going unless I'm feeling particularly patient. Every time I order strawberries with my oatmeal, they cut 1 strawberry and put it in the cup...maybe if they were prepared for a 9am order this wouldn't be the case. For $5 I expect a bit more than 1 strawberry. It's very underwhelming. Lastly, the service is just plain slow.

55.description: Healthy, tasty, customizable - the only thing missing here is "exciting," for which upon my honor I cannot say Freshii precisely qualifies.  The first few times I came here I made the mistake of ordering my own customized bowl, as is generally my impulse when presented with a list full of ticky boxes.  I love ticky boxes.  I love boxes.  I love ticking them.  I have the same urges of despoilment toward virgin boxes that I do towards virgin forms.  That being said, I have very little taste or common sense when it comes to choosing my own ingredients (lemon juice alone does not a sauce make!), so my first few times ranged from unspectacular to horrifyingly lemony.Then I decided to try the TKO Bowl and boy howdy do I not regret that.  That stuff is amazing.  I never thought I would get so addicted to something full of dietary fiber and delicious vitamins.  I'm also a fan of the snacks they offer: the little Kshocolat squares are tasty, the sea salt chips are delicious, and like any good white person I love Pirate's Booty.  If I ever make good on my desire to go vegetarian I am sure I will make myself sick of this place in no time at all.

9.description: You'd think it would be easy to get something called a wrap properly wrapped, but that's just not how it goes. Freshii, however, nails it - everything stays tightly swaddled, fillings stay in, nothing's falling apart. Couple fresh, fantastic taste with always wonderful service, and you've got an unbeatable (and healthy!) lunch.Don't miss out on Freshii at Water Tower Place by merely walking to the food court floor - you've got to take that escalator down one more flight to ground level!

26.description: I recently visited Freshii with a colleague for a quick lunch to take back to the office.  I wasn't sure what to get, so I went with one of their specialties, the Bangkok burrito.  I found the burrito to be quite bland and mediocre at best.  I understand that this is a healthier version of a burrito, but Protein Bar has them beat.

25.description: A-OK, that't about it.  I have had a small Southwestern Chicken soup and a small frozen yogurt from Freshii.  They were both okay.  It is a good option if one wants a  healthy non-frankenfood lunch.  However, the flavor is too low for a price that high. Good lunch option if you work in the area, but don't go out of your way.

12.description: This is my first visit to this Freshii and I was impressed with the pricing and the value of the doller spend . I felt, I got the real worth of my money. Food was delicious and feels like it energize you as they say. My server or the cashier was super fast, seems like they are having a good team of workers with customer service oriented. I will definitely visit again the Freshii at Water Tower Place.

59.description: I've eaten here 5 times and gotten a salad, a rice bowl and 3 wraps.  Portions and ingredients have been good.One thing I liked was that (on the little list you fill out - yes, you fill out forms in order to procure lunch), there's a box for how much dressing you want: light, regular, heavy, or on the side.  Sweet!  Great idea!  But I've checked "regular" every time and had WILDLY different amounts of dressing, most of them being TOO LITTLE - and I'm not a smothered-in-dressing person, there just wasn't enough.Still - I like that you can customize EVERYTHING, starting with a base of free, healthy ingredients.  If you limit the additional items (which cost extra), you can get out of there reasonably cheap.  I agree that they have a long way to go though - including the indoor seating problem as Dennis S. mentioned.  We'll see!

21.description: Ok I come back here because it's supposed to be "healthy", it's supposed to be "fast", but more importantly, it's really really close to me. With that said, this place is kind of inconsistent. Sometimes it's really fast and they get your orders right, sometime it took forever, and they forgot to put stuff in. One thing that's consistently good is their breakfast wrap--it's part of my new routine on Saturday mornings now: wake up, walk the dog to Water Tower, get the bacon/egg wrap, eat in front of the dog, then go back home to sleep.

17.description: The coffee is pretty good. But . . . a non-self serve salad bar?Freshii FAIL.

10.description: When they make a salad correctly (i.e. including the ingredients you ask and pay for) this place is great. However, 90% of the time they get it wrong. Great for people who like surprises and very frustrating for people that just want what they pay for.To Freshii's credit, I did speak to the District Manager who happened to be at the store  shortly after I received my latest botched order and he was very understanding and receptive to feedback. I have a renewed sense of confidence that there will be improvements at this location. For that, I upgraded my review from 1* to 2*s.

5.description: Minus one star:Make sure to check before leaving that you actually get all of the ingredients you ask for when ordering a custom bowl. Unfortunately I did NOT do that today and didn't get the kale I paid extra for and am missing 2 other toppings. Bummed but not enough to go out in the elements and complain about it.However, the portion size was larger than last time which is good, but inconsistent.

3.description: This place was so good when it started. I don't know what happened... So many different managements has gone through this place already. The food has gotten smaller, the price has increased! Plus, I miss some of the original options from the menu...they keep changing it up :/I knew the service was slow here...but forgetting my order is ridiculous! No compensation or anything. Not worth going here anymore.

35.description: Freshii is gourmet and healthy food, that borders on the indulgent side (on the taste factor)! There are several Chicago locations, but I happened to make my trek to the Water Tower one which is located on the ground level, not in the food court as I had mistakenly went to. Freshii offers completely customizable wraps, salads, rice and noodle bowls and burritos, but they also have a pre-set menu with some of their best-selling combos. I opted for the "best-selling" Bangkok Burrito filled with juicy marinated chunks of chicken, cucs, brown rice, carrots, mushrooms, bean sprouts and a warm peanut sauce. I also added fresh avocado for a dollar, more on that in a sec. I ended up waiting for what seemed like an exborant amount of time, and people that ordered and paid after me were given their schtuff first. I was a little overheated and annoyed standing in the tight confines like a schmuck. While I was waiting, I was able to notice their ample selections of beverages, healthful snacks, stuff to grab & go and baked goodies. It was hard to resist the zucchini bread! Two things I found that were very cool about Freshii: 1) you can order online and from their mobile app2) they have gluten free stuff and offer quinoaWhen I finally received my food finds, I situated myself with my hefty burrito and bite into a slightly warm and chewy delight. It was yummilicious! Two things did bother me slightly: 1) the sauce was not very warm, nor very flavorful 2) where was my added avocado for $1? All i saw was a mashed paste in random bites of 'avocado'I did leave feeling full in a light and satisfied way, and my nitpicks have not deterred me to go back again. I got a nutritious, delicious and satisfying lunch for under ten buckaroos on Mich Ave. Not bad...

19.description: Freshii got my morning off to a pretty annoying start. First, they have the Worst Coffee in the World. I took a sip, paused, and then took another sip to see if my taste buds were not functioning properly. Could this coffee really taste like it's been sitting on a too-hot burner for two weeks? Why yes. Yes it could and did. Into the garbage you go. Grrrr.They also forgot to give me my friend's breakfast wrap so we had to turn around and run back in. The guy behind the counter actually shrugged when I told them that they only gave me one wrap. The proper response to your error may be one of many things but this does not include shrugging. Especially when I haven't had enough coffee. You, sir, are sailing *perilously* close to the wind. (An early morning nod to Downton Abbey.)We didn't get the second wrap because they hadn't actually made it and we were short on time. They instead gave us a *coupon* for a wrap. Ahem. It's your mistake so you should offer two coupons: one for the wrap we didn't get and one for your mess up. However, one coupon is one more than I need because I will never come back.

28.description: You'd think it would be easy to get something called a wrap properly wrapped, but that's just not how it goes. Freshii, however, nails it - everything stays tightly swaddled, fillings stay in, nothing's falling apart. Couple fresh, fantastic taste with always wonderful service, and you've got an unbeatable (and healthy!) lunch.Don't miss out on Freshii at Water Tower Place by merely walking to the food court floor - you've got to take that escalator down one more flight to ground level!

45.description: I eat here almost 5 days a week. Love the menu, love the staff. I'm very happy with the quality and quantity of food. Great lunch spot... super busy at 1pm though. Call in or order online if you are in a hurry! My sister always gets the frozen yougurt (yoggi) with honey, I'm gonna try that today after lunch!

33.description: If I could marry a lunch place, I might be looking for engagement rings right now.  Healthy, made to order, reasonably priced, large portions (big enough for 2 lunches).  Breakfast is good too, but a little bit pricier, and their snacks are super-expensive.  Yes, I know they're "gourmet", but bitch, please--$7 for a tiny bag of rice crips?  The Fro-Yo is lemony, which I didn't know in advance, and it did NOT go well with chocolate toppings.  Lesson learned.  Their giant cookies, on the other hand, are delicious. My favorites are the brown rice bowl with teriyaki, a slew of veggies, and chicken and the spicy lemongrass soup.  Deeeelish.  I did have an issue with them messing up my rice bowl.  Randomly half-empty and cold.  I called, they told me to come in whenever to get a new one.  Free rice bowl was also wrong.  Forgot to add feta (how could they forget the feta??).  I called, they told me to come in whenever to get a new one.  And then all was right with the world again.

43.description: When I was too lazy to cook, but felt too guilty to get something unhealthy, I would come to this Freshii and get a Chicken Teriyaki rice bowl. It tasted very very healthy and generally satisfying. The chicken was cooked well and the veggies were fresh and raw. I've also tried their frozen yogurt - good stuff.

2.description: Like Protein Bar if everything at Protein Bar was mediocre.

18.description: So this is the closest place to my house to get food, so when I moved here it's all I ate for a week. First off: the ordering system is sooo silly. They make you grab a clip board and fill out what you want, which doesn't sound so bad until you're ordering for multiple people - because they then ask you to fill out seperate order forms for each item. What is wrong with just ordering from a cashier? As for the food, it's not bad. It's health food so you know you can't expect much. I usually get a burrito, but they're in desperate need of some kind of salsa to give it some flavor. Salads are pretty small, and the noodles are ok. Like I said, you don't go here for the taste, you do it because you're on a diet. Or you live a block from it.

41.description: Gosh. I really wanted to love this place. Right location, right ingredients, right concept, RIGHT?But~ it was okay. I had their Chicken Warrior Rice bowl and my boyfriend had their Chicken Teriyaki bowl. Both were flavorless. By the time we finished we got so tired of chewing hard brown rice (at least my jaw got a good workout) it hurt and we were still hungry. Maybe I'll try to assemble my own lunch next time.... maybe.

52.description: This little place is so tucked away in the ground, back floor of the Water Tower you wouldn't even know it was there! I happened to stumble in on it after an appointment. Originally, I had ordered a breakfast wrap and then quickly changed my mind after they started it (my bad!), instead of getting all huffy at me they just smiled and took the salad I opted for instead. The salad looked really good and the sales lady said that it was her favorite....When I got it back to my desk, however, I noticed that it was more the look of the thing than the actual taste. The mix of lettuce was a little bit off because it was quite bitter and they didn't provide enough salad dressing for such a large salad. I was really disappointed because it was after all, a $9 salad! I have to say though, their coffee is EXCELLENT and if I return by there again I'll definitely stop in for a cup of brew. I haven't discounted them yet, if I'm around again will try a sandwich or wrap and see how that pans out.

50.description: I love this place! I have taken to not eating traditional fast food since January 1. This is such a welcome alternative when you are in  a rush.  Everything I get there is really good and filling... and most of all healthy.  Anyplace with a brown rice and low-fat dressings works for me.  I would have given 5 stars, except that they often forget things like the dressings on the side, utensils, etc.  Also, the first couple of times ordering, the guy there was a little annoyed with the lack of getting the whole ordering process right.

4.description: While shopping on the Magnificent Mile, which is oh-so-magnificent, I stopped by Freshii for a wrap. Freshii is an international chain of fast casual cafes serving salads, salads, burritos, wraps, rice bowls, breakfast and soups.I got really excited when I saw that there was a wrap called "Vegan Wrap."  So as I was about to order it, I noticed it comes in a honey wheat tortilla. So, I asked the woman behind the counter about that and she admitted that was true and that it wasn't really vegan. Apparently there are vegan tortillas available in some locations, but not this one. Okay, well then you should call it the Vegetable Wrap with a note that a vegan option is available only in some locations.  That is very misleading.Then, I noticed a poster advertising the "Green Wrap." This was a wrap using collard green leaves. It looked great, but again the poster was misleading. At the top of it it stated "vegan, gluten-free, low-carb wrap option that supports digestion, immunity, and detoxification. " Underneath are the Thai Green Wrap and the Buffalo Green Wrap. So, I asked if the buffalo chicken was vegan chicken and they said it wasn't. So the heading on the poster was only referring to one of the two burritos. Um, you need to get a new marketing company.So, I finally ordered the vegan green wrap. Unfortunately, they didn't wrap it very well so it immediately fell apart while the girl next to me ate a perfectly wrapped one that stayed together. Oh, well. That said, I enjoyed the wrap. It was filled with rice noodles, greens, tofu, carrots, cilantro, bean sprouts, and cucumbers and came with a peanut sauce. It was pretty tasty.I also ordered a Made blackberry lemonade -- made in Illinois. So good.So for $12, it was an okay meal. I'd order it again. But, I hope they fix their signage soon so vegans don't accidentally eat the non-vegan wrap labeled "vegan." That's pretty inexcusable.

6.description: I hate freshii.  I knew I hated freshii but for some reason decided to just give it ONE LAST chance. They blew it.  I got the spicy lemongrass soup, apparently it's one of their best sellers. Apparently the only people who eat at Freshii are people with no taste buds.  Not spicy, not chickeny, not even salted.  I put sriracha in it and it's still barely edible. And .....it was an $8 soup. Ugh. NEVER AGAIN.

22.description: So this is the closest place to my house to get food, so when I moved here it's all I ate for a week. First off: the ordering system is sooo silly. They make you grab a clip board and fill out what you want, which doesn't sound so bad until you're ordering for multiple people - because they then ask you to fill out seperate order forms for each item. What is wrong with just ordering from a cashier? As for the food, it's not bad. It's health food so you know you can't expect much. I usually get a burrito, but they're in desperate need of some kind of salsa to give it some flavor. Salads are pretty small, and the noodles are ok. Like I said, you don't go here for the taste, you do it because you're on a diet. Or you live a block from it.

15.description: I found the ordering process here to be pretty disorganized, which is slightly ridiculous for a fast food joint. I ordered the signature burrito. It definitely didn't taste fresh(ii). In fact, it was closer to disgusting, and I ended up throwing it out after 3 bites. Never again.

57.description: I am so happy that Freshii opened close to my house, as I am definitely an eat and run girl most of the work week, and Freshii allows me to do just that without eating junk!! Yay! I always grab a wrap - they are huge, filling, have a ton of topping choices, grilled or no, and I am in love with the honey mustard dressing. The muffins (big fan of blueberry) and the yogurt are a great breakfast grab, and the service has always been great, fast and friendly. They just opened, and of course have a few kinks to iron out, but I am a loyal Freshii fan and will be back over and over! My taste buds,. wallet AND rear end thank you from saving me from the fast food calorie blasts I otherwise would be ingesting! If they only delivered.....sigh.

20.description: This is the genre of fast healthy places that I normally love, but my experience with the food was enough to scare me off. I try not to write bad reviews after just one go, but I can't imagine being compelled to go back.One star for the friendly employees, one star for the concept. No more stars because the salad ingredients were so terrible. I made my own salad and the lettuce was disgusting: slimy, soggy, and really repulsive. The dressing was bland, the tomatoes mealy, and nothing else on it could have saved that mess.

36.description: Ok. Rice bowl was cold. 7 veggie soup was good. Spicy lemongrass was very spicy. No indoor seating at the restaurant.

14.description: Whoa!  That was confusing!  The staff was confused, I was confused, my lunch date was confused... My friend and i checked this place out because we were looking for a really healthy option and mourning the loss of Ponte Fresco.  I ordered the southwestern chicken soup because it came with "two unlimited toppings" (what that means I can't be sure but it was incentive enough).  I was never asked if I wanted toppings and after some fluttering around and avoidance of eye-contact I finally caught one of the staff.  She looked, well, confused.  But I got the toppings in the end... I think.  My friend had a similar experience, really awkward, really confusing, but a great healthy option with good food.I'll take a Xanax and try it again someday.

29.description: This place could be great, but it consistently falls short. Every couple of months, after enough time has passed since my last visit, I get lured back by the funky midcentury-mod decor, the great photos on the wall, and the high-quality coffee. Then I sit down for a few minutes, and I remember why I don't come here all the time. The place is dingy all around the edges, with wobbly tables, spills left uncleaned for a bit too long, a few flies hovering near the overfull trash cans, etc.It breaks my heart, because the concept is so cool and the place is right in my neighborhood. If they could combine the look and taste of this place with the simple attention to detail found in every friggin' Starbucks, they'd have a real winner.

42.description: Negozio di caffè bello collegato al Drake. Una punta costosa. Ha sempre ospiti dal Drake che macina circa. Pasticcerie grandi.

23.description: Free wifi. Tables almost always available. Better food and coffee than starbucks, although thats not saying much. Pleasant staff. Better ambience than most coffeeshops. Hours suck, and patrons can be stuffy but thats easy to work around.

47.description: The food is not very good, but the space to have a giant-sized latte is wonderful. Great staff - very generous.

8.description: Being lactose and gluten intolerant is so difficult at any coffee bar. I can't even go to Starbucks for a cafe latte. But I found this little gem while staying at The Drake Hotel. They have almond milk and made me the most delicious latte! This morning while I enjoyed another large latte my husband had a super delicious almond croissant. Made my day!

31.description: I will say this - the food and bakery items here looked amazing and the IDis beautiful.  also, i witnessed a touching scene involving a very well-dressed, elegant woman and her grand-daughter eating ice cream together at the counter.i ordered a grandissimo iced mocha: decaf, no-fat, no whip.  it was my birthday and i wanted a special treat.  i got my drink and went outside to wait for the valet from the drake to pull up our car.  i took one sip of my drink and BLECH!!!  SLUDGE!  it tasted almost like a powdered diet breakfast drink that wasn't very well mixed and sludge.  it was DISGUSTING!  i tried to mix it up and it didn't work.  sad face.  i LOVE specialty coffee drinks and have ordered the same thing everywhere from borders to starbuck's to caribou to local coffee shops around the nation.  what are you doing to coffee lavazza?  shame on you!

34.description: cafe lavazzamorning latte's at the beachsei molto bellaSlick.  The Italian designer version of Starbucks.I grab a latte every morning and head to the lakefront trail for the human drama.  Decent gelato, good sandwiches.Lavazza...  They get it right every time.Carry on.

16.description: This coffee house was at the ground level of The Drake Hotel. AWESOME spread of danishes and muffins including fresh fruit and yogurt as options.  The staff is highly professional and courteous.  Free Wi-Fi.  Cozy environment with interesting pics and art on the wall.  Careful with the revolving door as the areas right by the door don't feel the wind you feel the WIND with the Chicago air coming in....Happy we got to try this place. Plus, it's also located at the top of the John Hancock Observatory. :)

13.description: Warning if you have some place to go DO NOT go here. I stood in line for 20 minutes with the line not moving. And there was only 4 people ahead of me. There were two workers behind the counter. One stood there doing nothing and the other had no clue what to do. I've been to this location many times it is slower than most coffee places but they do have good coffee and breakfast. Only reason I gave it two stars. If there is a line when you walk in you should just walk out.

11.description: Hit the spot.  High quality espresso.  Clean and modern shop.  Lots of yummy food options.  I'd definitely go back.

39.description: ************* REVIEW 141 ****************Staying at the Drake so I came down for some coffee & quick snack before my adventure in the city.Modern, chic & cool cafe shop with awesome photograph of beautiful women drinking their LavAzza cafe through out the wall, very slick, I must say.Beside coffee, they offer pastries, sandwiches, & gelato as well. The mini macaroons are so yummy & the latte was good.Service - not a Drake Hotel level = fail!

37.description: Being in the neighborhood, I decided to try Expressions by Lavazza in the Drake.  I enjoy the Lavazza coffee shops in the loop every day and wanted to see how the new Expressions line compared.  I was sadly disappointed.  It was only 9:30 in the morning and I expected the place to be hopping.  There were two patrons sitting with their breakfast and a women at the counter spending an ungodly amount of time ordering and being totally neurotic, rechecking her stamp three times and asking the same question over and over again and discussing her life ad nauseum.  The cashier had no clue how to deal with the woman and rather kept her engaged, prolonging my dismay at having to wait so long.  When it was my turn at the register, I was treated without any passion, and I must say rather rudely, and without a hello or welcoming smile.  I had asked for the manager, but he was not in, it was his day off.  I then when to the counter to wait for my drink.  The two staff members there could not stop talking, which in itself is not bad, but I had to wait 8 minutes for my simple hot beverage to be made when I was the only customer in there.  I was not impressed.  Perhaps this store should be closed and the space put to better use.  I don't think I would ever return.  For "Expressions by Lavazza," my expression is yuk!  I will stick to my favorite Lavazza coffee houses in the loop where the staff get to know you and get you your purchase with a smile and, right away.  After all, drinking coffee or eating breakfast should be a relaxing and enjoyable time, not rushed because you could not get someone to take care of your order.

0.description: I will say this. I expected that this brand of coffee and the chain itself would be sub par to other chains like starbucks. Im happy to say that i was virulently proven wrong as i received my paninni and latte. The coffee was incredible, far beyond the dry repetition of Starbucks and the paninni although large in size and quantity, was superb.All the other whiners and poo poo ers need to cram something else in thier mouths because the coffee was excellent.
