38.description: This was the worst coffee house I've ever been to.  I've had better experiences at a McDonalds for coffee.  First I went in, no one in line, three people behind the register & it took them a couple minutes to "assist" me.  Told them I would like some Tea and the first guy says "oh I dunno I don't drink tea, talk to this guy, then just walks away and asks someone else to come talk to me.  That next person knew even less.  They had no tea menu posted or available for me to browse, so the guy rattled off 10 very basic teas so fast I couldn't even catch them all.  I asked how the green tea is (strong, mild etc) and he said "i dunno I don't drink tea either."  Ordered the green tea (what the heck) when the man handed it to me he spilled SCAULDING hot water all down my hand burning me, with out offering me a napkin or some ice, and then proceeds to tell me I should have let him set it down on the counter first (no sorry, no mention that he held the glass out to me to take from him.  It's not like I was blocking the counter.   After this I will never return to a Lavazza and I will tell EVERYONE I know what a crappy experience I had.  By the way, the green tea was terrible.  I've had better lipton and that's pathetic.

27.description: awesome ambience.... lovee the food. comfy chairs..  would like to make it one of my regular coffee spot..

32.description: Espression by Lavazza is a nice place to get some coffee and relax. Located next to the Drake Hotel, it is also a good place to jump on the free wi-fi. It has a very chic, contemporary look and feel to it and there are some comfortable places to sit and enjoy your time. Delicious drinks and friendly service, with fair prices as well.

48.description: 0 for 2. I give up. Go for coffee, not food. So the breakfast croissant was bad. How about lunch? - Not quite so bad, but not worth crossing the street. I arrived at 12:30pm, and was the only person ordering food until 1:15. Not much turnover. Not much volume. And, reflecting the lack of business, not much selection. Other than sweets, the offering was two quiches and a dozen sandwiches. All had interesting ingredients, and I settled on a goat cheese and sun dried tomato quiche. Looked good. Arrived cold. After a second round in the cooker, where they sliced the quiche horizontally in half to heat it, they reassembled it and served it. Mmmm, doesn't that make it sound and look yummy!! It tasted like I would expect a Pillsbury frozen quiche to taste (if there is such a thing). Very cheesy, but not goat cheesy. Not worth ever ordering again. The cappuccino was again great, and I'd go back for coffee. But not for food. Even the scoop of gelato I had for dessert was ordinary. A comfortable but empty place, fulfilling a need for the Drake Hotel I guess.  But not for me.

44.description: Actually not the best espressos, but I welcome this place with open arms just because it's not another Starbucks.  Interior is very sexy with  some eye popping art.  Espression breaks that hippie, let's play board games for hours on end, poetry readin', guitar playin', pretending to study mold.  They have some interesting flavors like the orange mocha mio and meringato (don't worry there's no essence of cat in it).  And of course the Ferran Adria's espesso creation.   Lavazza branches have been one of my faves since opening on Jackson, and now I'm quite happy there's one on the Gold Coast.

24.description: Go for espresso but stay away from the food.With a location right off Michigan next to the Drake and Knickerbocker this place sees an average amount of traffic. The menu clearly highlights their only true specialty; espresso. Personally, I dislike coffee and my wife, who ordered the espresso, isn't exactly a fan. But they did look good, and with the many options on the menu, I'm sure they are above average.However, any shred of hope for this place stops there. This place has the laziness of a typical cheap chain franchise that clearly doesn't care about quality, flavor, or repeat business. They go for location in touristy areas knowing that they don't have to fight for repeat customers; and they seem to make plenty of money on passerby tourists. My wife ordered a breakfast croissant and I ordered a breakfast Panini with the fresh squeezed orange juice. Both sandwiches came with bacon, eggs, and an assortment of veggies.  Both the Panini and croissant were obviously a few days old and purchased fully cooked. The bacon was pre-cooked and reheated for 15 seconds in the microwave; and it didn't even look as good Subway's pre-cooked bacon. The worst part was the egg. The egg patty had griddle marks... You heard right, griddle marks. It is painfully obvious the eggs are purchased in precooked patties and then thrown on a griddle to heat them up. It is also clear that they are thrown on the griddle frozen because the griddle marks were black and the rest of the patty was typical neon yellow. To make matters worse, each breakfast sandwich was accompanied by a mixed green salad (greens only) drizzled with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Who puts a small tasteless salad as a side for breakfast? To finish off this embarrassment called "food," the orange juice was indeed freshly squeezed, but served room temperature. The ladies behind the counter acted like this was some sort of delicacy; warm orange juice. Never have I heard people so proud to advertise "fresh squeezed orange juice, served room temperature". Total cost for 2 sandwiches, 1 orange juice, & 1 espress: Approx. $25Buy a coffee at Starbucks and then grab 2 breakfast sandwiches at McDonalds. Half the price, double the flavor.

7.description: My experience here was great!! A funky spot in a gorgeous area. Good vibes and great coffee - couldn't get much better than that! I stayed at the Knickerbocker across the street during my visit to Chicago and met a friend there one morning after checking out. Loved it so much I brought my family back a couple hours later for a second helping! Vanilla latte & black coffee were both tasty. The young man helping us was very friendly and attentive. We had a couple slices of their banana mocha bread which was to die for!! Eat it!! The shop is CLEAN - I don't understand the reviews stating otherwise lol.Sexy modern photographs on the walls are a plus too!!

40.description: Fun furniture. Great coffee. Love the location.  We had a meetup here. Perfect setting.  Yep, I'll be back.

30.description: While visiting Chicago, my sister and I became fast fans of Lavazza. Luckily for us, this particular Espression by Lavazza was located in our hotel, so we got to go there daily. The banana bread with chocolate chips is to die for, perfectly moist and sweet, as is their gelato (I personally enjoy a mix of chocolate and hazelnut). My sister is partial to their croissants and mocha Blendissimo. On top of the great coffee and delightful snacks, the atmosphere is quirky and fun. Overall, it's a perfect place to chat or jump on your laptop.

46.description: The design of Expression by Lavazza is awesome and I love the pictures a lot. It feels really comfortable sitting there and enjoy my coffee and my breakfast. I order the almond croissant and it tastes really good.  :-)We stay at THE DRAKE and we went to Expression to have breakfast the first day we were in Chicago and the last day before we fly back home. ACtually i do miss this place because i love the white wall and it reminds me of the space theme.

1.description: One star for acceptable coffee and another for free wifi ... but that's it. Food I didn't try as it's the usual pre-cooked stuff that gets warmed for serving. Staff, all four, were rude and dismissive to me and other customers. Would not come back here and would not recommend.

9.description: Definitely over priced, but not unexpected seeing as it is located in The Drake. Nice set up with plenty to choose from, decent coffee and what i THOUGHT was nice customer service. Apparently they are accustomed to getting tipped or something because i didn't leave one and then checked my bank statement the next day to find they added their own as i had the receipt in my hand which certainly did not match the paid amount on my statement. Normally i would say to try it yourself and yelp it, but i hope you all stay far away from these...SCAM ARTISTS!!

26.description: It breaks my heart to only give 3 stars. This is/was my neighborhood - I often get work right in this area so sometimes hang out  in between or just take my morning espresso here, sometimes have the occasional date here. I've made several friends with the regulars. I'm also rather fond of some of the staff!I've read through a couple of the reviews (I'm writing to management) and it is true. The place can use a cleaning, more staff designated just for that. I try not to look in the corners but I do - and they are not clean. The expectations are higher for the reasons listed. I believe Hilton bought this place, and the Drake? Not clear how they are connected. But when I've stayed in the Drake I definitely hung out here. I would describe the Drake itself in a similar way. It needs a cleaning. They are great about turning down the music. I like the coffee and free wifi.

25.description: I feel like I've walked into Europe every time I come here (if only that was possible).  The coffee and espresso drinks are great but what I really love is the space itself.  I read some reviews that slammed Lavazza for being dirty but I've never noticed that.  Maybe I was too caught up in hearing an elegant, beautiful young couple speaking in Italian to each other just as I was thinking, "I feel like I'm in Italy."  Definitely a chic place to stop for a coffee if you're in the neighborhood.

12.description: Not only did they not have half of the food on the menu I felt as if we were inconveniencing the staff by ordering food. It also took almost 25 min to reheat a sandwich because one of the staff members had to run out to get gloves (you would think the other employee could have made our order) We asked that they throw in a cup of soup for all of the trouble and they said NO. Poor service for a coffee shop in the DRAKE hotel.

21.description: Nothing extraordinary but it works. A very modern interior with plenty of seating. Food and drinks galore but they do close a bit early. My hot chocolate was pretty good and was a decent size. It's a good alternative if you don't want to get stuck in a Starbucks on the Mag Mile.

17.description: This should be a stop for everyone, not just folks staying at the Drake. Friendly staff, great coffee drinks, and delicious pastries. Some breakfast options too.

10.description: Nice set-up, but pretty commercial. I ordered an iced soy chai latte. I was disappointed when I saw the barista open the refrigerator exposing the liquid chai mix from Trader Joe's!! Next time, I'll just go there instead and buy a box. I will try a café au lait and if that isn't good this place is toast.

5.description: Coffee was lukewarm. I ordered coffees to drink in the caffe and they made them to go, so they sat out and got cold. They seemed busy so whatever. Not worth it.

3.description: This place exists only because it's on the way from Michigan Avenue to the Drake Hotel and the Lavazza brand is popular with Europeans. Other than that, this place may seem a mess.  Understaffed, pricey and the ready-brew was a horribly bitter dark roast.  The pastries, which you'd expect to be beautiful and eye catching at a boutique coffee shop like this were outright paltry in offering and my scone tasted bland.  Blueberry scones and little poppyseed muffins were all they had.  It's a pity this is the only coffee shop near this area of Michigan Avenue. And while I'm lamenting my $8 coffee and stale scone, what's with closing at 4pm--on a busy Saturday afternoon?

35.description: I went there for a "Girlfriends' Circle" thing that was supposed to help those new to the city of Chicago (i.e., me) meet other women. Only 2 women showed up (besides me). One I had met before. She did not like me much (called me "too chatty"). The other one biked in and entered wearing her biking helmet. I parked in the Drake Hotel Parking Lot, which is pricey. I had not eaten, so I ordered quiche. It was cold. I ate it cold, because, as others have said, the service is nearly non-existent and I had to basically wait on myself.As it turns out, the place CLOSES AT 8:00 P.M. This would not have mattered, except that this "Girlfriends' Circle" thing began at 7:00 pm. I did not realize there were time constraints (and no booze) or I would have wofled my food. In an attempt to be polite, I asked each of the other women present to give me their e-mail address, not really planning on using it/them, but because it seemed as though it would be the easiest way to re-connect. (Bike helmet lady seemed like a free spirit who might be fun to attend a concert with; "Diane," the other woman, refused to give me her last name...and I had MET HER TWICE BEFORe! I admit I forgot her last name, but Geez! Then, the 2 of them just BOLTED for the door, saying, "Oh, they're closing!" We had been there about 45 minutes, and I still had food in front of me, since I did not know they closed so soon. This was a very deserted, very expensive, very ungood experience. I got back to the Drake parking place 3 minutes after the hour, so my parking amount increased by $4 so that I could be treated rudely by 2 women I had never met and never want to meet again. And the cafe and help and coffee and food? Uh...no. Never again. (Obviously, my personality requires a stiff drink, which is what I went home and had, after THIS place.0

19.description: This place is just fine.  Nothing special but certainly adequate if you are looking for a coffee drink.  They also have some fancy sodas, sparkling waters, tea and gelato.  Service here was super friendly.  I didn't see a specific drink I wanted so I just told the barrista that "a coffee drink with a hint of chocolate but keep it light" and he got it right.  I did notice that there were multiple tables in here that weren't bussed so that was kind of unappealing.  I just wasn't in the mood to look at someone's half eaten muffin and sloshed coffee on a table.

28.description: It's a coffee shop.  It's adjacent to the Drake hotel.  And it's usually easy to grab a seat and a cup of tea and wile away some time in a colorful environment with pretty comfortable chairs.The challenge to me is always the help.  It seems that every time I go and order a large tea for "here", there begins a debate as to what kind of cup I should get.  Usually I get a huge cup that is only filled half way by the time I pour my tiny pot of water and tea in the cup. The positive?  They do have a pretty wide selection of tea.And trust me . . . .it's the best $2.05 you can spend if you are looking for a warm drink in the area!

45.description: The coffee here is really good, like at all the Lavazzas, and the decor is cool. It's very modern with mismatched chairs, low tables and interesting artwork on the walls. The service was good too. There aren't a lot of windows for watching people, but there are enough interesting characters inside (European tourists, crazy rich people from the Drake, business men meeting much younger women). It's worth the stop if you are near by and craving a good cup o' joe.

33.description: I never would have noticed this place if it wasn't for today's Groupon Now $1 for $6 deal at Expression by Lavazza. Based on Nicole's recommendations, I ordered the following:- Salame di carcio.- Crema shakerato, regular, hazelnut.The sandwich was really good--I loved the combination of salame, tomatoes, artichokes, and shredded cheese (I forgot what type) on the French baguette. You could really taste the different ingredients in the sandwich. The baguette was a little hard, but that's okay. It was still good. And the tomatoes were so fresh! I loved it. It came with a side salad drizzled with some sort of balsalmic sauce (you can taste the balsalmic vinegar, I just don't know what makes the sauce so thick!). The espresso was out of this world! Ha. Nicole described it as "edible espresso." I had no idea what this meant, but I thought I'd try it anyway. It sounded good! She said it was topped with mousse and gave me an array of flavors to choose from. I chose hazelnut, and she said it would be "shaken" in the espresso. Ok... I still don't know much about coffee (even though I attended the Yelp Gets Cultured event at Asado) and I don't understand her lingo, but I needed something to wake me up because I was very tired! And I think I was most intrigued that it was going to be a cold drink. The drink came to me in a martini glass. Whoa, fancy! Everyone was staring at me as if I was crazy to be ordering a martini in the middle of the day. It's 5 o'clock somewhere though, right? Ha! (The drink is non-alcoholic though). And the taste? It was very good. The frothiness of the mousse added just another sweet touch to the already less-bitter taste of the hazelnut flavored espresso. The drink was sweet, but not too sweet. Perfect. My subtotal came out to be $10.54. Since the Groupon Now is new, the computer messed up a little bit. It only discounted the last item on my receipt. Luckily I noticed this halfway through my meal as I kept thinking, "Something's wrong if I paid close to $8 when my total, including tax came out to be $11 something." Nicole was already gone. She was only there to help out with the lunchtime rush because she's the marketing person. But Carlos helped me out and refunded me the rest of my discount. My total, including tax now is little over $5. What awesome service! So, good sandwiches (I love sandwiches; and they're better in quality than L'Appetito, which is also Italian), fancy espressos (I've gained a greater appreciation for coffee since the aforementioned Yelp event), great customer service in a beautiful place (it's fancier than Starbucks and Caribou Coffee)? AND it's near my work place? Yeah, I'll be back.

43.description: Great interior and good drinks, but all of that is null and void to me because of the horrible service I've now experienced twice. The first time in February/March-ish and again yesterday.Yesterday afternoon, I wandered in around 3:30, continuing my quest for the city's best readily available chai. I was shocked by how empty the place was--one guy sitting near the front at a table, and a couple of teenage girls sitting at the bar in the back. When I walked in, one of the employees sheepishly looked my way but said nothing. I approached the counter, giving the menu a once over just in case something sounded better than chai. The associate behind the counter stared at me blankly. No hello, no what can I get for you...nothing. I ordered, and he finally spoke: "Do you want a receipt?"I waited at the end of the bar for my drink. It was placed on the counter without a word. I walked out, confused.The chai was good, but I've had better. If I do ever come here again, I will focus on the coffee and not the service, but with Illy coffee available a block closer to home (at L'Appetito) the odds of my giving this place another shot are slim.

2.description: The reviews are correct, my fruit cup had mold and service was very slow. They did take the cup off my bill. Coffee was hot and tasty however!

18.description: It's a coffee shop.  It's adjacent to the Drake hotel.  And it's usually easy to grab a seat and a cup of tea and wile away some time in a colorful environment with pretty comfortable chairs.The challenge to me is always the help.  It seems that every time I go and order a large tea for "here", there begins a debate as to what kind of cup I should get.  Usually I get a huge cup that is only filled half way by the time I pour my tiny pot of water and tea in the cup. The positive?  They do have a pretty wide selection of tea.And trust me . . . .it's the best $2.05 you can spend if you are looking for a warm drink in the area!

41.description: This place is so cute, modern, and truly reminds me of the cafes in Italy.  I've had their americano, hot chocolate, gelato, and coffeetini(?).

4.description: The coffee is ok, food is terrible - Quiche was just disgusting. Staff was ok. Hours on Yelp are wrong - they close at 4pm.

6.description: Rude staff.No decaf, insisted on making a decaf Americano and charged for it instead of a decaf price. If they don't want to bother making a decaf then don't charge Americano price for the substitution. Expensive drinks.Did I mention rude staff. Very disappointing experience, long waits, no smiles.

22.description: This coffee house was at the ground level of The Drake Hotel. AWESOME spread of danishes and muffins including fresh fruit and yogurt as options.  The staff is highly professional and courteous.  Free Wi-Fi.  Cozy environment with interesting pics and art on the wall.  Careful with the revolving door as the areas right by the door don't feel the wind you feel the WIND with the Chicago air coming in....Happy we got to try this place. Plus, it's also located at the top of the John Hancock Observatory. :)

15.description: Great location if you're staying at the Drake, but hard to find UNLESS you're staying at the Drake. All in all, rudeness beyond belief! Don't order a smoothie unless you don't mind one that's been sitting in the glass case for who knows how long. And being yogurt-based, that's not a good thing. After experiencing that before, the next time I asked for the smoothie to be made fresh, and the guy threw a fit! Practically a temper tantrum. Totally unprofessional. Then one time I asked for an espresso drink that was advertised in a big poster in the window and they acted like they didn't want to make it, then proceeded to talk me out of wanting it! The other times I've been in there were nothing special. But the incidents involving the smoothies were enough to make me boycott this place. So much so that during our last stay at the Drake I didn't use my "free breakfast" coupons which were redeemable there.

20.description: This place is just fine.  Nothing special but certainly adequate if you are looking for a coffee drink.  They also have some fancy sodas, sparkling waters, tea and gelato.  Service here was super friendly.  I didn't see a specific drink I wanted so I just told the barrista that "a coffee drink with a hint of chocolate but keep it light" and he got it right.  I did notice that there were multiple tables in here that weren't bussed so that was kind of unappealing.  I just wasn't in the mood to look at someone's half eaten muffin and sloshed coffee on a table.

36.description: Let me start by saying I dislike Starbucks and love Illy; this is definitely closer to Illy, and I like it!  The staff is friendly and baristas are fast.  I did not try the bakery or the gelato but it looked good.  A very close second to Illy!

14.description: It is in a same building with drake hotel. Sort of a hidden location in the Magnificent mile next to channel. Easy location but capuccino was so so...like other reviews nothing special. I will still go for coffee once in a while. They have smoothies, panini, good breakfast menu as casual take out or sit down.

3.description: I got my Cheese Head and my Bear Head here. Sweet!

1.description: I have never purchased anything in this store It is very small, but they have a nice collection of hats. I buy stuff off lids.com and get it sent here to avoid shipping prices. The sales clerks are nice and polite.

2.description: I'm not that into this location because it is tiny.  Sure, all Lids locations are insanely tiny.  It's a store that sells hats - what do you expect?  But for the interior of a pretty large mall, this store is tiny.  There were about 10 of us crammed in a 4x8' space that could barely accommodate the sales clerks, let alone the hats and the customers.Anyway, I like Lids.  There's so many hats.  Baseball hats, college hats, NFL hats, cowboy hats, hipster hats, tool hats... hats!  I personally love their baseball hat selection - much cheaper than the ballpark/officially licensed merchandise and everything is nice.  They do have a lot of officially licensed stuff - same price as everywhere else.  They usually have buy-one-get-one deals, so take advantage early and often.  We just bought two hats for $30 - one Tigers and one White Sox.  Yay!  This location pretty much stinks but the selection is still awesome and the service was friendly.  If I were you, I'd go to the store in Ogilve Station - it's bigger and there's almost never anyone in it.  I'm also going to vote NO on wheelchair accessibility just because I don't know how you'd jam a wheelchair in that tiny store - it's inappropriately small and definitely not ADA friendly.

0.description: I am a guy that likes to wear fedora's and so once a month I will indulge myself to a walk through to see if they have a fedora that will look good on meThe stall is kinda small so that when they ask if they can help you. Its small so by the time they ask you if they can "help you" you will know if they have what you came for.This is located near the food court so if you are hungry while you are buying a hat, please be aware that you can soon satiate yourself with what ever stuff your heart and belly desire. Just buy that hat, ok?

4.description: All lids have great customer service bought a lot of hats here

3.description: I work for an intimates brand and stopped by Soma Intimates in Chicago with a couple co-workers while visiting the city for work. They have fantastic intimates for middle-aged and older women such as full coverage and vanishing back bras, a range of underwear from thongs to high rise briefs, dressy sleepwear, and loungewear.My co-worker and I -- we both are in our mid-twenties -- were quickly greeted by a sales associate. I appreciated the attention until it became overbearing. We were asked multiple times if we needed help as we slowly wandered around the store. I felt that they suspected us of shoplifting since we were about 30+ years younger than their target demographic. After the in-your-face customer service experience, I wouldn't plan on going back to this retailer unless shopping for my mom.

1.description: Soma is one place that I can be assured to find a proper fitting bra. I stopped in to find that they had new colors ad new styles. I was quite pleased. Unfortunately I was pressed for time, I didn't get to peruse much. But I will say this, they had a lot of a selection in their store front.

2.description: I used to love going to the Water Tower store, but new manager and staff are AWFUL.  If you are a size 2, they will treat you nicely, but last night I was "fat shamed" for returning some XL/XXL items that I bought online (I had receipt and all tags were on... it's not like I was trying to return worn items.)  I actually wanted to get two pajama sets in a SMALLER size, but left as soon as the return was done, which seemed to take forever.  I didn't want to spend another $ or minute in that store.

5.description: Not only do you carry my size, the sales woman also very gently and politely pointed me to the fitting room because it was my first time there. How sweet! And she acknowledged my presence the minute I walked into their store. Oh and if you've read my reviews for Victoria's Secret in the same building, you'll know that SOMA has a return policy of 90 days. Sweet. Plus if you join their mailing list, apparently you can get 5% once you spend $500 at their store in a lifetime. That's pretty sweet too. (That's probably around 10 bras assuming you buy the plain-looking ones for around $50...)Sweet customer service will bring a happy customer back for sure.

0.description: After failing to find nursing bras at the Macy's I stopped by Soma in hopes they would have something. I hate the cheap ill fitting uncomfortable bras you can find at the maternity stores and really just needed the most comfortable nursing bra possible. There are enough uncomfortable things to deal with in pregnancy/postpartum. Soma had exactly what I was looking for. I only had to try on two bras and found my new go to bra. The best part is the bra comes in a nursing style and a regular style so I can continue to purchase once my baby is done breast feeding. It is seriously the most comfortable bra I've ever worn and I'm so happy that I tried soma out as Victoria secrets quality has consistently gone down hill in the last few years.

4.description: I'm the first to admit that I cut fiduciary corners more often than not, especially when it comes to high-traffic items like bras and undies. Utilitarian, not much fun and no one sees them much so what do I care?Not anymore, I have seen the light. Soma's ladies are helpful and never pushy. They make the experience easy and comfortable, and the stock is lovely. There's something for everyone to make your girls look the best they can. Padded, lacy, push up, full coverage, cute, fun, functional and on and on. Lots of comfy pj's and pretty undies, even a bra sale rack where all of them are only twenty bucks. Three other items caught my eye while I was there and I completely plan to return for them. In fact, one color caught my eye that they were out of and my girl Molly said she'd order it for me and have it shipped to my address, free of charge. Nice!

58.description: Huge selection of amazing products, obvs, and also knowledgeable sales reps who don't pop up and scare me as i shop, chasing me with products. Walked in just to kill time and left with some Smashbox lid primer, which works well on my apparently sweaty lids, AND free samples :) I was impressed with the staff this last time. Fairly busy-ish in the store when I was there, and there was a woman with a baby which shrieked the whole time she was in the store. The staff was probably annoyed, but they were super nice to her and everyone else. There was a short wait to be checked out and the man (Marcus, I think?) at one of the counters acknowledged the wait and apologized to us in line, which was unnecessary (it really wasn't a bad wait at all) but nice. Efficiently rang up my items, signed me up for the insider thing, and was so fun I wanted to be friends with him in the 2 mins it took to ring me up. :)

56.description: This Beauty Insider has just discovered Ulta, thank you very much InStyle Magazine for the $5 off coupon.I am boycotting Sephora until they bring back my favorite Vincent Longo Water Canvas!  Sephora has medium level cosmetics for this Makeup Whore.  I will now shop exclusively Nordstrom, Nieman's, and Ulta (I stole six $5 off coupons from Walgreens).

29.description: Went to pick up some of the new magnetic nail polish. $16 a bottle! Crazy price but a cool novelty product. Staff was VERY cool, fun, & nice.

42.description: I HEART SEPHORA!!!!I love that you can try out the product before you buy and if you cant actually try it out (ie shampoos, etc), you can bring it back if you dont like it.The beauty insider card is the BOMB where you can earn points for free stuff.  With every purchase, they give you some sort of free sample.  Lastly, for the most part....the staff is helpful but not pushy....KEY in my book.  Be there if I want/need help, but dont stalk me with your two cents if I dont care.

23.description: Its oooookaaaay. Thankfully I discovered Bliss products and get them directly through the Bliss website instead of Sephora. My major gripe is that they can never process returns properly. It takes them to figure out how to give me cash back. Its just a pain. The sales people are hit and miss. Its pretty rare that anyone greets me or asks me if I need help. Perhaps its because I dont get all glamorous when I go shopping....? When its time to refill my Smashbox BB Cream, Ill go through Macys or Nordstroms.

47.description: I should probably never be allowed in here.I spend all my money here on things I don't really need. But I feel so pretty after wards. That justifies me spending all my money here. Right? RIGHT?!?!?!This location can be a total clusterfuck because of being on Michigan Ave, but mostly, this place is liquid sex to me.

8.description: I went in for a free (with a minimum purchase of $50) makeup makeover and I'm so glad I did. Anita was my beauty consultant and not only did she listen to what I wanted but she made incredible recommendations. I only purchased a few items that she used during the makeover but since then I've gone back and purchased almost all of them! They make such a difference. I would highly recommend checking this service out! And Anita is awesome!

31.description: Kiss me, Kate!  Better yet, may I bow down at your feet and declare my eternal love? Because you freakin' rock!Just moved to Chicago and needed a new "city girl" look. Want to look crazy fierce from my head to my toes. Today took care of my head. Buying foundation is the most awful chore and if not done properly you look like a freakish clown. And then nothing else looks right. Kate helped me using the Smashbox line (from primer to highlighter to foundation to powder to lip stain). And she showed me how to do it so I could duplicate it at home. When she finished, the enormous grin on my face spoke volumes. I just wanted to hug her.No hard sell at all. No "I made up your face, chica, so you better buy lots of crap" nonsense.  She simply asked if I would like to purchase anything. Would I like to purchase anything?  Um, yeah!  I bought EVERYTHING. On the way home some random man on Clark Street said I was pretty. Don't tell Boyfriend.

34.description: Janet was the most incredibly helpful staff member that I've ever come across! I already love the place, but it's just confirms how fabulous Sephora really is. Merci beaucoup!

16.description: Love this location. I come here very often VIB Rouge. Everyone is very helpful and knowledgable. Good job.

13.description: I was very impressed coming into this Sephora. Everyone was super friendly and I spent a lot of time deciding which perfume to buy. I was given tons of perfumes to try based on the scents I liked or not. In addition, I was given take-home samples to try to ensure there was not headache or other allergic reaction from the scents I liked.  Overall, I was very pleased and will be returning :)

11.description: Everyone here is so amazingly friendly and helpful without being pushy! I haven't shopped here in a very long time and it was so nice having so many people be so willing to help! Everything I was looking for was fully stocked so it was hard not to spend so much BUT I had points to redeem when I was checking out which was a very pleasant surprise!

39.description: Some things to note about this Water Tower location:1.) Most importantly, it has an ILLAMASQUA SECTION!! I've always wanted to find a Sephora store with this brand in stock, and after visiting countless locations in Chicago and the burbs, we finally have a winner. Definitely play with these products if you stop by - their cream eye shadows, lipsticks and nail polishes are amazing quality and have both mainstream and bold colors.2.) They also have high-end brands like Guerlain, Givenchy, YSL, Dior, etc. that you don't always see at Sephora.3.) Took me a while to realize this, but they don't have a little section exclusively for their rollerball perfumes. Instead, each rollerball is located next to its corresponding bottle of perfume alone the perfume shelves.Other than that, it's your typical awesome Sephora store. Oh how I wish I could spend less than $50 per visit...

37.description: I could spend all day in here...this place is THAT amazing.Guys...if you get your girlfriend/wife a giftcard from this place, BOTH of you will be happy.a.  Your girl will think you are the shiz-nit.b.  Your girl will look better with the products she gets here.I think you will agree this is a win/win situation.

0.description: Staffs of this place are the top! Friendly, knowledgeable, so helpful. I have very sensitive skin, so always want to try before purchase. They help me with samples and I found many products that work for me from this place.

38.description: Sephora, you own me. We began our relationship about two years ago, but not until I began living across the street from each other have we become inseparable. It's getting pretty serious...the more I spend time with you, the more I love you.See the thing about Sephora and I is that we have an understanding for one another. Sephora knows what I want (amazing products all in one place) and I know what Sephora wants (my money). It's the ultimate package, with tons of added benefits: my beauty insider card that tracks points and lets me choose gifts at certain point values, knowledgeable associates who can answer all my product questions, and a plethora of products to choose from and play with.I've become addicted to the experiment and play attitude that sephora inspires when I walk in the door. It's given me the opportunity to test drive different brands, which has led me to some of the best lotions, bronzers, mascaras, eyeliners, eyecreams, etc.  specifically for me.

51.description: My name is Elle and I'm addicted to Sephora, MAC, NARS and Make Up For Ever.  One of the many perks of my job is being right across the street from Water Tower Place, so if I need a mid-day pick-me-up, you can usually find me at Sephora or the MAC counter at Macy's.We all know Sephora is a beauty junkie's crackhouse, and Colby is my go-to girl for a quick fix. This location is always brightly lit, the displays and testers are usually clean and well-stocked.  Perhaps not always fully stocked, but I don't think they've ever been out of stock for something I was feiningg for.I was so intently swatching like EVERY color in Make Up For Ever's HD Microfinish Blush line, when she came over and asked if there was anything in particular I was looking for.  I was looking for the color of my beloved NARS Orgasm powder blush in cream form.She immediately picked out #6 - Quickie, a fusion of bright salmon and peach - when she finished applying it on me, it came out to the perfect  pinky/coral/peach luminous GLOW I was looking for then suggested a matching lipgloss from Laura Mercier.  Perfect for the spring/summer months ahead - I have been searching for a pigmented blush and lipgloss in this color FOR.EVER and Colby found a perfect match for my skintone in both in under 5 minutes!  I was beyond high.For the most part, the staff is friendly, and in case Colby isn't around, I can usually find someone to help me with what I'm looking for.  But when I need a fix, Colby to the rescue - she's sassy, knowledgable and fun, and knows how to feed my addiction quickly.

27.description: I've gone to this Sephora a few different times, and always had a great experience. The staff is really friendly and helpful, and they never overwhelm me with asking if I need help too often or annoy me with suggestions/info I don't want. It's like they've all figured out that delicate balance between welcoming customer service and overbearing smothering and pressuring. Plus, they are so awesome about taking returns/exchanges, with or without a receipt. And when I had a bunch of questions about my Beauty Insider account, the woman at the register didn't even flinch. Just answered me as best she could and then told me what I needed to do to get my problem fixed and gave me all the info I would need. Perfect.Oh, and they have an AMAZING selection of makeup, including a lot of brands that other Sephoras don't have. Totally worth the bus ride.

32.description: This is my Mecca. Sarah was helpful while applying my new brow products (Anastasia: it's a good train, get on it). And she gave me a free sample of the cooling gel to try at home. But unfortunately for my fellow Yelpers, the bulk of my review will be of a visiting employee, JC, who travels all over the nation to different Sephora spots. He is a godsend. By the time I left his capable hands, I had been (willingly) talked into a foundation primer, cake eyeliner, and a lip plumper. Mind you, I did ask what else he could show me after the lip plumper. The good news is this visiting associate apparently will eventually make it back here, but not for several months. GO NOW!The store itself is clean and bright, and there are no shortage of employees to help you. I really love their point system for free gifts. And I got my birthday gift, a shower gel/shampoo combo from philosophy. People, spend money on the good stuff. Your face will thank you.

54.description: With the holiday's approaching rapidly, I needed a few $25 grab bag gifts for the women in my life, and I was able to find everything I was looking for here.* Korres jasmine butter duo to go - lip butter and body butter that moisturizes without being greasy with a subtle hint of jasmine.* Philosophy winter escape - hot chocolate bubble bath, marshmellow body lotion and lip balm, what woman wouldn't want this treat under their Xmas tree?* L'Occitane shea all day sampler - complete with body wash, body lotion, mini hand lotion and foot lotion.  Seriously good sampler for the woman in your life with dry, itchy skin.I left here with my gifts in hand as well as some free samples and the special gift promotion, for myself.  The customer service was great and I could of easily spent a ton more time and money here than I actually did.  Being a self describe product junkie, I can see how this place can become addictive, so only once a year I'm allowing myself to stop in here and browse the endless rows of make-up and products.

48.description: It was like a religious experience, the first time I visited Sephora. All the gleaming, beautiful shiny, pretty, expensive baubles. The wall of delectable fragrances, the mounds of lotions and make up to experiment with. The angels eager to demonstrate how good a smokey eye would look on me (and, boy, did it). The bundle of free samples given with my purchase. My Mecca-it was just...heavenly.I only wish the Orlando location would treat me as well.

44.description: Went back here to return some mascara that didn't work out, that I had purchased from the Sephora at North Bridge (yes, the customer service at that one is such that I feel guilty about returning things there! They are super nice!)  I was greeted and people seemed willing to help me even though I just wanted to return something.  It appears that they've made some changes to the staff along with rearranging the store so hopefully the rude sales clerks and managers have either improved their performance or gone elsewhere.

24.description: Why would I not love Sephora if not for their free sample program that lets you try skin moisturizers of your choosing to determine which ones are the best for you? There is one reason: The person I needed help from was not present. Luckily, the men's fragrance specialist kept me company, but the skin care specialist person...where the hell were you? enough said...this is not great customer service at all

7.description: I had the worst experience today. I was standing alone the whole time looking for help. No one actually came and offered their help, even though there were staff just walking around.  It was ridicilous. When I finally found the stuff I was looking for, I went to check out to the cashier and asked if they have any travel size of the item I was checking out. The cashier said NO. Later on, when I was leaving I saw they have travel size. I also asked the staff if the cleanser I was getting as a sample is creamy or milky,  she said I dont know. Why they are there working if they dont know anything about the prodcuts they are selling?

49.description: After going to basically every Sephora in IL and in Manhattan, I have to say I am in love with this Sephora not because of its stock, its location (although having it right next to my boyfriend's flat is rather nice), but because one of the staff there is one of the sweetest, most helpful Sephora-nese ever. Because she used to do the job I am doing now she understands my needs (no foundations please, minimalist make-up for go sees, but they still need to be visible) AND she is one of the friendliest creatures ever. She aspired to become an MUA and is correctly educated to become one, so she has all the tips that I need when I go to a go-see and get judged as they peruse me like a meatloaf. If for nothing else, that staff has made my life MUCH easier. Her name is Colby, and while she has NEVER pushed me to buy a product, I usually walk out with a bag.

40.description: I love Sephora. This location has pretty much everything you could practically want and need, makeup and fragrance-wise. However, what's with the attitude? The cashiers here at this store are awful. They never smile, and they always give me sass. The sales people are all okay, some are a bit overbearing, but the cashiers... Can't get over their attitude!

53.description: One evening I feverishly rushed into the Water Tower Sephora with a skin issue that needed immediate attention (ok, so I'm a bit of a drama queen, but we all have our worries...)  I really had no idea what I was going to get, but luckily...     AMY J. TO THE RESCUE!!!  Amy is not always at this Sephora, as she is always visiting different stores to teach the staff product knowledge, but I sure am glad she was there on this day.  I told her what problem I was trying to address, and she immediately had 3 different products that could potentially provide the results I wanted.  She described them to me, and it's clear that Amy knows her shit, kids.  Another thing that was extremely impressive to me was that she really listened to what I wanted, and she was very sympathetic.  I loved this because sometimes you walk into an Ulta and they try to talk you out of whatever it is you're seeking (!), or they have no idea which products to reccommend.       Amy was knowledgeable, friendly, and most importantly, she didn't try to pressure sell me at all.  She showed me products and left the decision up to me.  She also gave me a free sample of this sunscreen I wanted to try before I buy it.    This Sephora is very clean, and most of the sales associates and cashiers are super-friendly and helpful.  No pressure to buy.

30.description: I went into this Sephora to buy a product I had seen advertised on their online website. I perused the entirety of the store without finding it. I spoke to Abigail about the product and she instantly knew that this particular store did not carry it but northbridge did and she would call to make sure they had it. Very good customer service and product knowledge even tho I didn't get the product there.

46.description: Love Sephora! This is a great store with great staff. This store has a sizable Men's section that is up front in the store so you don't have to wade through aisles of girly stuff to get what you want;  Very accommodating to the proper "get in, get out" shopping style. Christine has helped me get the various lotions and potions I need to be the freshest, moistest, sun protected person I can be. They have basically anything you could need for personal care in the excellent men's lines they carry.Here are my few minus points for the store:1) It is in Water Tower Place so it will be crowded2) The area the line starts is not well defined and leads to cranky ladies cutting each other and possible cat-fights (me-OW).

1.description: Basic. I only come here for perfume/cologne. Staff are generous and willing to help. But sometimes they hover. Which, in such a small space, feels like they are hawking you.

55.description: Totally awesome experience here....until I get home and discover that the free sample that I earned (208 points, DAMMIT!) is completely empty.Ick....Are you that pathetic that you have to steal from the free samples? I threw the empty container away and washed my hands with turpentine. Just kidding. I used soap, water, dried my hands then used globs of hand sanitizer.I'm going to shop at the location at Nordstroms from now on.

9.description: First of all, I'm a girl, this is my BF's account. I went to Sephora yesterday just to look around and wanted to get matched for a concealer and foundation. I am not a big makeup person. I rarely wear makeup and I wanted to see if there were any fun shadows or makeup that I wanted to begin to invest in. As far as my budget goes, I know I will be able to afford the pricier lines since I will be a doctor next year. I had Kady and Adela help me out and both of them were incredible! Adela did a full face for me without being pushy and she stayed focused, which I liked. She took her job seriously and still was fun and playful. I did end up purchasing quite a few items but like I said, I'm not a regular and I know that I'll be able to afford it, so I felt okay spending money on quality products that I'll use sparingly. I had an amazing time and I highly recommend Adela.

26.description: In a store that has everything you could want in makeup, thank goodness for their customer service.  I was in there yesterday, and I dont recall the woman's name, but she was so helpful in assisting me pick out makeup and brushes.  I have never worn lipstick before, and really wanted to find something right for me (and have failed for years), and low and behold, she helped me find the perfect pink lipstick!  Thank you and i will be back :)

25.description: Hands down, the best customer service I've ever received in a Sephora, and I've been to more than I probably should to admit to.  They didn't have what I was looking for (a basic hairbrush, as I'd forgotten to pack one), but I was so impressed with the friendly staff - who did not avoid me just because I was dressed in frumpy traveling clothes - that I went ahead and made some purchases there that I'd planned to make this week in Nashville.

12.description: I have been a frequent shopper at many Sephora stores; apparently so much that I was embarrassed when I reached VIP status.  Really? I spent THAT much money there? Ouch.Another reviewer is correct when she says the Water Tower Place store is rather hit or miss.  I understand there is an identity crisis when it comes to the customer base.  It's tourists vs Streeterville matrons vs workers on a lunch hour trying to replenish the make-up bag.  I am in the last category.  Unfortunately in the eyes of much of the staff at this Sephora that status is well under the others.  Lately it has taken forever to get help; with sales people helping each other apply makeup, chatting with each other, giggling, etc.  I made eye contact with a couple of sales people, smiled, etc and got nothing.  I actually had to open one of the lower stock drawers myself to see if the eyeshadow I wanted was in stock.  For the first time in my history of shopping at Sephora they were actually out of stock on something, too.  The place seems a little beat up, too.  There's a minor grubbiness to the place.Perhaps once tourist season passes things will be better at Water Tower but for now I will be making the North & Clybourn shop my home.  This is the second time I've been ignored and that's no way to treat someone you have designated a VIP.

59.description: Oh Sephora, you are my playground! I love Sephora for many reasons. They have any type of cosmetics and hair products you could want, they give you tons of samples, it's fun to play with all the makeup and for a girl that just never gets old! The thing I love best about Sephora are the little tubes of perfume. For $10-$20 you can get a little purse sized perfume and aren't stuck spending the big bucks on a full sized bottle (that I never seem to finish anyway.)  Also, a $10 mini-tube of L'Occitan hand cream?!? Score! :) I could spend hours trying samples and sniffing perfumes, but this location is one that I am only able to visit on my lunch hour. So, after a little adult recess I have to slink back to work smelling prettier and feeling more moisturised.

21.description: I love Sephora, but the staff at this location were not helpful at all.  The majority of them were just standing there talking to each other while lots of customers wandered about with questions.  One was standing next to me as I was browsing the Kat Von D line and I said, "Excuse me?"  And he just walked in the other direction.  I then noticed another customer who had a question and she asked me if I was having trouble getting help too and I told her yes.  I even asked her, "Do I have something in my teeth?  Do I smell? Is that why no one wants to help me?"  She laughed and said, "I give up.  I'm going to Macy's."  I also gave up, which I am really disappointed about because I really wanted that Kat Von D palette.

17.description: Had a great experience today with Domingo, who helped me with a tricky return situation. He was awesome and handled it with no problems at all! Will definitely return.

10.description: I am a big fan of Sephora however this branch is not that good. At other locations the reps are friendly and help you find whatever you are looking for. Here I was told to go towards fragrance to find what I am looking for !!! I was about to spend 100 US on eye cream and the rep was very dismissive - she actually said ' I wouldn't recommend any of the brands for eye cream!! ' really!! Great customer service !!

5.description: Niceeee! I came in to claim the free with purchase makeover and my beauty consultant was super nice and knew so much! I feel like a new woman, I walked out of there with a whole bunch of new products and I feel like my makeup routine has gone NEXT LEVEL! Only problem weas it was just a bit crowded for my liking and the line was long, but don't let that deter you!

3.description: I shop at Sephora on occasion but mostly for nail polish and lipstick. I've always gone to MAC for foundation and powders. However I got a gift card for my birthday and since I was running low on makeup I decided to give Sephora a whirl. Gabby was super sweet, knowledgable, and showed me how to put on each item and every technique. I walked out spending more than my gift card but it was totally worth it. Their face cleaning products are choice as well. I bought a small kit so I could see how I'd like it; it's only day one and I love it. Gabby gave me a lot of samples of items I didn't purchase (YET) as well as her business card. She was wonderful. I will definitely be back at this location and am no longer a MAC girl.

35.description: This Sephora is dangerously close to where I work and I see myself spending a lot of money here in the future on beauty products I don't really need.I was asked by no less than five employees if I needed any help finding anything. Somehow this didn't annoy me. I found it endearing.

19.description: I'm a VIB member of Sephora as I love it very much. Usually I can find what I'm looking for in the store and the staff are always quite helpful! However, when I went to this Sephora about one month ago to get a toner, nobody welcomed me or greeted me in the store. And after wandering around for 10 minutes, still I was approached by nobody  neither was asked if I need help. After realizing that my Claudier toner was sold out in the store, I found an African American staff and asked if she could recommend a different product. She then talked me into purchasing this expensive Fresh Rosewater toner. now it has been 1 month since I started using this product and I'm quite disappointed. I told the lady at Sephora that my sensitive skin gets very dry during Chicago winter and this toner is not moist at all! I have to apply a lot every morning just to feel a little bit of hydration. Also, the toner is very expensive compared to the Claudier one I used to apply. Overall, this store has the worst Sephora staff, they don't welcome their customers and they have no knowledge of their products but only want to sell expensive over-priced things to you. Stay away from this store if you can!

28.description: Better to  shop at the store in the Northbridge complex where Nordstroms is located in about 500 North Michigan Avenue if you want very good service and customer appreciation for your business and very positive fun experience and better and more product selections.

45.description: I'm a make-up whore. I'm always reviewing, buying, and playing with the latest makeup trends and products and Sephora doesn't disappoint. Whether  you're looking for a new product, a new trend, or a whole new look, Sephora  is the place to go. If you spend enough ($500), you even become a beauty insider, which gives you special perks, samples, and coupons. Admittedly, I became a beauty insider quite a while ago...

33.description: Still LOVE my Sephora.I came in here today thinking I just needed to buy some travel-sized moisturizer and little did I know, I would meet a very knowledgeable esthetician. She introduced me to a little something called hyaluronic acid. Never heard of it. I wasn't wearing any make up so you could see every blemish on my face. She told me I was "asphyxiating" my skin, and it just needed some hydration. This will hopefully help with the redness, the occasional break out, and just provide some calm to my irritated and sensitive skin. Here's hoping it helps because it was not cheap. However, another reason why I love Sephora is their amazing return policy. If me no likey, I returny. Also, I had enough points to get a free gift, which resulted in a Murad set of three sample sizes. Love it.Sephora staff are always very knowledgeable and I feel confident that they are knowing what they're talking about. This esthetician did not work for Sephora, but in talking to her I felt so at ease and very comfortable buying this product. Considering my skin asphyxiation, she said it will be well worth the money.Anyway, as always, I heart Sephora :)

43.description: like a kid in a candy shop.... :)tons of products to test and try out. loud music. friendly staff. i have so much fun when i come in here... the staff is awesome! they are always so helpful and make recommendations, show you techniques and give great tips.its pretty crowded because its location on michigan ave but it's never overwhelming or anything. just gotta navigate carefully and make sure u dont bump into a tourist. they have the most awesome customer service... i actually went in yesterday and returned an eyeshadow palette i had for over a year that i only used twice. i used it a couple of times but really hated the colors but it never did anything about it so it just sat around in my makeup chest. i decided to take it in and see if they can even just give me a $5 discount or coupon on another purchase (the eyeshadow cost $50) and they actually returned it and gave me a store credit for the full amount. customer service is seriously the best here. theyre not snotty or rude when you return items (like at many places). i mean even at nordstrom, i had to return some lotion i bought online because it arrived in my package open and broken and it got all over a dress i purchased as well. the sales girl at nordies gave me a really big attitude and lectured me about how i should purchase makeup and clothes separately. all other retailers should take some notes about customer service from sephora and learn how its done!

2.description: Good customer service. I had to switch my Mac foundations to something else because Mac leaves my face orange looking. I recently got the shade and light palette from kat Von d which I like with nars concealer and the porefessional.

18.description: Thank you so much to the team at Water Tower for helping me out tonight! I had a horrible experience at the Oakbrook location, but the staff at Water Tower was very helpful and accommodating and is the reason I won't start shopping at Ulta. Thank you!

41.description: So this isn't a review for Sephora in general (though I am a huge fan), so much as for this particular location.  Although this Sephora is one of the smaller locations I have been to (it is in Water Tower Mall), it probably has the nicest staff of any location I have been to.  They are helpful, not too pushy, and really friendly.

52.description: I shop at Sephora a lot, but my most recent experience exemplifies why I keep going back.  A while back, I had been given a sample of an amazing (though very expensive) condidtioner.  I loved it, but I kept debating because of the price.  I went in and found another, very similar condidtioner by the same company for significantly less.  I brought it to the counter with another item that was recommended to me (while I waited in line, I was given another free sample, by the way).  When I looked at my receipt, I found that the conditioner had rung up for the same price as the other one I had wanted but not bought.  I brought this to the attention of one of the staff.  She looked into the matter and determined that the conditioner I purchased had been mismarked, and then proceeded to tell me it would be "her pleasure" to return credit the difference in the marked price and actual retail price to me.  The conditioner is great, but the service...impeccable.

50.description: I love this Sephora - it's packed with all of the latest cosmetics and brands a person could ever want.  Though it is often teeming with tweens and tourists, it is well worth the occasional bump, obnoxious conversations littered with the word "like", and halting in human traffic jams that goes on within.  If you're in need of any sort of makeup help - go find Colby.  She's extremely knowledgeable about her craft and so helpful in finding the right product for the occasion and skin type.  She did my makeup flawlessly and because she was not pushy and was approachable, I felt completely at ease having my makeup done, despite other store patrons milling all around and staring at me on occasion.  When I was hesitant at a certain shade of concealer, Colby offered to give me a sample so I could see how it would work for me in the time being.  That is customer service, and that reflects why I keep on going back to Sephora for all of my beauty product needs.  Even their cashiers are so pleasant and seem happy to be there -- a rarity in the retail business.No matter what product I'm looking for - NARs, Microderm, Philosophy, Make Up for Ever - I'll be coming here to make my purchases and add to my stripey black-and-white Sephora bag collection.  Hands down, one of the best and friendliest beauty stores in the city.

4.description: This store is the only reason I enter water tower place. Stopped in over the weekend to try a new foundation and left a happy camper. I have a nasty habit of not wearing any drugstore makeup and this place satisfies my addiction!

6.description: I have a makeup addiction and Sephora helps me feed my habit. To show you how bad it is I am VIB Rogue which is the top level. In order to reach VIB status you have to spend $1000 at Sephora in a calendar year. Done and done. Lol. Out of all the Sephora locations in Chicago the Watertower location is my favorite. I have gotten many make overs here and my favorite makeup artist would have to be Natalie and the store owner Shauntel. I usually come in with a picture of who I'm trying to look like that night and they get the job done while letting me in on application tips. The last time I visited the store I attended the March 30th VIB Rogue event. Love that you got to bring a friend and they provided breakfast and a decent free sample bag. I was lucky enough to have Shauntel assist me in finding a orange lipstick which was a success. To show you how knowledgable she is she was immediately able to tell me the eye concealer I was wearing was too dark. She told me I probably had on Dior 5 and I needed a 4. When I got home to check she was right! Even though it was half way gone I was able to exchange it with no problem. Love Sephora and the team at the Watertower location.

22.description: I have been a loyal Sephora shopper for quite some time and always accumulate Beauty Rewards points when I make a purchase. I noticed that one of the 500 point gifts was a new perfume sample that I have been anxious to try, but was disappointed when I heard that my point total was not quite 500. The sales lady saw my disappointment and let me know that I was able to go into a negative point balance if I wanted to redeem the points that I did have now in order to secure a sample. It is a small, materialistic thing,  but her going out of her way to help me literally made my day! Thank you Sephora!

15.description: I love Sephora, but the staff at this location were not helpful at all.  The majority of them were just standing there talking to each other while lots of customers wandered about with questions.  One was standing next to me as I was browsing the Kat Von D line and I said, "Excuse me?"  And he just walked in the other direction.  I then noticed another customer who had a question and she asked me if I was having trouble getting help too and I told her yes.  I even asked her, "Do I have something in my teeth?  Do I smell? Is that why no one wants to help me?"  She laughed and said, "I give up.  I'm going to Macy's."  I also gave up, which I am really disappointed about because I really wanted that Kat Von D palette.

57.description: I love Sephora. Really, I do. Which is why I stopped in here with a friend to pick up some make-up. Since we had time to kill, I thought it would be fun to get her make-up done. She always wears very conservative make-up, and we just wanted to see what she could look like with a little bit of color.One of the employees agreed to do her make-up. I explained that we were just trying to experiment, and we wanted to try out some crazy colors. The salesgirl looked at the make-up we picked out, looked at my friend, and goes, "Do you really want to try this? Do you normally wear these colors?"She then decided we didn't do an adequate job of picking out colors, so she found a make-up kit containing all shades of brown. When I insisted she use color on my color-less friend, she hesitated. I finally pointed to a bright shade of purple and told her to put it on. She brushed a very light layer over my friend's lid, "See, if you don't use too much, it comes out very soft. Like a lilac color."I was beginning to lose my patience. "We would like to see the BRIGHT purple." She brushed it on, and my friend said, "Wow, that's bright. I think it just shows off the bags under my eyes." The crappy salesgirl responded with, "You're right, let's take it off." I pointed out that the purple under her eyes was from the flecks of eyeshadow that fell. And if her bags were really bad (which they weren't), the salesgirl should have offered a concealer. Really, I could have done a better job. How hard is it to do what the customer asks?

20.description: I went to this Sephora to get skull face makeup for Halloween. I showed one of the sales women a photo of what I was aiming for and she immediately grabbed two products for me. One was black lip gloss, which she said I could use on my face in addition to lips, and the other was a paper-white concealer for the rest of my face. It totaled to a little over $70, but I figured she knew what she was talking about. Then came Halloween. Any person with common sense would know that applying a wet lip gloss to a wet base would be nearly impossible, and yet that's what she sold me. It was extremely difficult to wear the makeup because it kept dripping off and never really dried. The lipgloss also burned and irritated my eyes, so I think she made up that the lipgloss could be worn anywhere else besides the lips. I've never had an issue at any Sephora before, but this makes me never want to go to one again. Not only was it a significant waste of money, but it made the weekend quite difficult (I had to walk around with tissues and Q-tips so I could repeatedly fix the makeup and soothe my burning eyes). Clearly the sales woman lacked basic knowledge of makeup application. She had only rubbed a small drop on her own skin of each liquid too, so I didn't think that the products would be an issue (or would never dry).In short: A woman sold me expensive makeup that was nearly impossible to apply to myself.

36.description: My relationship with Sephora began approximately a year ago when a friend took me to this store to look for fragrances. I fell in love with the test and play experience of the store. Then my friend took me to Ulta for some Halloween makeup. Sephora became my It Store for everyday beauty products. Beauty products from Ulta were usually items that I can use and toss. Their products cannot be compared. If you want quality, go to Sephora. I've also been to other Sephoras, but this location is by far, my favorite one. As a budding psychologist, I know it's because I frequent this one more often so I came to love it more. But I'd like to think that it's so much more than that! I think the customer service at this location is so much better here than anywhere else.I always get great customer service here. Every time I come in here, someone always greets me, someone always ask if I need help with anything, etc. I love that. Today, I learned that if I'm stuck between two fragrance choices, they'd even give me a little sample of each to take home so that I can think about it some more. Nice! Ask for Linda. She was very patient with me. She even showed me how to find a scent that's close to what I'm currently wearing on their touch-screen computer. Then she worked with me to figure out what type of scent I like more. (I realized now that the scent I love is more classic, less flowery, less sweet, and less spicy). That is awesome customer service!I mean, go to any Sephora (or Ulta) and you'd find similar products (ok, you may not find the high end stuff at Ulta), but the customer service just really does it for me here.

14.description: I'm a total glam queen and love everything makeup. The assistants who work at this location gave me a lot of attention by teaching me how to do winged eyeliner. At one point I had two people giving me makeup tips. It is also really nice to shop in a stress free atmosphere.Unlike so many other cosmetic stores, I didn't feel compelled to by anything. Sure the prices are probably more than what I've seen at drugstores, but I like the quality of the products. Facial moisturizers are plentiful at this location.

28.description: I've finally found a place to get a cut in Chicago.  Peter is possibly my favorite barber of all time.  He takes the time to understand what you want and then uses his expertise to create a great cut.  He doesn't rush, made great conversation, and really made the haircut a full experience.  I'm usually not a fan of getting my haircut more than once every six weeks or so, but Mr. Barber was so enjoyable that I'll be going a lot more regularly now.

1.description: This is the most honest review I will ever write. I will NEVER get my hair cut anywhere else. Let's start with the quality of the haircut you will get. For nearly nothing, these guys will give you the classiest, most handsome haircut you will ever get. This is the top of the line as far as quality is concerned. And the straight razor neck shave with the neck massages make this a full service cut. The environment is everything you want at a barber shop. Small. Quiet. One tv. Warm and relaxing. Peter and Cesar are the most personable, friendly, and conscious people that will ever touch your hair. They made me feel comfortable and knew when I wanted to talk and when I wanted to be quiet and relax. Amazing people. I give this place 5 stars only because I can't give them 10. Go here. And never go anywhere else.

39.description: I am new to Chicago and I was in desperate need for a barber.  Halo is a few doors down from me so I stopped there first.  It looked like a bad Sex in the City episode.  I want old school masculine.  More Steve McQueen than Jason Giambi  I decided to make the mile walk to Mr Barber.  It was well worth the trip.  I got a traditional haircut with hot towels, straight edge razor, and more scissors than clippers.  Even better than the haircut was the conversation.  Peter can talk on any subject.  It's not everyday someone can go from Alexander Karelin to local politics.  Quite an experience.  I definitely found my new barber.  I highly recommend to anyone else looking for a barber.

9.description: My husband was unable to get a haircut before coming to Chicago for vacation. We were happy to find this barber close to our hotel ! Caesar gave him a great haircut! My husband said it's probably the best haircut he's ever had

29.description: I've had my hair cut here two times. Both times, Cesar cut my hair, not Peter. And both times I received the best haircut I have ever had.Peter's small shop is top notch, from the comfortable chairs, to the inviting and friendly pair of scissor-wielding magicians (literally!), to the warm-foam back-of-the-neck shave to end the cut. You get what you pay for (a cut for me is $35), but after venturing elsewhere, I quickly realized why I should be willing to spend the extra dollars. And that's all there is to it. You want the best? Mr. Barber.

42.description: Peter aka "Mr Barber" is the best!  I've followed him from The Drake to Oak St and to his current Walton St location.  He can cut hair just as well as he can kibbitz, and he is a pro at that!  Caution: if you are a Blackhawks fan be prepared to defend our team, as Peter is a die-hard Red Wings fan.

23.description: Peter is the best. Always a smile on his face. Always a great job.  Easy to get appointments and always on time.  What more can I say?

5.description: Nice to be at a barber where they take pride in what they do. This place isn't very visible from the street but it is indeed there. Look carefully for the small placard in front of the address. Cesar cut my hair. I like the cut and I'll definitely go back.

31.description: Peter is a great guy who really takes pride in his work.  From the very first time I visited, he listened to what I wanted, gave me his opinion, and used it all to give me a great haircut.  I couldn't recommend a barber more.

25.description: I had my hair cut by Peter today. It was my first visit. It was the most detailed haircut I have ever had. He made sure every hair was in place including my eyebrows and ears. A great service for $35 (plus tip).

12.description: You know, I've never been to a true barber here in Chicago. For the past 12 years or so I've gone to mainly discount hair cutting places with a coupon. I tried doing the elite male salons for a bit but I felt it was the same hair cut but at a premium price.Now, I'm going bald (yes, a hard pill to swallow). I decided to try a true barber before it was too late so I turned to Yelp to find one near where I work. THANK YOU YELPERS.Here is why I love this place. First off, you need to be buzzed in, so it isn't like it is a walk up, I felt kind of prestigious right off the back. This place is a class act, a real guys barber. Ceaser went to work right away, using a towel instead of those fuzzy throw away neck binders. We get around to talking business, the hair cut then he goes into a conversation like we've known each other for years. He is showing me his article, taking about his services, his past and everything. It wasn't rushed, it wasn't snip snip get on your way. We are having a real good time.He takes his profession very serious and he is giving me advice as to what to do with my hair.  He is doing his thing and before I know it, we are finished. Shocked he turns me to the mirror and honestly, don't take this the wrong way, but it doesn't have that "fresh cut" look! You know what I mean? It isn't all shaved and cut short but I can tell that it is shorter without that just cut look which I loved!Definitely going back before I don't need to if you know what I mean. I want to go get their other "services" as well. $35 for everything. For the hair cut you get a straight blade neck shave with the hot oil, the warm towel on the head, the cleaning, I mean they don't skimp. I can't wait to see what you get with the shave and the massage.Do yourself a favor. Treat yourself right.

37.description: My recent first visit with Mr. Barber of Chicago provided me with the most wonderful haircut experience of my life.  Peter's attention to detail and engaging conversation made me not only enjoy the haircut, but it lifted my spirits for the remainder of the day.

21.description: You know, I've never been to a true barber here in Chicago. For the past 12 years or so I've gone to mainly discount hair cutting places with a coupon. I tried doing the elite male salons for a bit but I felt it was the same hair cut but at a premium price.Now, I'm going bald (yes, a hard pill to swallow). I decided to try a true barber before it was too late so I turned to Yelp to find one near where I work. THANK YOU YELPERS.Here is why I love this place. First off, you need to be buzzed in, so it isn't like it is a walk up, I felt kind of prestigious right off the back. This place is a class act, a real guys barber. Ceaser went to work right away, using a towel instead of those fuzzy throw away neck binders. We get around to talking business, the hair cut then he goes into a conversation like we've known each other for years. He is showing me his article, taking about his services, his past and everything. It wasn't rushed, it wasn't snip snip get on your way. We are having a real good time.He takes his profession very serious and he is giving me advice as to what to do with my hair.  He is doing his thing and before I know it, we are finished. Shocked he turns me to the mirror and honestly, don't take this the wrong way, but it doesn't have that "fresh cut" look! You know what I mean? It isn't all shaved and cut short but I can tell that it is shorter without that just cut look which I loved!Definitely going back before I don't need to if you know what I mean. I want to go get their other "services" as well. $35 for everything. For the hair cut you get a straight blade neck shave with the hot oil, the warm towel on the head, the cleaning, I mean they don't skimp. I can't wait to see what you get with the shave and the massage.Do yourself a favor. Treat yourself right.

16.description: Excellent service and quality. I showed up at 5:30 on a Saturday evening - $35.00 for a wash and a haircut. Peter is fantastic and his client list reads like the who's who of Chicago.

17.description: Decent shave and haircut, but pricey ($70) for what it is. I know I'm from out of town and not a regular, but there was really no attempt at making conversation. Very different than the barbershop experience I was used to from living in Boston (Razors there gives you better cuts and service for $30). It's even more pricey than the salon stylist I go to in Los Angeles. However, I was in a bind, and there was no wait for a walk-in, so that was definitely a plus. All in all it was an ok experience.

10.description: Peter is an awesome guy and he takes time to do the job right. Could not say enough positive things about my experience here.

11.description: This is no regular barber shop. This is an all around great experience. The best in Chicago.

26.description: I've been going to Peter for the past 1.5 years and have always been so happy with the results.  He's the best barber I've ever had!
