27.description: Peter is amazing. I usually avoid talking to haircutters, but Peter made it easy to hang out and chat about everything while also giving me a great haircut. I also got the straight razor neck shave, which was completely amazing. Highly recommended.

35.description: Very nice hair cut for a good price.  The owner cuts your hair which is something I did not expect coming to the "Big City".  He has a good sense of humor and a pleasure to get a hair cut from.Call to make an appointment.  This is a very private shop just the owner and a part time barber.

8.description: Best barbershop and haircut I have ever had .

0.description: I have a 5 STAR experience at Mr. Barber of Chicago!  Peter is truly amazing and embodies what it means to be a service professional.  I walked in unannounced and he had no problem taking me for a quick clean up.  Luckily the next appt. cancelled so he spend a little more time with me which was amazing.  So great to get a top of the line barber who actually knows what he is doing and talking about.  I felt completely comfortable even though this was my first time even getting a shave/beard trim.  All in all I highly recommend but be sure to call ahead first this guy is busy.  His phone kept ringing over and over during our appt which didn't bother me.Peter is a saint finally I know what it looks like to have a proper beard line haha.

38.description: Great haircut from a great guy.  He was in the Drake for a long time and was barber to most of the professional hockey teams as they'd come through Chicago - so he built up a lot of regulars and has some great stories.  I'll definitely be returning.

20.description: Hard to find but totally worth it. Make sure you go through the residential door at 200 Walton and up the steps or you might miss it. Go back in time to the men's salon experience of old. Caesar and Robert do it right. Make sure you're not in a hurry. You'll want to linger just to listen to the stories.

19.description: Probably the best barbershop in Chicago.  Peter will not only give you an amazing haircut, he'll offer you a cup of coffee and conversation as well.  As a Detroit Red Wings fan this is, THE place to get a haircut. Peter will cut your hair, tell you stories and show you pictures of his times hanging out with the Wings and the Russian 5.  The most important thing about a good barber however isn't his ability to conversate, it's how well he cuts hair.  Peter is damn good at his cutting and styling hair.  I would recommend him to anyone who needs a haircut but especially if you're from Detroit and homesick.

33.description: My son just went there for the first time.  Very friendly and interesting guy.  Nice haircut.

2.description: I wish I lived in Chicago to get a haircut and shave from Peter. Mr. Barber of Chicago is a real barber shop with tons of character and history.  I always make a point to come see Peter when I'm here.

34.description: I am just in from Los Angeles for the weekend and needed to get cleaned up for a business meeting the next day.  Walked in on a Sunday early afternoon.  No wait (but I'd call first to check).  It is hard to capture in words the level of expertise and skill Peter brings to the table.  From the conversation and service I suspected he used to be a surgeon, scientist, or a nuclear physicist in his past life.  Or perhaps a pro-hockey player.  Anyway, you won't find a better haircut, bear-trim, eyebrow trim anywhere, I am certain.  Peter is no BS.  Reasonable price.  Warm cream neck shave, straight razor, old-school master.  If you are in the right frame of mind, you will leave feeling like you just went to see the man on the mountain.  And as he says, "he will make you handsome".  I suppose he can't work miracles if you're ready for the scrap heap, but if you want your best hope, Peter's your man.PS: entrance is not well marked, gotta walk into entryway and ring buzzer at 200 E. Walton.

32.description: It's difficult to describe the stress of attempting to find a new hair cutter person in a large city. While there are plenty of options, the likelihood that one of those people will deliver a solid, precise cut at a reasonable price is slim.As such, I'd prepared myself for this inevitable trial and error process when I called Mr. Barber to make an appointment.It seems I needn't look any further.Mr. Barber is located in the northern Streeterville area, inside an attractive turn of the century high-rise. He quickly makes you feel attended to, smiling and explaining to me that he's just finishing up with the prior client.From the pictures on the walls, you might think that he knows half of Hollywood and Chicago celebrities. He probably does. And initially, this was a bit intimidating."Am I about to pay for a $100 haircut?" I worried.Peter is a very skilled barber, completing my cut within a 30 minute window. He needed little guidance, relying on what he saw in my hair when I walked through the door. I was given a quick shampoo to remove the product from my hair. Within a minute, I was wrapped up in a cape with scissors whirling about my head. Finishing things off, I received a smooth straight razor shave of the back of my neck.Fifteen minutes later, he was done, having efficiently and expertly trimmed my hair. The conversation (and laughs) flowed easily -- we were fast friends by the end of the appointment.It seems I would not have to hunt around much for a new barber. The price was MUCH below what I'd expect for this area of town without sacrificing quality.Thank you Peter for a great cut. I'll see you in a month or so.

18.description: Hard to find but totally worth it. Make sure you go through the residential door at 200 Walton and up the steps or you might miss it. Go back in time to the men's salon experience of old. Caesar and Robert do it right. Make sure you're not in a hurry. You'll want to linger just to listen to the stories.

41.description: Peter is simply the best. He was recommended by a friend after I tried a few other places in the area. He is very personable and always tries to make you feel at home. His new location on Walton is great.Peter takes pride in his business and it really shows. I look forward to seeing Peter each visit and highly recommend him to anyone looking for the best haircut and service in Chicago.

13.description: Simply put, the best find for any gentleman in downtown Chicago!   Moved from Seattle & was looking for a great barbershop, & I found a diamond when I came across Peter, aka Mr Barber of Chicago!!!  The best barber in Chicago.   It's a professional cut, great conversations, can walk-in, call ahead, & easy to find.  To find: same side as the Drake but further south, located at a red brick entrance, after you enter, then there's a buzzer to enter the actual building. Peter's the best barber I've come across & he's demonstrated that he wants his clients to be satisfied with their cuts.  I highly recommend his services as the best in Chicagoland!

4.description: Absolutely the best shave and haircut I've ever had in my life. Mr. Barber (Peter) represents the best of Chicago and he's frankly superb.

24.description: I checked this place out yesterday based on some reviews I had read on here. I can honestly say I received one of the BEST HAIRCUTS I'VE EVER HAD.  Cesar did an excellent job, I will be going here from now on.  I was so impressed that I actually created a yelp account specifically to write this review. Highly recommended.

6.description: Peter is, without question, the best barber in Chicago.The Service is excellent, the accommodations pleasant and comfortable, and the quality of the service is second to none!Great price and quality attention!Excellent ... Geoffrey

22.description: Friendly atmosphere, nice barbers and great haircut. The straight blade shave of the back of my neck at the end was a really nice touch. Couldn't recommend more.

15.description: I've had my hair cut here two times. Both times, Cesar cut my hair, not Peter. And both times I received the best haircut I have ever had.Peter's small shop is top notch, from the comfortable chairs, to the inviting and friendly pair of scissor-wielding magicians (literally!), to the warm-foam back-of-the-neck shave to end the cut. You get what you pay for (a cut for me is $35), but after venturing elsewhere, I quickly realized why I should be willing to spend the extra dollars. And that's all there is to it. You want the best? Mr. Barber.

40.description: Peter is great! If you are a hockey fan (especially a Redwings fan), this guy is an absolute must. Ask him about Blagojevich.

7.description: As many have said, Peter is the man. He's the heart and soul of "Mr. Barber," and has perfected the art of entertainment, service, and hair cutting over his career. A little on the pricey end ($35 for a men's haircut), but I'll be back in 4-6 weeks!

36.description: Peter has been cutting my hair for more than 10 years.  In my work one must be neat and well dressed and Mr. Barber does the job when it comes to an excellent haircut.  In addition, Peter is an enjoyable conversationalist with a pleasing personality.  I highly recommend Mr. Barber for complete satisfaction.

30.description: Quite possibly one of the best haircuts I've ever had. If someone at your hotel suggests going somewhere else... don't! Go here instead.

3.description: Great barber shop, ideal for a quick, well-donz haircut...and an enjoyable chat! Peter is skilled and affable, and provides a great barber experience! Suggested especially if you are in town and/or work at the northwestern campus downtown!

14.description: They really take their time to give you the haircut you want. Other barbers in this area rush through or just use clippers but that's not the case here. Definitely worth it and I will be back.

1.description: ***This is a 2-level museum store that features quirkier and more interesting stuff than most museum stores; there are several fun and/or useful knickknacks / novelties as well as a few tie-ins with the museum (I wish they had more price friendly tie-ins with the museum's collection; maybe they do and I just missed them); if it is important to you, this museum store features several attractive cashiers***I am not sure what the parking situation is at this gift shop.

9.description: I could live in this store!! Loving my adorable solar panda. Was able to pick up a herpes Giant Microbe for a friend's housewarming. So much to see, read and explore in here. I want it all. And imagine my excitement to find the second floor of books and japanese toys!!! Graffiti, interior design, fashion, robots!?!? I almost did cartwheels in the aisles! I only spent an hour in the store and that was not nearly enough for me. MUST GO BACK!

23.description: With holiday shopping just around the corner it's helpful to have a few 'special' gifts in one's kit-bag.The MCA store, located adjacent to the Museum of Contemporary Art, carries a wide selection of intersting items including fun stuff for the kiddies. There's a book store upstairs, too.Hours:Tuesday                         10AM - 8PMWednesday - Sunday  10AM - 5PM(free Museum admission on Tuesday between 5 and 8PM)

12.description: Scored 4 CF spring beaded bracelets here for $18.  Who knew I would find jewelry?  Lots of other cool stuff for visitors young and old.  If I could pack more in my suitcase (and not break it), I would buy so much more.

21.description: Fun fun fun! I love the gifts here. Yes they are quirky, like who needs Missoni dishware, but they are absolutely inspired and fun. When you are holiday shopping for the person that has everything, you are bound to find a great gift here. And the proceeds go to the Museum, so you aren't just a shopper, but a philanthropist. Gosh I can justify shopping in every way, shape, and form.

16.description: This is where I get like 80% of my holiday shopping done.  I could browse in here forever.  They have jewelry and handbags and motorized birds that sing and hop around.  They have dishes and books and baby onesies and little plastic dudes that wave and smile when the sun shines on them.  Ahhh, love.  PS, you get a discount with your membership.

17.description: Cool little shop. I feel like about half of the stuff in there is a bit overpriced, but hell, it's a gift shop at the MCA. Of course I think half of it is overpriced. The staff is fairly friendly, and with the amount of unique books, posters and knick knacks inside, you might spend as much time checking out the store as the museum.

10.description: I just love this store, great unique gift ideas here. Just came here last week for an update on the new exhibits. Good times. Love the MCA.

5.description: They have a lot of super cool stuff here. Prices are on the expensive side, but I think its worth it since everything is so unique and you cant find it at other stores.  My cousin bought a floor mat that I thought was really unique.  I came in here today in search for it but it wasn't here anymore!!! Lesson learned! If you think something looks great, just buy it! Otherwise it may not be there tomorrow!

11.description: With holiday shopping just around the corner it's helpful to have a few 'special' gifts in one's kit-bag.The MCA store, located adjacent to the Museum of Contemporary Art, carries a wide selection of intersting items including fun stuff for the kiddies. There's a book store upstairs, too.Hours:Tuesday                         10AM - 8PMWednesday - Sunday  10AM - 5PM(free Museum admission on Tuesday between 5 and 8PM)

22.description: I love art museum stores-- and I am a huge fan of the MoMa store but while the MCA store has a really great collection of art books upstairs (not too mention great videos and mags) I am less impressed with the downstairs shop.  One pet peeve is that they have some nice looking chairs scattered around but don't actually sell them-- you can't even order them! Second: most of the brands and items they carry can be found in other stores in Chicago.  They have some cute bags and accessories and some cute kids stuff, perhaps for holiday giving but make a trip for the cool art books and the art-- otherwise, save your $.

0.description: The MCA store is one of my favorite places to buy unique and fun gifts for family and friends! There's an assorted variety of household items, books about Chicago and art, gadgets, as well as one-of-a-kind greeting cards that aren't more expensive than what you can find at Walgreens ($2-$5). Members of the MCA also get a discount off all purchases!

20.description: I always go here when I am completely out of gift ideas for people.  They have very unique and fun items that will sure to make anyone delight. You can also rest well at night knowing your purchases are supporting culture and art in Chicago.

19.description: Oh man. This place is dangerous. Often better than the exhibitions themselves.  A huge library of coffee table-worthy books, funky clothes and room decor. Very commercial Warhol-heavy though. In all a great place for gifts that you'll end up keeping.

2.description: This is a cool little store, better than the museum itself. A good place to buy a gift or just something different for yourself

18.description: one of my favorite places to shop, browse, get lost. it's such an awesome store, great for getting gifts for the person who has everything (because trust me, they don't have a string doll keychain or a bag made out of rubber bands). upstairs - you will find sweet books on artsy topics, architecture, design, fashion, music, film. i have gotten some great books here and a few that inspire me in my work as an ad-peep. you'll also find hard-to-find-anywhere music, cards, notebooks and figurines.downstairs - very cool Ts (original, few made), artsy jewelry, bags, homewares, trinkets, etc. also, random but i have to comment on this - the bags they give you are so ultra-sturdy and have a cool design on them, you'll want to reuse them again and again...and you won't want to put your clothes to give-away to the salvation army in it!

13.description: Great store!  I was so pleased to find a poster from an exhibit that they had 6 years ago.  I also love the bathrooms at the MCA.  Sleek, elegant.

4.description: A hidden gem and a great place to come for a unique gift. While it is filled with a million things you would never NEED, they are all things you would love to have. Jewelry, movies, books, decor, toys, children's gifts, and more. Everything inside is so interesting. Just be sure you don't miss the second floor! It is also open later that the MCA itself.

6.description: All my friends and family members will be getting CHristmas present from this store. I will be buying myself a Christmas present - or 3- from this store.Upstairs has a fantastic card selection in particular; the book selection was interesting to me, as I'm not a big art buff, but it didn't look enormous... then again, I'm spoilt by seeing thousands of books like this in one place because it's the family business. I did spend twenty minutes looking through a retrospective of Marc Jacobs advertising imagery while seriously considering buying a cushion in the shape of a dunkin' donut (it had sprinkles, people!) The point is, there is something for everyone. Some of the jewellery is heart breakingly expensive, some of it heart breakingly beautiful, some of it heartbreakingly crazy. When these 3 things align, I am in retail heaven. My mum bought a cheese grater in the shape of a mouse and a post-it note holder in the shape of a moose, and was ecstatic. My brother inspected Gloomy bears and crazy Japanese toys for a full half hour.Like I said, something for everyone!

15.description: Things you don't know you want yet. This is the perfect place to spend some time looking through a bunch of stuff you didn't even know you needed. It's also one of my favorite places to shop for Christmas and birthday presents. The store is huge [2 levels] and offers a wide selection of merchandise from coffee table art books to jewelry to toys for the kid in all of us.

7.description: Anyone who who shops Michigan Ave. for gifts would do very well to walk a couple blocks down Chicago Ave. and shop here.  I buy a lot of books from the upstairs bookstore, some really unique stuff that is hard to find anywhere else in the city, or even on the internet.  It's a nice way of contributing to the museum by shopping here, as well.  Like Andrea pointed out, the staff is very nice and helpful, a nice change from the cliched hipster attitude you get in similar shops out in the neighborhoods.  Prices for some of the items seem a little high, but it helps to keep in mind that many of them are limited artist editions with secondary market value, and often go up in value in the future.  Some great stuff for kids, too--yet another reason to avoid the Disney store.

8.description: great store to shop for unique gifts, especially if people are into music, art, architecture, and graphic design

3.description: I said it before and I'll say it again. THANK YOU MCA. You have plagued my life with multitudes of kidrobot designs and labbits galore. If I hadn't been here, I would have never bought my first labbit and gotten pulled into the craze that kidrobot has inspired today.Other than crazy fun kidrobot / Japanese pop-culture toys, this store holds hordes of books on every subject art and contemporary society related. This store is very reasonably priced (read expensive kidrobot labbit story above ...) and have some of the newest, coolest toys around. No wonder people are set on buying Christmas presents for their friends and families here. I would too! ... if I didn't hog all of it for myself.This store is just as a must visit as the museum itself. Tons of great finds and fun things to browse.

14.description: Okay, one question... why have I never been in this store?! I've lived here for 3 years! I went in over the weekend, and I loved it. I could've spent so much more time in there, but I had impatient family members waiting on me. This place has two levels of awesome. Going to be such a great place to buy holiday presents this year. The second level is full of toys and books that I swear were meant for me. I bought a Kidrobot toy that is a pair to one I already own. I have not seen this toy in stores, or for retail price, since last summer, at least. So seeing it in stock, and buying it, totally made my day. The staff were really helpful and friendly as well. I would definitely recommend checking this place out if you are into art or any sort of quirky trinkets.

3.description: Just left the store as I was trying on a bead my bracelet Broke  the sales girls said that it's a different franchise and she would not do anything about it even though the bracelet was less than a year old  I would not let my mom buy anything at the store and stoped. 400 sale. When I complained she said she would send it out to be fixed but it would take att lest  4 weeks  but she only said that because I said I was going to call and talk to the manager tomorrow. She still said it was still better to bring it to old orchard.   She did not want to honor a sale from another store. This is not accetable customer service So I would recomened  be careful  were  you buy if it's a present because the sales girl at the water tower did not want to honore a sale from another pandora store. I would not recomend to buy pandora if  the stores do not back the product.

1.description: I've been here twice!! Every time I wasn't greeted. My husband and I got married last Friday, so we want to buy a new charm to celebrate this special moment. No sales come or say anything like "somebody will be with you shortly'. We waited there for about 15 mins. My husband said let's buy it online since we know sales persons there didn't have good service attitude. But I insisted we wait. Finally a sales man came, we said we just married, he said okay...I'm a little unhappy since we waited for 20 mins and then just got this. But I still asked if  they had a special Chinese symbol charm, he just said "no, we NEVER have that." I said I saw it in New York's pandora store. But he said impossible, maybe you just saw some other jewelry but not Pandora's!!! I'm so pissed off then I left bought nothing. It's the day I got married. I was happy before I entered this store. I really saw it in other Pandora's store with my own eye!! Okay? Seriously! How dare he can judge and say that! If I can give 0 stars, I will!! Never come to this store AGAIN!!

2.description: I called today and left a message for the manager...no response yet!!   Why does that not surprise me???   Sub par service...so I did not spend anymore than the special.  treated better at Woodfield.  ....I went to the Water Tower store for the Special a few weeks ago....I was told the Radiant Bloom charm was not for sale...only on a special bracelet.  What gives?  I am a very and I mean VERY good customer at the Woodfield store...happened to be downtown and stopped in Water Tower.  If you are going to only sell certain charms on Special Bracelets...let me know.  That is so unfair.  So disappointing..  You may think because you are in Water Tower you have built in business and that may be so...but I will never stop back..you also need good customer service...Managers tend to hire employees like them...not returning my call and your sub par service from employee...shows your true colors...

5.description: The people are nice. I wish there were more of them on busy days. They have the cutest charms.

0.description: I went in yesterday  where i was "suppose" to see Vicki and continue my purchase. Well she wasn't  there smh... Anyway thats fine because Kate helped me and she was awesome. not sure if it was because she knew about my past experience or if it was legit. Either way i was very pleased with the staff there today. No one from my last horrid experience was there. I came in for 1 specific charm and walked out with 5 for my moms bday. That girl can sell lol... so kudos to Kate!!!!!..oh the 4 stars was only because i thought  i was meeting with Vicki and thought  she was aware i was coming  but she left early

4.description: I have 2 sisters and a mom, and all of us have Pandora bracelets. We're always excited for every Christmas and birthday because that means we get to go shopping together for new charms. That tradition came to a screeching halt this afternoon when I visited the Pandora store at Water Tower in downtown Chicago to buy a snowman charm for my mom. Some girl with a clipboard walked up to me and basically barked at me that I needed to put my name on a wait list. I was on my lunch break from work, so I politely asked if she knew how long it would be. She replied "No." Ok, awesome. Very helpful. I explained to her that I was on my hour lunch break and if I could possibly add my name to a waitlist now to come and pick up a charm around 5:30. She replied "No." Herein lies my problem. I understand that you're busy. Welcome to the world of retail during the holiday season. But as a loyal customer who is paying a lot of money for overpriced charms that I could buy somewhere else, I expect to be treated with a lot more respect than that. Maybe you could have asked the 3 sales associates standing around the register talking to help out some of the waiting customers? Maybe when asking a customer to sit around with their name on a waiting list, you could do it with a slightly more pleasant tone? My career is in sales and I would never dream of treating a paying customer with such disrespect. All of the bad customer services reviews I've read on the internet are now starting to make sense, and I'm not surprised that about 5 customers walked out behind me after they saw how the woman treated me. A bit of advice - hire sales people who suck less. Oh, and happy holidays.

3.description: Sophisticated shopping for older women 26-50...great clothing a bit pricey but you can find anything in there even if you're 18.

1.description: They kept pushing the fact that the clothes were "wrinkle resistant" but I wad all my clothes in a ball, even when I know they're going to wrinkle.  People wouldn't recognize me otherwise.  I'm not really into it, but the clothes seem to be good quality, so I think I would recommend it to certain people.  I like things a little more tailored.

2.description: I've never found anything in this store that I would ever want to be seen in public wearing!  Maybe its just not my style but I think the clothes here aren't cute at all.. its a lot of earthy toned, flowing stuff and not very trendy

0.description: 5 stars for the great colorful clothing, which I personally LIKE.  2 stars for the fact that this morning at 10:00 AM a sale associate actually shooed out a customer who walked right in when their door was unlocked and started browsing!  Oh my!Come on Chico's (and all the other stores at Water Tower Place)......All your customers now have cell phones and we KNOW what time it is and if your WALL clocks aren't accurate-they need to be!Get with the times!

1.description: The staff here get 10 STARS! They were so kind and considerate towards me when I shopped here. They really know their style, I love shopping in Akira because it feels like you have a personal stylist, which for a fashion challenged person such as myself is a must!The manager in particular was super kindUnfortunately they got 3 stars overall from me because of the quality of the clothing relative to the prices. I don't think I would ever buy anything from here at full price. But despite my issues with the quality, the staff keep me coming back. I do not shop anywhere else. Why bother having your day ruined by rude staff when you can shop at akira and leave feeling great!

9.description: I went to this location to find an outfit for a holiday party. I was really excited because I had heard such wonderful things about this location but I was surprised because that wasn't my experience at all. I heard one of the girls bad mouthing the clothing as she was organizing a table. The other employees were gathered around the cash register talking about their one night stands and their sexual experiences for the entire store to hear. I approached the only girl that wasn't up at cash register which was the same girl with the blond messy bun organizing a table, for some assistance but she was very rude and short with me. She looked as if she had just woken up because she didn't have an ounce of makeup and looked very messy. For a stylish clothing store like Akira, especially Akira at Water Tower,  I would expect if the staff were more stylish and didn't dress like they just got out of bed. She must've gotten up on the wrong side of the bed because she was rude and obviously didn't like the clothing that Akira was selling calling it "hideous" and "who the f*** would wear something like this?" All in all, I walked out not buying a thing.

23.description: Two for one Hanky Panky Panties! Candy colors! Prints! How am I supposed to resist? I can't.More Please!

5.description: I was gifted a pair of Hunter's Boots from this store for Christmas. I wore them about two times before the back strap of them broke. Given they are not cheap boots, I was a little disappointed. I took them back to the store to see what could be done as Hunter's only allows you to go through the retailer they are purchased from. Akira was amazing. They fully exchanged the boots with no questions asked and the manager I spoke with (I believe her name was Missy) also gave me a ton of coupons for me to come back. Given this was not their fault as they only sell someone else's product, their service was amazing. I was very pleased!

25.description: This store has the perfect mixture of crazy going out clothes, fun and classy going out clothes, "I have style" work clothes, purses, and SHOES, oh I LOVE their shoe collection!Along with the perfect mixture of types of clothes is the perfect mixture of prices. You can find a $300.00 dollar dress, a $50.00 dollar dress, or a clearance dress for woah cheap.The staff was so helpful and not in my face. The last time I was in, the store was crowded but they had at least 5 sales associates working. They knew how to help without forcing me into a sale or a dress I would never wear.

12.description: I discovered this store for the first time on yesterday and I'm in love! I wish this store was in Atlanta! Hats off to the staff! They made me feel like I was shopping with my girlfriends and the manager (I think) went out of his way to find the dress that I wanted in the right size and color! I'm coming back with friends next time!

21.description: I have purchased a hat a week ago. I didn't like it and decided to return. But sales person,Jillbar,didn't tell me all the accessories are final when i purchased the item. Even i asked the Store manager to help me they were so persistant. They said it is a store policy. Policy is not a law...It changes every once a while....Economy is not great these days.Every store is competing with each other....You guys need persistant policy and workers or new customers and their satisfaction?  The reason i wanted to return was store hasn't enough mirror to look and they all covered by clothings..and poor lightings.....When i tried on at home it looked different...but sales lady monica was so helpful and were trying to help me to find something to exchange with hat....But didn't worked out overall...

16.description: Living in Cali all my life, then migrating to Denver, then visiting Chicago's Akira...... How come Akira hasn't opened up in California!!!!???? Or Any other fashion smart state yet?????  I LOVE AKIRA!!!  I had my doubts, but the variety of clothing, style, and fashion forward items (they had stuff here that I know Cali and Colo didn't have yet) definitely a great find!!!! If I'm ever in Chicago, first stop isn't the 3 story Forever XXI, it's the AKIRA!!!!!!! Memory: My first Spirithood awwww :) Ladies, it's from pricey to super pricey, but well worth the buy!! One of kind for sure. I'd compare this store as a Fred Segal / ASOS / TopShop, the best!!!!

17.description: Of course the shoe selection is adorable and extensive - I don't have an issue with that. But whenever I find myself drooling over a pair of ankle boots or thigh high beauties, I can't help but remember that I can get the exact same thing for a much lower price (using customer rewards coupons) at Macy's or Lord and Taylor. Or the Internet (Endless.com, Zappos.com, etc.).My advice, if you stumble across something you really love but are cringing at the price, would be to look it up on Google first to get a complete list of all the stores that have it in stock. Paying full price + 10% sales tax at Akira should be the last resort.

10.description: I went in to buy some shoes....although the guy helped me a little....none of the shoes I wanted were in my size and I felt like he was blowing me off...I wish he offered to call another store.meh.

11.description: As far as clothing stores go around here, Akira is like a more sophisticated (and more expensive) version of a Charlotte Russe, or a sassier version of Express (equivalently priced). They have a great Red Label lineup right now. The service was great (the guy who helped me, Tiger, saved me a changing room and even picked out some dresses for me while I was shopping).Some of my most favorite dresses & scarves come from Akira. A lot (though not all) of their stuff is spunky without looking too gaudy on you. Designer-like wear without the designer price.The only thing is that some of their stuff is poorly constructed with cheaper fabric and craftsmanship than, say, an Express.I love this place, though!

26.description: So, I think I have a client that shops here and buys the most awesome shoes.  I, however, only went in because my daughter's and I were taking our au pair to do some shopping (though I'm not nearly as pretentious as that sounded...)  Anyhoo - LOVE THIS STORE!  First, thank God for Abigail 'cause without her, I would have bought nothing and my children would have ended this shopping session in about 3 minutes.  Let me just start at the beginning..I naturally drift toward understated clothing to such a degree that I often feel understated when I really wanted to feel hip and breezy.  So a store like this is QUITE daunting to me.  Au pair chick went right to town.  I, on the other hand, initially saw the store through a mother's eyes and thought to myself, "Self - your kids are about to give you a run for your money that you don't want to spend."  Well, thank God again because Akira had some video of a fashion show (set the music in the store), on at least a 42" plasma and a couch right in front of it.  There sat my two girls, who proved themselves totally un-chic and truly mid-western as they loudly commented for almost 40 minutes, "Her dress is too short!  His hair is too weird! Why do they walk that way?!  That boy needs to button up his shirt, momma, we can see his boobies..." and on an on it went.Now, I coulda (and typically woulda) just said "F - it" but the au pair chick was havin' me paged to the dressing room.  So, as I headed on in, I asked Abigail to find me something "cute" but not too out there.  THEN I come to find out their sales rack was "buy one item, get the second for $1" !!!!!!!!!  NEED I say more.  "Miss Understated" did not leave empty-handed.While some of their stuff is a little out there for me, then you find something just perfect and unexpected.  I will be back - and if Abigail can't help me, her colleagues will do just fine as they were all helpful without being in my butt.

27.description: To celebrate the beginning of summer, this brand new location threw a soiree last night that involved the following:*complimentary wine, champagne, soft drinks and hors d'oeurves*20% off everything in the store*a gift bag full of Water Tower Place goodies (Godiva truffles & C.O. Bigelow lotion, anyone?) and certificates for spending over $100So basically, a straight man's equivalent would be free beer & pizza, a gift bag of porn and 20% off everything in ESPNZone.I wandered in here completely unaware of this, merely noticing the balloons in the display, and to my great surprise and pleasure, I had a wonderful salesperson (Abigail) guide me through dresses, designer jeans, tops, and shoes. It's tough shopping in a store when every girl in the fitting room is a size 3 or smaller except you, but Abigail made me feel beautiful. She even helped me find a pair of Paige jeans that looked fabulous on my ass.Thanks, Akira! I thought I would miss Mango, but I can't imagine a better store opening up in the same spot. I will definitely be back.

0.description: Uh, can I just say that I love RJ! He's awesome! I came in here because I had a wedding to go to and I didn't have anything to wear. He spent basically a full hour with me trying to help me find the perfect outfit. He also helped me style it with jewelry and gave me some advice on shoes that would go well with the outfit. Oh did I mention that he did this all while the store had already closed?! I came in about 20 minutes before closing (I know..I'm super annoying, but I needed a dress!) and he spent so much time ensuring that I loved my outfit before I could leave. I ended up finding two amazing dresses and necklaces. I've never felt so cared for within a store! He also gave me a coupon off shoes if I wanted to get any at their shoe store upstairs. This was an amazing shopping experience and I will be back for any and every other event that I have! If you're coming in here, ask for RJ and he'll make sure you look good and you love what you buy!

20.description: I rarely shop at Akira. But my experience at the water tower location was great that I might go back in the future. The sales associate Vahn helped me. He was wonderful and so helpful.  He helped me picked out some cute jacket. Plus I like it when I can buy regular priced items on sale when they have promotions. I don't see how this place is like forever 21. You can definitely find something that is not cheaply made. Plus my clothes won't fall apart after wearing it once.

19.description: This Akira is small, so don't go there thinking that you are going to find their entire selection.  They do however have some very good finds.  The staff at this location is much more friendly and helpful than other locations that I have visited, and talked me into buying this fantastic little black dress.  They also were able to recommend shoes to match.  It was an all around good shopping experience, and I'd definitely go back.

2.description: I've always had decent luck at the Akira Footwear on State Street, even finding a pair of Sorrels two seasons ago that still get compliments. Their store in Water Tower is very squinchy, and the two salespeople at the counter were all over me as soon as I walked in--not good. I started to feel claustrophobic, slowly losing my grasp on sound shopping judgment, so much  that I was contemplating buying a pair of  knockoffs of the Valentino rockstud pump for $39 (clearly, too good to be true, as these are $995  shoes). I got out of here as soon as it was humanly and politely possible to do so.

18.description: To celebrate the beginning of summer, this brand new location threw a soiree last night that involved the following:*complimentary wine, champagne, soft drinks and hors d'oeurves*20% off everything in the store*a gift bag full of Water Tower Place goodies (Godiva truffles & C.O. Bigelow lotion, anyone?) and certificates for spending over $100So basically, a straight man's equivalent would be free beer & pizza, a gift bag of porn and 20% off everything in ESPNZone.I wandered in here completely unaware of this, merely noticing the balloons in the display, and to my great surprise and pleasure, I had a wonderful salesperson (Abigail) guide me through dresses, designer jeans, tops, and shoes. It's tough shopping in a store when every girl in the fitting room is a size 3 or smaller except you, but Abigail made me feel beautiful. She even helped me find a pair of Paige jeans that looked fabulous on my ass.Thanks, Akira! I thought I would miss Mango, but I can't imagine a better store opening up in the same spot. I will definitely be back.

13.description: I rarely shop at Akira. But my experience at the water tower location was great that I might go back in the future. The sales associate Vahn helped me. He was wonderful and so helpful.  He helped me picked out some cute jacket. Plus I like it when I can buy regular priced items on sale when they have promotions. I don't see how this place is like forever 21. You can definitely find something that is not cheaply made. Plus my clothes won't fall apart after wearing it once.

4.description: What a friendly sales staff!!!! Would give 5 stars for that but overall the place ranked a 3. I wasn't particularly impressed by their selection or their prices but I was delighted by how genuinely helpful my salesperson (Nick!!) was. He was engaging and gave great suggestions - especially when it came to matching dresses with accessories - and brought me additional dresses to try on when I told him I was looking for red dresses in particular. His red dress suggestion was by far my favorite - didn't get it because I didn't think the material justified the cost but definitely appreciated him grabbing it for me and finding me the perfect black drop necklace to go with it (did get that!).

24.description: I love Akira and miss it now that I am far away from Chicago:(  Thank god they have an online store!!  They have great styles and prices.  When I visit Chitown it is a must to shop there!!

6.description: Love this store!!! Fantastic staff and great selection. On a recent trip, Bonnie was a huge help in getting me into a gorgeous dress that I love love love. Definitely go here with time to shop and an open mind. The staff will pull looks for you and encourage you to try all sorts of things. They know their inventory incredibly well and have been spot on in making suggestions if you let them know the event you're shopping for.  I look forward to my next visit!!!

22.description: This Akira is small, so don't go there thinking that you are going to find their entire selection.  They do however have some very good finds.  The staff at this location is much more friendly and helpful than other locations that I have visited, and talked me into buying this fantastic little black dress.  They also were able to recommend shoes to match.  It was an all around good shopping experience, and I'd definitely go back.

15.description: Two for one Hanky Panky Panties! Candy colors! Prints! How am I supposed to resist? I can't.More Please!

7.description: I absolutely love this store.I usually shop online at shopakira.com and they have really cute stuff!!If you shop around you will find that they sell some of the best items (designer shoes & dresses) at the cheapest prices out there!The only thing I hate about the website is that the inventory is not always up to date. There has been times where I've purchased an item online and then received an email stating that they dont have that size/color/style in stock anymore-- even though the website clearly indicated that they DID!Cant wait to visit Chicago again so that I can stop by the physical store!

8.description: I've been to this location a few times, and this 3-star rating is for my overall experience there. For me the most part, when I come here, I find the staff to be unprofessional and rude/snobby. I've been to two other locations and this one is the only one where I find fault. But I must write about this one really nice experience I had with this one particular staff member. I think his name is Thomas (wish I could be sure). But anyway, I went in looking for a sweater dress and ended up with two. He had picked out a very nice one for me and I had found another myself. I was debating between which I was gonna get, but this guy picked out such a perfect belt with the dress I picked (the folks at Akira love to use belts as a suggest sale lol)! I was so impressed because I never would have thought that the belt he picked for that dress would be such a genius match! The belt took my sweater dress to a whole new level, so now the dress is even more versatile. I usually don't like when sales people suggest other things to me, but he was so smart with his suggestion! I That's how I walked out with two sweater dresses. I'd give him 5 stars, but the overall customer service I've experiences is really a 1 or 2.

3.description: The store is very small and I did not find anything that interested me. However, the manager (I think) is SUPER friendly and made the visit more enjoyable.

14.description: LOVE Akira! I came in yesterday (a BUSY  Saturday) and I was greeted and helped right away! I came in knowing exactly what I wanted, I HATE crowds (and tourists!)and I wish I knew the associates name who helped me because he had me in & out in 10 minutes!

28.description: We come here every year for our company's holiday luncheon. The service is amazing; they remember which one of us is new to the company, they remember that my boss likes to have a glass of milk at the end of his meal. The champagne and the wines never stop coming, and they have Christmas carolers going from table to table, singing well, Christmas Carols to you.  It was amazing!The luncheon was buffet-style (I'm not sure if it isn't on regular days). I loved the variety of salads they have, the cheese platter, the various cured meat, the different entrees -- an excellent variety of vegetables and meat. Their bookbinder soup is amazing, if only a little lukewarm-- I like my soup piping hot. And I love their crabmeat and oyster stew. The food is always delicious, every year that I come here with my company.The only thing that I don't particularly like is that the restrooms are soooooo far away, in another part of the hotel. Every year, I get a little lost trying to find the restroom. Other than that, I have no real complaints as the food and the service are amazing.

1.description: Nice place for breakfast or brunch. The service and food are both very good. In the winter do not ask to sit near the windows as it's very cold. I recommend ordering the fresh fruit - delicious.

39.description: Mmmmm, I had dreams and drunken conversations about their corn. And don't get me started on mushroom gnocchi. For a steakhouse, this place aint to shabby in the vegetarian department. Upscale white cloth dining with knowledgeable staff. Wine selection was tops. The bar upfront is a bit of a tangle to navigate through and I always get lost on my way to the restaurant.

9.description: Don't waste your money on this place until they get their mojo back, you can get a better brunch at the Holiday Inn Express.  It breaks my heart to say that, but these people need to wake up!!!My father first started the tradition of coming to the Drake for brunch when I was a child.  It has been a tradition ever since.  However, in recent years, the restaurant now called the Drake Bros, which was originally the Oak Terrace, has gone down hill drastically.  The space and view are world class, but the food and service has since diminished greatly, especially since changing to the Drake Bros name.  The Oak Terrace had a sunday brunch weekly that was to die for with original dishes and spectacular items like corn beef hash, prime rib, specialties, etc.... The Drake Bros has a mundane typical brunch of omelet station, meat and cheese, etc.  Nothing original and at a very expensive price.  Today we went to the annual "Charles Dickens Buffet" at Drake Bros.  This was originally the best holiday brunch in the city and arguably the world.  All traditional English 18th Century dishes and a Christmas feeling that couldn't be beat......See below review from 1997:  articles.chicagotribune.…Not any More.....Now it is a very substandard, mundane brunch that even dedicated 1/3 of the buffet to goofy little kiddie dishes like mac n cheese, french fries, pizza!!!! Yes Pizza at a 75$ per plate freaking holiday buffet..... Grilled cheese, etc...There wasn't even one egg dish, nothing original, just a pasta, a couple meats, one soup, a cutting station unmanned with precut, luke warm meats, the salad dressing could easily be recognized as bottled!!! YES, Freaking bottled dressing!!! The food was a joke.  The managers, and hostess barely spoke clear English, I think this place has been contracted out to some foreign owned chop shop restaurant operation.....What a damn shame.  If you read the above tribune review from 1997, you will see how wonderful this Event once was, and how incredibly foolish the hotel management is to allow it to be destroyed like this.  You are basically paying for the Michigan Avenue views.  They didn't even do the parade, just some Santa wandering around....But the carolers were very good.  I have to say, the rest of the Drake is awesome still, from the decorations, the Palm Court, the Coq'dor lounge, etc.... It is just the Drake Bros restaurant.....Please!!! Get a good chef and manager in that space and bring that tradition back to what it should be.

29.description: Drake Bros. is a wonderful place to enjoy a break from the frenzy that surrounds Michigan Ave. at Christmas Time. Navigate up the stairs past the xmas castle and towering tree, through the carols and festive tea room, to the dining room and a table overlooking Oak Street Beach. Enjoy the Tropical Shrimp Salad that will conjure up memories of a warm beach on a frigid Chicago afternoon. Delight in the very reasonable prices. Happy Holidays!

23.description: It's just Dad & I at Christmas these days. I don't cook, and he doesn't want to anymore.We happily leave it to the pros!So we had Christmas Dinner at Drake Bros. and couldn't have asked for a better experience. It was a bit of a pricey prix fixe 4-course, but we couldn't say it wasn't totally worth it. Started with a generous and delicate pan seared scallop, moved onto lobster bisque and our entree was the Beef Wellington -- cooked to an absolutely perfect medium. Seemed to liquefy in my mouth. Even the dessert buffet was good -- my dad loves mince meat pie, which is a decidedly 20th century delicacy these days. Well, the Drake dessert menu had mini mince meat pies! Leave it to the Drake to get it right!We had a lovely table overlooking Lake Michigan on an unseasonably mild, sunny Christmas Day. It was a wonderful experience. My "complaints" are relatively small -- the butter should be room temperature; the booth seat is a little low and the table a little high for a petite gal like me. And I don't like the fact that there's no place to sit in the valet area. My dad's 81--if he's gotta wait 10 minutes or more for the car, he needs to sit.Otherwise, The Drake does an amazing job and has a packed house for Christmas. We had a lovely visit from Santa, who even sat down at our table because he was tired (he'd been working all night, you know...) and the old-fashioned carolers were a nice touch as well. My dad was talking about that Beef Wellington and those mini mince meat pies three days after dinner -- always a good sign that he enjoyed himself. And that's really all we wanted for Christmas--a good meal and a good time with each other. Thank you Drake Bros. for helping to make that happen!

5.description: Drake Bros is a great breakfast option when staying at the Drake. The breakfast buffet has a little something for everyone. Looking for something a bit healthy? Greek yogurt, cereal, and fresh fruit. Maybe something a bit more traditional?  French toast, pancakes, eggs, bacon and more. They also have an omelette station for those of you who want to customize your protein intake. Appearance is clean, with friendly staff and huge windows offering views of Michigan Avenue and Lake Shore Drive. I would say the buffet option is of good value and the $30 a person price point is in line with other Luxury Hotel Buffets.*Gold & Diamond members get complimentary breakfast

31.description: Mom has been a member of 4th Presbyterian since 1988. I've had breakfast in this room (I think it used to be called the Oak Room) a few times each year since then. Several of the wait staff are long timers and recognize Mom when when we walk in, it's cute. I can't swear to it, but I think I've only ever ordered the Eggs Benedict. They're excellent, the breakfast is almost twice as expensive as my favorites in my neighborhood, but it's a more refined taste experience. Mom loves the bluebery pancakes and that's really why we go. Alas, yesterday, Mothers Day, they had no blueberries (thus no 5th star).

25.description: I went to the Drake Bros last Friday. The architecture is very nice. I ordered a plate a cheese and to be honest I was very surprised. The cheese plate layout is awful. No green, no vegetables, no salad or herbs. Just 3-4 grapes. Once you see that you don't want to go further and taste the cheese (by the way, the cheese was so so). I did not want to try somethings else. For this type of Hotel I think it's very disappointing.

12.description: Came for brunch. It was hearty and filling. They have an omelet bar with plenty of toppings. The bacon was deliciously crispy. They have the usual fruit plates and yogurt, the granola was yummy. The servers were the best part of this experience. They were all extremely attentive and nice. The valet area is a cluster-f@ck but it's only $14 when validated. In all, it was a good meal.

37.description: It was fun to have a drink here and some appetizers while the piano was playing etc. Great times in the summer.

21.description: What a fun coincidence that I happened to go to Drake Bros. restaurant the same day as it it RotD! I was looking for a brunch venue for a work meeting and Drake Bros. was the rare offering. The buffet spread was quite limited - cereal, fruit, eggs made to order and muffins. The menu was a little more extensive in optionality, so we opted for a la carte. The eggs, waffles and french toast were all satisfactory but not memorable. Service was spotty and we struggled just to find someone to request glasses of water! Drake Hotel overall has a history, but not so much a present..

16.description: Hostess and servers were aloof and seemed miserable, and the food was underwhelming. Pats of butter were small, cold and hard as a rock, potatoes were barely warm with no flavor, pancakes did not come with enough syrup, and omelette was not very filling. Orange juice was good, but the coffee was very bland. Server gave me an attitude when I asked for cream. I was disappointed since it brings down the hotel, which is quite nice. Won't come here again.

17.description: I ordered breakfast off of the menu, not the buffet. I just wanted a simple eggs, bacon, and toast breakfast. The scrambled eggs were runny, cold, and tasted like they were 1/2 melted butter. The potatoes were barely warm and bland. The bacon was good and so was the service! It was an expensive, bad breakfast in a great setting.

10.description: Had breakfast here twice on a recent stay at The Drake.   Very nice view of either Lake Michigan or the City with lots of tall windows.  Has either an ala carte menu or their Buffet.   Typically not buffet eaters but ordering ala carte was actually more expensive than their $26 per person buffet.  Had your typical buffet fare, lots to choose from. Good coffee.  Very fast and prompt servers keep your waters and juice topped off.

11.description: Today was the first time dining in the Drake Bros room, although I have dined in all of the other restaurants here. This is not an updated review, as Yelp reports. This is the first review of the standard cafe. It's way over-priced. I wasnt hungry, like my friend. The buffet would be the way to go if hungry ($27, adults), otherwise a light breakfast is expensive. The atmosphere is delightful, I admit; there is a cost for that. Service is good. My order of a side of bacon (3 pcs, $6) and toast ($4) is nothing to write about. Bacon is good regardless, and the toast was toast.

26.description: Ya know, I worry that it's cliche to give this restaurant 5 stars, but I cannot deny it, we had a great visit. We went on Christmas day and in all honesty, I just really wanted it over with, but the atmospher and mood of the day was so nice that I truly enjoyed myself.Hubs and I dined here the morning after our wedding as we stayed in the Drake on our wedding night, so we'd eaten the break buffet at the Drake Bros., but this was more special. There were roaming Carolers and my two adult stepsons were both in choir in their younger days and love to sing, so this was especially a great time for us. Santa walked around and we even took a picture with him. Merry Christmas!The food was really good and another restaurant didn't disappoint me in their preparation of duck. It was delicous. All the food was and the service was good too.It was Christmas so I'll let it go that it was kind of an assembley line, but we never had empty glasses or plates in front of us so it's not really a valid complaint.

27.description: Was having a wonderful time and a wonderful meal until there was a change in waiter...I went from having an outstanding waiter (and a five star rating) to having one that was not around to ensure that i was taken care of.  Waiter #1 attentive and excellent, his name is Roger.  Food was very good...a little too much butter on the asparagus, but other than that excellent.  Pretty views, pretty venue...excellent carolers singing holiday favorites.  For the most part highly recommended.

35.description: a very expensive brunch but it was well worth it for a special occasion.   The ambience, food, and service were all outstanding.  Overlooking lake michigan was a definite highlight.

8.description: Christmas dinner at the Drake

0.description: From the moment you walk in they are ready to seat you with a smile. Staff is so wonderful here. Food is very good. They only serve breakfast and I enjoy sitting in front of a large picture window looking at Lake Michigan

38.description: Okay, beefy yumminess.  Came here for our wedding night dinner & for the Sunday brunch the next day and were treated like royalty by the staff.  I'm sure they're great anyway, but we were definitely coddled. The room is comfortable and offers nice views of Michigan Ave and the lake, depending upon where you sit.  Very nice for people watching while dining.I had the lobster bisque, which was really wonderful & both the fella and I had the filet, he had the mashed potatoes and we shared orders of the chipoltle corn, the crimini mushrooms and the asparagus.  Steaks were fork tender and perfectly cooked, the sides were amazing, especially the corn.  Note - the sides are HUGE and served family style, plan on sharing as each side is enough food for about 3-4 people.  As previously mentioned, service was wonderful and the manager not only sent us (more) champagne, but also had the chef make us a special desert with our names on it to mark the occasion - nice touch!The Sunday brunch (about $50.00) is fearsome - try not to eat for about 3 days before coming in as there is enough food on offer to feed a third world country for months. It's almost embarrassing, seriously.  Service is quick and friendly, offers of juice, coffee and champagne are made regularly.  Hot and cold stations laden with roasts, whole fish, pastas, omelette's, waffles, you name it.  If you can eat it, they probably have it. We tried to sample everything, but we were a bit hungover and not quite up to the task.  That being said, everything we tried was fantastic and fresh - they run a tight ship here.  This would be a great place to bring a group for a nice brunch as there is something for absolutely everyone - just make sure to wear your fat pants, you're gonna need 'em.

20.description: We had breakfast here a couple of times while we were staying at the Drake. We ordered off the menu the first day and had the Chorizo and egg burrito, the St. Nectaire and organic egg sandwich with pork, and a fruit bowl. I liked the fruit bowl but didn't care for the entrees themselves. They were a bit dry and didn't have much flavor to them. We had the full breakfast buffet the other days and that was much better. They had omelets made to order, pancakes, sausages, potatoes, pastries, cereals, and fruit. The highlight for me was the  wonderful cut fruit selection (watermelon, cantaloupe, honeydew, pineapple, strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries). The fruit was fresh and all offered separately instead of being mixed together in a mushy fruit mix. The dining room has an old school feel to it and it was usually pretty quiet whenever we had breakfast. I'm sure there are less pricey options for breakfast in the area but it was a nice way to start off our day.

19.description: We come here every year for our company's holiday luncheon. The service is amazing; they remember which one of us is new to the company, they remember that my boss likes to have a glass of milk at the end of his meal. The champagne and the wines never stop coming, and they have Christmas carolers going from table to table, singing well, Christmas Carols to you.  It was amazing!The luncheon was buffet-style (I'm not sure if it isn't on regular days). I loved the variety of salads they have, the cheese platter, the various cured meat, the different entrees -- an excellent variety of vegetables and meat. Their bookbinder soup is amazing, if only a little lukewarm-- I like my soup piping hot. And I love their crabmeat and oyster stew. The food is always delicious, every year that I come here with my company.The only thing that I don't particularly like is that the restrooms are soooooo far away, in another part of the hotel. Every year, I get a little lost trying to find the restroom. Other than that, I have no real complaints as the food and the service are amazing.

33.description: Review of Mother's Day Brunch at the Drake 2008For $83 per person (plus 17% gratuity added to the bill), I expected a lot.  We ate in a gorgeous room (Gold Coast Room) overlooking Lake Michigan (at least in the distance).  They had very nice live music playing.  The food was very good, including an excellent dessert table.  They fed a ton of people on Mother's Day, and probably necessarily the food selection was more limited than I would have liked.  There was an enormous amount of seafood, which I liked.  But if you weren't a seafood fan, you missed out on a lot of the food.   For hot food, there really weren't that many options.  Omelets, pancakes, bacon, etc.  Also roast beef, ham and veal.  Then there were like 6-8 other choices.  The selection was just not there.They was a room for kids (with parents) where a magician performed a show a couple of times throughout the day.  There were big sheets of paper  with crayons for kids to color  -- on the floor.  Also a face-painter.  It was nice that kids had a place to run around, and my kids LOVED the magician.  But were tables to color on too much to ask for?  Just seemed like this was a real afterthought.Also, the service was bad.  I expect mediocre service on a major going out holiday like this, and the Drake delivered.  They refilled our water once.  Our plates didn't get cleared away when we went up to the buffet, at least not all the time.  There were a lot of overwhelmed servers running around but just not doing anything helpful to us.  On the plus side, I didn't feel rushed at all.Despite these negatives, the brunch accomplished what I wanted -- a fancy brunch on Mother Day.  The food all tasted very good and you just can't beat the ambiance.  As for value for the money, I would say it's not so hot.  But actually, I'm glad I went here.

2.description: No need to leave the Drake. WONDERFUL STAFF, Good Service, Above Par experience in ambiance and quality. Priced appropriately. TIP: In the buffet area there is nicely prepared, creamy oatmeal but before adding the extra's (granola, etc) at that stand, wander over to the fresh fruit bar that had candied pecans and several types of berries.  The short woman who settled us at our table (sorry, did not see her name) and our waiter, George could have been better nicer or professional.  George was appropriately, and intelligently,funny once he realized we could welcome some friendly banter. He started our our day with a smile.  They reason for 4 rather than 5 stars is that if 5 stars is Woohoo,.. well, I can say I'm a fan but with the price and the standard items, it's not a "can't miss" breakfast destination but it is definitely a "no need to leave the Drake, this is very good."

34.description: This is a great place for both dinner and brunch. Brunch is really reasonable ($40 a person I think) and includes all the champs you can drink! Dinner was a bit more expensive, but the steaks were really great. Definitely a good place around the holidays.

32.description: I have eaten extremely expensive brunch at a few other hotels, but the Drake Brothers have taken it to a new level.  The food is by far the best quality I have seen, but the service is unmatched.  I know it is expensive but it is so worth it.--Make sure you have a reservation otherwise you will never get in.  They have a limited number of seatings.

18.description: I felt pushed around from the outset.  As an experienced diner, I was asked our opinion of various dishes but the eyes rolled when I didn't concur with the servers  approval.  The food was correct but underwhelming.  I was hardly given time to breathe before the next course was put down.  The restaurant wasn't full, so I don't know why I was being rushed.  It was like being served by a bunch of automatons...

41.description: The food here is amazing nd the service is unbeatable. We may have been blessed with our server, Chimmey (who is leaving the restaurant to be a Drake Hotel Concierge), but is was fantastic. The decor is a little cheesy, which is the only reason it loses a star, but the view of Lake Michigan is beautiful. All of the recommendations were exactly as described and the wine list is not all overpriced bottles, there are some good deals there.

13.description: We had breakfast here a couple of times while we were staying at the Drake. We ordered off the menu the first day and had the Chorizo and egg burrito, the St. Nectaire and organic egg sandwich with pork, and a fruit bowl. I liked the fruit bowl but didn't care for the entrees themselves. They were a bit dry and didn't have much flavor to them. We had the full breakfast buffet the other days and that was much better. They had omelets made to order, pancakes, sausages, potatoes, pastries, cereals, and fruit. The highlight for me was the  wonderful cut fruit selection (watermelon, cantaloupe, honeydew, pineapple, strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries). The fruit was fresh and all offered separately instead of being mixed together in a mushy fruit mix. The dining room has an old school feel to it and it was usually pretty quiet whenever we had breakfast. I'm sure there are less pricey options for breakfast in the area but it was a nice way to start off our day.

4.description: The buffet style breakfast was just okay. Not worth it for the price but overall good because it was inside the hotel

24.description: It was nice for a quiet lunch.  I had the New England clam chowder which was as good as the best in New England.  I also had the lobster roll and I would not recommend it.  There was mostly knuckle meat and not a lot of lobster meat in the sandwich.  They also put too much tarragon in it - i guess they were trying to make it upscale, but honestly tarragon has no business in a lobster roll.  My final issue with the sandwich was way, way, way too much butter on the grilled roll.   My husband had the turkey sandwich and fruit, he liked it.

6.description: We had a wonderful brunch with a lovely view and perfect service from the hostess to the waiter and everyone in between. We had Eggs Benedict and bloody Mary's. Outstanding!!

22.description: I was very surprised to come to this page and see all the high-star reviews. I went to breakfast this past Friday and was very unimpressed.Two of us enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which was priced at $23 each. Though that's not all that expensive, I had a really hard time feeling that I got my money's worth. Pros:Coffee & OJ (good-quality) included in the buffetOmelets cooked fresh to orderCons:Though an adequate selection, nothing stood out on the buffetPotatoes and cinnamon rolls were very dry from sitting out for a long time (or I hope that's why)Berries were not washed prior to being put out on the buffet (and didn't really taste good either - they don't necessarily need to be offered if not in season)The "brioche" french toast was nothing more than what looked like thin pieces of white bread made into french toast, lacking flavorWe were told that the buffet would be closing in a few minutes and were given a warning if we wanted to get anything else. When we immediately went up to it, half of the buffet was already put away without us having a chance to get anything else had we wanted it.I really expected more from The Drake. Service was fine, but after having been to afternoon tea at the hotel numerous times, the food in this restaurant did not live up to the standards I was expecting (or the price). Additionally, after working in a restaurant that served a magnificent brunch buffet, I know how imperative it is to keep the food fresh and tasting good, even to the last seating - something overlooked by Drake Bros. I will know not to return for this meal unless it has somehow improved.

15.description: What a fun coincidence that I happened to go to Drake Bros. restaurant the same day as it it RotD! I was looking for a brunch venue for a work meeting and Drake Bros. was the rare offering. The buffet spread was quite limited - cereal, fruit, eggs made to order and muffins. The menu was a little more extensive in optionality, so we opted for a la carte. The eggs, waffles and french toast were all satisfactory but not memorable. Service was spotty and we struggled just to find someone to request glasses of water! Drake Hotel overall has a history, but not so much a present..

40.description: The Drake Bros. Restaurant is tucked away on the first level of the Drake Hotel.  It is a very upscale atmosphere and the food is very tasty.  I was here for lunch and had the Tropical Shrimp Cobb Salad which had mangos, pineapple, avacados and of course, shrimp, and it was delicious.  If you are looking for a nice break from Michigan Avenue and want to treat yourself to an extremely nice lunch this is the place.  The service is top notch and the prices are very reasonable for a hotel restaurant. Highly recommended.

7.description: NOTICE:((This Review only applies to the Christmas Dinner!)) We have been coming to Drake Brothers for Christmas dinner for the last five years or so.  We look forward to it every year, and this year's experience was the first time we were very disappointed.  While the carolers continued to delight, Santa Claus did not even show up.  We avoid the holiday lines at the mall all season knowing that we are going to be able to visit with Santa during Christmas dinner.  You can imagine how difficult it was to explain to our children why Santa never came and why they were not able to visit with him at all this year.  In addition, there has always been a wonderful  dessert buffet, which was also missing from last night's offering.  This year proved quite different than years past.  If this new approach is going to continue, we will definitely not be coming back if it does.

36.description: If you want old school posh hotel, go here.  Around Christmas is key - the diorama in the lobby isn't to be missed.Steak is tops.  Expect warm, experienced service - very knowledgable about their conservative wine list and menu.  Make sure you get the mustard mashed potatoes!Don't expect anything but blue blood and you can't go wrong!

30.description: Mother's Day Brunch! What more could you ask for on the day that is devoted to you!! The elegance of the setting should be enough but the quality and quantity of food just is an added bonus. I did not find the service as up to par as I would expect. We had dirty dishes still on the table when we went for seconds and my son had to ask for them to be cleared. It is expensive but I will look forward to the 5x7 photo added to the package. For Mother's Day they had an area for children to play or watch TV so mom could eat in peace.

3.description: Lovely place. Beautiful views. Order off the menu. The buffet was sparser than I remembered. They ran out of plates at the Buffett. I had to ask to get more plates. It was hard to find bowls for the yogurt and fruit. The cereal wasn't the other end of the Buffett. It took 15 minutes waiting in line to make an omelette. She had no personality. Used a ton of oil. Yuk!No interesting options. It was a Sunday and I thought it would be better. I'd go again order the Eggs Benedict and a plate of fruit. Can't beat the view. And the History of the hotel. It is gorgeous inside. Skip the buffet. Lots of hotels have cheaper and better buffets.

14.description: Came for brunch on a Sunday afternoon and the food was very hearty and delicious. Of course its not the beautiful main restaurant in the Drake but has a great view of Michigan Ave and the park. The restaurant has a good omelet station and also a very good variety of breakfast foods. Drake Bros is a bit out of the way and the décor is a a bit old. But its a good place to eat. The servers were top notch.

28.description: Downstairs bar and restaurant of Gilt Bar. Came here for a nightcap.Nice, dark, lively atmosphere. A few people looked out of place, wearing goofy t-shirts and sneakers.The Library would make for a nice night out with a small group of friends. Big groups discouraged; I think the largest tables seats maybe six at most.

1.description: Fantastic speakeasy below a very charming restaurant. You are guided downstairs through some kinda spooky basement and through a hidden door you are let into a fantastic sexy lounge.My Lilly Rose Daisy cocktail was super delicious, not too sweet and very refreshing. Mmmm The room itself is really romantic and classy at the same time. Beautiful books on shelves, comfortable red velvet sofas, dimmed lights,  wonderfully lit bar. Really great place!We tried their gnocchi and spicy pork pasta, it was good, but not to die for. Cocktails is something to definitely try here!Try to book in advance,  as the bar area upstairs is small and the wait can be a bummer.

9.description: UPDATE: I came here again to bring an out-of-towner and had a much better experience. The server was professional, the music was great, the patrons weren't obnoxious. I wasn't particularly hungry that night so I just ordered the caesar salad and was pleasantly surprised that they put just as much quality into their salads as their entrees. A totally separate note, but I also want to point out that inevitably this Prohibition/20s aesthetic will become boring (I actually think it's already on its way out), but I'll still patron this place because the decor is just too gorgeous and it strikes me as being timeless rather than kitchy.

29.description: I only got drinks here but my old fashion was one of the best I've had in Chicago and my server was very attentive and helpful. The atmosphere and decor of this hidden lounge is very cool, perfect date spot. I would definitely go back!

23.description: A very sensual place lined with red velvet booths and lighting that'll make anyone better looking. A reco for date night with someone you're into.On GNO we came here for birthday cocktails before dinner on Friday night. We were lucky to score a table down here almost right away (vs. hitting up the bar upstairs). We had drinks and some fantastic Toast appetizers - burrata (sp?) and foie gras - to satisfy our hunger pains. Leave your carb counter at home.We had a wonderful server/bartender who whipped up some really smooth cocktails for us.Gotta head back here. I love the space!

5.description: My company held a private event here last week and it was incredible. The service, drinks, food and staff are all outstanding. We held our event in the Library, which is a secluded room underground. The decor of the room is very old school and beautiful and it has a speakeasy-like vibe to it. It was intimate and the candles and music and all added the perfect touch.I would like to give a shoutout to our wonderful staff--Jeanie, whom I coordinated the whole event with. She was a pleasure to work with and the event went off seamlessly.I have to give major props to the bartender and my personal superhero, Klause. When I booked this room two months in advance, I had no idea that our event would happen to fall on the Stanley Cup Game 1 night and that the Blackhawks would be in the playoffs. To my dismay, there were no TVs in this whole venue. But I was able to ship a projector to myself in Chicago and bring it to the bar where we streamed the game. Apparently anyone could set up this project, "it's that simple." NOT! The projector was broken and complicated, but Klause came to the rescue and managed to get the whole thing up and running flawlessly. And the Blackhawks won.I would also like to thank Casey and Alex.If you are looking for a beautiful and unique spot to hold a private event then this is your place.Also, the truffle pasta is out of this world.

31.description: My friend and I came early (5P) per recommendation on the Daily Candy website, which recently featured The Library (underneath The Gilt Bar).  We were told at the host desk that The Library didn't open for another hour, but that they would have no problem accommodating the two of us since we were so early, and no, we didn't need to leave our names or reserve space.  A second check a bit later got the same response - no need to reserve space, just check back when they open the room. When we did, the same people who reassured us (twice!) that we didn't need to leave our names or reserve space glibly looked at us like they had never seen us before and told us nothing was available if we didn't have a reservation. So if you're in the mood to be treated well for your $$$, go elsewhere.  It's not going to happen here.And oh yes.  Daily Candy, about that recommendation?  Not cool.

25.description: I don't know if this place should actually have a separate name from Gilt because it's in the same space (though "The Library" is downstairs) and the same exact menus are used.  Anyway, if we're calling it "The Library", I like the library a lot.  Real libraries with books, and this fake library with booze.Sexy lighting, fantastic patterned wallpaper, red velvet booths, and bookshelves adorned with books and decanters.  This is a great lounge with a look that I'd like to replicate in my own home.  Moderately pricey cocktails are worth it in this luxurious space.

12.description: I went here on Saturday, and I concur with everyone else; Have a reservation, as it fills up quickly. It's a beautifully intimate venue...I was facing a wall & still loved it! Also, the staff genuinely takes pride in their work. When ordering the octopus, I asked our server if it was fresh or frozen & he was quick to let me know it was "fresh frozen", which lead us to a discussion about it.
