He still sold me on it, and I'm happy he did. The chefs know what they're doing. I'll be back!

21.description: Intimate, sophisticated, and great drinks.  Drinks are not too expensive: $12-$14 per drink. I'd give it a 4.5.Really great date spot. Call to book ahead on a weekend!

16.description: A very sensual place lined with red velvet booths and lighting that'll make anyone better looking. A reco for date night with someone you're into.On GNO we came here for birthday cocktails before dinner on Friday night. We were lucky to score a table down here almost right away (vs. hitting up the bar upstairs). We had drinks and some fantastic Toast appetizers - burrata (sp?) and foie gras - to satisfy our hunger pains. Leave your carb counter at home.We had a wonderful server/bartender who whipped up some really smooth cocktails for us.Gotta head back here. I love the space!

17.description: Perfected drinks - got the Chartreuse Mule. Highly highly recommended. Incredibly smooth service. Coziest vibe of all time - impossible to not get seduced here...

10.description: With all of the awesome reviews I was rather disappointed here, but nothing to do with the food or drink. Service was just unbelievably slow. I arrived at 6:00 and was probably the 6th person in here, but I wasn't able to get a drink until almost 6:25. No idea what was going on or why but the next two rounds seemed to take equally as long.The other important stuff:-The"craft"  drink list is short, but they do have tons of spirits and will make standard drinks like martinis etc.-The appetizers were super tasty, the brie and raspberry jam was awesome-The decor/ambiance is ideal for a date (quiet and just dark enough)-The staff was incredibly nice (when I could find them!)I'd be back to see if it was just an off night for sure, if nothing else, just for the appetizers.Note: You have to enter through Gilt. Ask at the front and they'll take you downstairs!  Be sure to get a reservation if you're going on the weekend.

11.description: Yes, I am definitely a fan. Make sure to ask for the library downstairs. It is a secret bar with a hidden entrance downstairs.Ambience is great and the food is above satisfactory. Please do try the bone marrow. You will not regret it. I had one of the manhattans on the menu per server's recommendation and it was great way to start the night. It is little dark and not quiet, but it is a great place to hang out with your friends for hours. I will totally go back.

26.description: Upstairs and downstairs - fun ambiance, good crowd, cocktails and food were good. They even had a separate vegetarian menu. Loved the library feel!

27.description: What was Curio is now called "The Library"--only difference, there's better lighting, there's a door, and pretty much everything else is the same. I believe the menu is the same as upstairs at Gilt (or it might be a shorter version), same romantic speakeasy feel, good drinks. Enjoy.

35.description: It's Gilt's menu in a quieter, more intimate atmosphere.  The same exact menu.  They can make you some specialty drinks if you know what they want but I do miss the Curio cocktail menu.  Service is faster than what i remember at Curio.  Food's always tasty and consistent among all the Gilt empire restaurants.

0.description: Came here last weekend and it's exactly what you would want from a speakeasy. Hidden doors, dark lighting, 20s vibe... I'm in love.For drinks we had old fashioned's, dirty martini's and gin n soda water. The old fashioned's were perfect. For food we had the brussel sprouts (fire), the orechiette (fire), the Risotto (fire), the andouille sausage (decent) and the octopus (literally the best thing I've ever put in my mouth). We spent just north of $200, but it was well worth it.

20.description: On the recommendation of a friend, I made a reservation at The Library (which is only open Thursday through Saturday). Upon entering Gilt Bar, our party of two was led downstairs into a smaller, quieter, and more intimate space than upstairs. The decor lent itself to an old-fashioned and classy ambiance, with dark wood, printed wallpaper, books and decanters on the shelves, and red velvet booths. The lights were very dim, such that  I needed the candle or cell phone light to read the menu.Speaking of the menu, it's the same as upstairs. For food, we had the steak tartare, charred octopus, and shaved sprouts salad; and for drinks, we had the Paloma, Lillet Rose, Sazerac, and Lion's Tail. All the food and drinks we had were fantastic, as was the service. The Library is definitely worth at least one visit!

19.description: Great place, ask the host at gilt for a seat in the library and they'll take you downstairs. The staff is attentive and accommodating. It's really small though. We sat at the bar but asked to get one of the couches once itwas available. If you're with a group, ask for a table with a couch. There's only a few but it's the way to go.

33.description: I read about Curio re-opening as Library Bar and was immediately intrigued - i love libraries!  I never had the change to go to Curio but walked by on the way to the bathroom when I was dining at Gilt Bar - good music, seemed chill.We decided to stop in on Friday night, thinking we could just roll in, no problem.  NOPE.  We went down to LIbrary Bar where there were several tables open and were told we had to go back UPSTAIRS to reserve a seat downstairs.  Reserve?  There were empty tables!  We decided to get in line with the song and dance, expecting to be seated shortly given the empty tables.  Well people, guess what.  It took us 90 minutes to get seated downstairs.  The hostesses kept telling us that it was so crowded upstairs that they had to decide if people could sit downstairs.  Ummm...10:30 PM at Gilt Bar?  People weren't staying for drinks, they were eating their dinners and heading out to the bars.  There were several tables free upstairs.  The hostesses clearly were making shit up because there were seats just about everywhere we looked.  I have no idea why we waited around.  I guess the time was slipping away upstairs at the bar, as were the people.  We were finally seated at 11:30 PM!  Again, there were a number of booths open.  We had a few drinks and ordered dessert.  We liked our experience once we were seated but the fact that it took us an hour and a half to get seated in a part of the restaurant that wasn't even crowded is 1) bad business 2) baseless.Because we were seated so late, we were obviously one of the last groups to leave.  The fact is, you can't run a bar NYC style if you don't have the crowd or the culture that supports it.  It was a nice experience once we had drinks but aside from that, totally a two star experience based on the very poor service by Gilt Bar.  It's a new establishment so I have to give them some allowance.  First time, shame on them, second time shame on me.

2.description: Make a reservation!!! You would think "speak easy" you can just walk in, no you can't. If you add your name to the walk in list they will say "it is a 1 hour wait," but we waited 2 hours and never got in and eneded just having drinks at the bar upstairs. Place looks cool, drinks were good upstairs and can only imagine they are great downstairs too. Looking forward to making reservations and actually getting to enjoy the whole thing.

34.description: books, brendan sodikoff, and whiskey sour????yes yes and again yes....i heard about this place opening up and had to go!!!  they have pretty much everything i love all rolled into a place. if you've been to bavette's underground parlour, i feel like thats like a rich guy's man cave with alot of leather and exposed brick. i liken the library to that same rich guy's secretly hidden downstairs library with a fully stocked bar with its red booths and the dark bookshelves filled with gold titled books. i really liked the curio space before but i felt that it was a bit girly and there were fabric partitions that made it seem more feminine than it does now. even the door and entrance into the library seems almost super secretive and you feel like youre in the movie clue... it was MR MEATBALL WITH KALE AND ROMESCO SAUCE IN THE LIBRARY!!!!SERIOUSLY... i know its the same as upstairs... but i tried these meatballs... and i couldnt speak coherently for a good minute... they were amazing!!!! the best meatballs ive ever had in my life. im not a fan of kale... im a meat loving girl but that kale got all sexy with that delicious seemingly simple romesco sauce and let the flavorful pork meatballs roll around in it!!! GET THEM!!! there's only 3 of them... trust me, you wont want to share them... warning you now.love their parmesan broccoli... its got this beautiful brightly green broccoli thats been superbly charred and then they danced around in some parmesan. super yummy!!!brussel sprout salad was great... last night i went to gilt bar and i didnt see it on there anymore. but it was super light and the brussel sprouts were shredded and dressed in a yummy dressing.my friends got the toffee date cake and the chocolate cake. honesty policy in full effect here:: the toffee date cake and chocolate cake could not be more different in presentation. the toffee cake comes out looking like a juicy brownie with coffee ice cream. the chocolate cake is an actual behemoth of a cake... i think its actually 1/4th of an actual cake back there... its pretty huge!!! but size doesnt always matter, the toffee cake is very flavorful, the cake is warm and with the coolness of the ice cream its very delicious and sweet but not rotting teeth sweet. the chocolate cake is pretty much to die for as well... so what im trying to say is get both!! try them out... i personally am less of a chocolate person so i prefer the toffee but chocolate lovers will fall in love with the chocolate cake!!! and last but def not least... whiskey sour... i am really obsessed with pisco and drinks with egg whites. and didnt really know what to expect from the whiskey sour... it tastes very similar to the chico tazo that was on the violet hour's menu a few drink menus back and the pisco sour from barrelhouse. sweet, has whiskey, and egg white which means im good to go!! theyre strong!!

32.description: This place is Gorgeous!!! Fantastic environment, great drinks (esp the lillet daisy), and non descript entrance... Perfect nook to escape to on a cold winter night.

18.description: I don't know if this place should actually have a separate name from Gilt because it's in the same space (though "The Library" is downstairs) and the same exact menus are used.  Anyway, if we're calling it "The Library", I like the library a lot.  Real libraries with books, and this fake library with booze.Sexy lighting, fantastic patterned wallpaper, red velvet booths, and bookshelves adorned with books and decanters.  This is a great lounge with a look that I'd like to replicate in my own home.  Moderately pricey cocktails are worth it in this luxurious space.

13.description: Not only is the place very cool, comfortable, and cozy but the staff was great. Food is amazing here and the so are the drinks. Sometimes the wait on the drinks is a little long. The mood it holds is so relaxing that chatting it up passes the time. Went here twice, first time with 2 other girls and last night with a bigger group.

4.description: The library at Gilt is the perfect date spot. Dark and romantic lite only by candlelight. Killer drink menu and top notch food. Must try:-ribeye -truffle spaghetti (actually the best dish I have had in awhile!) Kudos to the boy who took me here!

24.description: I thought this place was going to be a lot cooler and when I saw it for the first time (I peeked inside), it did look pretty cool. Upon actually coming in for drinks, I was not so impressed. It was hot and a little stuffy. We also had to be seated by the hostess stand, which for some reason seemed weird to me (I thought in "speakeasies" you could just go in and sit? -- maybe this place isn't really considered a "speakeasy"). On top of that, our server was just alright. He seemed a little snobby and his drink recommendations were meh. I was also disappointed that they had the same menu as Gilt Bar. I understand this is a part of Gilt Bar, but I was hoping for some special drinks or something specific to The Library. The Old Fashioned is still a great drink here, though, but I think I'd prefer to sit outside on the patio.

6.description: On the recommendation of a friend, I made a reservation at The Library (which is only open Thursday through Saturday). Upon entering Gilt Bar, our party of two was led downstairs into a smaller, quieter, and more intimate space than upstairs. The decor lent itself to an old-fashioned and classy ambiance, with dark wood, printed wallpaper, books and decanters on the shelves, and red velvet booths. The lights were very dim, such that  I needed the candle or cell phone light to read the menu.Speaking of the menu, it's the same as upstairs. For food, we had the steak tartare, charred octopus, and shaved sprouts salad; and for drinks, we had the Paloma, Lillet Rose, Sazerac, and Lion's Tail. All the food and drinks we had were fantastic, as was the service. The Library is definitely worth at least one visit!

22.description: Went here on a date and it was like a sexy dream! One small critique was that the music was so loud that my date and I could hardly hear one another. Other than that, wonderful food and drinks.

15.description: Delicious cocktails and EVEN BETTER DESSERTS. The chocolate cake is AMAZING. Super rich, moist, and chocolatey. The brownies also looked good. This is the perfect date night spot. It's comfy, dimly lit, and has a cute/romantic vibe. But this is also a great intimate place to go with a group of friends. Our waiter was also great and the service is good. Definitely coming back!

7.description: Intimate and beautiful, makes you feel like you are living in the 30's. Love this spot. Hubby made reservations here for my birthday and we had a wonderful experience. Seem's creepy when you go down, but once you are there, you get why it is a secret gem. The dimly lit tables, combined with excellent food, service and drinks makes this spot worth your while. Definitely a spot we will be returning and bringing out of towners. Would recommend to anyone that wants to experience something different and still receive / taste the amazing food that Chicago has to offer.

8.description: This is my favorite date spot in the entire city! The decor is so cool and it feels so VIP to be led down to the hidden room in the quiet basement. The prices are a little up there but they allow you to bring a bottle in with you. The pork belly is probably the best thing I've ever eaten.

30.description: This is one of my new favorite places.  I went here with a small group of friends and we had great wine, cocktails and food.  The mussels were fantastic as was the ribeye, grilled fennel and chopped kale.  I'm also a big fan of the cozy atmosphere and the hip hop that played all night.  I have nothing negative to say about this spot.  I will be back!

3.description: We absolutely loved this place. It has all the advantages of the food from the Gilt Bar upstairs, but without the noise.I'm surprised they don't bill this as a speakeasy, because it has that atmosphere: a twisting passageway downstair to find the almost hidden door, and lighting that takes a few minutes to adjust to. Candles on book shelves provide part of the illumination, and the fancy bar at one end looks like it's straight out of the 20s.We tried a large portion of the menu, and loved everything except perhaps the bone marrow and the rib eye. Mussels were a standout.Of course with this theming there are cocktails, and many fine choices among them. I'm not a fan of sweet drinks, so I was delighted to discover many bitter ingredients available, and even finished with an Amaro Nonino.Service was friendly and helpful. I wish the Library was open every night, instead of just three nights a week. It's the perfect oasis away from the clamor upstairs!

14.description: This place killed it. Our bartender, a delightfully cheery blond woman, made us both custom drinks that were pitch perfect (one was a daisy something, the other was a cucumber drink with vodka). The truffle pasta was delicious. The atmosphere was dark and friendly - perfect for a date or to have a long conversation with a friend. I would definitely come back regularly, especially if I knew we'd have the same bartender.

12.description: Incredible coffee, free wifi, and comfy seating.  Need I say more??? Oh, and it's also not S***bucks.  #supportsmallbusiness !!!  Oh, did I mention amazing coffee?  Buy the local roast and take some home.

7.description: Some of the staff friendlier than others, but I get it, it's a tough gig, and while I always tip, I'm not sure what percentage of the clientele always does (sidebar: if you can't afford to factor a tip into your $4 coffee, you have no business buying a $4 coffee). I go here often and I love the coffee and food-- I particularly love the biscuits at this location, for some reason. I discovered them this month and have gone maybe four times to get them; they are perfect.

3.description: I've had Dollop before at a different location and maybe I just ordered the wrong drink but my seasonal pumpkin spice latte had absolutely no taste to it.  There was no sign of pumpkin and not even much of a coffee flavor which was disappointing.  As for the service it was pretty slow even though there were 3 people working behind the counter and there were barely any customers.  I wasn't too impressed with my visit here but it is conveniently located a few minutes from the John Hancock and Water Tower mall.

1.description: If I lived in this Chicago neighborhood, Dollop would be my daily coffee fix. Unfortunately, I was only visiting for the weekend but still managed to fit 2 visits in to my Chicago experience. The iced chai is delicious - and I think the price is right for most of the drinks. The baked goods looked amazing - chocolate chip scones and beyond - but I didn't try any. Next time! This place is everything a local neighborhood coffee shop should be. It gets a yes from me.

2.description: Great addition to a quiet charming neighborhood.  Big glass windows bring in lots of natural light. Coffee bar seats facing outwards allow you to appreciate the neighborhood architecture, landscaping and do some people watching. Oh yeah,  they do a great cup of coffee as well.

9.description: Dollop is so charming and little. It's like a gem. Indoor and outdoor seating with a very inviting environment. They have almond milk (yay!) and pastries. They also serve sandwiches and salads. Definitely stop into this little local coffee and tea shop!

10.description: Tasty place to pick up Metropolis coffee / Hoosier Mama Pie (local Chicago businesses) on the way to the hospital / campus. Fun decor and friendly staff.

13.description: I live right across the street, so the location couldn't be better.  Tried it for the first time...not bad.  On my 2nd visit, the guy behind the counter immediately served some girl that just walked in despite my having waited several minutes for the customer in front of me to finish.  I figure my money doesn't spend there, so I left and haven't been back since.  Too many good options in this area to bother with a place with poor customer service.

16.description: Neighborhood game changer. This area has been dead forever until Dollop came in. Extremely nice staff and excellent coffee. Small but they do a good job with the space they have.

17.description: I'm all for the smaller coffee shops that can potentially rival places like Starbucks and I love to give local places business (although this place does seem to be a small chain), but I did not appreciate the service at this place. I went on Saturday 08/29/15 a little after 1 PM. The man behind the counter took my order and made a comment about my friend's coffee drink that was from Starbucks. We all had a laugh about it as I ordered my drink. There was another man who seemed to be either training the guy that took my order or supervising I guess. I did not have to wait in line and did not think there was anyone ahead of me. I then realized the one woman behind the counter was making 2 drinks for people who must have ordered in front of me. I have no idea how long they were waiting but one of the customers did ask if their drink was ready. The woman behind the counter did eventually get all the drinks made but I had to wait much longer than I would have expected. During this time the two men behind the counter continued to joke about Starbucks and did move an inch to help make any of the customer's drinks.Like I said, I definitely do not mind supporting smaller coffee shops and even other chains, but if the employees are going to criticize Starbucks as they take your order they better make sure THEIR SERVICE is 10 times better than the chain they are criticizing. The service here was severely lacking.The coffee was nothing spectacular. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't phenomenal. I would take Starbucks over this place any day if this is the normal customer service attitude and the amount time I would have to wait for a coffee. I cannot even imagine coming here during an early morning rush.

15.description: Not only is their coffee extremely strong, the staff isn't nice either.  My coffee was so strong and I then asked them if they could put more almond milk on it and she wanted to charge me $2.75. Um...Starbucks doesn't charge me for these things. In addition, she just had a major attitude about it. Isn't the barista suppose to make it a good experience for you to want to come back? Ya...well...never coming back to this location EVER again!

0.description: When I visit Chicago I often stay in this neck of the woods, so I was pleased to see another breakfast/food/drink option open up as the hotel prices can be ridiculous.  The folks were super friendly, they had nice indoor/outdoor seating areas and the coffee was full flavored and rich.Ordered a bagel with chive cream cheese and a slice of mushroom/gruyere quiche courtesy of Hoosier Mama Pie Company.  The bagel was ok, the quiche was really good, with lots of earthy flavor from the abundant amount of mushrooms.   The filling was soft, well seasoned, and the crust was tender and buttery.  Dollop is certainly a nice addition to the neighborhood.

5.description: Great if it is the closest coffee shop to home.  Otherwise, pretty ordinary.They make excellent coffee.  Their food offering is lame, in part because of their signage.They have savory pies, but none on display and none listed on their menu.  You have to ask what they have available, which others stand in line behind you waiting to order.  Poor system.I figured out that you can get sausage with the biscuit, not because it was clear on the sign but because I asked.  Why they melted cheese all over it, without telling me, without saying it on the menu, and without me wanting it, I don't know.   Nice outside seating, but not much of it.

11.description: VERY knowledgable baristas that helped me! I didn't realize that such a small coffee shop could serve so much different food options, go there for the coffee though :)

8.description: This is mostly a review about the location, FYI. Food: Dollop ALWAYS has good food and coffee. I especially love going back for the Hoosier Mama pies. Yum! However --The space: Oh Dollop, why oh why does your business insist on getting the most uncomfortable chairs? At this location, the wooden stools at the "bar" looking out the window have sharp edges. (It's similar to the ones at the Streeterville location.) They aren't wide enough to support a behind comfortably either and I'm not that big a person. Someone from Dollop, please try sitting on a stool for about 30 minutes and see how it feels. :( The seats outside are definitely more comfortable and I would be sad to see those go once it starts getting too cold to hang out outdoors. (Another thing, when you're eating outside, watch out for the drippage coming from the airconditioning units above.)Wifi is free and reliable. I will go back just for the coffee and goodies but the seating situation is bad enough for me to just choose a different spot to get my caffeine fix.

4.description: This review is solely based on their cold brew, chive turkey sandwich (off-menu at this location), and Mexican cookie. Cafe Integral and Dollop probably hold the title for best cold brew in the city at the moment. While the Ohio Street Dollop is bigger, this location never closes their sandwich bar and everyone is always super accommodating and nice when I ask them for the signature sandwich from the Ohio Street location. Ohio Street always closes their sandwich bar super early. This location is also hidden within a fancy high rise, so it's easy to get work done here. It's not nearly as cool as the inside of the Dearborn location (love that building), but it's my favorite hangout of the three Chicago locations I regularly visit, especially since it's a quick cut behind the MOCA to get to Kellogg.

14.description: Dropped in while waiting for an appointment, had a pour over of Kenyan, a great way to spend an hour. Also had a chocolate chip scone, which was really the best scone I have had, knocks the socks off of a few other scones around town.

6.description: It's not my favorite Dollop location (I prefer the Ohio Street one) but this spot has a little nicer ambience and the same great selection of Hoosier Mama goodies. My preference for Ohio Street is that "my" baristas work there but I'm sure if you came here often enough this place could be yours. The people are still all really nice and always make a good cappuccino.

3.description: My mom was in town and needed a new pair of walking shoes, preferrably ones suitable for our weather. I've actually bought her a pair or two of Privo shoes (comfy, by the way) from here, so we went in knowing we may be successful. We were. She bought two pairs on sale! Our sales woman was very helpful and patient as my mom went through various sizes and shoes. While paying, the sales woman informed us of their Clarks Club Member Card. It's basically a punch card to use every time you buy shoes. The more punches you get (heh), you'll get $40 off next purchase. Um, that's a lot of shoes.

1.description: Service is fantastic! I went into Clarks hoping to buy my first pair, and was greeted and assisted by a very knowledgable, courteous staff. Both ladies were very welcoming and helpful, pulling multiple models and sizes and making sure I would be happy with the style and fit before checking me out! The shop is military friendly as well, accommodating discounts for those carrying id's!

2.description: We had been roaming around State Street looking at shoes when we thought of Clarks on Michigan Avenue. We called over to their store and asked if they had a particular style of shoe (in the size we wanted) and they told us they had it in stock! We hopped on the CTA and headed to Clarks!The sales associate that helped us was very nice. She seemed to know a lot about the different styles of shoes and the level of comfort at each part of the foot in the shoe.  Unfortunately the shoes did not work for us so we did not end up getting them. They didnt have all sizes of the shoe we wanted but we were told that the shoe could be ordered and shipped to us at no extra cost. Excellent customer service!

5.description: For comfort shoes you can't beat Clarks.  Our saleslady Mary was a delight.  Clarks is having a sale (2 pairs for $99), but did not have my size in stock.  Mary placed the order and arranged for them to be mailed directly home, and the shoes arrived about 10 days later.  Fast, accurate, and courteous service, all at a decent price.  Can't ask for more.

6.description: Well, I'd like to give another star b/c I did get good customer service, however, I had to return a pair of shoes because of poor quality, which made me sad. They gave me full price store credit without a receipt, based on the last price, which was what I paid, thankfully. I kind of expected to have to prove why I deserved the credit, but didn't have to. It was clearly poor quality shoe. So better customer service this time, but poorer quality product. 2 stars - final answer.

7.description: I returned a pair of shoes here that my wife bought at the Woodfield location. When we came in with a bag for a return, the five unoccupied salespeople were terrified by a return bag.They let us know - several times - that a return from another store goes against commissions earned at their store. They further informed us that the commission rate is 7%. So our return, which was a pair of boots worth about $185 after tax, cost one of the girls working there around $12. Enough for a "breakfast, lunch, and dinner."I probably wouldn't have gone back anyway, but if it weren't for the guilt trip they laid on my wife and me, I also wouldn't have written a one-star review.

8.description: This was my first visit to the Clark's store on the 7th floor of Water Tower.  The service here was really exceptional.  Clarks has some great footwear for bridging the gap between dress and casual.  I was looking for some desert boots and the selection here was really great (chocolate, gray, beige, cordoroy, union jack, etc.).  Prices were about $20 more than I might have paid online, but they happened to have a 20% off sale, so I walked away quite satisfied with my first pair of desert boots.  The sales people here are laid back, friendly and genuine fans of the whole Clarks brand.  They made me part of this thing.

9.description: The salesmen was the best I have had at ANY shoe store in a long time. He was polite and quick. He noticed the shoes that I continued to gravitate towards and brought them out for me to try on. He then left me along to think about the shoes instead of pressuring me to make a purchase. Because he was so great he actually talked me into purchasing 2 paris of shoes. He was very knowlegable about the brand and the best fit. I was recently shopping for very pricey wedding shoes and did not get anywhere near this type of customer service. I will be back for more shoes!

0.description: This was the most eye-opening and easiest visit to a shoe store of my entire life. My last pair of boots had reached the end of their useful lives (or so I thought), so I embarked on a search for a new pair. I looked online, I looked in department stores, but I still couldn't find what I wanted. I was looking for something that was comfortable, fit my calves, and was still stylish. I finally stepped into Clark's on a whim. The first pair of boots that I tried on was incredibly comfortable and beautifully made. Not only that, but the salesman used a variety of leather-conditioning products to polish up my last boots so that they now look almost new. I was in and out of the store in about 10 minutes, with a new pair of boots and an old pair of boots made-new, for a very reasonable price. The sales representatives were helpful, knowledgeable, and very friendly. Clark's will be the first place I look for shoes in the future.

4.description: Super weird experience today. So, I'd seen these shoes in a magazine and I scoped them out online but wanted to try them on. OK, so I walk into this Clarks location, find the shoes on the wall and want to try them on. A salesperson/woman, comes over and asks if I need help. I tell her, yes, I'd like to see these in my size. She asks if I am sure of my size or if I need my feet measured. I said why not measure my feet. I start following her and she turns to me and says that this other guy will do it. It was so weird! Anyway, he comes over and says, "Do WE need our feet measured?" I was tempted to say that I didn't know about him, but since it was offered...But I didn't. Instead, I said, "Well, I think I'm this size but the other salesperson just offered." And he said, "I'll just get you the shoes in both sizes you mentioned." I mean, why offer the service if seemingly no one wants to do it?? Anyway, he brings out about 10 boxes and I said, "That's a lot of boxes." I'd only asked to see one pair of shoes. Well, he "took the liberty" of bringing out something else that was totally unrelated to what I'd asked for, claiming that that particular pair was that store's "top seller." Whatever. I try my selection on and he disappears. Well, they look horrible and I wanted to try on another color of the same style. I had to wait for him- or anyone- to come and ask me if I'd like to see something else. And then he's finally back, trying to push other shoes on me again. I asked about the other color and he said they were very popular and sold out in my size. He then suggested that he could bring out a larger size so that I could see what it looked like and then I could buy them from him and get free shipping. Well, they have free shipping all the time on the Clarks website, so why would I do that? The whole thing was totally bizarre, unhelpful and a waste of my time. The other thing is that they were having a buy one, get 25% off a second pair. So he was trying to sell me another pair when I hadn't even settled on the first pair! Long story short, he was a lousy sales guy and the other two people there were also weirdos. That said, I'm glad I was able to see these and try them on in person before I made the mistake of ordering $100+ online that wouldn't fit correctly and are, well, ugly. There is really nothing stylish or fashion-forward about anything they have there but I thought that these chukka-type boots with a heel would be a little retro cool and comfortable. Oh, well. This was my first and last time going to a Clarks. They're just overpriced to be that ugly and weird.

12.description: Claudia Katra of Claudia's Skin Care is unethical, unprofessional and does not honor her own gift certificates despite being less than a year old with no expiration date written on them.  Indeed, it was only about 5 months old when I tried to validate it for products, and she refused to honor them.  I will never go to her Center.  Ever.

7.description: I hate to give places a bad review, but really, this place is terrible. I bought a pumpkin peel from LifeBooker and was really looking forward to it. First off, the spa is about the size of my closet and just as dirty. Claudia did my peel which was 35 minutes--30 of which was me sitting alone in the room with the mask on my face as I listened to terrible music. About one minute was me going out into the lobby to see if she forgot about me. The other four minutes was her roughly washing it off my face. Not impressed.

19.description: I am a little disappointed with some of the reviews I have seen, so I would like to add to my review from before.  When I started going to Claudia & Sandy I was 24 years old with severe acne, I had tried all prescription medications through the dermatologist, and my next step was accutane--A friend recommended Claudia skin care & told me straight up..It is not a 'spa'..its like a doctors office except they focus on your skin.  After a few facials I saw  a drastic improvement! It did take a long time to improve with continuous natural treatment through Claudia skin care..but I'm happy to report I have very beautiful skin now!  I am complemented constantly!  Also,  I went in while I was pregnant with both of my children & they made sure all the products were ok for pregnancy & they were extra pampering.  To Claudia & Sandy's credit..I was mistaken for a 19 year old at one point..and I am 29 years old. So, if they can take 10 years off my skin I can definitely say they know what they are doing!

1.description: I went to see Claudia and her sister for several years. This is not a relaxing spa experience exactly - these are the ladies to see when your pores are clogged and you are in need of skin fixing. They always offered me really affordable prices and Claudia genuinely wanted to see my skin improve - would even give me free product to take home - and worked hard to get it there. (It took almost a year on birth control pills combined with Claudia and her sister giving me various treatments). I would highly recommend these ladies!

2.description: This was a terrible experience. The owner false advertises to be a member of spa-finder and promised me on the phone that I could use my gift card. When I arrived, she said she would absolutely not accept a spa finder gift card and argued with me incessantly. I would not recommend and will not go back.

9.description: I just got back from my facial here and I really don't have any complaints. My face feels cleaner and after a lot of extractions my face isn't even red. I found Sandy to be a very sweet lady who always checked with me to make sure I was comfortable during the process. I plan on going back and giving micro a whirl in the next few weeks.

6.description: I love these ladies and not because I have known them my entire life.  they are well educated in their area of expertise.  they have a full skin care facility.  claudia and her sister sandy run the place and have for the past 30 years.  they are very good at recommending products to help you stay your youthful self.  sandy gave me the european facial, which I recommend.

18.description: I got a facial yesterday by Sandy, the owner's sister.  I agree with some reviews that this place is not "spa like", it's not at all, it's just a small space with a treatment room that is very crammed - BUT - the facial was awesome and Sandy really knew her stuff.  I have combination skin and have been having flair ups of moderate acne in places while being really dry in others - plus I'm a runner and the colder elements have not been forgiving to my skin.  Sandy did a few mask treatments and then went to town on extractions.  My overall facial lasted almost 2 hours and the price was only $90.  It would have been $70 but she mildly suggested (not a pushy sell at all) a sensitive skin mask for problematic skin and that added on an additional $20.  I'm not one for time of treatment add-on services, but when the treatment was so reasonably priced anyway (for downtown) I didn't mind.  Overall, I loved my facial and the experience - and Sandy is a great conversationalist to boot.  Not the calm and tranquility of a great spa, but honestly I seem to always feel disappointed by most spas anyway and they charge double the price.  I'm very, very picky - but I will be back to this place, which for me is saying a lot.

10.description: Claudia Skin Care Center is really knowledgeable and really prepositional ,They really know about skin and they care about there clients ,I had the best European facial ever.I would reccomend this for any body that's looking for facial and great skin care products .Love you so much

13.description: I felt unwelcome from the first step at the spa entrance.  The lady Claudia is rude and the place seems disorganized and dirty.  Their lack of custom care and poor techniques on their work made me feel sorry for them.  One less potential client.

16.description: My friend & I scheduled facials here because of a special.  I thought it would be fun to hang out together and get pampered.  When I arrived, I was told by a bossy women to get into my room immediately because they were overbooked.  She would tell my friend that I was already here.The room was small and dingy.  It was not what I had anticipated.  The facial itself was pretty good.  After the service, the woman was very nice to me.

17.description: I recently had a facial here, done by Claudia herself, and here are the pros and cons.Pros: Cheap, Good Location (Water Tower Professional Bldg), face was pretty decently clean afterwards, although I broke out for a full wk afterwards, Seems to have a lot of knowledge about skin care, Owns a beauty line so she can tell you what products will work on your skinCons: Sloppy facial (creams felt like they were literally being slapped on my face, I had stuff going up my nose. I have had many different facials before at different day spas, and usually it is relaxing to get the facial. However, this one was stressing me out with the way she was so rough with putting on the masks and I had to worry about my airway. And I swear one of the creams she used on me was Vix! ),  When she was giving me the shoulder massage, i felt her pushing my gown far down enough that my chest was almost exposed! -very unnecessary. I kept pulling my gown back up and she would keep going back and pushing it down. In addition, whenever she would leave the room for me to keep the mask on, she would leave the door open, so I would hear the conversations she was having with the other customers and her sister that also works there.   Conclusion: I've only been here once, so maybe Claudia was just having an off day, but if a friend asked me to go here, I would tell them to save their money and time and just probably go somewhere else.

15.description: These ladies are a hoot.  Seriously, they crack me up.My bf scheduled an appointment for a waxing for me (I know - how great is he?) & I took advantage of a great deal he got.  Claudia used a special wax direct from Paris & both she & Sandy were very knowledgable, answering all of my questions, & giving me good advice.  I ended up with a wax, a bleaching, & a nice sample of facial moisturizer with a very  high SPF.Plus, their location is right down the hall from my best friend's place of employment, so I hopped down there after to say Hi to her.

0.description: I have been going to her service for about 30 years. My skin stay firm and healthy is thanks to her special skill.

5.description: I've been a regular client for 2 years.  I love my aromatherapy facial which is a great value.  Claudia is very knowledgeable, takes time to answer my questions, recommends wonderful products for my sensitive skin, and always takes great care of me.  She is a straight talker like most Europeans which I appreciate.  Claudia lived and trained in France which resulted in being an expert cosmetologist.  We share a great love of France and everything French.  Claudia's Skin Care isn't about luxurious spa treatment.  It's simply about great skin care, casual atmosphere, terrific prices, and European expertise.  I just bought 1 year package of 6 aromatherapy facials for $350 which is a steal.

11.description: I wish I hadnt been fooled by the ratings they got on citysearch...very disappointed with what i got. Claudia and Sandy are 2 talky old ladies (sisters) who seem to think they are some kinda skin doctors...strange considering that i felt so stupid after walking out of the place!i just wanted the basic facial..look..am trying a new place for something as important as my face..so obviously i am in only for a minimal damage if any. so i insisted i will stick with the basic facial and if i do like it, i come back.Apparently they cant appreciate that some one is being careful in their beauty and financial decisions.......they kept on trying to upsell some or the other kind of treatment. ...and i almost felt taunted for not choosing something may be 10 times. ok, now the facial....started with very basic cleaning....hardly any massage(less than a min).. a quick steam and then face pack was on for 30 min..I wanted her to masage my face some more....needed it badly...but she said it would cause my skin to break out,so she would rather not do it.....from my past exp with facials (i hv had many) ...my skin always felt good, lively and glowing with a massage....but she just wouldnt take that ......i wondered what i was paying 70$ for?  ..all the other steps are so easy to do at home....i was cursing myself for even choosing to come here. they clean your skin for a facial....if you want a massage they tell you to go to a spa ...she insisted she was more like a doctor and not a massage therapist and that spas are better if am looking to relax.... wow....it was a joke.......a bad one for me :(

8.description: Oh Claudia and your small little space, I came here for a relaxing facial not a stressful one! I got a Lifebook Loot certificate for a facial for $25. I was excited because I have had oily Lebanese skin my whole life. I was planning a big trip home to the east coast for Thanksgiving which included stops in Philly, AC, NYC, and Boston. I was going to 2 Watch the Throne shows, a wedding that specific night of the facial, and it was my birthday so I decided to indulge myself. When I walked in Claudia and her sister were extremely friendly. They led me to the room and I began to relax under the steamer. I don't remember her sister's name, but she was extremely kind. Claudia, on the other hand, was a monster. She told me my face looked terrible (um, yeah, I think I know. I wouldn't be here if I had great skin! And it was that time of month), and that I needed A LOT OF WORK. This made me feel really bad, like it was borderline upsetting. This is where she began to go to town on my face. She prick, pried, and needled all the imperfections out. I walked out of the salon with a puffy red face. I went home, took some aspirin, and went to the wedding without any make up (like she said). The next few days I didn't see any drastic changes in my skin that I had hoped. I think it finally cleared up like 2 weeks later once I got home from my trip. My face was scabbed and scarred and I think it's safe to say I will never return.It would be one thing if my facial cleared my face a bit (I don't expect a miracle), but the attitude and rudeness that came along with it was not helpful. Also, towards the end of the facial, I heard people in the lobby so the place is not private at all. As I was getting ready to leave the room, I'm pretty sure fight club broke out too because I heard some girl complaining that she booked a facial online and Claudia wouldn't take her because "the online system sometimes doesn't work." How's that for customer service??

3.description: Best facial I have ever had!!! I don't let anyone touch my skin but Claudia and Sandy. Quaint, clean space, no frills, very homey and inviting. This is not the place to go to get your face massaged and sip on Champs. This is where you go when you really want your face cleaned. These ladies really know their skin and are very good at personalizing the services for your individual needs. I have very dry, red skin and they always treat me so kindly making sure the products don't irritate me. Yes my skin is not pretty when I leave, but it's SO worth it afterwards. I'm convinced my older sister has no wrinkles because she has been coming here since her teens. Definitely a great deal too, prices are very reasonable. Oh and I love that they use their own line of skincare that's all natural.

14.description: WARNING - do not go to this place!  I had permanent makeup (eyebrows) done there, and it was the worst mistake ever.  First, of all, Claudia did them uneven at the bridge of the nose, so my whole face looked lopsided.  One was higher than the other, and one was also in too far at the bridge.  Then, she didn't follow the arch of my brow, so I had "double eyebrows", especially at the tail.  Adding to that, within a few months the brown color turned a DARK blue/grey.  I've discovered this is caused by using cheap pigment or ink.  I made a bigger mistake of going back there to have her correct it, and she acted like there was nothing wrong with her work.  I looked hideous.  Had to cut bangs to hide my eyebrows, and wouldn't leave the house without tons of coverup and brow pencil.  I tried to have it removed by laser - very painful and costly, and it didn't work. Whatever product she used had something in it that caused the laser to make the tattoo even darker.  Finally, after 2 yrs., I found someone who can correct Claudia's botched work by applying pigment (tattoo) over the grey.  We're starting with a neutral color to match my skin tone.  It's going to take a minumum of 4 treatments, 1 month apart to correct what she's done.  I learned a huge lesson - do tons of research, see a lot of their work, before and after photos, research what product they're using, and DO NOT go to this place.  I'm not even going to get into the fact that the place was dirty, stuffy, icky in general, as I've seen that in other reviews.

4.description: For those of you looking for the 'spa' treatment and having an indulgent, pampered experience, I wouldn't recommend you go to Claudia's. BUT if you are looking for good care, a casual atmosphere and good prices, this is the spot.The shop is located in Water Tower Place and the two sisters who run it (Claudia and Sandy) have been in this location for over 30 years. They are great about returning your phone calls and working with your schedule.I recently had my 4th or 5th facial at Claudia's and I have has a couple rounds of microderm and a glycolic peel.  They don't over-prescribe and don't push product.  They are very considerate of your comfort when you are in their tiny space and I think they are very knowledgeable about their work.Prices are reasonable and I am happy to support them.

3.description: Took my girls to get their ears pierced at a location in Lexington, Ky two weeks ago. Paid $54 for each pair of earrings. In two weeks one of the earrings lost its stone. We happened to be downtown Chicago and visited this location to pick some other items up and asked if they could switch her earring out. It was obvious we got it done at a Claire's as my girls were telling the story of their experience to the girls working. Because I did not have my receipt, they wouldn't help. Now one of my child's earrings that she will need to wear for another month and a half is missing a stone. I am all for policy but when you can make an easy exception, make a customer happy, who has many young years ahead future purchase potential,  it would seem to be a no brainer. My kids are young and getting their ears done at Claire's was a big deal. We don't live next to Claire's. It is a complete paint to get my bank statement and travel downtown, pay $18 to park for a sales person to glance at it and do the right thing. Policies to protect business from fraud are needed. Policies that take are used as a shield to make an obvious customer happy create bad will are a relationship breaker. Hope this serves as a means for better training and customer service.

1.description: I made my stop in this store during my last visit to the Water Tower Place. It's exactly how you remember it. It's full of pink, plastic, and glitter. There's stuffed animals and makeup and jewelry as far as the eye can see, and of course the piercing station. I was excited to see that they had a bunch of winter and Christmas items available on sale for 50% off. Unfortunately the workers just said "anything on this display." There were no stickers or red lines, and there were clearly items there that didn't belong. It was a bit messy and unorganized. But, thankfully the wallet I wanted was part of the sale!

2.description: Stopped in to get my nieces some earrings. Some good deals for the holidays. Good number of employees working which was nice to see. I was asked twice during my short visit if I was doing okay and was even explained their current promotion, though it was hard to miss with signage everywhere haha. Will be back if I need another cheap gift.

5.description: The girl that pierced my ears was very professional and respectful. The employees were very friendly and it did not cost me a fortune to get my ears double pierced. Will definitely be going back in the future.

6.description: I walked into this Claire's location and was immediately flooded with nostalgia. The neon, and plastic, and cute and trashy things all bunched together in a tiny boutique immediately took me back to my early teens. Get me my babysitting money jar stat! Alas, as an adult the products don't have the same allure- but  I am glad this chain is alive and well.This location specifically is pretty good. It feels like other locations in terms of decor and music. The staff is friendly. There is a  wide selection of products and they do ear piercing. This store would be a fun way to spend some time shopping with your preteen. Try on the funny hats and the tiaras, walk out with a cute bracelet set and cheap nail polish.

7.description: I checked this Claire's out today while I was at the Water Tower! I can't believe I am the first person to review this place. The staff was very helpful not the norm for the other Claire's I have frequented. Lots of clearance items. I am definitely going to return!!!!

0.description: This Claire's hosted artist Simone Legno to meet fans and sign stuff. I stood in line for 3 hours to get an autograph for my brother. I'm pretty sure I was the oldest person in line by 10 years, and a "DJ" streamed the same shitty song from his Macbook the entire time. The silver lining was a charming employee with an English accent who made sure to talk to everyone in line. She even held my place in line when I stepped away to buy a hat for the artist to sign. She ran up to me as I was leaving to talk and make sure I had everything I needed. Just an incredibly friendly person that made the wait bearable. tl;dr: I don't shop at Claire's, but their employees are awesome.

4.description: Went into this location a couple of days ago with my mom. We both wanted ear piercings but arrived near closing time. The woman working (Mel) was very nice, patient and informative. Even though we would have liked to have gotten there earlier, it is very nice to know it didn't affect the quality of customer service we received. For lobe piercings and 2 cartilage piercings, it was also a great price.

58.description: It took me three tries to actually buy some donuts.  I think a normal person would find that annoying, but that made it kind of fun for me.  The first time I tried walking over, and I figured out the place is actually located inside Rafaello's on Delaware, and they had already left for the day.  The second time I called the phone number I found on Yelp, figured out that this location does not have a direct phone number, and found out this location was already sold out.  The third time, I called in advance again and found out they were down to only a few varieties,  Basically, it was just after Noon, and they were close to selling out.  WOW.I definitely wish the donuts cost less, but they were delicious.  I had the salted caramel, grape, and maple bacon.   My favorite was the maple bacon, which was essentially a long john with maple frosting and a real strip of bacon on it.  The salted caramel and grape tied for second.  I shared them at work.  A couple of my co-workers were hesitant to try the maple bacon, but they ended up really liking it, too.  I plan on going back to try more varieties.

56.description: The donuts were pretty good.  Nice variety.  We had an egg nog donut.  A creme  brûlée donut and apple fritter.  I think the fritter beat the fancy ones.The donuts were pretty good.  Nice variety.  We had an egg nog donut.  A creme  brûlée donut and apple fritter.  I think the fritter beat the fancy ones.

29.description: Go early and go often! Amazing doughnuts tucked inside the rafaello hotel behind the Hancock building. Creme brulee doughnut...and you are welcome!

42.description: Yum yum yum!! I am still dreaming about the lemon curd filled raspberry glazed doughnut I had here back in May.I went early on a Sunday morning before my flight out of town and I was very impressed. The doughnuts were excellent and the girl behind the counter was very helpful. I can't wait to visit Chicago again and I'll definitely be going back to Glazed and Infused to get a doughnut (or 5).

23.description: This place is hidden inside the Raffaello hotel. The donuts are delicious and relatively big, so paired with a coffee this meal will be a great start to your day.

47.description: Hidden streeterville location and I soo wished the hours were better. C'mon Chicago, what's up with your donut shop hours (not including crappy dunkin donuts)? Go like Portland and go all the way here with the fat peddling hours where I can get it late at night after some boozing or even after dinner time... Go on Chicago, I know you can do it. Your next step with finally catching up with the donut craze is to open 24/7 or at least more than 7.5 hours being gone by 2pm or 5pm. Lame sauce. Some of us work during the weekdays dammit and some days we're chained to our desk and let out to see the sky for 5-35 minutes, long enough to grab a quinoa bowl across the street.Back to this location...  it's tiny, about the size of my little 3rd grader bro's bedroom, in a little corner within Hotel Rafaello. Their lobby is teeny tiny so you cannot miss it. I'll be sorry I typed that out as it'll get busy! Hope not. I'm happy there's one close to my apartment. There's a decent selection, more condensed. Some of it didn't taste as fresh but obvi they have to transport these things over here as there's no kitchen in this room. There is always lots of the Voodoo copycat bacon maple bars. I was able to snag the last creme brulee around 9am and of course I always have to get at least one glazed vanilla bean. Summer flavors are coming soon.. looking forward to those. I don't know about checking it out on the weekends because this neck of the woods can be pure hell on Michigan ave and what if the tourists have figured it out and infiltrated this cozy little corner? We'll see.. I'm not too keen on waking up super early for food on weekends.

8.description: I may be spoiled in the donut department. My home donut joint makes em with such frequency and freshness that any place with an off site bakery is starting from behind with me.That said, I appreciated the creativity of these donuts. Apple fritter was good, not too sweet, kind of biscuit-ey. Apricot streusel was subtle, light. Just a hint of apricot. And the vanilla glazed was eaten so quickly by my friend that I didn't even really have a chance to ask for a taste. I'm assuming that's a good sign!My coffee was delicious. But this is not really a place for hanging out, more a place for grabbing a donut and going up to your hotel room to shelter from the crazy blizzard outside.

31.description: Arrived before opening while setup was underway. I wanted a dozen donuts for a coworkers birthday. I was told policy does not permit serving customers early. I asked for clarification and was told if she helped me she'd have to help others before opening time. I said that's what my office does. She told me I could buy my donuts elsewhere. So I did and will never go back. This customer service approach I call "dazed and confused."

34.description: Yum yum yum, tried four different ones (small portions of each one), red velvet, vanilla bean glaze, crème brûlée, and fruit fritter. Delicious! Oh oh oh AND they have cute little milk cartons that brought back memories of grade school, sealed the deal. Coming back for more!

16.description: I had the apple fritter, which is as close to a cinnamon roll as you can get, with big chunks of apple. It was delicious. The wife had an egg nogg doughnut was very good, but she thought could have more eggnog filling (4/5). They start in the West Loop and  have five locations and are expanding into the loop. Red Velvet , Hot chocolate snowballs, cranberry orange glazed, peppermint Oreo Royale and more. Also coffees teas drinks. In the lobby of a hotel around the corner.

13.description: May be my favorite donut shop in the world, definitely best in Chicago!  The maple/bacon is scary but well worth it.  The sprinkle glazed completely wowed the kids - a bit sugary though

11.description: This is the BEST donut place!! My favorites are the chocolate doughnut, and the sprinkles donut, but ALL are good. You have to get an assortment and share with a bunch of people so you can taste everything. Boxes of doughnuts are perfect for birthdays! They have doughnut holes as well that are awesome. Maple bacon is soooo good and the Apple fritter is too! They are the most decadent doughnuts you will ever taste!!

39.description: I wouldn't have found this donut shop if my friend hadn't led me in here, since it's tucked inside a boutique hotel, but it's very charming. My friends and I split the traditional glazed buttermilk cake topped with fresh seasonal jam, since we were doing a self directed donut tour and were comparing a few from different places. Unfortunately, this was our least favorite donut of the trip, since it was the driest, densest of the bunch and just didn't taste as fresh as the others. I'm sure that Glazed and Infused has many others that are better so this doesn't mean that I wouldn't give them another try, although I think I'm done eating donuts for awhile now.

37.description: Hidden inside a hotel, where I would never even notice it, is this little gourmet gem. I went with a coworker around noon, and there was still a solid variety of doughnuts available (I had been warned that as the day goes on the pickings are slim).I went with the cherry granola doughnut (pretending to be healthy), and it was really good, and very filling. The sole employee there was very cheerful and helpful.Minus one star because it's crazy pricey (although for an occasional indulgence, not a big deal) and because the menu just lists general prices ("2.50/3/3.75" or whatever the increments are), but there's no listing of what doughnut is what price. I know the selection probably changes, but even just a little name plate and price by each selection in the display case would be helpful.

0.description: One of my new favorites.  Its almost hidden away in the Raffaello hotel. I tried the pumpkin spice latte and donut they were  both awesome! I forgot to mention the wonderful staff! Very quick and attentive .

38.description: Stayed at The Rafaello and loved this little surprise in the lobby. The Old Fashioned was amazing!  Yummmmmy!!!

51.description: Great donuts and friendly, informative staff.  I had the maple bacon long john and the chocolate glaze donut.  The sweet and salty combination of the maple glaze and bacon was pleasantly harmonious!  I would suggest 2 bacon strips instead of 1 to balance the dough to protein ratio.  Or maybe have it as another option.  Bacon lovers would go even more crazy!  I would love to come back to try other donuts.  A Glazed and Infused needs to be farther north...Uptown, Edgewater/Andersonville???

27.description: Red Velvet? Creme Brulee? They had neither which were at the top of my daughters list.Even with those out the window, Lucy Y. made a great recommendation!I loved the maple bacon which really did get my day started off right while my daughter thought the Passion Fruit White Chocolate was great.They rotate some flavors which depending on what you are craving, can be either a great thing or a miss.When you walk though the doors of the Raffaello Hotel, immediately turn right and you're there. Mmmmmmmmmm.........

32.description: This place is in the lobby of our hotel. I think they should offer a discount to hotel guests but they don't. Too pricy in my opinion and limited options. The ones we picked were good but not worth the price. We were here for 4 days and only went to donut shop once.

54.description: A fun place to indulge. The creme brulee donut was excellent, but the real highlight of the winter season was the lemon curd. The maple bacon long john is also worth a try. I'm usually a cake donut person, but I thought the raised donuts were the way to go here. The red velvet and German chocolate were somewhat leaden and didn't live up to my hopes.

48.description: My latest survey of the Chicago donut scene brought me to Glazed & Infused. I hit up their Streetville location within the Raffaello Hotel. It's a little tricky to find but they proudly display their sign outside which is a beacon of donut-y goodness. I went with the Creme Brûlée and Apple Fritter although the Passion Fruit glazed special was looking mighty tasty as well. I dug into the Creme Brûlée first as I was expecting pure donut genius out of this one. Unfortunately, the brûléed sugar crust came off as rather odd. It was hard and crunchy and really overly sweet. The vanilla filling once I got to it was good but couldn't offset the weirdness of the crust. I was much more pleased with the apple fritter which balanced a nice apple flavor with a vanilla bean glaze. Glazed & Infused wins my award for best name of any donut shop but given the consistency across the donuts I tried, I wouldn't give 'em the crown for best donut.

44.description: This neat little donut shop is hidden inside the Rafaello Hotel. It was empty when I went there this morning at 8am. I chose the apple fritter donut. It had chunks of apples and hints of cinnamon, and it was covered in glaze. It was delicious. I had just heard of this place last week when my boss brought us a whole box full of the old fashioned donuts (including the chocolate flavored ones). I had no idea it was so close to my office. I can just imagine strolling on over for an apple fritter or maple bacon donut in the morning on my way to the office. Ugh. So dangerous!

24.description: First off I was super confused as to where this place was. You actually have to go into a hotel lobby and it's right around the corner. This is not an actual bakery. Just a small storefront. They sell about 10 different kinds of donuts. We had the sprinkles, red velvet, apple fritter and a maple bacon. For 6 donuts it was 18.50. They were okay. Nothing to rave about. I love donuts but these weren't anything magical. The two ladies working the counter were nice at least.

7.description: Creme brûlée-filled. That's all you need to know.The creme brûlée was phenom. The glaze isn't a glaze- it's mostly a cracked, crispy, chewy honey-like thin crust, sugary but not gritty. It manages to be sticky, drippy but also small crunchy glass like bits here and there. Amazing! The filling was rich and good, as was the donut itself, but that glaze and texture- truly unique and tasty. (Need more adjectives???)I had other donuts that were less memorable, and there were others I'd like to try in the future, but holy moly, the creme brûlée filled was out of this world!(This was a stop on a chocolate tour, and it was right before closing, so they were unloading lots of a particular other donut on us, but I happily paid full-price for my creme brûlée.)

49.description: I have a friend who says she has a donut place in Chicago that is better than Glazed & Infused. Until we have our donut-off, my vote for best donuts in Chicago is definitely Glazed & Infused. We have trekked over to the Hotel Rafaello for these treats multiple times, and they are amazing, amazing. Our building has donuts every Friday from Dunkin Donuts--"Donut Friday"--but I can't eat them, knowing that donuts as good as Glazed & Infused exist.I recommend the namesake glazed or the iced long johns but they're really all quite good. The fritter is pretty decadent and can easily be shared. They also have Intelligentsia coffee. And friendly people who work there.

40.description: Creme brûlée-filled. That's all you need to know.The creme brûlée was phenom. The glaze isn't a glaze- it's mostly a cracked, crispy, chewy honey-like thin crust, sugary but not gritty. It manages to be sticky, drippy but also small crunchy glass like bits here and there. Amazing! The filling was rich and good, as was the donut itself, but that glaze and texture- truly unique and tasty. (Need more adjectives???)I had other donuts that were less memorable, and there were others I'd like to try in the future, but holy moly, the creme brûlée filled was out of this world!(This was a stop on a chocolate tour, and it was right before closing, so they were unloading lots of a particular other donut on us, but I happily paid full-price for my creme brûlée.)

53.description: Got the red velvet cake and thought it was dry and leaden for being 9:30am on a Sunday.  All the other donuts looked like they had been sitting awhile even though it was in the morning.  Will not be going back, as Do-Rite's donuts are AWAYS fresh and melt in your mouth!  Go to Do-Rite if you are looking for the perfect donut!

30.description: We came in on memorial day and they had a buy one, get one deal so we ended up with 4 donuts total.  We had the vanilla bean glazed, the creme brulee, a white chocolate mango donut, and a mocha something or other (not all at once).  None of them were stellar, in general I was not a fan of the dense, cakey consistency as I prefer my doughnuts light and airy.  I can't compare them to other local establishments, but unless you're nearby and desperate I'd try something else.

46.description: Aaammmaaazzing!!! Wow, I had heard these were the best donuts in Chicago and that statement couldn't be more true. I stopped in today around 11 am and was a bit disappointed when the lady behind the counter was telling the family in front of me that it was a busy day, hence why she only had three flavors left: bar snack (looked like trail mix on top of a donut), key lime, and the maple bacon long john. While none of those would have been my first choice, I figured I was there, heck why not. I ordered the key lime. And wow - was it fantastic. A super doughy donut filled with key lime custard with crushed graham cracker topping...wow, wow, wow. I can't wait to get back on a day when more flavors are available.

1.description: My first visit was this past summer where I had the most delicious peanut butter and jelly donut. Unfortunately my past visit was disappointing. We came 30 minutes before closing and got the old fashioned and vanilla glazed donuts. Was nothing unique or spectacular so that was disappointing. Will try again.

55.description: GLAZED & INFUSED IS IN THE RAFAELLO LOBBY!To get to this cave of donut treasures, you enter in style as two guys stand by to open the doors upon your arrival. The craze has since infiltrated the radius of my abode and I am feeling slightly uneasy about this. They're open super early, which means post-night owl hours will leave me vulnerable to cravings. While I haven't been to G&ID's other locales, the selection they have at the Raffaello is enough to put you in a dreamy, sugary coma. Between the strips of bacon and other sweet confectionary adornments, deciding on my choice of indulgent breakfast was tough. I liked the old fashioned in terms of having a lighter profile. Soft, moist and just enough to satisfy a morning sweet tooth.

9.description: If you re into "sweets" like me to compliment your personality. These donuts are great. They also have some eclectic ingredients combinations, like bacon added. The price is OK.  Hard to find parking though since it's located in the busy area of downtown Chicago, but after eating all these calories you could probably use couple of miles walk anyway.

26.description: This is a convenient location for me when I conduct business in the area. I had a sprinkle, red velvet, and a chocolate. They were incredible. The sprinkles was moist and had excellent, sweet flavor. The red velvet had great cream cheese frosting. The chocolate was solid, nothing out of this world, but it was good. Only complaint is the selection. There were about 8 to choose from and the long john had bacon on it. I'm over the bacon fad.

25.description: The red velvet was amazing. The cream cheese frosting was light and fluffy.   The maple bacon was okay.  I was underwhelmed by the blueberry lemon and the old fashioned.  Considering I paid over $11 for those 4 donuts, I reserve the right to be picky about quality.  Recently, I had the best donut of my life at Blue Star Doughnuts in Portland, Oregon . It was an old fashioned , you could just taste the butter in it. I guess the bar was raised too high by those good folks.  Most of the donuts here are mediocre. Will I be back for a red velvet? Probably.

12.description: Great donuts! Coffee goes well too. Had a great selection and the staff were very friendly! I'll be back for more!

59.description: Are you kidding me? These were some of the best donuts I have ever had. Pumkin cake my favorite.In the lobby of the Raffaello Hotel not inside Francescas. Took me awhile to figure that out, but worth the effortI wonder if they can ship to Indy?

21.description: Stopped by here last week when I was visiting Chicago. It was near my hotel, just off the magnificent mile. I tried two donuts, which tasted very fresh. They didn't have the donut I wanted because they only make certain donuts each day, but the ones I chose were delicious as well.

17.description: These were pretty good! They definitely satisfy a sweet tooth. They tasted fresh even though its obvious they weren't baked on site. We came on a saturday morning which probably helped. It took us a few minutes to figure out where this store was. There is no sign. Its inside a hotel lobby.  I would like to try other flavors. Extra points for experimenting with flavors!

10.description: Hidden inside a hotel, where I would never even notice it, is this little gourmet gem. I went with a coworker around noon, and there was still a solid variety of doughnuts available (I had been warned that as the day goes on the pickings are slim).I went with the cherry granola doughnut (pretending to be healthy), and it was really good, and very filling. The sole employee there was very cheerful and helpful.Minus one star because it's crazy pricey (although for an occasional indulgence, not a big deal) and because the menu just lists general prices ("2.50/3/3.75" or whatever the increments are), but there's no listing of what doughnut is what price. I know the selection probably changes, but even just a little name plate and price by each selection in the display case would be helpful.

5.description: We ordered the Maple Bacon, Apple Cider, Old Fashioned, Carmel Pecan Pumpkin, and the Coconut doughnuts. Our total was around $20 for 5 donuts. The maple bacon was good. The apple cider was my favorite. The old fashioned was too sweet. The carmel pecan pumpkin had too much going on and was hard to eat. And the coconut was just average. Didn't think it was worth the $20- plus the service wasnt anything great.

3.description: The actually shop is situated in the lobby of the Raffaello Hotel. I opted for their chocolate donut which was on point. If you love chocolate, this should be your go to donut. The actual donut itself I found to be a bit more like a dense moist chocolate cake than a traditional fluffy donut. But I really enjoyed it! Think chocolate cake dipped in chocolate and topped off with chocolate bits. Will definitely come by again earlier to hopefully try the bacon maple bar I saw in pictures. 'Til next time, cheers!

35.description: PB&J dount = heavenly. Yes, yes and YES!

19.description: First off I was super confused as to where this place was. You actually have to go into a hotel lobby and it's right around the corner. This is not an actual bakery. Just a small storefront. They sell about 10 different kinds of donuts. We had the sprinkles, red velvet, apple fritter and a maple bacon. For 6 donuts it was 18.50. They were okay. Nothing to rave about. I love donuts but these weren't anything magical. The two ladies working the counter were nice at least.

28.description: Arrived at the Raffaello from Toronto last weekend and was really looking forward to trying these donuts! I was not disappointed - hands down the best I've ever had. Yes the "long john with real maple glaze & peppered maple bacon" looks intimidating, but it was heavenly. Sweet and salty and delicious! The vanilla bean (airy and light) and the old fashioned glazed (cake-like) were also both amazing. Cappuccino was also great. Will definitely tell friends this is a must-visit destination when visiting Chicago!

45.description: Amazing eye-catching flavors -- Maple Bacon Long John and Banana Pie filled Bismarks -- need I say more? Located in the Rafaello Hotel Lobby - Glazed & Infused is one of the best donut places in Chicago.  Open Daily 7am-2pm bringing these to the office will surely be a hit! Warning - get there early, because if they are busy, they may have a limited (but still great) selection.

33.description: Found a hair in our vanilla bean donut. Pretty gross.

43.description: So today the boss says we need sugar and brings dozens of these sugary treats.  I'm on a diet and already had my green smoothie this morning, but there was no way I could pass up the "bacon maple longjohn".  OMGGGGGGGGG, this was a little piece of heaven.  The sweet maple and salty bacon was a perfect balance.  I only had like a 4th of the donut in fear that I would go into a diabetic coma if I ate the entire thing. What a great way to start off a Friday!!!!

2.description: I've tried so many maple bacon donuts and was really excited to try Glazed and Infused.  While the donut was huge and had a big piece of bacon, I felt it lacked in the maple flavor.  The donut wasn't fresh like what I expected.  There's even a microwave with instructions to warm up your donut for 7 seconds.  It was mediocre to me.

18.description: Wow! The selection is outstanding - the quality is so good! The staff is funny and honest. Cannot say enough about these guilty pleasures!

41.description: A must for any Chicago morning. Creme Brûlée donut was incredible. Counter staff was very nice and helpful. Blackberry with goat cheese donut also quite good.

52.description: Now! That's what I am talking about... and for a Frenchy to write about donuts... it'd better be good... try the Caramel Bacon one with Nueske Bacon... a true delish... you might have to run a few more miles than 3, maybe like 9 or 12 to work it out... but hummm...The only downside, the place is not easy to find as it is in an hotel and I could not find the signage outside except from the A frame on the sidewalk. I would have walked past it despite the fact that I was looking for it.

50.description: Fantastic Selection even an hour before they close.  Try the original glazed!

4.description: Really hard to find; it's tucked away in the Raffaello hotel, and even once you're inside the lobby it's tucked around the corner from the entrance. Doughnuts were huge but also pretty expensive, and I was surprised by a heavy cream cheese frosting on one. Coffee was fine but nothing to write home about.

6.description: Red Velvet? Creme Brulee? They had neither which were at the top of my daughters list.Even with those out the window, Lucy Y. made a great recommendation!I loved the maple bacon which really did get my day started off right while my daughter thought the Passion Fruit White Chocolate was great.They rotate some flavors which depending on what you are craving, can be either a great thing or a miss.When you walk though the doors of the Raffaello Hotel, immediately turn right and you're there. Mmmmmmmmmm.........

22.description: Way over rated.... Dinkel's is way better.

15.description: Share the donuts so you can try all the flavors! So decadent. I gave 4 stars because I wish there was a larger seating area. It's a small shop.

57.description: A little hidden gem in the Rafaello's Hotel. We got the maple and bacon, and the creme brulee. Both were delish and unique. Definitely worth the try, but not the cheapest donuts in town.
