20.description: Hidden gem located inside the raffaello hotel. The maple bacon is a little bigger than usual and that is absolutely fine. One beautiful fatty strip of bacon is the perfect thing to wake up to.

36.description: Love it!! Best donuts anywhere. The girls working were so patient as we kept going back and forth of which to order. Oh! And there were samples!! Perfect.  Get there early, they sell out fast.

14.description: Stopped by here last week when I was visiting Chicago. It was near my hotel, just off the magnificent mile. I tried two donuts, which tasted very fresh. They didn't have the donut I wanted because they only make certain donuts each day, but the ones I chose were delicious as well.

3.description: I do love me some Forever 21!  This location, however wasn't my favorite...  I mean, what can you say about a store that has TWO floors for shopping, and I only found two tank tops that I liked...there were really long lines in the fitting rooms, and the sales people were NOT friendly.  I went there with an open wallet, but only spent abut $20.  Had the salespeople been more helpful, I probably would have (been able to) spend more.

1.description: The worst customer service. Nobody ever helps me or knows where anything is. You work here and it's your job to customer service, not to look angry at all times. I get it, it's retail! I've been there but it is your job! Be thankful you have one. It's also super disorganized and chaotic. I left feeling overwhelmed.

2.description: Ha ha.    Do people really shop here?

9.description: Worst Forever 21 location I have ever been to. They were extremely rude when I tried to go see what my sister was trying on in the dressing room. I will not be back here. What a rude sales associate!

10.description: I like Forever 21 but lately they've been hit or miss with me. This location is cool if you happen to be in the area but not worth coming to if you have one closer to you. They do carry more mens clothes than the one in westfield in chicago ridge. Sometimes it looks like a tornado came roaring through from all the merchandise that doesn't find its way back to the racks. The clothes can be cheap and sometimes remind me of something you might find at marshalls which makes me say "you get what you pay for".

4.description: A few months ago, I walked into this particular store in Water Tower Place, and after being overwhelmed by the racks upon racks of brightly colored crap, I found a sales girl and said,"Hi. I have a date in about half an hour and just need to find a simple black cardigan to go with my dress. Can you show me where those are?"She gave me a blank stare.Then she went to find another sales girl, who found a sales guy, and nobody was able to help me after 10 minutes of utter confusion on their part. They couldn't tell me where in the store I could find a simple. black. cardigan.I've since been dragged back to this store with a friend, and my opinion of this particular location hasn't changed. It's disorganized, crowded and  overwhelming, and the customer service stinks.If you're on a budget, try the sale racks at the Macy's or American Eagle in Water Tower Place instead!

6.description: Before you read my review and why I gave this place only one star, I'm putting up full disclosure that I am 1) a male, so I would never be shopping here for myself - 2) a 4XL-sized male with a not-XS girlfriend, so the store refuses to believe any fat people could be "Forever 21" - and 3) a person who knows NOTHING about fashion and thanks the Lord every day to remember to wear a shirt and pants and couldn't give a damn whether or not they "match".See that grain of salt over there?  That's what you should take my advice with.That out of the way, this store apparently thinks that 21-year-olds (that you should "Forever" aspire to be like) are loud, obnoxious, whorish, antisocial, devious and horrifically disorganized.  Either that or it doesn't understand what people think when they see a store labeled "Forever 21".I always thought that the music system in a store/business was meant to entice the patrons and lull them into a sense of comfort, like casinos do.  This place throws that notion out the window, then records the sound of all that window-glass shattering, and loops it at about 100 decibels until you're clawing at your ears to rip them off and end your suffering.  I'm not at all a "hep cat" (or however the youths are saying that nowadays), but I do have a wide range of music knowledge at my disposal.  And that sounds like a garbage disposal.If there's one thought that undoubtedly runs through the minds of these clerks 21 (and forever) times a day, it must be "This place would be great - if it weren't for the customers!"  Let me tell you something, Forever 21 executives.  The idea of being "forever 21" is supposed to appeal to PEOPLE OLDER THAN 21 because they wish they could be forever at that perfect age without growing old, like they are currently doing.  So how in the name of all that is good and right in this world did you pick a target demographic who is 14-18 years old?  These pubescent sticks of hormones wouldn't know 21 without the aid of a time machine - so how can you allow them to strive to be Forever 21?This store would be 30 times better if there were a bouncer at the door blocking women who couldn't present a valid I.D. - and it would be 300 times greater if it served alcohol.  Something for the menfolk - other than the clothes themselves...Whorish (adj.): a word to describe the clothing at Forever 21.  Done.We wandered the store for about 25 minutes in total and I was asked ONE TIME, "are you finding everything you need?"  I was not, because what I needed was for the store to sell more than 2 items in the size XL, neither of which I had located.  Unfortunately, before I could verbally get any of that out, the clerk had been distracted by something shiny and walked away.  Perhaps her hearing had been permanently damaged by the "music" and thought she heard me say "yes", so she was free to leave.As for the deviousness and disorganization, it's rampant.  Every "sale" sign in the place has those words "and up" attached to them, so by the time I've found something almost passable to purchase (after digging through stacks of items not sorted by size or anything useful or located near any similar items), I find out it's twice the price of the other stuff.  I'm fully aware that more material is needed to create an XL shirt than an XS - but people who can fit in an XS are too young to be shopping at this store.  Or need to eat something, please!(UPDATE: This store no longer sells XL at all.  They decided that XL is for people too fat to shop in their awesome store and is now part of their "Faith 21" line for plus-sized people.  Even though this new line only sells sizes in "XL, 1X and 2X".  They're dumb for considering XL and 1X to be different sizes and they're mean for making my S.O.'s 14-yr-old sister feel fat and unwanted in their establishment.)I'm frankly waiting for the revolution to begin.  The overweight are outnumbering the underweight, and all of these stores selling to the "pretty people" and offer nothing above a size L need to be driven out of business.  Yes, there will always be a size S in a department store for you - that doesn't mean we should have a nationwide chain of stores that ONLY sell size S.  And yes - I plan on posting this in every review I write of businesses who think that they don't have the obligation to offer clothing in sizes that are becoming more of the norm.Of course, those other stores might have a title that doesn't show complete disregard for itself like "Forever 21" does.  Then again, if a store were built around my 21st year, it would sell sweatpants and Nacho Cheese Doritos.  So grab that grain of salt, because this is the end of my rant:I guess I'd have to recommend this store to whorish teens who long to be 21 - and suggest that anyone who has survived that year and knows of the horrors of vomit-stained carpets from binge drinking that should not be revisited forever avoid this place like the plague.

12.description: There is so so much to hate about this store. First off they really seem to be marketing to tweens because the place is just swarmed with them, and I would like to think that if you want to be "Forever 21" you would have had to experience that age first. Secondly is the annoying loud club music, um I am not looking to go dancing, I am looking to by clothes, It's been loud to the point where i could not hear the sales people talking to me, that's just bad business. Thirdly they do not carry anything over a large, and their sizes are cut so small that I doubt it is really a "large" They market to the super skinny heroin addict looking chicks in this place. Worst part? This made my small except in the boob area little sister feel fat, because we could not find anything that would properly fit her on her boobs, and she's fourteen. We found out from one of the sales people that they now consider XL to be a plus sized and we would have to go their other store to get anything in that size. What? Even K-mart and Wal mart have enough sense to put the XL in with the regular sizes. Aren't bigger sizes becoming more of the norm these days? It's like only herion addict thin people can shop here, and they have shirts that say things that only a crack whore would be proud to say about themselves( anybody ever see a fat crack whore? didn't think so) so it makes me wonder what kind of message are they trying to send tween girls? Seriously this place blows.

5.description: So this Forever 21 is inside Water Tower (slightly annoying) BUT it's heaven compared to the other ones in the city.  The store covers two spacious floors, is incredibly organized, and has a great selection of sizes.  I was able to find several size 2 dresses when I usually can't find any.  I went during the afternoon on a week day and it was calm and easy to shop, this one even had the music at a decent level.  I'll still never understand why you can only take 6 items in the dressing room at once, but for those prices, I'll make some concessions like that.

11.description: This store can be a bit messy... but hey c'mon, you have 100's of people flowing through there by the second. They are FULLY stocked with everything, and I have to say they have thee best Accessory section I've ever seen at any Forever 21. Clothes are super cheap and last, I shop at them all the time. They have every register open (as they should) with people who MOVE THEIR ASSES. I haven't come across one slow, rude cashier. Definitely beats the one in the city. I didn't find the black bomber I went in for, but accidently stumbled upon a nice cream colored one that wasn't where it should have been. Things tend to travel in this store, it's huge, but I came up so I'm not complaining! Ease up people, it's forever 21 downtown... what do you expect?!

8.description: This place is awful. The staff is worse than just unhelpful... They're rude. I went with my girlfriend and wanted to kill myself after 20 minutes of continuous bad club music.

0.description: Eeek. Reading all the bad experiences here makes me feel kind of scared to put up my review because I had a "normal" experience I guess? I came here on a rainy saturday in May and the store was not so busy. I managed to find lots of clothes that i liked... even a favorite black and white cardigan that I wear all the time now. The only "bad" experience I had was that when I was in the front portion of the store trying to browse the sales lady was very suspicious that I would try to shoplift... dah T______T just because I look young.. sorry okay. Needless to stay she "stalked" around that area until I left to a more populated area within the store. What I liked about this store though is that they didn't have as big of a crowd that would have had on the F21 along michigan avenue, plus for me I hate being in a huge crowd of shoppers. In addition, I thought that the selection was alright. I found a lot of things that I liked here.

7.description: I used to love Forever 21.  Over the last ten years it has grown into this store of overstocked racks and merchandise that is too much to look at.   The employees at this store do not enjoy their jobs and why should they?  They have hundreds of clothes hungry women in and out and work for minimum wage.  The other evening my husband and I went to this particular store to shop using our gift cards from Christmas.  I looked at the women's section while he went to small section they called the men's section.  I asked an employee if I could find a shirt I was holding in a different size.  He attempted to look around but was more bothered by me asking him to have to search for it.  I hate that feeling when you feel guilty for asking someone to do their job.  He never found my size or was too lazy to look further.  When I went to the dressing rooms there was four young ladies escorting customers to rooms and counting merchandise.  It was the end of the evening and I heard all of their conversations in my dressing room, about what their plans were for the evening and the gossip about customers that they didn't like.  Very unprofessional.  I finally headed to the register and waited my turn.  I was next in line and the employee whose register I walked to decided to close it down without telling me.  So I got back in line.  I stood around waiting and finally asked who can ring me up.  There was an employee standing in front of me looking at some receipts but not bothering to acknowledge me.  I'm finally rung up and this same employee is talking aloud to the other employee who had just closed her register and tells her he can't stand working here for eight hours.  Well, if you hate your job so much then JUST QUIT!  That was my last visit to the water tower Forever 21.  There isn't an ounce of customer service in that store.

58.description: This review is specifically for a Thursday afternoon, not a weekend.  I spent over 4 wonderful hours at Water Tower Place and it was AWESOME.  Not crowded at all - found some great deals and had so many bags I had to take a cab home.  Haven't done that in YEARS.  The best experience was at the Clinique counter in Macy's.  Because it was a slower day, I was able to stop and play for almost an hour.  Neal was amazing - he let me try all of the products I wanted to try.  He also completely re-did my makeup with Clinique products.  I really wish I had before & after photos.  Neal is an awesome makeup artist as well as extremely knowledgeable.  I would highly recommend visiting with Neal if you're interested in Clinique products or if you need someone to do your makeup for a special occasion.It's been a couple of weeks and I've already seen tremendous improvement from using the "even better" product line.This was the best day I've had since I can remember - the best shopping experience in years!  Wish I could do it more often.Yes, the weekends are way too packed and busy, but if you have the chance to stop in during the week, it is definitely worth it.

56.description: We stopped by Macy's looking for shoes.  The men's shoes was on the seventh floor (I think?) of the building (inside the Water Tower shopping center).  We recommend taking the escalator instead of the elevator.  There was only one express elevator to the seventh floor (where the men's shoes were).  The other elevators would stop on every floor (even though the elevator by then was crowded and unable to fit any more people).   The shoe area for men's was very small.  There were a lot of people shopping for men's shoes as well so the place started to get cramped. Fortunately for us there was a sales associate readily available to help us.  The service was good, fast and friendly.

29.description: Great location in Water Tower, but the layout is very cramped and confusing (at least in the shoe department when I visited). The staff seemed quite friendly, but didn't appear to have a clue about where to send me to look when I asked about Winter boots. So just ended up wandering aimlessly around racks of shoes. (And, no, I never did find those boots!)

42.description: If your a man entering this store, this has got to be the most unorganized macys i've ever been to. Accessories for men is so hard to find and then just to be more unorganized they have some of the accessories mixed in with the womens accessories, for example, the watches. I had to leave the store asap because i just couldnt stand looking for something that wasnt gonna equally divided. I mean theres not only women in this world, we could use a couple floors not just one

23.description: This is a tourist Macys to be avoided at all costs! I went there to return a sweater. Was interested in getting some shoes so I headed to the shoe department to browse and asked if I could return the sweater there. Nope, I have to go to Womens on the next floor. Ok fine, I get off the escalator and head to the first available counter. The employee told me I can't return that sweater at that counter because it's not a certain brand. She tells me to go to the counter across the way.. which is unmanned. She says, don't worry I'll send a person over to take care of you. The second person got there pretty quick but she tried to convince me to put the exchange on a gift card instead of back on my credit card. After I said no, she agreed to put it back on my credit card but as she did so, kept talking to me about the "benefits" of putting my refund on a reloadable gift card. The second the transaction was complete, I thought I was free but she asked if I was planning on buying anything there today and even when I said no, don't think so, she tried to sell me a Macys credit card. By that time I was just wanting to get the f*ck out of there and I didn't even end up going back to the shoe department.

47.description: I am officially done with Macy's. The service at both the Water Tower and State Street locations is just horrific. I should have left well enough alone because I have had my share of sub-par experiences here which led me to contact corporate and complain on several occasions but yesterday did it for me. I know it was Black Friday and it was hectic but that's no excuse. I asked 6 people to assist me and my daughter with a coat purchase.  We both had found coats that we had been eyeing for a while and where quite excited. Out of those 6 people, only one young man stopped and looked me in the eye and had a conversation with me. He explained that he did not work in that section or on that floor and could only answer one of my questions, which he did graciously. I appreciated that. The thing is, if you work with the public, you need to at least pretend like you give a $%^&: pretend like you want to be helpful which other than him, no one did. Give me something-damn! One lady held up her pop and cheetos and pointed to her face and said I'm exhausted. Seriously?! Another lady said she was helping other people and would try, try to get back to us. She said this rather snidely. I swear I only saw her walking around like she was security, nothing else. Okay. Sorry to bother you. Everyone else said they didn't work that particular area. Okay. I found someone behind a register and asked if she could call someone to the section I was in to assist me. if she did it, which she said she'd do,  the person never came. At this point, my daughter has had enough and says "let's just leave. I'm surprised you haven't left already since you always stress the importance of customer service to me." I mean like 30 minutes has elapsed. So, we left but not before I let the lady who said she'd be back but was walking around doing nothing know that I couldn't believe that they would let such a large purchase walk out the door like that. My purchase easily would have been around $500. She looked like she couldn't care less. Unbelievable. I have never received decent service at a Macy's unless I was in the Lush section and that really doesn't count. Last year , Macy's sent me an apologetic email and a gift certificate for the shoddy service I received on State Street. They can keep all of that. I really won't be back.

8.description: Been trying to order a jacket since Oct 2015. It is Dec 2015 now. They have sent me the wrong size jacket 5 times over this period of time. Which is extremely frustrating. Call Center for returns:This is the absolute worst experience or experiences I have ever had. Besides having to go to UPS 5 times to ship the items back. The call center/customer service center is as unprofessional as they come. First off they are extremely rude and have hung up on me 3 times. Even without me showing my frustrations as deserved. How they do it is as follows: because you are asked prior to your call to take a survey. They transfer you to some other number without telling you, which eventually hangs up on you. My guess is that they do this so that you cannot take a survey about your experience with that particular caller.  Five times is more then enough to ship the correct size of a jacket. In the past I have spent a lot of money with Macys and I mean ALOT! Needless to say I will take my business elsewhere from now on. I suggest you do the same.

31.description: I was actually a little surprised to see so many negative reviews for this location.  My experience here was great.  I was looking for a "rooftop reception" with my university's alumni reception and ended up more lost than usual (hate to admit it but I get lost a lot in the Loop/Streeterville).  Walked into this Macy's to ask for directions and ended up chatting it up about this new men's fragrance, "Burberry Rhythm."  The lady, Rose Woods, didn't just give me her card when prompted but also a generous sample of this great new cologne.  Super-friendly and not too pushy.  Didn't get the right directions (well, I probably just didn't follow them well) and ended up skipping the reception because I was so late but, hey, I got a free Burberry sample!  In terms of Burberry Rhythm, well, it's great but I kind of liked Burberry Brit for Men better.

34.description: BFF & I had not prepared for our Chicago Girls' Weekend & were in desperate need of gloves & cold weather gear.......thank goodness for Macy's!This location is the nicer of the 2 downtown locations but really people, 2.5-Stars?  I don't see that at all!We found a nicely staffed, clean store w/ a reasonable layout & easy-to-find directories or department headersThere was a cluster at the glove / hat / scarf area but the sales people had everything under control - plus, there was a mega-sale going on but you'd never know itWe found the gloves & scarves we were looking for; the selection was extremely large & plentiful & there were many people to assist or ring up our purchasesThis Macy's made a fan out of us so showing some extra love!

16.description: This place has what... 6 or 7 floors? I would have expected a central downtown location to be well staffed regardless of the time or day. I had gone in through the entrance of the Water tower place and made my way into Macy's. I wanted to look for their children's section, but had wandered 2 floors before I found a sales person to direct me to what I was looking for. Honestly, if it wasn't for the sensors at the entrance, I wonder how many people can just grab and walk out with merchandise!

13.description: Usually very busy but it's in a mall so it has convenience as it has many other stores. BUT main problem was the African-American older woman in the Impulse section who kept following me and my friend like we were going to steal. She just keep following us even into the fitting room. My friend said want to share a room and she was about to yell at us before I said "we can't do that". The fitting rooms are dirty as well. Selection is ok. Best part of this Macy's is the cosmetics area that's it. I'm not a fan of Macy's, never have been. I rather check out their more upscale store, Bloomingdales.

11.description: MARSHALL FIELDSIt is hard for me to shop at Macy's but when this location was Marshall Fields I use to shop her all of the time. Recently we were looking for a winter coat for our little one. There was a great sale going on. We found our jacket and she loved it. The check out lane in the kids section was 7 people deep, so we decided to go to another register. We found a less crowded register in another area that was only 3 people deep when Kathy came out of no where. Kathy walked us over to her empty register to check us out. I love good customer service. Kathy could have just hidden at her empty register but she came out to help and service customers. I love that and wanted to recognize her for her service. Kathy was also a grandmother and she was really good with our little one. She was giving our little one words of wisdom like any grandmother would do. I am so happy Kathy found us and we got to meet here. Macy's is very lucky to have a dedicated employee that knows how to treat the customer. Kathy may be the reason I come back and shop here. On a side note the store is really cramped and laid out weird. There are multiple floors which is only an issue of you are shopping with women. For the dudes we only have to go to one floor to shop so that makes it easy. You will also find the best sales on Men's clothes here.  The rest of Michigan Ave is all designer full price all of the time. Okay so it sounds like I may have talked myself into shopping here again.

39.description: Looks like a hurricane went through there...wow.. Stay away. Goto the state street location

37.description: Had to kill time while waiting for a shoe repair; I never go to this location but it was right nearby.  I soon regretted going on a Saturday after throngs of very slow tourists blocked my path, but I managed to stampede over them politely.   This place is top heavy: the 8th floor for the men's section is gigantic and spans the building, but the other floors are smaller due to the mall amenities, requiring you to take escalators up 8 floors.  If you know me one of my pet peeves is taking escaltors with people that just stand there and don't move.   I made bounds up an empty 3 floor but used my signature "stand right behind them and breathe on their neck, almost touching them" move to try to motivate the other floors, which only worked on one.   I swear, what is it about a moving staircase that freezes people into a mode where they move slower than they can walk?   To boot the top couple floors were single file.  The shoe department was my target: I actually got pretty quick help and found what I wanted right away, which was satisfying.   Browsed briefly through the clothes and found the usual Macy's style of stuffing as many things as possible on crowded racks, which is not a very appealing way to encourage browsing and display.   Rather than kill someone or many people on the escalators back down, I elected to spend 2 minutes waiting for the 3 minutes elevator ride down 8 floor with a mom screaming at her geeky teen not to take things out of the bag repeatedly.

0.description: The sales associate at the 'Urban decay' cosmetic counter was extremely nice. She offered me a complimentary eye makeup. I bought a makeup palette with one free eye shadow. The brands 'Urban decay' and 'Mac' have the most long-lasting eye shadows. I like both brands have highly pigmented shadows in a wide selection of colors. The 'magic potion' of 'Urban decay' truly help eye-shadows to last longer when worn under the makeup.

38.description: I once did the most stupid mistake of taking my mom and dad who were visiting the country to the Macy's at Water Tower Place. Never forgave myself. It was a sunday, and I reached was there around 6. Obviously, the place was about to be closed. There were plenty of people inside as I wanted to confirm. I took my family inside, right next to the revolving door, they had the counter- with a couple of sales people. I asked "Are you guys about to close"? She stared at me and my family, and shouted. "YOU HAVE 20 SECONDS TO GET THE HELL OUT OF HERE, OR I'LL HAVE YOUR "ASS KICKED.I was perplexed. Humiliated in front of my family. I didn't want to say anything because I was sure I'd have exploded. Never been so pissed off my whole life.If I am next to that Macy's and anyone asks me the way in, I'll MOST DEFINITELY tell them not to go.

51.description: It's big, it's messy, it's Macy's. They always have sales and constantly mail you gift cards for 20% off if you use your Macy's card.  It's a win-win situation.

27.description: This particular Macy's is the worst I've ever been to. It's a mess. Especially the shoe department. They don't have enough people working there and you can never escape lines. I had to wait around 10 min just to ask for a different size. Then I had to wait another 15 min for them to check me out. Women's clothing department is kind of confusing. So many stories and no decent cloths. Again, I had a hard time finding sales associates. Their Employees didn't seem to be friendly either.

32.description: Every time I come here, I regret it. Every. Single. Time. What's worse is I feel like a bad person every time I leave because I'm bound to show someone the extent of my extreme dissatisfaction.  Who trains these people? Having worked for Nordstrom in the past, this places makes me shake. Iwould rather spend extra $ at Nordstrom (which, if you're buying shoes or make-up may not even be necessary-trust me!) or buy nothing at all. I know we all have bad days, things go wrong, places are understaffed, but that shouldn't happen at Macys Michigan Avenue. Btw, huge shoutout to the ladies and gents working the make up counters at the macys on state. You're doing a great job. To the three women at "make up counter x" who continued to chat as I stood behind them for 10-15 seconds going "excuse me? Anyone? Anyone" (told you I feel like a bad person when I leave), take note. Sometimes you don't know who will spend a lot of $.

54.description: This review relates specifically to my experience with a wonderful sales associate in the designer denim department named Steve.  I came in on a very busy Saturday to return a pair of jeans I had bought the week before at the State Street store.  When I handed Steve the jeans and the receipt he asked if I had a friends and family coupon-- I didn't and told him that I didn't plan on shopping any more that day.  He said he understood and then (because that purchase was made less than 14 days prior) gave me my refund and used the coupon to give me the 25% discount on the other items that I had purchased with the returned jeans and decided to keep.  Seriously? Who does that?  I left Macy's without the jeans I returned and with an additional $50 on my credit card because Steve was nice enough to offer a discount to me after the fact on items purchased at another store.  I love this guy!  The next time I need to make a Macy's trip, I will definitely be heading back to Michigan Ave.  Thanks, Steve!

48.description: Macy's is the only store at The Loop that sells Men's earmuffs -finally our search was over. We should have started with Macy's instead of winter outdoor stores.

44.description: Good. God. Such unwarranted bitchy service.. Quit your job already Jesus Christ. There's jobs out there where you don't have to deal with talking to people, try working those instead since it seems so painful. Let me name a few: data entry, janitor, garbage man, CTA robot, dishwasher, mailman, etc.. Oh this one would fit right in with the employees at the post office on dearborn. I live within short walking distance from this location but this time I really remembered why I avoid it like the plague. Being the impulsive person that I am, I'll gladly walk back over to the loop just to go to Macy's on state instead. This weekend I found a pair of skinny olive colored pants in my size but it had an oil stain at the one on state street so the employee looked up if the other Macy's had any in stock that were my size. 3 were left. Waah. I thought I'd just go in and out then walk to lunch, done. Nope, too easy. Man oh man I forget what level number but it's the one with BCBG, French Connection, Hudson jeans, Rachel Roy, Free People and such- what a cluster fuck the Free People section was mixed with another brand. It's like TJ Maxx with random shit everywhere after a devastating hurricane. The one on state was a lot more organized. I had the bright idea to ask for help locating the pants I wanted as I only found one that's too big for me in that train wreck. Long story short, he was really annoyed and showed me so, that I needed assistance. Sorry? The guy actually gave an obvious look of exasperation and sigh, with a snobby head turn as I was walking back to him. Bitch please, do you not know your job description? You have the wrong job mister. I just don't get why work at a busy Michigan Avenue location if you don't want to do your job... he seemed like he'd rather stand amongst the mannequins so that he won't be bothered. What a ridiculous and atrocious experience. I'm sure it'd be a different story if the District Manager was around right? People were always on it when DM's were around cracking that whip, I know I was. P.S. their shoe department sucks too. That's another clusterfuck going on down there. Incompetence, laziness and complacency. I hate all that shit. Trash.

24.description: Horrendous customer service when calling the store.  My God.I called multiple times regarding a simple question, "where do I pick up an item I've ordered on line for in store pickup?"  The first time an answering machine picked up and I guess I was supposed to leave a message.  Yeah right.  The second time I called in I finally reached someone who was not helpful at all.  When I asked where to pick my item up in store the respondent said "ummmmm either the 6th or 7th floor, I'm not sure".  I kindly asked him if he could go find out, and instead said "yeah it's the 6th or 7th floor".  He didn't know the answer and wouldn't go find out the correct answer either.  Oh how I love an incompetent lazy ass person. I then told him I needed to speak with a manager or someone who knows the answer to this simple question. Then he decides to transfer me to the HR dept who can tell me where to pick up my online order.  What the hell.

7.description: So many floors !! Lol and the escalator keeps shrinking as you keeping trying to go to higher floors . Lol I wish I had taken a picture but I thought it was funny how it gets wider and then shrinks . The loss of the star isn't due to customer service experience , they are very friendly and helpful . The loss is because the floors are not clearly numbered .

49.description: 8 Floors of pure bliss.  A shopper's paradise.  Millions of things to look at.  So overwhelming, but so great at the same time.

40.description: Only 1 floor for men. Every brand has the same style as its neighbor (casual friday boring fashioned...)5mn were enough, cant come back here as I know Macy's NY...

53.description: Are you closing down - that was the feeling you get in your store ...

30.description: MARSHALL FIELDSIt is hard for me to shop at Macy's but when this location was Marshall Fields I use to shop her all of the time. Recently we were looking for a winter coat for our little one. There was a great sale going on. We found our jacket and she loved it. The check out lane in the kids section was 7 people deep, so we decided to go to another register. We found a less crowded register in another area that was only 3 people deep when Kathy came out of no where. Kathy walked us over to her empty register to check us out. I love good customer service. Kathy could have just hidden at her empty register but she came out to help and service customers. I love that and wanted to recognize her for her service. Kathy was also a grandmother and she was really good with our little one. She was giving our little one words of wisdom like any grandmother would do. I am so happy Kathy found us and we got to meet here. Macy's is very lucky to have a dedicated employee that knows how to treat the customer. Kathy may be the reason I come back and shop here. On a side note the store is really cramped and laid out weird. There are multiple floors which is only an issue of you are shopping with women. For the dudes we only have to go to one floor to shop so that makes it easy. You will also find the best sales on Men's clothes here.  The rest of Michigan Ave is all designer full price all of the time. Okay so it sounds like I may have talked myself into shopping here again.

46.description: Macy's ruined Marshall Field's.This place is like a low-rent Marshalls, if there even is such a thing. It's like Filene's Sub-basement. TJ Maxx's strung-out half-sister asking for packs of Sudafed for another meth cook.Fuck this place. Should have closed and retained some of its former glory and dignity.

1.description: Went to try to pick out a suit today.  Saw something I liked and went and grabbed an associate, I'll just leave his name outta this...He comes over to the rack I was at and asks my size and then says I'm a different size and just ups and walks away from me... Didn't ask what I was looking for, if I needed any help, or if I had any questions. Just walked away like he had zero interest in helping me ?!#I walked out and bought from Men's Warehouse I've had better service from State St location and won't be back here

55.description: I know it's just Macy's and we all know what they have there, but yesterday we had a great customer service experience. We called ahead to see if they had a particular piece of luggage since we didn't have time to order it online. The sales staff quickly put it on hold and when we arrived it was not where it should have been. Everyone was nothing but apologetic and the situation was resolved within 10 minutes. During the time we waited we saw that these three ladies in luggage were dealing with a parade of less than enjoyable customers but it didn't change their attitudes. We got what we needed at a discounted price with a smile. It made me want to shop department stores more often :)

9.description: The prices are good when you catch one of there many sales. What I would like is for Macy's to get rid of all the cash register stations. The attendees are never there.

26.description: Usually very busy but it's in a mall so it has convenience as it has many other stores. BUT main problem was the African-American older woman in the Impulse section who kept following me and my friend like we were going to steal. She just keep following us even into the fitting room. My friend said want to share a room and she was about to yell at us before I said "we can't do that". The fitting rooms are dirty as well. Selection is ok. Best part of this Macy's is the cosmetics area that's it. I'm not a fan of Macy's, never have been. I rather check out their more upscale store, Bloomingdales.

25.description: I just cannot get into Macy's. The stores are outdated and need major facelifts. However, they constantly have sales and coupons and promotions so you're bound to find something at a good deal.

12.description: It's Macy's at water tower place. Macy's has always been classy and clean. I shop peacefully there and the customer service is friendly and helpful. I get what I need at this Macy's.

59.description: So I like to go for walk down Michigan Ave, mostly because there isn't much else to do in the winter with accessible stores to quickly go in and out and warm up a bit. I have been to this Macy's location quite a few times, every time I go in, don't know why, thinking I will actually find something here.....reasons why I don't particularly like this location: 8 floors!! It's just too huge...not practical if you want to browse and shop. Secondly, way over priced! And lastly,  just plain useless!I've been to another location in a mall, and actually found what I was looking for and more, sales are visible, and range of variety in items and prices. Lately I have been buying mostly house items, so unless one bright fine winter day I have a sudden urge to spend $80 on one throw pillow....I will probly not be buying anything from this location. Although I will go inside to browse and warm up when walking up and down Michigan Ave. Hope this helps!

21.description: This place has what... 6 or 7 floors? I would have expected a central downtown location to be well staffed regardless of the time or day. I had gone in through the entrance of the Water tower place and made my way into Macy's. I wanted to look for their children's section, but had wandered 2 floors before I found a sales person to direct me to what I was looking for. Honestly, if it wasn't for the sensors at the entrance, I wonder how many people can just grab and walk out with merchandise!

17.description: I stopped going there a few years ago after I had to  return  dishes because the paint was coming off after  I hand washed them. They credited my Macy's Visa card, but I couldn't use the credit for any purchases except at Macy's.  It was ridiculous.  I decided to give them another chance when I wanted a Kipling bag. I was charged $129, but the price tag was $119.  As a result, my discounts were applied incorrectly.  I called the customer service number on the receipt,  and they said they couldn't help me. Now I will return the item.  What a waste of time and money.  CHECK YOUR RECEIPTS BEFORE YOU LEAVE THE STORE.

10.description: Horrendous customer service when calling the store.  My God.I called multiple times regarding a simple question, "where do I pick up an item I've ordered on line for in store pickup?"  The first time an answering machine picked up and I guess I was supposed to leave a message.  Yeah right.  The second time I called in I finally reached someone who was not helpful at all.  When I asked where to pick my item up in store the respondent said "ummmmm either the 6th or 7th floor, I'm not sure".  I kindly asked him if he could go find out, and instead said "yeah it's the 6th or 7th floor".  He didn't know the answer and wouldn't go find out the correct answer either.  Oh how I love an incompetent lazy ass person. I then told him I needed to speak with a manager or someone who knows the answer to this simple question. Then he decides to transfer me to the HR dept who can tell me where to pick up my online order.  What the hell.

5.description: When I was shopping at the men's floor and went to check out , a manager named Sheryl with orange/brown-ish hair (forgot how to spell her name) had a really bad attitude against everyone even with the employees. I don't know how she even has the position she is at, but I'm not coming at the 8th floor again and I hope something is done about that woman, people with bad attitude shouldn't be aloud to work for Macy's especially in a manager level.

3.description: After going to several stores all up and down Michigan my wife finally found the shoes she was looking for and they weren't a thousand dollars.  Win/Win?This Macy's store was easy to find and well within site.  Water Tower Place is a well sized mall and we didn't have to spend much time in the store to get what we needed and the customer service was very helpful.  My wife was looking for her size and she took it to the sales rep who ran a scan and on her device and said that the shoes would be brought shortly.  No running around it seems... As most department stores the cosmetic level is on the first floor and is bustling, noisy and smells of perfume.  These are usually the busiest, nosiest and smelliest (good or bad) areas of any department store and Macy's is no different in that respect.

35.description: i love macy's and never seem to find anything wrong with it. I was in the perfume and then the bag department. The staff was real nice and helpful on both floors. love this  place

19.description: BFF & I had not prepared for our Chicago Girls' Weekend & were in desperate need of gloves & cold weather gear.......thank goodness for Macy's!This location is the nicer of the 2 downtown locations but really people, 2.5-Stars?  I don't see that at all!We found a nicely staffed, clean store w/ a reasonable layout & easy-to-find directories or department headersThere was a cluster at the glove / hat / scarf area but the sales people had everything under control - plus, there was a mega-sale going on but you'd never know itWe found the gloves & scarves we were looking for; the selection was extremely large & plentiful & there were many people to assist or ring up our purchasesThis Macy's made a fan out of us so showing some extra love!

28.description: Clothing- only fit for one type of person: skinny girls. Service- where?Other stuff- I am yet to be disappointed.

45.description: I hate that the men's dept is way at the top. It should be on the 2nd floor instead of having to trek it all the way past the 7-8 women's floors to get to men's.Hit or miss on the service aspect as I asked an associate to help me find something and he never returned, but I saw him helping someone else. I have also received very helpful service here as well. Good quality clothing and brands

33.description: Honestly, I like this store, when it is a good day and I actually get someone to ring me up. I have left here many , many times, because the "girls" have been too busy chatting. instead of checking out. That being said, Their management is grand. My son threw his glove on the soffit in the women's department and though no one that day would do anything, I called the store manager and she managed to get it down for us and held onto it. A great plus for us considering I just bought the darn glove! hence the 5 stars!

43.description: This was probably the most "blah" Macy's I've ever been to. I visited each floor and was completely unimpressed with the selections of clothing. Much of it looked like it was made for middle-aged soccer moms. I normally shop at Macy's in Atlanta and the experience is much better than what you would get here. I wouldn't come back to this store.

2.description: NEVER AGAIN!! This was by far the worst experience I have had in retail in a very long time.First of all, this is the messiest department store I have ever set foot in. Its worse than any JC Penney or Belk down in the south. Thank god I was not shopping for myself that Saturday night because if I had, I would have more than likely demanded a manager come to my area and explain why the staff here would not be recovering their areas during down time!What REALLY ruined my entire night was the staff here. I hate using the word ghetto, but truly there is no other way to describe the class of workers in this location. Popping gum, having thorough in depth conversations with each toehr while I am staring at them (sort of obnoxiously to make a point), being as short as possible with other customers who had questions, talking about parties the night(s) before, like...really?Do this on your lunch break for crying out loud. This store is already big enough and unorganized that shoppers need the help of these workers. Unfortunately, the staff on the bottom level are fantastic. It sucks that they must suffer from all of the other floors.From now on I will be going to the fabulous Macy's on State Street. This location is a joke. A horrible joke with the worst punchline ever.

18.description: I just cannot get into Macy's. The stores are outdated and need major facelifts. However, they constantly have sales and coupons and promotions so you're bound to find something at a good deal.

41.description: I had terrific customer service in this absolute mess of a Macy's store. A couple of weeks ago, I was in town for business and spent a couple of hectic hours in this store. First I visited women's shoes, which was just insane. It looked like a tornado had hit. Maybe I'm just used to bigger Macy's stores with more space, but I got so frustrated browsing I had to leave the shoe floor entirely.Next I went to the housewares floor. I was looking for a suitcase which had just gone on sale. This was by far the most well-staffed area of the store - I saw three employees in one department (far more than anywhere else in the store). The woman who helped me was knowledgeable and sweet - she advised me to ship the suitcase instead of taking it as I would be able to avoid sales tax in my home state and shipping would be free. She even applied a visitor coupon for me. Score!Last, I visited the impulse department. Again, an absolute mess but I found some great deals (though it was difficult finding anyone to ring up my purchases).A couple of days later, I visited one more time to return one of the dresses I'd just purchased. I wanted it in a smaller size, but there weren't any in the store. Not one, but TWO super helpful employees in the Impulse department looked up other Macy's stores that carried the dress, and the three of us split up the list and called various Macy's stores until we found it. I ordered the smaller size over the phone, the girls in Chicago returned the larger size for me, and I was on my way.Some good, some bad. But I do think Macy's has excellent customer service whenever you can manage to actually find an employee! While this store seems chronically understaffed and chaotic, I had two great customer service experiences.

52.description: Macy's could be soooo much better, really. The only reason you should go to this store is because you need clothes, not for browsing or a particularly nice shopping experience. It never ceases to amaze me how a literal tornado must whip through the women's shoes floor each and every day. I'm forced to soak in the disastrous scene while my wife sifts through shoes that are strewn all over the place.  Tornado or understaffed? Tornado is a much cooler image, I'll stick with that.  But, they have some good deals. My wife got a pair of shoes 80% off. The 8th floor men's is generally fine.  They had a sale this past weekend on summer clothes in Polo and TH. I got a steal on some shorts and seersuckers after using a coupon and Macy's card. Good deals sometimes, but, only shop here when you need to.

50.description: Probably (easily?) the worst department store in the city. I was here a year ago for some staple items and was so turned off by the inattentive staff, unshoppable sales floor and general disarray that I vowed never to return. For reasons unknown, I found myself back in this hellhole and immediately remembered why I gave it the death penalty in the first place. I posted some pics of the messy fitting rooms so you can see what you're getting yourself into.AVOID AT ALL COSTS

4.description: Estee Lauder counter: Zaga and Olga were amazing today!!!!! Hooked me up with everything I needed in a hurry!!! Foundation, primer, new brush, serum, samples of my foundation and day and night cream!!! Under my budget as well!!!!

6.description: So many levels! And I found it hard to find where I could get out to the other areas of the Water Tower. Additional signage would be useful. We didn't have a whole lot of time to shop, but went through a few of the ladies' fashion levels. I found a couple things to try on, but nothing really suited me. I think that the prices are good when on clearance. My mom and I pretty much only shop the clearance racks here, with a few exceptions.

22.description: Horrendous customer service. In some departments it's very hard to find an employee and when you do they are not friendly/knowledgeable. I prefer the one on State street and today's visit cemented that.

15.description: I've seen a lot better Macy's stores than this one. Not only is it always teeming with customers (which makes shopping a lot harder), it is usually disorganized and out of stock. Perhaps the slightly cramped feel of Water Tower makes it seem more so, but I always feel stuffy and unable to find anything I want when I come. It's often hard to get employees' attention, and they usually seem to be slightly understaffed. I definitely prefer other Macy's.

57.description: The sales here are just unbelievable! An $80 shirt for $10 each?! Yes, please!

20.description: I've seen a lot better Macy's stores than this one. Not only is it always teeming with customers (which makes shopping a lot harder), it is usually disorganized and out of stock. Perhaps the slightly cramped feel of Water Tower makes it seem more so, but I always feel stuffy and unable to find anything I want when I come. It's often hard to get employees' attention, and they usually seem to be slightly understaffed. I definitely prefer other Macy's.

36.description: So, I'm taking some cologne back and I asked someone on the first floor where would the service desk be?  She was like " ugh.. take it to 4th floor."  So I went up to the 4th floor.  Found a young girl, asked her and she told me this store didn't have a service desk and you just need to go down to the first floor to exchange the cologne.  Alright.. so I went back down.  I had no idea where to go, so I saw a man dressed up that worked for the store.  I asked him where can I return my cologne?  He said  go to floor 8, that's the men's area.  Floor 8?  Ok..  So I went.  Got up there, asked a lady where I can make my return, she said floor number 1.  Serious!?  Ugh, had to go back down. I walked around on the first floor for only 30 seconds to see the cologne area.  A lady came within 2 minutes and the exchange was pretty quick.   I wasted quite a bit of time going up and down, up and down.  I don't mind if some of the associates had no idea where I should go, they should just tell me that rather than guessing.  Jeez.  The girls on the 4th and 8th floor at least knew!

14.description: The men's store on the 8th floor is everything a men's store shouldn't be. It's messy, disorganized, and full of staff who are more interested in themselves than their customers. Went in for a shirt and tie, left disappointed and empty handed. The tie displays were so sloppy, and it was early in the morning (a sign it was left that way from the night before). I'm afraid that was my last trip to this store.

3.description: Ok, so I am pretty good at remembering most things, but I forgot my cell phone on this trip!  Can you imagine...people trying to reach you, and the phone is in its stand at home, ringing its heart out.  We went to the TMobile store to find out what I could do.  They told me they could loan me a phone...how cool is that?  I knew I loved TMobile.  So I am using a loaner phone that I then return to the store that loaned it to me, and virtually no cost, just the tax that Cook County puts on the transation (I had to let them charge my account as a deposit on the phone.).  I get that refunded when I return the phone.They couldn't have been nicer too.

1.description: Came here on a Thursday night, looking at phones.  If you're in market for new phone during the week, id recommend going to another location.  I had two issues:1) store was very understaffed2) the employees didn't acknowledge me or other customers walking in.  In playing with phones for 20 min, the only thing I heard was "someone will be with you soon" about 10 min in.  Someone with hustle would say "sorry you're having to wait, we are swamped at moment.  May I take your number and we will call you first thing tomorrow?"I'm mystified at the experience other Yelpers have had: the staff tonight wasn't it.  Let me know when the employees you worked with are working, and I'll give this store another chance!

2.description: One of my greatest frustrations in life is going into a Tmobile and not being able to be helped due to a shortage of staff that are unable to swiftly attend to the long lines of people.  Not only did I experience exact opposite at this T-Mobile, one of their staff members, Johnny, went above and beyond for me.  I had a phone that had to be exchanged after Asurion Insurance sent me a lemon.  I had expressed my frustrations to him about all of the media having to be transferred a second time. He ordered the replacement for me, and then gave me his schedule so that I could go back to see him so that he could help me with all of the media.  The phone came the next day, and I went back in for help. I walked in to three people at the counter.  I think that is a lot of people for one small store, but that also explains why I never had to wait long here.  Anyway, Johnny was there, and swapped everything out for me.  Helped me with the media transfer, put the screen protector on for me, and even help set up my work email on the phone.  I admit, I am technologically challenged, so this experience was priceless for me.  He was so patient with me, and so helpful.  T-Mobile visits are typically a headache for me, so moving forward, I see no other reason to go to any other T-Mobile store.

0.description: Walked here after frustrating anti-customer experience at 40 E Ontario store. What a difference!  I was greeted and taken care of within a few moments by the manager, Brian. I wanted one of the new Cell Spot devices. Unfortunately, T-Mobile neglected to mention that you must return the router they offered a couple of years back before you can have a Cell Spot. Brian kindly called the mother ship and confirmed that I had to mail it back and wait a week for processing. He also had them email an address label, gave me a UPS box, and promised to hold a Cell Spot for me to pick up next week. Brian's actions made it clear he wanted to keep me as a customer. In the process, he kept 3 more family members as customers too. Tip: This store is hidden on the 6th floor and not listed on the major signs.

4.description: I took my T-Mobile Motorola Rizr here and asked an associate if it supports stereo blue tooth, she gave me a dazed and confused look and shrugged her shoulders without saying a word. The store itself is okay and I say that there were more knowledgeable people around but its common sense to FIND OUT the answer if you don't know about your product. In this case one bad apple spoiled the bunch. No bueno.

12.description: I am a lover of smoothies and since jamba juice closed in the hankock center I decided to try Freshii but the three times I've ordered from them I never get what I pay for. The smoothies are watery and bland, I buy Naked juices that have a thicker consistency than what Freshii had served me and today was just the worst. I waited ten minutes for two carribean coolers that I specified I wanted them thick, but again I didn't get anything that even resembled a smoothie. Watery and tasteless. I had to wait another 10 minutes to have them remade and finally got what I paid for. Honestly I think this place is skimping on the ingredients for their smoothies. I have never ordered food from them but why would I if they can't even get my drink right. I guess I'll be walking right past them and going to the protein bar the next time I have a taste for a smoothie.

7.description: I had one of their Pangoa bowls. It's pretty much all rice with a smidgen of corn, beans, and chicken mixed in. Not terrible, but definitely not great. The sauce was really good though. And they were quick. I'd make this a last resort type of place.

20.description: This little place is so tucked away in the ground, back floor of the Water Tower you wouldn't even know it was there! I happened to stumble in on it after an appointment. Originally, I had ordered a breakfast wrap and then quickly changed my mind after they started it (my bad!), instead of getting all huffy at me they just smiled and took the salad I opted for instead. The salad looked really good and the sales lady said that it was her favorite.... When I got it back to my desk, however, I noticed that it was more the look of the thing than the actual taste. The mix of lettuce was a little bit off because it was quite bitter and they didn't provide enough salad dressing for such a large salad. I was really disappointed because it was after all, a $9 salad! I have to say though, their coffee is EXCELLENT and if I return by there again I'll definitely stop in for a cup of brew. I haven't discounted them yet, if I'm around again will try a sandwich or wrap and see how that pans out.

19.description: So bad. Literally only like four flavors of smoothies (no green) and the juices are pretty limited too. Haven't tried their food but i wasn't too impressed with the selection there either. The smoothie i got (Mango Tango) was watery and bland. I paid almost 7 dollars for it and had to wait nearly 10 min. There are lots of good vegan/vegetarian spots around Chicago but this is sadly not one of them.

1.description: Small location located in the basement of the water tower building but still serves quality food. The employees were also very attentive and nice. I got my usual Pangoa Bowl which is my favorite, but I have yet to try all the items on the menu. The service was fast. I just wish there was more space to eat and to wait for your food if you are taking it out like me. Overall good for a quick bite but don't expect to sit down and enjoy your meal anywhere near here.

2.description: I spent a long time deciding what to get for lunch here, not because the options all seemed really delicious, but rather because I was trying to figure out how to get the best bang for my buck. Juices seem super overpriced at $6 for a 12oz. Most of these salads are also pricey, around $7-8, but don't contain any protein. The burritos are at an even higher price point, and don't contain protein either (unless you pay the extra $1.99 to add in some chicken breast or whatnot). Sure, rice noodles and quinoa and brown rice are all gluten free, but carbs are carbs and are going to be caloric anyway, so I don't see the need to hide behind a facade of selling healthy food. What kind of shoddy business model is this?I got myself an $8~ Baja Burrito (which took far too long to make) and was at least happy to find a fat piece of avocado in my burrito. I thought it would make up for the fact that there wasn't any protein, until I learned that the one piece of avocado was the ONLY piece of avocado in my burrito. The other 2/3 was just quinoa and salsa, wrapped in a tortilla. What a disappointment. You can do much better with Chipotle.

9.description: I used to come in here for my smoothies with the Hispanic guy but ever since he is gone. The family that works there is the worst. The gave a WARM smoothie!!! It always watery and they get mad at you if you ask them to do it again. The young lady is incredible rude to every customers and she has no manners whatsoever. I'm not going back there, let's see how the 900 building treats me. $7 smoothies shouldn't be watery or warm.

6.description: Had the mango tango smoothie. It was delightful. Loved whatever kind of yoghurt they used. Don't think I'd give the rest of menu a try though. A little pricey for the kind of "healthy" food that is normally too bland to enjoy.

18.description: Worse soup I've ever had in my lifetime.  Tasteless, no seasoning and bland.  It was just hot sink water with raw vegetables.  At least add the veggie stock or a tomato based sauce.  Better yet, the cook should taste it before the customer does to ensure there is flavor.

10.description: Yes please!Build your own bowls with lots of options and fresh ingredients. Check.Service is polite and fast. Check.Prices are not crazy. Check.Seating in the little nook right outside. Check.Proximity to shopping and other fun stuff. Check.BONUS: If you work in the 600 West Chicago building, the shuttle will drop you off RIGHT outside and pick you up as well. It's great for a fast, healthy lunch.

13.description: I visited my gf in Chicago and she goes here often since it's right around the corner from her place. I love that it tries to serve "healthy" things but they definitely went way too far with that. Everything was bland and disgusting. I got the bliss bowl, spicy lemongrass soup and the spinach and goat cheese wrap. The bliss bowl had no flavor and they're very stingy on the veggies which is ridiculous for the amount they charge. The wrap was gross. The soup was the only thing that had flavor but it was way too sour and just done completely wrong. Freshii has definitely become a joke between my gf and I. Can't believe I wasted a meal at this place.

16.description: Visiting Chicago, and I needed a quick breakfast, so I went to the nearest breakfast place. I got the Ranchero Classic breakfast burrito, as well as a Green Refresher juice. The burrito was tasty as well as filling, and the juice was also very good, reminding me a bit of New York juices. All in all, a good meal. Nice!

17.description: I love Freshii. There was a Freshii I frequented in Toronto that was just so fantastic. So I was super excited when I noticed this Freshii across the street from my hotel. What a disappointment. Gloomy service. Tasteless and dry burrito. Spicy, flavorless bowl. And if you're going to insist on packing everything to go, wouldn't you include cutlery? Or a napkin? I know, I know, ultimately my own fault. But I'm feeling especially bitter about it as I eat my spicy, flavorless bowl trough-style because I am that classy. And that hungry.

15.description: The Freshii at Water Tower Place is a fantastic place for healthy food. I ordered Mango Tango smoothie. So amazed to be served with a freshly made within 2 minutes. I was of the opinion that it will take longer, but they were the fastest I have seen in quick served joints. I will be definitely visit again.

0.description: My green juice was not that good..little water down taste. Not worth of $7.50 I was looking forward to it..but disappointed.

5.description: I am super upset as I was expecting a vegan soup, after eating half of it and calling them they said that the broth is no more vegan and its chicken broth! yeah just great, thanks for letting your customers know, its no where on the main online menu how can that be, when they run a healthy restaurant is the number one thing they must do is to mark what ingredients are where! disgusting, so disappointing.

11.description: Looking for a quick breakfast, we arrived at Freshii at around 10:00 AM (the store was just opening). Ordered a #Lifesupport juice, and a Spinach and Goat Cheese egg pocket. The juice was a pretty bland; nothing special. However, the egg pocket was quite tasty; something I would definitely come back for. The person taking out order and making our food was very nice. Food took about 5 minutes; there were 2 other orders in (from the people I was with), and there was and a line out the door when I left. Another employee eventually arrived as well, which I assume would make things faster. I would recommend Freshii for a fast, healthy meal, but it's not something you should go out of your way to get (it just happened to be right outside our hotel).

8.description: Nothing special here - the salad I ordered was kinda blah.  I had the fiesta...I think it was the salad dressing though.  I just felt like trying this place out and now that I have, I don't think I'd be back.

3.description: First off I was a regular customer, I work in the building and I decided to become vegan seeing that they offer options for non meat eaters I ordered the vegan chilli and avocado wrap each day. I decided to order the chilli again and got half way done and saw a white bug in my bowl. I went back to them and showed them the bug and even asked them for a cup of water so that we can see it better. The manager and a regular employee looked at it and said no it not. I said clearly it has tentacals and legs. She took it out and rolled it around between her two fingers and said no it's not. I said you wouldn't know it was now since you've made it unrecognizable!!! At this point I was nearly in tears knowing I almost ate this bug and seeing that they were insulting me. I was offered a bag of chips for my troubles. I will never go back.

14.description: I love freshii, cheap healthy food and they don't make it too hard to see what everything is made up of. Love the burrito with bbq sauce. Everything on their menu can be customized to taste and rice and other grains can be replaced with quinoa for a more filling option. The reason I knocked it a star is about two years ago all freshii restaurants kept their price the same but removed the meat from the item and instead made it a cost item to add. I still think it is priced moderately well but it is hard to get over knowing I am buying the same thing for a few more bucks than I was prior.

4.description: If you have time to wait 10-15 minutes for something simple to eat, then Freshii is for you. They have horrible service; they are rude and take forever. Customers are not their first priority by any means. Wouldn't waste your time or money on this place.

3.description: We  were in Chicago for a wedding over Labor Day and my husband hurt his ankle. Fortunately, we discovered Carnegie Sargent's and were grateful that it was open on a Saturday. Mark Paley spent a great deal of time with my husband and recommended just the right type of ankle brace and crutches that worked like a charm. I wish we had this type of personal service in our town. An added bonus was that I walked by Walgreen's later and discovered that crutches were more expensive there than we had paid at Carnegie Sargents! Thanks, Mark!

1.description: Terrible place. Will not go back. They do not stand behind the products they sell and will not refund your money under any circumstance. Watch out for Mark Paley he has a temper and will unleash it on you if you question his refund policy. Also he told his employee to "use your words" and treated him like a piece of trash. Seems like a great place to work.

2.description: What a hidden gem inside the Hancock building!  If you need to rent a wheelchair in the city, this pharmacy is your place; CANNOT beat the $10/ day rate. In addition, the quality, the peacefulness of the store, and customer service are unmatchable down on the ground level of Michigan Ave.  We had a quick issue with our rental that the manager dis not hesitate to assist us (we already had our hands full with an 85 year old in a walking town) with a replacement chair or anything they could do to accommodate. Thank you!

5.description: The only good thing I have to say about this place is that it had the Coverlet bandages that I needed.  Tge pharmacist (or worker that was there) was in the phone.  It was clearly a personal call.  We waited for a second because we wanted to ask a question, but just looked for what we wanted on our own.  Then checking out, this guy was still on his personal call and pointed to the price in the register.  He finally got off the phone and was just rude.  Maybe arrogant is the bettwr word.  No, I will not go back and no, I won't recommmend this place.

6.description: It's nice that there's a pharmacy so close to my work. I don't have any particular problems with the owner or its staff. They seem nice enough. What I did have a problem with though, is that I'm pretty sure I didn't have to pay out of pocket for my meds, and they didn't want to go through the trouble of confirming with my insurance, so I had to pay out of pocket for my meds. All they did was xerox a copy of my insurance card and sent me on my way. Guess where I'm going from here on out? Walgreens. They have my insurance information in their database, and they know whether I should be charged for a co-pay or not.

7.description: Potentially I had a bad experience here- but I'll never return. I recently broke my finger and the hand surgeon and occupational therapist I go to is right around the corner. They suggested I come to this pharmacy to pick up some supplies for post-surgical maintenance. Anyway- I came in here with this newly broken finger expecting some sympathy and help as I was unfamiliar with some of the products on my shopping list, I was nervous, I was emotional and I was alone. Not only were they all cold and heartless but they were SO VERY rude that I am upset with myself for even giving them my money. The guy running things was a real jerk. I would never ever return nor would I ever recommend anyone I care about come here or spend their money here. Walgreens is on every street corner and they are kind, compassionate, and helpful. I'd rahter give Walgreens my hard-earned money!

8.description: TERRIBLE PLACE - Returned an unopened item one hour later - was rudely told that wasn't possible.  There are many better places to receive appropriate service - e.g. any Walgreens, CVS.  One might question why they are in business.

9.description: I had a fabulous experience at Carnegie Sargents Pharmacy. My husband was recently in a car accident and it has been very difficult for us to find a suitable walker for his needs. I have heard wonderful things about not only the pharmacy, but more specifically the owner Mark, from friends, who referred us to Carnegie. This pharmacy is very welcoming and I was impressed at the selection of products they had. Mark was very attentive and made me feel like I could really count on him. With Mark's help, we were able to get the perfect walker. We have been going to Carnegie ever since our first time there, and I truly have nothing but positive things to say about Mark and his staff. We have gone to the pharmacy with some tricky requests and Mark has done whatever it takes to get my husband and I what we need. Mark- thank you! You're a life saver!

0.description: Mark, the pharmacist, has always taken the time to answer my various questions about over the counter medications as well as enlighten me about the various factors to think about when I was considering a potential transition from a brand to a generic version of a medication. I feel like he really cares and I have rarely felt that way when dealing with the large pharmacies. For example, I mentioned an issue with a family member who might be in need of some home care (out of state) and he provided me with the resources to find qualified care personnel, even though it would bring no revenue to their business. Both Matt and Derek know me by name and are always kind and courteous. For a nominal fee, I have often arranged to have my prescription picked up from my doctor, filled and delivered to my home. Now that is great service!I can't say enough about the team. I feel like I'm in safe hands and who doesn't enjoy dealing with caring friendly people whilst going about your daily life? If you want personalized caring service, this is the place to go.

4.description: Rude, arrogant. Mark the pharmacist was terrible on the phone, demeaning. I will never buy anything from them again.

58.description: True blues and always worth stopping in. Was here on a Monday and the joint was packed. Lots of fun and really great music on the small stage. Makes you feel like part of the group.

56.description: What a fun place to go out and listen to some awesome blue's music.We showed up around 11:15 and they reduced the cover which was nice. There is a one-drink minimum, but the drinks are pretty fairly priced. The volume was at a great level. Loud enough to lose yourself in the music, but you didn't leave with your ears ringing. I'd definitely recommend this place to a friend.

29.description: Called ahead to see if they were open on July 4th, was told they were open. me and my family cabbed over and a tall skinny bitter door man refused to let us in for no good reason.  Won't be coming back

42.description: A work colleague took our group here. Great blues band, dancing, Etc. It was a classic dive bar, small, stuffy, dirty bathrooms with writing on the walls and killer blues. Perfect for late night fun!

23.description: Great experience. Great music. We had a blast. I will without a doubt return. A really cool part of Chicago.

47.description: Tough to give a good review when the door man doesn't let you in. Though the site says it accepts credit cards, they charge a cash door fee and though I tried to offer to by someone drinks who would then give me cash he wouldn't let me through. He's tall. And he's a dickhead.

8.description: What's a Chicago trip without going to a jazz bar?! The live music was incredible, the crowd loved it. There's a little bit of space in the front for dancing, where you can chill with friends or be intimate with your partner. There is limited seating and it gets super crowded so I would suggest to get there earlier. $10 cover per person. I really enjoyed my time here! Would've given it four stars if it wasn't so crowded... not good for claustrophobic people =X

31.description: Fun place. Great evening.

34.description: Great atmosphere, great music. We went there on a Sunday night. We paid $10 per person as cover price. The drinks were very affordable. They have non-alcoholic drinks as well. We listened to the Nellie Tiger Travis Blues Band. Not only are they fantastic musicians, but also they know how to entertain people.

16.description: We stumbled into this bar and decided to stay despite its $12 cover because it was raining. The place was really intimate and it had a good vibe going. The band came on around 9 and we were blown away with how good they were even though we aren't big fans of the blues. We ended up having a good time and enjoyed our night spent here.

13.description: This has always been one of my favorite places in Chicago! The music is always authentic blues, the drinks are strong, the vibe immediately puts you in a good mood. This place lives out the meaning  "Sweet Home Chicago"

11.description: I am an unabashed fan of this place. Yes, it's a bit of a tourist trap located in River North walking distance from all of the major convention hotels. Yet I've never had a bad time here. The talent onstage is always top notch , the crowd is always receptive and the drinks are always poured with a heavy hand. Reasonable cover charge and friendly waitstaff, this is a great spot to end your evening.

39.description: I'm rating this as 5 stars, with the qualifier that this is a fantastic true blues bar. It is not fancy and in fact it's somewhat of a hole in the wall type of place, but if you want a true blues bar experience, this is it. Great music the night we went, and definitely not an experience I could have back in Boise. Also, I don;t want to scare anyone off with the hole in the wall comment, it's completely clean and a safe environment, it just has the atmosphere of a neighborhood bar.If you have any inclination to go to a blues bar, do not hesitate and just go.

37.description: Wow! We went to three blues places while in Chicago and ended up at the Blue Chicago after dinner, kinda as an after thought, on our last night. What. A. Wonderful. Place. The music was everything Chicago Blues is known for. Not too gospelly, not too jazzy, not too showy, just plain awesome incredibly good entertaining music and singing! We'll return for sure.

0.description: Great for live music!!!!I was really impressed with the band that was performing and the overall vibe of this place. You can tell that the people that perform at this venue as well as the clientele have a passion for the blues.I would definitely come back.

38.description: Authentic.

51.description: Very cool little hole-in-the-wall place! Now I'm probably not the best person to review Blue Chicago, given the fact that we didn't spend much time there seeing as it was the last night of our Chi-town trip.
