But I felt uber-guilty for not having checked out the blues scene at all up until that point so a quick pop in was better than not at all! Our days were just jam packed and we were usually pretty wiped by the time 9:00 PM or so came around, so we just kept putting it off! Man, we're getting old...Anyways, thankfully it was located (conveniently) only steps away from our hotel. Not sure that I would go out of my way to do it or that I'd make a return trip next time I'm in town considering how much there is to do in the city but if you're looking for something to do and like good music and cheap drinks, it's hard to go wrong. Even for an 80s pop-rock aficionado such as myself (I know, I know) it's a great time. We saw The Shirley Johnson Blues Band who were fantastic, though I'm going to go out on a limb and guess that all of their house acts are probably pretty tight. Considering the quality of the talent, the $8.00 cover charge is more than reasonable. The atmosphere is super, exactly what you'd want and expect from a tiny (and it is pretty small!) place like this. Not a lot of space to manoeuver and you're pretty lucky if you get a seat. But it really is the sort of place that you're not going to mind one bit in either event.So I might check out Buddy Guy's next time around or see what my other nightlife options are if we manage to take it a bit easier on the sightseeing! But certainly no hesitation in recommending this place...straight up old school charm.

27.description: The cover is TOTALLY worth it! This place is killer. Great music, great people, great prices. A Chicago classic!

32.description: Forget those "chain" blues places.   Seriously.  This is THE place to go and hear some great music.  The staff is great, and the atmosphere is exactly what it should be. Stop searching, just put down your phone and go.

54.description: Wow!! So this place is super divey/hole in the wall, but pretty awesome. Get there early or you'll have to stand. Luckily we arrived a bit before 8:30p (open at 8p) and were able to get a table/stools close to the stage. They don't serve food, but the bar was full service. My drink of choice wasn't good...the sprite had a very odd and disgusting taste. There was an odor, but it soon went away/wasn't pungent to the point of being annoying. Nillie Tiger Tyler was the artist who performed with her band. It was non stop clapping, dancing and and all around good time. The band ran through covers and some originals. We shared a table with a birthday girl and some of her friends. It was like a family reunion....just good times. Would have loved more of a juke joint feel, but that's my personal preference. I'll be back!

48.description: Perfect. Stopped by yesterday night (monday) from 11:30pm to 2am.First, thought $8 for cover was a bit expensive, but went in anyway. Then ordered a drink and OMG!!! Almost GIVEN!!! $5 tequila sunrise, $2.75 soda.All that with great live music. From Blues to early rock.IN CHICAGO? DONT MISS THIS PLACE!!!

44.description: What's a Chicago trip without going to a jazz bar?! The live music was incredible, the crowd loved it. There's a little bit of space in the front for dancing, where you can chill with friends or be intimate with your partner. There is limited seating and it gets super crowded so I would suggest to get there earlier. $10 cover per person. I really enjoyed my time here! Would've given it four stars if it wasn't so crowded... not good for claustrophobic people =X

24.description: I love this place. A small local bar with a great flavor. I would return. Great place to sitting back and enjoy the music

7.description: This is a small, intimate club that attracts as many tourists as locals (because of its location).  But that doesn't mean it's not a fantastic place to hear authentic Chicago blues.  If you want to see, as well as hear, the show... get there no later than 8:30.  By 9:00, it's standing room only.  The singers are almost always women, and the band last weekend really rocked the place.  I think the cover depends on the singer, we paid $12.  There was no drink minimum.  I ordered a glass of white wine (there was only one choice), and it tasted like vinegar.  The server replaced it with another glass, but it was just as bad.  Cheap wine and great music don't mix.  So what would have been a five star rating is only a four.

49.description: I had a very odd experience here at Blue Chicago. We went on a Thursday night, and the band was good, the singer was legit, and the service was ok and prices were reasonable. However, as I looked around, I saw that the only black people in the club were the bouncer and the band...EVERY person in the club was white. A lot of tourists, looking to hear some blues. In a city with a racial history as fraught as Chicago's, this made me really uncomfortable.

40.description: This is a must stop location for any tourist.  The music is awesome.  There is a very small dance floor but you would expect nothing more than that. We went on a Monday night and the place was packed.

53.description: Good place for Blues on a Fri night!Great live music and cheap drinks as most are $5 (beer & mixed)Awesome dive bar with good servicePlace gets pretty packed after around 9PM...luckily we got there around 8:30 and friends were holding seats for us.FYI...there is a $10 cover charge

30.description: MUD. Too much attitude by bar tender and staff  (these people  are just too cool ) and they try to dictate where you can stand. It made me feel uncomfortable. Awful drinks. Horrible acoustics. t&a beers only.

46.description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Blue Chicago!! I celebrated  my 60th birthday here, fantastic music both nights I was there, yes I went back two days later and the bartender looked at me and said, Gin and Bombay, right? Gotta love that! For me, this is what Chicago is all about, Blues, great bar, fun staff...Make this bar a priority when visiting Chicago!

1.description: My wife and I were in there Windy City celebrating our anniversary. We had a great dinner and then we wanted to hit up some of the city night life and catch some good love music. We used Yelp and found a great LITTLE local spot called Blue Chicago. It was amazing! We arrived about 10 mins before they opened. Good thing we did too because a line began to form behind up pretty quickly. Doors opened and the place packed out in about 30 mins. It's a tiny little spot so you will want to get there early to get a great seat. There is a cover and a two drink minimum on the weekends. The cover was $12 but the live blues band was well worth it! The band playing this night was awesome and they rocked the house. The waitress was very nice and checked on us quite regularly. I would deff recommend this little Gem if your in town.

55.description: A great place to experience some true Chicago blues. It's no frills - The cover charge was only $10. The Tenry John's Blues Band with Miss Claudette played the night we were there and they were very good. Miss Claudette was great. I feel like there are more authentic places to go in Chicago as they were a lot of tourists in attendance. However, It was a great experience none the less!

9.description: What a great time here! This is dive bar type of venue that specializes in Blues music and was put on the map for featuring female blues singers, so cheers to this venue just for that! It isn't that big here, so I wouldn't roll in with a large group, but they definitely try and squeeze in as many people as they can, even with still maintaining a small dance floor toward the front of the room--which definitely gets going even late on a Sunday night when we were there! Clearly a work night/school night doesn't matter for this venue!Drink prices aren't that cheap though and it is a $10 cover usually too, but it is a fun, lively spot, and a good place in the area to see some decent music, some covers sometimes, and if you are lucky, you will see the guitarist go on a super long led zepplin cover where his wireless guitar still functions outside of the bar when he leaves the bar while playing and then comes back ha ha So funny to see in person! This is also a place that clearly has its regulars too which I really like. Some live music venues just sell out but you can tell that people who live around there keep coming back for a reason, and it is those people with their almost secret like handshakes they do once they get inside that make me realize this place is pretty clutch.

26.description: Great lil whole in da wall. Very mixed crowd tourist, local black white green Chinese jew blues soul in there you can feel it. Pretty cheap drinks considering the area. But don't look for the moder decor. Bare roots bar.

25.description: Why did I give this Chicago institution 1 star? Because this is the first bar I have ever been to that charges a ($12) cover AND a 2 drink minimum AND a $20 min for credit cards. Now honestly....maybe im overeacting because id obviously had bought two drinks anyway.  But the sheer fact that they have the 2 drink min sign on the table makes this place feel cheap. What would they have done if I paid the cover,  sat down, and didnt order anything?  And said "oh I don't drink alcohol"- then what? I really wanna know how that conversation would have gone...given that they didnt state the two drink minimum when I came in and paid the cover

12.description: Wow! We went to three blues places while in Chicago and ended up at the Blue Chicago after dinner, kinda as an after thought, on our last night. What. A. Wonderful. Place. The music was everything Chicago Blues is known for. Not too gospelly, not too jazzy, not too showy, just plain awesome incredibly good entertaining music and singing! We'll return for sure.

59.description: Great blues!I took off 1-star because of a) lack of variety on the drinks menu, and b) bathrooms were less than hygienic.Don't let that take anything away from the music they served though. Terrific!

21.description: This is a small, intimate club that attracts as many tourists as locals (because of its location).  But that doesn't mean it's not a fantastic place to hear authentic Chicago blues.  If you want to see, as well as hear, the show... get there no later than 8:30.  By 9:00, it's standing room only.  The singers are almost always women, and the band last weekend really rocked the place.  I think the cover depends on the singer, we paid $12.  There was no drink minimum.  I ordered a glass of white wine (there was only one choice), and it tasted like vinegar.  The server replaced it with another glass, but it was just as bad.  Cheap wine and great music don't mix.  So what would have been a five star rating is only a four.

17.description: Forget those "chain" blues places.   Seriously.  This is THE place to go and hear some great music.  The staff is great, and the atmosphere is exactly what it should be. Stop searching, just put down your phone and go.

10.description: From the Los Angeles area in Chicago for my birthday weekend on Dec 12th.  At dinner we asked our server to recommend a blues bar, he told us about this place.   We didn't know what to expect but this is exactly what we were looking for.  The band was awesome and atmosphere was so chill.  Our server was great, I forgot her name, sorry, I had too many tequila shots by that point , WE LOVED YOU!!!! and the owners talked with us as well.   We plan to go back November 2016, see you then!!!!  HAPPY NEW YEAR!!!!

5.description: What a great place! Inexpensive .. Only $10 cover .. Great music ... Crowd is probably between late 20s to late 50s .. Some local .. Some tourists! Dancing if you like ...

3.description: Waaaay too touristy for me and because of that I would not return.  Very basic drinks (I had Old Fashioneds but don't ask for cherries or oranges!)  Drink prices for the very basic drinks and beers were fair though.  Very small place but they cram you in.  Bathrooms dingy but as another Yelper said, you are there for the music, so use the bathroom quickly and get back to the music!  I'm glad I read that, it helped me look at it a different way, because I really CANNOT UNDERSTAND why any place as popular as this would allow their bathrooms to be so nasty and not invest in upkeep??

35.description: This is the place to be for live blues, great staff and very nice people...definitely a place to go.

19.description: Great night. Great music. Sat in perfect spot (as far as we're concerned) w/back rest. Great waitress (Johnavon or something). Good drinks. Still not wild about $12/head, but it's live jazz, so... Go at least once and make up your own mind. Go ready to sing, shout and dance -- if it's not too crowded. Doors open at 8, get there between 8 and 9:15, otherwise, don't B--- about not getting a seat. You will be seated with a person or two, so be prepared to chat it up. Met a couple from suburb in Oregon who had just moved to Chicago. Seemed cool.

28.description: What a great time here! This is dive bar type of venue that specializes in Blues music and was put on the map for featuring female blues singers, so cheers to this venue just for that! It isn't that big here, so I wouldn't roll in with a large group, but they definitely try and squeeze in as many people as they can, even with still maintaining a small dance floor toward the front of the room--which definitely gets going even late on a Sunday night when we were there! Clearly a work night/school night doesn't matter for this venue!Drink prices aren't that cheap though and it is a $10 cover usually too, but it is a fun, lively spot, and a good place in the area to see some decent music, some covers sometimes, and if you are lucky, you will see the guitarist go on a super long led zepplin cover where his wireless guitar still functions outside of the bar when he leaves the bar while playing and then comes back ha ha So funny to see in person! This is also a place that clearly has its regulars too which I really like. Some live music venues just sell out but you can tell that people who live around there keep coming back for a reason, and it is those people with their almost secret like handshakes they do once they get inside that make me realize this place is pretty clutch.

45.description: Love this place great music and reasonably inexpensive. Great service at the bar; the bartender was hilarious and gave us a couple of free drinks. We went on a Sunday and actually got seats. I can imagine on Friday or Saturday we would not be so lucky!  Great bar; we will be back.

33.description: Great quality blues for value prices.  Cover and drinks.  Very reasonable for River North.  I'm a local, not a tourist.  Reviewer who said no African Americans must be blind.  Full mix of ALL races nightly.  And no, I don't work here.

43.description: Great bands! Good service-  a must visit if you love blues & are in Chicago.  The Baltimore connection- lead singer & guitarist taught at Booker T. Washington in Baltimore!

2.description: Very authentic little blues club! It's tiny so you have to get here early to secure a seat. They open at eight, the band didn't go on until nine, they played for an hour and then took like a 40 minute break. It kind of broke the momentum for me but that was just the band so I can't really fault the club.Unimpressed with the alcohol selection. They offered no wine and even though I asked for a Gray Goose neat it tasted more like bargain vodka to me. 2 drink minimum  that was hard to meet under these circumstances. Uncomfortable stools and the service left little to be desired.All that said, the band was great when they played and the place has an energy that is just plain fun. I would come back.

18.description: Great atmosphere, great music. We went there on a Sunday night. We paid $10 per person as cover price. The drinks were very affordable. They have non-alcoholic drinks as well. We listened to the Nellie Tiger Travis Blues Band. Not only are they fantastic musicians, but also they know how to entertain people.

41.description: The &10.00 cover was worth it!  This place takes you back to the beginning of Rock & Roll.  Very intimate setting for the blues.  As Ferris Buller would say, if you have the means, I would highly recommend it!

52.description: So much Fun...business trip turned fun!  Great time with colleagues.  Must cost this place if you're going Chicago.  Definitely a must....

50.description: If you're visiting Chicago and want to hear some blues - Blue Chicago is awesome on Monday nights!Great band, great vibe, and casual setting.Drinks were good and a lot less than expected or that you'll pay at the surrounding hotels or bars.There is a cover charge but well worth it.Expect to see tourists or other visitors to Chicago - I don't think this is a place where locals go but I may be wrong.  I only went on Monday, 10/20.Have fun!

4.description: Great bar, the bartender was incredibly nice and on point! The music was very on point and the entertainment made the evening very enjoyable. It's a small cozy place to feel the blues, enjoy drinks and unwind.

6.description: Had so much fun here!  Place is small, but has a great atmosphere and music is good. Bought the T shirt!

22.description: We arrived late to standing room only but the bad (Terry Johns and vocalist Claudette Miller) made standing easy...the band was tight, energetic and engaged the packed room.  Blue Chicago is a tiny place...but I loved the intimacy.  We paid cash ($12 each) at the door and there was no minimum (since we weren't seated) but the waitress was great and found us again in the crowd with out order.

15.description: Small typical bar. Music was great and drinks were decent . The bouncer not much of a personality but I guess it has to be that way. We ended up dancing having a great time and walked out .. Wait for it .. Leaving our camera . Did not realize this until the next day . Called the office and went  over the next day at 7:30pm .karma was on our side because after searching for a bit and the manager calling the employees .. He found it behind the bar .. We are so grateful for honest good people in the world . Thank you Blue Chicago!!  and for that honesty you get a 5 star rating!

57.description: Great blues. $8 cover is great. Will be back.

20.description: I always make sure to visit this place whenever I take a trip to Chicago. It gets packed very quickly. I advise coming at 8 to get seats. The servers are lovely and even the bouncer at the door is one of the friendliest I have ever encountered. The atmosphere is fun although I think they should move into a bigger place to accommodate more seats. There are literally people standing from the stage all the way to the back. However I love the different crowds and it's great to dance even with strangers there. Always good memories at this spot.

36.description: A great local place for atmosphere and really brilliant Blues music and singing. If you like the Blues and are on the North side this is the place to go.

14.description: Had such a good time here! This is a smaller place with $12 cover charge, cash and no minimum drink. They do take cards for drinks at the bar. We reached there around 11 and it was standing only but we were able to find a spot at the bar. The setting is very intimate and crowd is a mix of locals and tourists. The music and atmosphere was very good.

0.description: Seriously lame. First of alll, I should have run screaming from the premises when I saw, on the menu, "Reuben . . . with coleslaw" COLESLAW!?!? Seriously? That's not a Reuben!! OY VEY! Or, more likely for my WASP ass to say WTF!!?!!?!?!!Opted for the Chopped Salad. Serious disappointment. A few stringy pieces of lettuce and raddiccio, a couple cherry tomatoes, hard boiled egg and two or three meager shreds of salami. What, WHAT?!! $6.50 and you can't give me a bit more salami? You could see the bottom of the bowl thru the thinning salad tossed in a bowl. Really substandard.Maybe because this is an LA chain - that's what passes for a salad there in the land that invented anorexia? Puzzling.The soups looked sort of appealing, but I'm not likely to go back here at all.If my lunch companion hadn't been so charming, I'd be lobbying to get this hour of my life back. Don't even go here if you're inside Macy's and starving to death. Brave the Foodlife food court before you think of coming here.

58.description: Plethora of food ranging from pizzas to burgers to asian, mexican, italian, bbq and desserts at a very reasonable price keeping in fact that it is downtown. Each time I come in I try something different. Food is always mouthwatering, can't barely ever finish what I order. Smoothie bar is probably my favorite.   It's almost like a buffet, but it's not just, because it has so many options and great aromas associated with the place. Staff could smile a little more tho. Also, they apparently charge 7.5% gratuity fee if you eat inside the restaurant and none if you eat right outside it. Makes no sense, sneaky they don't even tell you that but I noticed it on my receipt. Had to take a star because of that so be aware. Great place for tourists I would say or someone new to chicago if you're looking for something simple.

56.description: I love the idea of a Marketplace food court.  You can tell just by looking around that lots of people are not familiar with the concept, but as soon as we got in, my wife and I both realized how it was almost identical to Mövenpick Marché in Toronto.I was really surprised at the food quality at some of the stations--I wish I would have gone to the BBQ station instead of the Mexican, as the brisket and pulled pork actually looked really, really good.  My daughter got a huge slice of pizza and my wife had a massive baked potato.  My taco plate was huge as well, and really good.It's not cheap--we figured our "food court" lunch would be the cheapest meal of the week, and it turned out to be one of the most expensive.  And the staff is a little too eager to clear the table; we went to get ice cream and came back to a cleared table.  We stole some silverware from another table and finished eating.And while it might seem like a silly complaint, the bathroom setup is really, really dumb.  There's no bathroom in Foodlife; instead they share one with the Mity Nice Bar and Grill next door.  In fact, Water Tower Place as a general rule seems to need a LOT more bathrooms.

29.description: Food is ok if desperate or going to shows nearby. What's up with the loud Abercrombie and Fitch  loud music.? If they are trying to get rid of the old folks and install the new kids, they're making a good start. Turn. Down. The. Music.

42.description: Wow I just love Foodlife.  I was doing a little Christmas shopping and stopped in for a quick dinner.  The food selection is incredible and everything tasted great!  I go the ribs and they were done just right with a tangy sweet BBQ sauce.  I also got the fresh squeezed lemonade with free refills.Price is right and great food!

23.description: Lots of variety here which is the number one plus side of Foodlife! Good place to stop if you're at Water Tower, not like any old food court. There was tons of stuff to choose from, fresh juice bar, pizza, Chinese, Mexican, delicious looking desserts! Another advantage was that is was clean, didn't have to go on a hunt to find a clean table or anything. I decided to get a personal deep dish spinach pizza. The lady working there was nice, got it to me pretty quickly! My sister and mom got food from a Greek-type place I think and apparently there was a huge wait and only one person behind the counter having to everything by herself. Take orders, make the food, everything! So needless to say it took a long time for them to get their food. I had already finished mineThe pizza was ok, crust was really tasty, but it was a bit cold, also there were like big clumps of spinach and I would have preferred it to be spread out more. My sister didn't like her pita too much. She didn't like the type of pita it was served on, whole wheat and it was really chewy. My mom got chicken, rice, and vegetables and liked it. My grandma liked the Chicago-style hot dog she got.One downside was that it was kind of pricey, but I suppose that is to be expected.

47.description: Four stars for variety, but 3.5 stars for the quality of the food. I don't know...I enjoyed my BBQ chicken sandwich quite a bit, but I think there were some tiny crushed up bone chunks in there, so it freaked me out from the start. I had to really pick through it, but the flavor was fantastic and slathered in a sweet sauce. The side of macaroni and cheese was creamy with a few crunchy ends (love), and it was so good I didn't want to share!My boys ended up with personal deep dish pizzas, and the crust was buttery and flaky. Hubby loaded up on a fresh veggie burrito with a side of rice and beans. I tasted the veggies and they were nicely flavored and the burrito was packed. Rice and beans were a little dry, but that didn't matter, because it was all about those greens and good things. Overall good experience and a great value, but later that night we just all felt so overstuffed and like we were going to explode.Come here with an appetite. After 5pm there is a parking discount when you validate your ticket at the cashiers stand (found out the hard way when we came waaaaaay before 5pm).I'd go back for convenience, but I wouldn't go out of my way. The chicken bones really grossed me out - darn!

8.description: I'm not exposed to a lot of comfort food and fancy food courts back home (L.A.) so this is something new to me! The whole experience is interesting since you just get a card that you keep on swiping, and forget about how much you've had...Service is friendly but some of the items are a little pricy for a food court.BBQ pulled pork sandwich, comes with a side of mac n cheese (4/5):The pulled pork was pretty on point. But I wish there's something else in the sandwich besides the pulled port itself. That would add in so many more dimensions of textures and flavors. Mac n cheese was a little cold but the crispy burnt crust was pretty amazing.Tuna Poke Salad (2/5):Don't get this. I got it because i was missing Poke back home. But the tuna is visibly NOT fresh and they made it a little spicy. No.Cinnamon Crepe (5/5):It's a five star crepe. Soft and full of cinnamon. It's just so good!! MUST GET

31.description: Wow, what variety!  Been here a many times.  Whether you are a soup nut, fish taco fan, comfort food lover, bbq addict, burger connoisseur, fresh squeezed juice craver..you get where I'm going, something for everyone.  My last visit (earlier today) included desserts that my treadmill finds me unworthy of endulging.  Crepe with fresh strawberry and real whipped creme (not from a can).  Tonight, I will surely dream of the german chocolate cupcake..I believe the ratio was 30% cake and 70% heavenly topping.

34.description: I don't hate all of Food life. The rib station for example is great. And the people at the choose your own stir fry are equally great. In fact, my only issue is really always an ongoing problem with the salad station and the fact that they hate their station or me or my choice in toppings or something. It is always understaffed at this station as well. The line takes forever. The eye rolling is a constant. I am paying $14 dollars for a salad. And more than once have been berated. Today I got my hand slapped for pointing at an egg. If you don't like people work from home. Three strikes you're out Food life.

16.description: So glad that they have big bowl- for a LOT less than big bowl's prices! I had the kung pao chicken and the lady working was an absolute sweetheart. The card system reminds me of Vapiano, and this is a pretty cool idea for a food court!However, the hostess was completely rude and made me nearly turn around and go eat somewhere else.

13.description: I recently hosted a training for 70 people with a variety of different food and dietary preferences. We brought our group to Foodlife and it was great! Not only did everyone have their own choice of what they wanted, but the restaurant managed everything super well and our dinner ran so smoothly. Highly recommend this as an option for large group dinners when you want everyone to have delicious food options!

11.description: Lots of variety here which is the number one plus side of Foodlife! Good place to stop if you're at Water Tower, not like any old food court. There was tons of stuff to choose from, fresh juice bar, pizza, Chinese, Mexican, delicious looking desserts! Another advantage was that is was clean, didn't have to go on a hunt to find a clean table or anything. I decided to get a personal deep dish spinach pizza. The lady working there was nice, got it to me pretty quickly! My sister and mom got food from a Greek-type place I think and apparently there was a huge wait and only one person behind the counter having to everything by herself. Take orders, make the food, everything! So needless to say it took a long time for them to get their food. I had already finished mineThe pizza was ok, crust was really tasty, but it was a bit cold, also there were like big clumps of spinach and I would have preferred it to be spread out more. My sister didn't like her pita too much. She didn't like the type of pita it was served on, whole wheat and it was really chewy. My mom got chicken, rice, and vegetables and liked it. My grandma liked the Chicago-style hot dog she got.One downside was that it was kind of pricey, but I suppose that is to be expected.

39.description: Good lord, what a whopper of a food court right on level M of Water Tower Place.  From the funky killer glass elevators like sci fi-ish and fast.  Great friendly staff and ample seating with superior people watching.  Fresh hot pizza with a great crust (not deep dish) but real Chicago style...

37.description: Went to foodlife for Wine Down. Wine down was great- but mostly because the wine reps where awesome, knowledgable winos like the rest of us. Foodlife however- is a very different story. We decided to stick around for convenience and it turned into anything but. They wouldn't let us order wine because we were from Wine Down. The workers were also extremely slow and the managers were more concerned with apparent rif raf to care about customers who don't require cops.Bottom line. They need to do some re-evaluating. Keep the customers who just want to spend money. Only makes business sense? Used to life Food life but won't be returning anytime soon

0.description: M burger .  Really good Pull pork.  Mac and cheese , mashed pot , really good Stir fry.  Was very blend Oatmeal cookie. Really good  Good service

38.description: Great food. Such an awesome concept being able to sample multiple different cuisines all in one evening. Highly recommend!

51.description: Its my first time eating here in a couple of  years and now I remember why I stayed away: $16 for two slices of pizza and two sodas?  $14 for a skimpy plate of sesame chicken, rice, two pot stickers and a soda?  Yep...the prices are just way too high for what you get.

27.description: I liked the food so so f**n much I really enjoyed the deep dish pizza and the crib ow my gad

32.description: This is a food court located in the Water Tower building on Michigan Ave., in the same building where Oprah's condo is located. Foodlife offers several different kinds of food (Italian, Chinese, BBQ, Pizza, etc.) in the food court and they have a sit down restaurant in the back. Overall, the food is pretty standard. The BBQ place isn't too bad. If you catch them on a good day, try the beef brisket sliders. They also have a massive loaded baked potato bar and I mean massive baked potato. The main drawback about this food court is that is has a very dark and dungeon-ness feel about it. They have these bright spot lights throughout, but it doesn't do any justice. I actually think the food might taste better if they brought some light to the area.

54.description: I really like this place. It's nice the food court at Water Tower place has a healty option to choose from. Usually I sample the hot food bar. I love the sweet potatoes and the catfish. There is also a salad bar, frozen meals you can prepare later, desserts, and fresh fruits to choose from. On my recent visit I got the seaweed salad and it was pretty good. I usually take my meals to go, but they have a little bar and a few tables of seating in case you want to dine in. Great option to try after a relaxing day of shopping.

48.description: When your dogs are tired from shoppin, this is the perfect spot for a quick bite, or a full meal.   I would call it an upscale food court.  I would give it five stars, but for a first timer, it can be confusing.   You are given a card when you go in and assigned seating if dining in.   I like that because who wants to stand around holding your food waiting for a table to open up.  Then you can go to any of the venders and pick out what you want to eat.    Salad bar, soup bar, pasta, burgers, and much more.   When you order your food, the amount is swiped onto your card and you pay when you leave.   No need to clean up the table, there are people that will bus the table for you.   Maybe a bit pricey, but hey, you're on Michigan Avenue in Water Tower Place!   A great place in my opinion.

44.description: Lots to choose from, and I do mean lots. Enjoyed the Chicken Milanese special with green beans. Light and delicious meal. Crowded but didn't have to wait long.

24.description: I'm a big fan of LYE restaurants and being on the Mag Mile I decided to stop by the food court at Water Tower Plaza to check out Foodlife. Overall, I was disappointed. Mostly it was just the people working that made the whole experience underwhelming. Every one of the employees did not seem properly trained or interested in their task. The people cleaning the tables cleaned your "reserved" table before you are done. At the "stir fry" station the workers never called out when your order was ready, and if they did, you wouldn't hear them anyway because the music was too loud. A PA system would be useful for this. I saw other patrons annoyed at the same things that bother me. A lady at a table near me waited 20 minutes for her food, she came up to the counter and asked for her order and the man told her, "oh it's over there, it was ready like a while ago".I had a chicken stir-fry and it was over-sauced, salty, and too sweet. I would compare it to "Pei Wei" style, but the veggies seemed less fresh. The drink selection was decent, with a noteworthy assortment of iced teas. If I were to come again I would try "GRILL", which is a station where you can get grilled fish and other meats.The value is terrible. For two stir-fry dishes, two sodas, and a dessert the total was over $38. You can get much better food for this cost elsewhere and I'm certain better service even at McDonald's down the street.

7.description: I ve said this before this place is great, very clean, many different choices of entrees, and the music is just right, plus its a good people watching place. I had the Chicken Parmesean over pasta with a side of Italian sausage, the pasta was good with a nice garlic flavor, but i think you should ask for an extra scoop of gravy that would make it just right, the Chicken  was tasty, the itslian sausage was very good with the right amout of spice, i cant wsit to come back and try the stir fry section

49.description: Bring your wallet, this is a high end food court. The food is pretty good, but if your a first timer you won't get much directions, at least I didn't. The salad station is my favorite but there is plenty to choose from.

40.description: This food court concept is time consuming, you need to line up in 3 lines (1 to get seated, 1 to order your food and 1 to pay at the end) instead of the 1 of the traditional food court setting. The salad bar within the food court has amazing tasting fresh salads where you choose your ingredients ($14 each including tax) however the customer service is quite poor - extremely slow and service without a smile which I think is mostly a cause of them usually being understaffed. They serve people who just pop up to the sushi bar before the people that have been waiting in the salad line for a while. If you can put up with poor service, these salads are amazing!

53.description: A food court located in Water Tower Place is not your ordinary food court.  There is something for EVERY taste.  My friend, his 12-year-old grandson, and I dropped almost $60 bucks there one evening.  We had soup, sushi, pasta, the best chicken schnitzel and mashed potatoes, and we still hadn't sampled everything.  The smells coming from the various food stations were amazing.  Everything was fresh, hot and delicious.  They have a great system for paying -- you are given a card when you come in.  Each food stations will swipe your card and then you pay on the way out.  Will definitely recommend this to everyone.

30.description: Foodlife is a great option for lunch or dinner.  They have every type of food from burritos, to pasta, to baked potatoes, to bbq, to Chinese, to sushi, to kababs, etc.  I have never had anything here that I didn't like. It has a cafeteria feel but is still upscale and the food does not disappoint.  My favorite thing to order lately are the chicken kabobs and lemon rice. mmm!

46.description: Just had an amazing evening at the food life in water tower place! They have a wine tasting event the first Friday of the month, 20 wines for $20!!! Also free appetizers! It was my first time going and had a great time..., they also have $30 for the wine tasting and all you can eat.. I recommend it!! Is a cheap date.We got dinner at the chinese grill place at the food life and it was great. Even if you don't want to go, give it a try the first Friday of the month for the wine tasting event

1.description: ***I have to give Foodlife credit. After posting my original review, they contacted me twice asking if I would let them reconcile the situation. I didn't take them up on it, because I just didn't enjoy the experience and don't think I would even if they were 100%. But your experience may vary - and the line in my original review about how they don't care if you eat there clearly isn't true.Still, in the words of Yelp: "I've experienced better."

55.description: Great salad bar and friendly staff! Eat there every weekend!

9.description: The variety of the food is a plus and is worth checking out if you're looking for a lunch option. However, the price for what you get in the food and the overall quality is just okay. Think of a cafeteria with just average food.

26.description: I was in the area for a conference and visited this place due to yelp reviews.  It was grear that there were so many food place to choose from, but unfortunately I was not impressed.  The food was good, prices were ok, but not the best (worthy of 5 stars). It works for individuals who want something different or new experience.

25.description: Decisions, decisions.....So many options.  When you get there they give you a card to have swiped---I thought it was a little weird to tell me that everyone needed a card to exit---even if nothing was purchased--but I suppose understandable. Not sure if they have problem with folks running away...We weren't really wowed by the food, but I suppose if you're hungry, in the area, it's sufficient. We had the pasta station and the BBQ station--nothing stellar.

12.description: 1.-After waiting for almost 10min at the meat station for someone to serve us, trying to get some pulled pork the guy tolds us there wasnt any.2.- the pasta was plain and flavorless and the guy giving us attitude while attending us.3.- the chinese food (kungpao chicken n rice) was awful and plain.The only reason that im giving 2 stars is because the parmesan chicken was good. But i wont be back ever again.

59.description: Restaurant update:With another season of the LEYE summer scratch off coupon I journeyed back for another quick meal. I keep on forgetting how overpriced the meal is here. You can select from a pizza, crepe, italian, mexican, sushi, salad, fried food, smoothie, bbq/comfort food, chinese, and soup station. I somehow always end up selecting something that is not worth it. This time it was the chicken milanese that comes with a side of vegetables, no noodles This is 10.99 before tax and the 8% service charge. The food was good but you could probably get this for 4 dollars cheaper at a fast food italian restaurant . Oh well lesson learn.

21.description: My two starts go to that lady that made me a special sundae with both caramel AND strawberry, but I'm taking the rest of the three stars because that guy at the Chinese food area served the large man in front twice as much food as me, wth?! And I didn't get my neighbor employee discount because the machine was down, and they charge themselves gratuity. :/

17.description: I wish all malls came with the Foodlife option.  Located in the lower level of Water Tower Place, this food court type restaurant has a little bit of everything.On entering, each member of the party is given a swipe card, and then seated.  There are a number of different food stations, and you create your own meal, swiping your card with the attendant at each station.  It makes splitting tabs much easier, since everyone has their own card.The food choices here are widely varied.  Soups, a salad bar, home style comfort food, sushi, stir fry, BBQ, hot dogs, tacos, burritos, and deserts from sweet crepes and gelato to huge baked goods.  My personal favorite station has giant baked potatoes with your choice of broccoli, two cheeses, bacon, butter, sour cream, and green onions.  I barely can finish a loaded potato.  The soup station has a very tasty gumbo, and the giant German chocolate cupcake was also a big hit.All prices are clearly marked at each station, and they have a small beer and wine selection as well.  Service at each station is always friendly, and the tables are always quickly cleared of plates.

10.description: This experience was..weird.The concept is this: the hostess gives you a card; you go around the different food stations and order and they put your orders on the card; and at the end, you give the card to the cashier who then rings you up.The weird part was - it really felt like an airport food court. Kind of like a slightly prettier mall food court but with airport food court prices. I love Lettuce Entertain You restaurants (mostly because I love me some points), but the food at all the stations just seemed overpriced and mediocre. The whole time, I just wanted to go next door to foodease and give the hostess my card back.The other weird thing is that M Burger is built where half of it is "outside" (where any mall patron can visit), and half of it is "inside" (only for foodease guests). The weirdness was trying to get an M Burger employee's attention (as most of their business was on the "outside" portion of the mall) and then them scrambling to ring me up because they temporarily forgot that they aren't supposed to take my money but rather scan the Foodlife card.

5.description: A required stop for me every time I'm in Chicago, for one very special item - the cinnamon crêpe at the Magic Pan station inside Foodlife.  The Magic Pan once had locations in various parts of the country, but they're down to two right now - one at Foodlife, and the other in the Mall of America - so when the opportunity presents itself to have one of their crêpes, you have to go for it.  Nicely browned, perfect consistency, what I guess to be 1/8 stick of butter, and some excellent whipped cream. Get it à la mode, along with an Intelligentsia coffee from Sacred Grounds, then kick off your tour of Michigan Avenue.BTW, for those of you in DC, a Magic Pan location is slated to open in the B Concourse of DCA... yay!

3.description: Hmmmm. Not quite sure what to make of this little food market / buffet.Well, I used my 'gold-card' and plumped for a safe soup, it was bland but edible.I just didn't get the whole card malarkey and felt like a caged animal once I'd decided to venture in though.Odd. Very odd.

35.description: So I've been back a few more times to find better service. I suggest waiting and asking someone to explain how it works. I will continue to go here and bring family n friends.

19.description: Just had an amazing evening at the food life in water tower place! They have a wine tasting event the first Friday of the month, 20 wines for $20!!! Also free appetizers! It was my first time going and had a great time..., they also have $30 for the wine tasting and all you can eat.. I recommend it!! Is a cheap date.We got dinner at the chinese grill place at the food life and it was great. Even if you don't want to go, give it a try the first Friday of the month for the wine tasting event

28.description: Extremely good variety of food, from soups to fish to baebeque, catering to vegetarians alike. Thai and Chinese and Italian cuisine available too, and the quality of food is generally pretty good. This was my 3rd time here and I just keep coming back. Especially nice location if you are out shopping.

45.description: The only times I come here is when I'm craving their crepes. I've tried their various dishes but none of them left behind the desire to come back EXCEPT for their crepes. Last week I went just for their Nutella crepe and dude... I died..

33.description: I wish all malls came with the Foodlife option.  Located in the lower level of Water Tower Place, this food court type restaurant has a little bit of everything.On entering, each member of the party is given a swipe card, and then seated.  There are a number of different food stations, and you create your own meal, swiping your card with the attendant at each station.  It makes splitting tabs much easier, since everyone has their own card.The food choices here are widely varied.  Soups, a salad bar, home style comfort food, sushi, stir fry, BBQ, hot dogs, tacos, burritos, and deserts from sweet crepes and gelato to huge baked goods.  My personal favorite station has giant baked potatoes with your choice of broccoli, two cheeses, bacon, butter, sour cream, and green onions.  I barely can finish a loaded potato.  The soup station has a very tasty gumbo, and the giant German chocolate cupcake was also a big hit.All prices are clearly marked at each station, and they have a small beer and wine selection as well.  Service at each station is always friendly, and the tables are always quickly cleared of plates.

43.description: Out all the times that I've visited Water Tower Place, I've never eaten here until this trip. It was fabulous! I love all the options and I thought using the re-charge card was a great idea too. I had the strawberry banana crêpe and it was amazing. My daughter said the smoothies were fabulous. The pizza is always good. I had had the pizza before in the food court. The pierogies were outstanding. And the mac & cheese tasted just like homemade. I can't wait to go back and eat there again

2.description: Hmmm...Foodlife.  I have somewhat mixed feelings about this place.  When we visit family living in downtown, they always want to go here.  Would I choose it if it was just my wife and I?  No, probably not.  Am I annoyed to go here with family?  Not really.  They food is fairly standard.  Expensive, though.  Their main selling point is choice.  You can go with family who has many different tastes and each get something you want.  I usually always go to the Asian 'stands'. Fairly good, if simple and unimaginative food.  BIg, loud, and kinda 'weird' atmosphere.  You get a card at the start, and 'pay' at each location with it.  You then pay for everything at the end by turning in your card.  Seems like its a way to get you to buy more things with a 'credit card' mentality.

18.description: Foodlife is a great choice when going out with a big group. There's a wide variety of food, it's well priced, and you don't have to worry about splitting the check. The food is pretty okay. Their caramel banana crepes + strawberries are magic.

41.description: I love going to this place when I'm in the city. Great good options, awesome concept and always hits the spot. I brought my boyfriend for his first time and he loved it just as much as I did.

52.description: This re-imagined take on a mall food court is fun and interesting and just a tad confusing, at least to this first timer.  foodlife is the restaurant and within that space are 14 stand- alone food stalls, including kitchens for stir fry, pasta, barbeque, salads, taqueria, comfort food, sushi, soup and juice to name a few.When you enter, a host takes you to a table and flips a card on a stand to reserve it.  You also receive a foodlife card and when you decide what food stall you're ordering from, your order is swiped onto the card.  It's swiped again at the exit where you pay.  Note that a not unreasonable 7.5% service charge is added to your tab.They advertise that they serve real food made from scratch and the food certainly looks like it.  I settled on an individual deep dish pepperoni pizza, because I hadn't tried that iconic Chicago dish yet.  But the barbeque kitchen looked terrific as did the taqueria stall.  My pizza was good considering the pie was pre-prepared and warmed in an oven for a few minutes.  There was lots of great tasting tomato sauce but it seemed skimpy on the pepperoni.  Maybe it's a Chicago thing, but the pizza I had in Chicago all seemed to skimp on toppings.foodlife is a cute concept, trendy, and the food looks fresh and tempting.  I almost returned for a second visit, something I'll definitely do on my next trip to Chicago.  The concept gets 4* but until I try more items, I give the food 3*.

50.description: This is a pretty awesome concept. Get a card to charge all your food and choose from their many different options. They have so many choices for what type of food you may want to eat. I just had some mashed potatoes and some macaroni & cheese, but it was pretty good.The people were really nice. The girl that seated us made sure we knew how it all worked and answered our questions. And the man that gave me my food had such a big, friendly smile on his face. That made the experience pretty great.It's a little pricey to me, but at least the food and service were good.

4.description: My fiancee and I stopped in here for a quick lunch and we really liked it here. This is a great little place that has a wide variety of food and is conveniently located. The quality of the food is actually very good as well and you get good portions. We were very pleasantly surprised overall and would definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a quick meal!

6.description: Think of Foodlife as fine dining in a cafeteria or a food court on steroids. There are food stations everywhere. You are handed a plastic card upon entering and whenever you get a dish or item, the server swipes the card. We both had unlimited bowls of fresh hearty homemade soups. There were so many varieties to choose from. This place is much more than we expected. It's located in the vertical mall Water Tower Place. When you are finished eating, take the card to the cashier. No need to leave a tip for the person cleaning the table - a modest 7% is added to your total.

22.description: I go here, when I am looking for a little of everything. It has so many different cuisines from all over- Mexican, Chinese, Pizza, and American to name a few. It is such a cool place. The food is great, and I love the salmon they have.

15.description: Four stars for variety, but 3.5 stars for the quality of the food. I don't know...I enjoyed my BBQ chicken sandwich quite a bit, but I think there were some tiny crushed up bone chunks in there, so it freaked me out from the start. I had to really pick through it, but the flavor was fantastic and slathered in a sweet sauce. The side of macaroni and cheese was creamy with a few crunchy ends (love), and it was so good I didn't want to share!My boys ended up with personal deep dish pizzas, and the crust was buttery and flaky. Hubby loaded up on a fresh veggie burrito with a side of rice and beans. I tasted the veggies and they were nicely flavored and the burrito was packed. Rice and beans were a little dry, but that didn't matter, because it was all about those greens and good things. Overall good experience and a great value, but later that night we just all felt so overstuffed and like we were going to explode.Come here with an appetite. After 5pm there is a parking discount when you validate your ticket at the cashiers stand (found out the hard way when we came waaaaaay before 5pm).I'd go back for convenience, but I wouldn't go out of my way. The chicken bones really grossed me out - darn!

57.description: Awesome comfort food for a cold day. Ive never been to Chicago in the summer so I'm not sure what the spread is like for the warmer months. I repeatedly eat here when I visit because the food is so good. The pay card setup work well too.

20.description: Been here twice now and each time it's been very good. They have anything you're in the mood for. I've tasted the pizza, soup, pasta, ice cream. It's always delicious and the prices are reasonable. $25 for two and we got a lot of food, pro rate for 3...too many good choices! Very clean too. Will definitely be back.

36.description: Ok so i felt like i was being punked. After spending  850.00 in 10 min i thought to get food from here..so after  waiting to get mexican food,the guy tells us that the cook is not making anymore steak..we were standing there forever for him to just now have told us that. So then we go to comfort  food section and i asked the gentleman  when their chicken would be ready and he says verbatim "whenever I'm  done frying it". I looked at him with hopes that he was joking..He was dead serious. I walked away in disbelief.then i settled for a hot dog which was suppose to come on a poppy seed  bun.. uhm no...the lady who waa making my food acted as if she didnt want to be bothered... omg i live for great service. I reward and compliment great  customer service all the time like leaving 30 buck tips on 20 buck bills...so when i get shitty service from ppl it boils my brain... going there was a big mistake..never again

14.description: Decisions, decisions.....So many options.  When you get there they give you a card to have swiped---I thought it was a little weird to tell me that everyone needed a card to exit---even if nothing was purchased--but I suppose understandable. Not sure if they have problem with folks running away...We weren't really wowed by the food, but I suppose if you're hungry, in the area, it's sufficient. We had the pasta station and the BBQ station--nothing stellar.

29.description: "Yay! I'm a fan" of these bras. For some reason, they always fit me really well and are also well-made, which never hurts when you're paying for higher end, uh, undergarments. Seriously, though, I swear by these bras (Yep, it's TMI Saturday!). 5 star bras....But -1 star for attitude. Of course, whichever VS you decide to patronize, the sales girls (I've never seen a man working here) are snooty at worst and intrusive at best. I guess the Chicago Water Tower location is a key exemplar of this trend. First of all, just like at Sephora, saleswomen wear high-tech in-ear pieces as if they're secret service agents and the next world war will be fought over lingerie. Puh-lease. The best part is when you walk up to the counter with your new bra(s) and a credit card dreading the purchase thereof. The saleswomen ask if you want an Angels Card. It's like free and gives you discounts so just fill in these fourteen pages and give us all of your information and clutter your wallet OMG!!!1 You'll probably say no thanks at this point, but as much as that's enough for most store clerks/humans in general, that isn't enough for them and they will have to ask you multiple times b/c you obvz haven't thought this thru enuf!!111. I'm not a very assertive person at all, but I get a chance to work on being extra-assertive when I go here, so I guess that's a plus.

42.description: This is my favorite Victoria's Secret because te service is good and the availability of items are better than the Victoria's Secret across the street. There is all kinds of sales promotions going on all the time and in Water Tower, you can't go wrong with the location. The Pink clothing line is a really good line, but the bras aren't as good as the other lines in the store. Body by Victoria's Secret has the best fitting bras for all sizes.

23.description: Helpful staff.  The merchandise is specialized so it is easy to find something you like.  They have sales very often.

8.description: The store is nice and I was impressed by their vast selection of items, but as mentioned in other reviews the sales people here are extremely pushy.I came here with my mom for Mothers Day shopping and within 30 seconds, two separate sales girls had given us their spiel about the Body by Victoria being on sale. I immediately went to that section and found my bras, only to be asked by another sales girl if I needed a fitting room, to be sized, etc. I told her no thank you and she asked my bra size - if I already said I didn't need to be fitted, why would she need to know that? Then she tried to sell me on their strapless; I told her I already have 3 and didn't need another.Cut to the sports bras section where I was bombarded by a sales girl who immediately recommended their most expensive line, which have underwire in them for extra support. I told her I did not want a sports bra with an underwire and drifted away to the selections I was actually interested in. Another sales girl approached and said, "You don't want an underwire?" FOR THE LOVE OF GOD PLEASE LEAVE ME ALONE!I think next time I'll brave the crowds at their flagship store; at least there it will hopefully be too busy for the sales people to bother me.

31.description: The funny thing about Victoria's Secret is that the associates pounce on you when you come into the store . . . but ask them about something that's not one of the bras that they are practically shoving down people's throats (e.g. Biofit) and . . . NOBODY KNOWS!  It's truly bizarre.  The associates are like the scripted customer service representatives in other countries . . . take them off of their sales script and they are totally lost!  It's extremely annoying.  Don't ask me if you can help me when you can't! Add to that a VERY awkward and unsettling experience:  My young daughter and I went into the store one night and as I looked through the lingerie, an associate asked me if she could help me.  I told her that I did not need help and thanked her for the offer.  She proceeded to leave -- only to come right back and loudly ask me if I knew my bra size.  Without looking up, I told her that I did.  She waited and then aggressively (and loudly) asked, "Well, what is it?"  At that point, I almost lost it.  I am very sensitive about my bra size . . . VERY!  So, I looked up and said, "Why is that your business?"  She said something like, because she was going to help me find it or something.  But I was irritated.  She finally left.  It's absurd.  The associates are too pushy.  But my new trick is to ask them for something that they don't know about, instead of helping find it, they disappear  = ).

34.description: Seriously? This has to be one of the most annoying stores EVER.  I'm okay with Victoria's Secret in general. I normally shop the semi-annual sale online, because I can get great deals. And, after working for VS in the past, I know that the quality doesn't meet the price, but again, I'm okay with that sometimes.  But, the store was just horrible. I was bombarded by chirpy sales girls every five seconds when I made it clear I did not want their help.  They didn't have many sizes available and not nearly the amount of options that they have in the catalog/online (to be expected).  I thought I could save on shipping by going to the store, but it just didn't do it for me. I'd rather go to Target.

16.description: I was happy that Victoria's Secret started carrying bras in my size, but a few days ago, I bought the wrong sized bra by mistake and had cut the tag off without looking because I had assumed that I bought the correct sized bra... No one has ever told me that Victoria's Secret doesn't accept returned bras if the tag's been cut off. Hell, a person can wear a bra with the tag still attached. What kind of stupid policy is this, anyway? So I'm out $50.00 for a bra I told Sales Girl #2 to just "donate this then because I have no use for it." Sales Girl #1 didn't even know how to tell me that I couldn't return this item after waiting in line for 15 minutes and then another 2 minutes for Sales Girl #2 to tell me this stupid piece of news. If this is your policy, then tell me it yourself. Don't waste my time. Thank you and I'll probably never shop at a Victoria's Secret again (except for the freebies I get from being on their PINK VIP email list). Luckily for me, I know there's a SOMA Intimates on another floor (where I happened to find a similar bra for approximately $10 less with a return policy of 90 days!) and another lingerie store in the 900 N Michigan building across the street. I don't need to deal with your bad attitude and stupid policy that NO ONE has ever cared to mention to me before.

13.description: A fairly opulent and large Victorias Secret but what else would you expect on the Mag Mile? Because it is so big there is a pretty large staff, a variety of items, and plenty of changing rooms/registers. I try to only stop in and out when I am here and the staff makes this really easy.

11.description: I have grown to like this location. I walked in the store on March 4th in the afternoon and was greeted by a number of sales associates; it was a little overwhelming, but looking back, they probably all realized I needed help.... I thought I knew what I needed, alas I quickly figured out I had no clue, so I asked for assistance. The lady said I needed a B cup. I laughed and told her all my 'chest' was padding.... basically she helped me find an A bra to try on and the girl in the dressing room also said I needed a B cup... I told her I did not .... come to find out I have been wearing my bra incorrectly for XX years. Turns out I CAN have cleavage and my mosquito bites aren't such!Thanks VS ladies! Keep up the good work!

39.description: I walk in the door of VS and am immediately greeted by a bubbly, sweet salesgirl."Hi.  My weight has been fluctuating lately, and I'd like to get a bra fitting.""Sure!  Here, hold on just a second . . . . okay, lift your arms.""Uh, can we go inside a dressing room or something?""Oh, haha, of course.  Follow me."A few moments later . . . . "So what was your size before?""34D."  "Well, now you're a 38D.""But I lost about twenty pounds in South America this summer.""Oh.  Well, it's possible you lost twenty pounds and gained four inches around the chest. Every woman's body is different.""Can we try again please?""Okay, this time I'm getting 32C.""That's a six inch difference from a moment ago.""Oh, I may have been looking at centimeters instead of inches before. Sorry."  "But that would be much much more than 38 . . . nevermind.  Are you sure I'm a C?""Yep.""Thank you so much for your help."I tried on a few Cs, and of course I spilleth over . . . .well, at least VS has cute panties.

37.description: They had the cutest, and I mean the CUTEST (or wait, I should say hottest and sexiest, 'cos it was!!) black lace bra advertised in their window the other day. I rushed in, dreaming of wearing that gorgeous number under clothes. And/or, the eventual unveiling . . . However, disappointment. They do not carry my (classified) bra size. In anything. Fie. Clearly the models with the great racks do not get their bras at VS. Go to Intimacy in the Bloomingdales building instead for REAL high end lingerie, not cheap, shoddily made crap.

0.description: Great promotion on ultra-soft black fitted sweatpants with good customer service! The store is clean and pleasant to browse.Underwear and other running outfits were over-priced as it is the case in their other stores nationwide....

38.description: Whats great about this place is the staff- I actually had a meltdown in the dressing room and started crying. No, I'm not joking. Apparently it happens all the time. Im inclined to like any place that can deal with my insane bullshit. (crying over a bra size. woah) And they were sweet, understanding and most of all nice and normal- the last thing I need when Im insanely crying my eyeballs out is a snotty sales bitch that makes me feel insane. I already know that. These girls are sweet tempered and really helpful.

27.description: I was happy that Victoria's Secret started carrying bras in my size, but a few days ago, I bought the wrong sized bra by mistake and had cut the tag off without looking because I had assumed that I bought the correct sized bra... No one has ever told me that Victoria's Secret doesn't accept returned bras if the tag's been cut off. Hell, a person can wear a bra with the tag still attached. What kind of stupid policy is this, anyway? So I'm out $50.00 for a bra I told Sales Girl #2 to just "donate this then because I have no use for it." Sales Girl #1 didn't even know how to tell me that I couldn't return this item after waiting in line for 15 minutes and then another 2 minutes for Sales Girl #2 to tell me this stupid piece of news. If this is your policy, then tell me it yourself. Don't waste my time. Thank you and I'll probably never shop at a Victoria's Secret again (except for the freebies I get from being on their PINK VIP email list). Luckily for me, I know there's a SOMA Intimates on another floor (where I happened to find a similar bra for approximately $10 less with a return policy of 90 days!) and another lingerie store in the 900 N Michigan building across the street. I don't need to deal with your bad attitude and stupid policy that NO ONE has ever cared to mention to me before.

32.description: I've been buying lingerie at VS since I started growing boobs. I'm a long time fan of the quality of the underthingies that VS produces. However, of all places, this Michigan Ave location has the bitchiest, most degenerate staff EVER.There was one time I came in to grab a new bra, really quick after work while I was on my way elsewhere. I know what size I am.  The lady in the front convinced me to measure me. Fine. Kinda nice, actually. I know what kinda bras I like, so I start looking for one that doesn't have 2 inches of padding. I find a cute polka dot one. Then this same lady tells me that I shouldn't try it on, but should go upstairs and try a bunch of different "try-on" bras they have, then come back with the style that fits me best. Um, OK. I'd rather just try that polka dot one on. So 40 minutes of dealing with some scatter-brained ladies upstairs, trying on a bunch of bras I didn't like to begin with, I come back downstairs. Yup, as suspected, I just want the fucking Polka Dot Bra, PLEASE. Guess what? We don't have it in your size.....ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME!? WHY DID YOU JUST WASTE NEARLY AN HOUR OF MY TIME. IF YOU JUST LEFT ME ALONE, CRAZY LADY, THEN I WOULD HAVE BEEN ON MY WAY LONG AGO!I could have just looked for my size in the Polka Dot one, tried my size on, in the color I like, and been on my way as I intended. Why you gotta make things complicated without ever checking if you have what I want in stock?Then I decided that it was one bad experience and many months later came back to use my birthday coupon they sent me in the mail. The coupon said something like free gift up to $15. So I came in an ask the nice lady in the front if I can use it towards a bra. She says yes, calls someone else over who also says yes. Then I spend some time picking out a new pretty bra, go to the front to use my coupon, where I encounter the Bitchzilla of them all. She, of course, tells me I can't use the coupon towards anything over $15. Knowing that VS is pretty lax on all the offers they send out, I tell her that two of the associates told me I could, which is why I spent all this time picking something out, and if I can maybe talk to a manager or something. She tells me that she is the manager, "now do you want the bra or not? There's people in line."I'm sorry, I thought I was at Victoria's Secret on the Magnificent Mile, not WalMart in the 'hood. Dang, girl. You got some 'tude.Now I'm dying to go see some of the Vintage collection but am afraid I'll end up ripping out someone's weave if I go back.

44.description: I love this Victoria Secret Store. There is always a sales person ready to help you with different sizes, colors, etc.

24.description: I love this vicky whispers location....not because of the stupid body scanner that tells you exactly what kind of bra you need, but because they have everything here and the sales people are helpful but not pushy, up in your biz-nach.  They write down the bras, size, etc for you....I mean, I dont really believe them when they tell me that the 2+ cup bra would look good on me...hello, I look like a porn star now.  No thanks :)I did have to laugh when I walked in, a girl was walking around spraying some cheap whore scent all around like we were in abercrombie or something....bringing me back to my teenage years...HOLLA!I have to admit too...I have a secret obsession with their lip glosses....I just cant get enuf!  I bought like 5 the other day when they were having their sale...geez...I am like stocked for 2011 now.

7.description: This store has been recently renovated (I'm not exactly sure when it happened) and is so much nicer than it was before. Larger, more items and more lines (such as Swim, Supermodel Essentials, VSX) available, most likely due to the face there is now a free standing Pink store on the next floor so they have more room for the other merchandise. I stop in here as they always seem to have cute VS Chicago attire here.Sales associates are much friendly and more knowledgeable than before. During my last visit, the associate knew where Milwaukee was. That was a vast improvement (see previous review).I'd say they are probably in fair competition with the Victoria's Secret a block north after the renovation. However, I still prefer the store at 734 N Michigan Ave, due to the sheer size, layout, and décor.

40.description: "Do you have a Victoria's Secret Card!?!" the peppy, overpainted salesgirl chirped.... it wasn't a question, more like a recital. "I did, but once I read on the fine print that it had a 20% APR I killed it quicker than I would a rabid salesgirl!" I responded in an equally saccharine tone. The key: make contact and to say this in a calm, modulated voice with a slight smile. She won't ask you a second time. In fact, it is necessary for shopping in peace. Until checkout, when the equally vapid manager comes up and says "If you pay off the card every month- you don't pay interest!""At which point you don't need a credit card, only Guido the loan shark (who offers a better rate) and you maintain a spectacular credit report, just like me. Or you use the application for target practice, like me. Do you have this in a 34C?"D@mn, I love getting the last word!

30.description: At 23 my boobs have grown {yeah, I don't get it but I think it might have something to do with switching to eating non-organic chicken but that's just me}. I had been to countless other places in search of a new bra that fit because my boyfriend could even tell I needed a new one.I was greeted when I walked in by a sweet girl. She pulled out a card and asked me what I was looking for, checking off my preferences and then measured me. Apparently, I was "in between a B and C cup", but I honestly think she wasn't accounting for the fact that the current bra I had on was all wrong and made me seem bigger than I actually am. I was thankful I didn't have to hunt someone down and ask them to measure me. Staff in there seemed a little off-putting, but  I don't have much evidence that they actually were. In the fitting rooms, I was greeted by a woman named Diana who seemed to be working  the fitting rooms alone, but was doing a good job of it. I liked that there were other bras to try on up there as well seeing as how I didn't really know what I wanted to get for a bra. I rarely go bra shopping, so it's nice to have people who make it a little less confusing. So my bra size, 32B ended up being wrong. {Not that I blame the sales associate downstairs. I'm the one wearing a jacked up bra!} Diana came to check on me and was very helpful about assisting me about the way that the bra should fit {in my case, 32A was perfect.} I felt like I was being annoying, but she came to my assistance at least twice after I was in the fitting rooms. It turns out that yes, I am bigger than before even though I walked out with a bra the same size.  But it fits very well and for the first time in my life, I have a bra that gives me cleavage!  I believe it was well worth it and I view the price I paid as partially paying for the help I was given at this store yesterday so I don't feel remorseful about the purchase at all. That, and I know that the bra will last for a lot longer than my last one.

46.description: In a great location on the Magnificent Mile - this store is always crowded and the fact that it has multiple levels for its lingerie and clothing, it always showcases the sales on the first floor.  If you want to escape the huge crowds - go upstairs for some more personal attention and even try a free bra fitting, too.

1.description: Great sale going on right now. They have 7 panties for $26!  Which is like getting 2 free because is usually 5 for $25. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Will go back again for sure. Give them your emails and they will send you sale updates for in store or online sales!

9.description: This is a nice store but some sales people are on u the minute u step in the store. Can I look around first. On the beauty side one never left my side. Hey can I pick out some panties, a bra or some body spray by myself???

26.description: So you won me back Victoria's Secret. The whole vibe of this place has changed. They have little cards on the dressing room doors that they write your name and size on. The lady that helped me was super nice and helpful, kept referring to me by name, and knew her stuff. She even went into the back and scoured the place for my color and size. I was impressed that they had a much better selection of 32 Cs than they used to. They have a great selection of backless bra options...all with sticky sides or sticky cups, but it's great to have options in the $50 range (ironically double what I paid for my Forever 21 dress) I ended up with a bra I needed and a bra I didn't need. Better yet? They were giving away sexy pagoda style pink and white umbrellas. I got super cute full size umbrella free with my $60 purchase. Yay!

25.description: i stopped by the water tower victoria's secret during one of their infamous semiannual sales. even though i walked in on a weekday night, i still expected massive lines, pushy customers and unenthusiastic sales associates. much to my surprise, multiple VS employees asked me if i needed help within moments of walking into the store. i even got two of them to measure me! after confirming my size, i headed to the dressing room with my new bras, where i waited less than five minutes in line. once inside, the associates checked up on me a few times to make sure everything was still going smoothly. one woman was nice enough to step in my room to make sure i had just the right fit. seriously... i was impressed. especially during one of their busiest times of year! keep it up water tower VS!

12.description: Very friendly staff here who don't hover and ask you a million times if they can help you. I'm usually a semi annual shopper but I stopped in with a gift card and got a pair of some unmentionables :D and my friend got a nice perfume gift set for her mother in law. A lot of stuff is way too expensive but if you need a GOOD bra that will last this is the place to go! One floor is all Pink merchandise and the other floor is the rest.

21.description: Do you remember the last time that VS carried anything actually sexy?  No, neither do I.Seriously sick of the weird patterned shit.  I think that I can get all the awkwardly colored animal print thongs that I want from a place not pretending to be classy for half the price, thank you.  And neon pink lace?  Really?I spent a half hour looking for panties to match a bra before one of the sales representatives approached me to ask if I needed assistance. I know that I look like the sort of girl that knows her way around a lingerie store (what does that even mean?), but after you're done asking the bewildered looking middle aged ladies around me what kind of coverage they're looking for, could you check in with me too before you go back to picking at your nails next to the mannequins?  Do I not look like I have a disposable income or something?For some unknown reason, what I was looking for was on the complete other side of the store, nowhere near anything that it coordinated with. Huge waste of time for three pairs of panties.

17.description: Liz is absolutely the most fabulous salesperson! She let's me know about sales, helps me find everything in my size & preferred colour, goes above & beyond, makes me feel like a VIP, let's me use all my coupons, & remembers me every time I visit. She's found me the most perfect bra!

10.description: so here's the deal. I work right by Water Tower and I was looking to get a whole new undergarment wardrobe as I suspected I was wearing the wrong bra size and much of my underwear was old and needed replacing. I decided to avoid the Michigan Avenue store as I figured it'd be more crowded, and headed into the Water Tower while VS was giving away free duffel bags with a $75 purchase. I knew this would be easy as I was going to buy at least 4 bras and several panty sets.I walked in and was immediately helped by a lady at the front. I told her I wanted a strapless bra that i could wear with low-cut tops. She showed me two, one of which didn't fit my description at all, but I tried both on anyway. While in the dressing room, I was measured and lo and behold, I was wearing a larger size. A wonderful sales lady brought me several types of bras in my size that I might like so I tried on several and picked the ones i liked best. I was then guided to another wonderful lady who found the bras on the floor so I could pick colors and styles. That was good all around and I had no complaints. Finding matching underwear seemed harder. The bras and some matching underwear sets were not together so I felt I was wandering around and not getting anywhere. This means VS lost a star here. After a got what I wanted I proceeded to the checkout which had two women both busy with customers. There's no indication of where to stand in line so i just milled about until someone was free. The lady who rang me said hi once and then didn't talk for the rest of the transaction. After I just spent $300 in your store, I expect at least some better customer service like I received on the floor. Now...I've been a cashier before and retail blows, let me tell you.
