But no matter how many stupid people ruined my day, i was always pleasant with the next customer, because it's just good business practice. I didn't get that here. She told me I got a free bag, shoved it in with the rest of my stuff, and then threw my receipt on top as well. No thank you. No come back soon. She then went off to talk with the other cashier. This is the other star. It pissed me off for some reason that i just spent good time and money here and I get excellent service in sales, but that all goes away when i checked out. I wanted to return everything out of spite, but I have to admit, I still love my bras. I'll take my chances at another store next time.

5.description: I am going to start out by saying, normally I really hate being talked to by sales people while I'm shopping. I always want to be left alone, unless I REALLY need help (which I never do.) with that said I am surprised I liked this store so much because the girls here really kind of jump all over you. Usually this would really irritate me...but they were actually really genuine, helpful and nice to talk to. The customer service here was so spot on everyone was so friendly I couldn't help but feel taken care of. I feel like it's hard to get good customer service in a clothing store because it's usually fake, or pushy, or nonexistent. These girls were all total sweethearts!!

3.description: I can't really fault the store for being what it is, but Pink is just too college-student-ish for me. They're great for leggings, but have no pyjamas, and I just can't fathom going out in public with pants that say "Pink" on the butt. I guess I'm just old school.

35.description: 4.5+ I love VS. Always have. Usually the staff is very helpful and love the sales in the catalogs and store. Its fun to come here w/ gal pals and even BF and guy pals. Everyone has different styles for what they like to have on or see on someone else. *wink

19.description: Not what I expected from a water tower store. This has to be a high traffic store, and yet all the displays seemed empty and messy. On top of that it was like a sales associate ghost town. I couldn't bring myself to spend any money here.

28.description: VERY beautiful store. But there is one manager there that is convinced that she is saving the world. I came in looking for the usual and was met with a scoff.. I wont be coming here again..

45.description: Check out the sales--this store carries a lot of stock so there'll be plenty to pick through.  The staff are relatively helpful, both here and in Water Tower, albeit a little pushy.  Can get very busy and crowded, especially with people more intent on just looking and getting in the way, rather than shopping.  If you're local, might as well go the store at North and Sheffield, same selection, and maybe more square footage.

33.description: I am not a big fan of Victoria's Secret, and something about this locale makes me even like the company less. It just feels like the staff stares at you constantly and it feels just a tad unsettling. One of the times I was in here I swear they approached me and my SO three times within a ten minute time span, and then when we did ask for help, were given a short but not sweet answer that really was no help at all.I admit that they have a lot cute things and that their thongs are really comfortable, but I am a BBW, which makes it super hard to shop here. Especially when it comes to bras...i can never seem to find anything over a C cup and when I do find a D cup they don't have the right measurement, which is annoying as hell. So if your a BBW I really don't recommend even trying to find anything here.

43.description: Can I preface the bad review for their actual stores by saying I really do like and sometimes love their inventory? Especially at semi-annual sale time! Its cute stuff, and while some have complained that it doesn't fit, I've found it works for me, so you just have to shop around brands like with anything else.  Victoria's Secret has been a very bad habit of mine for many yearsHowever, if this is the Water Tower location, I have to give a very negative review due to the recent changes to the decor and music selection.  My jaw dropped when I saw what they did, it is just so trashy (not to mention the neon lighting actually hurts my eyes, seriously!)  I think Victoria's secret is that she has run off and become a hooker in Vegas.  What's with all the seedy neon lighting and much more suggestively posed mannequins? I don't see how this caters to women at all....Victoria's Secret used to be a place you could count on for pretty underwear in a pretty, girlie, semi-luxurious environment (well at least for what was a moderately priced lingerie store, it had much nicer dressing rooms and pleasant lighting than say a department store).  I used to really enjoy browsing the store, now I am afraid someone is going to run out with whips and chains if I don't buy something, and the music has become overbearing almost to the level experienced at Abercrombie & Fitch (are they trying to run people out of there if they are not young enough to find the defeaning music enjoyable? If so its not the best marketing tactic).   Ok this is really a bit exaggerated, but its just so unfortunate that they decided to go the trashy route that it makes me mad and makes it seem a lot worse to me.On top of this, I've found the customer service has plummeted - while the salesgirls themselves genuinely seem to WANT to help, no one seems to know what's going on, and this store has been reopened long enough to have worked out the kinks.  The cashiers are abnormally slow, and they have the lines set up individually, rather than one long line that feeds into all the registers.  This change is really dumb and frustrating.  From now on I'll stick to ordering online!

2.description: Well well well ---I feel like I have yelped every Victoria's Secret known to man. This one though, is on my hot list. I'm very critical when I go to these stores because I always have my guard up waiting for someone to tell me I'm doing something wrong or my coupons don't work. Not here! Ladies, if you are looking for a hassle free environment go here! I've read the reviews that say this place is annoying because the associates are constantly bothering you but so what! That's there job. I can bet that when you get to check out you won't have ANY problems. You won't find this selection anywhere else, besides the one on the street level BUT THOSE ASSOCIATES ARE NIGHTMARES. Two STAR employees at WTP PINK---MICHELLE and BIANCA Both of these women have helped me with huge orders and I didn't have any problems! GO TO WTP PINK

18.description: The staff at this particular store needs some serious retraining on proper customer service. Not sure if the appeal of a commission is what drives the employees here but they are certainly over doing it and having the reverse effect of sending potential buyers running out the door.I walked in an empty store on a Saturday afternoon, probably already a sign and was right away greeted by an employee asking me if I knew my bra size and if I needed any help with anything. I politely said I didn't need any help at the moment and I was going to browse around first and I started to walk in the store. Literally 1 step later a second employee started all over again and asked me the same questions. Again I repeated myself and walked away. A third employee then proceeded again with the same questions. All of that happened within less than 5 minutes of me walking into the store.I'm sorry but at this point this is not customer service, this is harassment. I run out of the store and as I was doing so two other frustrated potential customers walked out with me showing the same despair of not having the freedom to browse around.

41.description: This Victoria's Secret isn't as overwhelming as it might appear.  It's two floors, but very manageable.  And the staff is extremely helpful!  The salespeople are easy to find and very willing to help you navigate all the underwear.  I came in here looking for a great t-shirt bra and was shown immediately multiple styles that would be perfect for me.  Once I had picked out a few styles I liked, they helped me find them in the store.  It was easy to find my size and color because the store is so well organized.

4.description: Victoria Secret store at Water Tower Place is quite awesome, and what makes them awesome is that they have the best sales associates always ready to help. It was pretty crowded at this location today as they have their semi annual sale (plenty of great deals as you know), and still the customer service and attention to detail from the employees is beyond amazing. Theresa helped us find everything we needed, helped negotiate a deal with the manager for a piece of lingerie we really liked, and took such great care of us all around. Thank you Theresa! :-)

6.description: Want to know a secret? This store moves the most merchandise of any store in the U.S. Yes, even more than the flagship store on Michigan Ave. This store is located in Water Tower Place. And while any local will generally avoid WTP, we also know what a nightmare the Mich Ave. one can be 'cause of all the tourists. So we go here to stock up. If you're a VC fan, go here. Not the street level store. Otherwise order online.

22.description: I avoid Water Tower Place like the plague, but needed several different clothing items and didn't want to traipse up and down Michigan Ave in the rain. Thus, I found myself in one of Chicago's most notorious tourist traps, made no better by the freakin' American Clones store.What IS it with this mall? Is there a secret conspiracy to get me to become a mall-shopper again? I mean, with this kind of customer service (first at the Limited, now VS) I may have to admit defeat.I decided, being 30, that it was time for me to get a bra and some underwear that actually matched. I tried the lingerie section in Macy's and wasn't even spoken to by the three saleswomen on the floor. On to Victoria's Secret.The salespeople jumped on me immediately. At first, I thought this was going to turn into one of those awkward situations where I had to choose which one of them to give the sale to. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the team approach.Girl A asked me what I was looking for. I told her that I needed a big-girl bra. She then asked what level of padding I like, etc. After she got an idea of what I wanted (i.e. something to mold my perfectly-sized girls into perky perfectly-sized girls), she introduced me to Girl B, who would be assisting me with my fitting. I swear, this woman brought me everything. And they were all perfect. That fitting made me love my boobs again. Girl B took me back to Girl A and told her what bra I liked and what size I was. Girl A then showed my my color options. Easy as pie.I think what I really liked the most, besides my beautiful new bra, was the way the team worked together. I found it to be a low-pressure situation, I felt comfortable, and didn't feel rushed. Brava, ladies. I, and my girls, thank you!One star knocked off because I hate having to walk through that God-awful "Pink" section to get to the rest of the bras. I think they should just rename it the "I am an adult woman who wants to appear to be younger than I am by buying cutesy pants with 'Pink' written across the butt" section.

15.description: So you won me back Victoria's Secret. The whole vibe of this place has changed. They have little cards on the dressing room doors that they write your name and size on. The lady that helped me was super nice and helpful, kept referring to me by name, and knew her stuff. She even went into the back and scoured the place for my color and size. I was impressed that they had a much better selection of 32 Cs than they used to. They have a great selection of backless bra options...all with sticky sides or sticky cups, but it's great to have options in the $50 range (ironically double what I paid for my Forever 21 dress) I ended up with a bra I needed and a bra I didn't need. Better yet? They were giving away sexy pagoda style pink and white umbrellas. I got super cute full size umbrella free with my $60 purchase. Yay!

20.description: Not what I expected from a water tower store. This has to be a high traffic store, and yet all the displays seemed empty and messy. On top of that it was like a sales associate ghost town. I couldn't bring myself to spend any money here.

36.description: I have zero love for this place.  I loathe that I actually fit into something comfortably.  But when you're larger than overage but like to look cute it's hard to find a brad for you.  I use to shop here then my partner started working at Gap Body, so I found a fav there.  They discontinued it w/ no replacement anywhere close.  I tried the Lane Bryants etc and finally went back to VS's - so I bought a bra (not at this location, a nicer one to be reviewed on a later date).  And then the Semi-Annual bra sale starts so I jump online to buy it.  And I can't find it!?  What the hell.  I proceed to call 3 Victoria's Secrets and this one informed me to just look on the website.  I told her I did that and I have the tag w/ the style # etc right in front of me and just needed a simple answer!  And then I got "hunny, we're closed" by someone named Mary...something.  Didn't catch the mumbled 2nd part of the name.  And I told her I just needed a quick question answered but if you're closed...."yeah, we're closed"....are you kidding me!?  If I ever did that when I was in retail I'd be written up.  I've written an email to complain but I doubt anything will be done about it since they're Victoria's Secret, but I'm about to go braless at this rate.  Less hassle!

14.description: I love this vicky whispers location....not because of the stupid body scanner that tells you exactly what kind of bra you need, but because they have everything here and the sales people are helpful but not pushy, up in your biz-nach.  They write down the bras, size, etc for you....I mean, I dont really believe them when they tell me that the 2+ cup bra would look good on me...hello, I look like a porn star now.  No thanks :)I did have to laugh when I walked in, a girl was walking around spraying some cheap whore scent all around like we were in abercrombie or something....bringing me back to my teenage years...HOLLA!I have to admit too...I have a secret obsession with their lip glosses....I just cant get enuf!  I bought like 5 the other day when they were having their sale...geez...I am like stocked for 2011 now.

58.description: Came back with a Groupon, and a few things have changed:- it's summer now, so the outdoor patio is open!  It's kind of awkward though because the waitstaff is constantly in and out of the front door of the building, which is the entry way to the apartments and not very close to the mEAT kitchen.  The door isn't propped open, so when food comes out, someone has to help hold the door.- service is not very attentive.  Too leisurely for our liking this past Saturday night.- found out the kale chips are only by request.  I had to request it twice, as the waiter clearly forgot the first time.After the $80 Groupon, we still shelled out $69 (including tip and tax) for the meal, which included 4 skewers, a side, and a drink.  The $35 lobster tails were expensive and so so. Our favorite skewers are still the andouille sausage and scallops, both for their flavor and juiciness.  Overall, the experience just wasn't as good as last time: the kale chips were bland, the mushrooms weren't as flavorful, and the service was a bit painfully slow.

56.description: First time @ Meat with and was impressed with the menu. Nice atmosphere with great staff. Tryed a few things I wouldn't normally orders and was pleasantly suprised. Try the bacon wrapped dates, lobster, beef tenderloin, sausages, and meatballs. The best of the suggestions are the bacon wrapped dates. You will not be disappointed. BTW check out Groupon:)

29.description: This is the second location for mEAT in Chicago, and its location to the Loop and Michigan Ave show compared to the Boystown location. Right around the corner from Water Tower Place on the busiest road in the city. I like the feel better; dark, lounge-type atmosphere w less street visibility and a great private bar vibe. Think speakeasy meets downtown lounge. Booth seating near the bar was nice. There's also a gorgeous table seating area with windows to the street but a ton of privacy. The dining room is a mix of reclaimed wood, brick, leather, and concrete. Holiday decor is up, too, and the manager (great guy) mentioned while chatting w us that they'll be adding some more winter drinks to the cocktail menu (although we tried two cocktails and they were both FANTASTIC creative takes on classic cocktails-highly recommend the sangria-pineapple foam combo but can't remember the name. The Pisco was good too. Very spirit-forward). We ordered quite a few menu items, used a great groupon and the meal was WELL worth the price. TRY THE STIFFED MUSHROOMS AND THE BACON ONION TART. Just do. And the Surf and Turf Skewer was to die for. In the future I will order two of them and try the bacon wrapped dates. We also tried the Rosemary pork, which was delicious, but, as pork tends to be in restaurants, was a tiny bit dry after hanging for ten/fifteen minutes and we ended up using a sauce intended for the steak... Still a great choice. By the way, dive into the kale chips they offer at start of meal; they're perfectly done and much better than you'd expect of not a kale fan. Lastly, our server was great. He offered his own opinion but also listened to what our interests were, and didn't give us that "oh you're using a groupon" attitude, which was refreshing. The groupon got us in, but we will be back time and time again bc of his service. Also, a coat check is available at the host desk, which is nice in the winter.

42.description: Enjoyed the concept.  Food was good, but not great.  Tenderloin was cooked perfectly, but pork was over done.  Server had too many tables so attention wasn't what it should be.I'm going to come again to make sure what I experienced wasn't a one off.

23.description: So we have now frequented both Chicago mEAT locations and this one just doesn't stack up.  The skewers were great but it kind ended there.COCKTAILS: Not seasonal.  The cocktails that we saw on the menu were more suited for summer dining than the cold winter night that we dined. Cucumber gimlets and such.  I ended up going for the alcoholic root beer instead.  It seemed to suit the night and the meal better.  I was very happy with this choice.SALAD: We shared the bacon and egg salad.  It was nice that it was topped with two poached eggs, making it easy for two to share.  There was little bacon or grilled onions leaving mostly just a ton of greens.  Sub par overall.SKEWERS: The seared scallop skewer was excellent and I would highly recommend it.  The scallops were done to perfections and the sauce that comes with is just the right amount of flavor so it only adds to the dish and doesn't take away any of the sweet, succulent scallop flavor.  The bacon wrapped chicken was good but could used more of the cream cheese and jalapeno filling.SIDES: Fondue mac and cheese - not really.  This is a pasta dish NOT mac and cheese.  Not very  cheesy.  Says it has bacon, peas and sun dried tomatoes.  Okay we found one piece of bacon, some peas and an over powering amount of the sun dried tomatoes.  When I order mac and cheese anything I want that cheesy, gooey, creamy, rich consistency.  Really decadent.  This was nothing of the sort.  With the exception of the little bit of cheese melted on top I couldn't find any cheese in the dish even though it says it is made with both cheddar and Gouda.  Huge disappointment.    We also got and order of the creamed corn.  Also disappointing.  It was chewy and you would be left to gnaw on the shell of the corn kernels long after you swallowed the rest of your forkful.  Should have been sweet, creamy and tender but it was none of these.  The service started off rough but improved by the end of the meal.  Both the waitress and the manager seemed to start the evening with an attitude but we happy that they both lightened up by the end of our meal.  In the end we happy with service.

47.description: I enjoyed one of the most delicious meals I've had in ages at mEAT this past weekend! The atmosphere was warm and cozy, the menu was impressive but not overwhelming, and the wait staff was very friendly and informative.My date and I started with cocktails; the pomegranate infused margarita for him and the cucumber gimlet for me. He loved his drink and I can honestly say that their gimlet was th e beat one I've ever had.From there, we both split the cucumber cups (3/5), the andouille sausage skewer (5/5!), and the surf and turf skewer (10/5!!!). We ended with the chocolate avocado mousse which was a very pleasant surprise.  I might swap out the cucumber cups for their brussels sprouts next time since they looked really good on their way to another table. But other than that, I think I know what I'd like my last meal to be.AND it's paleo and glutard friendly?! I'll be back.

8.description: Horrible food and outrageous price (a perfect recipe for a worst review). We were the only customers from the time we entered the restaurant (5:30pm) until we left it an hour later. No wonder why.My friend and I ordered Cheddar cheese fondue and two skewered meat (more than $60 in total) and it was the worst restaurant experience in recent years. Cheddar cheese fondue came in a bowl that was not hot enough and we were not provided with a lamp to keep it hot/warm. As we eat, the cheese got thickened and cold. The sides that came with the fondue were also absolutely terrible. The skewered meat didn't taste good at all and got dry and cold very quickly as there was no way to keep them warm. I didn't get an impression that we were served with freshly prepared meat. I strongly recommend that you don't waste your money and find any other nearby restaurant.

31.description: Came to this location for dinner a few nights ago. Ordered 4 items per the waiter's recommendation -- which was WAY too much for our party of 2!!Fondue mac & cheese was awesome, but beware, this is not a typical "side portion". It could be a meal on its own. Bacon-wrapped chicken skewers were crisp, juicy, and perfectly salty. Surf n Turf skewer was bland, even with the dipping sauces. That particular skewer is their most expensive and I definitely didn't feel it was worth it for a small piece of lobster, 2 shrimp, and a couple pieces of steak. Last item we ordered was a caesar kale salad, which was decent if you like kale and caesar dressing.Docking some points because the waiter advised us to order 4 items for 2 people, which was REALLY excessive and a waste of food (and $$). Also, we had 2 waiters fighting over who would be in charge of our table throughout most of our dinner. No one apologized or even acknowledged what was going on. Awkward.Points for no wait time before being seated and atmosphere. The exposed brick and raw wood ceiling gives it a cozy vibe.

34.description: The place doesn't excite you at all, from the outer look or inside . Food was ok and nothing special , presentation was horrible . It wasn't to my liking at all, I've been to many places and I've found at least one thing about it I enjoyed but not this place .

16.description: Got the surf and turf, bacon wrapped chicken and grilled veggies. Two negatives on food - 1. Lobster was VERY over cooked. What a shame!! 2. Veggies were oily and also a bit overdone. Scallops, shrimp, been tenderloin and chicken were all good. All in all I didn't find the experience particularly special. Food was good but definitely overpriced. I would recommend asking them to bring out skewers as courses. We ordered two for two people and they came out at the same time. The meats were cold by the time we made our way up both the skewers.FIVE STARS for cocktails. They are very very yummy.

13.description: Hands down... Best food of any skewer or Brazilian steakhouse themed restaurant.Our recommendations: Beef Tips (cooked MR and to die for)ScallopsShrimpCheese Fondue Mushrooms.GO GO GO!!!

11.description: mEAAAAT! We got a couple of items to try on our first visit and was pretty full by the end of dinner. Bacon onion tart - delicious! The pastry is super flaky and hot when it's first served. Gobble it down, don't let these get cold.Cauliflower puree - Woah, so this is my new favorite side dish of the week! It's so smooth and creamy but still maintains the very strong flavor of cauliflower.  Pistachio crusted pork - The pork is cooked really well and the pistachio crust on the outside adds a crunchy dimension. Be careful when you pull down the pork from the skewer because the crust doesn't stick on the meat very well. It separates really easily which I was sad to see :( Beef tenderloin tips - Also loved this one - super savory, beef is tender. I wasn't a huge fan of the yogurt horseradish sauce on the side but the beef itself is excellent. Bacon wrapped dates - Good, but very make-able in your own kitchen. Skip this unless you absolutely have to have it.I recommend coming with a group of 3-4 people. Any larger and you'll likely have to order double portions, especially for the meats and also if you have a hungry crew.

39.description: Let me start by saying that the drinks were awesome! I had a pisco sour and it was the best I have had outside of Europe.  We also had the beef tip and surf and turf skewers and both were great. Service was very attentive and we LOVED the mac and cheese. We will be back!

37.description: Aaron was fantastic!! I had a great time. Food was good!! I had a great time with my friends. I also love the magic marg with the pomegranate cube!

0.description: We decided to check this place out on a sleepy Sunday night and I'm so glad we did, it's awesome!  When we went in, we were one of only a few tables dining so we got a great seat by the window.We started out with a couple of cocktails, the maple foam manhattan and the Vieux Carre.  Just coming from Hong Kong where drinks with giant mountains of foam are a thing, I was pleasantly surprised that they took it easy on the foam on the manhattan.  It was a perfectly reasonable amount of foam.  Yes, this is real, I'm actually discussing foam.  It was a very tasty drink.  In fact, we tried three different cocktails and they were all very good.For dinner, we decided to have the beef tenderloin tips and the twin lobster tails with a side of fondue mac and cheese.  Now, I've never been a huge fan of lobster but this lobster may have just made me a convert...or maybe it was the insanely delicious garlic butter that came with it.  Either way, I loved it and I loved the beef tenderloin with horseradish as well.  Both skewers were cooked and seasoned perfectly and we enjoyed every bite.  The fondue mac and cheese was also very good.  We wrapped up the night with some avocado mousse and cheesecake.Overall, this is a great spot.  The food was great, the service was friendly, and the atmosphere is cozy.  Glad we finally made it in!

38.description: If you're a fan of the "shared plates" mentality and love trying a bit of everything with your company during a meal, mEAT is a great restaurant for you to check out. They had a great selection of skewers, which their menu revolved around, from steak to chicken to seafood options. There was truly something for everyone. Their appetizers were also all fantastic, as well as their sides. It was so hard to choose- Our house favorites were the macaroni and cheese, which were chock full of huge noodles and melted cheese with bacon and sun dried tomatoes, and the tenderloin tips, which came with a delicious Worcestershire greek yogurt sauce. The vegetable side was also chock full of flavor. There was plenty of food to go around, and we ended up leaving with a hearty amount of leftovers. The only reason I didn't rate with five stars is due to the fact that the website, which we had viewed prior to going, did not list the current, updated fall menu and there were dishes we were looking forward to ordering that obviously were not offered on the menu when we went. However, I will definitely be returning to try the remainder of menu items we were not able to get to in one round.

51.description: Let me begin by saying the food was EXCELLENT!  We had the surf and turf skewers and the cauliflower puree and it was probably the best meal we had all weekend.So why just 3 stars?  Well, we had purchased a Living Social coupon that was supposed to get us one beef tenderloin tip skewer and our choice of one scallop, shrimp, or lobster tail skewers.  This came with one side, one dessert, and one glass of wine each.  It was a $98 value for $65.  Not a bad deal.Instead, they said it was valid for only one skewer to share, one appetizer to share, one flat bread, and one glass of wine each.  We argued and the chef came to our table.  When he pulled up a chair and sat down, it didn't look good.  We explained that all we wanted was what we said the coupon was for.  Unfortunately, Living Social doesn't spell out exactly what is included on their vouchers and we couldn't get an internet connection to be able to pull it up on-line.  He FINALLY agreed, saying we'd basically have a $98 credit and we'd be charged regular price for everything (which totaled $120 or so), and then we'd have to pay the difference.  So bottom line, our meal started with a lot of arguing and we ended up paying about $15 more than we should have.Moral to the story - next time you have a Living Social voucher, make sure it spells out exactly what it includes.

27.description: Saw this place after a long day of shopping and walking around, it's was after 9 and many quick restaurants were closed and we didn't want to eat a heavy meal- so were pretty excited. Ordered the crab Rangoon flatbread and truffle fondue after trying to decide for awhile. The menu has some good options. The flatbread was alright- quite extra crispy but not terrible. The fondue was not what I was expecting- the cheese flavor was overpowered by truffle and wine. It wasn't bad flavor but I won't order it again. Overall a mediocre experience that may have been better if we ordered something different and the women behind us weren't obnoxiously loud so that we could have a conversation. Meh.

32.description: Hands down... Best food of any skewer or Brazilian steakhouse themed restaurant.Our recommendations: Beef Tips (cooked MR and to die for)ScallopsShrimpCheese Fondue Mushrooms.GO GO GO!!!

54.description: I only came here because I had a groupon. The prices are too high for the cost. The food was good but service was lousy. The server was sick and for some weird reason wouldn't blow his nose. Instead, he rubbed his nose with his fingers and hands which were then used to serve food. He also did the thing where he was trying to suck in his snot - super gross when others are trying to eat. Totally not going back!

48.description: I'm actually pretty confused as to why this restaurant has such great ratings?Went here on a weeknight and it was pretty slow. We decided to sit outside because it was beautiful. We wanted to order the fondue, but were told they didn't do the fondue on the patio (but then I see in another review that someone else was able to have it on the patio?). No big deal, we moved on. We had the crab rangoon flatbread, and while it was good, it wasn't anything memorable and didn't taste as we were hoping. The skewers we ordered were the bacon wrapped dates and the meatballs. The meatballs were actually delicious, the only thing we ordered all night that was worth it. The bacon wrapped dates were not good. The bacon was so so fatty that it was incredibly difficult to chew. I love bacon wrapped dates so this was a big disappointment. We also ordered the mac and cheese, which was totally tasteless. This restaurant charges too much money for the quality of the food. Not worth the trip.

44.description: Have been meaning to try this place based on word of mouth reviews from friends for a long time.  This weekend, we met some good friends here before going to a play at the nearby Lookingglass Theatre.  All four of us were impressed with the service, food, and drinks.My wife and I shared the crab rangoon flatbread while we waited for the other couple to arrive.  We both thought the medley of tastes and textures was excellent.Because sides are served family style, the four of us agreed on the meat skewers and then each of us tried a little of everything.  Shrimps were giant and perfectly prepared; rosemary mint pork was delicious and cooked just right; bacon wrapped dates were as tasty as other reviewers have said.  Tenderloin tips were more well done that I prefer but they fine.Steakhouse mushrooms were as outstanding as the waiter promised: hot, tender, flavorful and ample quantity to share.  Brussel sprouts were char-grilled and surprisingly good.  Creamed corn was much better than average with an interesting mixture of spices, peppers, spinach and cheeses.Overall, we agreed that mEAT is a nice destination for a relaxing meal with good meats and great sides.  The mix of spices and textures made the food we tried a notch above the norm for grilled food places.  Our waiter was very attentive without being annoying, and made a pleasant experience even more enjoyable.We'll definitely be back in the future.  Since mEAT is within easy walking distance of Lookingglass, might well be another dinner and a play night...

24.description: Great! Fantastic foods, excellent service, highly recommended!

7.description: I bought a groupon and decided to check this place out. We sat outside and started with a cheese fondue. The server advised us that the fire could go out with the wind but we decided to risk it. Glad we did because it wasn't a problem at all. The cheese was delicious. They didn't bring enough bread and veggies but refilled after we finished with the first basket. We each ordered a cocktail which was small and overpriced. Basically the usual scene in downtown Chicago these days. It was vey good though. We decided to get the steak skewer, bacon wrapped chicken skewer, and Mac and cheese. First came the Mac and cheese and beef. They came a few minutes apart and the Mac and cheese almost went to the wrong table. Well, the chicken actually did go to the wrong table. The server figured out what happened and apologized and hurried out the next chicken. By the time we got it we were already full. We took a bite to try and the chicken inside was raw. Guess they hurried a little too much. Too bad because it tasted great. It took forever for a server to come by again and when he finally did we sent it back, too full to order another. Although all these snafus sound problematic, they handled it perfectly. The head chef came by with a vaportini and asked what else we needed. We ended up ordering a chocolate fondue. It was my birthday after all. They ended up comping the dessert and the drink which they didn't have to do but left a great impression in my mind. It's not like our meal was cheap either way. I'm excited to go back and get the bacon wrapped chicken the way it's intended to be. I know this place is paleo friendly but the non paleo options are legit too. I'm still dreaming about the chocolate fondue.

49.description: Decided to go for a low key night and sat at the bar.  Made friends with the bartenders who made a phenomenal Vieux Carre. The bacon flatbread was cooked perfectly and the bacon wrapped chicken skewers left me feeling the best kind of full.The owners decided to make friends with me and were personable and a lot of fun to hang out with.  If I am ever back in Chicago, I will certainly be revisiting.

40.description: My husband and I had a Groupon for mEAT and decided to try the Streeterville location on a Friday night.  We arrived in time for our 6:30 reservation, were quickly seated in one of their booths, and were introduced to our server Luis.  He asked if we had ever dined at mEAT before and we said "Yes, but the boystown location".  As soon as we said "boystown", Luis stood back, looked offended and said "I don't know what that is", "I don't know that location".  We thought his reaction was kind of strange but didn't think much of it, so we went ahead and ordered a bottle of pinot grigio.A few minutes later another server named Larissa came to our table and asked if we wanted to order an appetizer, we told her that we had already been served by Luis and she quickly said "No, I am your server now" without any other explanation.  We thought the sudden switch of servers was pretty strange especially since Luis continued to serve all of the tables around us.  We went ahead and ordered the hot bacon flatbread for an appetizer and the rosemary pork and meatball skewers for out entree and waited for our bottle of wine to arrive.  When the wine did arrive, we were disappointed that it wasn't chilled, the wine was served to us at room temperature which made it tough to enjoy.The flatbread arrived soon after and it was delicious.  Lots of bacon and giardiniera and it was cooked just right.  However, our entrees were a big disappointment.  The pork skewer was over cooked and dry and the meatball skewer was under cooked and pink in the middle.  We were looking forward to both skewers and were bummed that they were not very good.However, the dessert did make up for the underwhelming entrees.  We ordered the turtle fondue which came with cheesacake, marshmallows, brownies, bananas, strawberries, and pineapple.  Very very good.  I could not stop eating.All in all, my experience with mEAT was a disappointment, I would recommend the restaurant for a drink and appetizer or for dessert, but not for a full dinner.

53.description: Went here with my girlfriend who had a great groupon!  This place was flat out amazing.  I like a lot of food and tend to say things are always good but this exceeded my expectations and she agreed. First it is in a super nice area across from the Hancock.  It is just a block from Michigan avenue yet also quiet.  We ordered a great flat bread that really was a nice start.  Then, we got the beef and bacon chicken wrap skewers.  These both were very good. The side of mac and cheese was very tasty and unique and highly recommended.  I recommend doing an appetizer, a few skewers, and a side to really experience the entire menu.  Service was outstanding as well

30.description: I ate here on a Monday night about a month ago with a couple friends and this was truly the most bizarre experience I've had while eating out. The waiter seemed nice at first, explaining the menu and helping us out with questions. The first red flag was that I said that we would like the fondue out first, and he came back to the table 5 different times and asked if we wanted the fondue out first or with the meal and I kept repeating myself over and over that we wanted it out first. We then ordered a glass of wine and didn't receive it for 20+ minutes and it was totally empty in there, not busy at all. My friend had joined us eventually and he was also having the same problem. He ordered a glass of wine and he saw it sitting at the bar for about 15-20 minutes and almost just grabbed it, and then our server asked the bartender "what is this glass of wine for?!" And then I guess he realized it was my friends that he ordered about 20 minutes ago. The bartender was getting so pissed off at him, cursing and crying and it was just so weird because we were so close to the bar and could see everything. I guess she was realizing how incompetent he was and kept freaking out about it. It took about 45 minutes to even receive our food, which was actually pretty tasty (we got the scallops, Brussels sprouts, shrimp, roasted veggies and my friend ordered the meatballs). The veggies and Brussels sprouts seemed drowned in sweet sauce, which it didn't need. The meatballs didn't arrive with our food and my friend asked about it and he said it was coming right out. 30 minutes later, still no meatballs! I think he forgot she ordered it and rang it in right after he realized, and that's why it took so long. No apologies, nothing. I am a server myself and I was shocked with the service and the restaurant. It was just so completely bizarre. Id be surprised if that server still works there now. I definitely won't be back.

46.description: We had Jake as our waiter, and he was so personable  and really nice. We had a really great dinner, we decided to try the bacon wrapped chicken skewers, the shrimp skewers, and beef tip skewers. We all love the shrimpskewers the best, but they were all great!!  We had the Brussels sprouts and mac and cheese as a side dish.  Everything was awesome.  They gave us a free prosecco toast for our daughters birthday!! We will be back!!

1.description: I feel in love with mEAT when a friend and I went for her birthday last year. At the Halsted location we had amazing service and the food was delicious. I purchased a Groupon for the Streeterville location and was excited to take my boyfriend and share my scrumptious experience. The food was tasty as ever and I ended up taking home leftovers. Unfortunately the service was less than desirable.I understand Saturday was a busy night, almost every table was full, but they seemed to be short staff. It took almost 10 minutes for our waiter to come to our table to greet us and take beverage orders. By the time he did we had already figured out what we wanted food wise, and placed the whole order... 2 drinks, 1 appetizer, 2 skewers and 2 sides. About 10 -15 minutes later he came back to our table saying he accidentally threw out the paper with our order on it, could we tell him our order again. So we did. Everything was fine during the meal but at the end of the meal we asked him for a box for our leftovers. He took the dishes and said he would be right back. About 15 minutes later we flagged him down to ask where our leftovers were and his response was "oh did they take the dishes already?" Clearly he forgot he took our dishes and leftovers! We reminded him that HE took them and asked him to check. Another 10 minutes later (and several trips to the floor empty handed) he came back with the leftovers.The quality and taste of the food was perfect, but the service could have been better or perhaps more staff for a busy Saturday evening. I think I prefer the Halsted location.

55.description: The Good:1. They were able to accommodate a huuuuge bday dinner reservation2. You will leave full3. BRUSSELS SPROUTS4. They let us eat the amazing cake we brought in.The Meh:1. The service was very nice and accommodating, but also very slooooow.2. It's a little pricey without a groupon or yelp deal, but there are almost always groupons or yelp deals.3. The much raved about bacon wrapped chicken was underwhelming and kind of dry. Maybe we just got a bad batch?4. None of the other skewers were actually that memorable...The Bad:1. The bathroom was out of toilet paper. Thank God for purse tissues.2. Tequila old fashioned is not an old fashioned.

9.description: This is the second location for mEAT in Chicago, and its location to the Loop and Michigan Ave show compared to the Boystown location. Right around the corner from Water Tower Place on the busiest road in the city. I like the feel better; dark, lounge-type atmosphere w less street visibility and a great private bar vibe. Think speakeasy meets downtown lounge. Booth seating near the bar was nice. There's also a gorgeous table seating area with windows to the street but a ton of privacy. The dining room is a mix of reclaimed wood, brick, leather, and concrete. Holiday decor is up, too, and the manager (great guy) mentioned while chatting w us that they'll be adding some more winter drinks to the cocktail menu (although we tried two cocktails and they were both FANTASTIC creative takes on classic cocktails-highly recommend the sangria-pineapple foam combo but can't remember the name. The Pisco was good too. Very spirit-forward). We ordered quite a few menu items, used a great groupon and the meal was WELL worth the price. TRY THE STIFFED MUSHROOMS AND THE BACON ONION TART. Just do. And the Surf and Turf Skewer was to die for. In the future I will order two of them and try the bacon wrapped dates. We also tried the Rosemary pork, which was delicious, but, as pork tends to be in restaurants, was a tiny bit dry after hanging for ten/fifteen minutes and we ended up using a sauce intended for the steak... Still a great choice. By the way, dive into the kale chips they offer at start of meal; they're perfectly done and much better than you'd expect of not a kale fan. Lastly, our server was great. He offered his own opinion but also listened to what our interests were, and didn't give us that "oh you're using a groupon" attitude, which was refreshing. The groupon got us in, but we will be back time and time again bc of his service. Also, a coat check is available at the host desk, which is nice in the winter.

26.description: So good! We made reservations like 5 times and kept having to reschedule.  Finally made it in after a day of shopping. The ambience is chic and cozy. Luis was our server but I think there are two individuals with the same name.  We started with the stuffed mushrooms and the sausage flatbread. Both were very good. We moved to the surf and turf skewer which is beef tenderloin, shrimp,  scallop and lobster tail. We also had the bacon wrapped chicken skewer which is bacon wrapped chicken with goat cheese and jalapeño.  Yum, yummy, yummy. . We had the mac and cheese as our side. I had two glasses on Rose and my bf had a Manhattan. . All really good. It is our new neighborhood haunt because not only is the food great, it isn't too expensive,  and it's just a comfy relaxing,  chill kind of spot.

25.description: While I wanted to write a fully positive review as it seemed like everyone below had a great experience, this was the most subpar meal I had on my foodie tour of Chicago. As a meat lover I was expecting a lot from this meal. The waiter did a great job of making us feel welcome but there were just some things I couldn't get over. We ordered: Steak Tips, Jumbo Shrimp, and BaconWrapped Chicken. Started off with their Mac and Cheese. First of all we ordered the Steak MR and then minutes after ordering the waiter comes in and brings us the steak because someone else ordered the MR but decided last minute that they didn't want it so they brought it to us, which would mean it would come before our appetizer and way before our food. When we tried it, the meat was cold and the part we ate was medium well done. I called the waiter over and asked if this was actually MR and he apologized and said I'll go in and check for you and get a better one. The whole night he was passive aggressive about it saying "actually it was medium rare, you just didn't get to the rare part later on" to dismiss our comment. Then a separate waiter came to bring he steak and was very adamant about sharing how the rare parts are closer to the middle and how it should be perfect now. While it should have had a helpful tone, it came as more of an insult. The actual meat wasn't bad, just needed the sauces to really get any flavor out. The jumbo shrimp was huge but was bland and had no flavor. They need to add seasoning or something to it or it tastes just like the filler fake crab meat they use in sushi sometimes.The bacon wrapped chicken was so cooked I couldn't taste the bacon and the chicken was not tender at all. Overall I wanted to love this place but the food wasn't the best.

12.description: Concept is cool they hang your meat skewers in the middle od table.Food is really so so...we had crab flat bread. Salty and burned. Skewers of pork mint with berries, shrimps, dates wrapped in bacon. Pork was not that good. Shrimp was ok. Dates was ok too...food seem cold, meaning not as hot temperatures. Food wise i would give rating two.Wine..most red bottle runs around $44. We tried what the waiter recommend... again, pretty disappointed. I usually never leave my drink...but could not finish...due to taste.Friendliness was ok too. Our waiter was ok. Overall, I leave at three but not worth to go back..

59.description: So we were playing tourist in the City for Bryn's birthday. We had rooms at the Hilton Suites on Delaware and Ami joined us for a day and night of Chicago stuff after spending four hours at the airshow. After resting in the room, we headed over to mEAT near the hotel for dinner. mEAT advertises itself as the place for Skewers and Cocktails and it did not dissapoint. The Four of us had some fig foccia to start which was really good - quality cheese, perfectly cooked crust - but could have done without the sweet and sour sauce on top. We then shared three skewers and two sides which was plenty for us, even though our server recommended one to one and a half per person. I guess we just eat a little less than most. We had the Shrimp - outstanding, the Salmon - very good and the bacon wrapped chicken. Some of the Chicken pieces were a little dry but the juicy bacon made up for that. I also had their Boulevardier cocktail which was quite good and at around $10 was reasonably priced. All in all, mEAT delivered. Should we ever find ourselves in a similar situation, we'll give it another try.Cheers,

21.description: Took the waitress like 15 minutes to bring a 312 that wasn't even on draft so that makes no sense. The overpriced and bland flavorless skewers were so awful. Me and my friend BOTH got food poisoning from eating here. Even the dessert menu was mediocre. DONT EAT HERE ITS AWFUL.: "The only reason why anyone would eat here is if you have committed a felony and the state wishes to punish you with a fate one step away from death"

17.description: The crab Ragoon flatbread is a MUST try, it was freakin AMAZING, savory and flavorful, everything a true foodie loves. The bacon wrap chicken was delicious, although I could barely taste the cream cheese or the jalapeno pepper it was suppose to have in them. The cobbler sangria is delicious, I wish I could take a pitcher of it home. The staff were very professional.

10.description: Kind of like a Brazilian steakhouse but with out the swords! Nice atmosphere and nice menu! We got the stuffed mushrooms to start - delicious! And then tried the Lemon chicken, Rosemary pork, scallops, and bacon wrapped dates. Along with the Brussel sprout side. Our verdict: the Dates won over all - amazing combination! My second favorite was the Pork - great taste profile with the chutney. The lemon chicken really had no flavor - not dry at all tho. The Brussel sprouts were great too - I'm going to add balsamic to mine once I make them at home! The Kale chips were not a huge hit with our group but we saw other tables loving them. Lastly we tried the Vaportini - very different and interesting!

5.description: Our 1st time was a Groupon deal. Used it during the snowstorm and had a wonderful time. About $30 each without drinks.  The bartender crafted a terrific Choc. Martini. Going back soon.

3.description: So we have now frequented both Chicago mEAT locations and this one just doesn't stack up.  The skewers were great but it kind ended there.COCKTAILS: Not seasonal.  The cocktails that we saw on the menu were more suited for summer dining than the cold winter night that we dined. Cucumber gimlets and such.  I ended up going for the alcoholic root beer instead.  It seemed to suit the night and the meal better.  I was very happy with this choice.SALAD: We shared the bacon and egg salad.  It was nice that it was topped with two poached eggs, making it easy for two to share.  There was little bacon or grilled onions leaving mostly just a ton of greens.  Sub par overall.SKEWERS: The seared scallop skewer was excellent and I would highly recommend it.  The scallops were done to perfections and the sauce that comes with is just the right amount of flavor so it only adds to the dish and doesn't take away any of the sweet, succulent scallop flavor.  The bacon wrapped chicken was good but could used more of the cream cheese and jalapeno filling.SIDES: Fondue mac and cheese - not really.  This is a pasta dish NOT mac and cheese.  Not very  cheesy.  Says it has bacon, peas and sun dried tomatoes.  Okay we found one piece of bacon, some peas and an over powering amount of the sun dried tomatoes.  When I order mac and cheese anything I want that cheesy, gooey, creamy, rich consistency.  Really decadent.  This was nothing of the sort.  With the exception of the little bit of cheese melted on top I couldn't find any cheese in the dish even though it says it is made with both cheddar and Gouda.  Huge disappointment.    We also got and order of the creamed corn.  Also disappointing.  It was chewy and you would be left to gnaw on the shell of the corn kernels long after you swallowed the rest of your forkful.  Should have been sweet, creamy and tender but it was none of these.  The service started off rough but improved by the end of the meal.  Both the waitress and the manager seemed to start the evening with an attitude but we happy that they both lightened up by the end of our meal.  In the end we happy with service.

35.description: Food was awful, meat was cool ( must have sat in the kitchen too long) service not paying attention, drinks had to be sent back, veggies oily, cauliflower puree bad after taste., pork chops very thin covered with something, beef tip cool, presentation we laughed as food fell off the scures. Table never cleared off. MIL had a coupon, she had been before months ago and said it was wonderful. We had a party of 4 really looking forward to a fun place..................Never will return, also spoke to a couple that lived across the street seem to be having the same issues.

19.description: The Good:1. They were able to accommodate a huuuuge bday dinner reservation2. You will leave full3. BRUSSELS SPROUTS4. They let us eat the amazing cake we brought in.The Meh:1. The service was very nice and accommodating, but also very slooooow.2. It's a little pricey without a groupon or yelp deal, but there are almost always groupons or yelp deals.3. The much raved about bacon wrapped chicken was underwhelming and kind of dry. Maybe we just got a bad batch?4. None of the other skewers were actually that memorable...The Bad:1. The bathroom was out of toilet paper. Thank God for purse tissues.2. Tequila old fashioned is not an old fashioned.

28.description: So I've been meaning to write this review for some time! I work in the neighborhood and I come here a lot. Honestly I can't say enough good things about this venue. First, the manager James is wonderful he always remembers me by name and i notice I am not the only person he calls by name. Secondly the decor and ambience is so perfect. You have options of sitting in the front room which is beautiful and van enjoy dinner, or the bar area which is fun and the music is always on par. The food is great, I enjoy their flat breads, in particular the sausage and the cheese fries! Lastly, I enjoy their attention to detail to the spirits and classic cocktails! You should definitely go in and ask for James!!

45.description: Concept is cool they hang your meat skewers in the middle od table.Food is really so so...we had crab flat bread. Salty and burned. Skewers of pork mint with berries, shrimps, dates wrapped in bacon. Pork was not that good. Shrimp was ok. Dates was ok too...food seem cold, meaning not as hot temperatures. Food wise i would give rating two.Wine..most red bottle runs around $44. We tried what the waiter recommend... again, pretty disappointed. I usually never leave my drink...but could not finish...due to taste.Friendliness was ok too. Our waiter was ok. Overall, I leave at three but not worth to go back..

33.description: Disappointed. Was looking for a different kind of restaurant for our list night in Chicago. Read the reviews and it sounded like it would be good menu and fun experience. Well the atmosphere is nice. The concept is interesting. But our service lacked and the food was mediocre. We started with the bacon onion flat brrad/puff pastry tart. It was bland. The puff pastry had more flavor than anything else. We picked the steak tips and rosemary pork for our skewers and the Greek potatoes.Thw steak tips while tender had a very liver like flacor/taste to them. Cheap cut of meat used for the price charged. The horseradish yogurt dip was bland. The rosemary pork was dry and over cooked. The chutney served with it was awesome, but that's the only flavor from it. The rosemary was not found and it was very dry.The Greek potatoes sounded amazing. But again fell flat. They were crisp on the outside and dry on the inside. It needed something acidic to bring out more flavor and needed something to add moisture. It was so dry and bland when taking a bite. When I spooned over what butter/oil was in the dish onto the potatoes it tasted much better but just was not enough. Granted we don't live in the city but when we do return to Chicago we will not return here and definitely will not recommend them to our friends in the city.

43.description: First things first the skewers were amazing. My boyfriend and I highly recommend the surf and turf one. The lemon chicken was also very good. We had the macaroni and cheese FONDU as a side. It was very good and I love that it had bacon in it. My boyfriend had a magical margarita and it changed colors as we waited. Very cool. I had a sangria and it was just ok. Not the best I've ever had. The drinks were a bit small for the price we paid. I don't recommend the sangria. Our waiter Louis?/Luis? I'm not sure how to spell it but he was very nice and wasn't all in our face asking questions but attentive enough to recommend food to us. He's so nice. Enjoyed his service so much. Overall we loved it here and will definitely come back soon! The only thing holding this place back and why it wasn't a perfect score was the drinks.

2.description: A gem hiding in the shadow of water tower place! Great for couples and families. The ambiance is fabulous... You enter up a curving set of rich wooden steps in the gorgeous lobby of a residential building. The interior is dark and cozy with delightful raised booths. Service was outstanding. Thank you, Luis, for taking great care of us.The quality of the meat and seafood skewers was so high that you did not need the sauces. We had bacon wrapped  chicken, beef, scallops, and lobster.  The grilled vegetables in the balsamic reduction were perfectly done. And a finale of chocolate fondue...wow! We will be back anytime were in the area!

18.description: Disappointed. Was looking for a different kind of restaurant for our list night in Chicago. Read the reviews and it sounded like it would be good menu and fun experience. Well the atmosphere is nice. The concept is interesting. But our service lacked and the food was mediocre. We started with the bacon onion flat brrad/puff pastry tart. It was bland. The puff pastry had more flavor than anything else. We picked the steak tips and rosemary pork for our skewers and the Greek potatoes.Thw steak tips while tender had a very liver like flacor/taste to them. Cheap cut of meat used for the price charged. The horseradish yogurt dip was bland. The rosemary pork was dry and over cooked. The chutney served with it was awesome, but that's the only flavor from it. The rosemary was not found and it was very dry.The Greek potatoes sounded amazing. But again fell flat. They were crisp on the outside and dry on the inside. It needed something acidic to bring out more flavor and needed something to add moisture. It was so dry and bland when taking a bite. When I spooned over what butter/oil was in the dish onto the potatoes it tasted much better but just was not enough. Granted we don't live in the city but when we do return to Chicago we will not return here and definitely will not recommend them to our friends in the city.

41.description: Got the surf and turf, bacon wrapped chicken and grilled veggies. Two negatives on food - 1. Lobster was VERY over cooked. What a shame!! 2. Veggies were oily and also a bit overdone. Scallops, shrimp, been tenderloin and chicken were all good. All in all I didn't find the experience particularly special. Food was good but definitely overpriced. I would recommend asking them to bring out skewers as courses. We ordered two for two people and they came out at the same time. The meats were cold by the time we made our way up both the skewers.FIVE STARS for cocktails. They are very very yummy.

52.description: A girlfriend and I bought a living social deal which included a glass of wine each, beef, choice of shrimp, lobster or scallops, a side, and either the avocado mousse or the cheesecake to share. I ordered the Reisling and her the Chardonnay. They really fill their glasses! Definitely more than the regular pour. We also ordered the beef medium rare, lobster, mac and cheese, brussell sprouts and avocado mousse. The beef and lobster was cooked to perfection. The food ended up being a little more than we could eat in one sitting so I enjoyed a little left overs the next day. As far as the avocado mousse goes, try it! We were wary but it turned out being delicious. One weird thing about the experience was how empty the restaurant was. We were seated in the front half of the room and there was no one around us. The restaurant is located off the beaten path a little. I would have never known it was there if we didn't get the living social deal. Overall it was a good experience, though! Would love to try the fondue next time.

50.description: mEAAAAT! We got a couple of items to try on our first visit and was pretty full by the end of dinner. Bacon onion tart - delicious! The pastry is super flaky and hot when it's first served. Gobble it down, don't let these get cold.Cauliflower puree - Woah, so this is my new favorite side dish of the week! It's so smooth and creamy but still maintains the very strong flavor of cauliflower.  Pistachio crusted pork - The pork is cooked really well and the pistachio crust on the outside adds a crunchy dimension. Be careful when you pull down the pork from the skewer because the crust doesn't stick on the meat very well. It separates really easily which I was sad to see :( Beef tenderloin tips - Also loved this one - super savory, beef is tender. I wasn't a huge fan of the yogurt horseradish sauce on the side but the beef itself is excellent. Bacon wrapped dates - Good, but very make-able in your own kitchen. Skip this unless you absolutely have to have it.I recommend coming with a group of 3-4 people. Any larger and you'll likely have to order double portions, especially for the meats and also if you have a hungry crew.

4.description: So good! We made reservations like 5 times and kept having to reschedule.  Finally made it in after a day of shopping. The ambience is chic and cozy. Luis was our server but I think there are two individuals with the same name.  We started with the stuffed mushrooms and the sausage flatbread. Both were very good. We moved to the surf and turf skewer which is beef tenderloin, shrimp,  scallop and lobster tail. We also had the bacon wrapped chicken skewer which is bacon wrapped chicken with goat cheese and jalapeño.  Yum, yummy, yummy. . We had the mac and cheese as our side. I had two glasses on Rose and my bf had a Manhattan. . All really good. It is our new neighborhood haunt because not only is the food great, it isn't too expensive,  and it's just a comfy relaxing,  chill kind of spot.

6.description: Came back with a Groupon, and a few things have changed:- it's summer now, so the outdoor patio is open!  It's kind of awkward though because the waitstaff is constantly in and out of the front door of the building, which is the entry way to the apartments and not very close to the mEAT kitchen.  The door isn't propped open, so when food comes out, someone has to help hold the door.- service is not very attentive.  Too leisurely for our liking this past Saturday night.- found out the kale chips are only by request.  I had to request it twice, as the waiter clearly forgot the first time.After the $80 Groupon, we still shelled out $69 (including tip and tax) for the meal, which included 4 skewers, a side, and a drink.  The $35 lobster tails were expensive and so so. Our favorite skewers are still the andouille sausage and scallops, both for their flavor and juiciness.  Overall, the experience just wasn't as good as last time: the kale chips were bland, the mushrooms weren't as flavorful, and the service was a bit painfully slow.

22.description: Good environment and great food.  Unique presentation, Fun for groups. Outstanding service!

15.description: My husband and I had a Groupon for mEAT and decided to try the Streeterville location on a Friday night.  We arrived in time for our 6:30 reservation, were quickly seated in one of their booths, and were introduced to our server Luis.  He asked if we had ever dined at mEAT before and we said "Yes, but the boystown location".  As soon as we said "boystown", Luis stood back, looked offended and said "I don't know what that is", "I don't know that location".  We thought his reaction was kind of strange but didn't think much of it, so we went ahead and ordered a bottle of pinot grigio.A few minutes later another server named Larissa came to our table and asked if we wanted to order an appetizer, we told her that we had already been served by Luis and she quickly said "No, I am your server now" without any other explanation.  We thought the sudden switch of servers was pretty strange especially since Luis continued to serve all of the tables around us.  We went ahead and ordered the hot bacon flatbread for an appetizer and the rosemary pork and meatball skewers for out entree and waited for our bottle of wine to arrive.  When the wine did arrive, we were disappointed that it wasn't chilled, the wine was served to us at room temperature which made it tough to enjoy.The flatbread arrived soon after and it was delicious.  Lots of bacon and giardiniera and it was cooked just right.  However, our entrees were a big disappointment.  The pork skewer was over cooked and dry and the meatball skewer was under cooked and pink in the middle.  We were looking forward to both skewers and were bummed that they were not very good.However, the dessert did make up for the underwhelming entrees.  We ordered the turtle fondue which came with cheesacake, marshmallows, brownies, bananas, strawberries, and pineapple.  Very very good.  I could not stop eating.All in all, my experience with mEAT was a disappointment, I would recommend the restaurant for a drink and appetizer or for dessert, but not for a full dinner.

57.description: We had a Groupon for this place & used it tonight. We had the crab rangoon flatbread, surf & turf skewer, the lemon chicken skewer, greek potatoes, fondue, and two drinks apiece. My first drink was a ruby port based sangria (pretty good) and my second was the margarita with the pomegranate ice cube which was amazing. All of the food was delicious, service was attentive without being overbearing and even though we spent more than the Groupon value (which was essentially our drinks and dessert), it was totally worth it. We tipped extra simply because we had such a great time.

20.description: I only give this restaurant one star because of the service and I don't mean how long it takes to get your food! After two hours we received an overcooked skewer of what should of been great and savory food! The manager and server had many excuses, but were nice. I couldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone! Sorry and really upset that I gave it as a Christmas gift! I even had to light the propane underneath several times when we finally received our fondue appetizer even though they had told us they didn't have it and then apologized after they gave it to the table next to us. They offered to pay the check but I Already used a coupon I bought so it was still costly even though they offered many portions of our meal free. I have to say that after having dinner, I am going home to make dinner!

36.description: Very good, but we were there just after 7 on a Saturday night and there were lots of empty tables -- it was Halloween night, so that likely had an impact.Service was decent, and food was very good. We split a lemon chicken skewer and Greek potatoes, and both were very flavorful and tasty. Kale chips were served while we were sipping our wine waiting for the other items and they were very good. This was my first time having kale chips and they were very good - if you haven't tried them, don't shy away.Prices are reasonable, and our wait wasn't long to get food which was likely helped out by the scant crowd.

14.description: It was here that I realized that I had been to at least 6 unique establishments and had not yet had a bad meal.Sidenote: The Trump, although it's Ritz-Carlton branded, is not actually THE Ritz-Carlton in Chicago.  Call it "Trump" or prepare to deal with some confusion between you and the cabdriver.Now, back to the review.  I got a little bit lost and didn't want to waste the cab fare.  So, I scrolled through bookmarked recommendations and came across this one, not too far from the ACTUAL Ritz-Carlton.  :p  I came here full from a meal that I'd had hours ago.  Frankly, I came to get a little boozed-up and mellowed-out.  Don't judge.  But, I decided to order something to munch on so that I wouldn't look too pathetic sitting at the bar all by myself with a non-girly looking (ei, STRONG) drink in my hand.I ordered a Vieux Carre that came with a Honey Ice Cube.  Then, I ordered a plate of Stuffed Mushrooms.  You know, 'cause I'm a classy lady that eats food while drinking. Riiiight...Anyway, that was the first time I'd ever had a Vieux Carre and it was a variation of the original.  Honestly, who cares?  If it's good, it's good.  And this, my friends, was good.  No, it was fantastic!  Whatever was in it was smooth and well blended.  I couldn't make out distinct sharp flavors.  The ice cube, as it melted, sweetened the drink.  And, as you can see from the picture, I asked for a second ice cube to take with me.  And, I don't care what anyone thinks, that thing was good!  Not as good as when it's floating in a mix of liquors, but still really, really good.  It was difficult to keep my composure and limit myself to just one drink.  But, it was strong and I'd need to find my way back to my hotel.  Enter food, stage left.I thought that the Stuffed Mushrooms would be nibbled at and a bit of a chore to choke down since I'd just eaten.  WRONG.  Overused, but highly appropriate word- "Delicious!"  Another superlative: The best stuffed mushrooms I've ever had!  Simply, the best.  They were stuffed with cheese and rosemary and breadcrumbs and were piping hot and crispy on top and served on a hot skillet with shredded melted cheese on top and stuff.  Maaaaan!  *sigh*  I knife & forked it.  I did.   Kept it together.  But, if I was alone....  it would've been a different story!  It would've been ugly.  Nobody wanted to see what I wanted to do to those mushrooms.Too much?  Okay, I'll pull back.  :p  Simply, the food and drink far surpassed my expectations and not one thing marred my experience. I left full and happy and smiling naughtily to myself in 30-degree whether with a honey ice cube in my hand. :)

3.description: I'm from the west coast, so was super happy to find such a huge variety of things I might need as well as things I definitely do need, like a cold beer. Right around the corner from my hotel. Not only do they have a huge selection of everyday items - like razors, snacks, and TP - but they also have a wonderful craft beer selection. Frankly, I didn't even look or care about the prices, so if you're local you might be taken aback (but seriously, it's the Magnificent Mile). On top of the great selection, the people who were working there were the most helpful and friendliest people I met in Chicago. Look out world, that kid behind the register is going places. I am one happy customer.

1.description: If you are in the area hotels, need snacks, liquor, bottled water or just about anything else you could think of, this place is a life saver. They have EVERYTHING a traveler would need. Great convenience.

2.description: You find good beers for good prices. The others foods are expensive. You need some money to buy some foof in this place. Its good for some people and bad for other people. You find many kinds of foods over there.

5.description: A total diamond in the rough. They have EVERYTHING and I mean Everything you can ever want or even think of. HaaUGEEE wine selection, beer too. Every snack, pharmacy item or jewish/mexican/polish delicacy you EVER MAY NEED. In short, the perfect liquor store for some hotel accouterments but the store is ohhh so soo so much more. I will miss you big east delaware. Always in my

6.description: OK I am staying at the Westin for a meeting, and sick as a dog. I always look for grocery stores near business lodging, and this one is very close. Prices are higher than large supermarkets, but much cheaper than buying breakfast, lunch and dinner out at the local restaurants. Fresh fruit is wonderful, and if you are used to shopping at whole foods market the price is very reasonable. The variety of alcohol products is stunning! And they are not only on several large shelves, the bottles are scattered on ends of aisles here and there. Also strange little items like plastic hair curlers. Very interesting and convenient place. Entrance down the stairs on the southwest corner of the building.

7.description: For a store in a tourist-y area, this isn't bad. Expect to pay more for items that are conveniently located. But if you want some liquor, snacks, wine, or cigars next to your hotel, this is your place. The service is courteous and not overly chatty.

8.description: Just moved into the area.  This place has everything. Especially if you enjoy cocktails, like myself.   They also have great snacks.  You can't go wrong.

9.description: Looking at my portable GPS, I asked the concierge "Which of these 4 grocery stores is best?"  I wanted to avoid a likker store.  I wanted to be able to make a few healthy choices.  I loved her Chicago response "Oh, this one won't have any fresh meat."  "Oh, or fruit."It's Chicago-ish to me because  I would never think to mention "fresh meat."  I would think to mention that produce is unavailable though, but I'm a 16 year vegetarian, with 3 years of veganism under my belt.  I am coming from a different approach, for certain.Remembering Upton Sinclair's "The Jungle," I nod knowingly "Ok, no fresh meat, yes, thank you, this is very, very helpful."  This place is open until 10:30pm and is ridiculously overpriced.  Think $4 for a jar of hummus, $3 for Ak-Mak crackers and $18 for KJ Chard. I do, however, give them props, for having a lot of healthy choices-- you can really get some good frozen veggies and lite yogurts and such, it's just gonna cost you. If you're doing your regular grocery shopping here you've got a problem, but if you're staying at a hotel and want some cheese and crackers, East Delaware Pantry's got yer ticket.

0.description: HIDDEN GEMMy husband and I stayed at The Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel, which is right around the corner.  We were looking for some where to buy a few snacks and bottles of water to keep in our room, so we didnt have to spend the $5 for the small bottle that the hotel was selling.  So we asked our doorman, and he sent us here.  Well, we stopped in at least once a day! They have everything you could possibly need!! Snacks, alcohol, toiletries, beverages, household items, paper products, medicine, cigarettes, EVERYTHING! Its like a little grocery store! Fairly priced, even though its in the middle of a city! So if you are staying in the area and you forgot to pack something, have no fear, just stop in here!!! Also, its easy to walk right past this place, my husband and I did, twice!!! its in the bottom floor of a building, you have to go down a couple of steps to get to the door.  Enjoy!

4.description: Wow.  A 12 pack of bottled water was 8.99 and 12 cans of soda at 7.99 but then again this place was super convenient to our little apt stay Dewitt place.We also figured we would be paying more for soda and water at the trade show we are attending so all in all, totally worth it!

3.description: The gentleman working the morning I went in there was incredibly friendly and helpful!  He asked about the ages of who I was shopping for and showed me many ideas for gifts.  When I said I was looking for souvenirs and space was an issue because I was flying he told me that they offer free shipping!  That sold me!  Picked up a game for each of my loves at home and they arrived within the week.  His suggestions were spot on... my family has been playing them every day since they've arrived.  I wish we lived closer because it was a fun little store with great customer service!

1.description: The perfect store for the Husbeast! if you need something to challenge your brain, you will find it at this store! The staff is amazingly helpful and they encourage you to play with the demo models. They will even engage you with the trivia games that are around. I absolutely wish this was closer because OMG!! The different styles of Rubick's Cubes they have astounded me!  LOVE this store LOVE LOVE LOVE.

2.description: So much yes happening in this place. Not only are these toys entertaining but good for stretching the mind and imagination. I wish I had had these games/toys when I was a kid! So happy I get to enjoy them as an adult!

9.description: The guys working were into what they were selling. Some interesting stuff. Enjoyed the time there with kids.  Yes we purchased!

10.description: My son and I love this store.  They have the coolest games.  They put them out on display so that you can really see them and try them.  The employees are usually happy to show you any game and they will actually play with you so that you can experience the game before buying it.  We've bought several games here already.  Some of these games may look quite simple at first glance, but really make you think and strategize before moving that next piece.  I love that my son loves that!  If I had one wish for this store... it's that it would be bigger.  It can get really difficult to move around on a crowded day.  Otherwise, two thumbs up!

4.description: I had the most fun here than I've had in a store in a very long time. I could spend hours walking around the store, talking (or playing board games) with the staff, shooting 'braindrops' via catapult at other pedestrians and more.

6.description: This is by far the best store my wife & I went in.  Adam & Sean are some of the best people in the whole world. They really make u feel comfortable while giving u all the help u need & will answer any questions u have.  Awesome is the word I use to describe both of these gentleman. Will go back to buy from this store again.  If in the Windy City stop by Marbles : The Brain Store to find a good gift.
