12.description: I absolutely love this store!  I came to this store looking for games to play with my family on Thanksgiving.  You know, the type that doesn't involve a joystick, the internet and me getting dizzy.  What I loved about it instantly were that the employees were not behind a counter and the games all in display cases.  The games were out on display and the employees were eagerly demonstrating them all.  And the store was packed with kids of my niece and nephews ages.  My niece and nephews are avid readers and I found several games including Idiom Addict that were a hit.  I was the life of the party.  Can't wait to go back.

5.description: My 13 year old son and 2 year old daughter loves this store! During this holiday season, stop by Marbles.  They will have something for everybody on your Christmas list.  Not only is the quality of the product excellent, they are mentally and physically good for you. For a fun family time, try out spot it! We never go on vacation without it. We also love square up, goodminton, ogosport disk, shoot the moon, word a round and smart mouth. If you're not sure how a game works, just ask the customer service rep. They are very friendly and happy to help.  I have never encountered a crabby or unhelpful worker at Marbles.

11.description: This is a really cool store. I could easily spend some serious money buying stuff for myself, family and friends. They've got a lot of different games to exercise the old noodle for all ages. From games to brain teasers to puzzles they have a nice selection to choose froml. I purchased this board game called QUORIDOR ( ... yeah .... that's how its spelled) and was told details about the game by a friendly staff member that wasn't annoying and trying to get you to try everything in the store in hopes that you buy something. I will definitely be coming back to this store the next time i'm in the water tower.

8.description: The store and the staff that I encountered (Wednesday 2/26 @ 10am) are both fantastic. There is simply so much to explore and interact with here. I went in with no intention to purchase anything and left happily spending almost $100. I wish I could have purchased 80% of the items in stock. They have everything for young children to adults. I eagerly await this fantastic store's expansion to more locations nationwide. Great for gifts & inspiration.

0.description: I love this store.  I want two or three of everything in the store.  The employees are super helpful.  But this store is a closet.  It is tiny.  And it is always packed.  There are times when I walk by and think about going in, but I just cant with how many people are in there.  I dont have a sense of when their "slow" hours are.  I just wish this could be a bigger store.

7.description: What a great concept for a store! I was  browsing my way down the Magnificent Mile and came across this store.They have games, puzzles and educational computer software, all designed to test the gray matter. Divided into areas testing specific areas and abilities, there's an explanation with each product and an opportunity to try most of them out.The staff are friendly and not at all intimidating even though they look like they might thrash you at any of the games.Sadly, weight restrictions meant no purchases were possible but I so wish we had a store like this back in London

58.description: I live downtown and I've visited this best buy multiple times. Everytime I enter the store I just feel like I'm unwelcomed. All the employees seem too busy to care. Today particularly, I was there to recycle a few of my old electronics. I was "greeted" by Kaleigh, one of the most UNenthusiastic girls I've ever met in my life. She informed that for each piece I would be charged $10, for recycling. I was confused as I could have easily threw them into the dumpster and saved $30. Then she looked at me with her dead eyes and said that I'll get a $10 Best Buy gift card in return - First of all, why didn't she tell me this first? I have no idea - secondly, why does best buy try to lock in your money when you do a good deed to planet earth? I have no idea either. As I presented my third piece, an old laptop, Krappy Kaleigh asked me whether my hard drive have been taken out. I told her no and asked her whether someone can do it for me here. She told me that it'll be another $20 for someone to take 1 minute to take the hard drive out. If they had lend me a screwdriver I could have done it myself. I ended up carrying that heavy old computer home. The whole experience of me trying to be green was completely unpleasant. First the indifferent, incompetent customer service "specialist", then the high unreasonable charges for being green. I will not return to this best buy, or any other best buy for the matter of fact. Well, only to spend my $20 gift card that they forced me to buy.

56.description: We went to the apple store looking for iPhone 4 cases and they didn't have it. Which lead us here. They had a few different kinds. Ended up with one. Service was ok. Nothing special.

29.description: Slow. One cashier at closing the week before Black Friday. Glad there's a Best Buy in the City, but zero customer service.

42.description: This best buy is close to home so I come here a lot to browse, and have made several purchases here as well. The store is very big and has many products to suit a customer looking for simple items, however their inventory depth is a bit lacking. For example they have dslr's cameras but few models except for entry level ones, and they sell the gopro video camera but carry few accessories for it. That is what I mean by depth, they will be able to provide any customer with a product, but you may have to go else where for more accessories, further upgrades, or whatever (depending on product).The staff that I have spoken with are all very helpful and nice and liked to make conversation. This store will suit your needs for browsing and buying easily, but for more specific items, a more specific store might suit you.

23.description: A dying big box store really can't afford poor customer service and allowing their employees to be snippy....twice in a week. Good luck Best Buy, you're dead to me.

47.description: I walked into this John Hancock location of Best Buy wanting to spend my money and knowing exactly what I wanted. In other words, I walked in as a perfect customer. This perfect customer was seriously surprised at the TERRIBLE customer service I experienced. Upon walking in, I encountered two employees. I think they were supposed to be "greeters" but instead they were talking to each other. I waited a moment for them to acknowledge me and finally had to awkwardly disrupt their conversation to have them point me to a section where I could find a flash drive. "Upstairs" they told me. Trekked up the stairs which were a lot of stairs for a girl in work heels. Once there, another worker was immediately there, so looking at the expansive second floor, I asked her where I could find the section I needed. She pointed in a general direction (straight) and said "to the right". Followed her directions, no flash drives in sight. Found another employee who this time led me to the section that was right in back of where I had asked the girl earlier. Before I got the chance to thank the employee that led me to the right section, he was gone. I really felt like this unreal, that maybe I was being punk'd. It's nice that they had a number of employees working in the store. It would be nicer if they actually worked!

8.description: PC ADVENTUREThe job of searching for a white laptop because your Dad likes the color before Christmas is so much fun. I went hunting from Best Buy to Best Buy. Even places that showed 2 in stock couldn't even find them, while I was standing there waiting. Can we say inside store theft? If its in the computer, then how come its not in the lockup cage? Seems suspicious. Finally called on the phone over here and was told they had one. I asked if they could physically find it and secure it for me. The assured me on the phone that they had it in there hands. So I drove down and there it was with a piece of paper with my name on it. Success!Dad was happy with a white laptop and its a PC and not an Apple. I was happy because my painful tour of Chicago Best Buys had come to a successful end. Best Buy was happy because I stopped calling them asking for a white PC.  This location is a great addition to Michigan Ave. Everyone needs things for there gadgets plus we need lots of gadgets. Not many places on this block can hook you up with an HMDI cable. Trust me when your doing a presentation and the Westin wants to charge you $100 to rent a cable. It's so much cheaper to walk over here to Best Buy. I'd rather buy it and have it for future presentations, then rent it for the day. This is the Men's store on Michigan Ave, I could spend a few hours here looking at everything. So when the ladies are over looking at clothes at Water Tower Place, I can be doing guy stuff shopping. We all need an 80 inch TV...right!!!Thanks Best Buy for having a location on Michigan Ave and making it fun for guys to shop again. Plus how cool is it to have a store located in the 4th tallest building in Chicago, considering you're only on floors 1 & 2 of that building. There's always room to move up! When I'm downtown this is always an easy place for me to stop and shop! I love gadgets!

31.description: Joana H.0 friends1 review15 hours agoI went to the best buy on Touhy ave,in Village crossing to return something that was purchased the day prior and they gave me a hard time. They themselves FLAGGED  the product that was bought not Best buy the actual company since I indeed called the number that was given to me and sure enough they had nothing in their system stating that we couldn't return it. So the lady on the phone told us that there should not be a problem going back and returning the item. Which we in fact did we explained the situation to the customer service people at the one in Evanston and they didn't see anything in their system either, so they took the product back and gave us a full refund. So I believe that the store onTtouhy really have inept people working in there from the short overly Plumpy Short Girl who was in the customer service department to the Chip on the shoulder Bald store manager who should keep his snide remarks to himself. Buyer beware they used and excuse that since there was a return on the account in a 90 day period that is why it was FLAGGED so I looked at the date of the return it was dated December 30th 2012 the new policy that was put into place started Janurary 1st of 2013 so this should not pertain to the new policy also SINCE THEY REALLY DON'T KNOW HOW TO DO THE MATH from December 30th to April 24th it has been more than 90 days so they are either VERY STUPID OR JUST PLAIN IGNORANT as to how does customer service really works. It's just a sign of the times since they have indeed had some store closings. Can't compete with stores like Microcenter, New egg, Tiger direct, and ABT. Later all.

34.description: i was truly impressed today, the customer service in this place has come a long way and gone in the write direction. I have been to this location many times and felt like I should go elsewhere to spend my money, but today I didn't get that feeling.

16.description: Nice Best Buy, store is very big. It has two floors. Costumer service task was huge! Second floor was mainly all the products. I would say this Best Buy have more ''hard to find'' products compared to other Best Buy's I have been to. Overall, It was a great Best Buy due to what they offer and the location.

13.description: Twice in the past month I've sought their help and guidance on some basic issues. One involved improving internet connectivity, the other a television related matter and both times I was given product advice and assistance that not only didn't solve my concerns but nearly led to purchases that were unnecessary. Usually tech salesmen and women are some of the best most passionate people of any store I go to, but these guys were just awful and it's a store you  really should not make the mistake I did twice.

11.description: I Purchased the Samsung 7150 55" TV and Sonos Playbar on January 2nd from the 875 N Michigan Ave location in the Hancock building.My sales representative was Rich and the sale price at the time of the TV was $999.99. My scheduled delivery was for January 3rd.  On January 3rd I received a call from Rich telling me that the TV would not be available to ship until Wednesday the 7th.  Rich told me that for my inconvenience he would upgrade me to the 4k version for the same price and would be able to ship it Monday the 5th.I agreed to this offer but quickly reversed my order after researching the specifications of the 4k TV that Rich offered.  I wanted the 7150 because of the 240hz refresh rate rather than the 60hz refresh rate of the 4k version.The manager of the store, Zack, told me that it would be no problem to switch out the order and deliver the 7150 later this week.  About an hour later, Zack called me again and told me that he could not get me the TV and that it is sold out and there is no time frame at all for its delivery.  I told Zack that I don't mind waiting for the TV that I purchased and he told me that he doesn't know if he can make it happen.  After some back and forth questioning, Zack tried one more store to see if he could track a 7150 down.  A few minutes later I received a call from Zack and he flat out told me that he can't get me the tv.  I cancelled my order and have been told to expect my refund in the next 2-5 days.Ok, my question is WHY is the TV still being sold in stores and online?  Why is it not being shown as out of stock if it is impossible for me to get one?  If it is in fact still available than WHY can't I get one?  Why am I being told that it is unavailable with no time frame of it's availability when it is CLEARLY still being sold in your stores and online?  I am extremely upset by this set of circumstances and unfortunately have lost a lot of trust with Best Buy.  This is completely unfair and disheartening to say the least. No fault to Rich and Zack who were both open, frank and easy to work regarding the sale process but I find it extremely hard to believe that there is no time frame on when the said tv will be available.

39.description: I've always been a fan of BB. I went here because (no surprise) my charger for my mac book pro frayed (again) and I wanted to see if it was still covered under my warranty. The guy at geek squad didn't know for sure but he went ahead and created the order and submitted for me. I then went upstairs to get another charger cause really I need it for my mac book, and I was asked 3 times if I needed some help. How many times toes that happen?

37.description: Thank you BestBuy! You have iPhone5 accessories when the Fn apple store does not after 30 days of releasing the phone.

0.description: I See You Best Buy!I had a pretty cool experience at this Best Buy. In fact, I have visited this Best Buy a few times prior to this and each time I seem to attract the coolest employees. I guess I just "got it like that." At any rate, one of the best things about this particular Best Buy is clearly the location. Located on the ground floor of the John Hancock building, it is prime and subject to the "mall crowd." In other words you run a risk of trying to navigate your way through a sea of families that are fully prepared to NOT buy anything - however just there to spend time. I also LOVE the view from the second floor of this building. Mid shopping, I had to take a moment to just stare out the window and look up and around. Sometimes the city still just has this effect on you. The staff at this Best Buy are cool as I stated earlier. One thing I enjoy is that they the staff here...they let you digest the products before they come meandering over to you with whatever sales pitch they've been brainstorming for the past 5-10 minutes they've been watching you browse. In particular, I was approached by the associate Jordan. He was HILARIOUS. A very sarcastic sense of humor that would come across (to some) as pompous, but I resonate well with humors such as his being a performer myself. Provided that I used to be a retail manager, I was very impressed with how easily he made a connection with me and my friend. He shared the appropriate amount and type of personal information without seeming creepy or intrusive - when asking questions about my personal life. We had a great time. Jordan was VERY knowledgeable about product. I am on the market for a new TV and he was able to offer some very nice suggestions based on my budget and needs. He went through all of the pros and cons of the different TVs I was looking for, and made sure that I was prepared for whatever problems - if any - I would have with lesser quality models. The only thing I would have loved for Jordan to do is not hold out on the duration of sales. I am not sure if he was just trying to make a sale right then and there or if he legitimately did not know when the sale was ending for the TVs, but i checked online when I got home, and it was plain and simple that this was a part of their weekly deal. Surely management communicated this with the staff during their morning meetings. Perhaps not. At any rate, I still had a grand time with Jordan.I decided which TV I wanted, and will return after I have had some time to digest the small dent in will leave in my bank account. #AINTNOTIMEFORIMPULSEBUYSBIH*sidenote: These bathrooms are very well maintained. HUGE plus.

38.description: You can't have the magnificent mile without a Best Buy somewhere around there. Well I needed to buy a couple of small things so we walked in. It's 2 floors! Once you walk up, you realize that they do have almost everything. The top floor was quite large. We walked upstairs, picked up the 2 things that we needed, walked back down, paid and left. The staff is very helpful and I like that. Some places I've been to and they don't even bother helping you out. This location has the help you need. I asked them a question which one guy couldn't answer and instead of disappearing on me he walked back with the answer. Good job!! Great customer service!

51.description: I went here today to see if this is where I should buy my first pc. Sean was so nice, he took me step-by-step with every single service/product I would need to enjoy my pc completely. I shook his hand with the promise that I'd return to make my purchase as an early birthday gift. Sean: You Rock!!!

27.description: I called Best Buy's corporate "customer service" number, and spoke to two more supervisors who were somewhat akin to speaking to a brick wall. One supervisor finally rang one of the store managers named Scott in a rather half-hearted attempt to get him to agree to a single exception to their corporate return policy. This is just another page in this ad infinitum saga of returning an item at Best Buy. Sit down, grab a wheelchair because the PS30 will be out by the time Best Buy sorts me out. As one might have expected after several hours of dealing with a company that one must only assume bases their customer service training on the Vancome Lady. Despite being in Scott's power to resolve my complaint, perhaps even turning the whole situation around to be a positive one for both of us, he chose to display a lack of initiative that is almost impressive in his sheer inaction. After he refused to agree to the arbitrator's solution, I called the store and was able to get ahold of the elusive Scott in his office. I explained my situation to him in a much more personal way, assuming that a mere personal chat was much more effective than heavy handed lawsuits, BBB complaints, credit card disputes, and the rest of my arsenal might be. Instead,  Predictably, Scott was just as unwilling and unmoved by my plight as Damian had been the night before. Scott couldn't possibly do a favour as huge as accepting a return past the 15 day mark. His response actually sounded as if I was asking him to give me the keys to the store's safe. He repeated the same tired old cliches that "Best" Buy touts as their comprehensible return policy. Despite the fact that it is a policy that is so verbose that two receipts from Best Buy could wrap around the earth at the equator (that isn't even the whole policy, a webpage or brochure is required if you want the full exclusion list... a list that includes: "We reserve the right to deny ANY return for ANY reason). It reads like the Faustian contract between the Devil and Daniel Webster.Scott, in honour of your lack of initiative, and debateably even a pulse, this review is dedicated to you. I'd call you a common "drone," but I believe that would give a bad name male honey bees (which comes from the Olde English "lazy worker"), and to robots everywhere. I wish I could have said that, "You only did the right thing after all of the other options had been exhausted;" however, even then you still found a way to weasel out of doing such an small act of kindness. Instead of writing a scathing review for the world to view at their leisure about your ignoble lack of attention, I would have mailed you a thank-you card for being my hero, and sticking up for the little man instead of groveling to your corporate master in M.N.

32.description: Firstly, I think it's pretty cool that BB's warehouse is in the basement of the Hancock Building.  That's some expensive storage space!I bought a TV here and found the staff quite helpful.  Ditto for the people at the service/exchange counter.  But the delivery ops leave something to be desired.  Also, probably due to location, the selection is more limited than big-box-style Best Buy shoppers are used to.  And of course Chicago has the second-highest sales tax rate in the nation, so consider that before making a major purchase.

54.description: The staff in this location beats the hell out of the Olympic store in West L.A. There is a greeter and someone who actually points you in the direction of where you want to go. Score!The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Score!The location is awesome, easy to get to!The checkout service is speedy and nice!  Score!

48.description: Do people work on the second floor? They do? Word?? Hm.  I had to contemplate what rating to give this store. If there was a 2.5 option, that's probably what it would have gotten. But I'm nice, so I rounded up. I will give this store some credit because I bought the very laptop I am typing on from there in 2009. It was a quick and painless purchase, and the sales associate obviously did right by me, as the computer hasn't given me any trouble. But that was 2009. Let's bring it back to 2011. I went in yesterday to look at the cameras. My current Kodak hates me and to tell the truth, I'm starting to not feel too fondly about it either. So there I was, lurking around the cameras, picking them up, obviously browsing with the intent to buy, la dee dee, la dee da.......I would have an easier time finding Bin Laden than I did finding someone to help me! The upstairs is pretty vast, and yet I only saw a couple of employees up there. Two of which I know had to have seen me trying to get their attention! I left...I will go to another BB. I will go to Target. I will go anywhere else to get my camera, just not here.

44.description: I went to this Best Buy for the first time on black Friday. I saw a camera that I was interested in buying, the internet price was lower than the store sale price, I pointed this out to one of the associates using my smart phone. The young lady told me that she couldn't match the price of their own website,,, I've never heard any crap like this before! You cannot honor the price on your own website? The young lady said that the online store is a totally separate store. I hate haggling but I couldn't give up on this one, so I spoke with another associate and then to a manager and she gave it to me for the internet price. I walked out of that place like George Jefferson as if I won a major debate. After all of this I still have to say that the people there are very nice and helpful and I would be back to shop there again.

24.description: horrible employees and slow.. look at  you for damn few minutes and don't bother to ask if you need help. i went to buy 55" samsung tv but no one even came to me. i had to ask a few people and they didn't know what the hell they are selling. t purchased that from amazon. i go to this store only if i really really have.. fix the damn attitude...

7.description: As I was waiting, I had enough time to reflect deeply and how the retail experience should be renamed to retardetail experience. "Best buy" should also be changed to "Best to buy in Amazon".It's not lack of good will. I think the people here are good human beings. But maybe they belong to another time. I'm picturing something like selling swords in the middle age.

49.description: I dont know why there are 3 different results for this Best Buy so I guess I will write the review on this one.This review is for the Mobile Center in particular and not the entire store.My wife's Sprint phone was messed up and since we had bought it through Best Buy and have the Best Buy insurance we took it in here to have it checked out.They sent it out to the Geek Squad and it was checked out and they decided to junk it out, which meant she could get a new phone of equal quality and cost.So we went in to visit the Mobile Center and get a replacement phone.  All the employees at the Mobile Center are very nice and helpful.  The department manager for that section took care of us and he was very nice and very helpful.  I would definitely go back into this store and visit the Mobile Center.I cannot attest for the rest of the store since we did not check it all out.

40.description: Great customer service. My boyfriend and I were wandering around the DVD and BluRay racks trying to resist the amazing deals on some really great movies. In fact a few of them were so unbelievable that we had to check the sale shelf-talkers twice to make sure it was the same movie.We went downstairs and as the nice woman at the checkout was ringing us out, one of those fantastic deals was actually not on sale. She and her supervisor (I think) did NOT give us that doubtful and dirty look of disbelief like we read a sign with a one-word titled movie and a price wrong. In fact they were determined to get to the bottom of it. They checked online first, and the regular price popped up. They probably could have stopped there- but no! They asked another equally as helpful salesperson who just happened to work in that department to check on it. When he came back he determined that the movie we wanted was on sale in the less-than-fancy packaging, but they were out of it- we would have bought it if they had it in stock. So instead of shrugging their shoulders, this team got the manager over to do a price adjustment because the sign was unclear (truly it was!).We never had to fuss (we never would), never had to ask, it just happened. And my boyfriend was grateful. And we were impressed. Way to go Best Buy!

53.description: I walked in with a strut and a bad-ass attitude. I announced "This my house!" as the automatic doors opened and I entered. I asked a clerk where the RAM was being held. I was told. I followed instructions and found the RAM. The transaction at the checkout counter between myself and the clerk went off without a hitch. I walked out with my product. Holla!

30.description: If you're a fan of quick and painless transactions, do not get the Geek Squad Protection Plan for your phone!I brought my damaged phone in for the "on the spot" replacement I was promised when I signed up for the insurance plan.  When the representative uttered the words loaner phone I realized I got got.  Apparently the phone has to be sent to a warehouse for processing before they can begin mailing my new phone.  I relinquished my phone on a Thursday and they said it would be ready on Sunday.  I thought that Sunday was a bit odd but what the hell, it's Best Buy.  I'm a pretty patient guy so I really didn't think it would be too terrible... then I saw the "Loaner."The loaner phone is a first generation Android and my original phone is an iPhone 4.  Need I say more?So, Saturday rolls around and I visit the Geek Squad website to check the status of my replacement. Lo and behold, the service order number doesn't work so I have to call.  The representative on the phone looks up the status and explains to me that there has been zero progress.  My damaged phone hadn't even been processed yet.Fast forward to Wednesday, I eventually have a tracking number for the new phone that is being shipped to the Best Buy via UPS.  (For some reason they can't send the new phone directly to me because it has to go through more processing and they have to set it up for me.)  I signed up for SMS updates through the UPS website and one of the updates I received had the word "exception" in it.  I immediately checked the status of the shipment online and learned that the First Delivery Attempt failed... the first attempt failed.  How does that happen?  I understand how it can happen at a residence but at Best Buy during normal operating hours.  I called the store and they explained to me that this never happens, they have an agreement with UPS, blah blah blah.  Not once did I receive an apology.I'm still waiting on my phone...

46.description: Best buy in the Hancock

1.description: This review is about a manager, didn't get his name, behind the customer service desk.  That's right, "Customer Service."  This was around 7pm on Tuesday, February 23rd.I needed to return an apple watch I got for my GF.  She opened it, tried it on and said no thanks. I was within the return period.  There was a young lady helping me, and said their internal system said the watch was still locked. For some reason, even though the phone wasn't paired, it was marked as locked and un-returnable. I had the receipt and everything, with the exception of the phone that was "paired" with the watch which was all the way back in California with her.  This manager was horrible.  Rather than come to me and explain the first time how to unpair a watch that isn't actually paired with a phone, the girl would go to him with my questions and I would watch him shrug his shoulders from afar like "oh well, we can't take it back" not once, but 3 times.  Finally, I tried to make this guy do his job and actually try to MANAGE the sitaution.  He was very condescending.  I work in IT, I am tech saavy, and own my own Apple Watch.  He had no resolution to the situation.  Just told me sorry, I can't take it back.  I sat there in front of his face the next 45 minutes until I figured out how to do his job for him, unlock the watch, and get my money back.I provided every piece of information, including her iCloud info, mine, etc.  I DGAF if it's still paired with a phone.  If it's within 15 days of purchase and the serial numbers match, send that shit back to apple and have them fix it for you.  They know it isn't stolen in that case.  Don't make me waste 1 hour of my time googling how to do it myself.  And get a new job.  Cause service isn't your thing, coming from a retail and service industry veteran.Target and Wal-Mart sell electronics too. And they aren't dicks.

55.description: Amazing Service! My husband and I went in here tonight to buy a DVD player - yes, we are probably the only souls left on earth that don't have one of these things. We ended up looking at a home theatre system that was on clearance. A young man, Royal, helped us out. Seriously....Royal should get an A++++++ for effort, assistance, support, etc. He must have stayed with us for about 30 min explaining everything (without being pushy). He was informative and it was just what we needed. We ended up buying a wifi blue ray dvd player, but have some serious interest in a Bose home theatre system that we wanted to think about a little more. I have a pretty good feeling we will purchase the Bose though and when we do, we will absolutely buy it from Royal.

9.description: I came here to buy a video game for Wii U and I found it. I came here early in the morning, so there were many employees standing along the aisles and staring, I think they were there to give people help, but since there was no one there to help they stood there like that. I would do the same thing if I worked there and was tired. Let's see. This song, "Chasing Cars", played on one of the test radios. I was thinking about rating this best buy a 1/5 for such a sin, but that would be ridiculous. I was going to buy AA batteries, too, but saw they were much cheaper on Amazon and so I bought them on Amazon. Somehow, the order came the next day, even though I ordered on Saturday iwth 2 Day Shipping. I'm okay with this.My Shopping Partner purchased a keyboard for $50. It was an Apple Keyboard and it's the same one I permanently borrowed from somewhere. It works well.A 5/5 shopping experience.

26.description: went in to the geek squad services to see what was wrong with my mac that i bought in January.My external hard drive was not working but worked on all other macs so i knew it was my laptop.went in, they tested the usb ports. they didn't work. couldn't figure out what it was, DIDN"T EVEN RESTART IT EITHER....so they said they would need to take it in for 2 to 3 weeks to figure it out. TWO TO THREE WEEKS? THATS CRAZY.i took it back home to back my stuff up before taking it, but then my friend said the apple store has a 1 year guarantee on all apple products. so i made an appointment and went in, the guy said, have you tried restarting it? well no i didn't even think of that...he restarted it, and it worked!i would just think best buy being experts in electronics, they would have restarted it instead of telling me to leave it for 2 weeks...

25.description: Just like any other Best Buy but this place has limited selection since it's a smaller place located in the Hancock building in the heart of Chicago.  There are plenty of staff lounging around instead of helping customers. Don't expect to find parking unless it's private which will cost you about the cost of a blu-ray disc.

12.description: Terrible customer service. The manager in the TV section told me he's going to sell the anyways, I should be thankful that he's willing to cut $50 off because the one that I asked for is out of stock and they told me they are available. Very rude! Even it is very nice that you are willing to give a discount, that doesn't mean we owe you anything and you are a god or something.

59.description: I frickin love Best Buy.  It's my favorite store and I spend thousands of dollars there a year.  But if they were all like this one, I would never shop there.  I walked around and around the camera's for about a half hour looking for one in particular, checking them out, looking at features and etc.  Not a single person asked to help, smiled or even looked at me.  Finally, I said forget it and left.Even on the way out they looked at me like they were burdened by the fact that they might have actually had to help me.  I'm a normal dude, that showers once sometimes twice a day and I dress normal, so it's not like I am some dude that looks like "oh shoot, I gotta help this guy!!??".I actually planned on spending $750 dollars there that day on the camera and the new Xbox, but instead I just got them both at different stores, which is saying a lot because I ALWAYS buy my electronics and toys from Best Buy.

21.description: We started our adventure with returning my iPad which was in really good condition.  The power cord, however, was not.  There was a break in the plastic covering that I covered with scotch tape.  I didn't think it was a major deal but when listed in the B.B. computer as poor condition it knocked $50 off the exchange offer.  That was completely insane to me considering you can buy a brand new Apple iPhone/iPad charger for $30.  I surrendered my newer cord just to get the $50.We were escorted upstairs to purchase the MacBook Air I had my eye on.  The B.B. website was showing 5 in stock however, the sales rep insisted there weren't any in back.  Fortunately, we had a customer service rep with us who encouraged him to keep looking.  Finally, they found the Air and we purchased it.There was a ton of drama around a newly opened credit account that I won't delve into because it was the fault of worst bank to deal with (Citi), not Best Buy.  The shining example of good customer service came from this as the assistant manager helped us immensely to try and get things rolling.We ended up closing the account over the phone and paying otherwise.  At the end of the ordeal the assistant manager apologized for the inconvenience and asked us to come back again so he could take care of us.We will definitely return to this location because of the focus on customer service.

17.description: Best buy is probably the worst buy.  When the word "Best" and "Buy" are together, you presume good prices.  This is probably the best place to go where they are certain to get the best buy off of you.   Like most corporations, they also try to sell you special cards and garbage that you don't want at a register.  Not to mention, 1 year insurance for appliances for a low price (a few bucks), but fail to mention that all manufacturers have a 1 year guarantee (that is FREE) anyway.  Why would you scam people like that? Oh yea, its a business.  Not to mention, if you want some help on electronics that is good for you, check a review on-line and buy it whole-sale of the internet.  Clerks here, either have no idea 90% of the time, or you'll get lucky with someone who knows how to reach their sales goal and give you something they are probably trying to get rid of.  Topped with promises that it's the best item, but I'm sure you know how businesses work.I did give it an extra star though, because it still has a use.If you can't find electronics or products anywhere else on Earth... than maybe, this is the best buy for you.

10.description: We started our adventure with returning my iPad which was in really good condition.  The power cord, however, was not.  There was a break in the plastic covering that I covered with scotch tape.  I didn't think it was a major deal but when listed in the B.B. computer as poor condition it knocked $50 off the exchange offer.  That was completely insane to me considering you can buy a brand new Apple iPhone/iPad charger for $30.  I surrendered my newer cord just to get the $50.We were escorted upstairs to purchase the MacBook Air I had my eye on.  The B.B. website was showing 5 in stock however, the sales rep insisted there weren't any in back.  Fortunately, we had a customer service rep with us who encouraged him to keep looking.  Finally, they found the Air and we purchased it.There was a ton of drama around a newly opened credit account that I won't delve into because it was the fault of worst bank to deal with (Citi), not Best Buy.  The shining example of good customer service came from this as the assistant manager helped us immensely to try and get things rolling.We ended up closing the account over the phone and paying otherwise.  At the end of the ordeal the assistant manager apologized for the inconvenience and asked us to come back again so he could take care of us.We will definitely return to this location because of the focus on customer service.

5.description: I went in looking for a very specific item. Having had terrible experiences before, I started looking for it on my own. When I couldn't find what I was looking for, I took a chance and asked the kid working behind the checkout stand in the second floor. "Nah, I don't think we have that..." *goes back to talking to his coworker*. I kept looking and ended up finding EXACTLY what I had gone in for. Took it straight to the register, same kid and said "found what I was looking for." He asks where I found it, which happened to be right in front of where he was standing the whole time. "Oh that probably why I've never seen it." He then proceeded to be the most incompetent cashier I've ever had check me out before.

3.description: Don't shop at this Best Buy or any other for that matter. The customer service is horrible. The associate was condescending in his interaction with me and told me false information about a TV I purchased. Then when I bought the TV and had it scheduled for 10 days out, they never notified me that the delivery was canceled and needed to be rescheduled - I called the day of to find that out. So now I have to take another entire Saturday out of my schedule after I already had to pull strings for this Saturday to work. Worst of all, they didn't even apologize about the situation. I will never be doing business with Best Buy again, nor recommending them to friends and family.

35.description: Hey, Best Buy. You might want to tell your employees that on Black Friday of all freaking days, they might want to speed up a bit. Unfortunately, Best Buy was the only place offering a sale for the phone I wanted. I went later in the day, so I was actually seen rather quickly. But MY GOD was she slow. Every opportunity she got, she would chat with a coworker, talk about her precious nail art (seriously), or just kind of wander around. She took forever for a simple transaction. On any other day I might not have minded the inane chatter than spewed out of her mouth, but it was such a zoo in there I just wanted to get in and out, yet she made that impossible. Maybe she should try some ADD meds or something. I hate Best Buy.

19.description: This is my favorite Best Buy in the world and it best not go out of business! I can't take anymore...First it was Field's, then Borders...this is the sole survivor of my three favs on this short stretch of the Mag Mile. I'm a long-time Best Buy fan in general and a fan of this location specifically.  Customer service was exceptional.  I like the design of this store and it's multi-level-ness. It's got more personality than any other BBY since it isn't in "big box" store layout where everything hits you the moment you walk in. You can explore this store.  I know there's this "shop here and buy online" mentality and I was a sucker for that, in 2007,....for one purchase. A laptop situation gone very wrong. I'll never do that again. I'm all for "best price" but I also value excellent service + "peace of mind" and I've been fortunate enough to receive that from Best Buy. I also like their "Rewards Zone" program and I earn a ton of cash back (well, cash to use in the store and it goes a long way. I've found it to be an easy program to use.) The other thing I enjoy about this store in particular is the amazing entrance into the Hancock building. You walk in the storefront off the Michigan Ave plaza there and then may exit into the gleaming hallway of one of Chicago's iconic buildings. It's more than just "another Best Buy" for me...it's an experience unique to Chicago. Makes me want to buy a bigger flat screen and then take the elevator up to the 96th Floor Lounge...just to toast everything that is "great viewing."

28.description: PC ADVENTUREThe job of searching for a white laptop because your Dad likes the color before Christmas is so much fun. I went hunting from Best Buy to Best Buy. Even places that showed 2 in stock couldn't even find them, while I was standing there waiting. Can we say inside store theft? If its in the computer, then how come its not in the lockup cage? Seems suspicious. Finally called on the phone over here and was told they had one. I asked if they could physically find it and secure it for me. The assured me on the phone that they had it in there hands. So I drove down and there it was with a piece of paper with my name on it. Success!Dad was happy with a white laptop and its a PC and not an Apple. I was happy because my painful tour of Chicago Best Buys had come to a successful end. Best Buy was happy because I stopped calling them asking for a white PC.  This location is a great addition to Michigan Ave. Everyone needs things for there gadgets plus we need lots of gadgets. Not many places on this block can hook you up with an HMDI cable. Trust me when your doing a presentation and the Westin wants to charge you $100 to rent a cable. It's so much cheaper to walk over here to Best Buy. I'd rather buy it and have it for future presentations, then rent it for the day. This is the Men's store on Michigan Ave, I could spend a few hours here looking at everything. So when the ladies are over looking at clothes at Water Tower Place, I can be doing guy stuff shopping. We all need an 80 inch TV...right!!!Thanks Best Buy for having a location on Michigan Ave and making it fun for guys to shop again. Plus how cool is it to have a store located in the 4th tallest building in Chicago, considering you're only on floors 1 & 2 of that building. There's always room to move up! When I'm downtown this is always an easy place for me to stop and shop! I love gadgets!

45.description: For my 666th review, may I present my thoughts on Best Buy:I HATE this Best Buy. They're fucking idiots. Dumb bitches.

33.description: This is my favorite Best Buy in the world and it best not go out of business! I can't take anymore...First it was Field's, then Borders...this is the sole survivor of my three favs on this short stretch of the Mag Mile. I'm a long-time Best Buy fan in general and a fan of this location specifically.  Customer service was exceptional.  I like the design of this store and it's multi-level-ness. It's got more personality than any other BBY since it isn't in "big box" store layout where everything hits you the moment you walk in. You can explore this store.  I know there's this "shop here and buy online" mentality and I was a sucker for that, in 2007,....for one purchase. A laptop situation gone very wrong. I'll never do that again. I'm all for "best price" but I also value excellent service + "peace of mind" and I've been fortunate enough to receive that from Best Buy. I also like their "Rewards Zone" program and I earn a ton of cash back (well, cash to use in the store and it goes a long way. I've found it to be an easy program to use.) The other thing I enjoy about this store in particular is the amazing entrance into the Hancock building. You walk in the storefront off the Michigan Ave plaza there and then may exit into the gleaming hallway of one of Chicago's iconic buildings. It's more than just "another Best Buy" for me...it's an experience unique to Chicago. Makes me want to buy a bigger flat screen and then take the elevator up to the 96th Floor Lounge...just to toast everything that is "great viewing."

43.description: I like the quirky design of this Best Buy but the staff was rude to us and the selections were not there. The employees at the checkout were very friendly but the sales staff was just plain rude while we were in there. We asked about some games that weren't on the shelf, but were included with some bundled items. They acted like we were asking for them to change the gravitational pull of the earth its4elf. All I wanted was for them to open a box and give me the game, which they confirmed they could do. I'll give it another chance eventually.

2.description: I just popped into this BB to see how it is and how it compares to the kind of urban big box stores we have in Toronto.  It's a pretty big store considering some of the things they sell are sort of big (large tv's) but they have basically everything you would seem to find in a normal Best Buy except for the large square foot print.  Still, if you lived in the John Hancock Center how cool would it be that if you wanted to buy a PS4 game would be just to take an elevator down.  JHC has a large plaza footprint recessed from Michigan Ave so seeing this store is not an issue even though it's technically inside oft the JHC.  The storefront faces west towards North Michigan Ave.

18.description: Just like any other Best Buy but this place has limited selection since it's a smaller place located in the Hancock building in the heart of Chicago.  There are plenty of staff lounging around instead of helping customers. Don't expect to find parking unless it's private which will cost you about the cost of a blu-ray disc.

41.description: It's nice to have this in the neighborhood, however this store has a very limited inventory compared to most Best Buys.

52.description: Store reviewElectronic paradise for a price! I was happy they opened a Best Buy in streeterville over the past year. Without this store, residents would be severely limited by the ability to purchase electronic TV, cameras, and other goods in this area. Although online shopping i.e. Amazon probably trumps buying at Best Buy, when you need to buy a LCD TV you want to see it before dropping over your paycheck. Service is fair, but due to tourist buying up cameras like they are free, it is often hard to find someone to help. Bottom floor has GPS, phones, and other small portable electronics. The upstairs plethra of video game systems, cameras, home electronics, and a/v equipment. Good place to have especially when you need an ink cartridge or other electronic goods that can't wait for the 2-5 day shipping....Pros: although it is located in Streeterville, excellent store design to pack as much product as possible. no markup from other suburban best buyCons: the brick and mortar is a dying breed as online prices are cheaperHidden deals: Sign up for best buy zone rewards to earn money back. Also coupons for 10% in the mail for extra savings

50.description: One of the smaller Best  Buys that I have been to. However, this isn't to say that this is a bad thing. The staff is hit or miss. You can either get someone who wants to help you or someone who is just there get a paycheck. Came here a couple times. Had some 5-star service. Also had some 1-star service. So from my experience, a 3-star rating seems fitting.

4.description: I came to this location to turn in some old cell phones and a laptop computer which was simple...I took it straight to the customer service desk. However, I then went upstairs to buy a CD/DVD external drive and walked around for a while and could not find it. A lot of the reps were busy but a few were standing around talking. I had to go to one to ask to help me and then when he showed me where it was he walked away. I still had questions so the guy at the register was kind to find him again and ask him. The store is nice but I think they need to work on their customer service upstairs. The item was the same price at Target.

6.description: I ordered an item for my husband to pick up at this location.  My husband is a patient man, but after waiting in the Store Pick Up line for 20 minutes while the only available employee lackadaisically (half-a $$edly)  assisted a man with a transaction that should have occurred in the Customer Service line, my husband said "f%ck it" and left the purchase at the store.  There was no one NO ONE working at the Customer Service desk.  There were employees standing around doing nothing. The only employees who were actually working were the security guards.

22.description: This is probably the crappiest Best Buy I have ever been to. The staff was friendly, but that is the only positive thing I can say. The selection of EVERYTHING is sparse, especially the DVD's, and the layout is bizarre, as it occupies a space at the bottom of John Hancock which was clearly not intended for a store like this.

15.description: Don't say you're going to put an item on hold if you're not actually going to. Wasted a good hour of my precious time coming here for an item that I was told would be reserved for me, but it was sold out by the time I got here. Also redhead at store pickup gave me sass. I get that you guys get calls for specific items all the time, but if you tell me an item is on hold, I expect it to be on hold, and you have no right to give me attitude if you I am just asking about an item you said was reserved for me.

57.description: I would like to qualify this review to note that it only applies to the location at the Hancock Tower in Chicago.  I am, and will probably always be a HUGE Best Buy fan.  I am a rewardzone member, and regularly spend thousands of dollars here, year after year.With that said, this locations blows a big fat one.  My wife and I were on vacation, and our camera stopped working properly.  So we decided to go to BB, since that is where we usually go for electronics.  After looking around for 20-30 minutes, someone finally asked us if we needed help.  We asked if we could purchase a camera.  When the guy came back he said that they were out, and left.  He never once offered to check another location, or offer to order it for us.  Like others have stated, the employees downstairs for the most part were standing around talking to each other, not really working.I honestly don't understand how such dumbass people got, and keep jobs at this seemingly key store location.

20.description: I purchased one HP laptop from this store on July 12th. As per the product manual the said laptop will give the battery life of 4 hours. But unfortunately it was not given 4 hours. I was not happy with the product. I went to return back to that particular store where I purchased it within 6 days. They claimed that its not proper in set up and have virus in computer all lame excuses. I couldn't understand why they advertise that they will take back/ return it back within 15 days. They behaved very roughly and said they will not return it back.  I will not buy again from best buy if I can't give any 2nd thought after purchase. I met with Mr. Jason and he was not agreed to take back a 6 days old product which is defective one.

36.description: Very poor customer service!  I wanted to buy a Bose speaker for my iPhone and there were four employees jaw jacking behind the counter.  They couldn't figure out who would go into the back to get it.  They looked at me as if I had interrupted the most important conversation of their lives.  I guess Worst Buy still lives up to my very low expectations.  I miss Circuit City.

14.description: Zero star only for one employee who works at the store, Joseph O(who said he is the sales communication manager). Five stars for all other very helpful staff. Location: Best Buy 875 N. Michigan Ave, Chicago,IL(John Hancock Building)Employee: Joseph O( who declined to tell me his last name, but did state that he is the sales communication manager in the store, other title would probably seem less ironic)Event: We went to the store looking for selfie stick. Front desk told us even though we can not try and purchase but we can however purchase and try, if we don't like the selfie stick we can always return it. Sounds good! So we purchased the selfie stick and asked an employee who happened to be standing near by( Joseph O!) if there is anyone who might be able to show us how to use the selfie stick. He mentioned that the man who works at the camera department is the best one but we might have to wait 15-20 minutes for him. That's fine so we waited. After 20 minutes wait we finally got a chance to talk to the man who works at the camera department, he informed us he will charge us $30 for showing us how to use the selfie stick(I understand time is very valuable for them as well, but the selfie stick itself costs $24 before tax). Confused,we went downstairs again asking the front desk about this purchase and try, and Mr Joseph O happened to be standing next to him. He said:" that is right, it is a company policy to charge money show customer how to use products for things that take more than 15 minutes, just FYI, selfie stick takes less than 5 minutes).I said:" but the front desk told us we can purchase and try". He said:" well, he is just the security guy". Well, since it is the company policy to charge customer for demonstration, why didn't you informed us at the front desk before we purchase? And why didn't you, Joseph O,informe us while we explicitly asked you if anyone can show us how to use the selfie stick? Before we waited for so long? If you believe you behave professionally the whole time, definitely not cocky or rude and you the  "sales communication manager" slightly value your customer, why did you say"I do not have to tell you my name"? We were finally helped by all the other wonderful employees worked at the same store and it was otherwise a great purchasing experience.

58.description: Tucked away in back of the food court, this place is a gem and I look forward to returning. My bacon burger was huge and great tasting. My niece thought the tuna tacos were amazing. My son also loved his bacon burger, on which he had extra bacon. While it did take a while to get our food, when it arrived it was fresh off the grill. For the drinks, many of the items were from local sources. My son enjoyed Sprecher's Creme Soda and I especially liked the Eugene Porter.

56.description: I always get the skirt steak when I come here. It is cooked to your liking, and comes with mushrooms, and mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes is creamy, but has some little potato chunks..it's perfect! The sauce that comes with the skirt stake compliments it perfectly, and will leave you wanting more after you're done! Also, every Sunday for dinner the entrees are all $15 so you can't beat that price! You gotta try this place!

29.description: Hanging out with the boyfriend for dinner and drinks before the train home! Justine and Gabriel were AMAZING! Friendliest servers I've had in years! Not only was food scrumptious, the staff was badass! Keep it up my friends!

42.description: Came on $6 Martini night!!! Bonus right off the bat. I ordered the chicken enchiladas and they were absolutely amazing. Definitely recommend and I am coming back!!!!

23.description: Went to mitynice last evening for the first time. Was told by a friend to stop in for a martini and an appetizer. We didn't have much hope for it since it was hard to find, we even had to ask the mall security where to find it.. but once we were in there it was amazing!!!!!! First off, the host sat us right away at a table near the bar.. she was very sweet and made small talk with us on the way to the table, and she genuinely seemed like she cared about our hardship to find the restaurant! (didn't get her name, but she had cute glasses on!)  Next, the bartender was super quick in introducing herself and getting our drinks ( her name was Tracy, we highly recommend her!) then came our food...... OH MY GOODNESS!!!!!!! the burgers were phenomenal! The food came quick and hot,always the best combo. Overall, we had an amazing experience, we will recommend mitynice to all of our friends from now on...and we will be back next week!!!

47.description: My mom insisted that we go here for dinner to entertain some out of towner guests prior to a wedding we were having. The food menu selection was great and they even had a gluten free menu. The cocktails were delicious but the food was mediocre. We ordered the Sonoma Salad and after a bite we had to send it back, it was overly salty none of us were able to eat more than that. We also ordered broiled lake superior white fish and the skirt steak. The fish was bland and the skirt steak was overly salted. Our waitress was nice but we had an early dinner and the restaurant was dead and we a little more service would have been appreciated. I don't think I would return but for a quick dinner to please a handful of different people this was a decent not expensive choice.

8.description: Mity Nice Grill was mity nice!! I had been here once a long time ago and barely remember my experience in detail. However, I remember it being pretty good and family friendly. We had a reservation at Girl and a Goat for that evening. Not sure why, though I waited for months for a reservation there, each time I had to cancel. Our party grew and now it involved two toddlers and we decided to switch venue. I suggested Mity Nice Grill and everyone agreed.We were a little late due to traffic from Shedd Aquarium, but they were very accommodating with our reservation. No problem at all. When we got there, our table was set up with two high chairs and we were greeted right away with some cheesy poofs. It was like a mini popover but very cheesy. It was good. The table gobbled them up in no time!We ordered guacamole to start that was great! They're garlicky, fresh, and had a little kick. Too bad the kids who usually liked avocado didn't care for it because it was a little spicy. The adults loved it though. My sister who loves root beer was so impressed they had a whole root beer menu along with alcoholic root beer.My mom who loves French Onion soup boasted that it was best she had. It was pretty damn good I had to agree. It was soo cheesy and the soup itself was sweet from onion and not salty like it usually is. The chicken and kale soup was also delicious and light. Everyone seemed to enjoy their entrees. At first, we all wanted the fish special or the white fish in lemon butter sauce. However, most of us changed our mind since we just got back from Shedd Aquarium and didn't have the heart to eat fish after looking at how they were swimming around totally alive in aquariums. Except, my heartless sister. My sister went with the fish special and loved it. I went with the terri d chicken that was so good and sister in law enjoyed her filet mignon pot roast. The kids had some mac and cheese that was pretty good as well.Desserts.. The cookie skillet and the blueberry crostada were great! Yumm!! Overall, the food was great!It was no surprise. We can always count on a Lettuce restaurant. Though not fancy and overly gourmet, it was a great family meal. Plus, prices were very reasonable. We also thought the dad from Family Ties was eating with his family on the table next to us. It was a mity nice meal. Parking can be validated if you parked at Water Tower with a minimum purchase of $10. A couple of low notes, refills were slow and they didn't give us clean silverware for desserts. However, everything else was awesome.

31.description: We came in for an early lunch/late brunch planning to do some shopping damage on Michigan Ave after eating. At 11:30 AM, the place was pretty empty despite the area teeming with tourists on the holiday weekend. I ordered the Apple Cinnamon French Toast, not really knowing what that would be. It turns out to be almost identical to the Cinnamon Apple Pancake for the Original Pancake House. Except it is about 2/3 the size and 2/3 the cost. That really isn't a criticism. I LOVE the Cinnamon Apple Pancake at Original Pancake House, and I absolutely loved this dish as well - but it really wasn't what I expected for French Toast. It has the advantage over the Pancake House  version in that it is a more manageable size (the Original Pancake House version is really a meal for 2 very hungry people - this can be eaten by one with only moderate amount of guilt for overeating). My wife had the Chopped Chicken Salad which she said was terrific - also a huge portion. As a pass out before the meal, they gave gluten free pop overs that were very tasty. Overall, excellent food, excellent service, excellent ambiance. A definite 5 star rating.

34.description: Yeah, we ended up having our last meal in Chicago in what looked like a mall food court. What of it?For some reason, all the entrees were priced at only $15 for lunch that day. So I got a really juicy, tender skirt steak with a K2-sized pile of mashed potatoes for less than I spent on a single drink at other places in town. No complaints here.The salad that came with the entree was a surprising treat. It's sad that nowadays I get excited when someone has actual spring greens instead of gross iceberg or a pile of romaine hearts, but I guess we've come to that point of American history. (Our daughter's daughters will look back on these days and wonder how we made it past them.)The cheesy popovers they serve before the meal are a chewy delight. The boozy root beer is a delight. The lemon mousse angel food cake is a sweet and tangy delight. Honestly, if you can get past the IKEA food court ambiance you have to walk through to get yourself to a table at Mity Nice, it's really a great meal.

16.description: The best gluten free bun I have had and the burger was great. The cheddar pops were a very pleasant surprise. Our server, Krista, was very good. We would come back here any time.

13.description: The service is pretty good!! I love the deco in the restaurant! Root beer rocks! The Acapulco Salad is amazing!! Baka tuna tacos are also amazing! The tuna was half done with the freshness of a pink color in the middle and it tastes so tender:)) love this place!!! And the free cheese puffs???!!!! Uhmmmm:))

11.description: Yeah, we ended up having our last meal in Chicago in what looked like a mall food court. What of it?For some reason, all the entrees were priced at only $15 for lunch that day. So I got a really juicy, tender skirt steak with a K2-sized pile of mashed potatoes for less than I spent on a single drink at other places in town. No complaints here.The salad that came with the entree was a surprising treat. It's sad that nowadays I get excited when someone has actual spring greens instead of gross iceberg or a pile of romaine hearts, but I guess we've come to that point of American history. (Our daughter's daughters will look back on these days and wonder how we made it past them.)The cheesy popovers they serve before the meal are a chewy delight. The boozy root beer is a delight. The lemon mousse angel food cake is a sweet and tangy delight. Honestly, if you can get past the IKEA food court ambiance you have to walk through to get yourself to a table at Mity Nice, it's really a great meal.

39.description: Fritzys burger is AMAZING!!! Huge burger and so flavorful. French onion soup is great as well. The complimentary cheese bread is awesome. Go very very hungry. Portions ate huge!

37.description: Stopped here for a quick glass of wine and an app (hummus & pita) before dinner. This place is tucked in the back of the Water Tower Place food court, but it's pretty nice. Can't say much about the food, but the wine was great and the bartender was friendly.

0.description: A solid place to eat in the Water Tower building.  Follow the footprint pictures on the ground in the food court to find it!We went for restaurant week, and got a TON of food for $22 a person, along with an included glass of wine!  The deviled eggs were fabulous, with bacon both on top and mixed into the yolks :)  The real highlight of the meal was dessert, though- a freshly baked cookie served right in the skillet with ice cream on top!  After requesting it to be served slightly undercooked and a little gooey in the center, it was so perfect that I so wish I had another one right now!Other foods:-The trout dip was decent and not overbearingly fishy tasting-The salsa was gross, and was basically just tomato paste-The chopped salad was really good, but nothing out of the ordinaryAll in all, a solid meal, but nothing to go out of your way for.  Definitely worth the RW price!

38.description: (first of all - I see on Yelp this is described as Mexican - NOT true...  I'd call it American.)  I really like this place.  A group of us go at least once every couple months as we do theatre in the area.  The food is very good - their chicken terri d is fabulous!  Good burgers, good apps.  It's always on point and the rolls they serve at the table are fantastic!   They are like unsweetened cream puffs- can't figure them out, but I love them.   I've never had bad service here - wait staff always friendly and pleasant.  Unlike the maitre d' who always has a scowl on his face and looks annoyed to seat you. Never have seen the man smile - but alas - I ignore him and  enjoy the place.  Great bar too - best bleu cheese stuffed olives.   You see all kinds in this place - from old neighbors that have been going in for years, to tourists to folks like me that know it's there.  It's in the back of the food court in Water Tower.  So not being a food court person one would not know it was there.  And for some stupid reason, they give you a piece of paper when you go into the court area on your way to the Grill and you're supposed to give it back to these ushers on the way out.  I finally asked - what is this for?  And they told me, twice now, it shows you paid.  Ha!  Have no idea how, as it sits in my pocket the entire time, no one at the restaurant looks at it or stamps it - so I have NO idea why they kill trees to hand this out.  BUT...  Go there when you're in the 'hood.  You will not be disappointed.    Get the door guy to smile, will ya?

51.description: We were skeptical since it was in the mall, but we had an amazing experience! My family and I stopped there for a meal and a beer after a tough week with family matters. We had GREAT service, from Natalie, who was super chipper and attentive. The manager (?) who brought our beers was also very accommodating and friendly. At the table, we ordered salads, which were delicious, as well as the chicken pot pie and whitefish. We all loved our food and loved the atmosphere. Our experience there was phenomenal. Natalie even gave us a special treat on our way out! We even stopped to tell the manager. So thanks Mity Nice. You all were super nice and had delicious food! Will recommend to all visitors :)

27.description: Meat and potatoes r great. This place is loaded with senior citizens. Makes sense since the pot roast and meat load r delicious! Beware we came on vacation, thought bingo was going to break out at any moment. Good local draft beers !

32.description: What an excellent find thanks to Yelp! Looking for a place for lunch while staying in a nearby hotel, we would have never ventured into the food court of a shopping center. Thankfully, we made a reservation as the place was packed by noon on a Friday. We loved the food and the away from the mall atmosphere. This place worked perfectly for us as a lunch destination, not a side trip while shopping.

54.description: Its LEYE so you know its pretty solid.  Its a great place to take out-of-towners when you're shopping or seeing a show at the Lookingglass.  Its a touch confusing since you have to go into Food Life to get to the host stand, but they do take reservations which I recommend you do.True to LEYE form, once inside the service is great.  People are giving you bread and water (the same gougeres as Reel Club) and they have a really nice selection of diner food.  Burgers, salads etc.  They also have some craft root beers which is definitely a highlight.  Salted caramel & butterscotch were the favorites of the table.  I was with a big group so there were a mix of items.  Chicken nachos, mac 'n cheese, turkey burgers, meatloaf, cob salad.  We were too full for desserts!  Its all good quality, served hot food.  If you're on Michigan Ave and not interested in a 2 hr wait for Cheesecake Factory then give it a try.

48.description: Mity Nice Grill is a great option for a relaxed dining experience when you want to take a break from shopping on Michigan Avenue and don't want a slice of pizza at the food court. The restaurant is tucked away on the lower level of WaterTower Place just beyond the busy food court. We stopped in and sat at the bar, ordered the rotisserie chicken salad to share and a couple local draft beers. The salad was a perfect light lunch.

44.description: Went here based on other reviews.  Much thanks to the other reviewers who posted tips on how to find the place.  It is in Water Tower Place, just past Food Life in the food court area.  If you dine in be sure to go see the guy sitting in a chair handing out the little pieces of paper for the number of people in your party.  If you're coming here expecting fantastic food, you might be a bit disappointed.  If you're coming here looking for something akin to Chili's, you'll probably sated.  We tried the green chili chicken nachos, French onion soup, Chicken pot pie, and fish n chips.  I thought the French onion soup was pretty good.  The concept and flavors of the green chili chicken nachos were really good but poorly executed.  The chips were extremely soggy and the dish could not be eaten without forks. Flavors were great though.  Hubby was very pleased with the fish n chips.  I guess I'm a little pickier because I didn't really think they were all that great but hey I wasn't eating them really.  Chicken pot pie was more of a vol-au-vent (made with puff pastry) than traditional pot pie but I rather liked the idea of it.  Again though, execution was really really poor.  My dish was cold and the flavor was off.  It seemed like a random medley of vegetables as I found things other than those listed on the menu in the mix (i.e. roasted red bell pepper, green chilis).  Either way, the food was decent for what it was and when put in perspective of the type of establishment- a fast paced, mall eatery similar to a local Chili's but with a better sounding menu.

24.description: The food here is great. My stomach was upset so I didn't get anything fancy but the Mac and cheese was fantastic. My sister got a burger which was great. Elise was an amazing server even though it looked like she was bartender. Highly recommend. My sister is gluten free and they had a good gluten menu choice and she didn't get sick after so it was actually gluten free. Hip place as well.

7.description: The beginning of winter is the most cold, you are not ready(in terms of jacket, scarf etc) and it becomes chilly all of sudden and lots of wind blowing. Thats what happened and we were at Macy's - hungerand the gloom of winter was playing trick on our mood plus shopping was not eventful. So needed to lift the spirit.And we saw the advertisement for this restaurent, its in the basement of Macys and it gives comfort food. And comfort food is tasty and thats what we needed :) . It was a good ambience good crowd, good service, good food. We ordered burger -veggie for me and meat for husband. Both of them were good, portion size was good. (lots of good)everything was just good nothing bad nor exceptional.sidenote : will avoid for sure in summer, there are no windows but winter its a good option.

49.description: We were on our way to see a play when we decided to Have a drink,  we were pointed back to mity nice and although we had a poor experience our first time we didn't think just drinks will hurt.  We walked in at 630. March 8thSat at the bar.  We ordered 2 Margaritas one subbed with vodka,  and deviled eggs. When we received our food we were not offered plates napkins or flatware. We literally ate with our bare hands and no napkins. The bar seemed to have a lot of tickets. So we snatched our own napkin.Our drinks came. We got a vodka margarita and a cranberry crush. :/As she gave us our drinks she realized that wasn't what we ordered. I don't know.  I guess that's the end of the review.

40.description: I'm not sure why this place comes up at "Mexican" It's more of a New American type of place. Regardless, it's a great place. It's a little weird at first being that it's tucked away in the food court of Water Tower Place but whatever. Also, note that there is a back entrance to this place for when the mall is closed but you still want to eat here. Just because the mall is closed, doesn't mean Mity Nice is! I always make the effort to come on Sunday nights when all the entrees are marked down to $15. Usually, the place is pretty empty too because the mall closes early, so it's a win-win.I normally get the whitefish with potatoes and spinach. The fish is always cooked perfectly, but the potatoes are a little hit and miss. Once time they were fantastic -  crisp on the outside but creamy in the middle - and another time they were just overcooked. Regardless, it's still a solid meal. I also love the house dressing on the salad. It's a vinaigrette but it has a pretty unique flavor. I'm not a huge salad fan, but the dressing here has turned me.

53.description: If there's one thing I can say about Mity Nice is, it makes you feel comfortable. Compared to all the other restaurants in the area, it's a bit cheaper and more relaxing allowing you to just go in after work and have some good food.The ambiance seems to be a weird hybrid between a sports bar and restaurant. That's probably considering the size of the place and overwhelming TVs over the bar. Noise wise, however it is definitely on the quieter side which I appreciate.The main host (I always see him there) is extremely nice and accommodating. The downfall is the wait, which can be very lengthy at times even though the restaurant is hidden inside WTP.Being a part of Lettuce Entertain You, Mity Nice is EXTREMELY allergy accommodating. The whole chain is. They even have gluten free bread that they serve you when you get seated (if you're celiac). Even without any allergies I usually stuff myself with bread and then struggle through dessert. Their burger is definitely very good for the price (on both regular and gluten free bun).Unfortunately, lately their gluten free buns have gone down in quality (compared to a couple of years ago) but it's still nice to have the option if needed.Mity Nice has a pretty nice selection of Root beer and alcohol. Their bartenders are very hit and miss so be careful of that. I do have to say, even if they mess up they are more than happy to remake your drink or offer you some alternative. For the price, this place is amazing and I definitely enjoy the slogans and sayings on the back wall that change occasionally.

30.description: Great place, awesome service. First time in the area. Fair prices and the beer/tap choices are pretty good.  Note that it is inside the mall, yes, inside the mall but don't let that discourage you. The mac n Cheese app is very good as well as the French Onion soup.  Entree I'd recommend is the rotisserie chicken salad. Go snd then do some shopping,

46.description: It's been a few years since I've been to Mity Nice -- I guess because I'm not a shopper, the fact that it's tucked into the recesses of Water Tower Place seems to keep it off my dining radar. I was looking for someplace dependable close to the MCA prior to a performance on a blustery March night, though, so came back to revisit. I'm glad I did -- MN has a lot to offer: decent food, friendly service, comfortable surroundings, and that overall Lettuce Entertain You polish that generally provides a good dining experience.We liked the petite chewy cheese popovers that served as a bread course, and also enjoyed a Sonoma salad (nice mix of ingredients, fresh, tasty). My fish'n'chips entrée was A-OK, the fish very nice (moist & crispy), the fries OK (not greasy, but a little bland), and the fried lemon slices a perky accent. My companion's whitefish was excellent (fresh, tender, nicely seasoned), the accompanying wilted spinach was perfect, and the roasted potatoes were OK.There's a compact drinks menu. Hot buttered rum took the chill off my sweetie, and my sampler beer flight gave me a taste of four Chicago craft brews. There's also a serviceable choice of wines by tap or bottle.Not haute cuisine, for sure, nor a hot date night spot, I suppose, but good food served by an enterprise that knows how to do things right.
