I'm  really glad this exhibit's first US site is in a friendly manageable city like chicago as opposed to NYC which would have been super super crowded and ridiculous. Very doable and very nice trip/experience. we had chicago hotdogs and deep dish afterwards...not a bad day at all =)

52.description: This is a great museum. The building is welcoming, with wide steps leading to the 2d story entrance.  There are picture windows with great views, and places to sit, read catalogs, and watch videos. Exhibits are laid out over just three floors. The whole is manageable in 1-2 hours.What do you see? Usually 3-5 different shows, arranged 2 on the second floor, 1 in a small gallery on the third, and 1 or 2 on the fourth floor. Each will highlight either an individual artist's work, a theme or trend in contemporary art, or some curator's idea of an interesting way to showcase a group of works. Exhibits showcase the full gamut of contemporary art, and all the exhibits are temporary. The permanent collection is not on display, except when some pieces are brought out in connection with a current show. Very often, you won't recognize the artists unless you normally keep informed about contemporary art--that's a good thing obviously, because you're being exposed to new things here all the time.In my experience, the exhibits range from fantastic, like Isa Genzken, to the terrible, like "The Way of the Shovel" (don't ask). No need to mention "Bowie Is" -- it was over-the-top terrific. So the basic point is that each time you visit, your experience will vary.  You see the good AND the bad.  But you have to visit over and over, like every couple of months, to get what is going on here.  A single visit will be the luck of the draw. Every exhibit is accompanied by a full range of tours, talks, and music and theater performances that round out and comment on the experience.  There is a great theater on the first floor and ticket prices are reasonable. The visual and the performing arts co-exist and complement each other at this institution.So with an open mind, a modicum of understanding, and keeping your expectations in check, you will like this place. You're sure to get something, often wonderful and strange, out of your visit. (Just be sure to ignore the museum restaurant by Wolfgang Puck--the one lackluster spot in the building. Fortunately, there are plenty of great dining options within a block or two--use them instead!)

50.description: The gift shop is pretty awesome.  A great place for unique gift items, they carry lots of Plan Toys, Joseph and Joseph cooking goodies, wine accessories, cool jewelry, and tons more.

4.description: 1) Free coat and bag check here2) Tuesdays it's free for IL residents3) They have Student/Senior Citizen discountsI'm really not into art but this was a pretty cool museum. It was super clean and spaced out properly so it wasn't crowded when we went to different floors and exhibits.Overall, pretty impressed with this museum. It's a nice change while you're visiting Chicago.

6.description: I'm definitely not an art expert. I do, however, enjoy taking in a museum every now and then. I took my first day off in months and decided to check out the MCA, one museum I haven't been to in years. One of the main exhibitions out now (and ending in November, I think) was The Freedom Principle, which was a combination of music and art from the 1960's to now. I always forget how nice and peaceful this area behind Water Tower, and luckily for me the weather was perfect. After my visit, I sat outside on the stairs, took in some sun, and enjoyed the view around the museum.Notable notes:- $12 admission ($8 for students with IDs. Bless the ticket guy for thinking I looked young enough to be an undergrad. Aw, shucks.) - Restrooms are on the lower level, or street level. - The museum was on the warm side. I'm not sure if it was just me, or if they had to maintain the temperature for the art or what. Dress appropriately.

22.description: I've been here 3 or 4 times now. The first time the exhibits were pretty varied and interesting. Things have been getting increasingly worse. The last time the exhibits were pretty limited and poor in my opinion. The upstairs was off limits pretty much, as was the store. I really appreciate things are free on Tuesday, but the last visit wasn't even worth the time. I'm willing to give it another shot, but I'm becoming increasingly disappointed and pretty close to just giving up on it.

15.description: ZERO STARS.  NONE.   Worst art museum..wait, worst museum EVER.  Took my son and paid the reduced fee of $7 apiece.  What a waste.  $14 would have been better spent on a few happy meals at McDonalds (which I detest).  I haven't been to the MCA since it was located on Ontario Street and back then, they had a nice selection of inspiring art.  This location is a four floor joke. Put it this way, if all the art at the MCA were on one floor it would take all but about 12 minutes to see everything.  That's not an exaggeration.  Instead, they have four floors here,  which when you leave each floor you'll say to yourself,  okay..maybe there's better content on the next floor.  Nope...never happens.  When you get to the fourth floor you sadly realize that the best part of this museum, by far, is the gift shop and the goldfish pond on the ground floor.   Third place would be for the clean bathroom, which had better art (none) than the museum.Let me get to the art though..as that's what people visit for.  The art here is an unimaginative collection of garbage.  I know the perception of good art differs for us all but the material here would maybe appeal to a hundredth of 1%.  I've been a long time fan of all art, specifically contemporary art, and say with all truthfulness that the art offered here is pathetic (save the Calder pieces).   Especially for a museum with as much financial backing as this one.Look.. If you want to see good art or even contemporary art, do yourself a favor and visit either the Art Institute of Chicago or the Milwaukee Art Museum.  Both are worth the price of admission and have a great deal to offer.  The MCA is a waste of space with a really sad collection of trash (again, save the Calder's).   What an embarrassment to the great city of Chicago.

57.description: It's pretty small, but has some really interesting pieces. I think they ovecharge for admission for the size of the place, though.

20.description: I guess I would have to preface it to say that I used to work for the MCA and was a member...and I would frequent the place on school trips...yep I am more than a fan...This is one of my favorite places to go. I saw the Yinka Shinoba exhibition and the Frida Khalo influences exhibition. Both were awesome. Check out their gift store, they have tons to cool art gifts for everyone!

36.description: Admittedly, my appreciation of modern art is cursory at best; but there are a few pieces in the Art Institute's Modern Wing that are among my favorites in the whole museum. So, I thought we'd give MCA a try.  We were in the neighborhood anyway, and it didn't hurt that we had free admission passes.  My 2 star review isn't so much that this particular day's selection didn't strike me.  That happens, and I had low/realistic expectations going in.  Rather, we were stunned by how TINY the museum is.  We leisurely strolled as we saw everything except the Bowie exhibit, stopped to read a few of the plaques on a handful of pieces that caught our eye, and we sampled (we did not watch any in their entirety) each of the videos.  All in, it was less than 30 minutes.  Unless you're a huge fan of a featured exhibit the MCA is showcasing or have a deep passion for modern art, you'll likely find yourself saying "I guess that's it?" as you make your way to the exit.  Save for those few diehards though, most casual fans of modern art would enjoy the Modern Wing at the Art Institute much more than this place.

14.description: Couldn't beat FREE admission for military folks. It's usually $12 regular admission. If you're a senior or student, then it's $7.When they say contemporary art...it's pretty contemporary with a lot of 2014 and 2015 stuff hanging around. Mostly local artists and their pieces were out on display.A few notables such as Frida Kahlo and some of her work is here and a few other Mexican artists around the same time period. But they change out their stuff often, so the Frida exhibhit may not be there by the time you read this review.Although there are 4 stories of art, I saw the whole thing in about 35 minutes...and I wasn't trying to rush it either, so your visit here will be relatively quick.Photography is allowed but no flash.

3.description: I sold my mother's ring to Circa Jewelers. They cut a check on the spot and are very understanding that the decision can be emotional. I knew going into it that I would not get nearly close to the appraised value of the ring but I was told that by the appraiser as well.My point is, if you are holding onto a valuable piece that you don't use and  don't like aesthetically, you might want to consider selling it and using the money for something that truly IS you. the idea of keeping heirlooms, in my opinion, is becoming antiquated-holding onto something forever just to hold onto it benefits no one. Make your self happy now.

1.description: The lady I met with was extremely courteous, helpful and kind.  She was willing to see me on the same day that I called and explained how she valued each of the items I brought.  She even provided me with background on the jewelry resale industry and what sells well and what doesn't--in her line of business.  I think that last is very important.  If you have unique TRULY one-of-a-kind pieces, I believe this is your best bet.  But, I had your standard, run of the mill, jewelry (diamond wedding band, Omega watch, strand of pearls), none of which would sell for very much to this company's demographic.  Therefore, she made me an offer that was well below what I anticipated and I went home and decided to try my hand on eBay.  I'm really glad I did, b/c I was able to sell just TWO of the 5-6 things I brought for her for more than 3x what she offered.  Take this with a grain of salt!

2.description: With my divorce on-going, money tight, and a nice engagement ring in a drawer, I wanted to sell. Every time I mentioned this to a friend. they told me to be careful how scary it can be, and how easily you get ripped off. I went to CIRCA. and I was treated very well. As you can imagine, it's emotional selling something under those circumstances, and the man with whom I worked didn't ask many probing questions to make an awkward situation. He told me an amount he could cut immediately, and also that if I gave him a couple days to really examine it (I didn't have any certifications or papers) it might be more. I took the money upfront. Very nice people here, and a really professional office that will put you at ease.

0.description: I set up an appointment with Ed.  Walked in to a beautiful office with a nice receptionist who took my name and asked me to take a seat.  In only a few minutes Ed came and greeted me and walked me to his evaluation room.  He was very nice and explained everything to me.  He let me know the positive and negative aspects of each piece, and gave me an idea of what he would cut me a check for that very minute if I were up to it.  I told him I had to think about it and he totally understood.  In fact, he encouraged me to sleep on it for a few days and said his offer would be good for a week.  Although I didn't sell the jewelery, when it comes time to sell it, I will likely go back to Circa.  I have sold other jewelery elsewhere and usually it is a very uncomfortable situation.  If you are in the market to sell some jewelry, the only other place in this whole city I would recommend to you to consider selling at is A&R Estate Buyers with Keith. He was also amazing.  I reviewed them too check it out.

4.description: I came in with 14K and diamond rings appraised near $2400.  The man who looked at them was very nice and extremely friendly, complimented my purchases and made me feel comfortable with the process. However, the offer made to buy them from me was $180.  I would have sold them for 6% of their appraised value?Come on... I could have sold my rings for scrap and had gotten a better price for that!  I didn't feel like I wasted my time, but I'm just glad I had my stuff appraised prior to potentially selling (it only cost 1% of the total appraised value --$24!).

3.description: This place is unbelievably terrible. The "spa" is located in a closet of a law office-no joke. The owner is not certified in massage therapy and has no clue what she is doing. She tried to massage my breasts, stating that it was "good for the circulation and lymphatic system". She is crazy!!!! After about 10 minutes of her massage, I was actually trying my hardest not to laugh, because of the ridiculous situation I was in. I would not recommend this place to anyone! I cannot believe that She has gotten any good reviews. UGH!!!

1.description: I saw a deal on Lifebooker, and with an upcoming triathlon figured I could use a relaxing massage afterwards.  With the custom massage, Deep is an option, and would be close enough to a Sports Massage, so I checked around and the reviews here were positive.  Unfortunately my experience didn't match, so I'm here to add my opinion to the crowd.I have done some physical therapy for an ankle so I'm familiar with a true sports massage (and how it doesn't feel good until afterwards).  What I received was not a sports massage, not really a deep tissue massage, probably best categorized as a Swedish massage.  Yes she did focus on areas that were in need, and the environment was small and safe.  She acted professional and made small talk well.  But I was hoping for some good, deep muscle relaxation and I did not get that.  If you look at her website, you'll see lots of different body treatments that are holistic, healthy, feel-good services, which should have been an indication that I wouldn't get the intense therapy I was looking for.  I got a multi-massage package, and debated whether to return and use all massages.  I did return, but with a mindset that it would be relaxing and not beneficial for the muscles (and I was right).

2.description: So we all know how much I love a deal.  I couldnt pass up the deal on lifebooker.com/referral/…I think it was 2 hot stone massages for $50 or something ridic.I'm always leery when a place only has a few reviews...it could be good or very bad.Easy online scheduling.  It's in the Hancock so pretty close to my hood as well.Check in at the receptionist and then Miss Jazz came to greet me.1.  She is the nicest woman ever and has amazing skin...so she has to be good, right??2.  She is thorough and went through a consultation and everything she's going to do3.  The space was small, but super relaxing.  Heating blanket, comfortable table, variety of music to choose from (jazz, nature, prince, etc). You can hear the lull of other offices, however it did not bother me at all.  I was completely relaxed.4.  Great pressure with the stones and massage...loved itShe caters to her clients or so it seems to me.  She basically told me whatever I want, she can make it happen...scents, music, etc.

5.description: Every time I'm in chi town I have to go see Ms. Jazz. She's amazing! I've been to spas all over, and she gives the absolute best facials & I got one of my favorite pairs of earrings from her shop. Every time I'm recording in the city I always make the time to pop over and see her. You glow for days. Ms Jazz, come get yourself a location in LA asap. We need you here in Hollywood!

6.description: I am a huge fan!! Came here yesterday for a full body massage. The next day, I feel amazing and rejuvenated. The owner is professional and kind, and she really takes great care of you. She listened (and read) through my concerns, and I really feel like  my massage was catered to what I needed. I was SO relaxed and happy. I will be back for sure. If you're looking to be pampered and for some serious relaxation, give this place a try. You won't be sorry that you did!

7.description: Lifebooker deal brought me in.  I purchased 2 massages, one for me & one for a friend.  There was confusion on my part: I thought since I purchase two massages, my friend & I could each use one.  Doesn't work like that.  The massage therapist expected too bring in two separate certificates.  I was afraid my friend I would not get our massages, but In the end, she honored what I bought.  I felt bad when she told me that she said she would have made more $ if I bought them separately.At any rate, the massage was good: super clean room heated table, nice-smelling oils, and firm pressure, and attention to 'under served' areas like kneecaps & elbows.  In addition to massage, she practices reflexology & lymphatic drainage, which added interest  to my massage.  Located on 31st floor of John Hancock bldg, not so convenient for me, but great for lots of people.

8.description: I'm still trying to figure out how this woman stays in business. After waiting over 15 mins past my 1st scheduled appt., I told the receptionist I'd need to leave/reschedule due to the delay. At my 2nd appt., the owner/massage therapist was strangely unwelcoming and told me 'it was too bad I missed my 1st appt,' suggesting that I would be marked as used in the package I bought. When I contested that, she told me how patient her other clients are in those most passive aggressive way possible, but then aggressively kept talking over me. When I started to talk, she kept saying she couldn't accept negative energy and was repeatedly opening the door for me to leave and then closing it when she wanted to say more. I'd be even more frustrated, but the experience was so bizarre that I can't quite process it.

9.description: Not kidding. Had a facial. Glowed in the dark in a good way LITERALLY. She's amazing.

0.description: I just can't stop saying "THAT WAS SO GOOD!! "Ms.Jazz is the real deal.  I was visiting from SC and booked an appointment using a loot deal on a whim. So very glad I did! I received the Hot Stone Massage and the India Cranial massage. The spirit moves through that woman's fingers you hear me?! I feel SO good and it was truly THE best way to start my vacation.  Everything was great from her professionalism to the oils and tools she used.  Perfect pressure,  communication,  and technique.  I am officially a fan. It really was SOOO good! #church

4.description: Ahh-mazing! I am a picky massage receiver, and Ms. Jazz was spot on! I came with a discount certificate, and I will be a regular customer. The hot stone and custom massages I received are amazing. Such a quality massage!  It is a very rare treat to find someone who uses the right amount of pressure. I never had to say, "a little harder," or "softer, please!" She read what my body needed and she massaged accordingly. Seriously, amazing work. You can tell she loves what she does - she's good.

58.description: 1 star is 100% accurate.  The food tastes great.  However, our server, who I will not name, had no attention to detail.  My wife's Salmon came out rare.  By the time they wanted to re-do it she wasn't even hungry anymore.  My drink was not refilled.  He delivered ice cream with no spoons, and did not bring spoons until the ice cream was melted.  And the ice cream was supposed to be plain, but had toppings on it.  The manager was supposed to visit our table - he never made it.  They were maybe 5% full.  This place is sad.  If Harry were alive he'd take his name off of this location!

56.description: To be fair.. I visited this location shortly after it first opened.  While the location is beautifully decorated, I have to say that I was disappointed with both the food and the service.  I'm a mega-fan of Caray's on Hubbard so maybe I'd set my expectations too high.  I'm hoping things have improved by now and they've found their stride so I will be trying them again.  Will update once that happens.

29.description: Great Chicago Sports museum next door as well, Free with paid meal or drink. sports games for kids, adults, boys or girls,... .See how your arm span compares to Jordan, Pippen, Rose etc,See if you can block hockey shots legendary images, jereseys', view, stories, Whitesox, Bulls, Bears, Blackhawks, Cubs, ,,,Food is good, full bar

42.description: I went here a week ago with two of my coworkers for a long lunch. I had never been here, but the location was certainly convenient and it wasn't too crowded at 1pm on a weekday.Service - 5 Stars: Our server was fantastic. I wish I remembered his name because he was excellent. Very personable, attentive, felt like an old friend waiting on us. Awesome. And, even after he brought us the check, he didn't rush us as we sat around for another half hour chatting.Price - 4 Stars: Slightly overpriced for what you get, but given that it's in Water Tower Place on Michigan Avenue, it's not that bad. I was actually surprised we got away as cheaply as we did.Food - 2.5 Stars: We ordered a margherita pizza to share ($14), which was a substantial serving and fine for three of us. But, the sauce wasn't very good, and it was excessively cheesy. I wouldn't order it again unless everyone else really wanted it. We also ordered a side order of fries ($5, I believe). The fries were really good, but you really don't get very many for the price. I would equate it to the amount I would expect to come with a sandwich at Chili's or something. As a standalone side order, it wasn't very much. I would definitely come back here due to the convenience and the price point, but I would order something else. I also would like to try coming here for happy hour or something, because the atmosphere is pretty casual and they have lots of space. It was nice to actually be able to have a conversation since I was catching up with coworkers I hadn't seen in awhile.

23.description: I liked the casual, sports bar atmosphere. Originally just planned to get a few drinks and appetizer but ended up staying for a full dinner.   The food was very good and reasonably priced for Chicago. I had the short rib Italian beef Andy wife had the salmon. Very tasty. What sold the day was the waiter- Billy. The friendliest guy you will meet and can tell he truly loves his job. Everything he recommended was spot on. Definitely try the "Not Your Fathers Root Beer. Tastes like regular root beer but with 10% alcohol Definitely would come back

47.description: The food is really good here - it's a sports bar on the 7th floor of the Water Tower Place and is totally unexpected.   Unfortunately, despite the good food, the place is really poorly run and is empty during what should have been a busy NFL Sunday.A good sports bar/restaurant decides ahead of time which games are on which TD and doesn't let organized chaos develop once the games start.  I arrived 15 minutes before the games were to start, and there's Nascar on the TV, and it's just a sign that they don't know what the heck they're doing as far as sports are concerned.   Also, they serve Pepsi products instead of Coke.

8.description: Came here yesterday for lunch. Boyfriend ordered a couple Moscow mules. They hold your license as collateral (apparently a lot of people have been stealing the mugs). As we asked for the check, we asked for the license back as well--our server Eric assured us that he would bring it back along with the credit card used for payment. We grabbed the card and what we thought was the license as well and went about our day, not even thinking he wouldn't have brought the license back. It wasn't  until later in the afternoon did he realize the license wasn't with his card, by that time it was too late and too much of a hassle to drive back downtown, pay for parking (again), and get the license. Called the next morning at 8 am explaining the situation--he said the place didn't officially open until 11 am and that he could mail the license to us if we wanted. We waited until they were opened, paid for parking, picked up the license---with a "sorry about that", he ushered us on our way. I get it, it's not a big deal to the restaurant, but when you have Valentine's Day plans in Lake Geneva and you need to avoid the snowy drive and you can't because the place doesn't open until 11.... It's a big deal. You've lost customers, that's for sure. A $72 meal, $16 for parking, another $8 more for parking to get the license back.... A now shortened weekend trip because of bad customer service... Priceless.

31.description: Had the fish and chips with truffle fries. Completely ordinary and forgettable. Prob won't be back.

34.description: The drinks were great, service was great. It was a quiet Monday night when we went, which was nice. i ordered the Not Your Father's Rootbeer, and it was delicious! I've never had this before and it is way too good, and dangerous at 10%! The food was a little underwhelming. It wasn't terrible, we were just expecting more based on the reviews. The fried pickles were soggy. The sauce with them was delicious, but the pickles were cut in chips and we're extremely disappointing. We split the barbecue pizza, which had a decent flavor and a nice thin crust. It wasn't the best pizza I've had, but it wasn't terrible either. Overall, fun place, fun atmosphere, food was decent, drinks were great.

16.description: This is sorta like a crossing between a sports bar and a hard rock cafe. But opposite to HRC the food here is superb. I went with an italien beef sandwich and my wife had a burger. Both were extrzmzly tasty. The ambience of this place is also very cool and we found the museum part to be neat.

13.description: Went there on Sunday. Don't go there for the food. Everything that we ordered was cold. The pizza was cold, the sweet potato fries were cold, the tacos were cold. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because of the ambiance, but if your going to eat there then just save your self the money and go and eat some Dunkin Donuts. Much rather eat from Dunkin Donuts. At least they will serve me hot food. Or even Burger King or Subway.

11.description: Nice bar joint in The Water Tower Place. Stopped in for a libation during our shopping excursion. If you go and do not get the 'Not Your Father's Root Beer' then you are missing out! The beer is a 10oz pour with 10%abv for only $8.00! It is a locally brewed beer that is delicious to the tongue. Based on this, I would be interested in what the rest of their food and drinks are like. For the experience our bartender was good, very friendly and also changed the tv to the Royals game for us out-of-towners!

39.description: Restaurant is 3.5, but the admission to the museum gives it a 4.  Museum admission, is free with dinner, compared to $6 per person. The food is expensive, and inflated, but it was tasty nonetheless. Went on a Tuesday night and the server was very attentive and it wasn't too crowded. The restaurant and decor is decked out in Chicago sport's memorabilia which I am a huge fan. I recommend this place to any Chicago sport's fan and/or memorabilia collector because they have some pretty cool stuff.I also went to the museum. It was empty on a Tuesday night in January so I was able to enjoy a lot of exhibits. They have virtual simulators where you participate in a home run derby as Frank Thomas, 3-point shoot out as Scottie Pippen, attempt to block Patrick Kane's shots, and a QB target  practice simulator. All pretty cool, but the football one was my favorite. Overall, food was ok, nothing special, but the admission to museum is a nice touch and can be worth it if you are with a bigger party.

37.description: I had the spinach and artichoke dip which was fabulous!! Also, ordered a salad and the milkshake was ridiculously good!! I think the atmosphere is great and food is good. Nice place to come with a family while shopping in Watertower. Billy our server was super funny. Must ask for him!! I think people working there need to smile more and they need to change those black outfits to sports jerseys. It's a sports restaurant. Check out the museum. Pretty cool, especially for the kids.

0.description: Top of the World... well top of the mall place its located in, at least This place is super solid! Really good beer on tap! The house brew is a blonde hoppy ale. At first didn't sound too good but good thing i tried it. It was a good surprise! They also have a flight of beer where u can see the subtle difference in the similar beers. Who knew an American pale ale wasnt the same as an ipa. Education at its finest.The food was soooo good as well! The burger, wings and the carrot cake cupcakes! The cupcakes were sooo bombola! Super moiste and they had some kind of crystlized caramilized carrots on top, not sure what the term is for them.The ambiance is also super chill and unpretentious. Plus u get a free entrance to the sports museum.I wish Harry carey was still around, he seemed like a great guy!

38.description: A tad over-priced and the service was extremely-slow when we went.I had the Baja Fish Tacos. They were decent, but nothing spectacular. We ordered nachos as an appetizer and they were also pretty average.The decor and the TV's in the restaurant made up for the average food and slow service.

51.description: Four stars for the food, and one for the service = the three stars ( rounded up ). The place was super slow on a Tuesday afternoon. We were seated quickly and drink orders also taken quickly. Entrees were really slow, however. The waitress eventually came over to explain there was a problem with the ticket machine and apologized. Problem with that was other tables seated after us were getting their food. Place can look great, but service is key in any restaurant.

27.description: Fried pickles = goodBuffalo wings = hotBeer = coldNachos = waste of time, flavorless chicken, powder tasting nacho cheese, flavorless salsaItalian beef sandwich = not a sandwich Overall = tourist attraction

32.description: Stopped here for a quick drink, and was very impressed with the Harry Caray's 7th inning stretch IPA. Great taste!!

54.description: My partner and I went here with some out of town relatives and were pleasantly surprised at how excellent the food and service was. I had expected it to almost be a theme restaurant like The Hard Rock Cafe with a generic menu. Far from it. Every hamburger had it's own different kind of bun; so delicious. I would definitely come back for the menu. The service was pretty great as well. I really liked how low key the sports theme was as well.

48.description: I was kind of feeling blah about what I wanted to eat, and where, and my boyfriend and I just sort of ended up here. We had hoped to sit at the bar and watch football, and while the bar was full, we were able to be seated in a half circle booth that faced the bar. I loved the booth because it was very comfortable and still perfect for viewing the screens. Immediately I got a good vibe from the place because the hostess was genuinely friendly as was the management. I chose the fried pickles for a starter and we both ordered soft drinks. After a few minutes we ordered our meals. My boyfriend ordered a burger and I ordered calamari as my main. The waitress was very good about bringing fresh drinks and also ensured us a couple of times that our pickles would be there any minute and I almost wondered if they had been forgotten. Finally the pickles came and because of this I was afraid that the meals would arrive practically at the same time as had been the case the previous day at a different establishment, but we were able to savor and enjoy the pickles without having to worry about that. The pickles were yummy, kind of a thick batter but still crunchy on the outside. The dipping sauce was a tad spicy and really good. My boyfriend really enjoyed his burger (and I enjoyed the bite I tried as well) and I was a huge fan of the calamari. It seemed to have some seasoning in the batter, almost peppery, and it really brought out the flavor. The cocktail sauce really complemented it too. Honestly I really loved it and was happy I had chosen it. Overall the food and service was great and I was happy. When we got out checks, the waitress informed us that the fried pickles were comped because of how long they took. Yes they had taken a long time, but because of how happy I was overall it really hadn't bothered me, but that addition made me feel even better about choosing that establishment and I would eat there again for the food, the atmosphere and the service.

44.description: Really great burgers here. I ended up getting the first type of burger (I think it was called the Harper). Unfortunately, they sent me a bacon burger, but no biggie! I loved eating it anyways.The waitress was busy running all over the place. I felt that they were a bit understaffed, but she was super kind and apologetic. I felt bad for her, and was not at all upset. I tried the mixed greens + bacon burger (mixed up) + sweet potato fries (really soggy) and got a coffee. The coffee was okay also.I REALLY liked the staff as the manager apologized and also comp'ed my burger. I felt that the service here was really kind and I would definitely return. They're definitely known for their burgers. The fries? I may pass on those next time.

24.description: To start, our group had to convince both the concierge at the hotel AND the taxi driver that this place existed.  I don't know how long 7th Inning Stretch has been open, but both people wanted to take us to the original Harry Caray's and acted like we were mad, mad I tell you, for thinking that there was anything at the address we repeatedly gave them.  Nevertheless.It was a quiet night, even for a weekend.  Paralympic hockey was on several of the many televisions if that gives you an idea of the big games that would draw people into a sports bar.  I have nothing against paralympic hockey and actually found it entertaining, but I can't see it being a big audience draw.  With many tables open, there was little excuse for poor service and the service was, frankly, adequate.  Our server was fairly new (he admitted) but kept drinks filled despite some lengthy waits for our wine-drinking accomplices.  Food was good.  High-end sports bar food.  The Holy Cow burger was very tasty.  Dynamite shrimp app was meh, but I ate about half of it by myself since no one else was touching it and I'm kind of compulsive with food.  Nachos were not that great.  Spinach artichoke dip was good, but didn't have enough chips.The large, wood-adorned room is dark and cozy.  It gave a good feel with several different levels and eating areas so it doesn't feel too open.Finally, there is a sports museum attached and is apparently free if you buy food or a drink.  I didn't go in there, but it looked nice.  Overall, I'm glad we didn't listen to guys telling us that this place doesn't exist.

7.description: To start, our group had to convince both the concierge at the hotel AND the taxi driver that this place existed.  I don't know how long 7th Inning Stretch has been open, but both people wanted to take us to the original Harry Caray's and acted like we were mad, mad I tell you, for thinking that there was anything at the address we repeatedly gave them.  Nevertheless.It was a quiet night, even for a weekend.  Paralympic hockey was on several of the many televisions if that gives you an idea of the big games that would draw people into a sports bar.  I have nothing against paralympic hockey and actually found it entertaining, but I can't see it being a big audience draw.  With many tables open, there was little excuse for poor service and the service was, frankly, adequate.  Our server was fairly new (he admitted) but kept drinks filled despite some lengthy waits for our wine-drinking accomplices.  Food was good.  High-end sports bar food.  The Holy Cow burger was very tasty.  Dynamite shrimp app was meh, but I ate about half of it by myself since no one else was touching it and I'm kind of compulsive with food.  Nachos were not that great.  Spinach artichoke dip was good, but didn't have enough chips.The large, wood-adorned room is dark and cozy.  It gave a good feel with several different levels and eating areas so it doesn't feel too open.Finally, there is a sports museum attached and is apparently free if you buy food or a drink.  I didn't go in there, but it looked nice.  Overall, I'm glad we didn't listen to guys telling us that this place doesn't exist.

49.description: I'm not going to lie, the only reason we went here is for the free admission to the Chicago Sports Museum and I wanted to like it....but was really let down on both fronts. I'll do my museum review separate....but if you are thinking of doing both of these things, I just....can't....suggest it. What stood out about Harry Caray's was definitely the service. Our waiter was a nice guy, was prompt, and took care of everything we needed, but much like how I feel that great food can't combat poor service.....great service can't make up for food that isn't great. Don't get me wrong, the food is good....but the prices were about double what I'd normally expect to pay for what I got. I got the short rib italian beef which came in at a hefty $16. My friend ordered a thin crust pizza that was even a little less. The short rib was good.....but it wasn't $16 good. It didn't come on a roll or anything, it came on a piece of garlic bread. Interesting but the amount of bread far exceeded the actual beef. It came with fries that were pretty plain and boring. My date ordered the pizza and said it was great, and it must have been because she ate the whole damn thing. I feel like there are probably 20 better restaurants in the area that I could have had a better entree, for half the price. The search will continue!

40.description: For being in a mall, the food is fantastic. I had the short rib sandwich and it is worth the flight to Chicago.

53.description: The service was TERRIBLE. The beer was not cold. The food was ordinary.

30.description: Nice bar joint in The Water Tower Place. Stopped in for a libation during our shopping excursion. If you go and do not get the 'Not Your Father's Root Beer' then you are missing out! The beer is a 10oz pour with 10%abv for only $8.00! It is a locally brewed beer that is delicious to the tongue. Based on this, I would be interested in what the rest of their food and drinks are like. For the experience our bartender was good, very friendly and also changed the tv to the Royals game for us out-of-towners!

46.description: I'm confused by the negative reviews.If you look past the slightly inflated prices (it is a Chicago restaurant that will cater to tourists- of course they're inflated!) the food is surprisingly good.When we arrived this evening it was relatively quiet and empty. We were seated right away at a nice table by the window. We were promptly attended to by our waitress, Samantha... She was great.We ordered an appetizer to share and were pleasantly surprised- you see, as a Chicagoan, and an admitted food snob I wasn't expecting much- but this food was actually good! We then ordered our entrees, I tried some of his, he tried some of mine, we both agreed... It was all surprisingly good. Then came dessert. Samantha said that the shakes were good, and I love salted caramel, so that's what we had- also surprisingly delicious.In short- a surprisingly good restaurant of you're willing to overlook a touch of touristy 'charm'. As a local, I will be returning. Is it the greatest food I've ever had? No... But, was I pleasantly surprised and more than happy to return when in need of a quick, casual bite? FOR SURE!!

1.description: awesome fried pickles and drinks!   We loved the museum which was free entrance if you grab drinks there.   We loved the museum.   It was fun with lots of interactive things to do from batting baseball, shooting basketball, blocking hockey goals, and throwing football.

55.description: We went for a beer after shopping.  If you buy I think $6 minimum in food, you get free entry into the museum.  Bartender was friendly and attentive.  The beer selection was good.  We saw several plates of food come out and it looked amazing - especially the nachos.  We'll try to go back next time we are at WTP.

9.description: We stopped over for dinner with friends and everything was just so-so...Decor: It has the look and feel of a sports bar, which is totally cool. There are plenty of TVs and lots of sports memorabilia to take in. The lighting is a bit on the dark side and if you happen to sit at a seat that happens to be in direct shot of one of the little spotlights you'll be blinded (as my friend was). This place is pretty large though, and they could easily accommodate any size group.Bathroom: Pretty typical, nothing special.Staff: Our waitress was fine. Nothing spectacular and not really that memorable.Food: To start, we all had beers. But we all went our separate ways when it came to ordering, some had burgers, others had salads, but we had the Shrimp Tacos. Now, we like spicy food so we were very enticed by the Dynamite Shrimp Tacos, however they just were not that spicy or even that flavorful. The portion size was pretty typical, so that was fine, I just wouldn't get these again.Value: There is a bit of a premium placed on the name and the location, which is expected, so expect to pay a bit more. However, the prices are not outrageous. All-in-all we didn't feel like we didn't get our money's worth, just perhaps overpaid a tad given the sub-par food/service.This place is just "fine", that's it. There isn't anything special and I'll be trying many other places before returning. However, if you're in a pinch and want to catch a game, you'll be set here.

26.description: Poor service at the bar.  Not crowded, mid-afternoon.  Despite the fact that there were 2 servers behind the bar, it took 8 minutes for someone to come by.  I was ready to leave when I finally got service.Food was very good.  Delivered timely.  I do like the menu here.No one ever came by to refill water or ask if I wanted another glass of wine.I tried to get the bar person's attention to ask for the check.  There were only 2 other people at the bar.   Finally put my coat on and stood up.  She was busy talking with a co-worker.  Next time I'll go to Mite Nice or try table service.  Too bad, the food is decent but the service.....

25.description: We stopped over for dinner with friends and everything was just so-so...Decor: It has the look and feel of a sports bar, which is totally cool. There are plenty of TVs and lots of sports memorabilia to take in. The lighting is a bit on the dark side and if you happen to sit at a seat that happens to be in direct shot of one of the little spotlights you'll be blinded (as my friend was). This place is pretty large though, and they could easily accommodate any size group.Bathroom: Pretty typical, nothing special.Staff: Our waitress was fine. Nothing spectacular and not really that memorable.Food: To start, we all had beers. But we all went our separate ways when it came to ordering, some had burgers, others had salads, but we had the Shrimp Tacos. Now, we like spicy food so we were very enticed by the Dynamite Shrimp Tacos, however they just were not that spicy or even that flavorful. The portion size was pretty typical, so that was fine, I just wouldn't get these again.Value: There is a bit of a premium placed on the name and the location, which is expected, so expect to pay a bit more. However, the prices are not outrageous. All-in-all we didn't feel like we didn't get our money's worth, just perhaps overpaid a tad given the sub-par food/service.This place is just "fine", that's it. There isn't anything special and I'll be trying many other places before returning. However, if you're in a pinch and want to catch a game, you'll be set here.

12.description: Always consistent service and great bar food. Very happy with coming here to watch sporting events.

59.description: I'm so torn with this place :( On one hand, the food was pretty good/bordering on excellent and unique. On the other hand, the service was so atrocious (yes, I busted out a teacher word!) that it makes me wonder if I'll come back. When we arrived, I was glad to see that it wasn't super busy, especially considering that we came on a Monday afternoon about 12:45. I told the waitress that we were a party of four adults and two toddlers. They seated us pretty much right away, but when we sat, they arranged the table for two adults and four kids :/ Meh....easy enough fix. The waitress, however, didn't come and greet us or acknowledge us for at least 10 minutes. Now for those of you who follow my reviews, this is huge for me!:( She took our order, which was pretty simple enough, and than we didn't see her again! So let me start with the good....the food:Warm Spinach and Artichoke Dip: This was actually really good! Now I know many people will be wary since it IS artichoke dip, but either we were just starving by the time food actually appeared on our table, or it really was that good! They do come with, what seems like, homemade corn tortilla chips. The basket they give is definitely not enough for the portion of dip that they give, so ask for an extra basket!Grilled Chicken BLT: This looked really good on the menu, so cousin and I shared. With an extra side, this is definitely a shareable portion! The chicken was really good, and relatively moist. The bacon was nice and crispy, and again a good portion in comparison to the sandwich. The star of the sandwich was the basil aioli, which definitely gave the chicken a different and herby flavor.Bacon Mac 'n Cheese: This side was DELISH! The side, although pricy at $9, was a huge portion! Let's just say that cousin, and I AND my daughter were able to eat the side! The pair was definitely a great portion for lunch, and than some! The sauce was good, with a good smoked gouda flavor, and a generous helping of bacon throughout. The rest of the party had other meals including the mac and cheese and grilled cheese for kids (which both looked good!) as well as the Holy Cow! burger (huge and looked delish!) and the BBQ chicken pizza. Now for the not so good part....the service :( Throughout our 1 1/2 hr lunch (with two toddlers!!) we had to ask for our server multiple times, watched two tables be sat after we sat, eat, and leave before we got food, as well as having to ask for our appetizer again because she had forgotten it! We even had to ask for things like drinks for the kids or more water. The manager was super nice and accommodating, which definitely helped, and he did make sure that the appetizer came out within 10 minutes. I did end up talking to the manager after our meal to tell him that the service was really bad. He again apologized, said that they would take care of it right away, and seemed genuinely concerned with the poor service. This is was really made me give them a 3-star rather than a 2-star. I think I'll try them again since the food was really good, and I don't want to judge them off of one server.

21.description: This is sorta like a crossing between a sports bar and a hard rock cafe. But opposite to HRC the food here is superb. I went with an italien beef sandwich and my wife had a burger. Both were extrzmzly tasty. The ambience of this place is also very cool and we found the museum part to be neat.

17.description: I went here a week ago with two of my coworkers for a long lunch. I had never been here, but the location was certainly convenient and it wasn't too crowded at 1pm on a weekday.Service - 5 Stars: Our server was fantastic. I wish I remembered his name because he was excellent. Very personable, attentive, felt like an old friend waiting on us. Awesome. And, even after he brought us the check, he didn't rush us as we sat around for another half hour chatting.Price - 4 Stars: Slightly overpriced for what you get, but given that it's in Water Tower Place on Michigan Avenue, it's not that bad. I was actually surprised we got away as cheaply as we did.Food - 2.5 Stars: We ordered a margherita pizza to share ($14), which was a substantial serving and fine for three of us. But, the sauce wasn't very good, and it was excessively cheesy. I wouldn't order it again unless everyone else really wanted it. We also ordered a side order of fries ($5, I believe). The fries were really good, but you really don't get very many for the price. I would equate it to the amount I would expect to come with a sandwich at Chili's or something. As a standalone side order, it wasn't very much. I would definitely come back here due to the convenience and the price point, but I would order something else. I also would like to try coming here for happy hour or something, because the atmosphere is pretty casual and they have lots of space. It was nice to actually be able to have a conversation since I was catching up with coworkers I hadn't seen in awhile.

10.description: Fried pickles = goodBuffalo wings = hotBeer = coldNachos = waste of time, flavorless chicken, powder tasting nacho cheese, flavorless salsaItalian beef sandwich = not a sandwich Overall = tourist attraction

5.description: Great atmosphere for watching Sunday football although it did take an hour to get one of the games up we wanted to watch up in one of the TV's but they did seem to genuinely trying. They just could't figure out which TV was which.  The spinach and artichoke dip and maple mustard salmon are excellent.  The Thai chicken flatbread and short rib Mac and cheese were pretty good , as was the Chinese chicken salad.   The sports museum is also quite entertaining.  You can see and step into Shaq's shoes among many other fascinating sports facts and memorabilia, as well as fun interactive games.Highly recommend: spinach and artichoke dip, maple mustard salmon.

3.description: I'm going to leave ab3/5 review because food was ok but not anything special or unique. Our waitress was super nice but our appetizer came with outlet main meal at the same time and we waited forever for w Togo box. The place is just OK in service and quality...

35.description: Wemt for my sons 10th birthday.  Good atmosphere.  Food ok. Museum was a nice extra...free admission with purchase but a great way to end a good day. Wouldn't be worth admission had it not been free after dining at the restaurant. Overall a good night.

19.description: I have been going to Harry Caray's for some time now and I was thrilled to visit the new location in Water Tower.  First off, there's an express elevator to get to the 7th floor which is a HUGE bonus for anyone who's ever been to Water Tower.  Walking up to it you can see the famous "Holy Cow" and the new sports museum.  Also not to be missed is the photographic wall of fame with all the athletes, celebrities, political figures, etc. who've eaten at the location.  The restaurant itself looks very modern and clearly pays tribute to the original location on W. Kinzie Street near the river.  A lot of televisions are hung to show sports games and the like.  There is great views of the Hancock building and plaza.  The menu is not as robust as the original location, but some of the staples are there.  Overall it seems catered to the quicker crowds you'd expect in a large mall setting.  I have eaten there a few times now and the burgers are far and away the best I have had.I highly recommend visiting the 7th Inning Stretch the next time you're near or in Water Tower.  You won't be disappointed.

28.description: Food was awesome had the Harry's Chili for a starter, then the main course was the short rib sandwich. Will be back. Oh yea and the tour of the museum was pretty cool.

45.description: We were at The Water Tower Place so we thought we'd give it a try for lunch. Unfortunately, I didn't even get to give the food a try. We walked up to the host and asked to sit in the bar. He informed us that it would be a $25 minimum per person. We said that was fine. After all we are on Michigan Ave. The host told us to head in and he would be right behind us. We walked in and it was quite full. We started to sit at a table in the bar area but a waitress abruptly informed us that the table was reserved. Looking around we didn't see anything else open. The host never followed us in, and we waited a few minutes for him or an open spot. Without a place to sit we just decided to leave. Things just seemed a little off that day.

33.description: The food is decent enough, the service is poor.  A lot of Servers standing around talking to each other.  Very annoying.

43.description: The day before Thanksgiving we decided to spend the day downtown. After sightseeing and walking several miles, we were hungry. Really hungry. We couldn't wait much longer and needed food NOW. Several places we stopped in at had long waits for a table. We finally came across this place. No line, no wait. Perfect! Here are the good and bad of our experience:Good: 1. burgers            2. spinach artichoke dip            3. bottled root beer (my son loved it)            4. free admission to the sports museum            5. pictures of Harry and celebrities on the walls by the entrance            6. nicely layed out TVs            7. sports on TV during our mealBad: 1. SERVICE. Everything took way too long. I had to remind my server more than once about things I had asked for like napkins, a cup of water, a second drink, plates for our appetizers, etc.           2. Drinks are small for the price. Well, at least mine was. I'm used to getting a Captain and Coke in a tall glass and for 9 bucks, I got a short glass. No bueno.Based on the service and size of my drinks, I decided on the 3 stars.

2.description: The food was greasy, the costs were way over the top (even for Chicago), and the door staff seems out of touch with reality.  My wife and I shared a 'double play' pizza that was dripping with grease, had very few ingredients, and in no way demonstrated double of anything except grease.  We also ordered the Calamari, it was very rubbery, not cooked well, and ultimately was just poor. To add to the magic of the visit the background music is so loud that even sitting shoulder to shoulder with someone will not guarantee they will hear you.The highlight of the visit was that the waitress was friendly and we never ran out of water.  Beyond that I have nothing good to say about this location.

18.description: Just ok.  We got in without a wait on a Sunday afternoon the week before Christmas.  Lots of very cool Chicago sports memorabilia all over the place.  Service was adequate.   My bloody mary came  with nothing in it, not even an olive.  My heat hamburger was tasty.   Calamari wasn't very good-skip it.  Take your itemized receipt next door and you get into the Chicago Sports Museum for free.

41.description: Topnotch place!! The food, the service and the ice cream where incredible!! They gave us a discount because we bought tickets to the museum also.

52.description: I stopped in here last Saturday and this place was amazing. I can not say enough good things about Kristen,the only thing better than her spot on service was her gut busting jokes. The food tasted very good, but that might have been because I was in such good spirits from being at the bar and listening to Kristen crack me up. Next time I'm in town for business you will find me here.

50.description: I found this place totally by random.  It's on the seventh floor of a shopping mall of all places.  I was on a walk from the John Hancock towards the magnificent mile and they happened to be advertising it since it just opened.  I thought I'd stop by because I wanted to say that I ate at one of the H.C. places in the city.It was early and I had no problem finding a seat at the bar.  I was greeted immediately and offered a food and drink menu.  Their selection of beer is extensive and as someone visiting the Windy City, it was great being able to pick a local beer from such a wide selection.  I also ordered the fried pickles to go with it which were INCREDIBLE!!!  They are nice and hot, perfectly battered, and the chipotle dipping sauce is perfect.  There were also little deep fried peppers in the mix as well...I think I liked those even better!Since I didn't get a full meal, I can't comment on the food to a huge extent, but if you're looking for a quick drink, surrounded by sports memorabilia, and a friendly bartender, followed by free access to the museum, this is definitely the place to go!

4.description: If you happen to be on floors 6-8 of the Water Tower, you might have lunch or dinner here. This place (on floor 7) serves decent comfort food with (in my experience) very pleasant service, once you get seated--the host was a thin, zombie-like guy, unwelcoming in the extreme, who didn't speak a single word as he trekked to the table. The waitress, by contrast, was truly friendly and efficient, and someone, the manager I think, was pretty much on the floor at all times checking things out.Food & beverage were decent. I had a well-made martini with 2 cheesy olives, then quite tasty tomato bisque. My main was a plate of turkey meatloaf, whipped potatoes & asparagus that brought back memories of blue-plate specials of yore (at today's elevated prices, however). I just can't give very high marks to a sports-themed place, especially one that decorates the walls with sports gear. Not the sort of person that likes to have dinner staring at used baseball uniforms. Sorry. Still, if trapped in the Water Tower's upper reaches, you could do worse than eating here (Mity Nice Grill anyone?).

6.description: Went on a date with my daughter. She wasn't impressed with her spaghetti and I thought it was ok.  My cheeseburger was mediocre at best...wasn't bad but any chain has a better burger...definitely disappointed.

22.description: I'm giving this 2 stars only because the service was very good. The food was not great. Pizza, burgers, salad and pretzel appetizer - all eh. Upside, we got into the museum for free but next time, I would eat elsewhere and still go to the museum.

15.description: Great Chicago Sports museum next door as well, Free with paid meal or drink. sports games for kids, adults, boys or girls,... .See how your arm span compares to Jordan, Pippen, Rose etc,See if you can block hockey shots legendary images, jereseys', view, stories, Whitesox, Bulls, Bears, Blackhawks, Cubs, ,,,Food is good, full bar

57.description: Holy Cow!Walking brings up such a big appetite! While looking around the American Girl shop, I was getting a bit cranky, signaling it was time to eat! Yup, I admit it, I get Hangry (angry when hungry). Oh well! This restaurant is located on the 7th floor and there is an elevator that brings you directly to Mr. Harry Caray! Anyway, we were seated immediately, but that is cause it was past the lunch time traffic. The restaurant is right next to the Sports Museum. Tip: if you eat at this restaurant, it gives you access to the museum. Just make sure to save your receipt because that is your ticket! I love the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant. It is a sports bar/restaurant, so there are plentiful of sports happening on the TV! We were seated in a both and we totally felt like we were in a business meeting or in those 1920's gangster movies or the mafia! Ya know, the leather seats with tall tables and low lighting. Oh and the view was beautiful! You see all the architecture and the John Hancock building was right there!Once seated, we ordered our drinks and asked our waitress for recommendations. I can't remember her name, I think it was Joanna or Johanna (?). Anyway, great customer service and she gave great recommendations! She is very knowledgeable about their menu! I got the buffalo chicken wrap with a side salad. My friends got appetizers such as wings, sweet potato fries, loaded fries and side salad. We share food of course and that is one of the best part about our friendship! My friend tried the ginger beer and he let me have a sip, it was gingery. It doesn't have alcohol, but is called ginger beer...kind of reminded me of butter beer from Harry Potter, but ginger. The buffalo chicken wrap was good and the flavor was just right. The salad was pretty small, but it is a side salad. I like the long string for the carrot, different and unique. I wanted to try their shakes and desserts, but was already full. Happy happy joy joy! Holy cow! Overall, the food is good and the atmosphere was fun!

20.description: Great food, reasonably priced...leaves some change in your pocket to do some shopping.  Don't forget to hit the Chicago Sports Museum....learn all about your fav Chicago teams.

36.description: Overpriced. Don't waste your money. Nothing very special here. Except they have a very good Banana Nutella shake. The rest of the menu is stuff you could get at any chain restaurant in America. For half the price. Also the greeter was rude. But our waitress was attentive and polite. I wouldn't bother going here again.

14.description: Went here only bc I had family visiting from out of town & heard that you get free admission to the Chicago Sports Museum if you dine at Harry Caray's.  This is definitely a restaurant that is geared for tourists. While the food was decent, the service was lacking. The restaurant is fairly new, but they definitely need some better training for the staff because service is very slow. We came here on a Monday and still waited almost 45 minutes for our orders to come out and the staff weren't very apologetic about it. If you're an out of towner, it's an easy spot to dine since its located in the Water Tower, other than that..probably will not be back!

58.description: All the lego sculptures are amazing! But if you are just looking for a bunch of legos in one color they don't seem to have what you need. All I needed was a bunch of white legos for a winter wonderland I was building. Also if you aren't in the store with a child you may get a few odd looks.

56.description: I've never bought anything here but I always find myself wandering to check out the Star Wars section.  They have a life size Vader and R2 made out of Legos.  Lots of other really cool lego displays too, Sears Tower and Dinosaurs to name a few.  I feel like a kid again when I go in here.  You can also just put some blocks together if you want.  Place is always clean and staff seem friendly.  Esspecially Zach, Zach, he's a Lego maniac.

29.description: I'm doing Christmas shopping early, and I went into this store looking for a present to get my cousin's kid... I reasoned that boys must love Legos, right? I was a girl, and I loved them. Maybe the kid would like them too. I don't know; I guess we shall see.The display in the store was very neat. I guess I hadn't anticipated that. I expected chaos in toy stores. This wasn't so, and I liked it. They have lots of cool Lego collections now... Star Wars, Pirates of the Caribbean, Harry Potter, some girly stuff... It was very cool. The staff people were also wonderful. They helped me pick out my gift that would travel well, as I will be flying to see my cousins in another country for Christmas. Then, they signed me up for a free Legos VIP membership. I thought it couldn't hurt if I continued to buy Legos for the little ones, right? Perhaps I'll buy Legos for my own kids one day.

42.description: It's got a LEGO giant dragon going through the ceiling and walls.It's got a LEGO 3D relief of the Chicago citylineIt's got a LEGO Super Star Destroyer, not merely a Star Destroyer but a Super Star DestroyerIt's got a LEGO Death Star with cutaway panels showing all the important scenes in the original trilogyWhat more do you need? Let's go to LEGO!

23.description: BUIlD IT & THEY WILL COMEThis store originally was located in the Bridge Shops at Nordstroms down the street. This new location is more accessible for tourists plus you are where all the shopping seems to start. When you enter the Water tower shops from Michigan Ave take the esculators straight up and then continue to walk straight. You will eventually walk into the Lego Store located on the back wall.  Legos have turned into a big business.  When I was a kid you bought a box of Legos and you used your imagination and you built stuff. Now Legos are competitive and cross branded with movies. Like building the Star Wars Death Star. Yeah I've got nothing to do for the next week but follow along and assemble 2000 pieces of Legos into complete destruction for Darth Vadar. Luke Skywalkers is gonna be pissed. Legos have become the modern 3D puzzle for people. Wait till these kids have arthritis, then its back to jigsaw puzzles. The store is fun because it has an area for the kids to sit and play. It is great because this is how I played with Legos. A giant pile and I just started building. I love watching my little one come up with original ideas or hearing...Daddy help me find a piece like this...I need it. It reminds me of being a kid. I know some kids need direction and motivation...that's where branded Legos from Star Wars steps in. It's a big partnership plus makes them a lot of money. Have you seen the price of these sets. I still have a bucket of legos at home and I enjoy watching the little one spend hours putting stuff together. I love seeing the imagination and creativity at work. That is why I loved Legos as a kid. I love the giant Lego sculptors in the store. I also learned that they are built off site and glued together. I always had a fear of accidentally knocking one over and it shattering into 10,000 pieces. Then the staff makes me rebuild it and I'm there for months. So I can cross that worry off my list. You don't have to be a tourist to visit the Lego store even though you will find a ton of tourists shopping here.  Legos are international. Stop by and bring your inner kid or your own kid if you have one and head on down to start building the next great idea.

47.description: Yes, my significant other is an 8-year old trapped in a man's body, and legos are his kryptonite.I played with legos too... you know, back when I was a little girl. It's funny to me that the number of adults in the store completely outnumber the amount of kids. This store isn't too big, but their displays are awesome. They have a display made to look like the city, as well as some other things outside the store in the mall area. I think it's awesome that they have a wall with lego pieces, and you can get a bucket and fill it up with whatever pieces you want. Too bad they didn't have that back in the day! I personally think the lego sets are overpriced, but I guess money ain't a thang when it comes to toys!

8.description: Oh yes I do love being a grown up, but, sometimes you just have to be a big kid. Coming to the Lego store is one of those times. It's okay, because even though your kids are building away, it's hard to not want to buy everything in this store... though you'd have to have a lot of chunk change to do so. I haven't been to the Water Tower location before, so like anyone else who has experienced this wonder, you'll understand what I mean when I say I went a little crazy! It's about twice as big as the Northbrook Court location. If you like all the fun displays they put together along the wall in plexi, they have so many great ideas and concepts! Greeted by a giant statue upon entrance, the happy dragon that wraps itself around the perimeter of the ceiling is ready to play. BEST window displays - EVER! The Lego sign is made out of Lego people and their construction hats make up the color (picture uploaded).Come. Lose yourself. Plan to stay awhile if you have kids. And, when you're done, hop on over to the Dr. Seuss exhibit. You'll love being a grown up kid!

31.description: This store was great. The staff was so friendly and my son had a blast. We didnt buy anything but was greeted and encouraged to walk around and play. This was definately fun, and we took great photos.

34.description: How could I not love the Lego Store?  I went with a friend and the staff, who were our age, loved our excitement.The only reason I don't give all 5 stars has nothing to do with the staff.  There's a screen at the Star Wars Lego section.  You hold the box of any Star Wars Lego product up to the screen, and a CGI of it in action appears.  We had so much fun with just that!  But...it didn't work for the Batman Lego producs D:

16.description: The staff here was wonderful! The Lego designs on the walls are intricate, cover a wide variety of interests, and keep you occupied while the kids run around trying to figure out where to go and what to get. The guy working the loose Lego wall was great and showed my cousin how to maximize her purchase of a Lego container. I appreciate that they sell the containers by size and not weight. One problem I had was that on the Lego wall, a lot of the Legos are out of reach for almost all kids. I see that this equals an easier cleanup for staff but it takes some of the independence away from kids being able to chose their own Legos without mom or dads help which I know they enjoy.

13.description: This place is just crawling with lego experts - lego people that are passionate about the hobby and simply love what they do. In particular, a salesman named Ryan is now my sons personal hero. He took time to answer my son's questions, show him around. He was genuine, and did not talk down to my son, but on a common level of two lego fanatics. Thank you, Ryan. I love that store!

11.description: Took my 2 grandsons here from Indiana last weekend and they were in heaven. The displays they have I even wanted to buy a Lego set! The associates in the store couldn't be more helpful and friendly. Even though I took them to Navy Pier, Willis Tower and other attractions, they said this was their favorite! After they each bought a set for $45 they received a free surprise character with the purchase. I had a great time just watching them be so amazed. If your kids or grand kids like Legos, this is a "must do" !

39.description: The LEGO Store is no longer at The Shops at North Bridge. It is now permanently located at The Water Tower Place 835 N. Michigan Avenue 2nd floor and can be reached at 312) 494-0760

37.description: The Lego store is no longer located in the North bridge mall. They have moved to the water tower mall located at 835 n. Michigan ave.

0.description: I love Legos! I love this store too. I will go out of my way to schlep to Water Tower to pick up new sets either for me or my friend's kid. They have most of the sets here, and while it is not as large as NYC's flagship, it is certainly as crowded. So why would I come here? It's the hometown Flagship store. If you've ever worked in retail you know that Flagships get more quantity and better selections than their suburban counterparts. It's a about double the square footage of Northbrook court. They also have a really cool display in the window made of Lego's. This week it was the Chicago skyline. I wonder what the man hours to build that were? Anyways today I picked up the new Big Bang theory set. I wish they had made the Golden Girls instead, but I'm into these TV scenes. I also picked up a joker mobile. Tee hee. BATMAN FOREVER! Super Hero collection is one of my favorites. Everyone who works here is really friendly and knowledgable. And if you are shipping out of state they waive the abominable Cook County Sales Tax.

38.description: please be advised: lego is no longer  at the shops at northbride (nordstrom mall) it is now at the watertower place 835 n. michigan ave on the second floor. there is no longer a location at the the shops at northbridge (nordstrom mall). This is a permanent location.

51.description: Ah childhood memories! I remember having boxes and boxes of Lego's as a kid and my sister and I would stack things up and use our imaginations to make it look like it what we were trying to build, as we were never able to construct anything that looked like the diagrams that came with our boxes. "This square tall thing is an office building, and that red thing can be a fire house...." It is a mystery as to how any of the giant models in this store came to be, but they are really fun to look at, and remind me of a simpler age, and when kids actually used their imaginations. My little sis who is not of the same generation of me and my other sister, does not understand the magic of Lego's, but even she marveled at the models on display here. Very fun store.

27.description: Ugh, LEGO stores always get me. I grew up playing with LEGOs for fifteen years. Is fifteen a bit old to be playing with blocks? Maybe. But I still love them, so suck it world.

32.description: AMAZING!!!!!!!!!  This place was so much fun! Stopped in randomly and left extremely HAPPY!!!!!! Lego's are fun for all ages!!!!

54.description: Technical bizbaz makes me spaz.I love businesses that solve, rather, than perpetuate problems. Today, Legoland fixed a mindnumbing technical bizbaz problem that had me all spazzed out, so all is calm again.Today we went to Legoland armed with a generous Lego E-Gift Certificate from Grandma, which she had purchased online and which Lego had then emailed to us. Note how efficient and simple the Internet has theoretically made the art of giving!!!! Go to the Lego web site, type in the credit card number and the beneficiary grandkid's email address  ... Done!  Er...well...little did Grandma know she'd done it "incorrectly." She had no idea that she hadn't purchased what she'd intended.We chose a normally very expensive, huge, bright red, real boyish, testosterony, Star Wars Lego space ship thing that was marked down about 35%. Grinning ear-to-ear, we carried it triumphantly to the cashier, presented our gift certificate and the cashier says: "You can't use this certificate in a Lego store."With raised eyebrow and attitude, I ask: "What should we do, take it down the hall to Nordstroms?"Now, for the technical bizbaz that makes me spaz:Cashier: "That type of 'e-gift certificate' can only be used to order Lego products online; you can't use that in any Lego store. Plus, that item you want to buy has been discontinued, so it's no longer in our online catalog, which means if you want to buy that item you can't use that certificate at all, anyway."Glad I'd taken my blood pressure meds lately, I knew better to argue with him, and set off to find a manager.Long story short, the intelligent and sympathetic manager called his district manager, and in a voicemail message explained the obvious: with that e-gift certificate, Lego had essentially dragged us into the store all eager and excited only to disappoint. It was hardly apparent  to Grandma or anyone else that what Grandma intended to buy her grandchild was the experience and fun of the hunt in the Legoland store, but that's not what she bought; and, for gosh sakes, what's the point of selling these certificates online if you need a Ouija Board to parse the fine print to realize they don't really allow the recipient whatever Lego products that Lego sells, new, discontinued or otherwise?I left the Lego manager my business card, and asked him to call me if he had any luck, because we really had our hearts set on that normally very expensive, huge, bright red, real boyish, testosterony, Star Wars Lego space ship thing that was discontinued and marked down about 35%. About an hour ago, I received a phone call from the Lego Lady who left me a really sweet voicemail with instructions about how to contact her so we can obtain whatever we want with the money Grandma gifted with such good intentions.The best part was imparting that news to the thrilled, soon-to-be-owner of that normally very expensive, huge, bright red, real boyish, testosterony Star Wars Lego space ship thing that was discontinued and marked down about 35%. And Grandma, thanks, because that ear-to-ear grin is back.......now we're talkin! We're going back to Legoland first thing tomorrow morning for our booty.

48.description: I'm a LEGO VIP! Since my son is into Legos I joined the free VIP program here this past summer. You earn points the more you purchase, and it doesn't take long to cash them in. Why? Well, because Legos are damn expensive! (Ooh, sorry for swearing, any kids reading this?). The VIP program gives you cash off your next purchase, which is nice.Star Wars, Harry Potter, the City collection, this store has all the latest and greatest. Store employees are about the most helpful I've seen anywhere. I've never been here when I haven't been asked a few times if I need help finding anything, or someone explaining to me how something works. I like the Star Wars character magnets, sold in three packs, and the keychains of characters such as Harry Potter. Stocking stuffers are easy to come by here. This store also has a few build-your-own stations, so the rugrats get all excited and may get underfoot or in your way. But it's easy to get excited by LEGOs! They're pretty awesome.

44.description: They have spongebob legos!

24.description: ***This Lego Store features lots of great stuff for Lego fans; their display window features great Lego creations of some of Chicago's most well known architecture including Willis Tower (formerly Sears Tower), the John Hancock Center and Trump Tower***This Lego Store is located in the Water Tower Place mall; I am not sure what the parking situation is at the mall.

7.description: Visit was at 5:00 PM on a Thursday. The store was relatively slow for a weekday, late afternoon for a location in a popular shopping complex. The 5 star rating is based off of the following:Cleanliness of the store, floors were clean(not a brick skewer across the floor), did not see any wet spots or trail of salt from the outside world, nothing was sticky to  the touch, and display cases were clean and smudge free of fingerprints. There are sections of the store where you can build mini-me figures and it was very well kept, definitively great if you have kids that need to be immediately entertained, though the downside is that you can purchase what you built, or put it back where you found it and hear the wrath of your screaming children. The store was well stocked & well organized, did not see a shelf that was empty. Plenty of items to choose from. Staff was friendly, knowledgeable about their products, talked about their favorite sets, asked you about what you liked and guided you to the right spot to pick something out. They talked about their VIP rewards program as well. No pressure to commit to something that is offered for free. You get points for the stuff you buy, coupons, freebies, and exclusive early access to cool things.

49.description: Found a great coupon code: CHLD10YP It knocks off another 10% from discount tickets on trustedtours.com. With this coupon, I think this is the best rate on the net for Legoland - Go to: trustedtours.com/store/L…  to use it at checkout. They offer discount tickets for $15.95. Add on the 10% coupon code and it is about $14.36. It will save you over $5.50 per ticket. have fun!
