40.description: A few Saturdays ago some of my family came up for one of my Niece's b-day's...the plan included lunch/tea at American girl, shopping, shopping and, yea, more shopping.  My son and I were to meet them after the girls did lunch at AG and hang out for w them for a few hours around town.  We got there early as I wanted to check out the Lego Store and get a few things as he's right at that age where Lego's are becoming interesting and well, doable.  As expected the place was a madhouse...it was a Saturday afternoon and gorgeous out, a recipie for mind numbing tourist hell. The store is surprisingly small and every square inch of the space is utilized...ultimately the design/configuration makes for a congested mass of ppl standing in a huge queue, while others navigate thru said line to browse, buy and play w. all things Lego. Any rate, he and his cousins didn't mind the crowds and dove in to all the stations where you can choose your own combinations of Lego pieces and bag them up...great idea.  We will definitely be back but it will be off peak hour and a weekday.

53.description: It's baby month for a few of my friends. One in particular recently gave birth to her second son. While running around the city getting a gift for my friend's newest arrival, I wanted to pick up something for his big brother as well. This is my attempt at making him feel just as special about being a big bro, ya know? I stopped by knowing full well that I probably would end up finding a cooler toy at a Target or something. The lego displays they have are pretty cool (Michigan Ave., the John Hancock structure, the Star Wars stuff), and I ended up staying here longer than I planned. It's a bigger store than it appears from the front. I had no idea there were so much Lego stuff of varying themes (i.e. dinosaurs, Star Wars, pirates). Prices start at about $15 for something that looks like a basic starter kit, and then the prices obviously go up for bigger sets. I found a Thomas the Train set thing which seemed reasonably priced and looked age appropriate. I only know this because all the lego items are age specific as indicated on the boxes. It's a good store to bring kids (and adults) to but probably not so much on parents' wallets. Just kidding! I dug the helpful and very patient employees working here. I wonder if they get to play and build legos when the store closes? Wouldn't that be fun?

30.description: Who says you are too old to buy Legos? If they do they are dumb. The staff is always fun even though they are busy every time I've gone in there. I live in Michigan and wish I had a Lego store close. This is the next best thing.

46.description: I love Legos!  That is all.

1.description: This store is so cool. It's a big burst of nostalgia to a 20-something like me, and wow have Legos come a long way since I was a kid!The decor is awesome. There's full size sculptures made from Lego bricks throughout the store, and displays of the put-together sets that they sell. There's also a HUGE variety of different Lego sets. From Star Wars to Doctor Who, Elsa and the Simpsons. There's a set you'll want to build. There's also a wall of colors, and you can pick out your own combination of bricks to take home, which I think is really cool.The service here- meh. Workers passed us a few times and never bothered to ask if we needed help finding anything or had any questions. They could have maybe sold us on something, but ultimately we left without making a purchase.

55.description: Grown ups can shop here too! They have the cutest selection of Lego accessories like cake pans, ice cube trays, pens, notepads, key chains, etc. I bought my friends the cutest little Lego Head Timer. It was featured in Rachel Ray Magazine and is a big yellow Lego Head with different faces that spin around when you use it....and it's only $8.00! Super fun store for fun quirky gifts, they even have a savings club card so after you spend a billion dollars you get a gift certificate.

9.description: I grew up playing with Legos, and they were one of my favorite toys. I love that there is a store devoted to them, but I actually don't think it's the best place to buy Legos. The store isn't that large, so they aren't going to have every single set, just really popular ones. Most of the store is sadly devoted to selling various branded sets with specialty pieces you can't use for anything other than building the thing on the box. They do have a small section in the back of the store where they sell generic sets with 250-1000 pieces, but the options are slim. Along the back wall, they've got bins of pieces that you mix and match. You an fill a large container for $15.99 or a small container for $8.99. The signs say that the large containers can hold 325-375 pieces, and the small containers can hold 125-175 pieces, but obviously this depends on which actual pieces you want to get. I've never actually taken the time to count how many pieces I ended up getting, but I will say that a good strategy is to put big pieces in first and then sprinkle smaller pieces in the cracks. If you're building some project and really need a specific piece or a specific color, I would recommend getting all the pieces you might use together, because they do switch them out regularly. Also the containers themselves are really nice for storing dry goods like beans or rice afterwards.Despite its lack of actual products I want to buy, the Lego Store is a fun place to come and just play with Legos. They have several tables with huge bins of Legos next to them where you can just build whatever you want, and also a ramp where you can race Lego cars.

26.description: Who doesn't love LEGO??  I'm not gonna lie... I do!  OK... so I don't play with them any more.  But, I do think they are an excellent toy to help a child use their imagination.  I played with them as a kid, I bought them for my son, I buy them for my niece and nephews, and I buy them as gifts.  This particular LEGO store in Water Tower Place is huge.  So many options!  The only downfall is that it's always crowded which can make it hard to move around.  But, I love knowing that I can find a LEGO set for every age range here.  The store also has little play islands set up for the kids.  And, of course, the front display case is the Chicago skyline done in LEGO... photo op!

25.description: If you or your kid is a Lego fan, it is worth the time to check this store out! The front window has the Chicago skyline out of legos - it's amazing!  The store itself is the largest I've personally been to - so my son was in heaven!!

12.description: BUIlD IT & THEY WILL COMEThis store originally was located in the Bridge Shops at Nordstroms down the street. This new location is more accessible for tourists plus you are where all the shopping seems to start. When you enter the Water tower shops from Michigan Ave take the esculators straight up and then continue to walk straight. You will eventually walk into the Lego Store located on the back wall.  Legos have turned into a big business.  When I was a kid you bought a box of Legos and you used your imagination and you built stuff. Now Legos are competitive and cross branded with movies. Like building the Star Wars Death Star. Yeah I've got nothing to do for the next week but follow along and assemble 2000 pieces of Legos into complete destruction for Darth Vadar. Luke Skywalkers is gonna be pissed. Legos have become the modern 3D puzzle for people. Wait till these kids have arthritis, then its back to jigsaw puzzles. The store is fun because it has an area for the kids to sit and play. It is great because this is how I played with Legos. A giant pile and I just started building. I love watching my little one come up with original ideas or hearing...Daddy help me find a piece like this...I need it. It reminds me of being a kid. I know some kids need direction and motivation...that's where branded Legos from Star Wars steps in. It's a big partnership plus makes them a lot of money. Have you seen the price of these sets. I still have a bucket of legos at home and I enjoy watching the little one spend hours putting stuff together. I love seeing the imagination and creativity at work. That is why I loved Legos as a kid. I love the giant Lego sculptors in the store. I also learned that they are built off site and glued together. I always had a fear of accidentally knocking one over and it shattering into 10,000 pieces. Then the staff makes me rebuild it and I'm there for months. So I can cross that worry off my list. You don't have to be a tourist to visit the Lego store even though you will find a ton of tourists shopping here.  Legos are international. Stop by and bring your inner kid or your own kid if you have one and head on down to start building the next great idea.

59.description: Screw Barbie! Growing up I played with Legos! Walking around the store made me remember all the good times I had.Marvel at the Star Wars section! Take photos of the Godzilla movie set! Take your picture with the guy on the bench outside! There's so much to do and see for just a Lego store. I think the biggest nostalgia factor was seeing the European style Lego sets, the kinds that I got in Germany as a kid. No castles or Outer Space adventures here. Your imagination settles on a cafe scene or a local fresh produce store.What's keeping this store from 5 stars? How about the crazy price of "Build Your Own Lego Man" for like $2.59? That's just insane.

21.description: Every time I see the price of Legos my heart skips a beat and my hands get clammy. This store is every lego connoisseur's dream come true, it's every nook and cranny is filled with lego sets that will blow your mind. What totally made this store incredible is the Lego Wall! A giant wall with individual bins filled with super sweet Legos (some of which I have never seen). For a very inexpensive price my son filled up a little tupper bin and walked out a happy camper without me spending a fortune.

17.description: ***This Lego Store features lots of great stuff for Lego fans; their display window features great Lego creations of some of Chicago's most well known architecture including Willis Tower (formerly Sears Tower), the John Hancock Center and Trump Tower***This Lego Store is located in the Water Tower Place mall; I am not sure what the parking situation is at the mall.

10.description: Dude! It's a Lego store. What more do you need to know!?This place is large, maybe not massive, but very large compared to many of the other Lego stores in various malls. As an adult who still buys Legos for myself, as well as my nephew and some of my grown friends, this store has never failed me. Whatever I've come in looking for has always been available. And the time I came looking for a set that was recently discontinued, two staffers went above and beyond to locate it for me at another store and have it shipped to me.In general, the store is usually crowded given that it's on Michigan Avenue and the mall is a tourist draw. But even with that, employees will always greet you with a smile, engage you in product information, and do whatever they can to make your visit productive.

5.description: No matter what city I visit, it's Lego store always feels like home. I get the same expert and knowledgeable service, the same familiar lay-out and people with a passion for creativity and overall awesomeness.

3.description: Great store for kids and almost anybody. You can build your own Lego guys, buy some blocks of any color/shape/size, or buy a set. Workers here always seem to enjoy their time.

35.description: Everything Lego's can be found at this store, and it is not overpriced as I expected everything on Michigan Ave to be.  Also, you can find some harder to find Lego's here and much cheaper than what some online retailers are selling them for.

19.description: A lot of kids brains all over the place from sensory overload. Brian at the check out counter was very friendly and patient. There is a huge Iron Man made out of lego's.

28.description: Thanks to a fellow yelper for reminding me to visit this place once more!  I admit that I don't spend a lot of money on legos. I just love to come in and play.  I particularly love the "free play" wall where you buy legos by the container.  I just have a ball creating my own stuff.  Every now and then I take one of my kids (I nanny, don't have my own so this is how I borrow them) into the store and we are set for a couple of hours making stuff.  The best part for me is that their parents are usually thrilled to pay the bill because the kids were out actually doing something creative rather than being inside watching a video or playing a video game.Legos rock and this store shows why.

45.description: Currently at it's temporary location.  Great place to get your lego fix.  Things you need to do:  1. get the VIP card; 2. If you are going to get the "pick-a-brick"... connect the pieces together in to a structure that fits, then load up on the little bits that fit in the dead space. You can get a lot more by doing that. 3. You can build your own figures (3 of them).Love this place.

33.description: I was hunting for the lego store that was in a different building on Michigan Ave which is now closed. Sadsies.And then I stumbled across this location and was all excited. *Yes, a lego-fix.* It does have lots of sets but not so much of the peripheral lego stuff that I love. It was sort of disappointing.Although the build your own mini-fig bin was pretty cool, until I saw the toddler trying to eat the various bits.

43.description: Fun place, even for big kids. Although, I kind of wish I was a little kid so I could partake in the commotion out front. Inside, there are stations where you can make your own lego person, pretty fun.

2.description: I love the build-your-own wall of pieces on the back wall.  I've been filling buckets there for years, to provide grandsons with lots of little pieces to do their own creative building.  Good service in the store too, on every visit.

18.description: This store is by far the best of the 4 Chicagoland Lego stores.  They are so helpful and sincerely love what they sell, a rarity in this world.  April, the manager, is awesome. She personally gave me an invitation to their private sale after Thanksgiving.  It was so appreciated and I believe she actually looked at my account and saw how much I've happily given the store this past year.  Northbrook store is so different in the sense that 2 of their female employees are out to get people.  I bought two of the same sets and the woman questioned me as to why I needed two?!  Umm, because I build one and keep the other maybe?!  It's amazing that two stores could differ so much.  Hit the Water Tower one as the staff is fantastic and they usually have the hard to find items.  Five stars.

41.description: We go every year for my son's birthday. They always have something on sale-I've never left that store without a big bag and never spent more than $25. I love their Lego display of Chicago and all of their displays are amazing. Went last week though and they moved to Water Tower place...no more clearances but it seemed much bigger!

52.description: Okay, I guess I'm going to come off as Grandpa Fuddyduddy (especially for using a word like "fuddyduddy") but when I was growing up, I played with old-school building toys like Tinkertoys and Lincoln Logs and the Erector Set.  When I first got into the Lego scene, all we could really afford was the giant red plastic suitcase with a big ol' gray platform board and some various bricks in various colors.Use your imagination, kids!  Go wild!  Build!Long gone are those days, when kids used their imaginations and built wondrous things like a helicopter that's also a dinosaur and can drop car-shaped missles that also drive to the place that needs exploding, like Barbie's Malibu Dreamhouse.  KABLOOEY!By the time my really young cousins got into the Lego scene, all that was available in the stores were pre-designed Lego kits.  You get all of the pieces you need (if you were lucky and weren't sold a bum set with one missing slanty black matte piece crucial for the structural integrity of the complex Lego construction architecture) and easy-to-follow directions with over 20 steps with blocks and arrows that a child could read but a licensed contractor adult was required in order to understand the assembly.Luckily, I was smart enough to not need certification, and my cousins were too riddled with ADD and ADHD (its hyperactive cousin) to put the thing together - so they'd hire me for the day to come and build their awesome kits that cost $100 back then and I'd have fun putting it together (because I'm a geek) and they'd have fun inevitably destroying it to the point where I'd get hired back and the cycle repeats until the pieces go missing and they get mommy and daddy to buy a new one and we would rinse and repeat.One trip to the Lego store and a little piece of my childhood was saved.  Well, first it was trampled on, then it was saved.  90% of what you see in this wonderful land of miniaturization is pre-designed model kits with about 1,000 pieces and likely 20-page instructions for assembly and the things are GORGEOUS.  And the price tags are well over $200.But if you can make it past all of that, in the back room, you can still find a big ol' kit of simple Lego pieces and each of those comes with a little bit of freakin' imagination for your child.  They also have some imagination on display at the building stations with a pit full of Lego bits and a bunch of gray platforms to work on and the Paleocopter Mark II can once again be prepped for demolition.It's about then when the adult part of me smacks the kid part of me on the back of the head and reminds him that we pay the bills now and we're not spending $50+ on a piece of our nostalgia.It's about then when I start doing the calculations, trying to figure out how much these kits all cost PER PIECE and then picking up one damned Lego block and just KNOWING that they can't cost more than a fraction of a penny to make each of them.  It's a mold and some plastic.  And just because you figured out the right combination of tiny fraction-of-a-cent pieces it takes to make something that looks like a Medieval hut, does that give you the right to sell it at 500% markup per piece just to save some child of having to use imagination to create it themselves?I have two choices:  I can either (1) purchase my own chemicals and experiment with molds and making my own homemade blocks (and whatever knockoff name I feel like replacing the Lego trademark with) or (2) find out if the Lego corporation hires people to play with Legos all day until they come up with the next design that they can kit and sell at 500% markup - because that sounds like a really fun job.And these are the things that I keep in the back of my head to stop me from dropping hundreds of dollars on Lego versions of my favorite Star Wars memories.  But you sure put up one helluva fight, Lego Store...

50.description: This is one of the few non food reviews that I am going to write. That's because outside of food, one of the other few loves in my life is LEGOs. I've been building and collecting them since I was at least 3. I know because I remember playing with them when my mom told me she was pregnant with my brother. Ironically, that's also one of my first definitely accurate memories.Seriously, the LEGO store in Chicago is one of the best LEGO stores that I have been to outside of Legoland in San Diego. Definitely a must go if you're on the Mag Mile. The neat part is that unlike department or clothing stores, every LEGO store is different. This one is full of prebuilt massive LEGO statues and it also has plenty of prebuilt LEGO sets for you to see what they look like before you buy them (one of the common problems cash strapped LEGO lovers like me experience all the time).Seriously, This place is awesome. Just go.

4.description: From Star Wars to ANY Lego set from beginner/advanced, this store has it! This location, located in Water Tower Place is a kids(or Adults) heaven who love legos :) My son, instantly went from bored to a "BIG GRIN" once we arrived there :D Everything you can think of for legos, from your own creation(blocks) to individual sets are there. You can buy mixed Lego pieces in cups, filled to the top for 1 price or buy individual sets/characters. Great display of life size/Chicago landmarks on display. The atmosphere is never dull! Kids running all over and elbow to elbow parents watching and saying "Yes" or "No" to their kids favorites. Prices range from $3 to over $150 for some sets. Great store, great atmosphere for all. Lines move pretty well and there are staff on the floor for your questions.

6.description: Friendly staff of they are very good of acting. Large selection and they have some great Lego creations of Chicago's skyscrapers.

22.description: Go LEGO crazy!!! They have every Lego you can imagine. The displays are super cool and certainly something to see. I love the Willis Tower, White House and Rockefeller.

15.description: my kids luv the store! its well arranged with a lot of customer service folks checking on you to assist. Lots of legos to build in designated areas  while browsing the store.

57.description: Beware: The Lego Store distorts perception and logic.  Whenever I enter the Lego Store I explore the idea of spending $200 for the Lego Death Star.  There's no reason this should be in my mind.  I don't have $200 to just randomly spend on some legos.  I don't have any space for a Death Star in my apartment.  However, I get in that Lego store and I want something epic.  I will usually settle for an Anakin Skywalker key chain.  That'll do for now.  Nonetheless, the Lego Store is way cool.  They have lego replicas of the Sears Tower and the John Hancock Center.  You can't get them online (according to the boy) so pay a visit to the Lego Store!

20.description: So many Legos every where! First time here to pick up a birthday present! But how cool is this store! I felt a little overwhelmed with the amount of people in the store however if your kids love Legos coming here would be like walking in to candy land! And the lego displays are too awesome!

36.description: How could I even begin to explain how amazing the LEGO store is? Let's see...... It can be compared to the warmth from the sun. The refreshment of a cold glass of lemonade on a hot day. Or perhaps the smile of a child. Ok enough of that.... The LEGO store is just awesome and amazing! I love it so much, I want to work there part time just so I can be around kids and play with LEGOs all damn day! God I spend way too much here and I don't even regret it at all. They have a great rewards system and I love the fact that when a 27 year old business professional comes in here, they just don't judge me. Especially when I take a photo next to the life size woody and I bust out my VIP card.

14.description: Well I am NOT an expert on Lego stores this place is simply awesome. It seems as if they have the most complex designs that exist with finished examples.  Got kids?  Perfect for starters to 16+. Good for the big kid in you all well.  A+

0.description: I went there yesterday after meeting up with my best friend and purchased some body wash and bubble bath (which I gave to  my friend) and I noticed now they hired men to work there since the majority of their staff is female. The guys were really nice and very professional and I like coming here every time I am at Water Tower Place. I still got great service here it's the pinnacle of my shopping trips to Water Tower.

29.description: We came here for a quick snack. We all shared an appetizer of jacked up nachos (cheese, olives, tomatoes, onions, ground beef, and hot peppers) and the tri-guacamole (regular, mango, and spicy guacamole). Both were really good, but my favorite (and most of the tables favorite) was the mango guacamole. I think that the majority of the time we kept on saying how great it was and trying to figure out how to make it ourselves. It's a definite must if you ever visit Chango Loco.

42.description: While checking out Navy Pier on a hot day this place provide the drinks, chips and salsa and an air conditioned bar for us to take in the soccer game. For that I am thankful, ha.

23.description: People definitely don't come here for the food, but for its location.  Food and drinks at Navy Pier are overpriced in general and that's something you just have to expect.  Chango is situated on the upper level near the Ferris wheel and carousel.   We waited about 15 minutes for table for about 10 people.  I thought it would have taken longer as there were a lot of people in line.  The outdoor seating area provides a nice view of the lake and the skyline.  It's also a great spot to see the fireworks on display at Navy Pier on Wednesdays and Saturdays during the summer.  There's a canopy that would protect from light rain.The food here is decent.  The complimentary chips and salsa were good.  The alcoholic beverages are watered down.   The waiter is friendly and attentive.3 fish tacos - $12Chicken quesadillas - $11Pitcher of sangria (approximately 5 glasses) - $32The closet bathrooms are located either right downstairs or in the red building near the Ferris wheel.

47.description: During Summer 2006, my wife and I (with our two sons) had lunch at this restaurant a couple of times while we visited Navy Pier. The food wasn't great -- just good, which is fine in a touristy spot like Navy Pier. It's not like I was expecting a 'Lindo Mexican' (formerly of Lincoln Park) kind of excellence.So last Sunday (09/21/08) while visiting Navy Pier we decided to have lunch there again. I ordered the enchiladas and my wife the veggie burrito (kids had hotdogs/fries). My first thought on seeing the food was 'what a large serving' considering it was lunchtime. But after TWO bites... I called my waiter over and sent that CRAP back!I have never in my 43 years ever.. EVER had such putrid food served to me. I would've enjoyed a dead rat better. The sauce was disgusting.. it tasted like generic tomato soup made by some fourth-world country in the 15th century. The 'steak' consisted off tiny bits (about a 1/4 the size of my fingernail) of some undetermined meat (hell, it might have been dead rat). This was rolled up in a tortilla that had the consistency of two week old, second-hand bread.While I was sending my food back, my wife was helping our sons get situated and then she took a bite of her food and I thought she was gonna projectile vomit like you see in the movies. She gagged so hard I thought she might have swallowed her tongue. Her 'veggie burrito' consisted of huge spoonfuls of guacamole and minced onion/tomato mixture served with tortilla chips and shredded lettuce that was so wilted it looked like it spent days in the rain before being left out to dry.Even our sons hot dogs were served on bread that was falling apart like it was days old (fortunately, they only eat the hot dogs anyway.. so the bread wasn't a concern.)I have eaten in restaurants all over the western hemisphere -- from N.America to S. America and a few islands in the Pacific -- and I have NEVER been served food that disgusting.Needless to say.. never again will I be eating at this restaurant.

8.description: Navy Pier is crazy expensive, but this restaurant is not to bad. Yes, a bit overpriced, but it was ok. Service was good, our waitress was very nice. I could see service being bad if this placed was packed which wasn't when we are here. Very young waitresses and people who cleaned out table and gave us water. It was clean. Menu was not a lot, but they had their options. I like it being on the second floor so good view outside. 4 stars, but 5 stars for hard working waitresses and waiters who were super polite and nice.

31.description: Blah food, mediocre service. We should have walked out when my wife couldn't get anything prepared to her specifications. Apparently, everything is made beforehand & just heated up when ordered. A big waste of time & money.

34.description: Here's a serious tip: the flight of guacamoles, unless you like sauce added to your guac (yes, SAUCE!), don't get it.  The regular guac, while a tad under-seasoned, is just fine.  But added mango sauce to the mango guac, and some sort of smoky sauce with pepitas to the chipotle guac, was gross.  Guacamole should not be sweet, and that's what the mango-sauced guac ended up being. I added some Tapatio to help the cause, but it didn't.The tacos, while small, were quite tasty.  I had one of each:chicken, pork,and beef.  They only come with cilantro and onions, though, so I requested sides of cheese and sour cream. The addition of these two items picked up the flavor, for sure.  I didn't eat the rice or much of the beans that come with the dish, and so can't speak to those.  My 16oz margarita on the rocks, with Petron Silver, was just okay.  I got slightly buzzed.  But, that kind of makes sense if you've got 16oz with only one shot.The line looked like it would take forever, but we were seated outside, overlooking the pier and lake, within about fifteen minutes. The waitstaff was pleasant, and we left satisfied.  If you want to use the restrooms, however, they're back downstairs in the food court area - there are none in the actual restaurant.

16.description: Here's a serious tip: the flight of guacamoles, unless you like sauce added to your guac (yes, SAUCE!), don't get it.  The regular guac, while a tad under-seasoned, is just fine.  But added mango sauce to the mango guac, and some sort of smoky sauce with pepitas to the chipotle guac, was gross.  Guacamole should not be sweet, and that's what the mango-sauced guac ended up being. I added some Tapatio to help the cause, but it didn't.The tacos, while small, were quite tasty.  I had one of each:chicken, pork,and beef.  They only come with cilantro and onions, though, so I requested sides of cheese and sour cream. The addition of these two items picked up the flavor, for sure.  I didn't eat the rice or much of the beans that come with the dish, and so can't speak to those.  My 16oz margarita on the rocks, with Petron Silver, was just okay.  I got slightly buzzed.  But, that kind of makes sense if you've got 16oz with only one shot.The line looked like it would take forever, but we were seated outside, overlooking the pier and lake, within about fifteen minutes. The waitstaff was pleasant, and we left satisfied.  If you want to use the restrooms, however, they're back downstairs in the food court area - there are none in the actual restaurant.

13.description: The fanfare & service probably would out do the food here. Although I must try more of the cuisine. But still, A great place to relax & hang out.

11.description: Not good at all. Everything was very bland and you could tell it was all pre-made. Very disappointing.

39.description: Oh Chango. I went here cuz your name is so fun.The food however leaves less to be desired. I needed something with sustenance after a night out on the Chi-town so while my friend and I were being touristy at the Navy Pier we were intrigued by the name. So we walked the lengthy pier, doubled back, and found you Chango Loco.We didn't know at first that the restaurant means "crazy monkey" and that its mascot was in fact a crazy, possibly drunken monkey drinking Sauza Tequila. We stepped inside and had a veggie burrito and a taco salad with skirt steak. The inital chips and salsa was disappointing because somehow the chips were too dry and healthy tasting although the salsa was good. My friend thought her burrito was dry as well and needed my side of salsa to wash it down.My skirt steak was chewy and cut in tiny little pieces that were sort of rubbery. now that is loco you chango!If you do go here, take a picture of the sign, enjoy saying the name a few times, and walk back out to get some navy pier goodness (fried powdered things and hot dogs). You'd be better off!

37.description: The rice was just got one big blob of salt. Salt, salt, salt, salt. I'm not talking about a little to salty taste, but literally someone poured a dozen or so extra grams of salt in everything; not just the rice but especially the rice.Waiter: "Would you like a box for that?"Me: "No thank you, it was utterly and completely disgusting."Waiter: "OK. Thanks for stopping in, please come back soon!"Me: "You bet."Whomever manages this place needs to fire the entire kitchen staff. Or maybe the owner needs to fire the kitchen manager. Something needs to change that is apparent.

0.description: We were lured here by a sign telling of the best Margs in Chicago.  They forgot to add alcohol.Food was OK, nothing special.Service was polite, friendly and fast -- no issues there.They have a kids menu, but nothing to keep them occupied.

38.description: Location is awesome. Views are great. Don't order the margaritas or the piña coladas...  but isn't that what you want in a Mexican cantina?  Hmm

51.description: This place is HORRIBLE!!!!! I went there on Sunday August 6, 2006 and had the WORST experience. We went to the bar for drinks and the 1st thing out of the bartender's mouth was "let me see your IDs!"  No "Hello" or "Hi, can I please see your IDs" none of that. We order 5 patron margaritas that came in tiny cups for $12 each and they were absolutely horrible. We complained to the bartender and his response was "that's just how we make them." Being in a group of African-American business women I swear that the bartender (Chris) was racist as he never made eye contact, had nothing nice to say and slammed down our change faster than I have ever seen. I will NEVER go back to this place.

27.description: My husband and I were wanting Mexican after a long day of walking. He ordered a crazy monkey to drink, I'm not sure if they even added alcohol. I had a margarita, hard to mess that up. We both ordered the grande burrito with steak. I was not a fan, but my husband liked his. I did not like the whole beans or the flavor of the beans. I would not come back.

32.description: A while back I wrote a review for Fajita Grill in Westbrook, ME and gave if 3 starts for not serving impressive enough Mexican food..... However, this place is far worth, and in fact, the worst Mexican place I've ever been to.I used to think that Mexican food was so flavorful that you can't really mess it up. But I was wrong. The chips and salsa were absolutely awful: much much worse than the bagged chips we can buy from Walmart. They werer not crispy but rather firm. I am 80% certain that they weren't fresh made.My mom and I ordered one of their specials (which turned out wasn't so special after all) and one salad. The salad wasn't really Mexican. But I really wasn't expecting much out of a restaurant by the famous Navy Pier. So I'll give the salad a pass. The special came with 3 jumbo shrimps (which were pretty good I'd have to say), and a slice of steak, served with rice, beans and guacamole. All the side orders were OK. But the steak was way overcooked. We couldn't chew it even after cutting it into little pieces. The service wasn't so great either: music way too loud; it took them forever to get anything.However, it does have a view as it is located on the second floor (same level as the  Ferris Wheel) by Navy Pier.

48.description: Majorly a tourista thing, but when I was in the area after a movie and wanted to pretend to be a  Texan coming to the big city on vacation and watch the fireworks this past Saturday, it totally was the right setting.The food was good, as good as most tex-mex places in the city, and the view was great from the outdoor patio. We had perfect seats for the fireworks. I'd like to also point out that the service was actually VERY good considering if I worked at a place like that I would have a super sour attitude.  But, by all means do NOT try the mojito. I know it came from a mix bottle...the green color was tell tale.Yee-haw folks!!

44.description: This is the worst Mexican food ever!  I didn't know you could screw up Mexican food this bad. Food was so overpriced, lacked flavor, and didn't taste fresh at all. If it had been exceptional I wouldn't mind paying for it but Taco Bell is better than this place and I hate TB.  We fell in to this tourist trap because we were starving and happened to be at Navy Pier. Do yourself a big favor and avoid this place.

24.description: I had low expectations for the food, which was ok. It's navy pier people...not an authentic Mexican restaurant.  However, the service was ridiculously bad.  Ordered nachos (and a meal). Took 15min or our drinks to come...then quesadillas... Wait, we didn't order that "did you put the order in wrong?" "No, I'm not sure what is going on with the kitchen". "Waiter, are they coming?" Yes he says. Never checked. Never came. He said he "took care of it" for us. Lucky us not having to pay for nachos we never got. Oddly enough, we WERE charged for nachos. Nuff said.

7.description: The service was super slow. The food was mostly terrible. The beans were decent and the tater tots were good.  We had a four year old with us who wanted cheese dip but they apparently don't have plain cheese dip which totally bummed her out.

49.description: I wouldn't normally even think to give this restaurant a review it is such a bland touristy place to begin with.... but man, did they treat me like shit!  I ate here for lunch with a couple friends and everything seemed normal enough. Like I said... nothing memorable. The waiter was pleasant enough. We ordered a plate of nachos to share and were munching on them as our food arrived. I checked mine out and was eyeing the green substance in a small plastic container on my plate wondering of its contents (salad dressing). Out of nowhere an employee pops up at our table and asks, "Is there a problem?" with some *major* attitude.. She is not our waiter or the hostess so I immediately assume she has the wrong table and tell her no. She informs me that I was looking at my food like I had a problem... I once again tell her that there is no problem and state that I will try very hard not to look strangely at my food anymore. She disbelievingly says "ok" and walks off...  She never did say who she was but I truly hope she is not management as she has much to improve on her people skills. There really was no "problem" with the food although it was abundant it lacked taste so I can't say it was bad. The nachos were decent. I had a chicken wrap and a friend had the fajita wrap. We both agreed they were less than wonderful. We each only ate half.  Perhaps my taste buds simply went into hibernation after being irrationally berated by a stranger. Rating: Two stars for being less than average and -1 star for at least one employee without manners.Recommendations: Get the nachos, don't expect to be treated with any respect and you'll be fine.

40.description: God, what was I thinking?  I should have known better.I had a co-worker in town visitng Chicago and I thought we'd go to Navy Pier since she's been to Chicago a dozen or so times and never been to Navy Pier.  Nice evening for a walk. We settle on Chango Loco.  What a mistake.  I ordered the Taco Salad and it was a pile of lettuce in a taco shell.  Oh, there was a little bit of cheese, guac, and sour creme.  No rice, no beans.  Ugh.  Service was good, and that's about the only thing saving this from getting zero stars.  Next time I'm going to skip ALL food at Navy Pier.

30.description: Just stopped for a quick bite outside on a semi sunny, warm day. The food was ok... Guacamole flights were good. Service was ok. Fish tacos were alright but I've had better. Overall a mediocre experience, good but nothing to write home about.

46.description: very touristy but perfect if you want to get dinner and have great seats to watch the fireworks. the food was good but nothing special. pretty standard for tex-mex. the margaritas were really good and fairly strong especially the strawberry margaritas. service was good.

1.description: Just stopped in for a drink, chips and salsa before the our river boat cruise.  We had 20 minutes and we got in and got out just fine.  The chips and salsa were better than average but the margarita was only average.  Quick service though, which was my top priority, and the bar is located in an indoor park with trees and what not.  Pretty scenic...

9.description: Pretty bad overall for such a great location. Guacamole was bland and the Salsa dip was extremely watery with no flavour.

26.description: Horrible. Not authentic Mexican. Food is under seasoned. The $12 margarita tasted like tequila I made in my toilet. The Jalapeno peppers here are like super screaming hot. My family member had a burger that they enjoyed. The fact that a mexican restaurant served a burger should have been warning number one.

25.description: I ordered a Cobb Salad yesterday, and i wasn't even half way through and found a SCREW, yes- a piece of metal. Apparently, it fell off from a tomato slicer. It doesn't make sense because they would slice the tomato somewhere else and transfer the food after, so they should have noticed that. The manager came and tried to make it up by asking me if he can buy me anything, but i didn't get anything because i lost my appetite already that i didn't want anything from that place. People there are nice, but they don't seem to be very careful with what they serve. It was my first time at Navy Pier and had the worst experience with the food.

12.description: The "Ulitmate Margarita" was horrible. Indescribable flavor. We sent it back and the waiter knew why before we said anything. The Dos Equis on tap was great. The salsa was great and our meals were excellent. Fish tacos, chicken quesadillas and the Mozz sticks came with some amazing tater tots. Over all very good. Would go again.

21.description: Nothing really positive to say.  The service sucked.  The chips and salsa were nothing to write about.  The margaritas tasted like they poured some bottled mix in with some horrible tequila.  Needless to say we didn't finish our meals but signed off on an overpriced lunch.

17.description: Stopped here a couple of days ago with a friend - I ended up with a chicken wrap and she had a burrito. Meh. Food was plentiful, but bland at best. Hello!  If you want BLAND food, would you choose a Mexican restaurant? I don't think so. But, the chips and salsa were pretty good, the beer was cold, the view from the upper level patio was good, and unlike every other place on Navy Pier, it was half empty and had no wait. Maybe this last part should have tipped us off. Anyway, went back a couple of days later with a few more friends, and;1) Had to seat ourselves. Stood at the entrance in front of the PLEASE WAIT TO BE SEATED SIGN for 5 minutes with no help in sight, looking at a bunch of empty patio tables, and finally just sat ourselves. 2) Had the waitress finally come up and say "Oh. Did you seat yourselves?" with that look like, how dare you? 3) Then she asked whether we were eating or just drinking, and when we told here we going to have a couple of drinks and may or may not eat, she said "Oh, well you'll need to sit out there near the entrance. This area is for dining only." We couldn't believe it. We were surrounded by empty tables and really, could have gone anywhere on the pier for a drink. We were doing them a favour by wanting to spend our money there. Plus, two of us had just eaten there a couple of days before, and we all would probably have ordered dinner after our drinks anyway. They were just real dicks about it. So we asked to speak to the manager. After a brief confab - in spanish, right in front of us at though we weren't even there - he agreed that we were fine where we were. 4) So we think that's settled, finally. Except then nobody would serve us!! We could see the waiters standing in a group about 30' from us, looking our way and talking, but no one would come to our table. We eventually got up and left. So in summary, I would DUMPSTER DIVE before every going back to this place. Seriously, only go here if you have a deep sense of self-loathing. For all those who gave this place more than a single star: there is a famous bronze statue of Bob Newhart (from the psychiatry sitcom, not the New England innkeeper sitcom), complete with psychiatrist's couch, right at the entrance to Navy Pier. Go lay on that couch and get some therapy!

10.description: Worst Mexican food i have ever had....horrid service, terrible food.  These idiots can't even make a cocktail.  How is this place open?  Tourists who don't know better, that's the only thing it can be.

5.description: People definitely don't come here for the food, but for its location.  Food and drinks at Navy Pier are overpriced in general and that's something you just have to expect.  Chango is situated on the upper level near the Ferris wheel and carousel.   We waited about 15 minutes for table for about 10 people.  I thought it would have taken longer as there were a lot of people in line.  The outdoor seating area provides a nice view of the lake and the skyline.  It's also a great spot to see the fireworks on display at Navy Pier on Wednesdays and Saturdays during the summer.  There's a canopy that would protect from light rain.The food here is decent.  The complimentary chips and salsa were good.  The alcoholic beverages are watered down.   The waiter is friendly and attentive.3 fish tacos - $12Chicken quesadillas - $11Pitcher of sangria (approximately 5 glasses) - $32The closet bathrooms are located either right downstairs or in the red building near the Ferris wheel.

3.description: Overpriced and food is mediocre at best. I would not recommend to friends or family to visit this place. The only pro was the waitress we had was friendly, but that alone wouldn't bring me back.

35.description: All of Navy Pier is a tourist attraction, and so you should eat here knowing that you are at a tourist attraction, not a fine dining restaurant.I ordered the steak burrito & my friend ordered steak tacos.  We sampled each others.  Both were delicious!  Each entree comes with beans - yummy to dip the chips into - and rice which was tasty.  Free chips and salsa are delivered to the table.  The sangria is delicious!!This is a great place to visit on a summer day at Navy Pier.  You are paying to sit overlooking Navy Pier where the view is great!  Good food, good view, good price (for Navy Pier).

19.description: The view of the lake was good, but the food was so-so. The food is not authentic, which is a downer for me.

28.description: Give this place a miss. There is a reason that this place is not busy. The food tastes like a frozen microwave dinner. The staff rude. They were slow with the check. You are better off at the local Taco Bell. It's a shame yelp won't let you give a no star rating. I guess that one star will do, it does have a nice view.

45.description: If you are looking for overpriced, atrocious Mexican food, this is your place.  I previously thought it was impossible to mess up Mexican food, Chango Loco proved me wrong. I created this yelp account to warn the masses about this utter failure.

33.description: Horrible food.... Is that Mexican food?  Horrible service.. Messed up the order and didn't bother to fix it.. Super expensive .. Skip it at all cost

43.description: Crap, crap, crap. I have been here twice. Unfortunately. The first time the food was not that bad but the service was absolute shit. I mean, it was so bad it was not only annoying but infuriating. But, the view is good and it is the only mexican place on the pier so I went there again over Labor Day with my parents for drinks and appetizers. Service was just as bad. Food was worse. Drinks are ok. But really expensive for what they are. Even for the pier. We ate chips and salsa which was acceptable and then we got an appetizer sampler that was awful. It had chicken wings, jalapeno poppers and quesadillas. The quesadillas (just tortilla with cheese) were about the only edible thing on the plate. The other thing that was infuriating was I had promised my daughter some ice cream so my mom went down to Ben and Jerry's to get her some so she would be busy while we ate. Yeah, they wouldn't let her bring it back in. We were about to cancel our order and just leave but they finally caved. Overall I think I would rather eat a frigging hot dog from one of the pier vendors then eat here again.

2.description: Stopped by for a snack and ended up ordering their nachos. Most orders of nachos are big, but this was just overly huge...felt wasteful because I am sure even a table of 4 (we were a table of 2) could not finish it. As far as the taste, the nachos were okay. There was a lot of cheese and beans which made it very filling. They gave us a teeny tiny to-go style container with salsa. It was good but not anywhere near enough. If they gave us more salsa I think it would have made a huge difference with the nachos since they were pretty dry. The main thing going for this place is the location since it is inside of the Crystal Gardens. If you are already there it's a decent place to go to, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

18.description: The margaritas are not good at all. The wine was served in a plastic cup. Our waiter was nice, but once we got our drinks he never came to check on us and it was not busy so that was not the reason. We finally had to flag another waitress down to get our check. Only giving it 2 stars because it's a great location/view. Would not go back.

41.description: The WORST restaurant experience of my life!!  First, we came to the podium where the hostesses were and asked if there was a wait.  They said that there were no tables available outside.  I looked and saw probably 4 open tables.  I was a little confused, but then someone said, "Oh, we can sit them down over there."  The hostesses were pretty much attached at the hip.  They sat and talked and followed each other around everywhere.  I felt like I was in a high school cafeteria!  We sat down and looked at the menu and the food was way over priced for what you get.  Beans, rice, and a burrito were $11!!  It was one of the cheapest things on the menu, though, so I ordered the Vegetable Burrito.  It was supposed to have grilled vegetables, tomatoes, lettuce, and sour cream.  When we got our food, the rice was way undercooked.  We asked for new rice but the server said the whole batch was undercooked.  Instead of tossing it, they continued to serve it to the whole restaurant.  Even the tables next to us complained, but they never did anything to make it better.  Then I cut open my burrito and it had a ton of lettuce and sour cream, but almost no other vegetables.  I mean I could literally count the small diced pieces on one hand!  Who would pay $11 for a lettuce and sour cream burrito!?!?  Seriously??  So we called over the server again and asked him and he said that he'd get the manager.  After waiting about 20 minutes while watching the server come around us but wouldn't make eye contact. When we'd try to flag him down, he'd look at us and walk the other way.  So, we followed him inside and asked about the burrito.  He pointed at the manager without a word.  The manager barely gave us the time of day.  He yelled and waved his arms and said, "What do you want from me?  Here I'll give you half off the bill!"  We said that it wasn't necessary, we just wanted some grilled vegetables to go with the burrito!  He was so angry and said, "I don't have time for this!  I'm too busy!"  So, he discounted our bill and refused to give us any other food.  We got back to the table and were never helped again...even for water.  It was TERRIBLE!  I will never ever go there again.  I can't believe what happened.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!  The prices are way too high for the crappy food and service!

52.description: This is a super good mexican place and they have outdoor seating that overlooks the pier!  The menu is small but the food is really good!  And the service is really fast!

50.description: Just visited this restaurant for lunch while stowling Navy Pier.  Although the menu is small, it offered just what I was looking for, nachos and quesadillas.  I loved the nachos so good.  I loved them so much I didn't have the quesadillas.  My boyfriend liked them though!The views from the outside seating area were great.  Our server was attentive and food came out promptly.  Oh and the margarita was pretty good, I have had better but it was nice a refreshing on a hot summer day!

4.description: Came in for cocktails and were met with free chips and salsa. Nothing too fancy but that's not what we were looking for.

6.description: Our server was great! Taco Bells food is better and more Mexican than this place! The second level seating was a nice view of the city.  Food came in a timely manner. It aas cold and terribly awful. Hot meals were cold except for the enchiladas was was microwave too hot! Food got very cold after like 8 minutes.  Avoid this place at all cost.

22.description: Stopped here a couple of days ago with a friend - I ended up with a chicken wrap and she had a burrito. Meh. Food was plentiful, but bland at best. Hello!  If you want BLAND food, would you choose a Mexican restaurant? I don't think so. But, the chips and salsa were pretty good, the beer was cold, the view from the upper level patio was good, and unlike every other place on Navy Pier, it was half empty and had no wait. Maybe this last part should have tipped us off. Anyway, went back a couple of days later with a few more friends, and;1) Had to seat ourselves. Stood at the entrance in front of the PLEASE WAIT TO BE SEATED SIGN for 5 minutes with no help in sight, looking at a bunch of empty patio tables, and finally just sat ourselves. 2) Had the waitress finally come up and say "Oh. Did you seat yourselves?" with that look like, how dare you? 3) Then she asked whether we were eating or just drinking, and when we told here we going to have a couple of drinks and may or may not eat, she said "Oh, well you'll need to sit out there near the entrance. This area is for dining only." We couldn't believe it. We were surrounded by empty tables and really, could have gone anywhere on the pier for a drink. We were doing them a favour by wanting to spend our money there. Plus, two of us had just eaten there a couple of days before, and we all would probably have ordered dinner after our drinks anyway. They were just real dicks about it. So we asked to speak to the manager. After a brief confab - in spanish, right in front of us at though we weren't even there - he agreed that we were fine where we were. 4) So we think that's settled, finally. Except then nobody would serve us!! We could see the waiters standing in a group about 30' from us, looking our way and talking, but no one would come to our table. We eventually got up and left. So in summary, I would DUMPSTER DIVE before every going back to this place. Seriously, only go here if you have a deep sense of self-loathing. For all those who gave this place more than a single star: there is a famous bronze statue of Bob Newhart (from the psychiatry sitcom, not the New England innkeeper sitcom), complete with psychiatrist's couch, right at the entrance to Navy Pier. Go lay on that couch and get some therapy!

15.description: Service was SUPER slow on a Tuesday afternoon. Got seated right away, took 20 minutes for a server to come up to us and ask for our drinks and order.  My boyfriend and I decided on sharing a steak dish.  We said steak, we looked at our server and said steak.... What did we get? Chicken. Automatically I told the busboy please take this back we asked for steak.  We sat there 15 minutes not knowing if our proper dish was being made. After getting the steak dish 15 minutes later after the chicken the waiter came up to us to apologize. When we got the check we were charged for the chicken and then there was a credit for the chicken dish.  Well we never ordered a chicken dish so that charge shouldn't have ever been on our check. Even though we got a credit for it, we never ordered it so why was it on our check?  I was going to go up to the manager. But he seemed to be the only one working hard.  SERVERS NEED TO LEARN TO MULTITASK. I watched the servers work, and seriously? Do two or more things at the same time.  I watched my server with so much frustration. Not going her again unless it's a take out order. Food was good, my boyfriend and I liked the food.

20.description: Came here with low expectations. And I hadn't read any reviews before we arrive. Fortunately our experience was better than a lot of other people. We arrived mid-afternoon and the joint was mostly empty. We were seated immediately and the waitress was very pleasant. My wife who is from Mexico City said the fajitas were "excellent." My cheese enchiladas arrived on a plate completely smothered in cheese. I didn't see the tortillas. They were buried.  The cheese was very good but it was 90% cheese and 10% everything else. Nothing close to authentic. She had piña colada that was fair to middling while I had a 16 oz. Dos Equis. So we lucked out. But I probably wouldn't return because I'd be afraid I'd have a bad experience like a lot of others.

36.description: The wait wasn't bad considering other restaurants were over 2hrs.The drinks were good.The salsa & chips were yummy!!!The food wasn't bad~ i had 3 tacos (chicken, pork & beef) and it was really good & filling! The rice & beans were a little weird but not horrible.we did order the Chips & guacamole appetizer & it was mostly chips but it was delcious!Our server was attentive & very friendly!I'd go back

14.description: The food is BAD!But the service is good!I won't recommend this place, only if you want to enjoy the skyline and a glass of water!

3.description: I have to say that I'm kind of over Wet Seal. Their clothes are still inexpensive and cute, however, the quality is not that great. Even Forever 21 has passed them by as far as quality. It's not bad for accessories and quick fixes, but it's just okay.

1.description: Even though I usually avoid this store for its lack of good quality clothing. Today I just needed some cheap maxis that would last me a few weeks. As I was going through the clothes I overheard the manager reprimanding a sales associate. I think that is the most inappropriate thing you can do in front of customers as a manager. Just take it to the back room or lower your voice. After I found a few dresses I went up to the same manager asking for a fitting room. She let me know I needed to walk to the other side of the store and ask a sales associate. I did not understand. You have keys and you're right here standing around, but okay. After that I just decided to leave and not waste my money.

2.description: I like wet seal, cuz I get most of my scarves and bags from here. But I shop at the one in Orland square mall. I just have to say those bitches who work there need attitude adjustments. I was recently there about a week ago, their were no customer's,and it was three people that were working. The boy that was working he was nice he was doing his work while the other two girls were talking to eachother about nothin. So i'm at the register ready to purchase my items those girls were still talkin to eachother like I wasn't even there. So immediately I got an attitude and was like "excuse me don't you two see me standing right here" and then they were looking stupid and one of the girls finally rung up my items. She was lucky I didn't snatch her ass across that counter.But I got what I wanted hehe.

5.description: I love Wet Seal. They have an awesome deal where if you buy their discount card, you receive specials and 10% purchases. I think this is a steal. I've gotten many items from this store for so cheap....Great styles and accessories.

6.description: This store is awesome! They always have good sales going on and even if they don't, they're reasonably priced and fun to look around!

7.description: I love this store!! They have the coolest accessories. I always find great jewelery, purses, and shoes here. And everything is always really reasonably priced. The store is not too big -- but it's jam-packed with lots of cool things!

8.description: I prefer their accessories over their clothes any day. Cheap prices but also cheaply made clothing.

9.description: price is okay...style is good...better quality than forever 21 but not the best.

0.description: I took a break from Wet Seal in an attempt to feel more adult, but I'm back.  I got some great dresses for $15 each for my honeymoon and their jewelry is all 2 for $10! The Water Tower one is much better than the State Street store; The staff was friendlier, the store was calmer, and all the merchandise was organized.  Plus, they didn't sneer at me trying on things at 8:30 when they close at 9.

4.description: Eh, I'm pretty up in the air about Wet Seal.  Back in the day, I remember it being called Contempo.  Anyway, the reason why some may like it is the reason why some may hate it.  They always have the latest trends, but just when you purchase them, they go out of style, or they don't and you end up looking like everyone else.   What I do like are their more casual t-shirts. I LOVE that their tanks are longer than the skimpy stuff at Abercrombie.

0.description: This store is located on the sixth floor of Water Tower Place, and technically, it's an American Eagle store with a tiny section of Aerie products (i.e. American Eagle's sister brand of underwear, PJs, workout gear, and lingerie). For whatever reason, Yelp and the AE web site list it as being exclusively an Aerie store, when it's actually a big American Eagle store with a pocket toward the back for Aerie stuff. First off, I love the Aerie products - specifically their underwear (thongs and boyshorts for the win!), which are 5/$25 or sometimes on sale for 7/$25. However, this store totally lacked the ambiance of the Aerie store in Woodlfield Mall (in Schaumburg), which has its very own store separate from American Eagle, and has a much more girly, "you're floating among the clouds in cute underwear" type of a feel to it. In Schaumburg, the sales associates are also very helpful about bra/underwear fittings and will wrap your purchases in a pretty bag with a colorful ribbon that you get to pick out. (I'm a HUGE sucker for packaging.)At this store, however, you're going to have to put up with obnoxious Justin Bieber music and 16-year-old sales associates that don't come anywhere near the Aerie section. There's inevitably a smaller selection of products, too.If you're in the area, and you're looking for adorable, affordable, and good-quality panties that are more mature than Victoria's Secret PINK but less frilly and expensive than the 3/$30 lingerie panties that VS also sells, then Aerie is a great option to check out.

58.description: Not impressed. After reading so many great reviews, I swung by since I was in the neighborhood, even though I avoid "American" restaurants. The decor is nice; clean, bright deli with a Mediterranean touch. No waiter service, food-court style seat yourself after grabbing food & paying. The menu is ok. Pastas, salads, soups, sandwiches, pastries, ice cream, coffee... good selection if you're looking for something quick/light. Since it's a deli, the pre-made, pay by the weight salad is fine. However, what's not fine is PRE-MADE PASTA already divvied up into to-go containers and PRE-MADE paninis/sandwiches. It does NOT take that long to put together a panini, so there's no reason why they can't make that to the order. Needless to say, the sandwiches looked sketchy, & I went for the pasta. Asked the server if there's meat in it and he had to refer to the chalkboard menu (um... I can read too, you know). $8 for a serving of what turned out to be soggy lasagna w/ 2 slabs of prosciutto, I'm disappointed. The pasta had been sitting in the sauce and it was over-seasoned (read: salty). The soggy pasta was the killer. Cashier was nice enough, gave me some plastic wear to eat. Should have left instead.

56.description: Good coffee and good pastries.

29.description: Good for a quick breakfast. Reasonable prices. A lot of seating inside and some outside.

42.description: I love this place. Their prices are great for the city.  A bagel with cream cheese, a muffin and a Snapple iced tea all under $5. We come here every morning when we visit Chicago and pick up a loaf of bread and meat to carry with us for lunch. Amazingprices and friendly staff. My favorite muffins are the Cinnamon muffin and the double chocolate chip, which had some cheese-cake tasting stuff. Yum. Make sure to get there before 10, so their best muffins aren't sold out!

23.description: My oh my just tried to order something from them and got completely ignored by the two employees working in the breakfast section, male and female workers disgusted me with their lack of line consideration. ...I was the only person of...well let's just say I got ignored

47.description: VERY rude staff behind the coffee counter.  Some kid punk with glasses waved bye in a condescending way as I left.  This staff needs to be replaced.  I am here for a week and learning the friendly Midwest is now replaced by rude foreigners.

8.description: Needed to grab a lunch bite and did not want to spend big money or suck up too much time, enter L'Appetito. A welcome respite compared to the Cheesecake next door which was completely inundated with folks. The prices were surprisingly reasonable and the food was not bad either, good to know, definitely keeping in mind for future visits.The folks working there all had accents so it can be a little lost in translation but nothing you are unable to work through, after all, food is food.

31.description: This is for the Lakeview location. We ordered about a pound of cookies, some gelato and a cannoli. All were wonderful Italian treats. They source from local bakers too, which I love.

34.description: Very reasonable cheap prices. I love buying a container of their Italian Tuna - tuna with capers, sundried tomatoes, and artichokes. Unique take on tuna!

16.description: Great place for a quick lunch. I enjoy their pizza, toasted sandwiches and paninis very much. They have a great dessert section as well as a huge diverse beverage selection.

13.description: Welcome to the Gold coast section of the Near North side of Chicago, where you will more than likely find either tourists or the "ruling elite" of this city. This information I tie together because this small coffee shop is located in this area, so of course these type of people you would encounter in here. I went in to the left line heading in a westward direction to order my white chocolate mocha with a gluten free cookie, so far I was impressed with it. Of course, there is a sign on the start of the line that says you must pay first, then you can sit down. It is common policy in most coffee shops. Sitting down to enjoy my order, I can see that the walls are painted like if we are in a small Italian town, hence given the store name. Then you will notice that the vast majority of people here are persons who have enough income to live a satisfying lifestyle. I recommend this place since it receives less traffic than the Cheesecake Factory that is next door.

11.description: This is an interesting restaurant cafe.  I have always wanted to go here but finally did.  Its in the bottom court in front of the John Hancock building.  Its rather lively today with locals and tourists.  There was actually a food tour that came and a guy spoke about the history of the place.  "The owners were 1st generation Italian immigrants hr says and they have another store......"This place is a good rest stop when touring or shopping.  They have beer, wine, all other bottled or canned beverages, and a full cafe if you are in need of an expresso.They serve mostly deli sandwiches/subs but have pizza and sides by the pound.  I had the Diavolo and it was really good.  We also had cheese pizza which was not good and a turkey and cheese sub which was so so.  The coffee served is Illy, a popular brand like Starbucks in Europe.  The coffee was good. We had dessert and it was pretty good, a cannelloni and almond crescent. There is seating inside and out and quite a bit inside.  The place is comfortable once seated but a little loud and made to look Italian Mediterranean, yes I got that from eavesdropping on the tour......the layout is a bit unorganized and cluttered.The food quality is good but overall taste average.Still Worth a try.

39.description: Magnificent Munchies!L'Appetito is an Italian deli/cafe located at the base of the John Hancock Building in the front, down the stairs off of Michigan Avenue in Chicago, IL. It's a great spot to grab a quick breakfast, lunch or snack when shoppin' or workin' on the Magnificent Mile. It serves up hot & cold deli sammies; a variety of salads & soups; hot breakfast items such as pancakes, scrambie eggs, bacon & sausage; yummy-lookin' pizza square-slices at lunchtime; and it even serves wine for a lil lunchtime/afternoon stress-relieva! I've ate the pre-made chef salads before and other assorted salads from the deli & everything has always been fresh & tasty!On the bakery side, there's a gemload of sweets rangin' from cannolis & lotsa other specialty, Italian treats; a smorgasbord of every kinda cookie under the sun; an assortment of decadent-looking cakes slices, brownies & muffins; and any other type o'pasty & sweet carb you can possibly be cravin'. In a moment o'weakness I can't pass up the large, soft cookies in the cookie jars on top of the bakery case for $1.95. (The jars to the left have the soft cookies. The jars on the right have crispy cookies, if ya like a crunchy cookie). My fave cookies are the soft chocolate chip, M&M, pumpkin & peanut butta! (See my yummy pics!) The available cookie flavas in the soft jars rotate/vary but really any one o'these guys are oh so soft & will be yummo in your tummo & will taste betta with your fave cup o'joe!Speakin' o'Joe, L'Appetito brews & sells coffee drinks made with one of my personal fave brands, illy! It's a smooth but bold coffee. The coffee here is always served pipin' hot & needs no doctoring! A cup o' illy is the perfect pal to your sweet bakery treat! Finally, a stop at L'Appetito wouldn't be complete without hittin' up the gelato case. It's not the biggest selection in Chi-town but it's super tasty. One lil, perfect, round scoop o'gelato will cost ya $3, but it's worth it. The texture is thick, creamy & spoonably-gemlicious! Sampling is allowed & really all the flavas are good but Espresso & Italian Vanilla are 2 of my faves. At peak breakfast & lunch hours, you'll be hard-pressed to find a table as L'Appetito is popular & gets packed. You pick out your food at the counter & pay at the register. (You have to pay separate for items on the bakery/gelato side & for food on the deli side.) There's usually a line on both sides, but they move fast. Service is quick & the workers expect you to order fast too! They ain't there to make small talk witcha! It's not Cheers people, but I'm not bitchin' cuz ya get your food fast & it's good! So whether you're headin' up to the top o'the Hancock for a killa view o'Chicago, workin' downtown or shoppin' for some killa clothes on Mag Mile, I highly recommend stoppin' in for a quick bite at my fave Italian cafe on my fave Mile for some molto gemmy snacks! L'Appetito is a convenient, gem-approved cafe & this hidden gem has got a quick, sure cure for everyone's appetite!

37.description: Nice little place for a quick snack/food. Gelato is delicious. I got a vanilla canolli which was ok and some gelato which was good( about $3 a scoop ) Nothing too amazing bit if you are in the mood of a pasty its good to give it a try.Service was ok.

0.description: This is the perfect place to recover your wits after a dizzying trip to the 95th floor lounge in the Hancock tower. It's an even better place to recover from the dizzying prices of said lounge. The place has a nice homey feel, with a spacious cafeteria-style dining area. I eavesdropped on an older couple sitting next me to to find out the woman was teaching French to the man. It's never too late to learn :).My tip? Have a drink at the top, and come back to earth for the eats. The sandwiches there are delicious, grilled, made-to-order delights that won't break your wallet.

38.description: L'Appetito somehow manages to mix European cafe vibes with Michigan Ave polish, offering higher-end coffee drinks and delicious baked goods. When in the area shopping or showing your tourist friends around, stop in here to escape to cobblestone Italy for a moment. My only complaint is in reference to their hours; sometimes when I'm around hitting up a bar or hotel party, I'll get an itch for a good espresso and L'Appetito has gone to bed. This is easily forgiven when I swing by the next morning and get my fix.

51.description: While staying at a nearby hotel for a week my husband & I stopped here for breakfast every morning. The breakfast panini with bacon was my favorite. They are pre-made  but because they're busy in the morning everything still was fresh.  Illy coffee was good. Service was friendly & the atmosphere quaint but cozy. Prices can't be beat. The only item we would avoid is the pancakes.

27.description: I'm disappointed with the way this place is set up. First there is no clear indication of where the line begins and as a result or no one cares. This results in dumbass people cutting me off which pisses me off and the people at the counter do nothing about it. When I asked, all I got was a bullshit response from them stating that anyone who jumps in first goes. Jump in front of me next time and see what happens! Well I digress because there won't be a next time. If you can't get your line together I won't be back. Furthermore if you order something there is no clear indication of where to wait. I'm done with it.  The only reason it gets another star is that the coffee is decent and the prices for it are reasonable. Otherwise I'm too dissatisfied with how it's run to return.

32.description: First off, getting a sandwich bigger than my head for under $10, wow and the deli guys were great. Lots of character, lots of energy and really friendly people. They can take my money any day of the week.

54.description: Absolutely delicious Italian sub! I loved it.  The employee that we spoke too was really friendly & helpful as well.

48.description: A few options, the food is pre-made and severed all day long. The coffee, lates are good and that why people come here.

44.description: Came here on a food tour for a brownie stop and I was like "meh" - the brownie was ok but it felt like it had no soul.  Like a machine produced it and was cranking out brownies for drones all day every day.  It's a three star experience for me right now, but I'll stop in on a future trip to experience more.

24.description: Great place to go with a group. There is everything! Deli has sammies and pre-made goodies as well as great stuff to take home and cook. Then there is the gelato and the baked goods. I share the pizza, spinach rice balls, gelato, and even got muffins for breakfast the next day. Indoor and outdoor seating. Right by Chicago 360 which is handy for touristy activity. Great spot and would totally go again next time I'm in the Windy City!

7.description: This is a little gem. Located just steps away from the hustle of the mag mile, this small Italian grocery store has Italian imports, snacks, bakery and a deli/sandwich counter. Today's sandwich special was prosciutto, marinated artichokes, mozzarella and tomatoes on focaccia. We added turkey to it. It was delicious and BIG. Definitely good for two people. I recommend this spot if you're looking for a great sandwich for a quick bite. There's a few tables inside, but no bathroom FYI.

49.description: The girls behind the counter need to learn a lot about customer service and how not to lean on the counters looking bored out of their minds.

40.description: This is a great spot to grab a quick and quality lunch. They have a pretty large variety of made to order sandwiches, hot sandwich options, different deli-style salads and a couple of soups. Their chili is awesome! You can also grab a pre-made salad if you're in a hurry.

53.description: Came here a second time and this time had a Arancini, Italian fried rice ball stuffed with ricotta and spinach.  If that was all that they served this place would be five stars easily!  It was out of this world.  Creamy and crispy all at the same time!  Done to perfection!Also had a cappuccino.  Not the best.  Insert sad face.  Too much foam and it didn't get that nice sweetness out of the milk.

30.description: I had the Chocolate cake- it was amazing; I wasn't partial to the cheesecake though...sorry. Service was fast & friendly :)

46.description: I visited this location twice recently to have lunch with a co-worker and I am very impressed! The food is delicious and fairly priced, and the service is efficient. During both visits, I ordered a slice of pizza which totaled out to $4. I'm a fan of the thicker crust pizzas, so I thought the slices I ate were great! They weren't anything to write home about but they did the trick. The second day, I ordered an additional pastry to complement my lunch and it was fantastic! I forgot to add that they have a great pastry display so if you're ever in the mood for something that's not Cheesecake Factory, I would highly recommend L'Appetito. As some other reviewers have mentioned it's right next to the Cheesecake Factory and to be honest, this would be my pick between the two any day.

1.description: I had such high expectations of this place after reading reviews! Unfortunately, I was less than thrilled.I got the Luino sandwich. Salame, roasted red peppers, swiss cheese - what could go wrong? The peppers were exceptionally bitter and ruined the taste of the sandwich. I decided to also try the tiramisu and an espresso macchiato. The espresso was delightful. Illy coffee is really quite good, and I would come back for coffee here. The tiramisu wasn't...real tiramisu. The top layer was tasteless whipped cream, and the ladyfingers had a strange orange flavor instead of coffee, and the mascarpone layers were rather small and flavorless. Very disappointing.

55.description: Been here twice now during my lunch break with my girlfriend and we both really like the sandwiches. Given we haven't tried anything else, from the four different sandwiches we tried all were very good.Don't be the guy ordering an "American Classic" at an Italian deli. You'll miss out!Also, when ordering be sure to take a ticket from the counter as it gets pretty busy during lunch hours and that's how they determine who will be served next.They have Goose Island Root Beer!

9.description: They have ready made food which is very convenient, if your pressed for time or work in the area.The food is "what you see is what you get". Everything I have tried so far has had flavor. The bread is very good no matter which kind you order. The ready made sandwiches can get kinda hard if there sitting for a while.  The prices are very reasonable. Its worth sitting down to eat, many young ladies coming in and out while you eat. You can also stare at the random Italian crap all over the place.
