26.description: I have read great reviews so I wanted to check it out. I stopped in on a Wednesday morning for coffee. This place is located below street level- next to the Cheesecake Factory. Friendly service & decent prices. I only ordered coffee but I would go back to order breakfast or lunch. Very happy with my experience! I will go back next time I'm in the area!!

25.description: Beautiful cafe. Good food, great selection, and reasonable prices. Good for quick dining or sit-down meal. Great sandwiches/other things and coffee/pastires/gelato.

12.description: Very good Italian deli in lower level of Hancock Building. The muffuletta sandwich was big and filling. Nice bakery inside too with lots of choices for coffee too.

59.description: Fine latte, though not as rich or hot as Starbucks. Hot pressed sandwich high in flavor but with very little meat or veg. Great deli selection. Try the Carols Cookies, or almond split cookies. They are over the moon. Wonderful location to get out of the wind and sit near waterfall.

21.description: Welcome to the Gold coast section of the Near North side of Chicago, where you will more than likely find either tourists or the "ruling elite" of this city. This information I tie together because this small coffee shop is located in this area, so of course these type of people you would encounter in here. I went in to the left line heading in a westward direction to order my white chocolate mocha with a gluten free cookie, so far I was impressed with it. Of course, there is a sign on the start of the line that says you must pay first, then you can sit down. It is common policy in most coffee shops. Sitting down to enjoy my order, I can see that the walls are painted like if we are in a small Italian town, hence given the store name. Then you will notice that the vast majority of people here are persons who have enough income to live a satisfying lifestyle. I recommend this place since it receives less traffic than the Cheesecake Factory that is next door.

17.description: I've been coming  to L'apetito for a few months now. This is definitely one of the best places to get a quick breakfast lunch or some great coffee. They have lots of different drinks including fresh espresso ,Frappuccinos, cookies croissant and full deli. Overall they have very fair prices and good quality items. The customer service is also excellent.

10.description: Magnificent Munchies!L'Appetito is an Italian deli/cafe located at the base of the John Hancock Building in the front, down the stairs off of Michigan Avenue in Chicago, IL. It's a great spot to grab a quick breakfast, lunch or snack when shoppin' or workin' on the Magnificent Mile. It serves up hot & cold deli sammies; a variety of salads & soups; hot breakfast items such as pancakes, scrambie eggs, bacon & sausage; yummy-lookin' pizza square-slices at lunchtime; and it even serves wine for a lil lunchtime/afternoon stress-relieva! I've ate the pre-made chef salads before and other assorted salads from the deli & everything has always been fresh & tasty!On the bakery side, there's a gemload of sweets rangin' from cannolis & lotsa other specialty, Italian treats; a smorgasbord of every kinda cookie under the sun; an assortment of decadent-looking cakes slices, brownies & muffins; and any other type o'pasty & sweet carb you can possibly be cravin'. In a moment o'weakness I can't pass up the large, soft cookies in the cookie jars on top of the bakery case for $1.95. (The jars to the left have the soft cookies. The jars on the right have crispy cookies, if ya like a crunchy cookie). My fave cookies are the soft chocolate chip, M&M, pumpkin & peanut butta! (See my yummy pics!) The available cookie flavas in the soft jars rotate/vary but really any one o'these guys are oh so soft & will be yummo in your tummo & will taste betta with your fave cup o'joe!Speakin' o'Joe, L'Appetito brews & sells coffee drinks made with one of my personal fave brands, illy! It's a smooth but bold coffee. The coffee here is always served pipin' hot & needs no doctoring! A cup o' illy is the perfect pal to your sweet bakery treat! Finally, a stop at L'Appetito wouldn't be complete without hittin' up the gelato case. It's not the biggest selection in Chi-town but it's super tasty. One lil, perfect, round scoop o'gelato will cost ya $3, but it's worth it. The texture is thick, creamy & spoonably-gemlicious! Sampling is allowed & really all the flavas are good but Espresso & Italian Vanilla are 2 of my faves. At peak breakfast & lunch hours, you'll be hard-pressed to find a table as L'Appetito is popular & gets packed. You pick out your food at the counter & pay at the register. (You have to pay separate for items on the bakery/gelato side & for food on the deli side.) There's usually a line on both sides, but they move fast. Service is quick & the workers expect you to order fast too! They ain't there to make small talk witcha! It's not Cheers people, but I'm not bitchin' cuz ya get your food fast & it's good! So whether you're headin' up to the top o'the Hancock for a killa view o'Chicago, workin' downtown or shoppin' for some killa clothes on Mag Mile, I highly recommend stoppin' in for a quick bite at my fave Italian cafe on my fave Mile for some molto gemmy snacks! L'Appetito is a convenient, gem-approved cafe & this hidden gem has got a quick, sure cure for everyone's appetite!

5.description: This is my favorite little spot in Chicago! Their pastries are delicious and so is their deli!! I could never come to Chicago and miss coming here!!

3.description: Coffee was good, but the breakfast combo makes you wish for something else. It tasted 2 days old and plain as school food. Should have tried the Panini.

35.description: Ive eaten here many times over the past 15 years as i used to work across the street in the Bloomingdales building. Overall, its a fine place to get a $7 sandwich and a soda etc. I went there yesterday and ordered the meatball sandwich (for $7) and the guy put 3 meatballs in the 10-12 inch torpedo roll and then wrapped it up and gave it to me. I asked him if he was sure i was only to get 3 meatballs in the sandwich, he grunted "yes".  Seriously, there was bite after bite of nothing but bread. I dont mind going back on occasion. but i will not be ordering that again. Stick to the basics like roast beef, ham or italian.

19.description: Great subs, the best vanilla latte I've ever tasted (coming from a coffee fanatic) and adorable shop. The only down fall was the service was sub par - expected better. It took forever to get our coffee and there was only one woman in front of us.

28.description: Very fast service and a nice little shop. The food was great and certainly worth the very good price. 5 stars for this place.

45.description: Custard too sweet and tasted not like custard at all. The staff are so unfriendly & unhappy, and not helpful explaining their desserts. Very very disappointed.

33.description: Great place for a quick lunch. I enjoy their pizza, toasted sandwiches and paninis very much. They have a great dessert section as well as a huge diverse beverage selection.

43.description: i wasn't that impressed with their chocolate cake but i did like their gelato. ive gone here a few times via food tours & ive tried different things. their samiches are really delicious so definitely try those!

2.description: My Partner and I went here for breakfast and Brunch and both of us really enjoyed it both times, great food cozy place, always busy fantastic coffee, great breakfast and lunch menu.Fiona my partner, really enjoyed the pumpkin spice chi tea, said it was the best she had drunk here in USA.I had a iced coffee which was great a fantastic cappuccino, and a nice hot black coffee,

18.description: A nice little gem with a lot of character smack in the middle of Commercial Central and next to Cheesecake Factory.  (You do need to go downstairs of the Hancock Tower to get to it.) Fast food - you get your order, pay for it and sit down in a small internal seating area.  In better weather outside seating is an option.Combination bakery/deli and Italian goods convenience store.  Soups, paninis, pasta salad, arancini (rice croquettes filled with either meats or spinach and ricotta cheese - mild and filling).  Espresso and variations go well with a line-up of bakery goodies from pistachio sandwiches to decadent chocolate pastries.Recommend as a quick snack or lunch stop on the North side of the Magnificent Mile.

41.description: Needed to grab a lunch bite and did not want to spend big money or suck up too much time, enter L'Appetito. A welcome respite compared to the Cheesecake next door which was completely inundated with folks. The prices were surprisingly reasonable and the food was not bad either, good to know, definitely keeping in mind for future visits.The folks working there all had accents so it can be a little lost in translation but nothing you are unable to work through, after all, food is food.

52.description: Excellent find!! Hidden little place but what great food and the prices were awesome. Lunch for four with drinks only cost 36.00. Big slices of thick crust pizza, huge 7.00 sandwiches and Italian rice balls. The caramel lattes were excellently made.  Two large lattes, large earl grey tea and 4 chocolate drop cookies only cost 16.00.  Overall it was a great lunch with a great atmosphere, that felt welcoming and extremely authentic.

50.description: A nice little gem with a lot of character smack in the middle of Commercial Central and next to Cheesecake Factory.  (You do need to go downstairs of the Hancock Tower to get to it.) Fast food - you get your order, pay for it and sit down in a small internal seating area.  In better weather outside seating is an option.Combination bakery/deli and Italian goods convenience store.  Soups, paninis, pasta salad, arancini (rice croquettes filled with either meats or spinach and ricotta cheese - mild and filling).  Espresso and variations go well with a line-up of bakery goodies from pistachio sandwiches to decadent chocolate pastries.Recommend as a quick snack or lunch stop on the North side of the Magnificent Mile.

4.description: I have read great reviews so I wanted to check it out. I stopped in on a Wednesday morning for coffee. This place is located below street level- next to the Cheesecake Factory. Friendly service & decent prices. I only ordered coffee but I would go back to order breakfast or lunch. Very happy with my experience! I will go back next time I'm in the area!!

6.description: 8/30- Almost missed this little spot as I was wandering down Mag Mile since it was tucked into a deeper ground/basement level of a plaza. I got the feeling that it was probably always this surprisingly busy once I realized there was a whole deli/savory food section in the back right in addition to the pastries/coffee section that greets you just as you walk in. There is substantial amount of seating along the back left. All the walls back there are impressively painted in an Italian theme complete with arches and columns and the like.I wasn't too hungry so I just picked up a pistachio amaro and a pignoli. These pastries were sold by the pound (~$15/lb?) so it ended up being a bit pricey for the size. Understandable though, considering the fact that there was no skimping on the quantity, quality, and freshness of the butter, pine nuts, and pistachios. Both of my treats were deliciously fragrant. I'd definitely swing by again to try out the other offerings when I'm in town!

22.description: The ordering/service situation is kind of a shit show. No one seems to be paying attention to the number system, so during lunch it can get a bit hectic. That being said, it is absolutely worth dealing with. The food is great. The sandwiches are huge, so you definitely get the bang for your buck. The menu is extensive, so it's impossible to go wrong.

15.description: Beautiful cafe. Good food, great selection, and reasonable prices. Good for quick dining or sit-down meal. Great sandwiches/other things and coffee/pastires/gelato.

57.description: With a row of restaurants tucked away in an alley set against a backdrop of high rises in the Financial District, the atmosphere at Belden Place is very European and most restaurants here.

20.description: This is an interesting restaurant cafe.  I have always wanted to go here but finally did.  Its in the bottom court in front of the John Hancock building.  Its rather lively today with locals and tourists.  There was actually a food tour that came and a guy spoke about the history of the place.  "The owners were 1st generation Italian immigrants hr says and they have another store......"This place is a good rest stop when touring or shopping.  They have beer, wine, all other bottled or canned beverages, and a full cafe if you are in need of an expresso.They serve mostly deli sandwiches/subs but have pizza and sides by the pound.  I had the Diavolo and it was really good.  We also had cheese pizza which was not good and a turkey and cheese sub which was so so.  The coffee served is Illy, a popular brand like Starbucks in Europe.  The coffee was good. We had dessert and it was pretty good, a cannelloni and almond crescent. There is seating inside and out and quite a bit inside.  The place is comfortable once seated but a little loud and made to look Italian Mediterranean, yes I got that from eavesdropping on the tour......the layout is a bit unorganized and cluttered.The food quality is good but overall taste average.Still Worth a try.

36.description: This is a nice little deli in the bottom of The Hancock Center.  I work in the building so we have lunch from this place at least once a week.  The different baked goods are delicious and they have great coffee.  The sandwiches, soups, salads and pastas a alright.  I may be biased because we eat here so often. Its a good place for a quick snack and the outdoor seating is very nice when the weather cooperates.

14.description: This place is an easy recommendation. Go when you need a quick meal and want something fresh. There are ready made sandwiches and a menu of things you can order. Also great salads to be bought by the pound. Breakfast is good here too, with an array of coffee drinks to be added on as well. Stop by!

3.description: The brow bar is a great place to get your brows or any other facial waxing done in under 20 minutes. They are fast, efficient and do an awesome job. They also are very helpful in locating the perfect product for you in the millions they have at the counter. I had opportunity to work at this location over the weekend and Abe and Ashley were super friendly and professional!

1.description: This location is okay. They usually have availability and are generally friendly. There just isn't that extra attention that makes it worth coming to outside of the training and knowledge the brow bar specialists have. I'd recommend going to the Macy's on Randolph to see Rosie or Vanessa.

2.description: Nichole is my new "Brow Arch Angel" and savior! I had been growing my brows out for 3 months (after what can only be described as a brow massacre) so you can imagine how leery I was of trying someone new again. After asking friends and scouring reviews I gave myself a pep talk and walked in intent on just getting it over with . I was nonplussed at the set up (out in the open by the doors) but then realized this is actually a good thing, it allowed me to be the creepy chick watching from Lush to see who's eyebrow sculpting looked the best. In the time it took me to smell every freaking bath bomb twice (I may have been stalling) I decided to ask if Nichole was available, luckily she had an opening before I could chicken out. Nichole asked questions, listened to what I did/did not want, and when I mentioned my evening plans she went above and beyond and showed me some quick makeup tricks and gave me a new natural look. I'm soooo happy with my experience, my brows, and my new bodacious brow broad!!

5.description: Been twice so far and scheduled for a third. The girls are super friendly and  it's been easy to schedule appointments. I liked how my gal explained the process and what she was doing because they color in your brows and draw lines first, to give them kind of a template to know exactly where they need to wax/tweeze. I'm sure it looks a little weird to passerby's. It was a little weird at my first appointment though because you're right in the middle of the open mall, but who really cares, right! That was my first time experiencing that and I really liked how they did it. My brows were totally uneven and she's helping me to get them right!  Would definitely recommend if you need your brows done.

6.description: They put me through brow rehab, my eyebrows were a mess before I started coming to Benefit. This is the only brow bar I will go to, I love this place! I always get compliments on my brows. Susan is the sweetest and does an amazing job on my brows and afterward they always touch me up! I recommend this place to all my friends and family

7.description: Well, while I did not get my brows done, all of my girls did.  The staff here was very professional and courteous.  My girls walked right up, sat down and were treated very well.  I stood and listened to the ladies explaining how they were going to shape their brows and noticed that they took the time to listen to the person they were working with.  Bottom line all three of my girls were extremely happy and will return for future services.  Thank you!

8.description: I was ecstatic to find out that this location did brow tinting because they didn't before. The lady waxed my brows before tinting and charged me for both wax and tinting, which I was kind of upset about because I didn't ask for the wax in the first place. I paid for both services, but they should be more careful about that kind of stuff.

0.description: I live in a very small town now, and missed the option of visiting a place nearby to get my brows cleaned up. The woman who worked on me (I forget her name) was very nice, easy to talk to and did a great job. She trimmed them, which I would have preferred that she asked first (I kind of like the way they look untrimmed near the corner of my eye) but I'll just be sure to mention that beforehand next time. I walked out feeling like a million bucks, and got a bit of an ego boost about my full eye caterpillars.

4.description: ***Ask for Cathy***I waltzed in on a work trip, walking all around downtown, so I could justify eating an Eataly pizza and popped in Macy's to check out Lush (haveta get some bath bombs where I can), and happened upon the Benefit Brow Bar right there. I saw Cathy giving someone a wax, and being as my brows hadn't been touched in AGES, I took a risk and asked her (after her customer was done and checking out) if she had time to squeeze me in, even though it was after 7:00pm. She said her other appointment was running behind and would love to.First, let me preface by saying I'm a brow fanatic. It took me 2 years to find the best, and I mean BEST, brow technician in all of Nashville and then converted all my friends. Since I've moved to Texas, I've read reviews for HOURS and still am not 100% happy with anyone I've tried. I took a HUGE risk to just walk up to Cathy and trust her without any reviews. Honestly, it was a bit reckless, but I was desperate.Let me just say, Cathy did a FANTASTIC job!! I mean it. She didn't thin me out (always my greatest fear) and shaped it perfectly (by eye, no tools used, which did alarm me a little, but you can tell she's a pro). Next time I'm in Chicago I will book an appointment with her, and you should, too! And for only $20, that's a STEAL! I pay $25-30 typically, so to pay 20 + tip was lovely.

12.description: This little clock shop is located in the Water Tower Place on the seventh floor. My boyfriend and I had each of our watch batteries replaced here.  The owner/manager, Alex, is always very helpful and accommodating.  It takes about 10 to 15 minutes to get the batteries changed. You dont even have to tell him what type of battery your watch runs on, he'll figure it out for you! Service is about $21.95. Great people, great service, great price!

7.description: I live in a world of too many clocks so I have one purpose and one purpose only for this shop.  I do wear watches because they are pretty.  But they need a new battery now and then.This is my watch battery place.  I pop in, leave them my watch while I go grab a quick snack at FoodLife or poke around the mall.  They have it magically re-batteried and ticking away when I get back.  Sometimes I have them clean it too, but mostly I have a husband for that sort of thing.

19.description: Don't go here.  I gave them a watch to fix.  They fixed it with very very bad finish.  I can see glue marks on the dial.  They also left some scratches inside of dial!  Especially, the guy who fixed my watch was very very rude.

1.description: They were so nice to help me get jewelry beads out of my iphone headphone jack! I'll definitely be taking my watch and clock repairs to them in the future. :)

2.description: I have been here 2 times in the last month to have watch batteries replaced. Both times they have changed the battery while I waited and had a coffee or cupcake at Crumbs right next to it. The same guy was there both times and was wonderful. Very nice place to have in the middle of the mall for a quick fix.

9.description: I came here to have a watch adjusted.  There was no line, but the sole man there was occupied adjusting the time on a watch and was a bit slow to respond to my standing there waiting for service.  I first took this as a bad sign but then considered that these are employees surrounded by timepieces, and this can make them less sociable (or drawn into their thoughts about the temporary nature of life, the passing of time, et al.).  Anyhow, once he got started on my watch, he had to ring up a couple other customers but he was efficient.  It was fast service and a job well done, and only $16 to remove a couple links.  They also have a decent return policy if you're unsatisfied with their work, but I doubt I'll need to go back.  The guy even set the date, time, and day for me (which is great because I can never figure out exactly how far to pull the little gear out to change all the smaller dials on my watchface...)Word to the wise, it's tucked in the back of the mall on the ground floor.  I had to walk through Macy's to find it.

6.description: I walked up to the counter with 3 broken watches, 2 needed new batteries and one had a broker winder so I was unable to change the time.    He said "They'll be fixed and ready for pick up in 10 mins."    Fifteen minutes later I came back and just like he said, they were all fixed!    Could not have been an easier transaction, very pleased!

18.description: I have had the unfortunate experience of using this clock shop over the past six months. Not only was my watch returned untrepaired, twice,  but the personnel was impolite, unfriendly and entirely unwilling to help.  Eventually, I demanded a refund, after leaving the watch there for the 6 months, and had to virtually argue with the owner for it, at that!   I would reommmend any other watch shop in the city other than this one!

10.description: I went here for a battery replacement. I had tried to remove the screws myself and couldn't. The guy was pretty fast and very nice and chatty. My only gripe, which really isn't their fault, is that I paid more than I would have had I been able to buy the battery and change it myself.

13.description: I went into this store looking to get a watch repaired.  Instead I was challenged to an argument by their condescending staff. Rather than argue, I left to take my business elsewhere.  I'd recommend others do the same.  If not, be prepared to deal with rudeness.

16.description: Terrible service.  They damaged and scratched my watch just replacing the battery. The worst.

17.description: This people rock. I had a kuku clock that i am very fond of. I took it to the shop and the guy fix it in10 minutes. He was so helpful and cordial that i will always go back.

15.description: I happened upon this little shop when I was giving my family a tour of Michigan Avenue and Water Tower Place. I followed my brother in law into a clock shop and checked out the watches. There staring back at me was the  exact Swiss Army watch that I had been drooling over for months online. The owner pulled out the watch and I noticed it was priced at $325...A good deal lower than the standard $395 for this model. "Good price", I told the owner."Most people don't realize that", he replied. Since I did my research on the internet...not to mention being a big fan of Swiss Army watches...I DID realize what a good price it was for that model. The owner quickly and expertly removed enough links and adjusted the watch perfectly to fit my wrist. I'm so glad that I happened upon this little shop...It's much better to buy there than from some company you don't know on the internet!

0.description: Love love love this place for fast & convenient battery replacement service! I've been coming here for many years, always quick service.

5.description: Since I live within a 5 minute walk from WaterTower Place, the Water Tower Clock Shop is a convenient place to get my watch batteries replaced and I've done so over the years. On 10/20/15 I paid $15.30 for a new battery to be placed in the watch that I had repaired their previously.  Within about an hour I noticed the watch wasn't keeping time.  That evening I looked up my receipts for the repair.  2 years previously, 10/28/13 I had paid $80 to have the movement overhauled.  However when it came back it still wasn't working properly so I brought it back and picked it up again on 12/2/13.  At the time I was told that by Hillman Castor that the whole movement had been replaced so it was like a new watch.  If that was true, I doubt that the watch would need repair again.  When I called I was told that the work done in 2013 was only warrantied for 1 year.  Not wanting to throw good money after bad, I took the watch to Macy's watch repair on State street on 10/26/15. I explained that I already had put in a new battery but just wanted the repair people to call me with an estimate. I talked to the repair person today 10/27/15 and he told me that the movement was very dirty, was not new and certainly not only 2 years old.  He said he would clean the movement and replace the circuit that connects the movement to the battery.  This is going to cost $150. and the work will be done within a week which is certainly better than the time frame for repairs at the Water Tower Clock Shop.  Basically I feel like I was lied to and wasted $80.  I'll be giving Macy's my repair business from now on.

11.description: I had a nice walk down Michigan Avenue and went into the Waterplace Mall because it was the nearest place I found using Google that could change the battery in my watch. They replaced my battery while I waited and the price was very reasonable. In all it took about 10 minutes.

8.description: They used to be located on the seventh floor, but now they're at the bottom floor next to Freshii. I came here to get my battery replaced. It took all but 5 minutes of my time, and the total was $15 to replace the battery on my Citizen watch. I liked the fast service, but it's a bit expensive for me. I wonder if I can find a cheaper alternative.

3.description: The two gentlemen(that I've encountered not sure if there are any other number of employees) that work here, are so cranky. Like no smiles, ever. They act like the any question you ask is annoying and dumb. I am revising this on 8/22/15. After my last visit, 2 of the three watches I had fixed here less than three months ago are no longer working. On top of flawed customer service culture, the product is terrible. This place should be avoided.

14.description: Brought in my Polar heart rate monitor watch for a battery replacement and ever since, the heart rate function on it has been wacky. The watch works, but the actual monitoring of heart rate is now erratic and unreliable. Oh well, my fault for being lazy and not sending it directly to the manufacturer for battery replacement.

4.description: DO NOT get repairs from here. The guy got so frustrated with my watch band that he hammered the pin leaving it unable to be removed. This was also supported by several other skilled watch repairmen that I visited. They could not fix his mistake. Links cannot be removed and I now have a $500 watch that I cannot ever wear. Also prior to this I went there to put a band on a watch. I later found out he put it on backwards and the lock was flipped upside down. Two basic repair needs and he screwed them up completely. One was fixable but had to pay someone else again and the other is now damaged forever. Bring your watch here if throwing it into the trash is too hard.

12.description: The Limited has to be my favorite store for subtly gorgeous grown-up clothes that are very well-cut, made from great materials, and much cheaper than Banana Republic. The store atmosphere isn't what I would call warm and inspiring, but every time I (even hesitantly) buy something here, it turns into a long-time favorite clothing item.This particular store, however, goes over the top a bit with their sales strategies. An employee started a fitting room for me, and as I came to try on my clothes, the room was stuffed with clothing items I hadn't picked out. I thought it was just a mistake, but they told me they had picked these out for me. Uh, thanks! A gray suit? IN A RANDOM SIZE? Maybe others would appreciate the well-intended effort, but I prefer to pick out my own stuff.

7.description: It took a lot for me to go here. First off, I hate malls...especially Water Tower Place, especially with the American Girls store. Second, I went to Express before I went here. Long story short, they're overpriced and lie to you about what's on sale.In my quest for new dress pants, I decided to give The Limited a go. I did my deep cleansing breaths, then plodded on to Water Tower. I must say that from the very beginning, I was greeted warmly. No one at this store was "selly." They simply reminded me of the specials, and steered me towards what I was looking for. As most normal people have actual plans on Friday night, the store was pretty empty. I liked this. A long line at a waiting room will completely steer me free of a store, even if I intended to buy.So, kudos to the staff for being friendly and approachable. The store was well-organized and everything was easy to find.Dare I say, I may be back!

3.description: I've always been a fan of the Limited, but yesterday the customer service was extra awesome. I don't know if it had anything to do with Adam F. coming with me, but I got $100 off a suit, and an additional $50 off with a coupon, and I also got 50% off on a pair of pants.The sales associate, Grant, was very friendly and helpful. My shopping experience was fast and painless, and my male shopping companion didn't have to wait too long for me...Hahaha.

1.description: The Limited has been pretty good to me lately.  With a handful of coupons I was able to save $100....we'll overlook how much I may have spent.  I typically scan the clearance section first.  Yes, I'm a clearance whore.  Their clearance selection was okay, I did score a cute $10 tank so I can't complain.The staff were super friendly, but as far as helpful advice...I'm not too sure if I believe they were looking out for my best interest or their sales level interest.  It seemed like they were trying to tell me what they thought I wanted to hear.  But faulty advice aside, it was a shopping success!

2.description: OMFG!  I won?!!  *Takes deep breath*                                 *Clears throat* First, I'd like to thank MTV for all of the votes it took you people to get off your lazy @ss and vote me as the Best Dressed.  Thanks to my fans for recognizing that I don't have to be dressed like a hoochie to still be sexy and attractive.  Most of all, thanks to my stylists for providing me with form fitting suits, fashionable long length jeans, silky shirts that fit just right and allows me to go from the office straight to Yelp events, and cute accessories to dress up my outfits once I leave my place of employment.In case you're wondering where my stylists get my clothes; let's just say they like to use the unlimited amount of coupons in the mail and charge me twice as much.  But, after today's award, I'm dropping them like change spewing out of a winning slot machine.  So, if you want to see a glimpse of me off this stage, drop into The Limited.  Since it's the only one in Chicago, I'm sure I'll run into you eventually.

9.description: This Limited is smaller than most, but has a super friendly staff.  I bought my first pair of grown up pants here a year ago and they are still in good shape.  They usually have a buy one get one half off sale every year and a decent selection of sale merchandise as the seasons change.  If  you don't mind wandering through Water Tower it's a great place to go after you've realized you can't afford to shop at Banana Republic.

18.description: The Limited is my favorite store for work clothes because everything is well-made and fashionable without being overly trendy.  It reminds me of the clothing that Express USED to have before they decided to be the sweatpants and tank top capital of the world.  This location at Water Tower Place was remodeled about 2 years ago to have more of a boutique atmosphere.  The store seems to be divided into smaller rooms by color.  The front of the store holds a plethora of dress pants, skirts, capris, and great tops for the working woman.  I have recently fallen in love with their washable wool suiting which comes in a variety of colors.  If you travel for work or just don't like to dry clean everything, try this out!  Almost all of the pants come in petite, regular and tall lengths (great for us giants) and they offer FREE alterations on regular-priced pants.  There is a smaller area of casual clothing in the back of the store and a great accessories area.  If you are looking for casualwear that isn't designed for a pre-pubescent-14-year-old, there are great options here for you!  I have found many casual items here that are perfect for the office when paired with a nice pair of slacks.  The Limited's regular prices are not cheap.  Expect to pay $60-80 for a pair of slacks and $30-50 for tops.  However, keep in mind that I still wear basic slacks that I purchased here  4 years ago.  Keep a look out for the great sales and you can often find a 50% off rack in the back of the store.  The often send out coupons too, so sign up for the mailing list.

10.description: I love this store!!I got the cutest dress here today and the best part: every time I came out of the dressing room a person was there to comment about how the pieces looked on me. I had a great time and love that there are always sales!

13.description: Love, love the clothing and styles here.  Not so much the price though.  But when I think about it, it's worth the investment.  The quality of the clothes are good, the styles are always in fashion.  I also love their events when they close out the entire store for a fashion show with free wine, food, and desserts and 40% off the entire store for that evening.  I can always find some business clothes that's still sexy and appealing.  Kudos to the fashion buyers for choosing amazing pieces of clothing.

16.description: I just got my first grown-up job, and this is one of the first places I headed for work clothes. They're trendy, but not too trendy, and a lot of the pieces were very similar to what I had seen 5 minutes earlier at Banana Republic, but significantly cheaper. I got three very classy, sophisticated knit tops for $19.50 each on sale, which you really can't beat. The quality of the pieces is rather good, especially for the sale prices, and the salespeople at this store aren't pushy or rude.

17.description: All I can say is "CHEAP QUALITY."  The jeans I bought that were slightly snug on me stretched out so badly they were hanging on me the first day I wore them!  Cheap, "made in China" label.

15.description: I love this store. I come here often and they are always helpful and friendly. They do need more employees that can be more helpful with fashion and helpful tips; however, there are a couple employees that are amazing. The woman manager is always really nice. I was there the other weekend and a young man helped me with a few super cute outfits. He needs to work more often:)

0.description: I have to disagree with Lauren K.  I hope you voice your concerns to the store manager because I don't think your experience is what they intended. I have been a loyal Limited shopper for years but have recently gone more frequently and have spent substantially more money. The Water Tower Limited have incredibly friendly staff. I have twice encountered a not so knowledgeable sales person, but overall they will bend backwards to satisfy you. I love this Limited location and the ladies who work there! Not to mention... I think the pants and suit jackets are great quality for the price.

5.description: Dear The Limited,I am BEGGING you to open up another location in downtown Chicago.  Seriously, begging.I hate going to Water Tower.  HATE.  And now that the American Girl store is there?  HATE CUBED.And because you are the only location downtown, you are ALWAYS PACKED.  The lines for the fitting rooms and the lines to check out are enough to make me walk out empty handed.  And I do, nearly every time I go there.  Which is a shame, because I love your clothes.I know the economy sucks, but I'm willing to bet if you opened another location on...  say...  North Avenue...  you would get more than enough traffic to keep your doors open.All my Limited-less Love,Jo Mama

11.description: The Limited has really great, classic, styles - perfect for work or for some wardrobe basics like black or khaki pants, capris, suits, etc. They aren't super cheap, but they are a bit less expensive than Jcrew or Banana Republic. I think their clothes are on par, price-wise, with Express but the quality is better. They also have a much better selction of non-almost crotch-baring pants, pants that I can actually wear without sporting a sweet muffin-top. They usually have at least a few more trendy options for night and weekend wear as well. The accessories are great, and they are almost always having some kind of buy one/get one special. The salespeople can be a bit over the top sometimes. You just have to tell them to back off a bit. This is the only store to which I have held on to my credit card. I come in every 6 months or so, stock my wardrobe for the season, and then spend the next 6 months paying off the damage.

8.description: While my preferred method of shopping is thrifting, I can't buy pants at a thrift store because I am tall. Its so hard being me.I like their pants here very much. The work pants fit me, are flattering, and can usually be found on sale. Ditto for their jeans. I have one gripe : not all of the pants can be found in the tall sizes. This means that you can buy brown, black and khaki till you go broke, but its a no go for the fun gray ones or the trendy tweeds. This makes me sad. The pants last though - I've been wearing my brown, black and khaki ones for about two years now and they don't show any wear and/or tear.

4.description: It has been a while since I've been to the Limited, but I think I'm back... The reason?  Machine washable suits.  I was in need of a suit for an interview and after scouring every store in Michigan Ave, this was the place.  In addition to their machine washable suits, they've just got an overall suit collection.  There was another suit I wanted but couldn't get at the time.  They seem to have lots of promotions which is also a plus.

14.description: My hometwon lost The Limited well over a decade, but I recalled it not being all that great when we had it. But this Limited surprised me. I liked the clothes. Not too colorful, not overly trendy. Very nice!

6.description: I've been a fan of The Limited for almost 20 years. It sounds like a long time, I know.  Nowadays, it has become a go-to place for my work wardrobe and sometimes every day items like camis, tees,  or cardigans. Unfortunately, it's located in Water Tower, but the store gives me reason to come in here once in awhile.What do I like about this place? With a few exceptions, most pants and jeans styles come in three different lengths: short, regular, and tall. Now, any place that offers short (or tall) length sizes is worth checking out, in my opinion. They also offer free hemming with a purchase of regular priced pants. It's been awhile since I last had a pair of pants fixed here, but I think that's still the standard and thought my pair were fine. Tops and sweaters are pretty basic and, at times, cute. I've also found the suits here to be comfy and have a good fit to them, which is nice because I hate wearing suits for long periods of time. Yes, they are a little pricy, but check out the semi-annual sales and you'll often  find something worthy. Dresses are cute here too. I just found a dress I thought would be unflattering but turned to work out just fine. You know what else - it ended up to be about $20+!  Employees can be hit or miss, but during the week or late Sunday afternoons, they can be very helpful...I think, when the crowd dies down a bit.

58.description: The ambiance of this place was so friendly and quaint, I immediately new I was going to love it.  There were couples on dates, groups of girlfriends, tourists- a great spot for any occasion. Server was very sweet and attentive.  She chose our meats & cheeses which was paired with soft warm bread, figs and giardinera! Heaven!! I had the Gnudi which was pretty simple could maybe have used some (more) garlic.  Overall, I'd recommend this hidden gem to anyone looking for a relaxing evening out in the Gold Coast/Streeterville area.

56.description: We had the most amazing dinner and wine here. It had a warm, lounge feel to it. The wine selection is incredible and meat and cheese platter was fantastic. On top of that, Our pasta dishes (lobster ravioli and fettuccini pasta) will definitely bring us back when we visit Chicago!

29.description: Hidden in the basement of Francesca's is this lovely gem of a restaurant/wine bar. We had been wanting to go here for a while due to the numerous positive reviews on Yelp, though it does appear many Yelpers have been submitting reviews and pictures of Francesca's instead.Well, this place truly didn't disappoint. We were here on a Monday evening and our first reaction was why is no one here?! We were literally the only ones here though two other parties arrived later on in the night. Others stopped by and quickly left due to the lack of patrons, but they decided too hastily!Once you step into this place, you feel as if you've just walked into a grotto or an intimate cavern so it definitely has a romantic and rustic feel. I can imagine this place can get quite busy during the weekend dinner times, so make sure to get here early to snag your table.The wine selection is quite extensive and while the food choices seem limited, everything we tried was outstanding though be warned that a number of the dishes come with bread so be prepared for a carb overload! :)All dishes are meant to be shared family style and most closely resemble small plates like Quartino's or a tapas place. However, you will feel full after ordering a few dishes and you should definitely sample from each section of the menu. In addition to the wine, the dishes that stood out were the:- Mussels (Cozze e Sopressata)- Fontina cheese bread with egg yolks (Tostato con Uova)- Prosciutto e Caprese- Cheese and meat selection (Formaggi & Salumi)- Fried gnocchi balls that were part of the pork belly dish were very good- Fried eggplant meatballs were divine!- Chocolate lava cake with mint chocolate chip gelato (Torta lava)- Vanilla gelato (best I've ever had and I've tried gelato from a number of good places)- TiramisuYes, I listed all three desserts we had since they were all delicious! 5 stars for ambience, 5 stars for food and 4 stars for service since it seemed quite slow even though no one else was there. All of this rounds up to 5 stars, so if you're in the area, make sure to stop by!

42.description: The food and wine were so good!!! It's a really romanic/cute place. Wine bottles,  brick walls, candles. I can't remember the names of what we ordered but everything was so good. If I'm ever back in Chicago we will come back. And I recommend it to all winos and Italian food lovers.

23.description: Great wine list. Many Italian wines. But also good choices of other types of wines. We had champaign with appetizers. We had the eggplant balls. And the Italian version of egg in a hole. We will come back for more. The food was fantastic. The atmosphere is fantastic. My wife and u both enjoyed the experience. The services was excellent. Relaxed setting.

47.description: I went here, solo, early on a weeknight. The star off was for not recognizing that a solo diner, early on a weeknight, probably wants relatively prompt service, not having a romantic or other companion to occupy the time. The cheese selection was sumptuous, and the ricotta e bottarga bruscheta was bursting with flavor. The wine selections were impressive as well. Very cozy, intimate setting. I'd come back again with dining companions.

8.description: My vote for the most romantics 'bar' in Chicago.  It offers everything you want in a quiet romantic place - in a basement speakeasy type setting, walls lined with wine and great tables and seating.  We had a wonderful time celebrating my birthday.

31.description: Fantastic service, food, and wine!  Our server Elliot was amazing.  He was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and recommended perfect wines for what we were in the mood for.  He made our first time there memorable. The food was not your average bar food but made with love and inspiration.  Tostata con Uova and mussels were my favorites, but everything was delicious!  This place reminded me of a small wine bar in Italy with lots of culture in homey atmosphere.  If you are looking for a non-chalant, laid-back Italian wine bar in a basement, this is your place!  We went around 11:30 pm on a Saturday night and it wasn't crowded with just a couple other tables.  I highly recommend this place!

34.description: We went here on Saturday to celebrate my girls bday. We had reservations and had a fixed chef tasting menu that offered 4 courses. The food was really tasty  and flavorful. They  had vegetarian options available as well. I really  liked the decor. It was a contemporary rustic  feel. One wall was a mosaic of wine crates displaying the names of the wine. All and all we had a great time. The price was a little too high for my blood but I'm guessing you are paying for the overall  experience as well. I would Recommend.

16.description: I had an amazing experience at Disotto Enoteca when I was in Chicago with somefriends. It's a complete experience that's a must-do for foodies and wine enthusiasts.To start of, Disotto is just gorgeously decorated: the interior is rustic and classy but comfortable enough that you can kick back and relax with friends. The servers are lovely and very knowledgeable about wines and are very accommodating about any requests you have. Five stars just for service alone! I believe my servers name was Elliot, he was helpful, respectful and very patient and also offered a lot of good suggestions. We tasted a few wines, all good recommendations before we settled on our carafes.What also stood out to me was the quality of the food- Disotto Enoteca serves small bites, so the food is generally the size of an appetizer. We ordered the Caprese - which has a large hunk of mozzarella cheese with fresh tomatoes, I am not a fan of cheese but this dish was really to die for. The cheese was soft, aromatic and just very delicious! It also paired well with the white wine. Very delicious dish and clearly too notch ingredients. The tomatoes were sweet and aromatic: unbelievably good.We also ordered the eggplant meatballs in marinara sauce. To me this was a stand out dish, the crispy eggplants, the delicious tomato sauce. I just wanted to lick the plate when I was done. Absolutely phenomenal dish. I will be dreaming of it from Cali.Lastly we ordered the truffle egg toast. Despite the popularity of this dish I was really underwhelmed. It's pretty much your run of the mill toad in a hole. Would really not recommend except for the fun factor.All in all I had an amazing experience at Disotto Enoteca and cannot wait to go again to sample more delicious wines and food!

13.description: Excellent service and great food.Very friendly hostess and very attentive servants.Food and appetizers were great and presented very well. Very generous meals specially Pollo Salvia.Grilled Salmon plate was very tasty.

11.description: This Italian restaurant has cozy warm feeling especially around the fall and winter season. I had a pasta dish with prosciutto in it and it was light and gave enough to save for another day. I would suggest coming here for a date with the romantic feel and ambiance.

39.description: Had a lovely time at this wine bar .To start with it was beautifully decorated with a vintage charm to it . Food was delicious and fresh ! They had good music and Amazing service. Everything we had caprese,beet salad were top notch . Food was full of flavor and super super fresh :) Cant wait to go back with my girlfriends again :) Special Thanks to my server who made it a memorable experience :) A special mention to their dessert menu.. Don't leave without trying their desserts !! A must for everyone !

37.description: Located beneath a well regarded upscale Italian restaurant, this snug, romantic, European style wine bar was just ideal for me. The menu is limited, really just bar snacks, but what bar snacks! Why bother with a full menu if you can get food of this quality. The wines we had were also first quality. This was not a bargain, but when I left I did not feel the least bit cheated. Everything I ate was excellent, aroncini , eggplant, pepperonata and olives. It gets 5 stars as a wine bar, but don't confuse it with a full scale restaurant.

0.description: As others have mentioned, this is a hidden gem. My friend and I never would've found this restaurant if it wasn't for Yelp. Actually, we might have found it since (later) one of my good friends stated he and his wife had their engagement party at DiSotto Enoteca. They rented out the area and it was the perfect size for them.She loved the ice cream puff dessert and shrimp Gamberetto. My favorite dish was the eggplant balls: Polpette di Melanzane. We didn't care for the truffle egg toast, but I loved the seasoning on the asparagus that came with it.The ambiance was intimate and quiet. Perfect for a catching up with close family/friends or a date. I would def come back here again.

38.description: Cozy little wine bar :) loved the ambience and the good was fantastic. I had the wine flight, which was expensive IMO $25, about a glass and a half. We ordered the beet salad, eggplant meatballs, bruschetta and the gnocchi. Everything was super delicious and the service was great. Best part was the dessert, banana bread pudding. Highly recommended!

51.description: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this wine bar on our first vacation together in May 2013.  It was a quiet, rainy evening and we were the only couple in the place.  The hostess seated us in the quaint corner by the meat cellar.  This place in one word: romantic.  I felt like we were in Italy.  The wine list was amazing, so many to try!!! Our waitress was very knowledgable and suggested many to taste that we otherwise would not have been adventurous enough to try.  We did not have dinner here, but we did share some small plates, some of the best cheese we've ever had! Great date place, definately intimate setting.  I hope to visit every time we are in Chicago!

27.description: We came here on a whim (and based on Yelp reviews)--we mistakenly thought we could get bigger plates here.  Imagine our embarrassment when our wonderful server said they only did small plates!  No big deal though--she gave us a menu for Francesca's and told us we could order and eat at DiSotto Enoteca.  The ambiance was great.  Not too crowded.  Service was impeccable.  Our sever was friendly and knowledgeable about the wine list and beer list.  My boyfriend got a milk stout he really enjoyed.  I enjoyed a white wine from South Africa with my seafood pasta.  We also ordered the mussels--some of the best mussels I have ever had!  We also ordered the apple puff pastry with salted caramel sauce.   Not overpowering with sweetness.  I enjoyed every aspect of our visit!

32.description: Phenomenal. Nicely-edited wines by the glass, amazing warm olives and snicky-snacks in a lounge-y, cave-like, romantic atmosphere. Loved the late-night vibe here. Perfect for a solo hideaway, intimate trist or cozy get-together with girlfriends.

54.description: The only way to describe this place is a hidden gem in the city. I used to live in Germany and traveled to Italy and this place is the best of both worlds in Chicago.Elliot is very knowledgable on his pairings and has impressed me on multiple occasions.  Currently the location has over 30 patrons and he has been attentive to all while making us (wife and I) feel like we are the only ones here. This is a must for wine enthusiasts and romantics.

48.description: My sister and I ate here during a small 2 day trip to Chicago. First of all, let me warn you that you will go through a glass door that says "DiSotto Enoteca" to get into the building but the restaurant you walk in to is NOT Disotto. Disotto is actually downstairs and what you walk in to from the street is Francesca's. My sister and I made that mistake and we were seated at Francesca's thinking it was DiSotto. Luckily we had an amazing waiter who allowed us to order from the DiSotto menu even though we were seated at Francesca's. Now on to the food. Food was delicious but very heavy! We had the pork belly with figs, egg in bread thing, burrata, and beet salad. The egg in bread thing, though it looked really cool, had too much bread IMO and was pretty blah - my least favorite. My favorite was the burrata. Soooo delicious and enjoyed the next day as well. This was definitely a fun place to eat and I would recommend it for anyone visiting or anyone that wants a fun meal with friends.

44.description: Stopped by for a dinner since the environment seemed romantic and the food looked good...environment is definitely 5 stars...in a wine cellar with rocks/stones as the wall and dimly lit...but the food started with a bang with the eggplant meatballs!! Then went down hill with toast with truffle egg (looks great but really toast with an egg on top and then mussels was flavorful but pasta of the night was just ok, its not bad but not great...mussels were smooth (1/2) but other half had grains of sand in it...and we ended with tiramasu which was 4 star caliber...so overall environment 5 stars, food 2.5 stars, desert 4 stars with overall average of 3.25 stars...

24.description: I'd have to say I had a similar experience to Paul J when I visited DiSotto Enoteca a few weeks back. The location is a little hard to find - it is below Francesca's, which means there isn't much signage out front and you have to actually go through Francesca's to get downstairs. Once we found it, we were greeted by a server but were told to just sit wherever, rather than being seated. We asked for some wine recommendations and we were guided to a very nice bottle, so the server knew what she was doing. Our food arrived rather quickly and we were pleased with it. The pork belly with gnocchi is delicious, but the portion is *huge* so order wisely if you are splitting other dishes.

7.description: I had a late night meal on my own (at the bar) after a long day of work events. Oh boy, the service is SPECTACULAR. On point recommendations, attentive but not overly so, delicious food and terrific wines by the glass.I took some to go for my partner who was working in the hotel. He profoundly enjoyed his meal as wellI wouldn't call this a quiet restaurant, but I loved the ambiance and the style. Would be happy to return again!

49.description: Fresh foodPoor chefVery friendly staffFood was mediocre at bestPoor seasoningGot pasta, undercooked patateos, oily pasta, weird shrimp tasteFrozen dessert, lava cake wasNot very good combination of mint with chocolateOverall bill came out to $40 per person with tip and I would say its worth it but I would not give it more than 3 stars and would kor recommend if you are looking for great Italian food.

40.description: Their menu looked good but just came here for some wine.  A nice place to chill from the busy Michigan Ave Street. The interior is really nice and pleasant. The staff were pretty attentive. It was empty when I went there but I'd be be eager to to try the wine bar downstairs.

53.description: Only had an app and a couple glasses of wine. With that said, great service but the bread and bruschetta were disappointing. I was pumped up from earlier reviews that this place would have a good wine selection, turned out to be fairly poor.

30.description: Favorite hidden gem in Chicago! We travel to Chicago from Central Wisconsin. This place is the reason we keep coming back. Cozy quiet atmosphere, awesome knowledgeable staff and amazing food!! Must try!!!!

46.description: I had an amazing experience at Disotto Enoteca when I was in Chicago with somefriends. It's a complete experience that's a must-do for foodies and wine enthusiasts.To start of, Disotto is just gorgeously decorated: the interior is rustic and classy but comfortable enough that you can kick back and relax with friends. The servers are lovely and very knowledgeable about wines and are very accommodating about any requests you have. Five stars just for service alone! I believe my servers name was Elliot, he was helpful, respectful and very patient and also offered a lot of good suggestions. We tasted a few wines, all good recommendations before we settled on our carafes.What also stood out to me was the quality of the food- Disotto Enoteca serves small bites, so the food is generally the size of an appetizer. We ordered the Caprese - which has a large hunk of mozzarella cheese with fresh tomatoes, I am not a fan of cheese but this dish was really to die for. The cheese was soft, aromatic and just very delicious! It also paired well with the white wine. Very delicious dish and clearly too notch ingredients. The tomatoes were sweet and aromatic: unbelievably good.We also ordered the eggplant meatballs in marinara sauce. To me this was a stand out dish, the crispy eggplants, the delicious tomato sauce. I just wanted to lick the plate when I was done. Absolutely phenomenal dish. I will be dreaming of it from Cali.Lastly we ordered the truffle egg toast. Despite the popularity of this dish I was really underwhelmed. It's pretty much your run of the mill toad in a hole. Would really not recommend except for the fun factor.All in all I had an amazing experience at Disotto Enoteca and cannot wait to go again to sample more delicious wines and food!

1.description: This is a cozy italian wine/small plates venue in the basement of another restaurant. I went here with my girlfriend based on the strong Yelp reviews. We thought the place met our expectations: the dining room does have a nice decor/rustic italian vibe. We really liked the wine selection and how they offer two sizes: a 'taste' (which is a half glass) or a full glass. We enjoyed sampling many different wines on the menu with the half glass option. One of the reds I tried was the most memorable wine I've ever had.For food, we had the butternut gnocchi and the honey bruschetta; both were tasty and recommended. Overall, we enjoyed the wine and the small plates - I recommend this place for a relaxed evening or anyone in the mood for sampling wines.

55.description: We absolutely love it here!! Our first time here was March 2013 and fell in love with the atmosphere and the concept. This is our second time back and we are so happy that it is still as cozy as we remember it. The small village engraved in the brick wall is a great touch. Elliott is extremely knowledgable in the wine selection and offers great service. He is friendly and attentive. It is not overly crowded or too loud. I highly recommend this place!

9.description: I was disappointed with my visit to DiSotto. To start with, the small room had been booked for a private party on the weeknight I went. The host graciously offered to seat us in the Francesca's upstairs and serve us from the DiSotto menu. Regrettably, the food did not meet my expectations, given the appealing descriptions on the menu and the generous reviews posted by other diners. To their credit, the staff in Francesca's was courteous and attentive.We ordered Carciofo Arancini (OK flavors, though the date puree was sweeter than I expected), Polpette di Melanzane (eggplant balls were OK, but the dish was a bit gloppy), Barbabietole (sweeter and sharper than I'd like), and Porchetta e Pepe (the porchetta wrapped in pork belly was a good idea, but sooo salty, and the accompanying fried gnocchi were rubbery). All in all, the flavor balance was not so good.Maybe it's just a personal preference thing, but DiSotto just didn't do it for me. Maybe things are better if you dine in the enoteca. If you do choose to give it a try, be sure to call before you go, just to make sure the enoteca is available.

26.description: OH MY OH MY.For all you tourists out there, please visit this delicate place. You will be amazed.

25.description: My girlfriend and I decided to check this place out since its reviews were really good. However, upon arrival the service was extremely disorganized. There was no one there to greet us or bring us to our table. And so we just kind of walked in and sat at a table.We asked questions about the menu and the waiter has absolutely no idea how to answer our questions. At this point my girlfriend and I decided to get a dish and eat quickly so we can go to a different restaurant. After getting our dishes we were blown away. I got the pork belly and she got the mussels and the flavor was unbelievable.After this we decided to stay and order more food. Bad start, but the food was beyond incredible so I had to give it 5 stars.

12.description: I had been wanting to come here for some time, and I was really excited to try this place. I was not disappointed. This restaurant is located in the basement of Francesca's, and they do not take reservation. I came with a party of four, so I was pleasantly surprised that we found a table right away. We sat down and we were immediately greeted by our waitress. She was very knowledgeable about the wine and food menus. You get four pieces of crostini right away, served on a cutting board - they were really good!We started off with the Poppette di Melazane, which is eggplant meatballs. It was AMAZING! So good that we had to order it twice! Next, we got the Burrata Con Pomodori, which is sort of like a cheese-ball with pistachios and pesto underneath. It was a little watery, not sure if that's how it normally is, but it was our least favorite. We also got the Cozze e Sopressata, steamed mussels. They were really good, and the sauce that they came in was very flavorful. We also ordered the Pepperonata e Formaggio di Capra, which is bruschetta with a goat cheese spread. I'm not a big goat cheese fan, so I did not try it, but everyone else said they loved it. We finished with an order of the Gamberetto, which is shrimp and pickled veggies. It was very tasty as well. Overall, the really cozy and intimate environment combined with the great food and wine, makes this place a must. I will definitely be going back soon!

59.description: Incredible.  Very easy giving this place 5 stars.  It was everything we were looking for, and more!  First things first, it's in the basement so be sure and get to the right place.  You enter through a restaurant upstairs.  As you enter, you immediately feel relaxed.  The setting and exposed brick give the feel of a great, old-fashioned wine cellar.  I'm not much of a wino, but the staff was really helpful and we ultimately stumbled upon a great bottle.  The bruschetta was the best I have had.  The mozzarella was so creamy it had more of an ice-cream like texture.  Delicious! We stopped here prior to heading to a show.  What a great night.  Highly recommend!

21.description: Delish food and great atmospere. We got a bottle of wine, salad and a pizza and were very happy. I was surprised it was pretty empty at 9 on a Saturday night but the service was great and not badly priced.

17.description: Plates were generous (for a tapas place), the food was OK, and the wine list was extensive and the service was OK. I would come back to stop for a drink before a larger event.

10.description: Since I've moved to the neighborhood I tried to get a table here four times with no success. It's probably my fault trying to get a table on weekends in a popular place that doesn't take reservations but all four times they had private events with no room for other patrons.When I was about to give up on trying, I stumbled upon dinner reservation at Francesca's through work, which is their main restaurant upstairs. On my way to the restaurant I called Disotto, and luckily they were able to accommodate us in the wine bar downstairs (Disotto). To my surprise it was completely empty throughout our three-hour dinner. Sure, it was a Monday night, but once I got to see the wine bar I could understand why it was so hard to get in. It's a small, cozy area next to the wine cave and small bar with a handful of tables. A perfect place to host a small business event or party for a small group (less than 30). With a dim, relaxed and comfortable ambience and it can cater to both a casual romantic date night and after-hour drinks with coworkers or friends. Service was attentive if a bit slowWhile they did not offer cocktails off the menu this particular night, I ordered Vesper (which is actually on their cocktail menu) and they were happy to serve a well-made drink. Their wine list is not too extensive yet interesting although they did not have four out of five bottles of wine I asked for in stock.Last but not least: foodThe gave us the menu for Francesca's to order from.Antipasti selections were decent. We tried carpaccio, gamberi (shrimps), fried calamari, mussels in tomato sauce. Despite my bias towards food with ingredients from the ocean, carpaccio was my favorite. Thinly sliced raw sirloin was nicely complemented by capers, mushroom, and lemon. For main dishes we had linguini alla sora assunta (scallop and spinach), Vitello con polenta (veal), pollo con spinaci, and roasted red grouper. They were quite filling but none super memorable. Grouper dish was my favorite. We finished the meal with Torta Lava (lava cake with mint chocolate gelato) and crème brûlée. Crème brûlée tastes pretty good even with a full stomach.After all, I'm glad I got to try Disotto - it gets solid 3.5 stars which I rounded up to 4. Since we ordered food off Francesca's menu it may not be a fair rating but running out of several wines for a wine bar seemed a bit odd. Would I go back? There are many other places I would rather try before returning to Disotto, although if I'm in neighborhood I wouldn't mind walking in to catch up with a friend. Unless they are booked up once again for a private event.

5.description: First time at the restaurant, with 2 kids...and it went great. The food is pretty good, kids friendly, fast and courteous serviceI definitely recommend this restaurant.

3.description: The info about closing at midnight is nit always trie. Tonight they close at 10pm. Thamks God we called.

35.description: Lovely Italian cheeses, cold cuts, and wine in a cosy and intimate setting. It had the feeling of a true enotecca in Italy!

19.description: Delish food and great atmospere. We got a bottle of wine, salad and a pizza and were very happy. I was surprised it was pretty empty at 9 on a Saturday night but the service was great and not badly priced.

28.description: Very cool and intimate wine bar that's a perfect way to cap off an evening.Attentive and helpful servers will guide you to the ideal wines and cheeses / salami that suit your taste.  Broad selection of unique wines and reasonably priced by the glass as well.Will be back!

45.description: Fromaggi y salumi, tostato, and burrato for appetizers. All excellent! Even the kids enjoyed!  Ladybird shrimp and pork belly for entrees. Also outstanding!! My 14 yr old son said "that was exquisite". Being a bit cheeky but he did eat a lot. Great flavors, very tasty!

33.description: I had been wanting to come here for some time, and I was really excited to try this place. I was not disappointed. This restaurant is located in the basement of Francesca's, and they do not take reservation. I came with a party of four, so I was pleasantly surprised that we found a table right away. We sat down and we were immediately greeted by our waitress. She was very knowledgeable about the wine and food menus. You get four pieces of crostini right away, served on a cutting board - they were really good!We started off with the Poppette di Melazane, which is eggplant meatballs. It was AMAZING! So good that we had to order it twice! Next, we got the Burrata Con Pomodori, which is sort of like a cheese-ball with pistachios and pesto underneath. It was a little watery, not sure if that's how it normally is, but it was our least favorite. We also got the Cozze e Sopressata, steamed mussels. They were really good, and the sauce that they came in was very flavorful. We also ordered the Pepperonata e Formaggio di Capra, which is bruschetta with a goat cheese spread. I'm not a big goat cheese fan, so I did not try it, but everyone else said they loved it. We finished with an order of the Gamberetto, which is shrimp and pickled veggies. It was very tasty as well. Overall, the really cozy and intimate environment combined with the great food and wine, makes this place a must. I will definitely be going back soon!

43.description: The disclaimer is that I didn't actually eat here I just called them to enquire. The girl on the phone was clueless to menu options and  asked what I meant when I asked "how late are you open". It blew me away so i wrote this review. The three stars are bec I didn't eat or taste here and hence they deserve the benefit of the doubt.

2.description: I called for reservations on Christmas eve and was told they didn't normally take them but for that night they were! Lucky me. Although they weren't needed as there was only 2 other couples there and they ended up closing early.We had a great time.  The wine list is well varied and somewhat pricey. We ended up with a couple bottles of some nice Italian wines. The staff is very knowledgeable. It's super cozy..dark..intimate. a great place for date night or an evening with friends.The food was very good as well. The menu is small and limited but it's certainly has enough offerings to satisfy you. We had the pork belly with gnocchi. It was the biggest most delicious pork belly I ever had. We also had the arancini which were equally delicious. Definitely  a hidden gem. Even the locals didn't know about.

18.description: My girlfriend and I decided to check this place out since its reviews were really good. However, upon arrival the service was extremely disorganized. There was no one there to greet us or bring us to our table. And so we just kind of walked in and sat at a table.We asked questions about the menu and the waiter has absolutely no idea how to answer our questions. At this point my girlfriend and I decided to get a dish and eat quickly so we can go to a different restaurant. After getting our dishes we were blown away. I got the pork belly and she got the mussels and the flavor was unbelievable.After this we decided to stay and order more food. Bad start, but the food was beyond incredible so I had to give it 5 stars.

41.description: Great food, great service...good was good and had great taste. Wine by the glass was a reasonable price. Overall great experience

52.description: Off the charts delicious! Intimate basement dining lounge and wine cellar. Knowledgeable and friendly staff.

50.description: It should be 4.5 but I round up :)  the ambiance is truly lovely- the small pasta dishes and the beet salad were scrumptious.  The wine the waiter suggested was the perfect embodiment of not too sweet and not too biting- our description while explaining our desired vino.

4.description: Hands down, this is my favorite place to go on a date night in Chicago. The most romantic setting, a quiet environment, gorgeous wine selection, and the absolute BEST food. I have been here two Valentine's Days in a row with my boyfriend and we will definitely be back. On Valentine's Day they have a special menu which is always really fun! The menu seems to rotate on a regular basis, but I've never been really let down. Note: They are located in the basement of Francesca's, so you have to walk into Francesca's first, and then tell them you're dining at Disotto Enoteca. I also recommend having a reservation, since the seating room is fairly small at Disotto. The asparagus ravioli was the best ravioli I have ever had in my life, and I love meat. Their valentine's day dessert special was also the best dessert I have ever had in my life. I was waiting to write this review so that not everyone would learn of the secrets of DiSotto, but I figured it was time to share the love. The portions are amazing, the taste unparalleled, and the ambiance my favorite.

6.description: I love coming here when I'm in Chicago it's alway a must!  The menu is awesome and everything prepared to perfection. Love the inside.  It's very relaxing and wonderful selections of wine & spirits I couldn't have ask for anything better I just wish it was in California too . Needless to say I will be back again & again.

22.description: Hands down, this is my favorite place to go on a date night in Chicago. The most romantic setting, a quiet environment, gorgeous wine selection, and the absolute BEST food. I have been here two Valentine's Days in a row with my boyfriend and we will definitely be back. On Valentine's Day they have a special menu which is always really fun! The menu seems to rotate on a regular basis, but I've never been really let down. Note: They are located in the basement of Francesca's, so you have to walk into Francesca's first, and then tell them you're dining at Disotto Enoteca. I also recommend having a reservation, since the seating room is fairly small at Disotto. The asparagus ravioli was the best ravioli I have ever had in my life, and I love meat. Their valentine's day dessert special was also the best dessert I have ever had in my life. I was waiting to write this review so that not everyone would learn of the secrets of DiSotto, but I figured it was time to share the love. The portions are amazing, the taste unparalleled, and the ambiance my favorite.

15.description: I gave it five star because the service was superb and whoever gave us a bottle of champagne really made our NYE a memorable night!!! Wine selection is very comprehensive and food is decent too...

57.description: I planned a Saturday night date here with my boyfriend and loved it. The atmosphere, the food, the wine and the service were all great. There was no wait and the waiter was helpful and pleasant. We ordered two plates and loved them both. Great date place.

20.description: My vote for the most romantics 'bar' in Chicago.  It offers everything you want in a quiet romantic place - in a basement speakeasy type setting, walls lined with wine and great tables and seating.  We had a wonderful time celebrating my birthday.

36.description: Hosted a surprise party for my in-laws here.  Fantastic location! Fabulous service!  Great food, drinks, and decor! Could not have been more pleased for the money we spent.  Thank you

14.description: Hidden in the basement of Francesca's is this lovely gem of a restaurant/wine bar. We had been wanting to go here for a while due to the numerous positive reviews on Yelp, though it does appear many Yelpers have been submitting reviews and pictures of Francesca's instead.Well, this place truly didn't disappoint. We were here on a Monday evening and our first reaction was why is no one here?! We were literally the only ones here though two other parties arrived later on in the night. Others stopped by and quickly left due to the lack of patrons, but they decided too hastily!Once you step into this place, you feel as if you've just walked into a grotto or an intimate cavern so it definitely has a romantic and rustic feel. I can imagine this place can get quite busy during the weekend dinner times, so make sure to get here early to snag your table.The wine selection is quite extensive and while the food choices seem limited, everything we tried was outstanding though be warned that a number of the dishes come with bread so be prepared for a carb overload! :)All dishes are meant to be shared family style and most closely resemble small plates like Quartino's or a tapas place. However, you will feel full after ordering a few dishes and you should definitely sample from each section of the menu. In addition to the wine, the dishes that stood out were the:- Mussels (Cozze e Sopressata)- Fontina cheese bread with egg yolks (Tostato con Uova)- Prosciutto e Caprese- Cheese and meat selection (Formaggi & Salumi)- Fried gnocchi balls that were part of the pork belly dish were very good- Fried eggplant meatballs were divine!- Chocolate lava cake with mint chocolate chip gelato (Torta lava)- Vanilla gelato (best I've ever had and I've tried gelato from a number of good places)- TiramisuYes, I listed all three desserts we had since they were all delicious! 5 stars for ambience, 5 stars for food and 4 stars for service since it seemed quite slow even though no one else was there. All of this rounds up to 5 stars, so if you're in the area, make sure to stop by!

0.description: A cute little shop in Water Tower that is FULL of socks.  Don't let their colorful, kid friendly displays fool you, they have socks and such for adults too.  They have a friendly sales staff that will perkily greet you with their little slogan."Welcome to Little Miss Matched, have you been here before?  No.  Well all our socks don't match!  They're sold in sets of three, so if you lose one you still have two more."And that is correct, all their socks don't match, they're a mix of complimentary colors and patterns and are oh so cute.  They also carry stuffed animals made out of socks, bags, and other little trinkets.  A great place for a cheeky gift.  Or for the dancer in your life...they sell some great half socks, or "spinner socks," toe-less socks, etc.
