1.description: NEGATIVE STARS!!!Had some friends in from LA and I thought we'd go to Water Tower for some shopping because my friend's 11 year old daughter was begging for us to take her somewhere to buy jewelry.  So she saw Aldo and wanted to go in.  From the time they went in (I waited in front of the store as they looked around), one of their workers was shadowing them, on their ass, as if they were criminals.  As they walked out, she pretty much accused my friend's daughter of taking a ring.  Asking if they "put the ring back" and when my friend said "yes, she looked at the price and put it back" the girl, with a MAJOR condescending attitude said "I didn't see her put it back."  My friend told her to go ahead and search her daughter, to which she got a nasty dirty look from the girl who, as she walked away saying "no, that's ok."  I was so embarrassed and tried to reassure my friend and her daughter that not all Chicagoans are racist, stereo-typing a-holes like the ones who work at Aldo Accessories.  We ended up finding AND PURCHASING some really cute items from another store in the mall, with EXCELLENT customer service.

2.description: I had a disappointing experience here. I saw the cutest black rain boots and asked if they came in a size 5, to which the sales associate replied "Maybe, I'm not sure" and then pointed me to some other boots that may or may not come in my size. Not once did she go check if they carried my size. The only other thing I got out of her was that "sometimes they run small so you might be able to wear a 6," before I decided I had had enough. Too bad because it looked like they had some cute purses and jewelry.

0.description: I've been to a few other locations, so I knew what to expect. The selection is more youthful and trendy that I normally prefer, but I *did* find a headband for my wedding outfit a few years ago. I was hopeful this time around for an accessory to go with my outfit for tonight. Wasn't looking for any particular accessory. I scored a couple of their necklaces in their '2 for 1' clearance rack. A simple chain adorned with little gold 'sequins' throughout. The coordinating silver one was perfect. Both were marked down from $15 to $11.98. Modest, tasteful, and at a fantastic price.

3.description: I went in about 2 weeks ago not expecting to buy anything right away. As soon I step foot in the Fossil store, a cheerful and nice associate asks if I'm looking for anything specific which I was, I needed a men's travel bag, she def helped me in picking one out and showing me their selection, but she had no idea what she was talking about when describing the bag to me. So I ended up purchasing one of the nicest bags I seen there and she told me the strap on the side was so I can hang it on my luggage in case I got tired of holding it. I thought that was cool and helped me decide to get it. Wrong. The strap is for when you want to fold it over into a smaller bag. It's a second handle. Another thing that got me was when she went to the back to find the bag, I was looking at the bracelets and found a nice one, the. When she came out she was standing off to the side looking at me from the corner of my eye like I was trying to steal it. I might be a teenager but that doesn't mean I'm going to steal it. Trust me, I can afford a $60 bracelet. Love the store and products but Fossil should invest in employee training on products.

1.description: Horrible customer service!! My boyfriend took his watch in about 2 months ago to have the battery changed. The guy at the store could not easily get the watch to open so he was banging it against the wall!!! A few minute later, he came out and said he had broken the watch and that it would have to be sent in for repair... 4 weeks later, the watch comes back and the battery is still not fixed!! The watch also came with a $40 bill for the repairs that were the fault of the Fossil employee in the first place!! I went in yesterday to have the battery changed an the same guy broke the minute hand on the watch and so now it is being sent in again and we have to wait another 3-4 weeks for it. Absolutely dreadful costumer service.

2.description: I love Fossil watches and have purchased quite a few in the past but have never been to this particular store.  I brought in two different watches that were no longer working and the salesperson, Kathleen, fixed one on the spot for me.  The other she changed the battery on but afterwards noticed the minute hand was moving freely when the watch was moved.  Because she was unsure whether or not she had caused this to happen when she changed the battery (neither of us had noticed it in our conversation before), she sent it in the be fixed and waived the charges.  She was also just an overall friendly salesperson.  I will definitely be coming back to this location for my future purchases!

5.description: I came here yesterday because I had been eyeing a few things in the catalog for a few weeks. I was really trying to avoid coming to this area because it's always so congested on the Magnificent Mile. I am really glad I came here because the sales people were really friendly, helpful, and just generally nice, especially since I had just come from being outside in the gross, rainy weather. I'm very glad I decided to make the trip to this location. I cannot remember the name of the associate who helped me, but she was awesome. I'm a fan of this store and will definitely come back.

6.description: The little band on the strap on my husband's fossil watch broke... so we went to the store to see if they could fix it.  They said they would have to send it off to another watch store to do this... so we gave it to them and they took it away.About a year later, we still have not received the watch back.  My husband has called the watch company multiple times.  They said "the watch couldn't be fixed" and "that a check was in the mail" as compensation.  We never received the check, even after calling back twice to say we never received it.  When he called Fossil, they just passed the buck without a care in the world.Absolutely awful.  Why Fossil would work with such an untrustworthy business is beyond me.  We are totally out a watch (that still worked fine, minus the band!) and we will NOT be doing business with Fossil again.

7.description: I recently stopped in to grab a pin I'd lost and battery for my watch. I was immediately informed that my watch would need to be sent in for repair which would take 3-4 weeks. Even though Fossil claims to have an 11 year warranty, the "fix" would cost $27 claiming the crystal was broken. A typical battery replacement would have been $17. These prices include shipping and handling. After refusing to pay $27 for a battery and pin, they offered to replace the battery for $10 plus tax. They also gave me a phone number to call to have a pin shipped to me.Seriously, what kind of service is this? I have to question why they needed credit card info for my allegedly NOT "under warranty" repair. And, how hard would it be to have 50 pins in various sizes at every store? They claimed that they "could not store spare watch parts" at every store. Ummm, ya know, b/c watch parts, like pins take up a lotta space.Whatever, Fossil.

8.description: The new sales staff at Fossil are so great!  I went in with a ceramic watch that had a broken link, the link right by the face.  Instead of shipping it off to get fixed for $80 (it was a fix they couldn't do in the store), they replaced it with a totally new watch in the same style.  They are awesome!

9.description: I was in this store with a friend who was shopping and my Fossil sunglasses broke. I asked the clerk to throw them away and she replaced them! i told her I had bought them 6 months ago, or more, and she had the same pair in stock and replaced them anyway. I am impressed and will buy many more Fossil products. I have a purse from there also and love it

0.description: I know nothing about watches, especially men's watches, which is what my fiancé wanted for Christmas. I can't afford Michael Kors, but wanted it to be nice, so I checked out Fossil's website to see the price range ($100-150 for the style he wanted) then headed to the store for some help choosing. The woman that helped me was soo sweet and helpful, and not pushy at all! It can feel a bit uncomfortable walking into the store as everything is perfectly placed, including the employees positioned just so, but once we started talking, the stuffiness was gone :)My fiancé loved the watch, but a few days after Christmas it stopped keeping time. I took it into the store, and without hesitation they said they'd just give me a new one! Minutes later, I was on my way out with a brand new watch. Great customer service!Fun fact -- Fossil actually makes Michael Kors watches, then just adds the logo instead of their own. Same for Marc Jacobs, Diesel, etc. SO it's definitely a better deal to buy Fossil instead if you care more about having a good watch than the label ;)

4.description: Many thanks to the salesperson at Fossil yesterday who took the time to take a link out of my watch, and then replace it right away when the watch was too tight.She didn't have to take the time to do that, especially since I had already purchased the watch elsewhere, and had no intention of purchasing anything on this visit.

3.description: The first time I was lead up to this hidden gem in the John Hancock, I was full of wonder and excitement. It was a cool mini super market with many different offerings for prepared foods and groceries. When I looked at the prices, I was stoked. The prices at Potash Bros JHC are really reasonable (being that I'm used to South Loop Market prices). Sometimes they have special discounts on popular items that are pretty competitive with any larger chain supermarket. The fact that this is right above my office is just the clincher. However, this location is only accessible to tenants that either work or live at the John Hancock. If you are so fortunate to be in the building, this is a great convenient way to grab a quick bite or grab a few grocery items. Here are a few items I have tried at the prepared food section. Soup and Half Sandwich Combo - They have a great deal on a cup of soup and half sandwich at $5.99. The food is not very good, but it's passable. The bread is a bit stale, and the soups are a bit inconsistent. But the price is relatively low, and it keeps you full. I got a roast beef sandwich and the chicken wrap. For soups I have tried the chicken noodle, the cream of chicken and wild rice, and the chili. The soups were a bit salty and not memorable, while the sandwich was below average (even with Boar's Head meat). Broiled Chicken Wing Combo - You get 6 broiled (look and tasted fried) wings with a handful of fries. Unfortunately, they won't let you substitute out the fries for a different side, but it was still a good amount of food for $6. The wings are a bit salty, and the fries are a bit soggy and uninteresting. But it's passable. Overall, this is a sweet place due to the convenience factor. The prices are really reasonable, and the food is passable on days where you really don't want to go outside. The food really deserves 2 stars, but the groceries and the pricing deserve a star.

1.description: Very convenient Inside the building Can sit there w/your coffee or lunch and enjoy the great view from the beach ,lake michigan and the north side of our city

0.description: Staff is so nice and helpful. Good food selection for a small location. I don't recommend the salad bar but that's okay.

2.description: Rude and sassy service and extremely overpriced for prepared foods compared to FoodEase next door. Groceries aren't cheap either.

5.description: Gorgeous view of Lake Michigan from the 44th floor. Great friendly staff. If I didn't work in the building 10 floors below them and without a dining room, I'd probably not set foot in there though (unless I'm doing some grocery shopping). Don't get me wrong. This particular Potash Bros is a cut above any other Jewel, Dominicks, etc. Need I remind you of the view and the friendly staff? (Hence the extra star). But the warm food here is only decent at best. What do you expect from a grocery store though? I come here mostly for the view and for some peace and quiet (as opposed to the bustlin' noisiness of L'Appetito downstairs).

6.description: Summary:Location gets five stars, Food gets four stars, Price gets three stars, and Service gets four stars,Details:I've been to two of the Potash Bros. locations - this one, and the one on State Street.  My review of both would be the same, but as this location hasn't had a review yet, I don't want it to feel left out.The Hancock location is pretty super secret.  I've been working (as a contractor) in the building for four years, and only first heard about it about a year ago.  Based on rumors among my team, you can only get to the 44th floor through the freight elevator, and you need to either a) be an employee or resident of the building with a security badge, or b) ask one of the security personnel in the lobby level to let you up.  I've never tried asking the security personnel...always been lucky to hitch a ride on the elevator with another working stiff during the lunch hour.For such a smallish grocery store, I'm always surprised at the volume and variety of food.  It is a full-service grocery store, from fresh fruit to frozen foods.  You really won't find generic brands here though, at least none that I've seen.The best part (for me at least) is the deli.  It's so hard to find a real deli downtown.  And I love fresh salami...the fresher, the better.  Momma always told me to stay away from foul-smelling salami.   Good advice for anyone.The deli serves Boar's Head meat products...very tasty, kinda pricy, but worth it given you're paying more than $10 for a sandwich, drinks, and chips most anywhere in the area anyway.  There are other meats and deli items too...potato salad, macaroni salad, other salads...they also serve full-size deli pickles, and who doesn't like a big pickle?  The ladies at the deli counter have always been friendly, and always give me a pickle spear even though I order the big pickle.  I guess they think I just look like a guy who can handle a lot of pickle.If you're in the neighborhood and feel like a fresh deli sandwich, I'd suggest trying to get up to the 44th floor, or try the location on State (it's not too far of a walk from the Hancock).  Also note that there are no places to sit at either location, so you'll need to order to go.  I'd stay away from the "deli" in the basement of the Hancock...more on that in another review.

7.description: You assholes.True story.We're a good 2 bottles of wine, 1 hour into Risotto (after spending 20 minutes disagreeing on a dinner option and Milk vs. the Wrestler).  Hey, we'll make risotto and take shots of our own booze-- better food for half the price!  And we'll be drunk!  Well, needless to say, the doctor of the group decided there are 2 cups in a quart and we're quite a bit short of vegetable broth.  So we try to find a place closer than the more than wonderful Jewel down the street.  Potash!  Who doesn't love Potash!?We get there.  Store is only for residents of the building.  1 hour of Risotto is ruined and I have to live w/ the fact that Oprah really does have it better than me.SCREW YOU POTASH.

8.description: For being a "local" store just for the Hancock residents, it is pretty good. Wide selection for a small store, and they don't jack up the prices due to the location. Deli is great, and the store is always neat and clean.

9.description: This is not just a Potash Bros. This is a 5,200-square-foot location on the 44th floor of the John Hancock Center with a fabulous view.  I have been here many times because my good friend lives in the building. I am happy to say  the service is outstanding, the Deli is always fresh and  they really have all you need. At first, you would think the price is very high compared to others, but it's not !You really can't beat a Potash with seats available for viewing the lake and surroundings. Forget the expensive  Signature Room..Good job Potash for this great idea!

10.description: Potash Grocery has an excellent selection at fair prices.  Deli is awesome, produce fresh and has a wide variety of misc. grocery items. There is always a manager or two around to make sure everything is good.  Definately a quality old school grocery - nice break from the whole foods / whole paycheck mindset.

4.description: Wanted to go check out the view but was told that this potash is only open to the residents and tenants of the building. Waste of time.

3.description: They have a great selection of sauces, even ones that are hard to find. Sales associates were very friendly and helpful. Reasonable prices for specialty hot spices.

1.description: I love stopping here whenever I'm at Water Tower Place. It's always fun to look around and the staff are outrageously nice! They're always willing to give you a few samples and share their favorite hot sauces with you. It's pretty difficult to walk out of here empty handed.

2.description: I didn't realize this store located in 7th floor by red mango and new sports museum. It is a specialized store only with hot pepper. They carry so many variety of hot sauces. One of fun items is hot peoper cotton candy. They also have pickled egg!Must stop by if you are in water tower!

9.description: WOO! For those of you who love salsa, hot-sauces, and seasonings galore- this is your joint.This store literally has everything you could ever imagine to spice up your favorite course.

10.description: This is similar to the Pepper Palace in Gatlinburg, TN, only much smaller and with less samples.They have all of their store-brand hot sauces on sample so you can determine which heat level you want.  The sauces are a bit overpriced, but most of the sauces are not carried elsewhere locally, and you can sample their store brand.I've had the hottest hot sauce in the universe and the hottest salsa they have, both of which are very overwhelming.  Since there isn't a supermarket hot sauce that's hot enough for me this place is perfect!  I asked if they had anything with a heat level above Dave Insanity Sauce but with a better taste.  They gave me samples of 6 different sauces with different flavor and heat combinations.Definitely check this place out, even though it's in Water Tower....

4.description: My husband and I stopped into Pepper Palace earlier today because we were in Water Tower, and our experience was all but a good one. The hot sauces were good enough, but the sales associate giving us samples was sour as can be! She didn't have a name tag unfortunately, but she was blonde and wearing a white shirt. My husband asked her if a particular sauce was very spicy. She responded very rudely "This is a hot sauce store, so what do you think?" He then asked if she had tried them all, once again trying to make conversation and ask about the product. She once again retorted "Well I work here so obviously I have." We were so turned away by her terrible attitude that we walked out without saying anything else. We are still in shock that we were so disrespected by someone who worked at Pepper Palace. We will not be returning.

6.description: Man was this place fun!  I have a handful of hot sauces at home, but my winner is my powdered Habanero spice.  This place has powered jalokia (sp?) which of course is many times hotter than the habanero.  The store employees were probably the owners as they demonstrated an extreme sense of knowledge in the products that they were selling.  They had me sample of few of the sauces and horseradish; good work guys! I ended up purchasing some homemade hot pepper jelly and a scorpion lolly-pop. Good stuff!

12.description: The only problem is there's too much to choose from! The walls are lined with hot sauces and bbq. It would be nice if they were grouped into categories. We sampled some of the barbeque sauces and we'll be back to buy some. My husband tried to the hottest salsa sample and got the hiccups much to everyone's amusement. We ended up buying a Scorpion pepper plant, hopefully it turns out!

5.description: I love hot sauce! So naturally i'm a big fan of this store. When i saw this store i couldn't believe my eyes. I know americans were crazy (in a good way guys!) but do they really have a hot sauce store? AWESOME!I bought some 'winning hot sauce', some 'hottest hot sauce in the universe' and some home grow kits. this was a lot of fun!

13.description: This rating isn't necessarily for the products they sell, but it's for the service. The prices are WAY over priced you could get almost everything what they sell at a grocery store for WAY CHEAPER. Also, the kid working the front register is so rude. He is single handedly the reason I stopped going there because I was a frequent shopper there.

11.description: OMG Hot sauce heaven.  Amazing selection of hot sauces, spices and rubs.  Check em out.

8.description: I love hot sauces, so this store is perfect for me.  The only problem is a ) they have a HUGE selection, so it's hard to decide what to buy and b )it's expensive BUT these sauces are 100 times hotter than what you get at a typical grocery store.You can even test out quite a bit of the sauces!Good store! Pricey, but worth it!

0.description: If you like HOT sauce this is the place to go, i was eating lunch at foodlife today so i thought i would pop in and pick out a little something, my favorite is Malindas they have many different flavors and heat levels, their GHOST one is their newest, be careful this one is not for the beginner, but really if your anywhere near this Palace you must stop in you will not be disappointed

7.description: Such a cute little store in Water Tower Place!  There are a ton of selections and as others have stated, since its not sectioned in any way, it is hard to find what you are exactly looking for.  Everything I sampled, however, was just great!  The employees are super friendly and very happy to help you.  They highly suggested the Key Lime BBQ sauce and I was instantly in love, great flavor with a subtle lightness due to the limes.  I can't wait to smother my chicken with it!!Prices are reasonable, especially since these are items you are unlikely to find elsewhere.

3.description: This place is great - only place I've found that will tweeze rather than wax. Only problem: the smell from Lush - bleh!

1.description: They ruined my brows after a long year of having finally a perfect shape so upset I wouldn't return I was rushed and the lady didn't even ask me if I like them she justCharged me and took the next person wish I could had them at least filled

2.description: I came here out of convenience, and the price is slightly higher than it's possible to pay if you know where else to go.  (I know a place nearby where it's $13).But nevertheless, if you're ok with the price ($21) the brow wax I had here from B. was perfect.

5.description: The only reasons I didn't give the Brow Bar in Macy's a 5 is 1) the unbearable stench from LUSH and 2) whether or not I make an appointment, I ALWAYS have to wait. Will try BB at 900 N. Michigan.

6.description: On a whim, while visiting Chicago for the weekend, I decided to get my brows shaped at Benefit Brow Bar.  Initially I thought I may not like having my brows done in the middle of a bustling cosmetic area in the Macy's in Water Tower Place, but once in the chair, I didn't notice anything else going on around me.  First, I watched the brow expert work her magic on another client.  Once I realized she knew what she was doing and I also took notice that her own brows were beautifully shaped and FULL, I went for it.  My Benefit Brow expert was Maggie Egan.  She was very cheerful, friendly, knowledgeable, professional, and talented.  Just look for Zooey Deschanel's twin (my husband disagrees and says she looks like Emma Stone?)! She told me exactly what she would be doing and my brows looked amazing.  I was very pleased with her work and would recommend her to anyone who is going for a full, classic arch.  I will definitely be making a trip back to see her again!  A great brow expert can be hard to find!I went back to see Maggie again in July 2012 and she's just as fabulous as I remember!  So pleased with her work and she's so sweet, too.  I'll return again next time I'm in Chicago!EDIT: I understand Maggie is no longer here. If anyone knows where she went, please let me know!EDIT: Maggie Egan is now at Zazu Salon in Chicago.

7.description: a comfortable bow wax!?!? YES!

0.description: *This is the Benefit Brow Bar in the Macy's at Water Tower Place* So I'm at the Taste Bar (cafe on the ground floor at the back of the Water Tower Place) buying a lemon cookie the size of my head when I hear this chick say, "Hey Girl, check out those brows!" I'm mortified (mostly b/c of the size of the cookie I just bought) - but then I turn to see Maggie, my new eyebrow lady from the Benefit Brow Bar. You can tell from the word go that she could care less if I were purple and eating pine cones. She's too chill to care. She asked me about my friend's birthday dinner party and if I like my brows. I've met this chick ONCE, for five minutes over 2 days before. After I picked my (hairless) chin off the floor I nearly high-fived her for her memory, and realized I owe her a review: Two days earlier I'd marched up to the brow bar to get practically my whole face waxed. I told her to thin out my brows and give me an arch. She said no - she'd never thin me out. Maggie 1: Emily 0. I took it on the chin, literally. Everything looked great after (no strays!) and I wasn't red or itchy after (I'm usually red and itchy). Will go back. Thanks, Maggie! (She's the one that looks like Zooey D., except ZD is creepy and Maggie isn't at all).

4.description: Such amazing service from Jerri! I walked into Macy's just to look around and spotted the Benefit Brow Bar. I knew I needed a fix up, and I saw that they offered waxing for $20 or tweeting for $25. Now I typically do threading but I figured hey, why not go for the wax? I saw Jerri finishing up a customer and she looked amazing, so I was pleased when I was told that I would be getting her. Jerri was very nice and informative, showed me my arch and the beginnings and ends of my brows, and explained that she was going to trim and shape my brows. She did an awesome job! They have an excellent staff here at Benefit, very kind and attentive. Also, the wax was really gentle, which I liked. I'm very fair and my skin is pretty sensitive (i.e. red hot after waxing for hours on end) but this wax session only left me red for 30 minutes! My brows look fabulous and I think she changed me from threading to waxing. If you get a chance to go here, definitely ask for Jerri.

3.description: Not quite sure what Sports Authority is going for here with it's "SA Elite" stores, but given that I love all things relating to workout gear, I popped in one day while in the building. They have employees at the front explaining to you the store concept: basically all higher-end workout clothes and footwear. No gear, no equipment. Think Nike, Under Armour, Adidas etc. Pretty much all full price. Quite a large selection of footwear, which should be the draw. For me, I jumped for joy when I saw they carried Salomon Speedcross. Granted, I already have two pairs, and they are much cheaper to order online, but it's nice to know there is a brick and mortar store in Chicago that carries the Salomon line. Overall, I get the impression that SA is trying to "class it up" and have a knock lulu-esque type of store. Perhaps there's a draw for it, but I'll stick to my regular SA for the time being.

1.description: I purchased $15 running socks here last week.  They slipped down into my shoes.  Tried to exchange them last night for a different brand at the same price.  I had my original receipt.  The employee at the register was unable to exchange the socks without a "code."  He spoke via headset to (presumably) a manager with a code.  The manager was not in the store.  I waited eight minutes.  No manager.  No code.  I suggested to the clerk that he call again.  He refused.  The manager was "busy doing things for the store" somewhere else in the mall.  I suggested he take my name and number, then have the manager call me when he's back.  Nope.  The employee could only suggest that I come back later (later...perhaps I should call first to make sure the code-bearing manager is available??).  I refused, took the new socks, left the old socks, and left the store.  #1 - an even exchange shouldn't take more than ten minutes#2 - if the manager leaves the store, s/he should leave someone with the magic return code#3 - train your employees to solve simple customer service problems, like an even exchange, without management inputIf I were in Sports Authority management, I would fire the store manager and retrain the young man who was working the register.  Disappointing.  I won't be back.

2.description: I've been here a few times, and, while it is a smaller version of Sports Authority (or any other big chain sporting goods store), they don't seem to make the same mistakes with their customers.  Each visit, I've been able to shop without intrusion, yet people were available to answer my questions. The pricing isn't bad, despite their location.    They specialize mostly in athletic clothing and shoes, so if you're looking for actual equipment, you may be left wanting.  Overall, I plan to shop here again.

5.description: I found the shoe collection--it's along the back wall. And they have a treadmill so that you can try them out. I ended up buying a pair of shoes during my latest visit :)

6.description: I just returned from my first visit to S.A. Elite. It was a very pleasurable experience. They honored a 10 dollar check in reward even though I did not have a confirmation number. The staff was very helpful. They may be working on commissions. I feel a little guilty because one person helped me at the beginning and someone else helped me the rest of the way.

0.description: This spot is quickly becoming my go-to for athletic gear of the non-Lucy or Lulu variety. Nothing wrong with these usual suspects, but sometimes a person just needs to change it up, especially now that the aforementioned two retailers seem to have reached critical mass. To wit: A  fiftyish guy in my gym was wearing Lululemon shorts, leading me to wonder if what is happening here is just another version of what happened about a decade ago with guys wearing premium denim...I digress.When I stopped into Sports Authority elite earlier this week to redeem my $20 off $100 coupon, I pretty much had the run of the store, as it was just before 4 pm on a weekday. The staff were helpful when they needed to be and let me browse in peace the rest of the time. I was surprised by the great sales going on all around the store--I managed to score a puma zip up and tank on discount to help me round out my purchases and bring me up to the $100 mark. The items are stylish vs super trendy and geared toward the performance end of the spectrum. Bonus points to the workers for letting me leave behind flyers for a run without any rolling of the eyes or attempts to turn me out of the store.

4.description: This place is trouble for me. I love coming here because I get to indulge in my love for comfortable but stylish and fresh gear. There is one employee here in particular who is cool as ever but since I took so damn long to write this review I can't remember her name. I always chat with her when I go too. Anywho, this is my spot!

1.description: Hello everyone!So here is my story and my first review ever about smth else but I must do it!So I found a coupon on a groupon website for laser hair removal.I worked in another company here in US and we worked with group on so I know that businesses give groupon about 50% of the money I pay via website. So I called this spa and asked if it is ok and good for them if I pay in the office. They told me yes. (And this is my first mistake)After this I asked front dest lady how long will it take. And she told me it will be about 1-1,15 hour. This was very important for me because I have a 5 month old baby and I had to ask baby sitter to come and I had to tell my baby sitter when I come back. After this I called this spa 3 times to reschedule because of my baby and they confirmed me that time.So on that day I came there on time. Almost immediately the lady picked me up. In the beginning we started to discuss money. I wanted to do 2 middle area and one large areas. I told her this and I told her I want to buy one coupon for this and do 3 on that day and 3 on another day. That lady started to tell me that I can't buy 6 procedures for medium area. Ok I was agree and I offered her if I just buy 6 procedures for large areas and she will do 2 medium and 1 large on this money. She was not agree. I tried to understand and we were spending about 15 min of discussing. She told me that I have to pay 6 procedures for extra large areas and we will do 3 today (remember it was just 2 medium - underarm and bikini and one large - half legs). I was solo upset so ok I was agreed and I was thinking I was wrong. I told her lets start asap. The  she asked me did you shave? I told her no nobody told me this (I did laser hair removal in another spa and they told me I shouldn't shave 2-3 days before the laser). She told me - oh ok - I have to shave you and you have to spend additional 15 or 50$ on this) AND you know I spend so much time discussing with you money that I do not have time to finish all 3 areas. I was shocked. I called the spa several times to confirm time, we spend max 20 min for all this staff and she is telling me please pay me for shaving and maybe I won't finish all areas!!!Is it normal???I told her I won't pay and see asked manager.I told the manager that story almost crying and she told me yes I understand you and I have to check with front desk! Is it normal? Also she told me that is If didn't shave at home they will charge me for this!!! Yes I started to tell her that it is not normal and I don't lie and she asked me if I want to go out!!!!! What???Ahh I forgot the lady who told me that I have to buy 3 extra large areas asked me if I live close by and I can go there and shave!! yes i live in downtown but i don't want to go home, shave and go back!So now I think it was emotional abuse or smth like this, I do not have other words. In the end I agreed with everything because I wanted to finish all this. And this is was my second mistake - I had to go out after all this terrible things.So yes in the end they shaved me with the shave very quickly - 2 min and did 3 areas in 10 min - very very quickly also.And yes I paid like for 6 extra large. And yes the lady who told me this she told me we did 3 extra large and 3 I will do next time.I left and felt terrible.I found other deals on groupon and I even called them and they told me they would charge me the same amount for 12 procedures not for 6 as I was told here.After this i called my husband who is a top manager in international company here. I told him this and he told me it is terrible and it is first time he meets so awful people who behave like in a very cheap salon! Of course he meets many people and deals with many different situations here in Chicago.He told me I will never go to this spa again, never called nothing... I disputed a charge in Chase (thank you Chase) and they returned me money. So please do not go here or if you go - please buy the coupon :)What I want to say in the end - this spa thinks that they are expensive salon with good reputation but not after this. Me and my husband will tell as much people as we can that nobody should go there. But after this story all my friends were shocked!!! So yes this is my first and I hope last review because usually I don't care even if smth do smth bad but they try to solve this and don't lie. And this spa is different story.And I know that the owner from that spa will read this or front dest lady - please cancel my appointment with you on the Dec 17. Thanks II don't want talk to you or deal some other way with you

9.description: I've been to a handful of medi-spa's, and True Skin care is be far the most professional.  First of all, I appreciate that it is a doctor's office.  I think there is more legitimacy that comes with it.  The first time i went in, they had a PA (physician's assistant) check me out to make sure I was a laser candidate.  I've been lasering my hair for a while now.  (People need to realize that it takes a while and numerous treatments.)  I think the lasers they carry are more effective than those I've used at other locations.Finally, I can't say enough about Jen Casey, my aesthetician.  She is so fun and helpful and will become your girlfriend over your sessions with her.  She takes a personal interest and almost a sense of responsibility about her work.  She wants to make sure you get the results you are looking for.  She is so awesome.

23.description: I went there for Laser hair removal on my lower legs. The location is very convenient. The office is clean and always busy. The receptionist is okay, not excellent, but helpful. The appointment is easy. The service is very professional. I had Kaitlin last time and she was friendly and resourceful. Their laser is really pain-free! Believe me! I love this machine. I have my armpits and bikini done elsewhere and that was super painful. I will definitely go there for more services.

5.description: This place is outstanding and very flexible! I have received laser hair treatment for several different treatment areas. Kaitlyn is amazing! She is very patient and through, thanks for everything =-)))

25.description: I have been going to True for a few years, and the reason is Terri! I have been going to Terri for almost 10 years, and I won't let anyone else touch my face.She is so in tuned with what's going on with my skin, as she is so well versed and teaches classes. She's just not an ordinary esthetician. She will talk to me about reactions I could possibly have from medications, skin care products, etc.I love everyone in the office, as they're all very friendly.If you need a facial, of any kind, please go here!Their monthly specials are the BEST!

12.description: I'm getting married in 6 months and wanted to try laser hair removal for my underarms so I didn't have to worry about razor burn with my strapless dress. True Skin Care Center is one of the only places in Chicago with the new machine, The Duet. I've had a few treatments and it's definitely working. The best part-- hardly felt a thing! I've heard horror stories from friends about their laser hair removal experiences with other machines. My underarms only took about 4 minutes each time and Kaitlin, the esthetician, was so nice! Can't wait for the finished results! P.S. I've had the Intraceuticals Oxygen Facial (and their other oxygen facial) and it's a to-die-for glow! Definitely worth checking out for any event you have coming up!

21.description: Very impressive!I purchased a Groupon for three Laser Treatments for $180 without knowing anything about True Skin (couldn't resist that deal) ... and I was delighted by how great my entire experience was. The staff was VERY friendly, my appointment was taken early, and I felt really comfortable during the entire session. I've never done laser hair removal before and was a bit nervous - but Terri patiently answered my questions and was extremely thorough with the details of the procedure. After 15 minutes of talking with Kaitlin, I decided I first wanted to test a small area to see if I'd have an adverse reaction - and come back in a few weeks to finish during a second appointment. Kaitlyn was completely patient and nice about my decision, and she didn't charge me anything for the consultation and trial (even though I was supposed to forfeit one of three treatments)! The laser hair removal itself was almost painless, and super quick. I will definitely be back to see what other services they offer! Love this place!

16.description: I came to True Skin for laser hair removal and was pleasantly surprised with how quick and easy the treatment is. I had also read reviews that hair removal hurts like hell and could leave red marks for days or weeks (or even months!)... so when I expressed my concerns, the specialist, Jen Casey, told me we would customize the treatment for me and ensure we do test patches so I wouldn't leave there with a giant red fu manchu. My specialist Jen is super friendly and professional, and she made me feel comfortable getting hair removed from ALL the embarrassing parts of me. I've only been in for one treatment, so I'm not sure how effective the laser itself is, but I have started to see hairs already falling out, so I'm feeling very positive about the results. Thanks Jen!

17.description: Sorry guys, my laser hair removal didn't work.  Not sure if it's the lasers they use or the staff's technique (the woman treating me seemed kinda inexperienced) but I saw almost no results.  (On the plus side, the office itself is very nice and you do feel a bit pampered.)I might have written this off to "well laser hair removal just doesn't work on me" but:a) I am a perfect candidate (dark hair, light skin) andb) I tried going to a different salon and I've had TERRIFIC results there - so much so that I've purchased two additional packages for two more areas after seeing the great results from my first one.So I cannot recommend True for laser hair removal.

10.description: I have been working with Joanie for the last year.  I am still in shock at how much she has changed my skin!!!  She is a miracle worker.  She understands skin like no one else.  I have struggled with my skin all my life.  After one visit, Joanie changed my skin for the better.  Ever visit since, the Improvements are astonishing.  I laugh when I wake up in the morning as I am no longer horrified.  And I go out of the house without make up on frequently.   Joanie changed my skin but also my life.   She knows what she is doing, she is a ton of fun to work with and she is a perfectionist.  I am so grateful for her!!!! Go see her.  Best decision of my life.

11.description: I come here for laser hair and I love it! Staff is very friendly and welcoming. It is also very easy to schedule and change appointments. I see Jen Casey, an aesthetician, for my laser treatments and she is really great. She is very friendly and professional. She is very open to answer any questions you make have. She makes sure you are as comfortable as possible and explains everything. She is patient and tries to make it as pain free as possible. Definitely ask for her! I have had 5 treatments so far, and have seen a noticeable reduction in hair growth. I definitely recommend this place!

26.description: I'm getting married in 6 months and wanted to try laser hair removal for my underarms so I didn't have to worry about razor burn with my strapless dress. True Skin Care Center is one of the only places in Chicago with the new machine, The Duet. I've had a few treatments and it's definitely working. The best part-- hardly felt a thing! I've heard horror stories from friends about their laser hair removal experiences with other machines. My underarms only took about 4 minutes each time and Kaitlin, the esthetician, was so nice! Can't wait for the finished results! P.S. I've had the Intraceuticals Oxygen Facial (and their other oxygen facial) and it's a to-die-for glow! Definitely worth checking out for any event you have coming up!

27.description: Everyone at True is very friendly and knows exactly what they are talking about when it comes to skincare!  I have had the chance to work with most of the staff, and they are very passionate about what they do!

0.description: I just had an appointment for LHR with Meaghan, and it was amazing. They were so thorough, sensitive, detailed, and concerned from beginning to end. They took the extra time necessary to make an effective and grouch treatment and have me great recommendations to make the most of my sessions. I can't imagine getting laser anywhere better.

20.description: I bought a groupon for laser hair removal last winter and I did three treatments at True Skin Care.  At the time, they offered me a discounted rate to extend my treatments, but I had already bought a groupon for 3 treatments at another facility so I declined.  I wish I had now!  I felt completely at ease at True, and the Duet definitely is the best machine out there.  The other place I was at could not even compare the results I got from the first three sessions at True.  The only downside for me was getting there.  I live in Boystown, so I either have to drive (and parking can be a little bit of a nightmare) or take the L.  But the actual service and results were spectacular.

19.description: I bought a groupon for laser hair removal last winter and I did three treatments at True Skin Care.  At the time, they offered me a discounted rate to extend my treatments, but I had already bought a groupon for 3 treatments at another facility so I declined.  I wish I had now!  I felt completely at ease at True, and the Duet definitely is the best machine out there.  The other place I was at could not even compare the results I got from the first three sessions at True.  The only downside for me was getting there.  I live in Boystown, so I either have to drive (and parking can be a little bit of a nightmare) or take the L.  But the actual service and results were spectacular.

2.description: I found out about True Skin care through Groupon.  I purchased a deal for a facial and made an appointment.  I made sure to arrive early but ended up arriving late because I got lost trying to find this office location.  If you come here, I suggest going up to Macy's and then find another elevator to take to the 9th floor and then locate the suite. There is no elevator from the ground floor that will take you to this office (at least not one I could find). Good luck!When I came, I had Gigi as my aesthetician. The room was set up to be very relaxing. As Gigi put facial products on my skin, one of the products started to really burn and tingle on my face. When I expressed this problem to Gigi, she was quick to remove the product from my skin. I'm not sure what products they use here but that was the first time I've ever had that happen to me while I had a facial (and I've had a lot of facials). The rest of the facial was pleasant. They did not try to sell me any products (thankfully).

18.description: This place is fantastic for laser hair removal!   I've been to other places and tried different lasers, but have gotten great results from Jen at True Skin Care.   She is gentle and very professional.   She makes the appointment as pleasant as laser hair removal can be.....with her wonderfiul personality, and efficient manner.   I keep going back to her because she is really knowledgeable, and really takes her time.  The office always does a great job with scheduling ahead, and confirming the appointments.  Ask to schedule with Jen....you'll be happy!

13.description: Very impressive!I purchased a Groupon for three Laser Treatments for $180 without knowing anything about True Skin (couldn't resist that deal) ... and I was delighted by how great my entire experience was. The staff was VERY friendly, my appointment was taken early, and I felt really comfortable during the entire session. I've never done laser hair removal before and was a bit nervous - but Terri patiently answered my questions and was extremely thorough with the details of the procedure. After 15 minutes of talking with Kaitlin, I decided I first wanted to test a small area to see if I'd have an adverse reaction - and come back in a few weeks to finish during a second appointment. Kaitlyn was completely patient and nice about my decision, and she didn't charge me anything for the consultation and trial (even though I was supposed to forfeit one of three treatments)! The laser hair removal itself was almost painless, and super quick. I will definitely be back to see what other services they offer! Love this place!

4.description: I bought a Bloomspot certificate for a Brazilian wax here.  Staff is friendly and the office is very comfortable and accommodating.  I cannot remember the name of esthetician, but she was pleasant and personable.  She did the job with precision and ease. But the one thing I noticed that bothered me was that she DOUBLE DIPPED her sticks, which is a big no-no in the waxing world!When I got home, I realized there were tiny patches of long hair in multiple areas that she forgot to wax off. For a place that typically charges $65 for a Brazilian wax, this is inexcusable.  I'm happy I had a coupon or else I would have been very upset.  Needless to say, I'll never come back nor recommend this place for waxing to anyone.  I'll stick to my usual spot where every strand of hair that could be waxed is taken off and my esthetician never double dips.

24.description: I've been here twice for facials with Kaitlyn and both experiences were excellent. She is very knowledgeable and is great at explaining the different treatments and she does not push you into buying products like a lot of spas and salons do.

6.description: I come here for my laser hair removal! I have seen 2 of the aestheticians here they were both great and both made me feel comfortable.  As comfortable as it can get for a brazillian at least.  Of the two, I now request Jen! I feel like she is more thorough in the procedure and she takes her time.  It has been more than 6 treatments for me but it is expected. I've done other areas of my body (at other med spas or dr.'s) that also took more than 6 treatments before the hair was gone.All in all, I don't mind coming in to get my girl parts painfully shot at. First, because I know Jen is Great! Secondly, because it feels like your about to be pampered when you walk in, and finally, because I don't think I've had to wait more than 5 minutes for my appointment. They even fit me in when there was a small schedule mix up.

22.description: As promised, an update after three treatments: The laser is working EXTREMELY well, much better than the older-style laser that another medspa used on my armpits. Even though the hair on my armpits is darker than on my bikini line and should therefore respond better, the Duet after two treatments achieved the same reduction as the regular laser after five. And now that the settings have been ratcheted up, I'm even more grateful that the Duet is less painful, because these higher settings would really be torture with a regular laser. Kaitlin also continues to be super-nice and conscientious.

15.description: I come here for laser hair treatments and it is fantastic. The staff is lovely and very accommodating.  I work directly with Jen Casey, an esthetician. She is very friendly and great at her job.I checked out a handful of places before I chose True Skin Care.  All the others were very aggressive with their sales tactics and several of them tried to make me book my appointments on the spot. Then I went to True Skin (which is in a doctor's office) and met Jen who was extremely patient, calm, realistic and did not make a high pressure sales pitch. I felt infinitely more comfortable with True Skin than any of the med-spas. And I was ok with paying a little bit extra for the benefit/peace of mind of doing laser in a plastic surgeon's office rather than via a groupon deal.  If you are thinking about doing laser hair treatments but are a little paranoid about wrecking your skin (as I am), go and find Jen at True Skin, she is the best. I also got a light peel from her a few weeks ago and my skin looked incredible (with no down time).

7.description: Went here for my 1st laser treatment with Jen Casey, an aesthetician. She is very friendly and personable. She answered all my questions and my appt went really fast. The entire staff was very friendly and professional as well. Excited to go back next month for my 2nd treatment. Also added on a facial to my appt b/c everything was great on my 1st appt. Tip: Take advantage of the $99 monthly special

8.description: Going to see Jen Casey is like catching up with an old college friend.  A Groupon for laser hair removal introduced me to True Skin Med Spa a little over a year ago.  There are 6-8 weeks between every appointment and each time I go, I'm trying to remember "What did we talk about last time?"  We exchange updates and advice about what's going on since our last visit, including any new restaurants we've tried around Chicago.  I know it's weird, but I feel like I've made a friend at this place.  That's not normal customer service.Over the past year, there have been two scheduling snafu's, both of which were handled very well by the front desk staff.  One time, I missed an appointment due to travel that put my watch in a different time zone.  The front desk staff was able to book me for another appointment the same week, so as not to throw off my treatment schedule.  The other scheduling snafu had to do with an equipment problem with the laser, so they rescheduled me and comped me a treatment to make up for their cancellation.  Considering I have been there 8 or 10 times, that's a pretty good track record.These people treat you well.  They know how to run their business.  And they know how to keep good people, which speaks to good management at the top.  I'm glad I found Jen and True Skin.  Highly recommended.

3.description: I found out about this group from Groupon.  I went in for laser hair removal and was thrilled with Kaitlin.  A year later, and I am still going and adding more services.  I recommend Kaitlin to all of my friends who are interested in laser treatments.

14.description: I went into this appointment looking to get a wax from Annie (who is fantastic by the way--so cute and personable). Annie and I got to talking and she suggested I go through with laser treatments. I was a bit apprehensive about the procedure and expense at first but Annie sold me on how this investment would pay off financially and with longer results. She told me everything that was going to happen before it happened, easing my comfort level with the procedure. With only one treatment of laser on my armpits---I honestly haven't shaved in weeks. I can't believe how slow the growth has been and can't wait to do another treatment! I think I will even start with other parts of the body (my upper lip is a pain!). So happy to have met Annie because I would have never in a million years thought this would something I would invest in before meeting her. Such a sweetheart; so professional. Overall this place is really swanky, up in Water Tower so I thought the prices would be outrageous but it was actually quite reasonable for treatment that was high quality.

3.description: For several years now, when I'm downtown Chicago I've had superb service at Windy City.  Staff is extra helpful.  Rooms are ultra clean and ambiance is pleasant or they will come to you (I used to have them come to my boat!).  Most importantly the staff of massage therapists are consistently the best I've had and I have tried many different places and therapists.  I highly recommend Windy City, you can't go wrong.  Prices are moderate for what this is...downtown Chicago massage.

1.description: Sometimes you don't realize how badly you need a massage until you're on the table and someone begins to work their magic on your body. Sometimes getting a massage can dramatically change your mood and help you think more clearly on the other side. Sometimes you are so blissed out that you can barely remember what you were worried about on your way in.John was my masseuse and was a true professional at body work, and knew how to problem solve my ache and pains in ways that no other massage had done before. His techniques proved that he had a knack for working out sore muscle with a strength matched with a tenderness that made this experience worth every penny.This was the best massage I have received in years and sent me on my was as a different person then when I arrived. The effects were so deep that it felt like I had just left an acupuncture session. I went on with my day feeling like regardless of what came my way, it was ok because I had just been brought back to my own center of sanity and peace! Any time I come to Chicago I'm coming back here for a massage. Great facility, great staff, and worth the price!

2.description: I never new how much massage helped until I received one from the awesome staff here. Way to go Windy City!

9.description: I received a gift certificate for an in-home massage from Windy City Massage (with a recommendation for Bebe).  This was the first time I've had an in-home massage and was looking forward to not driving to or from the salon.Bebe showed up promptly at the scheduled time, talked to me about what I needed while setting up the table, sheets and music.  She was amazing!!!  Very professional and focused on the areas/issues we had discussed.  I highly recommend an in-home massage with Bebe and look forward to my next appointment!

10.description: very solid massage. i had kyle as my massage therapist, and he was great. i live downtown, and it's very convenient to just have them come to your place (with a foldable roll-in massage table). at the same time WCM is not the cheapest. and they sometimes do not return calls / messages.if you seek better quality and value, try millennium park massage!

4.description: $120 for a mani pedi... They've got jokes

6.description: I get massages all over the world Thailand, Europe, the states. This was the BEST massage I've  gotten in the states. Zana is her name I recommend her she reads your body like an open book. Very well spoken and 20+ years experience. I can't  believe how reenergized  I feel. 5 stars all the way. I will be sore tomorrow but it was worth it!

12.description: post travel massage a 1 hour flight from the Cleve. totally worth it. First to review? Really? I have utilized Windy City Massage(WCM) since it's start. I come to your most fair city regularly. I wish I lived here. I am a business owner in a service oriented industry. WCM was a small operation at first, As a matter of fact, the owner was the primary massotherapist. I called WCM on a lark, from an ad in the back of Chicago Mag. -Note - it is listed under licensed massage, not some Wang-Bang Hootchie-San massage. After my first massage from her (awesome), I was way impressed. (I do this often... ... get a massage that is... ) The massotherapist immediately returned my call, gave me concise instructions to order extra sheets from the front desk for the table, and set up a time. Punctual, professional, and very skilled. Since then, the business has grown, but the quality remains. I have recently had WCM service my staff when we were all in town. Pricey, but, well, I have good people... and I also support good people, such as WCM. A study in professionalism, and, in a great business concept. Hats off to you Windy City Massage! -so if your in from out of town, just call them. You won't regret it.Carry on.

5.description: This service uses Westin's spa. I've had massages and facials here before and have always really loved it (on the expensive side, but worth it for quality of service) and they always manage to get me in same day. I had an 80-minute with Zana - called and got in within 2 hours - my shoulder was killing me. She knew exactly what to do with my rotator cuff issue and went above and beyond to get it back to where it needed to be (which was a LOT of work). She always checked in to be sure it wasn't too deep, but I'm all about therapeutic work (as opposed to just relaxation). She even showed me a few stretches to do to relieve problem areas. I will definitely ask for her again and would recommend her to people who really want to get after it for relief.

11.description: A few weeks ago, I was really stressed and decided last minute, on a Friday evening, that a massage was what I needed.  I called Windy City Massage, and surprisingly, they were able to accommodate me.  Within an hour (!) Joe arrived at my home.  He was completely professional and gave me an excellent deep tissue massage.  I could not have been happier!

8.description: This place is great! I had a girl named Roxy do a massage. She was amazing! If you are in downtown area or staying at the hotel, please enjoy this spa/massage. Price was right!

0.description: This review is based off an Outcall Service with massage therapist Leticia. (Hope spelling is correct) She was very professional and did a great job with the massage. My other half received  a 90 min massage from her and it was quite helpful for the lower back tension he was feeling. He said the therapist utilized the time effectively and covered all the areas of focus with in the time allotted. There was a miscommunication with the booking and Tanya sent someone our right away to fix the error and she was very attentive of the situation. Thank you Tanya and Leticia for making our Chicago experience a great one by providing us with exceptional customer service. KUDOS TO YALL!

7.description: Called in this afternoon to request an in-home massage; had an appointment scheduled for several hours later quickly and efficiently. Terra was my therapist and did a fantastic job; all without leaving my living room! Highly, highly recommend. Will be a return customer for sure.

58.description: My boyfriend and I tried the BBQ pork, chicken teriyaki, Kung pao chicken, and spicy Mongolian beef. Our favorites were the BBQ pork and chicken teriyaki. The other two were okay. The baos are pretty filling, but overpriced. I would rather go to Chinatown and get more for your money, but not a bad place for baos when you aren't close to Chinatown.

56.description: When I'm in the mood for a little something different I come here. This location is fast and it's conviently located on the lower level of the water tower. I usually pick up a little something before I shop. Savory wise I normally get the Teriaki Chicken Bao. It's a little on the sweet side and has a good flavor to it. I also enjoy the chocolate bao. Warning though it's messy. It never fails I will take the smallest bite and chocolate just starts oozing out every where. Be prepared with a napkin. They also have combo meals. I've gotten one once and it came with their thai herb broth. Great for a cold winter day and reasonably priced.

29.description: Whenever I'm over here, I have to get my bao fix. They sell them frozen at jewel, but it's just not the same. I love the ginger ale, the pomegranate ginger ale, 8 veg salad, edamame bao, and the broth...I wish I knew how they made that broth.Check it out, they have raised the prices over the years of me coming here, but now you can get on their coupon text list. Yeah, I can be a sucker for a deal, sometimes referred to as "cheap ass", idc!They need to open one in hipster sq or wicker park...

42.description: Teriyaki chicken bowl should be named a rice bowl. Big bowl of rice covered with a very thin layer of sauce with some small chicken pieces in it. Wasn't even enough sauce for the whole bowl of rice. Not worth it.

23.description: I had such high hopes trying Wow Bao for the first time. Whenever I visit Water Tower Place the line is always extensive. So, I finally decided to test the hype. Now, I am a huge lover of anything and everything Asian. I have never tasted more artificial / Americanized Asian food in my life. I was literally on the verge of tears (not really) because the food looked amazing but the tastes seemed like frozen Chinese food. I ordered the Kung Pao Chicken bowl with BBQ pork and Mongolian Beef baos. The only thing I enjoyed was the rice. It was perfectly steamed.All I can say is if you really want to experience a real bao, visit Chinatown. You won't pay such high prices for low quality Chinese food.The reason why this review is not 1 star is because the cashier and cook were so pleasant in attitude.

47.description: I just wanted to grab something small and fast to stave of the hunger for another hour or so. I decided on a chicken curry bao, mongolian beef bao and an original ginger ale(I will never pass up house-made ginger ale).It was decent. The ale alone will get me to return to try other items.

8.description: I had such high hopes trying Wow Bao for the first time. Whenever I visit Water Tower Place the line is always extensive. So, I finally decided to test the hype. Now, I am a huge lover of anything and everything Asian. I have never tasted more artificial / Americanized Asian food in my life. I was literally on the verge of tears (not really) because the food looked amazing but the tastes seemed like frozen Chinese food. I ordered the Kung Pao Chicken bowl with BBQ pork and Mongolian Beef baos. The only thing I enjoyed was the rice. It was perfectly steamed.All I can say is if you really want to experience a real bao, visit Chinatown. You won't pay such high prices for low quality Chinese food.The reason why this review is not 1 star is because the cashier and cook were so pleasant in attitude.

31.description: Yummy rice bowls (Thai Curry is my favorite) and the baos are delicious Good service Good location

34.description: WOW!  Amazingly good.  This is the best fast food ever....if you want to call it fast food.  Everything here is good, so I don't have to give a long review.Definitely need to try the pomegranate ginger ale.

16.description: One of the many Wow Bao locations, this particular one right inside the Water Tower entrance is convenient and quick.  It's small, but still has all the same goodies, so it's also efficient (not that such a thing matters much for your food-tasting pleasure).I recommend trying the Mongolian Beef and Kung Pao Chicken.  The BBQ pork is also pretty good, but easy to get at any place that serves bao.  I'm always curious about the desert bao, but haven't yet gotten the courage to try them, instead preferring to fill up on the meat ones.

13.description: I was intrigued by the modern take to traditional baos and stopped here for a quick snack. My friends and I shared a terriyaki chicken bao, bbq pork bao, and chicken dumplings. To be honest, I wasn't expecting much grabbing a quick snack at a mall, but I was surprised how tasty the little baos and dumplings were. This is definitely a good place to stop if you're on the go or in search of a fulfilling snack.

11.description: Stopped in on a whim as the wife and I were taking a walk down Michigan ave. We enjoy Baos but were pretty full at the moment. Luckily they have 6 packs of frozen ones to go. Not only that but they had a variety pack. It was perfect as we got our dinner taken care of. The frozen ones are a breeze to cook and still taste great. Just a few minutes in the micro with a wet paper towel on top.  One interesting tidbit about this location. You pay via these automatic ordering kiosks. You pick what you want and it gives you a ticket with your order number. Then when your order is called you pick it up and leave Great for if you want bao but don't want to talk to anyone. euroatheart.com

39.description: I thought their teriyaki chicken was unimpressive. It was like teriyaki stew poured over rice.

37.description: NOMS! Had their ground beef and dessert baos. Delicious! Their service is slow. But mine was hot and fresh. Great for when you're shopping and starving. Quick and easy bite to grab!

0.description: Wow Bao is located in the Water Tower Place on Michigan Avenue. They have hot asian steam buns (bao) made fresh. These are smaller than the size I usually see at the asian markets. I would say that Wow Bao's size is equivalent to that of a standard cup cake. It fits nicely in the palm. We ended getting a six-pack just because I could seriously finish one in three bites. And I did...These come in various flavors but my favorite by far is the Thai Curry Chicken (top right). It tastes like curry in a ball...which is pretty much what it is. It's not spicy at all but the curry flavor packed inside is strong enough that it isn't masked by bun. My second favorite is the Spicy Mongolian Beef (bottom right). The is a bit spicier, and the flavor here is also strong enough that the bun doesn't take away from the taste.

38.description: Wow to the Bao! My first time going to Wow Bao was in the year 2004. I was hanging out with friends at Water Tower, trying to decide what to have for lunch= McDonalds or Wow Bao. Looking back I'm glad we went to Wow Bao. Ever since then I tried almost every freshly steamed, savory asian bun they offered!

51.description: The food is ridiculous!!! Very very very bad taste. Totally different with real Asian foods! The price is unreasonable! One little Bao costs 2 dollars! The Bowl is as tiny as you can imagine! The rice is raw! I had a very tough experience with it! 22 dollars for my lunch, I ate nothing but trash!

27.description: It's Americanized Chinese bao. Subpar in every way. If you really want to try good Chinese bao, go to Chinatown. The concept is interesting though.

32.description: I was intrigued by the modern take to traditional baos and stopped here for a quick snack. My friends and I shared a terriyaki chicken bao, bbq pork bao, and chicken dumplings. To be honest, I wasn't expecting much grabbing a quick snack at a mall, but I was surprised how tasty the little baos and dumplings were. This is definitely a good place to stop if you're on the go or in search of a fulfilling snack.

54.description: Absolutely amazing.Thai Chicken Curry was the BEST. Like coconut? Go for the coconut custard. SO yummy. Pomegranate ginger ale was so delicious.Take me back!!!

48.description: Great for a quick bite while strolling through Chicago. The pork buns were pretty good. My favorite was the chicken teriyaki.

44.description: Great place to go to for a quick snack or food on the go.  Also great for people who love spicey foods and are coming up with a cold.  All their fillings for their Baos and dumplings are all ginger based, so they're spicey. They also serve bowls and soups which I never got around to.The place is the first thing you see in the water tower lobby coming in from Michigan.  It doesn't look like they have settings Cuz it's in the main lobby, but they have seatings reserved on second floor up the escalator.Went with the Spicey Mongolian beef and Kung Pao Chicken Baos with Thai Broth.  All three are somewhat spicey, but if u can take medium at Buffalo Wild Wings you can scarf these Baos down easily.Overall great snack

24.description: We were at Water Tower, and we've seen all the positive reviews here on Yelp, so we decided to give it a try.  We tried the bbq pork, teriyaki chicken & the spicy kung pao chicken.  The baos are small and snack size, which is probably convenient when walking around a mall.  But I'm used to the bigger boas you get at dim sum.  At least the boas here were priced accordingly.  Taste wise, they were good.  Nothing special, but not bad.  The teriyaki chicken was good, not too sweet.  The spicy kung pao chicken wasn't really all that spicy, and I don't really go for spicy foods, so it's not like I have a low tolerance for spicy foods.  Of the 3 I like the bbq pork the best.  I would eat there again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do it.

7.description: Wow bao is a tiny tuck shop like establishment that sells baos (Chinese buns), rice, noodles, salad and even quinoa with curries and stir fries. Soups are also available and their own brewed ginger bee available in a plain and pomegranate flavour.The food is cheap and delicious. And good after a day before shopping or substantial enough before.tpure out shopping at mag mile. I had the sticky kung pao chicken with rice and the kung pao chicken. Both delicious. Definitely going back

49.description: Some great quick eats while shopping in water tower place!  The chicken noodle soup was really good as were the steamed buns!

40.description: I have worked across the street for a long time but only recently tried Wow Bao.  The bbq pork bun blew my mind! I did not know what to expect when a friend described the dumpling with pulled pork in it.  I'm a sucker for anything pulled pork related so I got one just as a snack. It was fast service, the food was served quickly, and in the end it was delicious.  The only thing is I wish they had more seating.  There is some if you go up the escalator to the second floor.

53.description: I was out Christmas shopping and about to head on the L back home so I decided to grab a pork bao to go. The place is in Water Tower place in the entrance so I thought it would be a quick stop since it's not really a restaurant, but a stand. I had to wait 10 minutes for it! But I have to say this was the best dumpling I've had and I can be really picky with dumplings.

30.description: Ordered the spicy mongolian beef bao. Cheap and yummy sustenance during a long day of shopping. Definitely recommend if you're hungry but aren't ready for a huge meal. They offer quick service and it's in a great location.

46.description: Ah, it was ok. stopped by for some pork buns and chicken buns before heading to the 360 observatory.  I like the chicken teriyaki the best.

1.description: I'm a fan of anything that's business model relies on those pillowy buns of goodness AKA "baos" This is in the Water Tower right next to Macy's/Lush. The cool thing is that the baos are served incredibly fast--even if there's a line. There's also a kiosk where you can bypass the line and use a credit/debit card to order. The only reason for not a perfect 5-star rating is because I don't like all of their flavors. I've noticed that some are really delicious and some are just okay, so it's really hard to know what to pick . The Thai Chicken Curry was a little bland, but the Spicy Kung Pao Chicken was fannntastic. The two ladies working were very efficient and got our baos out within a few minutes.

55.description: This cute little bao shop has a great assortment of baos. We actually went here 3 days straight to order something. We ordered the mongolian beef, curry chicken, kung pao chicken, bbq pork, and chocolate. The mongolian and kung pao are my favorites, they have great flavor and have a nice kick to it.

9.description: I went to her and asked for a baozi chicken curry! I'm in love with this flavor !!! It is exactly the taste of china baozi !!! the dough is incredibly soft and delicious as well as the ones I ate in China !!!

26.description: Love all wow bao locations, these are incredible and even better when you just want to grab a quick bite to eat and fill up-be warned that these fluffy dough like drops are a lot more filling than you would think, I definitely over ordered my first time not that it was a problem! I have been back many times and always leave satisfied

25.description: One of the many Wow Bao locations, this particular one right inside the Water Tower entrance is convenient and quick.  It's small, but still has all the same goodies, so it's also efficient (not that such a thing matters much for your food-tasting pleasure).I recommend trying the Mongolian Beef and Kung Pao Chicken.  The BBQ pork is also pretty good, but easy to get at any place that serves bao.  I'm always curious about the desert bao, but haven't yet gotten the courage to try them, instead preferring to fill up on the meat ones.

12.description: Ah yes, Wow Bao. This is part of the reason why I keep visiting Water Tower Place after all these years. It's conveniently located on the first floor/foyer area, so it's easy to pop in and out. Not so convenient, their seating is up a staircase, so be prepared to carry your food up if you're dining in. Wow Bao is really reasonably priced. The bao (steamed dumplings) are only $1.89 a piece. How can that be beat? My girlfriend and I had lunch plans elsewhere,  so we only got a quick bite here. I ordered a chicken teriyaki bao, and a coconut custard one ($1.89). She ordered a chicken teriyaki bao, a five-piece order of chicken potstickers with soy ginger sauce ($4.69), and a homemade pomegranate ginger ale ($2.69). The bao (baos?) were delicious. The outside is fluffy and soft, and the inside is full of flavor. The chicken teriyaki filling is sweet,with just the right amount of spice. The coconut custard one was a bit too sweet for my liking, but I'd order it again. The best thing we ordered was actually the potstickers. I've been to Wow Bao a number of times but had never tried them, until she ordered them. They were super flavorful and well cooked, the outside was just the right amount of soft and a little chewy. The dipping sauce complemented them perfectly. The pop was pretty delicious too. If you're torn between the original and pomegranate, definitely go for the pomegranate. This is a great little place for lunch on the go, that delivers great food and flavors for a tiny cost.

59.description: Love the service. Always friendly. I am willing to swim through the sea of blind, idiot tourists that gather out front just to get a hold of one of their soft, warm carb and meat filled balls. Seriously what more can you ask for? Two of the greatest things God created on the 3rd and 7th day (bread and meat respectively) perfectly blended together, under the same principles rivaling that of our solar-system, achieving palate-blowing homeostasis. Meals on plates and sandwiches are sloppy and is a two-handed chore. This architectural ingenuity conveniently packs the meat (seasoned with Asian awesomeness) in a one-handed, two fingered cuisine that would make Frank Lloyd Wright and Leonardo da Vinci roll over in their graves. The history behind this Pritzker Award deserving concept roots back to the Chinese being brought over to America for plantation labor. They needed a quick, on-the-go meal. Though plantations today are arguably gone, our fast-paced lives still demand the on-the-go meal and should be a staple to any business man or soccer mom today.

21.description: Service is very quick. Definitely one of my favorites for a fast lunch. I loved the teriyaki chicken bao.

17.description: Before we started some shopping in the mall, we decided to get a snack at Wow Bao, which was located just past the entrance.  The menu consisted of savory and sweet steamed baos, steam dumplings, rice and noodle bowls and salads.  With Bao in its name, baos was what we were going to try.  The savory filling choices included spicy kung pao chicken, whole wheat edaname, teriyaki chicken, Thai curry chicken, spicy Mongolian beef and bbq pork. Coconut custard and chocolate were the sweet options.We opted for the Thai curry chicken and bbq pork.  After placing our order, we were told that there would be about a ten minute wait for the Thai curry chicken as they were being steamed. We opted to wait as this was an interesting filling for a bao.  After getting our order, we took it up to second floor where Wow Bao has tables for its customers to enjoy their food. The Thai curry chicken filling was tasty and the BBQ pork was ok as I've had tastier ones.  At $1.79 each and the size of the baos, I would say they are pricey considering BBQ pork buns that are larger can be had for $.75 each.
