I could have eaten two for a satisfying snack. Overall, friendly staff and unique choice for the bao filling. Just felt at $1.79 each, it was pricey for these small baos.

10.description: Great food! I liked the different bowls and gyoza. The pomegranate tea is ok, but kinda watery. This place is good for a quick Asian snack when you're on a business trip or something similar. The price is a bit much for the size, about $7 for a middle size bowl of rice, but still good. I'd recommend it to anyone who needs relatively cheap and good Asian food.

5.description: I was feeling under the weather during my business trip in Chicago and quickly ran out to grab a bite to eat.  I stumbled upon Wow Bao and the menu was just what I was looking for.  I ordered the broth, steamed dumplings, and a pomegranate ginger ale to go.  The service was very friendly, the food came out quickly and it was reasonably priced.

3.description: The baos are good but are too small. You need to buy 6 to be full. Obviously a rookie mistake for me! :p

35.description: Simple, cheap and delicious. Order at a kiosk for even speedier service. The bao are delicious and the Thai herb broth is the perfect remedy for the chills. Ginger ale is made on site and tastes unique and spicy - if you're looking for Canada Dry, avoid! Will be back for a quick handheld meal on the go.

19.description: Calling the venture capital industry!Wow Bao is a great local chain that really needs to expand nationally.It's got several advantages over that chain I love to hate, Shake Shack.Advantage One: char siu bao and potstickers, WB's signature fare, are fairly unique in the fast food space. Panda Express serves one potsticker and no bao, and Panda's really the only national Chinese chain. Shake Shack is in a *very* crowded field; there is no shortage of burger joints.Advantage Two: inexpensive, tasty food. Shake Shack's food may be tasty but it ain't cheap.Advantage Three: because WB isn't representing itself as gourmet fare, its supply chain is much simpler. Any town big enough to hold a fast food joint also has foodservice suppliers. If they went national they'd clean up.

28.description: 凑合吧，包子肯定不是手工做的，从样子和里面的馅来看肯定是工厂批量大生产之后冷冻的。吃起来还凑合，但是肯定不是正宗的中国北方大包子。。。。。。

45.description: Absolutely amazing! This is my first time eating a Bao and I wish I lived in Chicago so I can eat more. My mom and I ate here when shopping on Michigan Ave. We got one Kung pou chicken bao each. They were so soft and fuffy. When I took the first bite I was in love ! The Kung pou chicken was delicious. We actually liked it so much we went down and got more. We also got to try the coconut custard bao and it was delicious as well. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone going to Chicago.

33.description: Very tasty bao and chicken herbs broth. However just acknowledge that the combo of 2 baos and the herbs broth is more expensive than separate buy. Is that a cheat?

43.description: Wow!  Delicious bbq pork buns!!!I will go back!It is a bit of a long walk to the far end of Michfan Ave by it is totally worth it. I wish I could go there more often!!!

2.description: Interesting concept, but execution is meh and I don't think they're really worth the price.Cha siu baos are one of my favorite things on this planet, but for all the hype, Wow Bao's are just OK, especially since Chicago has a Chinatown right down the street. The other, more creative "baos" also taste pretty good (thai curry gets my thumbs up), but again, I wasn't impressed for the price I paid for them. Usually at dim sum places, I can get 3 Baos for less than $4 - here, they were $2 for each individual bao, and these baos weren't even particularly big! Even for Mag Mile standards, I don't think the price difference should be that much. TL;DR: Good flavor and taste, but not really worth the steep price. It is an interesting concept with a cute storefront, though.

18.description: WOW!  Amazingly good.  This is the best fast food ever....if you want to call it fast food.  Everything here is good, so I don't have to give a long review.Definitely need to try the pomegranate ginger ale.

41.description: Overpriced at $6.49 for Bao combo.   This place has zombies working behind the counter.  The Baos are basically bad dim sum!

52.description: Bizarre to find this spot in #Chicago's #WaterTowerPlace right at the formal entryway. Steamed, healthy options. The Lemonade is pretty good too. There are chairs n small tables on the floor above to grind at baby girl...

50.description: I had the thai curry. Wasn't that good to me, but then again I have much exposure to asian food.

4.description: Not a meal, but a great snack. Wanted to try this many trips ago with my travel companions were never interested. Everything tastes fresh and delicious. Very inexpensive. There is seating upstairs. Love it.

6.description: 5/5/2015 first time there and very interesting concept...we had to check it out given how popular this chef was...and not being from the area, we wanted to get a taste of something we didn't have back in Cali. the food was not something I'd write home about...but I did like the fact it was convenient and fast. Next time I'm back in Chicago, I'll give it another try.

22.description: When I come to Chicago, my family and I stop here at Wow Bao located at Water Tower place main lobby. We normally buy the Teriaki Chicken or spicy Mongolian Beef. I like the concept of the dough with the meat encased inside. The price ranges fro $1.99 each for one wow bao to $4.99 for a bowl combination. Since I am such on the run, I have yet to taste the bowls. I enjoy the flavor and it is a quick way to kill your hunger on the go.

15.description: When I come to Chicago, my family and I stop here at Wow Bao located at Water Tower place main lobby. We normally buy the Teriaki Chicken or spicy Mongolian Beef. I like the concept of the dough with the meat encased inside. The price ranges fro $1.99 each for one wow bao to $4.99 for a bowl combination. Since I am such on the run, I have yet to taste the bowls. I enjoy the flavor and it is a quick way to kill your hunger on the go.

57.description: My favorite is the thai curry chicken bowl and/or bao. Tried the hot ginger tea for the first time and it was as refreshing and delish as could be. The mongolian beef is great also! Like them on FB and get occasional promos for free bao Wednesdays.

20.description: Solid consistent food! This is my family's Go To take away joint when in a pinch. Delish consistent food ... All the time. Check it out!

36.description: Big fan of this place - if you're looking for a place to get a quick, affordable, and filling bite to eat, this is it. All of their chicken baos are great - I love the thai curry one and the spicy teriyaki. I also have had their soups and thought they were pretty tasty. Great casual place to grab a filling meal - quality ingredients, fast and polite service.

14.description: Yummy rice bowls (Thai Curry is my favorite) and the baos are delicious Good service Good location

58.description: I came here craving something dessert  -- absolutely the worst cheesecake I've ever had. It was completely covered with whipped cream and sickeningly sweet.

56.description: I had to drop the stars down this one time. Our waiter, Nathan, last night was not friendly and it was not received well since we were a large crowd who waited 2 hours and change to be seated and had 3 birthdays. It took forever to get seated which is understandable since we had a large crowd. However when we got called we had to wait another 20-30 minutes for them to get our table ready. Followed by three meals that were incorrect / under cooked. The waiter dropped bread on our table and expected us to still eat it . I ordered the kale salad and the Diane steak which was delicious ( Thank God ). But I just feel like the service could have been much better than it was.

29.description: In terms of value, I think their steak diane and shrimp scampi is the best. I like their avocado egg roll as appetizer.  Their cheesecake is the best that I can find in Chicago but it is bit expensive, though acceptable.

42.description: Situated next to all the hotels and shops of Chicago downtown, along the Magnificent Mile, can't be anything more central. Open all day long, till 12:30 am on Saturdays and Sundays, and always very very packed. We went there twice but never to sit and eat inside, but to place and get to go order. Customers are standing and waiting to be seated in line. They get pagers to know when their table is finally ready. And it can take 15 or even 30 minutes. To my mind the place is not the most delicious or prestigious or anything to spend so much time waiting. Time waiting for to go food is enormous too. And I heard the clients were not very happy with the service. Of course if it's called the "Cheesecake Factory" - their cheesecakes are good. But as for the food on the menu, it's absolutely ordinary and there is nothing to droll that much about, it's a chain restaurant and besides in some other their locations the service is much better. And the prices are a bit above the average there to me for the quality of food they offer. There are tons of different and more interesting and delicious places around there to visit. So if you're coming back late from some event, you can drop by and order a bite to go. May be after 10 pm it's quieter there, but before - better choose something else not to waste your precious time.

23.description: We came into Chicago for a little get away, and made a stop here. It was about 9pm local time, and we didn't think they'd be busy - we were wrong! Even though they were crazy inside and out, they seemed to have a system in place for getting people in and out while having an enjoyable experience. We waited about 40 mins, but the food was worth every minute. The staff was very kind as well. I would highly recommend for large parties or a night out.

47.description: I have been to this particular location many times and have never experienced what happened today.  The hosts at the main desk said our wait for a table for 2 two would be 20 minutes at around 7:30 PM today (Thursday).  We waited and waited and killed some time in the Best Buy right above it.  An HOUR later we finally go into the restaurant and ask what is happening, they reply with oh sorry it'll be less than 10 minutes.  So we stand nearby the host desk for maybe 5 minutes or so and our buzzer goes off.  We handed in our buzzer and half a dozen others were trying to do so too by waving them in the air like a damn concert or something.  They then printed out a ton of slips with party names on them and the corresponding number of menus into piles on the desk in no particular order and random hosts start calling out parties in no particular order. We stood there staring at our ticket for probably 10 minutes...so over an hour and 15 minutes went by JUST TO GET SEATED.

8.description: This is my absolute favorite Cheesecake Factory location- it's the one that I grew up with. The interior is really cool and unique, and it's nostalgic for me. It's always a pleasant treat for me when I get to go there.Like other Cheesecake factories, the menu is huge, and the portions are too. You better come hungry, because the food is ridiculous. It's a little bit pricey, but it's worth it considering you pretty much get two meals out of it. Plus, the honey wheat brown bread is amazing all on its own, and it comes free to the table. The service is always great at this location- they're always working fast and hard, and are always friendly. Most recently, I went with two of my friends. We started with an appetizer, the Parmesan-Garlic Cheese Bread. It was unexpectedly awesome. It was super cheesy and garlicky, and is one of the best garlic breads I've ever had. I'd definitely order it again. One friend ordered the  Grilled Pork Chop with applesauce, mashed potatoes, and spinach. He devoured it, and thought it was exceptional. The other friend ordered the Fried Shrimp Platter, which is the only thing she ever orders there, so she thought it was great. I ordered my favorite Chicken Madeira, which was delicious as always.Naturally, we also ordered cheesecake. Both of my friends ordered Fresh Strawberry cheesecake and really enjoyed it. I got the Mango Key Lime Cheesecake. It was pretty good, but I don't think I'd order it again. It was too tart for me.

31.description: I went this place with my boy friend, and then I fall in love with him and the cake. This was the first cheesecake factory i ever been in chicago. very good memory. and recommend.

34.description: Tried again for my boyfriend's birthday in June. Once again the cake was not ready and they were out of toppings. Maybe I'll just order online or give up next year.

16.description: Moderately priced with huge portions. Tons and tons of choices. Food was really great! Beer menu is slightly limited :/  desserts are also great!

13.description: We were sat by the kitchen, the staff was incredibly loud and distracting.  The waiter was not friendly and there was hair in our food. I felt it was completely over rated and over priced. There are hundreds of better options in Chicago.

11.description: Had just done the hop on hop off tour and this was close to where we got off.  First of all we sat almost in the dark we had to request another table why do they have such dark lighting you need to use a flashlight! We were sat near the window the food is always the same in Cheesecake Factory so you know what to expect ! We had quesadillas and pot stickers to start - delicious- I ordered lunch size pasta carbonara but was still a big portion shared strawberry cheesecake for dessert really good.

39.description: Location: GreatAtmosphere: GoodFood: DecentService: PoorWent on a busy memorial day (evening), yesterday, and was met with slow service, food items that they ran out of, and a waiter that kept telling his customers that they were very busy every time he made an error or had a problem with service/food, etc.  I noticed other customers were getting the same type of poor service as me.  To end the evening on a better note we decided to pay our check and grab a cheesecake on the way out.  We paid our bill and went up to the counter to order cheesecake but were rejected by the staff saying we had to order through our server.  Our server was barely serving us while we were seated, and I was not about to go find him to help me order cheesecake now.  They lost my cheesecake business that night, and all future business at this restaurant chain.Goodbye and good luck Cheesecake Factory!

37.description: Hate the parking, but it is chicago lol. Love this place, great food, good service. I think this location is the only one who knows how to cook. Props to the head chef! I have had many bad experience at other locations. Go here, its worth it :-)

0.description: I love most cheesecakes and desserts at the Cheesecake Factories, but I must say that not everything else on their menu is as good. (There are, of course, a number of bakeries who make better items, but many are harder to find than this chain.) A great food item to get for lunch or dinner is the Herb-Crusted Salmon in lemon sauce with delicious mashed potatoes and asparagus! My mom and I really enjoy this item, and I was surprised to taste something this good here in comparison to other average dishes served here. Most dishes are huge there, but ask your waiter about the sizes and the smaller lunch portions. I've shared a delicious special 30th Anniversary cheesecake/cake and other desserts with 1 or 2 other people after a big meal. I must say that the Chicagoland and Indianapolis locations have pretty much the same quality.Yum, now, excuse me while I go Google chees

38.description: Surprised there was such a long wait at 9pm on a weeknight. That place is huge. Food was pretty average. Cheesecake was yummy. Walked out of there stuffed and even had leftovers. Not sure I would go again besides the fact that it's the only place open late in the area.

51.description: I will never eat here again for the second time I was served sub standard food  at the place

27.description: Came here for dinner with my family and the food was terrible! We had to send back the wings because they were cold and salty. When we ordered our main courses, the quality continued to suffer, pasta was dry and the crusted chicken was soggy! The staff didn't seem to care much about our concern, and the manager though by offering us a free cheese cake would resolve everything! Wow!

32.description: Love Steak Dian. The original cheese cake also very good

54.description: We were downtown for a day and had lunch with the fam. Great food, but really long wait and the hostess could have been better. Overall good but the old orchard location is my favorite.

48.description: Definitely one of the most convenient and amazing places to eat in Chicago. Food is great as always. The service is neither fast nor slow which makes you enjoy your break between the meals. I suggest the pasta choices that include shrimp. The sizes of the meals are big so if you also want to eat a cheesecake you might want to share the main course. I think you should definitely go there if you've never been to one of the Cheesecakes Factories.

44.description: I understand that the cheesecake is great, but we didn't have any. The service was painfully slow, I had an omelet, that was quite mediocre. I asked to have salmon mixed with the omelet. It came on the side. Took forever to get the food and the check. Not a good experience. May just have been our waiter who was inexperienced or mediocre or just didn't give a s#€!. Other guests with a different waiter seems to have better service and experience. Have been here once before for my son's birthday after a ball game, 3 years ago. Packed, loud, but the good and service were great.

24.description: "Atmosphere" is different here than other Factory restaurants as the decor us like being inside a fluffy cheesecake!  Food is complimentary to the other restaurants though. It is always busy...we've dined here quite a bit and never been quoted less than an hour wait time. Chicken and biscuits and original cheesecake with strawberries to finish is highly recommended!

7.description: I'm happy we came, despite the so and so reviews. We went to the 360 Chicago observatory. This place is a next to it, hidden gem in a great location.Perfect place for a romantic dinner or bday celebration. For a Friday night,  there was no waiting for a party of 2. Geat, fast service. Recommend Andrew to be your waiter, very nice and fast. Ordered stuffed tortilla, orange chicken and a piece of cheesecake. We had to take half of the food to go because the portions are generous. Little pricey, but totally an indulgence worth it !!! Food fresh and hot!

49.description: I really do hate writing bad reviews, but this experience irritated me. My family and I are on vacation and this is our first time in Chicago. When we arrived our waiter did get our drinks rapidly, after that it was horrible service. It took about 15-20 minutes to get our order, he brought to the table 8 pieces of bread to a table of 6 people, and our order took more than half an hour. May I add we never received one refill throughout our whole dining experience and this was a early lunch on a Thursday, it was hardly busy. I am a foodie and the food was wonderful, but as far as the service I would be very skeptical to come back.

40.description: The meatball spaghetti was soggy and we have waited 20 minutes longer because the woman on counter took someone else instead lol She never apologized and five teams who came later than us went ahead. Also, the carbonara was served in dirty dish, the sauce was spilled all over the plate. They didn't attempt to wipe it before it's served.

53.description: I'm a fan of CCF, but today was not the best experience. Got to the bar after navigating my way through the lobby of tourists. Sat at the bar and was greeted immediately by the bartender. Order a Titos Vodka with cranberry and a fresh lime. The lime never made it on the glass. No big deal I would survive. Decided on the grilled fish tacos. By this time my glass was empty! Gave the bartender my food order with the hopes that he would notice the empty glass. No such luck today. I give it a few minute more and finally I ask for a refill on the Titos. Again no lime! Fast forward 20 minutes and still no food. I notice a few people who came in after me getting food, so I ask are the tacos coming soon? "yes I sent someone to check on them." the bartender replied as he turn to a passing server and says "hey can you check on grilled fish tacos?". About four minutes later a runner appears with the tacos. I dig into the black beans n rice, and they are luke warm at best. Okay you got me. They were cool at best. I attempted to eat the tacos, which were flavorful and well presented. I picked one up and the tortilla fell apart and the fish was cold. Warning! These tacos had been setting under a heatlamp for sometime getting cold and saturated with moisture. If I had more time I would've waited for them to fix the dish. Unfortunately I was meeting a friend at another location so my quick dinner turned into a "I wish it was a better experience". The bartender sends for the manager and this took forever. Finally he (manager) arrives, but the bartender had left to find him. The who's on second scenario. Long story short I recieved no apology from tha manager and he seemed annoyed that his system that clearly failed me created more work for him. Ad I mentionef I'm a fan of CCF, but I will stick to the suburban locations. They seem to care more.

30.description: Staff is insanely rude and the food is mediocre and overpriced. Save your money and try out the many other options of restaurants near by which are worth the wait

46.description: Terrible wait time. Was told it would be 45 minutes and hour and a half hostess told us 10 more minutes and then sat a table of 5 who just came in. When I questioned it she said they were sitting outside. I would have taken first available. Hostess had no clue!

1.description: Coming from Los Angeles and eating at a couple of CF that are great this was an incredibly disappointing experience. Although the server was very pleasant and polite and just did not seemed as trained as the ones in Los Angeles. One of us orders Salmon that comes with asparagus and it literally was almost refrigerator cold. This now was our second complaint. Our first was two of us ordered pork chops that supposedly came with applesauce when they finally served our plates, staggered mind you, they came without applesauce. After quite a while the waiter came back and when we asked for the applesauce he said he would be right back with it. After another while the manager then comes to tell us they don't have it, in a very nonchalant attitude in top of that the pork chops were very dry. Not sure if they are all like this in Chicago but if your from LA lower your expectations because it will not be the same.

55.description: Holy sh*t, the hostess working last night had the WORST attitude that I have ever come across in my life. Just a suggestion to her, if you hate your job that much...then quit! So rude, not helpful, and rolled her eyes several times when customers were putting in reservations. On the plus side, our waitress was amazing. She really made up for the witch working at the hostess stand.

9.description: I found a black hair in my salad! It was disgusting! When I told the clerk she just apologized! and I could no longer continue to eat after seeing that hair in my food! disappointed!

26.description: Bartenders are not able to talk about or describe their menu. Asked about a beer and was completely different! Not attentive during busy hours and can be hard to get a bar seat because of the number of people they let take it up waiting for a table. Food was relatively quickly prepared. Fries cold, boo!! No one checks in. Better restaurant options close by!

25.description: Very disappointed in the service. We were there thanksgiving weekend . Sunday 11/29 got seated at 1 , ordered our food , my husband and daughter got their meal at 1:30. On the other hand me and my daughter are waiting for our food. The server kept saying its on its way, about 1:50 my daughter who was waiting for her salad , she asked the waiiter if she can get her food , her brought it, meanwhile I'm still waiting for mine, for gods sake all I ordered was salad with salmon. He said the kitchen was busy. Still waiting for the salmon to cook. My husband and my daughter finished their food. I got my food about 2:15 at that time I lost my appetite . The salad and salmon came , the fresh vegetable salad was all lettuce very few vegetables and a very small piece of salmon. Very, very disappointed , will never eat there again. Not worth the money or the service.

12.description: The place is huge, but the seating is kind of cramped. Food is good, huge portions. Avoid ordering too many dishes at once. Service is good and quick too. Pricing is also reasonable.

59.description: Nice place. Bacon~bacon cheeseburger. I've been there couple times with my girlfriend. It gives me surprise every time

21.description: Prepare yourself for this tourist haven.  It's loud, hectic and dark due to the location in a below-grade plaza.  There are times I've gone in here, and the wait was over an hour.  Today, I got right in.  The ambiance is dark, with a distinctive Alice in Wonderland feel to all the curvy columns and bubbly ceiling.The food wasn't bad.  Three mini loaves of bread as a start.  The sweet corn tamale cakes were a nice appetizer.  The lunch special was a little bit of a letdown since they were out of turkey.  The Renee's Special chicken-almond salad sandwich was salty, and the small ciabatta it came on was dry.  The side Caesar salad was fine, and the tomato-shrimp soup was thick and tasty.Our waitress was overwhelmed (aren't they always at big family places like these?), but she was very nice and kept the drinks flowing.

17.description: Got the specialty shrimp pasta. Ugh service is slow but large portions. Pretty much what you expect from this place. Only come here if you have to.

10.description: Love the Cheesecake Factory! Will always go back here. Good service, amazing architecture (even the bathrooms are cool), well located, but overall amazing food. Try the macaroni balls, they are for real life changing, lol.

5.description: Great place for kids and adults as well! The salads are to die for AND the dessert! Our waiter, Chris, is the most patient dealing our table of Girl Scouts! And it's convenient...right in the Hancock!!Go there!0

3.description: Service was so slow! Sat in the bar immediately, which was great. We were there late at 1030pm, yet the kitchen seemed like it couldn't handle the amount of orders or something. For two people, waited 45 minutes for food but it wasn't terribly busy. Manager came up and apologized for the wait even though we didn't complain. Even after telling us it would be 'right out', it still took 10 more minutes. Server was very slow and couldn't multitask well. Food was good as usual though.

35.description: Got the specialty shrimp pasta. Ugh service is slow but large portions. Pretty much what you expect from this place. Only come here if you have to.

19.description: "Atmosphere" is different here than other Factory restaurants as the decor us like being inside a fluffy cheesecake!  Food is complimentary to the other restaurants though. It is always busy...we've dined here quite a bit and never been quoted less than an hour wait time. Chicken and biscuits and original cheesecake with strawberries to finish is highly recommended!

28.description: Love this place so much! It's always been one of my favorites! I usually order the 4 cheese pasta dish, but I decided to go with the eggplant Parmesan this time and it was delicious! Their cheesecakes are also pretty delicious

45.description: Went there Saturday afternoon around 12:30 or so with my cousin as we got massages to relax and hang out for the day - absolutely horrible waitress/service! unfortunately i didnt get her name as i was so mad after waiting about 20 minutes for our drinks and we could barely hear her as it was so loud in there, she wouldn't even try to hear us or speak louder. Since we wanted to try a little bit of everything we ordered 4 apps and she literally scoffed at us and said, "woah!"...as if to food shame us for ordering 2 too many apps for just us two ppl! SO MAD! she never once asked if we needed anything in the meantime, she then took the order of the table next to us and the faces/looks she was giving this mother/daughter was horrible! she took her time in talking and getting food for the other tables in her section but not us. our food came in 2 cycles which was fine however, she never once came to check on us and then when she noticed we weren't eating anymore, she just took our dishes away and we had to flag her down to give us the bill. Worst $55 spent ever; will never come back to this location or any other - food/service has really gone down over the years!

33.description: I came with my son here and had to wait for long hour... Then waitress bring me very dirty tea cup , I had to ask for new one . The food and quality is not bad ..

43.description: Fun date place with literally every kind of food option possible from burritos to burgers to pasta to steak, so it's great for when everyone is craving something different and neither of you want to compromise. The service is ok but nothing special, I usually find that the waiters are doing a lot more running around than actually waiting on people and tend to slack on the extra stuff you might request, like more water, extra dressing or more bread. I've also found that if you're having a more "basic" dinner (meaning no appetizers or fancy drinks) that they tend to really leave you alone and often leave you with empty water glasses. On the flip side, if you both order a drink when you first meet the waiter, they're never going to stop hounding you. I do think the food is pretty good and overall love going, just would like to see the service stepped up a little bit. Big tourist place it seems so expect lots of families with younger kids but overall a win.

2.description: The Cheesecake Factory has always been the ultimate high school date place. Pros: - Obviously the Cheesecake! I'm a fan of all the cheesecakes that incorporate some type of chocolate cake. - The restaurant is huge so the wait is not as long as it may seem when you walk into the place. On a busy Saturday my friend and I only had to wait between 20 to 30 minutes. - The employees, from the waiters to the busboys, here always seem to maintain a positive attitude even when they are obviously swamped with the amount of tables they have to juggle- Depending on what you order you can get a large meal that is probably at minimum two servings for a reasonable price. Cons: - This location it's always packed with tourist so you're always guaranteed to wait no matter the time of date. - If it wasn't for the Cheesecake I don't think anyone over 18 would eat here. The food quality is sub par at best so they give you a serving size that could feed a family of 4. - Due to this location always being so busy you always have a 50/50 chance of your food being cold. My friend and I was excited for our fries to arrive and when they finally did the fries were ice cold. The plate was hotter than everything that I ordered.

18.description: Came to this location right under or on the ground level of the Hancock building.  It was a late Monday night.If you really want to impress someone I would suggest coming to this location as I stated is located under the Hancock.  I came for desert only and got the Reese's Cheesecake.  It was extremely good but also extremely rich.  I should of gotten a glass of milk to go with it.

41.description: Have been to other locations of the Cheesecake Factory and have always been impressed with the wide selection on the menu and of course you need to leave room for dessert-the Godiva cheesecake is divine!!

52.description: I ENJOYED my meal Southern Fried Catfish Meal... it was delicious! We walked in and got a table immediately (1pm on a Thursday) The catfish was meaty and very well compensated. The corn was sweet and buttery. The mashed potatoes chunky and moist. I enjoyed every bite. The margarita was weak but thats ok. Our server Dana was wonderful!! Request her... and shes cute!! Lol...

50.description: I went here on a Saturday night for a dinner date with my girlfriend, and it was just okay.  They sat us upstairs, and I wanted the fish tacos, but couldn't find them on the menu.  We asked if they still had them, and we were moved downstairs, where they have a much bigger menu.  Strange that the menu was so much bigger downstairs.  The bread was a bit stale, which was surprising, since the restaurant was packed.  The fish tacos were okay, but not that flavorful.  The girlfriend had spaghetti and meatballs, which were very good.  The meatballs were among the best I've ever had.  We shared a piece of white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake, which was delicious.  I had a black coffee, which tasted like canned pre-ground coffee, but whatever.  Overall including tip, I spent about $55, which was a little steep for a couple parts being less than great.  However, I would probably go back.  I just feel like there is better food for a better price at a lot of other restaurants.

4.description: Prepare yourself for this tourist haven.  It's loud, hectic and dark due to the location in a below-grade plaza.  There are times I've gone in here, and the wait was over an hour.  Today, I got right in.  The ambiance is dark, with a distinctive Alice in Wonderland feel to all the curvy columns and bubbly ceiling.The food wasn't bad.  Three mini loaves of bread as a start.  The sweet corn tamale cakes were a nice appetizer.  The lunch special was a little bit of a letdown since they were out of turkey.  The Renee's Special chicken-almond salad sandwich was salty, and the small ciabatta it came on was dry.  The side Caesar salad was fine, and the tomato-shrimp soup was thick and tasty.Our waitress was overwhelmed (aren't they always at big family places like these?), but she was very nice and kept the drinks flowing.

6.description: Located on the sunken plaza at the base of the John Hancock Center.  A somewhat dark room, with daylight from windows on the plaza not penetrating far into the labyrinthine interior.  Decoratively a bit unsettling, full of pink, bulgy organic shapes--Jonah might have felt right at home.We arrived around 2:00 on a Sunday afternoon.  The place was crowded to the point of discomfort, but we were handed a pager, and seated within about 20 minutes.  Our server came at once, though the food was then rather slow to be delivered.The menu is typical of the Cheesecake Factory chain:  Lots of variety, most things dependably well-executed, portions probably too damned big.  We ordered a couple of old favorites, and a couple of things new to us:- Taco sampler.  Four different kinds of tacos with four dipping sauces.  Adequate as an appetizer for two, and could serve as a perfectly satisfactory entree for one.- Thai lettuce wraps.  My wife's go-to Cheesecake Factory choice.  Delicious and messy; a few toothpicks might help with some of the structural engineering problems.- Cashew chicken.  Big chunks of sautéed white-meat chicken, cashews, green onions, white and black sesame seeds; rather dry, but what sauce there was, was mildly spicy.  Choice of white or brown rice.  Pretty good, though many Chinese restaurants do this sort of thing better.  Probably not something I'd order again, with so many other dishes waiting to be tried.- Mango Key lime cheesecake.  Our usual favorite from among the large selection of the house's eponymous specialty.Restrooms clean, but at least one of the stalls in the men's room was out of toilet paper; this had not been corrected fifteen minutes after being called to the attention of a server.On all of the bus lines on North Michigan Avenue.  Five blocks from the Chicago Avenue station on the Red Line.

22.description: Located on the sunken plaza at the base of the John Hancock Center.  A somewhat dark room, with daylight from windows on the plaza not penetrating far into the labyrinthine interior.  Decoratively a bit unsettling, full of pink, bulgy organic shapes--Jonah might have felt right at home.We arrived around 2:00 on a Sunday afternoon.  The place was crowded to the point of discomfort, but we were handed a pager, and seated within about 20 minutes.  Our server came at once, though the food was then rather slow to be delivered.The menu is typical of the Cheesecake Factory chain:  Lots of variety, most things dependably well-executed, portions probably too damned big.  We ordered a couple of old favorites, and a couple of things new to us:- Taco sampler.  Four different kinds of tacos with four dipping sauces.  Adequate as an appetizer for two, and could serve as a perfectly satisfactory entree for one.- Thai lettuce wraps.  My wife's go-to Cheesecake Factory choice.  Delicious and messy; a few toothpicks might help with some of the structural engineering problems.- Cashew chicken.  Big chunks of sautéed white-meat chicken, cashews, green onions, white and black sesame seeds; rather dry, but what sauce there was, was mildly spicy.  Choice of white or brown rice.  Pretty good, though many Chinese restaurants do this sort of thing better.  Probably not something I'd order again, with so many other dishes waiting to be tried.- Mango Key lime cheesecake.  Our usual favorite from among the large selection of the house's eponymous specialty.Restrooms clean, but at least one of the stalls in the men's room was out of toilet paper; this had not been corrected fifteen minutes after being called to the attention of a server.On all of the bus lines on North Michigan Avenue.  Five blocks from the Chicago Avenue station on the Red Line.

15.description: Thought it'd be funny to try one out while at this Chicago conference (nothing "wrong" with the brand, per se, but not my thing (you know?))-- joke was on me.It was 62 degrees in there. I had to blow in my hands the entire meal, and spent most of my time looking around at others and commiserating with them while they complained to their 'other/s' about how cold it was. A single tear streaks down my cheek, as I've only got Yelp at this meal.In fact, I need to take a break from typing this to sit on my hands because I'm losing feeling in them.Okay, I'm back-- so what else about this joint?  Highlight comes via the hostess station: these girls is a bunch of sour pusses, for real.  The only time they smile is when they swing through a server station to flirt with a guy or talk trash about the one coworker also seating (possibly manager) who is obviously not like the others. I'll just leave it at that.They clearly lack knowledge about the concept of situational awareness, too. I've seen them give the gasface to at least a dozen families/groups because, I imagine, they're "not sitting down fast enoughjustsitdown,God!"If you work here a few times a week, and stand at a crappy little podium with a map of the joint, you'll likely be more comfy there. Customers, on the other hand, particularly ones that don't frequent the place, want to gauge the light, or whether or not they're sitting under the full blast AC, or are identifying exits, or who knows what but why is your sour little gas face in such a hurry to get back to the podium?  You ain't smilin' or greetin'.You just gasfacin'.And you get paid by the hour, not by the guest (or gasface).Look, the food's good, right?  But I can't imagine ever coming back to this atmosphere.Above comments are completely exclusive of my server, Lauren, who was rad. Although she kept calling me 'sir' when I'm obviously not that kind of customer, made it known, and she must've known anyhow because it was weird EVERY single time. I think this place breeds that sort of weirdness, though, and I encourage her to at the very least be aware it, best case scenario get outta there.

57.description: Cool space. Had soft chicken tacos which was a nice light lunch. Ate at the bar. Bartender was nice and attentive to me. I haven't eaten at one of these spots in quite a while. Extensive menu.

20.description: Love the Cheesecake Factory! Will always go back here. Good service, amazing architecture (even the bathrooms are cool), well located, but overall amazing food. Try the macaroni balls, they are for real life changing, lol.

36.description: Had just done the hop on hop off tour and this was close to where we got off.  First of all we sat almost in the dark we had to request another table why do they have such dark lighting you need to use a flashlight! We were sat near the window the food is always the same in Cheesecake Factory so you know what to expect ! We had quesadillas and pot stickers to start - delicious- I ordered lunch size pasta carbonara but was still a big portion shared strawberry cheesecake for dessert really good.

14.description: Beautiful and tasty cheesecakes everywhere! Really hard to make a choice! :)Nice place to go w friends or family!

12.description: I thought that the woman who painted my nails did a good job. That was the only good thing about my visit. This was an empty and weird members' only kinda place. I had no place there except in between annoying regulars and their annoyingly slow mani pedis.I DO NOT recommend. There's a better place in the basement of the Hancock.

7.description: Given the mixed reviews, and balancing out my desire for high quality but not wanting to overpay for it....I was willing to try the no-frills pedicure at Tran Nail Salon.  I agree whole-heartedly with Marnie S.  She was spot on.  The actual salon is nothing special, but sitting in an awesome massage chair for 40 minutes and walking out of there with one of the best pedicures I've ever had (and I've had quite a few!) for $25 (yes, a pedicure for TWENTY FIVE bucks,)  I'm quite done paying $50, plus tip for my pedicures.  LOVE this place. Oh, one minus, but not a big deal for what you get, it's CASH ONLY.

19.description: for its price, this is the best nail salon in the gold coast. tran is wonderful, warm and does an awesome job.

1.description: I desperately needed a manicure on a Friday afternoon before a rehearsal dinner. I'm from NY so went to Yelp to guide my search. The 3 best rated salons nearby were all booked up so I stumbled into Tran's and at that point didn't bother looking it up, just sat down. Quite possibly the worst manicure I've ever gotten. I won't even get into the atmosphere, which is depressing and unsanitary to say the least. The manicure itself started off ok until my technician put on latex gloves to apply my lotion. She turned her mismatched gloves inside out in an effort I can only imagine is to use them a second time?? Well, the powder coating that's on the inside of the gloves mixed in with the lotion and had an awful granular feeling on my skin. It really grossed me out. No hot towel, just wiped off the excess lotion with a dry wash cloth. The worst part was the nail polish she used. The top coat was clearly ancient (it's too thick and doesn't spread correctly). I knew it was trouble the second I saw it. They also don't have real nail dryers, just asked me to put my hands in front of a tiny fan. I could have blown on my nails with faster results. Sure enough a half hour later, back at my hotel, I look at my hands and the nail polish on my thumbs has been completely smudged, almost wiped off. I immediately return to ask that they fix them and instead of taking off all of the polish on those fingers to redo them, she insists dabbing them with remover and just layering more gooped up polish on top. Needless to say, they all smudged again by the end of the night and I'll be redoing them myself tonight before the wedding. I should also mention that I went with a friend. I was charged $15 for a manicure, she was charged $18 for the exact same thing. Didn't realize the discrepancy until later that night but, wtf? Lesson learned, book an appointment for a better rated salon ahead of time!

2.description: Congratulations, Tran Nail Salon, you are officially the worst nail salon I've ever experienced. The salon is more like a neglected basement, complete with moldy carpet, ancient aquarium, and beaded drapes. Against my better judgement, I proceeded with a manicure. To remove my gel polish, she soaked my ENTIRE hands in hot nail polish remover which burned my hands and the fumes made me light headed. When she trimmed my nails, she gathered the clippings in a paper napkin, then emptied the napkin on the floor... The nasty carpeted floor... Which another woman was walking barefoot across. It was like a nightmare come to life. She did a terrible job evening out the edges of my nails, even after I showed her how my nails were not smooth and catching on fabric. I got out of there as fast as I could. And surprise, surprise: 4 days later and my nails are chipped and broken. Do yourself a favor and spend the $14 on cab fare to take you as far away from this place as possible.

9.description: Hidden gem.  Right across from Bloomingdales.  Very conveniently located near my work which I love!  It's a little hidden as there's some construction going on in front of the building.  My co-worker and I couldn't find it at first and so happy that we kept on looking.  It's downstairs so there's no view but it's very spacious once you get down there - no frills like at a salon/spa but clean.  And ,it  doesn't have that nail salon smell - you all know what I'm talking about!  I'm not a high maintenance person so going to get my nails done is a chore as it is - especially when you have to go so frequently.  At this place, my pedicures last a long time so yay!  I got manicures last time I was there and they were great - lasted longer than any other manicures i've ever gotten by far!As Carson mentioned, they don't use their finger nails to wipe off the polish from your nails which is a plus! Definately recommend this place!

6.description: This place is AWFUL ! I went last week to get a gel fill on a business trip . The nail tech only knew how to do acrylic nails ! So being from out of town I settled . Literally the next day the tips on my French manicure were a yellowish brown .

18.description: Very inexpensive, so I didn't expect very much, but I came out with a better mani/pedi than Mario Tricocci or any other expensive salon!  They do a great job with smoothing out feet, and do an impeccable job with everything else. Would highly recommend Tran and her girls!

10.description: Off the beaten path- across from Bloomie's underground, down a spiral staircase next to the cleaners.  Nice place, great manicure, only downer was that the place is supposed to open at 10, and they weren't around until 10:30.  Fish tank is a bit weird too...1 of the fish is on his last legs (or, ummm, fins), and was in really bad shape, and the gal told me, "oh, it ok, all other look out for him."  Sure, if you say so.  A good manicure nonetheless.  12 bucks.

13.description: There a number of cheap nail salons in the neighborhood, but no one is as good as Tran and her girls. They never leave you with messy nails (I HATE when they just use their nail to get the polish off your cuticles), all their equipment is sterilized after each use, and they have those great spa chairs with the balls inside (I think they're called shiatsu??).Her old location on Oak was better for people watching, but they are still conveniently located right across the street from Bloomingdales on Walton.

16.description: The ladies at Tran Nails are amazing! I get weekly manicures and pedicures and have been going to Tran's for the past 5 years. I have tried several other nail salons in Chicago and I've never found a better place! Their painting is extremely precise - my fingers and toes always look perfect and my pedicure usually lasts a full 2 weeks without showing wear! If you need a mani/pedi in Chicago - Tran's is the place to go! One note - they are located in the downstairs of a large apartment building on Walton and are sometimes a little hard to find for people who've never been there. They are located directly across the street from the Walton Street entrance to Bloomingdales.

17.description: I have been going to Tran and her girls for over 10 years because they have THE BEST prices for THE BEST manicures and pedis. There is no reason to go to any other salon in the neighborhood. Why go to those brand name salons when you can get better, for less and contribute to a small biz owner? I have been to every salon in the hood..none is better. So much so that I even had my wedding day nails done by Tran. Yes you may see a lot of regulars, especially on a Sat. That is for a reason...but don't feel excluded just jump in the conversation--really none of us know each other well,we all just come to Tran.

15.description: I suggest giving this place a try if you like quality, budget prices and friendly service. Everyone is nice and very professional. I've gone all over the Gold Coast  and this place gives the best pedicues by far. I wish it weren't downstairs because it lacks windows but that's the ONLY drawback. GO THERE!!

0.description: I came here on a Sunday of a holiday weekend over the summer and there was only one lady working, but she said that this was because all the other girls deserved a weekend off.  She was extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  She fixed up a broken nail for me that stayed fixed for at least 2 weeks!  Amazing! It's hard to find a salon that is open on Sunday, and this did the trick.  It's not in a convenient location for me or I would definitely be a regular.

5.description: Inexpensive for Gold Coast..but also get what you pay for. The technician spent a fair amount of time, and did an okay job..but the gel choices are super limited. The owner argued with me and my color choice basically telling me they didn't make opaque no-chip colors! It doesn't even look like there's paint on my nails now. So pretty unimpressed and kind of pissed I had to even pay.Speaking of payment - no credit cards. So be forewarned.

11.description: I made appointments for myself and my bridal party for the day before my wedding.  Knowing they had 7 people to get done they still only had 3 people working so one of my bridesmaids ended up not getting hers done at all.  I also had to point out to the woman doing my nails that she missed a spot on my nail for the gel and had I paid more attention to her work I would have noticed that most of my nails were not fully done.  When I got my pedicure the water was so hot my legs were bright red and she never added cold water when I told her it was too hot.  Then when I got up on my wedding day one of my nails was broken, I still have no clue how you break a Gel nail in less than 24 hours.  When I called to have it fixed they were not open and I ended up going somewhere else to get it fixed.Although the prices were good by Chicago standards I would not return or recommend this salon to anyone.

8.description: What attracted me to visit this place, was their $14 dollar manicure, which I should have done. Instead, I got the shellac, which has been the worst experience ever! I have done it four times before (in Miami), so I am kind of familiar with the process, and I can say it was the very 1st time they did it. I believe they think that the only difference between a regular manicure and shellac is using a different enamel, which is not. Long story short:1.  They scratched all (literally ALL) my nails with a cuticle machine, they said is the way nails should be polished - NOT! I'm already worried of how they're going to be when I remove their terrible shellac. 2. The girl that applied it, loved to concentrate additional enamel at the point of my nails, so now I have my fingers stick to my nails, with thick material in between. 3. The finishing touch was passing some acetone on one of my hands, therefore, one hand is soft and shinny, and the other one feels dry and looks opaque. Moreover, I always pay $30 for shellac in professional nail salons in Miami, and I end up paying them $35 -  not worthy at all.

3.description: So, I was looking for a place to take my cousins to get their pedis - nothing too expensive and I didn't want to take them to a "spa" yet. Tran Nails could use some improvement - 1) when making an appointment, please make sure that all the staff are there to start when the appointment is made for. I waited 15 minutes for my tech to come, while the 2 other techs started on my cousins. 2)  when you are working on a client, you shouldn't be on your cell phone while working. 3)   have dryers that work 4)  when i was leaving, i requested that they wrap my toes in saran wrap and apply oil or spray so they dry quicker - the tech looked at me like a deer in headlights. 5) the saran wrap stuck to my toes that I have to go get the polish fixed.6) when i requested a design for my 12 year old cousin, the tech either didn't hear me or understand me. the only good thing was the massage chairs.

14.description: My manicure lasted less than 1 week before every nail started to flake. Further, I bumped into a woman in our building who told me that on 2 different occasions they failed to honor a $40 gift certificate there. Sadly, their "we don't need you" attitude is costing them customers and they don't even know it..or care.

4.description: Love it here. The place isn't uppity like a lot of places that do manicures and pedicures. Very laid back and they do a quick, professional job. You will not find nicer people, either! Plus the last time I was there they selected "Clueless" to play on the TV amongst their ample DVD collection. Pedicure + amazing movie + massage chair = best day ever. And really, paying $30 for the best day ever is pretty darn reasonable.

58.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon with some friends and the place was completely dead. It is a large restaurant though and they seated my little group in the back near the kitchen. The kitchen doors seem to be the place for the waiters/waitresses to wait when the restaurant is dead and so it felt like they were hovering near us.If you want to feel fancy by overpaying on lettuce, might I recommend Francesca's chicken caesar salad? The menu listed this item as something, something, "pollo." Call me uncultured and cheap (I'll only admit to the latter) but sometimes I wish either (1) I could read Italian/whatever language Gold Coast restaurant menus are in or (2) they would use good 'ol American English like Jack in The Box's menu. Just sayin'.Now, this caesar salad was actually excellent! It had strips of some fancy cheese on it that were kind of dried out but I guess I'm just too used to Velveeta :( The chicken was also really good. It seems that it is hard to find the perfect balance between drenching a salad in dressing and adding enough so it isn't too plain. This caesar salad had the perfect balance. I really enjoyed it and recommend it!Regarding customer service, the waitress here was very nice. Individuals from our party kept departing one-at-a-time and we would all stand up to see them off. The waitress would dash in and we would have to explain that we were not all leaving. It was humorous but I felt it was a little pushy considering the restaurant was dead. With that said though, the waitress was nice. I also already noted the small cluster of waiters/waitresses nearby but hey, I honestly don't blame them considering the place was dead and if you went when they were actually busy, I doubt you would have the same experience.Vibe was cool. Kind of felt like a banquet hall, but that isn't a negative comment. They say Al Capone's speakeasy is located in the basement which is interesting. Kind of neat to check it out (it's by the restrooms).Quick note, expect to sell an organ in order to pay for street parking here. This continues to be a trend in my Yelp reviews located in/near the Chicago Loop. Overall, my salad was excellent, service was fine/above average, vibe was cool. I would come here again but considering the service and menu, might find this better suited to a dinner date instead of a Sunday afternoon group.

56.description: Lovely restaurant! I had my sisters "Gatsby" theme bridal shower her in their private space downstairs, and I'm so happy I did! The room is a great space to host a large group (and it fit perfectly with the theme). They have a full bar and can easily fit 50 people. The food was great and reasonably priced (esp because of the location).  We had a few pasta, chicken and salad dishes. I would definitely come back here again.

29.description: Exceeded my expectations. Could not have asked for a more perfect place to eat. Amazing menu. Dinner was excellent. Service was above and beyond. They have the most attentive and friendly staff imaginable. You can tell they have a great management team as everyone "gets it", from the customer service perspective. Not to be out shined by the creative menu and superb food.

42.description: Wonderful Italian spot.  We ate at the bar and the bartender was very friendly.  The food was delicious as it is at other Francesca's around the city and suburbs.  The ambiance is what usually gets me in the door at Francesca's - a great fancy place for a lady lunch.

23.description: I was in town for a conference and had a hankering for pasta.  I was also incredibly  hungry.  Had the salad special which was burratta (probably spelling that wrong), with avocado, yellow cherry tomatoes, and crostini with olive oil and a balsamic glaze drizzled around it.  It was so delicious and I smashed it right away.  My main course was the penne with sausage and that was delicious! I had to take most of it home but i left very happy and full from a wonderful meal.  The server was very pleasant and attentive but not too much so.  All in all a great self-dinner treat!

47.description: Mediocre service at best.  This marked our second bad experience in a row at a Francesca's the other being in Lake Forest a couple of weeks prior.  The waitress obviously lost track of her tables.  An entire course arrived out of sequence.  The food was unremarkable.  Francesca's for us used to be a nice Italian meal in Chicago, now it is just another restaurant factory.

8.description: Wow! Francesca's on Chestnut is definitely a restaurant that exceeded my expectations after just reading the yelp reviews. My boyfriend and I chose this restaurant in a last minute decision because it was close to our hotel and our next destination (360 Chicago). I was expecting overpriced Italian food for small portions but that was definitely not the case. We showed up at 6:45PM and immediately got seated. The ambiance and decor is semi-casual and though the restaurant was bustling, the music and noise wasn't too loud to not be able to have a decent dinner table conversation. I ordered the conchiglie with asparagus and mushrooms and man it was delicious! I'm not much of a cheesy sauce person so this dish was perfect for me. The sauce was tomato based but light enough to not be overwhelming. My boyfriend is the complete opposite and possibly got the most cheese-filled thing on the menu--ravioli stuffed with cheese. We were expecting small normal size raviolis but no way Jose his ravioli was bigger than his mouth! Overall, our experience was quite excellent and the $15-20 range is definitely reasonable for the HUGE portions they give. Definitely recommend!

31.description: Wow! Francesca's on Chestnut is definitely a restaurant that exceeded my expectations after just reading the yelp reviews. My boyfriend and I chose this restaurant in a last minute decision because it was close to our hotel and our next destination (360 Chicago). I was expecting overpriced Italian food for small portions but that was definitely not the case. We showed up at 6:45PM and immediately got seated. The ambiance and decor is semi-casual and though the restaurant was bustling, the music and noise wasn't too loud to not be able to have a decent dinner table conversation. I ordered the conchiglie with asparagus and mushrooms and man it was delicious! I'm not much of a cheesy sauce person so this dish was perfect for me. The sauce was tomato based but light enough to not be overwhelming. My boyfriend is the complete opposite and possibly got the most cheese-filled thing on the menu--ravioli stuffed with cheese. We were expecting small normal size raviolis but no way Jose his ravioli was bigger than his mouth! Overall, our experience was quite excellent and the $15-20 range is definitely reasonable for the HUGE portions they give. Definitely recommend!

34.description: We ordered from Francesca's and ate at the restaurant downstairs.  I can't speak to service--but the food was excellent.  I had the seafood spaghetti and my boyfriend had the rigatoni with spicy sausage.  Large portions, very hearty, and well balanced flavors.  Also very reasonably priced!

16.description: Such a perfect neighborhood getaway. Amazing drinks and the bartenders really remember who you are and what you like. I know we are loving the $5 happy hour menu 3-630pm. All dishes are plentiful, and you almost always have leftovers. Homemade sauces and real Italian is what sets Francesca's apart. Warm and cozy location on chestnut here .... Sit at the bar and chat with neighbor hood friends, always a good time.

13.description: I have never been here before but I saw it was a block from my hotelVery nice cozy local atmosphere The menu is very reasonable as well as the $15 corkage feeAll the food is very goodThis is a place to go if you want low cost Italian cuisine in a comfortable environment

11.description: Francesca's has a fairly upscale atmosphere to it. It feels more businesslike than romantic though, but it would still be a very suitable place for a fine date. The waitstaff was excellent. They were helpful in their wine descriptions, prompt with clean up and refills, and attentive to my needs.The wine was quite good. It didn't pair well with my meal, but I didn't ask for any advice on this matter, so that's my own fault. The caesar salad was surprisingly tasty as well. For being the equivalent of a side salad, they truly went all out with it by even including pimento peppers.For my main course I ordered a pizza. It was quite a pizza too: mushroom, artichoke, black olives, prosciutto, and egg. The presentation was amusing as well. The pizza came out with the egg cooked over-easy in the center. The waiter took a large spoon and broke the yolk. He then scooped the egg and spread it all over the pie. It was a rather sloppy meal, but a delicious one.

39.description: Francesca's came up as I searched for a gluten-free Italian restaurant to eat near the  hotel where we were staying. Francesca's exceeded my expectations.My wife ordered off the regular menu and I the gluten free menu. Both servings were reasonably priced and servings were plentiful. Our wait service was exceptionally good. They have all the "bells and whistles. you could desire from a restaurant.

37.description: We were seated and served very promptly for an early dinner after a long day attending a conference. Service was excellent. My main course of sea bass with sautéed vegetables was exceptionally tasty. I started with a Caesar salad that was fine and not too large, served with big flakes of Parmesan. Large glass of a good Malbec for a very reasonable price. I'm not exactly an expert on Italian cuisine, but I do live and work in San Diego's Little Italy. I tend to avoid Italian restaurants when I'm on the road, to avoid disappointment, but I will definitely try to eat at this Francesca's again next time I'm in Chicago.

0.description: I'd recommend Francesca's for a NICE DINNER with a date or a group.Went on the Saturday just before Valentine's Day -- it was PACKED! People at the bar, people waiting for seats, and almost every table with guests. Our reservation at 7:00 pm was upheld and we were seated before we could order a drink at the bar.. supurb.I ordered the Tortellini Con Pollo and the lady got the Salmone con Lenticchie.They were both fantastic. The Tortellini was delicious on its own and the chicken sealed the deal. Cheers!

38.description: Fantastic. I came looking for the diSotto restaurant but stayed once I realized that I could get full entree vs. tapas downstairs. So glad I did. The bartender recommended my wine (chianti/cab blend), appetizer (mixed greens, tomatoes, and TONS of lobster meat), and entree (spinach/artichoke ravioli in  vodka sauce) which were all superb and VERY reasonably priced. I will go out of my way to return next time I'm in Chicago for business. Highly recommend.

51.description: Ate downstairs with a group of eight. Wine selection was fantastic ..extensive but not overpriced. Cheese and salami plate was spot on... Risotto was the best I have had in a long time, twin filets we cooked perfectly, all in all a great night

27.description: I'm really torn on this place - Pizza was amazing, but pasta was not good. We got the pizza they had on special that had mozzarella, fontina, arugula tossed in lemon juice, and truffle oil. This was a fairly simple pizza, but it had a blast of flavor. It was just salty enough, and the tartness from the lemon juice was perfect. The crust was also spot one - thin and the edges had a little crisp. Now the pasta was just disappointing. We got the pasta with asparagus and wild mushrooms with an orecchiette noodle. This was completely flavorless. Totally bland and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. My grandma special ordered linguine with their spicy tomato sauce- this was better than my pasta, but still nothing special. The ambiance here is nice, and just about every age was present. This could really work as a location for a business meeting or a nice date. Service was prompt and they start you out with complimentary bread and oil, although the bread crust was a little soft in my opinion. I will definitely give this place another shot, and I also want to check out the wine bar downstairs.

32.description: The food was fantastic and the service was even better. The rigatoni I received was so delicious I became emotional. The drinks were strong and the prices were fair. Definitely recommend this place. The pizza was authentic Italian style and put my girlfriend in the "mood" if you catch my drift.

54.description: Found this cozy place looking on Yelp for an Italian restaurant near The Drake where we were staying. A quick 5 minute walk just a few blocks away.  Had rezzies and arrived a little early and they tried to cram us into one of those little 2 tops that are literally 6 inches away on either side of another 2 top but we asked to be seated someplace different and larger and they graciously accommodated us.  Menu was 1 page only so a bit limited but was very reasonably priced and everything looked great.  Was disappointed that they were out of calamari.  Hubs and I both had a different pasta dish and both were very good, very generous portions. Also cocktails were good and they had a nice selection of wines by the glass in all price ranges.   Shared the Apple Crisp dessert that was also very good.

48.description: The food here is perfect! The best Ravioli I've ever had!! Bruschetta, Soup, Linguine, Tilapia, and Pork are also wonderful!! Like the vanilla in Crème Brûlée! Give only 4 stars due to Tiramisu...it's still a great one but not the classic type (wet with alcohol).

44.description: I have never been here before but I saw it was a block from my hotelVery nice cozy local atmosphere The menu is very reasonable as well as the $15 corkage feeAll the food is very goodThis is a place to go if you want low cost Italian cuisine in a comfortable environment

24.description: Get the Pollo arrosto alla Romano... Really...  Delicious, simple, every time.  You will not be disappointed

7.description: This place is simple classic. Great service, great food & great French wine in a canteen

49.description: There are about 20 of these scattered throughout Chicagoland, and this one is one of the better ones.  The ever-changing menu always has classic Italian dishes--calamari, bruschetta, pizza, rigatoni, linguini, ravioli, chicken, fish--and it's consistently good.  I wouldn't rank it as the best or most authentic Italian food in the city, but for the price and portion sizes, it's worth dining at, especially in groups.  I would recommend going the pasta route.

40.description: Food was 3 stars at best and the service was 2.5....what happened to this place? Slowly slipping away.... We were seated next to the most obnoxious fake rich couple who had the poor manager running around to find them a "fine wine" ugh. Whole experience was less than stellar and we will not be back.

53.description: The food was excellent, service was great, and the atmosphere is very intimate, even when there was a large party when I was dining. The waiter seemed very knowledgeable about wine recommendations, and I enjoyed having a fairly low-key environment in which I could catch up with my friend.

30.description: Service was awful and the food mediocre. We had to beg our waiter for more drinks, they kept walking by and ignoring us.  I stepped up and ordered a double of bourbon, another person a beer, and the third ordered a glass of wine.  It wasn't until after the table was cleared they asked if we wanted another drink.  My pasta was cold when it arrived.  Not sure what to think.  All I expect is warm food and a waiter to ask if I want another drink when it's empty...

46.description: We had an issue with a promotion but it was handled very professionally by Elliot (manager).  Food, service, and ambiance are very good.

1.description: We wanted to bring an important colleague to Francesca's to impress her as well as have a great meal! We had heard great things about Francesca's and I was really hoping that they would give us a great dining experience. I made a reservation on a Friday for a Monday dinner for 9 people. We were promptly seated in a large circular table in the corner, and everything started off well. We got multiple appetizers, which were great, but I noticed that no one was bussing our table. There were two instances where servers saw our table with empty plates, but no one came over. They forgot a drink and then the entrees came and there were still dirty, empty plates on the table. They bussed the table while putting the entrees down, but some plates were still left at the table. I found this totally strange, as dirty plates should be taken pretty quickly. My entree was not cooked all the way through - the pasta was very underdone. I would have said something to our server, but he never came to ask how the food was, and they were only servicing half of the table. I understand if it was hard to get to the other side of the table, being in the corner and all, but they were aware we were coming and could have prepared better. Anyway, with the dirty plates, lack of service, and my undercooked entree, I decided to say something to the manager. We were there to impress this colleague, and I did not want her to notice that things were amiss. I went to the host stand and asked for the manager. Elliot introduced himself, and I explained the situation. He apologized and fixed everything! Our table was taken care of - no more dirty plates, water and drinks for all, and he threw in free dessert for the table. Our colleague did not notice anything and had a fantastic time at dinner. Once the service issue was fixed, everything came into place and everything was enjoyed! Thanks to Elliott for fixing the issues so quickly and efficiently, as well as making sure that our special guest didn't notice a thing!

55.description: What's with the reviews raving about the food and service then only giving four stars?  I've been traveling the Midwest four two weeks with my family and this was our last night out before flying home.  Our concierge at the Talbott Hotel recommended this to us and it turned out to be the best meal of our entire trip.The food was amazing from the appetizer (bruschetta) to dessert (turtle brownie).  Our waiter was perfect and the food came out surprisingly quickly.  I wouldn't change a thing.  I would give a bonus 6th star if I could.

9.description: What can you say about Francesca's?  Well this is the Italian restaurant, not the women's dresses store.A friend suggested this place after a long day of St. Patrick's day festivities.The atmosphere here is near perfect.  Low lit, cozy, romantic, not too loud, just right.The food is very very good.  Full of flavor, fresh, and plentiful.The Bruschette alla Toscana which was topped with Prosciutto was pretty much the best thing I've ever tasted.The service was prompt and polite and they made us feel as important as anyone in the place.I would have already given this place 5 stars but something they did above and beyond is when I left my jacket there (being from a different city) they shipped it to me and paid for it.Everything about this place is near flaweless.  If you go are dare you to try and be disappointed.  (Hint) you won't be.

26.description: I travel up to Chicago regularly for business and this has become an easy go to place.  The food is always good and the menu changes frequently, offering a nice variety.  I have celiac and they are able to accommodate my gluten free challenges without issue.  Seafood dishes are always delicious and serving sizes are a healthy size.

25.description: Went for lunch. Alright food. Few people, so kinda slow service. Good bread. I got pasta. Friend got salmon. Alright, bit bland. Friend found hair in salmon. Fish don't have hair. Dinner would probably be better.

59.description: I am obsessed with this place. I moved in around the corner 2 years ago, and Francesca's quickly became my go to. I think I have eaten more Francesca's than anything else this year. I've been here for lunch, dinner, gotten take out more times than I can count, and I have nothing but positive things to say.Their baked half chicken is one of the best things I've ever eaten.. I used to mix it up with pasta, but now when I get it to go that is the only thing I will order.Their fish is the best ever. If they ever have the halibut, you have to get it.Their lunch portions are perfect as well. Paninis and salads and other perfect portion meals for the middle of they day.GO HERE. You won't regret it!

21.description: We are having our rehearsal dinner here and had a lunch to taste the menu. They created a tasting menu for us and the staff and manger were very kind and helpful. All of the food was delicious and it made it very hard to choose our menu for the rehearsal.

17.description: We hosted our rehearsal dinner here in December in the wine cellar area of the restaurant. The space was gorgeous and intimate. There were bottles of wine on racks surrounding the tables with medieval looking chandeliers. I was so impressed with the space. We did have an issue with the service, however. We reserved the space from 6-8pm, and there were three family style meals being served. The first one came out at 6:45, and then next one didn't come out until 7:30! Naturally our guests were still finishing their meals by 8pm but they were trying to rush us all out. My father-in-law had to yell at the manager so that he wouldn't be charged for the extra fifteen minutes that we stayed. Also one of the waiters gave my dad a hard time when he asked for another plate of the food for the table, I couldn't believe how rude that was! Luckily, everyone had a great time overall and the food was pretty good. We didn't assign the seating so everyone loved mingling with new people and the night ended up being a lot of fun.

10.description: We were originally going to to to mEAT but they were so busy that after a half hour of waiting for a seat, we never saw anyone leave. We went over to Francescas and were seated immediately even though they were busy. They served us some bread to go with the oil that is already on the table and it was fantastic. I ordered the chicken Alfredo. The dinner came out in a few minutes and I was immediately impressed by the fact that the pasta was real, homemade pasta freshly made in house. It was a welcome change to the standard pasta that you get at most restaurants. I would definitely check this place out again if I am back in town for the evening.

5.description: My friends and I came here on a Saturday night which may explain why I can't rave about it. The server, when we saw him, was polite and nice, however he seemed to always be away. To say the pasta was al dente is an understatement, I think it may not have been cooked all the way. I've heard great things about francesca's so I was really disappointed having gone and wished I went to Quartinos or somewhere else instead, but maybe they should figure out a way to manage the customers a little better on a busy night.

3.description: I have a funny story about Francesca's. My sister and I were trying to go to DiSotto Enoteca which is located in the same hotel but somehow ended up at Francesca's. Right outside the hotel, the sign says DiSotto Enoteca but once we were inside, we were at Francesca's. On our way out after the meal, we realized DiSotto Enoteca was under Francesca's. Very smart business move on Francesca's part!Maybe you also made the same mistake. I didn't realize it until we were looking at a menu and it looked so familiar, especially the girl on the menu. It was then that I realized that we were at another restaurant, one I had been to before in the suburbs! (It is a chain restaurant.) When I let my sister know we were at another restaurant, a lady at a different table was nodding because apparently, she made the same mistake. Anyway, it was a good mistake because we had a great meal.When I went to Francesca's in Arlington Heights, I was not a big fan of the pasta (it tasted a bit overcooked and on the mushy side, and I prefer chewy, al dente pasta) so we steered clear of pasta dishes. We ordered the meatballs and artichoke risotto. The thing about risotto: I really wanted to like it but up to that point had not for whatever reason--probably because it is usually mushy and bland. I was pleasantly surprised and really enjoyed the artichoke risotto here. It was flavorful and really quite delicious. It was the first time I enjoyed eating risotto! The meatballs were great as well. We had a wonderful meal. I would go back again. I also look forward to trying DiSotto Enoteca one day!It is wheelchair accessible. It is conveniently located near the Water Tower Place and within walking distance of the hospitals (Northwestern, RIC, etc.). The ambiance is very classy and upscale. It is also pretty dark inside.

35.description: Francesca's has a fairly upscale atmosphere to it. It feels more businesslike than romantic though, but it would still be a very suitable place for a fine date. The waitstaff was excellent. They were helpful in their wine descriptions, prompt with clean up and refills, and attentive to my needs.The wine was quite good.
