It didn't pair well with my meal, but I didn't ask for any advice on this matter, so that's my own fault. The caesar salad was surprisingly tasty as well. For being the equivalent of a side salad, they truly went all out with it by even including pimento peppers.For my main course I ordered a pizza. It was quite a pizza too: mushroom, artichoke, black olives, prosciutto, and egg. The presentation was amusing as well. The pizza came out with the egg cooked over-easy in the center. The waiter took a large spoon and broke the yolk. He then scooped the egg and spread it all over the pie. It was a rather sloppy meal, but a delicious one.

19.description: This was a great experience all around. We had 8:00 reservations, got there at 7:30 and was sat right away. The food was wonderful and Marco our sever made some great suggestions on some other places to go for after dinner drinks.His service was excellent as our waiter.

28.description: Came in town from LA.  Ordered the calamari grilled not fried. It was so beyond delicious!  Food was perfectly prepared and temperature was spot on.  Favors were outstanding and service was spot on.  Best experience will be back for more.  Apple warmed dessert yummy!

45.description: Their pizzas are delicious and so are their salads. I agree with some people who say that contrary to what some reviews say, their service is top notch. I adore the decor and the atmosphere here. Not too over the top and loud. I'd go here all the time if I could!

33.description: What can you say about Francesca's?  Well this is the Italian restaurant, not the women's dresses store.A friend suggested this place after a long day of St. Patrick's day festivities.The atmosphere here is near perfect.  Low lit, cozy, romantic, not too loud, just right.The food is very very good.  Full of flavor, fresh, and plentiful.The Bruschette alla Toscana which was topped with Prosciutto was pretty much the best thing I've ever tasted.The service was prompt and polite and they made us feel as important as anyone in the place.I would have already given this place 5 stars but something they did above and beyond is when I left my jacket there (being from a different city) they shipped it to me and paid for it.Everything about this place is near flaweless.  If you go are dare you to try and be disappointed.  (Hint) you won't be.

43.description: We were originally going to to to mEAT but they were so busy that after a half hour of waiting for a seat, we never saw anyone leave. We went over to Francescas and were seated immediately even though they were busy. They served us some bread to go with the oil that is already on the table and it was fantastic. I ordered the chicken Alfredo. The dinner came out in a few minutes and I was immediately impressed by the fact that the pasta was real, homemade pasta freshly made in house. It was a welcome change to the standard pasta that you get at most restaurants. I would definitely check this place out again if I am back in town for the evening.

2.description: No wait on a Sunday night at 7. My friend and I sat in the dining room, which was about half full. My guess is this is kind of a neighborhood spot. We had come because prices looked reasonable online and I had a coupon. Good points: The service was fast and overall attentive, it took us under an hour to have dinner and drinks. Interesting cocktail menu..I started with a peach smash with ginger beer. It was sweet but had a bit of a weird aftertaste.  The Sangiovese wine was a better choice, which I ordered next.   Bad points: the food. My house salad was wilted and made of the tail ends of romaine lettuce, yuck! The pizza we shared (a make your own pizza, with broccoli, onions, and mushroom) arrived underdone and looking much like a frozen pizza that they had not cooked long enough. The meatballs were just ok. I would not return given all the great restaurants in Chicago.

18.description: We had our holiday lunch at this restaurant.  We had a reservation made but I don't think it was necessary as the restaurant was basically empty.The server was overall fair.  Based on past dining experiences as a group dining at a variety of other Francesca's locations we were deeply disappointed with the service.The amount of time between the appetizer and entrée being serve was unacceptable.  Once the food was finally brought out it was all cold.  Clearly, it had been sitting in the kitchen waiting to be served.  And again, there was only one other occupied table in the entire restaurant which was as two top.  I am not sure where the disconnect was but I don't think we would ever go back to this restaurant for lunch.  The waiter was overall not in the least bit attentive.The food was fine, not as good as other Francesca's but acceptable.

41.description: The only reason this got two stars was because the food was above average and when we did finally get service, our waiter (that I had to call over) tried his best to make up for our lack of service before hand.After coming into the restaurant and being seated by the host, we got bread and water immediately, however after this we waited about 15 to 20 min for a waiter to come over to get our order. We may have been waiting even longer if I didn't flag one of the waiters down. We noticed tables that were seated after us got waiter service immediately while we were still waiting eating our bread... sadly :'(However after we did get some service, our new waiter (who I don't think was supposed to be serving our section) was friendly and accommodating, and didn't charge us for our drinks. The waiter who was meant to be serving us only checked in on us near the end of our meal and to give us the check, and never apologized for basically ignoring our table for 90% of the meal. If the restaurant was packed, it may have been another story, but since many of the tables around us were empty, and the wait staff were obviously not busy, it was disappointing.

52.description: Francesca's On Chestnut  was so - so...I was meeting friends here for NYE dinner. I arrived first and sat at the bar. The bartender was busy so I waited for awhile. I noticed the manager was at the bar eating her dinner. I think she should have at least greeted or acknowledged me if not hop behind the bar and assist.Francesca's On Chestnut has your standard Italian eatery decor with white tile floors and espresso wood furniture. Our waiter was super friendly but a bit forgetful on getting our drinks correct.I had a Caesar salad which was standard. For dinner I had the half chicken which was decent but the sauce was really thick and mild like turkey gravy. I recommend to serve it with lemon, garlic and wine sauce.

50.description: Yummy pizzas and salads. Great service and good location for a group. Not too noisy and easy to talk with others. Hope to come back next time I'm in Chicago!

4.description: I'm really torn on this place - Pizza was amazing, but pasta was not good. We got the pizza they had on special that had mozzarella, fontina, arugula tossed in lemon juice, and truffle oil. This was a fairly simple pizza, but it had a blast of flavor. It was just salty enough, and the tartness from the lemon juice was perfect. The crust was also spot one - thin and the edges had a little crisp. Now the pasta was just disappointing. We got the pasta with asparagus and wild mushrooms with an orecchiette noodle. This was completely flavorless. Totally bland and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. My grandma special ordered linguine with their spicy tomato sauce- this was better than my pasta, but still nothing special. The ambiance here is nice, and just about every age was present. This could really work as a location for a business meeting or a nice date. Service was prompt and they start you out with complimentary bread and oil, although the bread crust was a little soft in my opinion. I will definitely give this place another shot, and I also want to check out the wine bar downstairs.

6.description: Incredible Italian food. I ordered gnocchi and was in heaven. I just visited Rome in August and the Italian food here at Francesca's is better than the food I had in Italy. Highly recommend!

22.description: Came here after yelping for Italian restaurants....by far some of the best Italian food I have ever had!!! We decided to eat at the bar where we were waited on by the most delightful bartender. He was extremely attentive without being annoying which is great. The happy hour items are huge, delicious, and cheap. The bread was super fresh and yummy. And the entree pasta dish I got was amazing. Can't say enough great things about this place!!!!

15.description: Bruschetta was delicious, highly recommend it. The table bread was dry and the oil lack flavor and had a lemon hint to it. The food is well made and alright, wasn't my favorite Italian place. My waitress was inattentive to us to the point where we had to ask our busboy for several different things.

57.description: The menu always changes (it's handwritten). The pasta is creative and well balanced- not just your traditional spaghetti and meatballs. Prices are high, but commensurate with the quality and the location. Would recommend. NOTE: Francesca's on Chestnut has the best bruschetta I've ever had. Super fresh tomatoes, cheese, and olive oil. NOTE2: Go to the wine bar one floor below (called DiSotto Enoteca) before or after Francesca's.NOTE3: You can have them make your pasta however you like. Just name ingredients and they'll custom make it.

20.description: This was a great experience all around. We had 8:00 reservations, got there at 7:30 and was sat right away. The food was wonderful and Marco our sever made some great suggestions on some other places to go for after dinner drinks.His service was excellent as our waiter.

36.description: Average setting, a little odie style. I was by myself eating on a high stand table. Bread is hot, dish is ok. Service is fast relatively, attentive. Lots of take outs by the neighbor residents. I will come back again if there's no other choice.

14.description: The bar service and quality were excellent. The food was amazing but the service could not have been slower. My group felt that our waiter was ignoring our table. Very unimpressed with the service.

3.description: The last time I was at one of The Body Shops was circa...high school? There used to be a huge mall 15 minutes from home and I would rarely go there because I thought it was expensive and you can get the same thing at Bath & Body Work.Thanks for the amazing deal on Groupon, I entered the store with a new outlook after a decade later. The sales guy was actually super friendly, not pushy at all, and I appreciated he just said hello and let me wandered around the store. It was my birthday month so I got a free love my body card. So I will be getting 10% off all year long plus freebies throughout the year. Bad news for me because I will be coming here frequently...But all in all, I picked up some great products for more than half off. For fabulous skin, get the aloe mask and vitamin c capsules. And for a restful night of sleep, I picked up some pillow mist and japanese sea salt. After tonight's trip I definitely won't be waiting for another 10 years to visit this store again. I think this will become my regular store like Sephora.

1.description: Walked in here to buy some coconut body butter since I had seen that they were having a sale. Despite knowing exactly what I wanted, the salespeople kept trying to get me to try other things. Some people might enjoy this, but I personally like to browse in peace and utilize the salespeople's expertise when I have questions.Another thing about the Body Shop: they rarely post prices to their products which irritates me. It's helpful to check online beforehand so you know how much things cost before ending up with product that costs far more than you wanted to spend.

0.description: I started shopping here around 20 years ago when (I think) it was brand new and it used to have scented oils that you could buy separately or add into their products, so I am a long-time customer But foolishly, I had fallen off in recent times. So lately, people have been noticing that my hands are very dry. About the third time I had to explain to someone that my skin is dry to begin with and the dry winter air makes it worse and this winter won't end so I can't heal and besides my job requires me to wash my hands a lot and I can't apply lotion until after I clock out, and on top of that the only thing that helps me is the hemp hand cream from The Body Shop, I started feeling self-conscious, and why don't I just go back to the Body Shop and get said hand cream?So I did. The two ladies who worked there were very pleasant, and knew a lot about the products. Even though I said was I was looking for, the one lady sold it to me anyway, explaining the benefits of the cream, and agreeing that it was the best product for my preternaturally dry hands (and she told me some things about it that I didn't know, as well). Both ladies also described and suggested other products that I might like as well, and were unintrusive after I picked out what I needed but still looked around for a bit.Oh yes, and my hands feel 100% better already. Body Shop, we will not take such a long break from each other again.

2.description: It's been awhile since I shopped at this location but was pleasantly surprised with how much the store didn't change when it comes to it's quality and store layout.The service was phenomenal, thanks to the lovely Liz, who helped me pick out a small gift for my sister while I was in town.  They had a great selection, everything was labeled and customer friendly and of course when I asked if there were any promotions that day, I was happy to find out that there were and I was more inclined to buy more!if you're in the area and are looking for some great scented toiletries, visit the Body Shop on Michigan Avenue and you'll be sure to walk out  with something useful, that smells delicious!

5.description: PUSHY SALES STAFF!! I work in Sales, and if a client says no to something I suggest, I leave it at that. My salesperson at The body Shop was nice but pushed me to sign up for some BS rewards program. Look, I'm all for rewards programs....IF I SHOP THERE FREQUENTLY....but I very rarely shop at this store so I declined. He kept telling me about all the benefits after I told him no TWICE. Ugh. I bought a travel sized hand santizer, which I legit needed, and high tailed it out of there.

6.description: Listen up ladies, because I'm about to share my winter moisturizing secret: The Body Shop Shea Butter body butter. I have tubs of this stuff in every room in the apartment. It's non-greasy, absorbs right into your skin and keeps your hands moisturized through a few hand washings. It's worth every penny.This is my favorite Body Shop location because I just like the salespeople there. Also for some reason every time I shop there it's not crowded. I give it minus one star simply because getting there means having to walk through Water Tower Place, bleh.

7.description: I had never been to the body shop but I was super excited to check them out because I had several people rave about how wonderful their products are. The products I have to say are awesome however the service was lacking. I walked in and was not even acknowledge the lady behind the counter actually acted as if I was bothering her just to ask a question. That was such a big turn off for me so I left very sad that I didn't get to make a purchase.

8.description: Love me some body shop. I only shop during the semi-annual sale and stock up on the items. My favorite is the blueberry body butter. Also worth mentioning are the Jasmine body wash, Manuka shampoo, and Oceanus body wash. A definite visit during the sale period.

9.description: I had a Groupon that unbeknownst to me expired on 12/24; I was there on 12/27 & they wouldn't honor it. The so called Manager was in the back room & the associates had to go back there to discuss with them. He or She never came out to talk to me directly which I thought was highly unprofessional. Well, I always have Bath & Body Works who always have coupons.

10.description: What the hell is going on with the staff here?  It was like I was the first customer they've seen in years.  The minute I walked in the door I was being bombarded with suggestions and multiple offers for help and business cards for the home business they're running.Weird.    I'm not a big fan of fruity smelling crap, but I like their exfoliating cloths and stop in every few months to buy them in bulk.Oh, and for those fools who've fallen for the cellulite zapping claims at Bliss Spa, the "slimulator" which is $22 at Bliss is $12 at The Body Shop.

4.description: Knowledgeable sales staff would be nice. I'm not that familiar with The Body Shop products, but I'm extremely intrigued because of the all-natural appeal and the Fair Trade uses, plus I'm a sucker for great cosmetics. I came here on a Saturday with a friend who was looking for a product she had read about. We walked in and there were no other customers - shocking because the mall was packed. We were greeted immediately, which was nice... but when the sales girl "tried to help"... oy.We asked about a specific mask, and asked if she had used it. She replied no, but she had used another. She continued to tell us about the other, because it was all she was familiar with. She didn't even say anything more than "it's nice because it's warming", which hello - it says on the bottle. I asked her what other ingredients were used in the mask we were inquiring and she had no idea. She said "well, it has Tea Tree" which, I should hope so because it's a Tea Tree Mask!Essentially, I found the girl useless. She did nothing. Unlike some other cosmetic stores located in Water Tower (hint hint Lush) that actually try to help you and know everything about their products (sometimes a little too much), my Body Shop experience was terrible.

58.description: This is one of my favorite places in Chicago.  It's not pretentious, not showy, it's simply a great place to listen to the best blues in town.  The crowd is more relaxed than Kingston Mines so if you're looking for a good hang out place, come here.  I'm here on a weekday and it's great.

56.description: Wow is all I can say about this spot. The vibe is like nothing I've experienced before. The walls are covered in history of Blues and Chicago Icons. It doesn't matter if you are a Tourist or a seasoned local, this place is a top 10 of Chicago if you ask me.

29.description: Amazing Blues!!!

42.description: One of the best Jazz/blues joints I have been to. This is saying alot because I have been to a only a few spots like this so far, such as in  NYC, D.C., and even in So. Cal. If you want a good introduction to Chicago Blues/Jazz, then this is a place to check out. The night I went, one of the bartenders happened to jump on stage, and started belting out some old Jazz tune, and wow for a white lady, she can sing:DI liked the band that night, it was mix of seasoned Blues guitarists and even this young dude playing his guitar as good as the rest of the old-Blues cats! hehe.If I am ever in the area, its my go to spot to listen to some great LIVE music!

23.description: My wife has never been to a bonafide Chicago Blues bar/club so I found this place and brought her for her 50th B-Day weekend.  This place reminds me of the little side clubs in St Louis were I was brought up, cramped, old, worn out but still a lot of life to live.  Wood floors with 50 years of drinks spilled on it.  Stage so small that the drummers cymbal stand tipped over once and the crowed caught it and set it back in place and he didn't miss a beat.  Bathroom (singular)  Man if it could talk, old worn out and small.  Drinks flowed like water, music flowed with a deep down heavy R&B funk.  I LOVED it and my girl was turned on to what a Chicago Blues house can be, without the tourist crap.  If I lived in Chi-Town I would be a regular here.

47.description: .... A remarkable..fun...place to hang with good friends!! this band kept us going the minute they started playing a wonderful repertoire of blues......drinks at a decent price and mixed very finely.....recommend highly if you are up for a fun night....Im definitely going again

8.description: Outstandingly perfect when it comes to what anyone with soul wants to find while in the heart of Blues Music. It gets packed with incredibly friendly people during the performances, and the bands are so spot on with what I wanted to go see while I visited Chicago. It's not if, but when I come back to the city that I'll drop in for some mo' blues. Drinks are very affordable (I come from LAla land, the city of over-priced snobby bars), and the waiting staff is awesome (especially considering that the credit card machine is still connected to dial-up internet).

31.description: I get it. This is a blues institution. I've wanted to check it out for years. Unfortunately they don't control the occupancy. I'm no prude and have no problem getting cozy in a bar, but when you are literally pinned in place and unable to even take a breath that's where I draw the line. Picture those images of the Japanese commuter trains with the designated "pushers" who literally jam as many people in as possible and you will understand this place. Surely it's a fire code violation and a tragedy waiting to happen. That aside, the guy on stage was great - for the 5 mins I could stand being trapped like cattle. The bar was 8 feet away and literally unreachable. Maybe I'll try again on an "off night", although that's what I thought I was doing by showing up early on a weekday.

34.description: I have been coming to this place since I moved to Chicago in 2001.   This is hands down the best Blues bar in Chicago.  Its a small venue which in turn gives this great personal experience with bands playing.  Staff is always witty and attentive.  My wife and I had our 1st date here.  Love this place.

16.description: Love this place, home of some good Chicago Blues music. Small place so get there early if you want a table or seats! Best in the city.

13.description: We came here on a Sunday night. Thanks to Yelp, we got buy one get one free offer. Costed us $8 for two people. We got lucky and our ticket was valid to enter Kingston mines, the blues and jazz place situated opposite to blues. But we enjoyed music in blues than Kingston. I think the music had rock music fusion with blues and jazz. I m not a big fan of blues but enjoyed this experience  completely.

11.description: Southern blues came up to Chicago in the early-mid 20th century, and you can't ignore its role as a part of Chicago's identity.  There are plenty of spots in Chicago to hear good blues music, but if you're in the Lakeview / Lincoln Park area, then this is your spot.  Both BLUES and Kingston Mines are located right on Halsted.  When you step inside, you are taken to a different place.  This an authentic blues joint, where the focus is on good music, good friendly people and having a good time.  There are different performers here almost every night of the week, but they're all good!  Sure, you won't see B.B. King or Buddy Guy here, but then hey, they're not charging you $100+ to get in here, and its even free for local residents!  I've always appreciated the great musicians you see here, guitars, drums, harmonicas, vocals, everything is solid!  They will sing your blues away!  During set breaks, the musicians sometimes hang out by the stage, and I've spoken with many of them, some  have been playing here for decades and they have incredible stories.  They are true legends of the scene.  Amazing atmosphere here, its really something to see.  I highly recommend that you experience the Chicago blues when you visit.  On a cold winter night, this is a great place to come into and warm yourself up to the blues!!!

39.description: Great spot! Very intimate and killer music. On Sundays, one cover gets you into Kingston (across the street) too!

37.description: I went on a Friday night around 9:30pm and the place was already packed! Partly because it's a small venue and partially because it's a great place for live blues music. The drinks were average priced and the crowd had a great vibe. I'd definitely go again.

0.description: Bodacious atmosphere every day of the week,Loud music blasts in the cozy venue yet the waitresses can hear you,Uniquely a Chicago music scene, these  Easy, swinging beats on an August nightSoaking in the scene, with a foot tapping on the bar stool.That's the B.L.U.E.S.

38.description: Sorry for the unbelievably late review... My husband and I were in Chicago this past winter and last minute decided to go to B.L.U.E.S. on Saturday night. What a treat. We found a table and started ordering drinks around 9:30pm... Carlos Johnson was lined up for the evening and I cannot begin to explain how much we enjoyed his performance. Thinking we would stay for a bit and then go grab food elsewhere - we ended up finding ourselves still at B.L.U.E.S. until 1AM! Our stomachs had been filled with cheap, yet satisfying drinks and amazing music. Thanks for an awesome, unforgettable night!

51.description: Thank you Groupon for introducing me to such a great place. Looking for something to do to celebrate my mom's birthday ON A SUNDAY, I came across this voucher on Groupon.  I was skeptical about the place because some people viewed it as loud, and small.  I'm happy I decided to check it out for myself.We arrived, and everyone was sitting toward the back in the small venue, so all  seats remaining were in the front, by the band. Fine, well at least we didn't have to stand right. It ended up being a great experience, as I'm all about live music.I ended up loving our seats, because it was a geat intimate feel by the band. To see them play their instruments, and sing, just mesmorized me. I was born in the 80's,  so I only knew a song or two, but the words of the songs.....whoa. love it. I love to hear a story told through song.  My mom on the other hand. OUR WAITRESS JAMIE: On a scale of 1-10(10being the highest), she's a 10. The sweetest person. Even when we mentioned we had a voucher, her demeanor stayed the same. Very attentinve to all her tables and to usI couldn't help but notice, that she made all of her tables

27.description: I came to hear some Blues. And that is what I received.  Some good wholesome blues. It was nice to hear some Chicago blues. The bar wasn't what I imagined,  but I came for the music. The bar was old but I noticed not being from Chicago that is the way things were here. No updated properties but it may be as the result of the rash weather that they endure.  It was a nice place to go for blues. And to hear the wonderful Eddie Baan Shaw band. Very nice.

32.description: This venue is guaranteed to spark your inner passion for authentic Chicago blues, not too mention some Motown and funk vibes to boot.  Small and intimate, it tends to be a bit crowded -- even on a Tuesday as was the case last night.  The cover price is affordable and drinks are reasonably priced.  Despite the small space, table side service is readily available and the servers are friendly. The shoulder to shoulder atmosphere is worth putting up with just to see the legendary musicians absolutely own the tiny stage.  How they regularly fit seven+ artists on stage is beyond me.  Great crowd in attendance aging mostly 20s and 30s all the way up to 60+. All in all, a worthwhile choice for some hometown Chicago entertainment.

54.description: Great chicago dive with live music. make sure you CHECK IN HERE ON YELP BEFORE YOU WALK IN to save yourself a few bucks when paying the doorman! I checked in 2minutes after I entered and paid the doorman and he would not refund me $5 lol. REFUSED! His brilliant reasoning was that I had to do the "check-in" thing before I entered...whatever dude.

48.description: My friend and I stumbled on this place after talking with one of the waitresses outside. Greatest surprise of my trip to Chicago. The cover was waived and the beers cheap and cold. The music here was fantastic. I'm not a blues aficionado, but you didn't have to be to enjoy the pure quality coming from the band. They rotated instruments as well, and were clearly exceptionally talented. I wish I could remember the name of the waitress who served us, we had a cool chat about the city and everything Midwest. As a tourist who tries not to behave like one I feel I kicked out to find this place. It's divy and loud, but real, and quality. Enjoy!

44.description: I'm really torn up about how to rate this blues joint. Its small inside which is both a blessing and a curse. It's nice that its so intimate and you feel like you are at the bands house in some Mississippi swamp, but the chairs are so jammed together that you have to literally climb over people to get to the bar or bathroom.  It oozes authenticity, I can just picture Jake and Elwood Blues coming in here tossing back several cold ones and jamming with with some blues legends of Chicago. The place feels like its been there forever, and it probably has. The band that I saw was excellent and even played a beatles song in a funky blues style which I was not expecting.

24.description: Amazing. Incredible. Everything you'd ever imagine and want out of a TRUE blues bar in Chicago!

7.description: Awesome joint, very authentic and true to the city. If you want real blues, come to this spot. They won't discriminate for using a groupon! Lovely bartenders, great atmosphere. The friendliness and good mood are contagious at this place. Also, check in to receive a yelp deal!

49.description: Open late with great music.

40.description: John Primer & the Real Deal Blues Band "wowed" all of us. Doesn't get much better than this! B.L.U.E.S. is a small venue, and it was packed. As the night progressed the patrons became younger, drunker, an stupider. Although it was interesting to watch all of this unfold, we came here for outstanding blues and were not disappointed.

53.description: Paid a $10 cover and would've paid $50. We saw Carlos Johnson and sat about 5 ft from him all night. He and the band made a show out of the whole night. The rum and coke was the best I've ever had, as if this place needed another reason to be my favorite spot. If you like blues, and you like booze, this place is an absolute must.

30.description: Small joint and fun as can be!!!  Saw Carlos Johnson here last night.  Croud was packed in and there were a ton of 21 to 25 year olds; that is great to see.  Low cover, decent beer prices.  Super small 1 person bathrooms.

46.description: If you like Blues music, skip Kingston mines- this is the place to go.  I came in here with a friend with little expectations and we got seats right in front to listen to the music.   I'm not a blues expert by any means, but I really enjoyed the musicians that played on the Saturday night we were there.  The atmosphere here is one where you silently enjoy your drink and listen to the music.A much smaller venue than Kingston Mines, but much more intimate, and perfect if you want a relaxing Saturday night.  No need to come here and talk someone's ear off all night, just come and enjoy the beautiful music.

1.description: Loved it here and you'll love it here too!  There's a $10 cover which is completely worth it.  t's such a small place with cheap drinks and live music.  The closer you are to the front of the stage the better.  I came here on a Saturday night and saw Carl Weathersby and he was absolutely rockin'.  I wasn't sure what to expect when coming here.  I don't know if it's because I've never heard the blues live, but it's something you want to experience.  Go here now and you won't regret it.

55.description: This place made me fall in love with BLUES!!

9.description: I saw Carlos Johnson and the Serious Blues Band and was absolutely floored! Best blues I've ever heard live. Couple that with a small, intimate venue and extremely friendly staff and I had an incredible night. I'd strongly encourage anyone (local or visitor) to stop in as it's worth the trip to Lincoln Park!

26.description: Seating was a bit awkward but the ambience and performers were great. This place gives off a real cozy atmosphere and the bartenders were extremely nice. We will be visiting again.

25.description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. This bar is comepletely what a dive bar should look like and be. Very tiny space, but the music was great. I came on a saturday to see Eddie Shaw & the wolfgang. They were fantastic! Here are some tips. PAY for the $10 valet. Arrive early for seating. I would pre-game because going to the bar and going to the bathroom is a huge pain! I would definately come back.

12.description: Music here is insane. You won't be disappointed. Raw, gritty, sweaty. It doesn't get much better than this. $10 cover when we went, sat up close and wasn't tooo loud but was def an experience. Would return. Would recommend to tourists looking for authentic Chicago Blues in chill environment. Also recommend showing up at least 30 min prior to music if you want a seat.

59.description: Every Monday night, Pistol Pete is jamming out!  This is definitely a great Chicago experience for anyone who is looking for some great blues and a good time albeit the place is very small, crowded, limited seating and LOUD.  If your up for it, this is a must try, just know seating is hard to find and you might be standing all night.  Pistol Pete is crazy good! I loved his song choices and kept the night upbeat! He even played my favorite Jimmy Hendrix song, little wing!  This guy definitely loves what he is doing and it shows. The bartender and cocktail waitresses were friendly and very observant. It wasn't hard to get a drink at the bar even though it was very crowded and loud, she just pointed at the list of beers. The cocktail waitress came by at least 8 times In the time we were there and cleaned up empty drinks often. There isn't much room to dance, but people still do, great to see.. Cover was $5, but normally it's $8 any other night I believe. I only wish they carried some IPA bottles of beerWhen you leave with the munchies, Taco Palace is the best Mexican food on the block. Order the pastor and asada tacos or chorizo y huevos burrito!

21.description: I saw Carlos Johnson and the Serious Blues Band and was absolutely floored! Best blues I've ever heard live. Couple that with a small, intimate venue and extremely friendly staff and I had an incredible night. I'd strongly encourage anyone (local or visitor) to stop in as it's worth the trip to Lincoln Park!

17.description: I came to hear some Blues. And that is what I received.  Some good wholesome blues. It was nice to hear some Chicago blues. The bar wasn't what I imagined,  but I came for the music. The bar was old but I noticed not being from Chicago that is the way things were here. No updated properties but it may be as the result of the rash weather that they endure.  It was a nice place to go for blues. And to hear the wonderful Eddie Baan Shaw band. Very nice.

10.description: The night we went, there was a great band! We went to Kingston mines across the street, but quality of music could not compare!!! Show up early to ensure you have seating. Be prepared to have happy ears for some amazing blues!

5.description: This is my favorite place in the whole world. It always feels like home when I am there. Good music, friendly staff, good times always.

3.description: I didnt expect the crowd to be so...vanilla.  Reminded me of the jim crow days, because the only black people there were the ones on stage lol.  Even I seemed to be a subject of intense scrutiny to some, "Look sweety, theres another one...theyre so....primitive".  Im kinda big on atmosphere, and I just wasnt expecting that.  The music was very good.  Will opt for something less touristy next time.

35.description: This is a great little divey blues bar.  Absolutely love it here.  The staff is great and the music spectacular!!   I love the blues and this is one of the best.  Get there early to get a seat right on the floor close to the band.  Not strictly for tourists as they have a "neighbor night" with free entry ......it's awesome.  If you haven't been...GO!!!

19.description: Small joint and fun as can be!!!  Saw Carlos Johnson here last night.  Croud was packed in and there were a ton of 21 to 25 year olds; that is great to see.  Low cover, decent beer prices.  Super small 1 person bathrooms.

28.description: Southern blues came up to Chicago in the early-mid 20th century, and you can't ignore its role as a part of Chicago's identity.  There are plenty of spots in Chicago to hear good blues music, but if you're in the Lakeview / Lincoln Park area, then this is your spot.  Both BLUES and Kingston Mines are located right on Halsted.  When you step inside, you are taken to a different place.  This an authentic blues joint, where the focus is on good music, good friendly people and having a good time.  There are different performers here almost every night of the week, but they're all good!  Sure, you won't see B.B. King or Buddy Guy here, but then hey, they're not charging you $100+ to get in here, and its even free for local residents!  I've always appreciated the great musicians you see here, guitars, drums, harmonicas, vocals, everything is solid!  They will sing your blues away!  During set breaks, the musicians sometimes hang out by the stage, and I've spoken with many of them, some  have been playing here for decades and they have incredible stories.  They are true legends of the scene.  Amazing atmosphere here, its really something to see.  I highly recommend that you experience the Chicago blues when you visit.  On a cold winter night, this is a great place to come into and warm yourself up to the blues!!!

45.description: My boyfriend and I came here yesterday for my birthday weekend. The place is small but the music is loud and soulful. Open late with a mixed crowd. The live band was amazing! Will be come again!

33.description: Awesome joint, very authentic and true to the city. If you want real blues, come to this spot. They won't discriminate for using a groupon! Lovely bartenders, great atmosphere. The friendliness and good mood are contagious at this place. Also, check in to receive a yelp deal!

43.description: Definitely a worthwhile place to visit.  Very good music great energy.  My only complaint is the place is a bit dirty.  Restrooms are horrific.   I don't know if this is intentional for that "authentic" atmosphere. For the customers you currently have coming I would clean the place up a bit.   All that said this is still a must see if you go to Chicago.

2.description: An amazing experience in a place with a totally authentic and feel-good atmosphere. If you have never been here you are needlessly depriving yourself!  You don't have to be a Blues "fan" to have a wonderful time - you just have to enjoy music!We saw Smiley Tillmon and he is superb!!!

18.description: One of the best Jazz/blues joints I have been to. This is saying alot because I have been to a only a few spots like this so far, such as in  NYC, D.C., and even in So. Cal. If you want a good introduction to Chicago Blues/Jazz, then this is a place to check out. The night I went, one of the bartenders happened to jump on stage, and started belting out some old Jazz tune, and wow for a white lady, she can sing:DI liked the band that night, it was mix of seasoned Blues guitarists and even this young dude playing his guitar as good as the rest of the old-Blues cats! hehe.If I am ever in the area, its my go to spot to listen to some great LIVE music!

41.description: Amazing!Full of energy with good blues!Drink is also reasonably cheap. Worth a visit!

52.description: This is a small divey place. The live music starts at 10 i think, so if you roll in around 8pm trying to party, you may have to wait a bit. However, if you would like to get drunk while you wait, you can, cheaply. The drinks are cheap and they a have a fairly decent selection. You get a good 'in the family' vibe here which is always appreciated. They're open everyday I think which is a perk to me. Sometimes on a Wednesday, I want to listen to some live blues before going to bed. Also, you may spot a decent amount of tourists here trying to be all exploratory and Chicagoan. This doesn't bother me but.. Tourists, we know who you are and you cant be like us.

50.description: This plac is AWESOME, and I prefer it to Kingston Mines.  Small, divey, better crowd than Kingston Mines IMO.  I am not really a blues/jazz fan, and I don't listen to it in my free time, but I have never not loved the music when I come here.  $10 for great live music?  Sign me up.  Drinks are reasonably priced, staff is very friendly (though the door guys can be a bit surly, gotta back up the tats and shaved head I guess, and you only have to deal with him for 5 seconds so who cares?) and it's something different than just sitting in a bar all night and listening to whatever crap is currently popular.

4.description: Love, love, love, absolutely love this place! There is a cover charge so make sure you have cash on you. The place is small and cozy which gives it a pretty intimate and relaxing vibe. The talent they have coming through there is nothing short of excellent! This is a great place to hang out, have a few drinks, and enjoy outstanding music. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a local blues bar to end their night. The music is great, the vibe is chill, and the people are awesome! You'll for sure have a great time at B.L.U.E.S.

6.description: LOVE THIS PLACE, its small but the vibe is awesome. I've been a couple of times and can't wait to go back this summer. cheap drinks, cover charge but they have an ATM right up front. try to get a seat close to the stage

22.description: Great venue. House band was incredible and the woman jam night was excellent. Really friendly waitstaff. Place felt real; we felt at home instantly.

15.description: Five years ago for my wedding anniversary, my husband and I came to visit Chicago. We had no idea what to do, so we looked in the paper and saw that their was live music being played at B.L.U.E that evening and decided to go. We had such a blast that every time we come back it is a tradition to go. We have also been to the House of Blues and prefer  B.L.U.E way better.

57.description: What a wonderful, intimate and most of all RAW Blues club! The ambience and vibe this club has is incredible. Starting with the music, the talent never ends from Toronzo Cannon to Eddie Shaw and Pistol Pete. The music is real and top-notch. Just when you thought you saw it all, I heard a saxophone and after looking around the stage, I glanced in the back and the doorman was playing - a single spot light on him! Incredible! So many musicians who played with Muddy Waters, Howlin' Wolf, etc. grace their stage nightly.The service was very friendly and prompt, the beer ice cold. Drink prices and the cover charge are more than reasonable. The crowd is mixed and very friendly as well. You can see people in suits to blue jeans, young and old. If you are an out of towner, or a local, this bar is a must. There are several reasons why B.L.U.E.S is considered to be the top club to see blues in Chicago, and perhaps the country. When I have guests visiting from out of town, I always take them there.Keep it up and keep the blues real!

20.description: What a great call.  Pistol Pete is an amazing guitarist, tight band.  Really a fun place.

36.description: Hands down best blues club I have ever been too! Also it's a 5 dollar cover with awesome drink specials! I will never pass through Chicago again without stopping:)

14.description: What a fun place to go and see some great music. I was visiting a friend so I yelped live music and we ended up here. So glad we went, we really enjoyed ourselves. It was a packed house on a Friday night but we lucked out and found seats right next to the stage. The server was super friendly and efficient and the cover was only $10.00. Drinks seemed affordable. There is even a little room to shake your groove thang if you're into that. Check it out.

12.description: I'm a makeup junkie and these are by far my favorite products. The foundation is just amazing. It blends well and it never feels heavy or cakey. I have sensitive skin and this has never irritated me or made me breakout. For me, it's the perfect foundation. I was in the store a couple of weeks ago and I had a great experience. It was the first time I've bought makeup in a store without feeling like the salesperson was trying to pressuring me. I'll definitely buy my products from this store for now on.

7.description: Sales Gals way to pushy and focused on the up-sell.  I'll stick with Ulta!

19.description: I never use to wear any makeup but sometimes you want to look like you are fixed up.  Simply put,  when I do wear makeup, this is the only thing I will wear.  Sheer, non irritating,  easy to use, has a natural SPF 15 in its mineral foundation,  and lots of great colors to choose from.  I will never use anything else.

1.description: Looks like people have been getting a mix on service in here. I came here back in the Fall of 2012 one early evening to buy eye shadows. When I walked into the store, no one was there to help me. Eventually, when I looked like I was ready to try on a color, someone came to answer my questions. The shadow that I liked they no longer make, so I was urged to try one of their eyeshadow palletes. The  lady who helped me (brown long wavy hair, I know that's not very specific) was SUPER rude and impatient. Literally I was about to walk out of the store. But I liked the neutral eyeshadow pallete enough and decided to give it a try. The whole time the lady who was helping me acted like she was ready to leave and was miserable. When I asked her questions she was being super quick with me and had an attitude.I wish there is more consistency in BE staffs. I've encountered both good, mediocre and now bad ones. BE needs to up their training on staffs.I highly recommend going through the reviews on here and jot down the names of the  staffs that are recommended before going in to avoid a bad experience.

2.description: There is a Bare Escentuals at Macy's, but they don't even come close to the service and care that you get at the proper store in Water Tower Place. I'm makeup challenged, so I appreciate that they take the time to show me how to to use the products and give me a chance to try it myself. They have a great loyalty program called FAB with lots of rewards. If you need a sample, just ask....they are always generous.

9.description: No.Not worth it. I really wanted to like their powders but it doesn't give a flawless finish but more blotchy finish. Also, it made me itchy so I think i'm allergic to it. It can't be my brushes because they're new and I clean them religiously. It's also just way too messy. Put on a tad too much and it'll look caked on, but if you go real light (one sweep or 2) it doesn't offer any real coverage. Their bronzers are too dark and have an icky reddish, orangish tone to it. Out of all the powders I bought, I'm only happy with the mineral veil which is just a translucent powder. I think I'm going back to my trusty MAC and SmashBox.. also MAC's bronzer will look a lot more realistic. You'll also find better blushes with Nars. Good for eliminating shine. Sucky coverage. Made my face itchy after a couple hours, everytime I had it on. So no more, sorry.

6.description: Living in California, there are alot more BE stores, so I've been kind of spoiled. I have super sensitive skin, and nothing- no makeup, no medicine, has ever truly helped or worked. Some foundations camoflagued the issue, but only inflamed and made my skin worse! The first time I wore BE I kept in on for 16 hours, not only did it stay on that long, but I also didn't break out the next day. I was happy, my skin was happy, it doesn't get much better than that.But when I moved from Norcal to Socal, I went from BE being 5 minutes away to 6 hours.I had makeup withdrawals! Aside from using sephora and utla, where they didn't always carry the products that I needed (well maybe not needed, but just wanted really really bad), I got sick really fast of them trying to sell more expensive items that wern't BE, and so I set out to try and find a substitute brand that would last me between my not so frequent trips to Norcal. All of those other companys (this includes the 10 dollar stuff at rite aid and walgreens, all the way up to the e-bay companies that sell "similar" products), could never give me the finish that I wanted, and half the time would make me break out! (If only I had known about QVC back then!)So on vacation to Chicago, I was thrilled to find a BE, and I stocked up on all my must haves. The staff at this store are pretty amazing as well, they do a great job with customer service, and they're alot friendlier than at some of the other stores. If you haven't tried it- you should. I mean how can you go wrong with a free makeover (now they're by appointment only, so make an appointment before you start shopping and then you don't have to sit and wait or wander around till its your turn).

18.description: I love Bare Escentuals!  I have been wearing the makeup for 3 years now and I have more makeup than anyone one person should ever have, it is so addicting to add to my collection!  I purchased my original products on QVC and then started to buy refills locally at Sephora or Ulta but then Leslie opened a boutique in Water Tower this summer.  They have a frequent buyer program and have very helpful employees.  They do makeovers but you'll need to make an appointment.  I have not had one yet but have seen them done and most people getting them are new to the product and staff seem are very helpful and informative.  I am also on their mailing list and received a coupon to use the month of my birthday in the stores.  Prices are competitive with other department cosmetics and last a long, long, long time.  I am still using the original eyeliner that I purchased 3 years ago and I even dumped (on accident) some of it out.  BE is the original mineral makeup and has won a lot of awards from magazines voted by readers and staff.

10.description: After reading tons of rave reviews about Bare Escentuals on the internet, I finally decided to purchase some back in May--it seemed like a huge indulgence at the time, but the products last so long that it's actually turned out to be reasonably economical in the long run. The Water Tower Place location is fantastic. I've been there twice. The first time, I tried the foundation, which is the core of the BE line, and they gave me a generous sample of an incredible acne lotion that I used for almost two weeks. The difference didn't seem that remarkable until I finished the sample and remembered that I had acne problems. The second visit, I allowed them to play a little with the makeup and walked out with foundation, the acne lotion, and one of their kits. The staff was great--super friendly, low pressure, and helpful.Having used this stuff for a few months, I have to say it really has helped my skin. And after trying more products than I care to remember, the acne lotion (MD Formulations Vit A Plus Clearing Complex) has actually cleared my skin! It's not the cheapest solution, but it's the only thing that I've found to consistently work. Yay! The foundation is also fantastic, though having to deal with the brushes takes a while. The only downside is that I have a tendency to drop the containers while in the process of tapping the minerals out (what usually happens is that I'll get too much out and try to tap some back into the container, and then the whole thing will end up in a mess on the floor or sink). I ended up having to replace the Mineral Veil this way.Hint: if you have a little patience, you can usually find new, unopened BE products on eBay for less than they would cost you in the store.

13.description: It pains me to give four stars, because trust me, I LOVE Bare Minerals makeup.  I have been using the foundation, mineral veil, warmth and half of the brushes for about 2 years now, and it never ceases to amaze me.However, if we are talking service, I'm taking one star away because I went in to expand my eye makeup to include their products and was given the 'you must be an idiot if you don't know how we do eyeliner here' look for asking what they sell in terms of eyeliner.  He also could have been more friendly when I rejected the sparkly powder he suggested-club rat at 10 am class is just not my look, sorry.I still bought it though, and yes, the color 'Bark' combined with the lining brush and waterproofing liquid has proven amazing.

16.description: I have loved using these products for almost three years, but I love them even more now that I've visited the Bare Escentuals store in Water Tower Place.  The staff is so friendly and patient and will explain everything to you!  They have a lot more products to offer than Ulta (where I used to purchase my BE make-up) and the best part is the punch card that will give you $10 off of your order once it's full.

17.description: I think I have the weirdest combination skin ever, it's like oily, dry and red in places and I could never find the right cover up to wear.  So, I went to the Water Tower location and they did my makeup for me and it looked so nice and I couldn't even tell that I had anything on.  This is the best makeup ever in my opinion for any skin and it always looks natural.  I would recommend this to anyone............and do actually.

15.description: There are a few infomercials I've been obsessed with over the years. Proactiv, that hot sandwich press, and yes, Bare Minerals. After developing some strange colony of blackheads on my cheeks after age 30, I decided it was time to bid my old foundation and powder adieu, and give Bare Minerals a try. Wow! I love this stuff. At first, I was somewhat skeptical. It all seemed a little "the Emperor has no clothes" when I put it on my face because I couldn't see it. Then I realized that this was its secret: you look like you're not wearing makeup, just that you have perfect skin.  Not only that, it stays that way all day! And yes, the blackheads cleared up (goodbye Clinique!).I got the starter kit, which is a good bargain (even includes a DVD to show you how to put it on!). One tiny pot will last you for a long time! But one star off for the Warmth, which is meant to be like a bronzer. I got the package for Fair skin, and the Warmth is the exact same one thats put in the packages for people with medium and dark skin tones. Why only one shade? The effect on me was very Old Lady in Boca Raton.

0.description: This store is my favorite because the ladies here know wassup. Shout out to Miss Camille!

5.description: I've been using Bare Escentuals for over three years now and am a huge fan. The prdocut stays on, helps keep my skin healthy and just looks great.This store location is close to my home and the staff is always so helpful. They always greet people and always have a solution for my inquiriy.The prices are really great for the quality of the product. I've used a lot of the name brands, Chanel, Lancome, Estee Lauder, Dior, Nars,  etc., and find this product to work better and be priced extremely well for the quality.

11.description: A friend and I walked in two weeks ago to look at their Adult Acne Kit and the staff was very friendly without being too pushy. Answered our questions and even gave us her own experiences with the kit. We not only walked out with our purchase but the clerk also loaded us down with some free samples. Love it.

8.description: I admit that I am a Bare Escentuals junkie and have been for 10+ years.  However, this review if specifically for a wonderful associate at the Water Tower store.  I replaced an old Kabuki brush approximately six months ago and then two weeks ago it sadly came aprt.  I've never had an issue with any other BE brush.  I went into the store and asked if they do any repairs and when I explained to the sales associate what happened she immediately offered to replace my brush.  It is my understanding that BE does not normally do this without proof of purchase and I, unfortunately, did not sitll have my receipt from six months past.  I was absolutely not expecting that type of service but am beyond grateful for it!JACKIE-your level of customer service was impeccable and you are someone who truly understands the clientele of BE and serves as a phenomenal representative of the brand.

3.description: Bare Minerals is the reason I've put all of my other foundations on the sidelines. I don't really have much in the way of blemishes and I've never had acne, but I do have some uneven areas. This gives me just enough coverage, I don't want it to look like I have a ton of foundation on my face. I only use their primer, foundation, and occasionally their mineral veil though (I can't give up MAC and Nars completely!) I'm iffy about their warmth, I'm guessing you only need a teeny tiny amount of that, otherwise it looks too dark. Now the actual store location....I don't think I've ever been in there. LOL

14.description: I love this stuff!! I love it all! The foundation, eye shadows,face color. So easy to put on and never looks cake-y or too made up. I especially love the Mineral Veil, makes your skin look flawless! Try this make up line,it is good stuff!

4.description: The best makeup on the planet. I'm skincare obsessed, and always liked the *idea* of powder for a flawless finish, but could never wear it 'cos my skin is too dry. No more! This stuff makes my face look airbrushed with just a little bit. And no allergic reactions for my sensitive skin. Plus, for someone who is sometimes bad and falls asleep with makeup on, it doesn't matter with this stuff. It's a bit messy to put on, but a small price to pay for makeup that really works. A small fluff of powder and you're out the door - a jar lasts forever!

12.description: This is the first time I've been to a Red Mango that is self-serve. That in itself is a plus. I'm not a fan about weird flavors. I love their raspberry frozen yogurt. Since it is self-serve you pay by weight. I like to get fruit toppings on mine. Friends of mine love to put fruit and even fruity pebbles on their frozen yogurt. The place is on 7th floor of Water Tower. It shares a space with Auntie Anne's.

3.description: Fall from glory...they have been SO inconsistent lately.One time I went in and all the taps were loaded with different flavors and the texture was solid.  They even had two flavors of the new sorbetto.  The dark chocolate sorbetto was so rich for being so light.  I was checked out promptly and even got to use bonus rewards from my mango card.  It was glorious.Another time I went in and more than half the taps were not on and the flavors available were plain and a slight variation of plainer.  Not to mention the texture on some of the flavors came out way to runny.  Then I had to wait to weigh and pay because one clerk was busy cleaning something and couldn't or wouldn't stop to help a customer and the other was in the back.  *Face-palm*

1.description: Ehhhhhhh.  The people were nice and gave us lots of sample cups, but everything tasted watered down or artificial or both. I prefer Forever Yogurt.

2.description: Store Review:FROYO! Somehow the tart of the probiotic filled froyo is something that can't be replicated even if you pay .56 cents per oz. I recently signed up for club mango and had 5 dollar credit to try and I was not let down. It might even be better than forever yogurt. There is a rotating line of flavors but the best was the original and peach flavor that added the right tart. Toppings include mochi, pineapple, strawberries, and mango which is a unique blend of texture. All this in the 16 oz cup topped off for only 6 dollar ish. I believe the froyo must be lighter than the other competitors. Pros- multiple selection of flavors, friendly staff, low caloriesCons- expensive dessertHidden deals-Sign up for club mango, 5 dollar credit when you sign up and 5 dollars for your birthday. Earn credits for more free FROYO

9.description: The froyo was good, but the service...not quite as much.  Found the cashier lady slightly rude, much like many of the other workers in the Water Tower building.  The rare moment I found a nice person, I was pretty shockedI suppose it's convenient for those who want to have self serve frozen yogurt with other food from Auntie Anne's Could use a wider variety of flavours, perhaps I'm too used to Menchies in Canada

10.description: I LOVE RED MANGO. BUT WHY IS THIS PLACE NOT AS GOOD?well, i've decided to ask around, and according to the manager at the lincoln park location, he believes that the melty texture of the froyo here is due to the fact that auntie annes that is connected. therefore, it is alot warmer and causes the froyo to melt, which kinda makes sense i suppose.  But, Red mango's froyo is normally super good! gahh!just disappointed.Guess i'll be going to the lincoln park location moreee.

4.description: I'm glad that I ventured to the upper precincts of Water Tower Place. I usually stop about floor 3-4, for Lucy/SA Elite/Banana Republic. After a particularly intensive experience at the T. Mobile Store to suss out the latest gadgetry to which my plan entitles me, I knew I needed something to take the edge off. I peeked into this location of Red Mango, which happens to be squirreled away next to an Auntie Annies, and was happy to note that the machines are self-serve. When it comes to fro yo, I prefer to customize my own selections and determine how much/little I want versus having someone behind a counter dictate my preferences. I found the price/ounce on the steeper side, though I did enjoy my combination of original tart and Pina Colada. For a once in a while treat, and a worthy reward for braving the throngs at Water Tower, one could do worse than Red Mango.

6.description: Where can you find refuge when your blistered feet are tired of shopping and your bank account has been depleted? Look no further and make your way to the 7th floor and enter the oasis that is Red Mango!After a long day of retail therapy, nothing hits the spot like some froyo. Red Mango shares the the space with Auntie Anne's so you can not only grab a refreshing cup of frozen yogurt, but also load up on some carbs (the pepperoni pretzel is bomb...jus sayin). OK - back to the froyo, RM offers a wide selection of froyo flavors from coconut tart to mango to white peach to my favorite - red velvet. That along with your choice of toppings, nothing can bring you down!So here's how it works - the concept is self-serve so you grab a cup and fill up to your heart's desire of froyo then top it off with their selection of toppings including mochi, fresh fruit, cereal, nuts and sauces. When you're finished, head to the register and you pay by the number of ounces that you're froyo weighs. Simple and quick!Additionally, there's seating along the wall if you choose to chill or you could walk around the mall if you're on the go. Defs recommend coming to this hidden gem when you're having shopping woes or anytime for that matter!

0.description: I went twice during my weekend stay in Chicago. They had white peach flavored froyo. WHITE PEACH. Never have I ever had such a delicious tasting froyo dessert, and believe you me, I've had my fair share of froyo on the East coast. The consistency is a little chunky, but I didn't mind. The strawberry and vanilla were good too! Yes, it cost me more than a comparable-sized froyo cup elsewhere, but for me, it was worth the walk(s) in single-digit temps!

5.description: My friends and I came here with big expectation, but I have to say: it just okay... We tried chocolate flavor, it's a little bit sour.. We don't know why... And the non-patient service let us down again...Anyway, I don't recommend here...

13.description: It's OK,,, but not as good as the other red mango s.

11.description: I'm not sure how new of a development this is, but there is a SELF-SERVE Red Mango in Water Tower...INSIDE of the mall's Auntie Anne's Pretzels. Literally the same shop. We discovered this about a week ago and I thought I'd died and went to salty/sweet heaven! Now that BerriChill is no more, Red Mango is my new fav tart yogurt chain in the city. It's a big chain that I tried for the first time years ago in SoCal. But this is the first I've seen that is self-serve! Like a mini version of Yogurtland! Lots more flavors than in the normal Red Mango shops, and of course since it's self-serve you commitment-phobes can mix and match little bits of each flavor. The toppings are self-serve as well and there are TONS. My fav toppings are mochi, fruity pebbles, and these fabulous flavored boba balls they have (mango and strawberry). They're like regular boba, except when you chew them the fruity liquidy gel pops into your mouth. Just trust me...Needless to say we splurged and got Red Mango aaaand shared Auntie Anne's original pretzel sticks. Perfect saltysweetsaltysweet combo!

8.description: They have a lot of flavors and toppings. Mango was too sweet and very liquidy. I guess their yogurt machines weren't working properly when I went there. I have been to better yogurt cafés before. This is okay but not the best one out there. You have to pay by the weight which is good.

14.description: I don't know why I keep going here, as I always leave slightly disappointed.  I don't find the flavor selection to be all that great, and half the time it seems that they don't have the yogurt dispensers' temperature low enough as often times it comes out drippy and half melted.  Perhaps the other locations in the city are better, but I definitely prefer Forever Yogurt  down the street or Forty Carrots inside Bloomingdale's over this location.

7.description: I'm glad Red Mango is located on the top floor of Water Tower Place as the first time I visited Water Tower, I took the escalators up and circled each floor before taking the escalator up to the next floor.  By the time I reached the top, I was parched and needed something to drink and a snack.  A Red Mango smoothie was the perfect thing to quench my thirst and fill me up just enough before my dinner later in the evening.  Service was quick and friendly too.

3.description: Staying with my family on Michigan Ave. and needed somewhere to eat. Walked into a very crowded Cheesecake Factory and headed straight for the bar. We found an open table quickly but it was quite dirty.The service was great, however, the food was less than desirable. We shared the nachos that were just "ok". This location in general lacked the charm. Will not return, mostly based on that I don't come down to river north often.

1.description: Service was awful. We arrived "mid-shift" of wait staff which may have been part of the problem. Never received complimentary bread. Appetizers took forever to arrive. Then another 20+ min wait for entrees which arrived cold. Two of three entrees were sent back because they were inedible cold. Took another 20+ mins for replacements. They comp'ed two cheesecake slices. Whoopee. Will never go back.

2.description: We order chicken teriyaki the portion was big and the flavour very nice also .Me and my son eat and left food on the plate it's enough for 2 people and 1 kid:-)

5.description: I literally signed up for Yelp just to write this review.  I've ordered pick up from this location about 5 times in the last month and every single time something was wrong.  The first time I walked home with the wrong salad.. the second time I learned my lesson and checked the bag( I had the wrong salad again).  The third and fourth time the salad was missing ingredients but I'd already walked home.  And tonight, I got home and realized they gave me the wrong dressing.  I know they probably don't care about quality control because this location is so popular, but be warned!  Check every single takeout item closely before you walk away!!

6.description: If you have a large group of people and everyone wants something different then this is the place to go.  Their signature lettuce wraps are excellent (pricey).  This one is right below the John Hancock Building and gets very crowded and the seats are VERY close to one another and loud.  Not a great place for a quiet date unless you get a booth in the back.  As for the cheesecakes, there are so many to choose from and I have never had a bad one yet.  The lemon meringue is a recent one I've tried and if you like lemon it's fabulous.  There is a little bit of coconut in it.  Definitely worth a try but beware it is pricey.

7.description: After many trips to downtown Chicago, where tourism is huge, it is a nice to find a place where the staff is genuinely professioal and sincerely kind. The Cheescake Factory in the John Hancock Towers is a great place to relax and eat a  delicious meal. The staff is happy and even the cooks and bus boys are smiling. Everyone there is generallly just " happy!" The friendly hostess, who is bright and conversational seatee me and stuck a a coverstion and asked me about my stay The waiter ,( named Daniel M) was also bright, friendly, calm , and professional,. As I ate my appetizer I watched this truly happy staff be jovial and congenial with the customers, and each other! Wow. My crab and cream cheese won ton type appetizer( do not remember the specific name, was delicious I also orerded the Chicken Regatta , which was also very nicley prepared. In a place where  literally millions travel to for shopping, dining, and cultural events, and many of the tourist employees are rude, this place is THE exception. A classic piece of cheescake with a nice hot cup of Earl Grey Tea completed my visit to the Cheesecake Factory. All of them were smiling.,. not one grumpy face in this place,  So refreshing to have that customer service. And I have visited many places on Magnificent Mile. So go visit them!

0.description: Yes, it is National Cheesecake Day which calls for longer waits and more business. Luckily, my mother and I grabbed a table in the bar section (first come/first serve) within about 10 minutes of arriving. SERVICE: BAD! Our waiter seemed to be out of it. Every time we asked for something he forgot. It would take 2-3 times asking or having to ask another sever before getting something. FOOD: I ordered a Kid's gluten-free pasta with Alfredo. My mother had Spaghetti with Meatball which she liked. When my pasta came out it was not done with a hard texture. I know GF has a different texture but this was terrible! I sent it back and within 10-15mins I had a fresh bowl. This was somewhat better but not the best GF pasta I have had. Thankfully the manager took off my pasta!CHEESECAKE: This restaurant has one cheesecake that is currently gluten-free: Godiva Chocolate. It is delicious and definitely the best part of the meal. Also, because it is National Cheesecake Day it was half-price! I would recommend skipping the food and maybe going for dessert. You can also just order the cheesecake To-Go through the bakery.

4.description: I usually frequent your Orland park or oak Brook location I was at your place in Chicago and wow.... Very disappointed, I'll start with our fried came to the table 6 mins. Before our meal camel wth???? Waitress did not bring me lemons for my water like I asked and the wait for a seat was 45 mins not 10 like I was told.

3.description: This lil' gem was located in the hotel we stayed at whilst in Chicago - Millennium's Knickbocker.  We went down for breakfast twice while staying in the hotel, and it was just all around delicious, quaint, and perfect.Went for the eggs Benedict with salmon the first go around....yes...not vegetarian but fish is the only exception....technically that's pescatarian but anyways.  It was simply amazing.  Th 2nd dish consisted of an spinach omelet....there was another ingredient or two but they've escaped me at the moment.   It was delicious but the salmon eggs Benedict was definitely the better choice of the two.  Both dishes came with a side order of seasoned red potatoes - also amazing.  Both of the waiters were super friendly and on the ball as far as keeping my java intake flowing.  Service was great - food came out quickly.  Overall, both visits consisted of a lovely breakfast experience.  They are more on the $$ end as far as breakfast goes but definitely worth it.

1.description: Good but on the pricey side.  The food was not so fantastic that it set them apart from any other place.  I opted for salmon benedict and I was really expecting the standard slice of tomato on there.  But it only came w/the muffin, smoked salmon, egg, hollandaise.Coffee was ok and they were super generous with the refills.

2.description: I honestly debated between giving a 2 or 3 star rating. The restaurant was clean and had a nice setup. Our waiter was friendly enough, although he charged us for two coffees when we only ordered one. He fixed it no problem. At this point we were ready to pay but he just dropped the fixed bill on the table and walked away. After a few minutes, I went to find him and he was up front counting money when I handed him our bill. A bit odd. The food is what really brought down the score. I ordered the chorizo breakfast burrito and it had a very strange taste ... Almost like a kitchen wash rag. And my boyfriend said his eggs tasted funny as well. It was a big on the expensive side for what it was. I wish we had enjoyed it more because the hotel itself was fantastic.

9.description: Went there for dinner Friday night. The fresh fish special was softshell crab po boy.  I love softshell crab. This po boy was LE-GIT. They fly the softshell crab in live. 'Nuff said. One of the best soft shell crab po boys I've had in Chicago.

10.description: Spendy.  Good food though.

4.description: Just tried it because of the certificate from restaurant.com. The food was okay. Goose Island BBQ Chicken was too sweet. Grilled Asparagus was tasty. A bit expensive. Not a big fan....

6.description: Went for breakfast before checking out of the Knickerbocker after celebrating my beau's birthday. Kinda spendy (wish I would've known they are on Restaurant.com). Omelets were yummay. Nice hotel restaurant.

11.description: liked the warm pretzel roll, got the kobe burger which was a little too dry but still good. also got the prosciutto flatbread w/ mushrooms which was pretty darn delicious. not sure if i'd crave it per se but it wasn't a bad meal

5.description: Food was good enough, but there was an issue with the charge...but first the food:I had the chicken pesto sandwich. The chicken was a bit dry and it needed more pesto flavor, but it wasn't a bad flavor combination overall. And the bun was toasted perfectly. The fries were only ok.Office Mom got the prime burger; she thought it was only ok, but the bacon strip I stole was great.Coworker got the crab salad; I tasted a piece of crab, it wasn't particularly flavorful, but at least it wasn't fishy.Dessert: The caramel brownie was awesome, probably my favorite part of the meal. The lemon tart was meh, and the tart Milano (can't remember the name) was death by chocolate and pretty dry - would not recommend.Then comes the billing portion of the meal. We had a cert, which they took off correctly (and thank goodness - it's got the typical higher hotel restaurant prices). When they went to charge the debit card, they put an extra $13 or so on there. Office Mom gets a text each time her card is used, so she was able to compare it to the bill. When she questioned them about it, first they tried to tell her the charge wasn't closed out yet - but uh, we're treasury folks, we know how the banks work and that's just incorrect... Then we were told the system went down and that they would credit her back the next day - which they did, eventually, but it was still a questionable incident.When all's been said and done, eat here if you can get a discount, but check your charges.

7.description: My husband & I were staying at the hotel and had breakfast here a couple of times.  Everyone is very friendly.  We stopped by on a Saturday about 11:30 and asked if they were still serving breakfast.  Even though they weren't, the waiter said it wouldn't be a problem and brought us breakfast menus.  The food is very good and they give you a lot of it!   My omlette was super fluffy and very filling.  The next day I had the waffles.  Again, super fluffy and very tasty.  Our waiter brought out 3 different butters for me to try.

8.description: Located inside of the Knickerbocker hotel is a nice, comfortable restaurant with a simple menu.  The ambiance is good, the food is good, and the service is very good.  When I was there, the director of the hotel was having lunch with a few executives.  So, is it fair to say that I received a little better service?  Probably so.  But, I still have to rate it a four out of five because I reserve a five for those who have great food, great service at a great price.  We ordered soup, spring rolls, and a crab cake sandwich, and all were delicious.  We also used a restaurant.com certificate without any problems whatsoever.

0.description: Ate here for daily breakfast while we were staying at the Millenium Knickerbocker hotel off of the Magnificent Mile. Menu was simple but pretty delicious. Service varied - overall folks were friendly, but placing your order and getting the food took a little longer than I would have liked.Over the course of our stay we tried the smoked salmon eggs benedict, American breakfast, french toast, blueberry buttermilk pancakes, and the omelette. All of the above were delicious although the pancakes were a little thick. If you get the orange juice, it does taste fresh squeezed like Odwalla, so was pleased it wasn't your typical chalky minute maid stuff.Nice hotel-like decor but I'd allocate a solid 45-minutes for breakfast.

58.description: This location is in the food court of Macy's in watertower.  Got the Dr. Betty.  Burger was not bad overall.  It was nothing really special in my view.  I liked the couple different styles they did have.  Fries were good.  Very thin and crispy.  Just seems like it is a step above Mcdonalds and Burger King and that really doesn't make it stand out that much.

56.description: The Water Tower location is the third M Burger that I have been to.    I've been happy with all of the locations.  However, this is the largest of the burger joints and has its challenges.  Believe it or not, I was there on a Saturday......The restaurant is just outside of the Foodlife Court.  There is not a designated  entrance. If so, would people really pay attention???  However, people do end up in the ordering line.  Line generally moves quickly.  Since the orders are made to order, it may take a few minutes.  By the time you find a seat at one of the communal tables, your order is being called.  I had my usual meal, double cheeseburger, fries and the Cookie & Creme shake which is flavor of the month.  All very good - just like the other  M Burger restaurants.
