What makes the M Burger different?  They have plenty of ice cream to choose for a dessert.  They also sell couple beers on tap.  If I don't feel like eating at MityNice or the FoodLife Court, I would definitely return to M Burger.

29.description: I tried M Burger yesterday for the first time. I ordered the Old Fashioned and was excited to try it, I love a good burger. Two bites in and I was pleasantly surprised. The ingredients were fresh and the meat was delicious. Then it hit me... some sort of horrible burning sensation on my bottom lip. Another bite and before I knew it the feeling/pain was spreading to my tongue and upper lip. I opened the burger and saw some sort of sauce that didn't exactly look like ketchup on the lettuce. I smelled it and was blown away at how spicy it smelled. I immediately went to the counter (sweating and practically in tears) to ask what might be on my burger that was so hot. The girl said that they don't have any sauces that are hot so she wasn't sure. I asked for a manager and waited while she went to the back where I could see her tell my story and I got to watch all of the guys cooking laugh and look at me. WTF?! The manager explained eventually showed up and I explained the situation. I said I wanted to know if there was something hot/spicy that could have gotten on my burger or if I should call 911 because I was possibly having an allergic reaction.  He apologized and said that they have a spicy bbq sauce that must have gotten on my burger. ARE YOU F*CKING KIDDING ME? Excuse me, but if you're going to serve something like that you should probably have a warning sign on the counter or at least make sure the flipping cooks don't put it on anything by mistake and then laugh about it while the customer suffers.The gave me a small cup with some vanilla milk shake in it and insisted that they make me a new burger. That was nice and all, but my mouth was in pain for a couple hours and I wasn't even able to enjoy the food they made so I didn't eat it. :(

42.description: So yeah...I decided to cheat on my fish and chicken only diet to get a burger.  I couldn't help myself; I was hungry and the food smelled sooo good.So I order my food, wait 5 minutes, and receive my order. I think the burger would have been really good if it wasn't so cold.  They must have had it on ice waiting for me. And if you have high blood pressure pass on the salty a$@ fries. Although if you have hypertension you shouldn't be eating here anyway. :)This is what I get for cheating. Next time I'll walk straight pass this place.

23.description: My first time trying this place. I ordered a single cheeseburger, a lemonade and fries. Burger was good. It tastes the way it looks in their ads. The fries were ok, but I hate skinny fries so I wont order those again. Lemonade was good, but could've been a tad sweeter. This food cost me almost $10. Service was quick.

47.description: I was pretty impressed overall, though nearly $10 is still what I consider to be a little too much for a single burger, fries, and a Coke. Friendly and quick service. The burger and fries were both flavorful and delicious. I love the sauce they use on the burger!

8.description: I wasn't blown away with this place, but the burger was good. Far from the best, that's for sure, but above average. I'm doing the low carb thing, so I was glad to see I could order the burger salad style - wrapped in lettuce and no bun. I did try a couple of my wife's fries, and they were pretty darn good. I took a sip of her shake, and that was very good too. This is a good place to get good food on a busy Saturday night at the mall. I'd come again.

31.description: Sometimes you just need a good burger and you never know where it will lead you.Shopping for hours can sometimes trigger this craving.How lucky for us that we found this place!  I was there with some friends and I am happy to say that everyone was delighted with their meals.  The chicken sandwiches were as yummy as the burgers and the fries were outstanding.  The meal seemed to put us in a "pleasure trance".  Although we were quite full, we walked- "zombie-like"- to the adjoining ice cream counter and ordered cones dipped in caramel, chocolate, coconut or other delicious coatings. The sweet treats snapped us right out of  our "zombie" state....We were refreshed and ready to get back to work....the hard work of shopping!A good time was had by all : ))

34.description: Fries are increble. Also recommend the adult grilled cheese... not on the regular menu...a secret yummy delight!

16.description: I really like this place! I came here about a week ago for the first time, and got a bacon cheeseburger and fries. For the price, the food was great! The service was great, the burger was hot and melty, and the fries were crispy. What more can you ask for? I'll definitely be coming back here.

13.description: Mall BurgerM Burger is the upscale McDonalds of Lettuce Entertain You, a corporation that owns a lot of well-known Chicagoland restaurants. There are several M Burger locations in Chicago, but I've only ate at this one which is located by the "food court" on the Mezzanine Level (between the 1st & 2nd Floor) in The Water Tower Place in Chicago, IL. This fast-food joint sells burgers, fries, soft-serve ice cream & shakes. They also offer an all natural chicken sandwich, a free-range turkey burger, a vegetarian sandwich & a chopped chicken salad if beef isn't your baby! If you are counting carbs or calories, or follow a paleo diet, you can request your sandwich or burger to be "salad-style" which is lettuce-wrapped at no extra charge.I ordered a salad-style, free-range turkey burger with tomato & pickles. The burger was juicy & tasty but the lettuce-wrapping was a MF fail! There was only a few pieces of limp, iceberg lettuce draped over the top of the burger nothing around the bottom. A pre-schooler coulda wrapped better than that! The burger was only $3.99 so maybe I shouldn't complain as I'm used to paying at least $10 for a t-bird at most places. FYI: The burger should be completely wrapped in one tight, neat, cohesive, crisp lettuce "bun" like they do at Five Guys & In-N-Out. This isn't brain surgery people!I got a side order of M Fries which only comes in one size for $2.29. You get a bag the size a lil bigger than a small-size fry at McDonalds. M fries are kinda similar to McD's fries too except a lil fancier. These skinny guys are natural-cut & tossed in sea salt. Not the best or worst fries I've ever had, but they're pretty Mmm tasty! Some M-iscellaneous notes:The restaurant is small, not a lot of seating; self-serve fountain drinks; yummy-looking soft-serve: all natural, low-fat M ice cream & shakes sold but I didn't try; food is made-to-order & they call out your number when it's ready to be picked up at the counter. (Also, luv the restaurant name, M is my fave letter!)I had a taste for a burger so I stopped to eat here while I was shopping at the Water Tower Place. Would I make a special trip to this M Burger just to eat here if I wasn't shopping in the Water Tower, Mmm no. But I was impressed that M Burger offers a free-range turkey burger for $3.99 albeit unimpressed by the shoddy wrap-job! However my entire bill was only $6.94 (includes tax, no drink). Really you can't beat that with a drum for lunch on the Mag Mile in Chicago, IL!So if you're shoppin' in the Water Tower & ya have a hankerin' for a hamburger, I don't hesitate to tell ya to take a break & eat at M Burger. It's sure to be the cheapest purchase you make in the Water Tower. M Burger is conveniently located, is a step up from McDs & is servin' up some pretty Mmm good fast food!

11.description: ***This location is inside of the Water Tower, in the lower level food court area.  As such, there isn't that much space, and the noise level is loud.***I've been to M Burger many times, and each time I hope it gets better.  But at the end of the day it still strikes me as an average fast food burger with the slight pretense that it may be better.The patties are so small, it's not even worth getting the single option, double all the way if you want some satisfaction.  The Hurt Burger is the only one really packing some flavor (I prefer mild heat, but have also had medium and been able to take it), but you will want to ask for extra sauce.  But really the sauce and pepperjack are just covering over the blandness of the meat and bun.The fries and shakes are a bit better though.  Fries are thin (not quite shoestring thin) and crispy.  The salt they use to season is good, but they put on a tad too much.  Shakes are solid, creamy, and probably the only thing on the menu that is priced at its true value.  So get a shake.

39.description: Was it a great deal? YESWas it made fresh? YESWas it so hot when I got it? YES Was the customer service friendly?  HELL NOFor 1.99 I got hot freshly made french fries, they were not the best but they were exactly what I expected at a food court in a mall during a lunch rush.  They were busy, the cashier was pleasant enough...if you like dirty looks and not being acknowledged but the kitchen staff were just not happy to be working.  I know it sucks when you're busy at work, but a smile on your face and do your job.  Myself and and other people waited at least 10 minutes... I just ordered fries, everyone was grouchy and clearly did not understand the meaning of customer serviceIt could be better but if you are hungry and craving fast food that you get slowly  go for it.

37.description: Great location...but very small awkward seating. I ordered a Turkey Burger with extra pickles and I didn't get a single pickle. There was like no one there either so them being busy is not an excuse. The Turkey patty was okay. The plus side is that the burgers are small...the way a portion should be. I also had a caramel sundae...nothing special but I liked that they had the option of sundaes. :-)

0.description: FIRST TIMER OVER HERE...And woah... Did not expect this coming at all, but swung by the other night craving a fast food burger and I have to say I may have found my favorite $5 burger. Consider this a compliment coming from a California kid who grew up on In-N-Out double doubles. I'm impressed. The double hurt burger hit the spot like no other for me. The medium was just the perfect spice with that tangy spicy bbq and pepper jack cheese and if I recall correctly sliced jalapenos. Fries were perfection. Also, enjoyed I could ease that spicy off with a pint of beer fresh off the tap. Too much goodness in one sitting.Browsin' their website I saw this link for a "SECRET MENU"... I'm seeing In-N-Out parallels over here. Will need to do some more investigating... Also, thank you for not rushing me even though I was still eating my burger in the dining area past the 8:30pm closing time. 'til next time, cheers!FYI attached photo does not do this meal justice.

38.description: Had the turkey burger which was a little bland, with some sort of weird m burger sauce on it.  Didn't care for the sauce... next time I'll try a standard cheeseburger sans their special sauce and I should be in business.

51.description: Never have I been so annoyed by other people's reviews of a place that I felt the need to mention it in mine. But here goes...what is wrong with you people??? It's a $3 burger at a fast food joint in a food court...you're simply expecting waaaaaay too much. For the people who complained about it being crowded or rushed, it's a FAST FOOD place, it's located in a tiny space in the most crowded food court in the most popular mall on the busiest street in the city of Chicago!! So what if there's no flow or space for you to wait for your burger, booo hooo, get over yourselves!!! They needed to have some seating and they only have so much space to work with, do you have any idea how much rent they pay for that tiny space? Now on to the girl who gave this place two stars because I quote "only vegetarian item on the menu is a patty-less burger with tomato, lettuce and guac"---um, HELLO?!?!? I don't know if you noticed this, but the place is called M "BURGER" not M "VEGETABLE"--check yourself at the door, turn around and walk away because if you're going to diss a burger place for not having a vegetarian-friendly menu, you have no right writing a review for this place.Now back to your regularly scheduled OBJECTIVE review for M Burger. For the category in which it's meant to be judged (fast food burger not gourmet burger), M Burger is pretty darn good. The patties are well cooked and delicious, love the pickles and special sauce (ketchup and mayo). Do get a double if you're hungry because the patties are super thin. Fries are delicious but a tad too salty. Service was friendly (and I was there on a Saturday during lunch). It hit the spot, it was cheap, it was a yummy bite to satisfy my post-shopping hunger. That's all.

27.description: Absolutely unreal. I live super close to this place so when I'm craving a cheeseburger, this is the simplest most obvious choice. This review is more of a pledge, to never go to this particular M burger for as long as I live...no matter how desperate I am! I would say maybe 2 out of 5 times they get my order...the most easy of orders (single-everything but onions) correct. I for the life of my have no clue how one single burger place can make so many mistakes. Usually I check my order before I leave but since it's been awhile I mistook this place for one more efficient and left before I checked it on this day of days.Wouldn't you know it. I get home and what I've received was nothing but utter disgrace. A single...with onions and ketchup. I check my receipt, yep...corresponding number, wrong order. Never.Again. Never...ever...again!!!!

32.description: Great burgers, AMAZING fries, good prices and great locations. Need I say more?

54.description: I'm VERY torn. I live a block away from water tower and was so thrilled M Burger went in...I like that there's a bunch of seating either in the restaurant or in the general food court area. However, something seems off about this location. The burgers don't seem cooked enough. I don't know if they are trying to get the food out too fast but the burgers ARE cooked but not charred in the least...they're kind of gray. Again...they ARE cooked but just past the point of raw. I have been 2x now at different times of day and they were both like this. Not very appetizing...hard to justify the calories.The fries are still stellar as are the shakes. This location also has some sort of ice cream bar with toppings.I will probably come back in a moment of starvation but I really prefer Epic Burger for the price....or a different M Burger location.

48.description: I die for the Chicken Betty.  Best chicken sandwich I've ever had.  They also have soft serve low-fat ice cream with a bunch of fattening toppings.  I die for that too.  So I guess this review is over, since I'm apparently dead now.

44.description: I wanted to eat at Foodlife while on an hour lunch break from a temp job across the street.  The line was crazy- even at 2pm- so I opted for M Burger.  The line was much shorter and was moving along- plus you can take it to go or sit at the tables outside of Foodlife.  I got a chicken sandwich and it blew my mind- again.  It is perfect.  The last time I came here I was actually at Foodlife and went up to the counter through that area.  I was pleasantly surprised and excited to see that they have dipped cones now- yum!  And they have peanut butter dipped cones.  This made my life.  If you are really hungry and, unlike me at the moment, not counting your calories, here is a perfect M Burger meal:Chicken SandwichFries (perfection)Strawberry Shake or...  peanut butter dipped cone

24.description: Good burgers and fresh, crispy fries.  Soft drink prices are crazy (I didn't get my itemized receipt but based on the three other things I ordered, looks like the drink was $2.50 or more?) but I guess that is where they get you!

7.description: My first time coming to this M Burger, I was not a fan. I gave a bad review and told myself I would never be back. A few days later, I was contacted by the manager of the restaurant assuring me that my experience was not normal, and that I should try M Burger again. The fact that the manager cares enough about customer satisfaction that they are spending their time personally contacting me leaves me very impressed.This time around, my burger was delicious. I had no temperature problems, the bun tasted fresh as well as the ingredients. The fries were good just like my last time, and I substituted a shake for an ice cream cone this time around. My food was ready almost instantly and I was treated well by the staff.I am glad I was convinced to try M Burger again. I recommend the restaurant if you are looking for a good burger and some ice cream to go along with it.

49.description: This is located in the Water Tower Food Court... It isn't bad for food court food IMO.I mean, it's no In-N-Out or Habit, but it's better than the other fast food burger chains!The service was fast and friendly, but then again I did come close to closing and not during any mealtime rush. It's a pretty small place/area to sit and dine at so I got my food to go. I tried the M burger with single patty and it was pretty good. I mean, the price is pretty cheap so I can't really complain! The fries are pretty average and nicely salted.This is a burger joint in a mall food court. Considering all these things, it's pretty decent!

40.description: I'm a fan of M Burger, but my M Burger that I ordered from this location was not appetizing.  The bread was soggy and for the first time I forced myself to finish the sad thing.  That aside, located on the Mezzanine level at Water Tower Place, M Burger is convenient for shoppers who need a break and want to grab a quick bite to eat.

53.description: Just try harder. SIGH.M Burger is like that kid in your class that you know is smart but just doesn't apply himself. C'mon dude, get it together! I should have known better - the FoodLife Court was packed, yet no one was in line for M Burger. Still, my optimism won this time and I ordered an M Burger (bacon, cheese, & BBQ sauce) and fries. I got my order within five minutes and it looked just like when that same lazy kid in your class waits until the night before the big, end of the year project is due to start AND complete it. It was a mess. All the pieces were there, but you could tell it just wasn't handled with care, nor did the person who assembled it really give a flying poo if I was going to enjoy it or not. The first bite was enjoyable, but the kid always makes the cover page look nice on his projects, doesn't he? Then, you start to flip through the pages and realize what a shoddy, rushed job he has done.My patty was so small, I finished it and still had a huge chunk of bun and sauce left. Wah. The fries were OK, but didn't make up for the precious calories I was wasting on this meal. The prices are very affordable at around $3-$4 per burger and $2 for fries, but with this (lack of) quality, I still feel like I got ripped off.

30.description: In many ways, so sorry we tried M Burger. The menu, which should be simple, is confusing. Chopped chicken salad in a list of burgers--who knew it's an actual salad? The order taker was absolutely no help. There's a traffic jam at the register, since it abuts the drink stand. But mostly, the food isn't all that good. Why can't every gourmet burger place visit the mothership--In and Out Burger--and take notes. It's not hard--it's a burger!

46.description: This place is a mess. Truly disorganized from start to finish. Waited 15 minutes for my order when the young girl kept giving it away after I told her each time what my order was. Finally I went to the cashier and demanded my correct order, it was made quickly and with a ' charity free burger card' for my wait. If this place is going to succeed train the staff to get orders right, and incorporate a wiser system for executing the order to the pick up. And reduce the music, when you hear what's going on the food is done right.

1.description: Tucked away in the mezzanine level of Water Tower (which I avoid like the plague), M Burger is a tiny QSR amongst the stir of confused tourists. The good: The fries. Not greasy or crazy salted. Shoestring fries in a well-filled paper sleeve. The milkshake. Thick and chocolate my, though I might prefer vanilla next time. The not so good:The small, over priced burger was more toppings than meat. I wouldn't persuade anyone against this place, but I probably won't return. Maybe to a different location.

55.description: So I don't love the Water Tower place food court.... I know I am in the minority - but I was super excited to see the M Burger come in.  On my latest shopping experience - sometime around 4 pm (so not prime time), I decided to grab a burger and fries.Poor execution drives me insane - especially when it can be fixed by management.  I honestly can't imagine eating there at noon on Saturday - it would take forever.  So as we all crowd around the counter waiting for our # to be called so we can grab our food....the women behind the counter would only read one order at a time.  So she would have 4 complete orders (on trays or in bags) and would call out a number and only one number at a time. So if that person was in the middle of getting a drink, she would wait until that person came and picked it up before calling the next number.  It was painful.  They need to go to portillos and take a lesson on how to multitask.The burger was okay - the fries were sub par (and cost $1.99).

9.description: Does the M stand for McDonalds?  Rough first try at somewhere which I had high hopes. They've got great marketing and seem to be popular with locals, but my experience was nothing special. I'll have to try again sometime because maybe what I got was an outlier. They messed up my non-complicated order.The coke coming out of their dispenser was a sad and scary concoction. The fries were bland, I mean... bland for fries. I was going to give it 2 stars but my wife liked her burger.  If you make my wife happy, You get a bonus star. Congrats.

26.description: This was my first time at M burger and I loved what I got....- Cheeseburger salad style.   Juicy, meaty, tasty, delicious. - Fries were crispy, fresh and hotGreat prices, most stuff is less than $5.

25.description: Delicious!  Great typical burger and fries.

12.description: I recently visited the M Burger location in Water Tower Place.  While the food was OK here, I thought other M Burger locations cranked out a better product.  The Hurt Burger just sort of tasted mediocre, the weakest link of my meal this evening - and that should NOT be the case when "Burger" is in your title.  The fries were pretty good, and the orange dream shake of the month was fine, but overall nothing bowled me over.

59.description: Not bad food court type burgers! Fries weren't especially great...kinda dry maybe. The burger was thin, but the bun was soft and it tasted like the whole thing had been steamed. The ice cream bar looked yummy. I'd try it again.

21.description: Mall BurgerM Burger is the upscale McDonalds of Lettuce Entertain You, a corporation that owns a lot of well-known Chicagoland restaurants. There are several M Burger locations in Chicago, but I've only ate at this one which is located by the "food court" on the Mezzanine Level (between the 1st & 2nd Floor) in The Water Tower Place in Chicago, IL. This fast-food joint sells burgers, fries, soft-serve ice cream & shakes. They also offer an all natural chicken sandwich, a free-range turkey burger, a vegetarian sandwich & a chopped chicken salad if beef isn't your baby! If you are counting carbs or calories, or follow a paleo diet, you can request your sandwich or burger to be "salad-style" which is lettuce-wrapped at no extra charge.I ordered a salad-style, free-range turkey burger with tomato & pickles. The burger was juicy & tasty but the lettuce-wrapping was a MF fail! There was only a few pieces of limp, iceberg lettuce draped over the top of the burger nothing around the bottom. A pre-schooler coulda wrapped better than that! The burger was only $3.99 so maybe I shouldn't complain as I'm used to paying at least $10 for a t-bird at most places. FYI: The burger should be completely wrapped in one tight, neat, cohesive, crisp lettuce "bun" like they do at Five Guys & In-N-Out. This isn't brain surgery people!I got a side order of M Fries which only comes in one size for $2.29. You get a bag the size a lil bigger than a small-size fry at McDonalds. M fries are kinda similar to McD's fries too except a lil fancier. These skinny guys are natural-cut & tossed in sea salt. Not the best or worst fries I've ever had, but they're pretty Mmm tasty! Some M-iscellaneous notes:The restaurant is small, not a lot of seating; self-serve fountain drinks; yummy-looking soft-serve: all natural, low-fat M ice cream & shakes sold but I didn't try; food is made-to-order & they call out your number when it's ready to be picked up at the counter. (Also, luv the restaurant name, M is my fave letter!)I had a taste for a burger so I stopped to eat here while I was shopping at the Water Tower Place. Would I make a special trip to this M Burger just to eat here if I wasn't shopping in the Water Tower, Mmm no. But I was impressed that M Burger offers a free-range turkey burger for $3.99 albeit unimpressed by the shoddy wrap-job! However my entire bill was only $6.94 (includes tax, no drink). Really you can't beat that with a drum for lunch on the Mag Mile in Chicago, IL!So if you're shoppin' in the Water Tower & ya have a hankerin' for a hamburger, I don't hesitate to tell ya to take a break & eat at M Burger. It's sure to be the cheapest purchase you make in the Water Tower. M Burger is conveniently located, is a step up from McDs & is servin' up some pretty Mmm good fast food!

17.description: This was my first time at M burger and I loved what I got....- Cheeseburger salad style.   Juicy, meaty, tasty, delicious. - Fries were crispy, fresh and hotGreat prices, most stuff is less than $5.

10.description: The Heat Is On!Been to a few M Burgers, and overall they're pretty nifty.  The single-patty items are a little pricey, and the fries are just so-so, but the shakes are great and the super-secret menu is an awesome feature.  Particularly, I love that their 'hurt' burger (pepper jack cheese, fresh un-seeded jalepeno slices, fiery bbq sauce) has several tiers of intensity.Encountered some communication problems with the register girl.  I had to repeat my order several times, and at one point she asked me if I wanted my hurt burger wrapped in lettuce.  What?  Why would I want that?  All in all, she gave me a very deer-in-headlights look, which was a frustrating experience.  She also neglected to give me a drink cup at first.  I ordered the 'hurt' burger with heat level 3, the maximum setting.  This greatly perplexed her, but thankfully, one of the guys in the kitchen overheard me asking them to 'step it up a notch', and he shot me a "yo bro I GOTCHU!"  When my order number was called, I verified "this is a level 3, right?" to which I was told "......it's more like a level 5."  Perfect.  LET'S DO THIS.~Sticky Fingers Challenger~Watertower Place M Burger'Hurt' Burger - Level 54/4 screaming skullsVerdict: ow ow OWWWW.  So much pain, so much pleasure.  Symptoms include watery eyes, runny nose, intense facial coloration, shortness of breath.......and euphoria.  I would NOT recommend that ANYONE attempt to do what I did, because it's foolish and prideful and will in all likelihood send your internal organs into a massive panic attack.Caty D: "are you okay? you're turning weird colors"Me: "yep fine" *wipes sweat from forehead*Caty D: "do I need to call an ambulance?"Me: "nahhhh......probably not.......I don't know.......maybe."Honestly guys, I struggled to keep my sh*t together.  I can handle nearly anything spicy that's thrown at me, and M Burger's hidden "Level 5" Hurt Burger was at the exact threshold of what my body can tolerate.  Anything more, and it would've been inedible.  It was indeed that hot.  As much as I valued the experience, once was enough.  I'll stick to a more modest level 2 or 3 henceforth.  But all in all, I would certainly return again for a burger + shake + fries.I'll end this one with a lyric from 80's supergroup 'The Power Station':"Some like it hot and some sweatWhen the heat is onSome feel the heat and decideThat they can't go onSome like it hot but you can'tTell how hot 'til you trySome like it hot, so let'sTurn up the heat 'til we fry"

5.description: Chicken sandwich is delicious and juicy. Their fries are yummy. I just feel claustrophobic here so just sit out in the mezzanine.

3.description: I look forward to returning to M Burger when I actually try their burgers and fries. At this point I have only tried their dip cones and they are delicious! Tastes just like dairy queen! Provided that this is in a mall food court, the service was quick and easy on a Saturday afternoon! There is not a lot of seating inside the actual restaurant though

35.description: In my pre-Celiac days, I frequently ventured over to M Burger for a tasty burger and fries over lunch. Since having to go gluten-free,  my burger & fries days are long gone, but thanks to M Burger - I can still indulge every once in a while when a salad just won't cut it!Order your burger without a bun (and no special sauce) and instead get it wrapped in lettuce and you won't really miss the bun too much. They have single or double patties and are always juicy and tasty. The best part is that their french fries are gluten free since the fryer is exclusively for fries - nothing else is fried in there! Fries are SO good - lightly salted with sea salt, skinny, not greasy and perfectly crispy. Tip: Line moves pretty quickly even over lunch - so don't be discouraged by the long lines!

19.description: The food is typical M Burger and if you are familiar with what that is, you will not be disappointed one bit. It is VERY good as I have grown to expect. What I was not impressed with at all was how unfriendly people were. I know this is an EXTREMELY busy location but still at least pretend that you are pleased for me to spending my money in your place. I really do understand the fact that you want to move the line along as quickly as possible and i appreciate that. At least give me glimpse of friendliness please.

28.description: This location used to be fine but the last couple of times the fries have been old/stale and the burger lukewarm with dry buns. ehhh. Huron and Ontario locations seem to consistently be better in this regard.

45.description: I love M burger. They're signature burger is amazing! They are comparable to other fast food chain prices, but their ingredients are fresh and many are locally obtained. I just recently made my hubby a fan as well as my vegetarian 5 year old daughter who devoured the nurse Betty.

33.description: While suit shopping at Water Tower, we decided to grab lunch and after pushing through the throngs of little girls with their dolls in the food court, stumbled upon M Burger.  Since I've become jaded to the whole "fancy burger" trend thanks to subpar experiences at Epic Burger, B Spot, Five Guys and In-n-Out, I wasn't expecting much. Thankfully, M Burger was able to deliver a decent burger that tasted very good.  The burger had a great fresh taste and didn't need ketchup.  The fries were also quite tasty.  M Burger definitely is better than most of the other burger places that have popped up recently.  Of course, Shake Shack come to Chicago, you might have a fight on your hands!

43.description: i am a fan. i got a double M Burger.first thing i tasted was some kinda sweetness... then i realized that it was the bacon. sweet ol bacon on a good ol burger. oh my gad. so good. mmmm.the fries were also pretty good but that baconn. there was no line when i went, which prolly meant the workers werent overwhelmed with a swarm of hungry people, which prolly means happier workers who were nice to me.... so no complaints about that! 4/5 for awesome burgerss but not the bestest ever! sorry mburger, but i still love you!

2.description: M Burger is nothing complicated.  Many people have described it as an upscale imitator of McDonald's, and that really does hit the nail on the head.  The primary difference is the quality - you're a lot less likely to wind up having gas for some reason, the cheese is a lot nicer, and the beef has a superior texture.  My only real beef, if you will, is that the fries only come in one size, and that size is large.  I can never finish them if I am eating here by myself - which is often the case, as I work in the building.  I'd actually buy them more often if a smaller portion size were available at a lower price.The basic grilled chicken sandwich is still available off-menu, even though they swapped it out for the Chicken Betty among the advertised offerings.  It's pretty good, but I've found that you have to order chicken well-done here to get it fully cooked.  But if you're after chicken, Chick Fil A is only a couple blocks away and does that much better; M Burger is about beef.

18.description: I have been to several M Burger locations and I will continue going to those. This was my first and last time at the Water Tower location.My low rating addresses only the service; I cannot fairly comment on the food. Why? Because when I walked in and placed my order, I had time to sit down and enjoy my lunch. But by the time I actually received it, I had to pretty much inhale my food and sprint to work on a full stomach. I really didn't get the time to taste it.The employees here seem to be moving as slowly as possible--example later on--and seem to truly hate their jobs. Contrast this with every other M Burger where everyone is cheerful and pleasant, and full of smiles and small talk. The food comes out quickly, and where it cannot, you are offered an explanation and apology.Not at the Water Tower location. There was clearly a delay--no one was in line ordering when I arrived, but a lot of people were sitting around waiting for their food and boy did we wait. No explanation was given for the long wait, nor did anyone apologize for it. When the cashier was not taking orders, she was just staring off into space, not helping with the orders like I have seen at other locations. Once I finally received my food, I asked the food runner for a bag, since I knew I would not be able to eat it all before I had to leave. This is how that exchange proceeded:Me: Can I have a bag?Him: A bag? Sure. (Pause).(Slowly meanders the two large steps to where the bags are stored.)(Pause.)(Take a bag.)(Stand there looking at it.)(Enjoys a leisurely stroll back to the counter.)(Hands it to me.)Honestly, I am trying not to be the kind of person who thinks that this employee was mad at me for asking for something and was taking his revenge by intentionally taking that long, but I just can't think of another reason why a person would move that slowly. There's too many other locations for me to put up with this. Even for the Chicken Betty and Nutella shakes.

41.description: I was really craving a burger and their fries looked good so I wanted to give it a try.  I got the M Burger which was good, not super awesome but good, plus it had bacon and bacon is great.  The fries were good as well, seasoned with sea salt and cut thin.  However, their shake was the worst.  I asked for a neopolitan shake, and I ended up with a chocolate/strawberry shake.  I planned on dipping my shakes in my fries which was pretty much pointless because I didn't really want to dip my fries in chocolate.  A shake may not be the biggest deal to complain about but I was really excited for it and wanted it to complement my meal.  The shakes at In-N-Out are way better, creamier.  But the ones at M Burger are low-fat which is probably why it didn't taste as great.

52.description: It was lunchtime...I felt like a hearty meal so burger came to mind.  Plenty of people here so it must be good right?  Long lines and a tad unorganized.  The lines for ice cream and burgers seemed to bottleneck and many didn't know what to do.The servers were friendly and smiled and obviously have a ton of patience.  The M burger seemed to be a good choice with bacon, cheese, and "sauce", but fell short of a hearty meal.  With dozens of people in line, the burgers came out a little too quick.  By that I mean, maybe not cooked to perfection.  A little charring would have nailed it.Come here on a Saturday at lunchtime - you are crazy!

50.description: I am astonished my the negative reviews of this place. My friend coerced me into coming to this place despite the fact that I am watching what I eat. However, I was in love with my meal. I loved our cashier. She was so pleasant. I wish I knew what her name was but she would always end her sentences with a term of endearment like pumpkin or sweetie. She called the person behind us "my queen." I swear these terms of endearment brought a huge smile to my face.I ordered a single patty burger with the fries. The burger was pretty good, on par with In and Out without the sauteed onions though. I wish I had gotten a double because a single patty was not enough for me. The fries were pretty good although I wonder whether they make them fresh from real potatoes like In and Out. This will be my go to place for a good inexpensive burger in Chicago.

4.description: You're typical burger joint. One of the employees felt it was needed to sweep while we were eating, literally under our feet

6.description: Chicago could really use a great fast food burger - this isn't it.  The burgers aren't particularly large, they are pretty dry and the toppings aren't anything special.  I've tried several of the ice cream items and the problem is that they use a mediocre quality soft serve that spoils whatever they try to do with it. The fries are pretty good but not worth a visit just for that.

22.description: How did they do such a great turkey burger for such a low price in this location? Inquiring minds want to know. Fast, juicy and delicious. Crowded, but what should I expect the week of Christmas?

15.description: I want to start by saying this place is disgusting. The employees were rude and the cleanliness of the establishment was unacceptable. See pictures for details. I don't think I'll be back to this location. It's too much of a hassle for an average burger. Corporate or management should really look into this location.

57.description: Nurse Betty, the only vegetarian item on the menu is a patty-less burger with tomato, lettuce and guac. Did not make me go MMMMM... Their malts were too sugary and not the shake/malt craving satisfier I was seeking.. This is their 4th location and in Water Tower Place, right next to and within Foodlife, the Mezzanine food court.

20.description: The burgers seemed tiny and unsatisfying. After having a Classic I felt like I still wanted a burger. The fries were well cooked but grossly over seasoned as well. I wouldn't go back.

36.description: Solid place to grab a quick bite.  We were famished after walking around the lake and Mag Mile all day and needed something to eat NOW before we headed back to the car.  Our made-to-order burgers were quite good -- was hunger a factor? -- and they were gone in 30 seconds.  M Burger reminds me of what In-n-Out would be if it upped its interior decor!

14.description: Burger joint in the mall.  I like the concept, they reminded me of 5 guys on one level, but the burgers were pretty tasty. The fries were damn good too.  The service was quick and easy, and they weren't too expensive either.  However.. they were crowded because of the way their table set up is.

3.description: If I could give no stars I would. This was by far THE WORST manicure I have EVER gotten. I'm pissed at myself for even paying. This place should not be in the John Hancock. And for the prices they charge (it's no deal) they should have the place cleaned up and actually take care of their clients instead of doing a less than half ass job. I think she spent a total of 15 minutes "cleaning up my nails & painting them" and the paint chipped that night. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. I can't believe they have enough clientele to stay open. Do not waste your time. You will not be happy with the outcome.

1.description: This is the worst pedicure I have ever gotten in my whole life. I said "ow!" at least 5 times and he didn't seem to care. He cut me then put alcohol on it and burned like crazy. There was no massage of my feet or legs. He rubbed my feet for 1 minute with dry rubber gloves. The next morning I woke up with scabs bc he filed my skin. And it's also dirty, silent (besides the scrambled tv) and workers were eating. Don't do it.

2.description: I used to come here with my mother when it was "Fingers and Toes" and always had a great experience.  So we decided to try it again and it was literally the absolute worst experience I've ever had at a nail salon.  First they didn't have anyone on staff who could do a gel manicure even though we booked an appointment.  So they called some friend and I had to wait half an hour just to get started.  Soon after I realized this woman had no clue what she was doing.  I should have stopped her but my nails really needed to be fixed.  Not only was it the worst looking manicure ever... soon after leaving I realized every single one of my fingers was all cut up and bleeding.  My mom's fingers were cut up too.  We called the credit card company to cancel the payment, but they wouldn't do it without a drs note!  Stay clear of this place!  It was shockingly horrible.

5.description: I got a pedicure here a few months ago that was fine but got a no-chip manicure ($40) on Monday that's so sloppy, it's embarrassing. And it took a full hour from start to finish. I work in the building but no amount of convenience is going to get me to come back. I'd give it one star were it not for the decent pedicure I got here previously.

6.description: Came here the other day for a no chip because I work in the building.  It's super bright white inside, kind of blinding actually.  My no chip was expensive-- $45.  I added a tip, and I don't think excess of $50 for a no chip every two weeks is reasonable.

7.description: Go someplace else, not worth it. I decided to give this place a shot, since it's new, to have gels done. By the time she was done "shaping" my nails, there's hardly any white tips left (pointless when getting white tips). I never knew if she was talking to me or someone else, probably because I there were two people crammed on either side of me about 2 inches away. The gel has bubbles, I thought my nails were going to separate from my finger tips while she was working and for $50?! I'm so not happy. Choose wisely if you want to go here, I'm going to be busy scraping the extra glue off my fingers for the next 3 days.

8.description: The only thing I can say about this place is that it's fast.  I've been there twice, and the first time my manicure started chipping in 3 days. I figured this was a fluke, or I had spent too much time with my hands in water, so I went back. On that second visit, the nail tech did not clean off the excess from my cuticles after painting my nails, and when I came home I noticed they were somewhat scratchy. I took a closer look and saw streaks in the color application, that the color was uneven around the tips, that she didn't re-glue the patch properly,  and that one of my nails had a rough edge because it wasn't buffed completely!  Chipping started on the 4th day.  Their space at 875 N Michigan used to be "Fingers and Toes", which was great.  No one at Azure will talk about why they are gone, and since I had been given a gift certificate to Fingers & Toes, I was disappointed to lose the gift.  When I asked the new owner about Fingers & Toes, he was very unfriendly.Needless to say ,I won't be going there again.

0.description: I was worried after reading all the bad reviews for this place, but since it's near my office I gave them a try. My manicure was great! I did let them talk me into the VinyLux for $3 more (regular mani $17, VinyLux $20), and my girl Chi was very detailed and nice, and I walked away with a beautiful nails. It's certainly not the most beautiful space in the world, but I'm happy to have another go-to nail spot in the neighborhood.

4.description: Overpriced ... Different treatments for everyone ... Some people get back massages after nails and some don't.  Some get great long pedicures with great scrubbing and others don't.  My feet are just as rough as they were when I came in... Basically just a polish change.

58.description: I can not stop eating at this place. Given it's proximity to school and the quality I go here at least 2-3 times a week. They have everything I could want. A super fresh salad bar with everything I could think to put on my salad and a ton of vinagrettes/oils to add on. They also have a cold and hot food bar with amazing premade salads and a mac and cheese that I never pass up :).If food bars arent your thing they also have a bunch of prepared foods. Or you could get one of their many fresh soups. Or sushi. Or sandwiches. Yeah. Love.There is a decent amount of seating and they open up a back area during really busy times. 10% discount for northwestern students and employees. I think after 5 pm you can get dinner, though I am not sure what it includes, for just $10.

56.description: Everyone who works here is so amazing!!!! If you go at the right times (11:30am and 6:00pm) you will have plenty of options to choose from that are very wonderful. If you go other times, the food just seems really picked over. Also, NEVER go on the weekends - the crowds are just so awful and you will never want to go back.

29.description: Hot food, soup, salad bar, sushi, fancy water,   designer chocolates and candies, prepackaged salads, tort as...all in one place! It's probably the best fast food on Michigan Avenue. Ok, it may be the only fast food within a few blocks from Water Tower Place. I don't do typically greasy, nasty, mystery food fast food so this was a welcomed find when I was pressed for time. I had spicy tuna sushi, lentil soup and an orange and ginger spa water. All pretty good, especially the soup!And p.s. I was really impressed that they had a deluxe hand washing station.

42.description: I first entered in this bustling compilation of food in search of some hot food that wasnt tied to a link card (like in Foodlife). When I saw the restaurants posted on the board, I definitely had to try it. And since then I'd go in whenever I needed a pick me up from work. The selection is incredibly vast for a cafeteria styled eatery. The offerings change from day to day and there are always interesting options to try. While many of the more famous restaurants on the list don't typically bring their signature dishes, they still bring quality in the dishes they do serve. There many things to like about FoodEase -- Huge selection of foods... hot foods, soups, made to order sandwiches, extensive salad bar, wrapped foods to go, sushi... etc. - quality ingredients and preparation from some of the great restaurants in Chicago- I have yet to encounter a really busy time, so its usually fast and painless to go through, make your selection, and enjoy your food- a nice seating area with a TV and a stand alone bar- very nice reusuable plastic containers for your foods, and small discount if you use a plate (dining in). So an underlining theme of going Green (if you're into that sort of thing).In the couple of times I've been in there have been a very small amount of bad things that I've noticed about FoodEase. - this only pertains to the hot food, but some of the food that sits out too long tends to get very dry. Causing the consistency of some of the items to go down. Some of the items are storage proof, some aren't.  And it's difficult to make that assumption just by looking at the food. - the different number of restaurant offerings will cause some foods to be very goods and some not so much based purely on preference. - it does get a bit pricey for what you're getting. A trip there is usually $10+ without a drink, with a very moddest pile of protein and veggies (and a splash of carbs). While I have no issues paying that at a sit down place, I still haven't gotten over the sticker price shock of paying that for cafeteria styled food. Overall, it's a great option in the area. And you can do a lot worse in terms of pricing. I enjoy coming here, but can't make it a regular spot because it's probably not worth it.

23.description: Gourmet food market located in the food court of water tower place.  We visited as a part of a food tour and were greeted by executive chef Janet and we got to taste a gourmet toffee.  We were primarily focused on their "chocolate closet" a little book packed with lots of gourmet chocolate confections.  They've got quite a lot of goodies to choose from if you are hungry and looking for some gourmet goodies.

47.description: I only had the salad bar but it was well stocked with 80+ ingredients which were all fresh, clean and presented well. The best salad bar I've seen in a long time. I had a large salad and my companion had a small. Each of us has a drink. $40. Seems a little high as far as salad bars go but I had no regrets.

8.description: Food is good but the service is slow  tons of workers but no one helping you very frustrating when your on your lunch break  !!!!

31.description: Foodease is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. DEFINITELY the best salad bar. They offer great raw veggies, dressings, and cooked foods as well. I appreciate that they use biodegradable to-go ware. They also have the machine that dispenses any sort of pop with any flavor! Would eat her errday.

34.description: I love coming to this place specially because of all the variety of food. Everything Taste so fresh and for a great price. From soups to meat, everything looks so good!

16.description: Hah! Love it Leave it to Chicago to do a mall right with a bad ass market restaurant with a wine bar.  27 restaurant appearances, enjoying a bottle of a San Francisco Pinot Noir ($9).  Hand washing station in lobby, tons of buffet style choices.  Trail mix nut section, bakery, chocolate closet (very tempting), sushi, sandwiches, soup bar, wine shop (great prices) quiet room, etc.  No need to leave the mall in the snow for a great fresh lunch.  At $5Per pound the buffet is a great value.  While mac n cheese, fried tofu and snow crab tomato and spinach was great the pork loin rocks!

13.description: the meh is on price of item not quality. Lookit: I filled a cardboard box with my own salad items trying to steer clear of heaveir items casue gawd knows you get penalized for that as price by the pound. anyhow, a box of salad and fixins (cucs, onions, olive slice you get the drift) cost me $14.25 wtf and im now eating pretzles 'cause like im still way hungry. wtf.hey pretty good salad (should be I picked the ingrredients lol) but. 14.25?? ..wtf.naw.

11.description: Fantastic place for lunch! So many delicious and healthy options and you can make your portion as little or large as you want. Can't beat the wine bar either :)

39.description: Great place with great food to recharge after all the mall walking and exhausting card swiping lol....

37.description: I really can only comment on the salad bar because it's so good I haven't yet managed to make myself try anything else here. Even at peak times, it's pretty easy to navigate the bar, which is always fully stocked with all the salad accoutrements. Seriously, they are constantly refreshing and replacing the food, and quality is very high. The array of standard salad bar options is great, but they also have options you don't always see-- quinoa, wheat berries, lima beans, etc. Also, I could probably live off their marinated mushrooms for the rest of my life and be happy-- they're that good.The coolers also contain a great variety of both main meals (sushi, sandwiches, etc.) and snacks (hummus, hard boiled eggs, cheese, fruit cups, etc.). My only minor gripe is that I wish they had more low-fat salad dressing options!

0.description: Great fresh salad bar, hot food bar, sushi market. Excellent healthy and local food sources. A great find!

38.description: Ugh.  I really liked this concept and wanted to like the food.  I just didn't.  I am a HUGE fan of these Whole Foods-like places but there was just something lacking with the food at Foodease.  Some items were too bland, others had WAY too much dressing, and the sushi was only meh.  The chocolate selection was terrible.  If I was local I'd consider giving it one more shot but given the hefty price tag I'd think twice.

51.description: I WOULD EAT HERE EVERY DAY OF MY LIFE - if i only lived in Chicago. This is one of those places where EVERY ONE can be happy with multiple items ! There is an enormous amount of salad bar options, in addition to pre made salads and  a variety of soups !! and sushi!! and hot bar !! with lots of veggies and other yummy things !! a bakery section too !! and candy !! and drink machine, this place is just AWESOME !!!!they weigh out your food, sooo it just depends how expensive you want to make it.its located perfectly in the water tower - i think its the "healthy take " on the Food Lyfe cafe end.theres a little wine bar, with cheese and meats too! in the front** reduced pricing for dining in and being eco friendly !

27.description: This place was amazing. I went with a friend who had already been here before, so I kind of tagged behind her in the buffet area but there were also pre packaged and fresh looking items and beverages along the wall. Also, some great looking desserts. I got the large to-go container and chose the mashed potatoes, Mac & cheese, sweet potatoes,(I obviously like my carbs) steamed broccoli, brown rice and one chicken drum stick. There was also a large salad, fruit and veggie section but I didn't really go over there. It was a bit pricey, mine came out to about $14.50, but it was worth it. The mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese were sooo very amazing. DO get them, please. The sweet potatoes were also very good. I think they were honey glazed or something if I remember correctly. Chicken was just okay, though. Brown rice was a bit dry and bland but everything else was enough to get me hooked. A couple people around me had great looking salads. They have a lot to choose from and you are in control of your portions which is pretty nice. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone, as long as they promise to try the mashed potatoes and Mac & cheese. ;)

32.description: I love this place. Nice salad bar with a rotating selection of hot food from different restaurants throughout the city. They also offer a nice selection of prepackaged foods to go. It's a great spot for lunch or to pick up something on the go.

54.description: I'll be honest, after passing by Foodease on numerous occasions, I never thought it looked like anything special... Until I actually tried it. Who would think you could actually find good food inside a shopping center? And I mean really good food at that.The Blue Pig and Fig sandwich is a must try.  It consists of prosciutto, blue cheese, arugala, and a little house made sauce on a pretzel baguette.  So good.  Want to know what's even better?  The Edamame Hummus.  It's the perfect consistency and packs amazing flavor.Surprisingly, I'll be going back!

48.description: A large part of me loves cafeteria style restaurants but it's nearly impossible to find one that actually has great tasting food. I am in love with Foodease, it's concept, their food, and everything else about it. Chicago is a bustling city and food is everywhere. Water Tower Place is a neat indoor shopping mall but I would honestly go there just to get food! I found Foodease just by simply following the signs for "Food" and my eyes were instantly drawn to this restaurant. Image a University's dormitory cafeteria but with fresher and better tasting dishes. They have everything from a salad bar, soups, a sandwich bar, hot food bar with entrees-like dishes from fine restaurants, and desserts!When you grab a plate (25 cents off your bill for being green!), you will feel overwhelmed by the selection that Foodease has. Since I'm not from Chicago, I tried to pile as much food as I possibly could in one plate so I could have a taste of everything! Now, keep in mind that this is a "health conscious" type of restaurant so some of you may not give this place a chance but you need to take my word and most of the reviewers words and try it out! Some dishes I found to be very tasty were: the garlic noodles, vegetable empanada, carnitas, anything with quinoa, and a very interesting buffalo lasagna. I made of mistake of not trying a dessert even though a Chicago local told me that their brownies were one of the best. I guess I will just have to visit again. Unfortunately I was too fixated on the food on my plate to know how much the prices were but it is calculated by a certain $ per pound. It probably isn't the cheapest food but certainly not the most expensive. I could eat at Foodease every day and am glad there is not one near me, otherwise I would be extremely hefty.

44.description: I go here 3 times a week-- amazing and FRESH salad bar. Hot bar with options from the various Lettuce Entertain You restaurants.  It can get expensive when the food is finally weighed, but the convenience is unparalleled for me.  GO if you are in the area for take out! or a quick bite at the tables.

24.description: Cons: $11 is a lot for chips and a sandwich (Shout out to Hannah's Bretzel for also eclipsing the $10 threshold. Keep getting them checks, Hannah!)Pros: The Banh mi had all the right moves.Would return (begrudgingly).

7.description: The best part of this little market in Water Tower Place is the wine bar. It's so cool and chill, and seriously the best wine value on the Mag Mile. $7 daily wine special every time I've gone in, a cheerful, friendly bartender and a nice pour. It's a great place to watch people. The salad bar in the market looks LEGIT, and there are some inexpensive wines to be had. Definitely worth a visit if you are in this totem of consumerism and don't feel like spending a lot of money.

49.description: If don't feel like a great sit down lunch or dinner at Mity Nice or eating at the Food Court, Foodease Market is the place and a great little oasis in the Watertower Shopping Center!  Upon entering the market, will be a list of contributing Lettuce Restaurants which you will have the opportunity to try from when you are heading down the hot items area.  The market is very planned out.  Along the wall are the prepackaged salads, sandwiches or liquids.  The first aisle is the salad bar.  Generally, there are four types of greens to choose from along with twelve or such confinements and about six different dressings to choose from. The second aisle is designated as the hot items and where you try items various Lettuce Restaurants. The items do change so you never get bored with having the same items. On a morning run over to the market, I have been very lucky to have discovered their hot cinnamon rolls.  OMG!  Be prepared to share that roll.  The roll was huge and sweet.  Sure bets other cinnamon rolls that I have had at other businesses.  Again, check out the hot aisle.The third area to mention is the counter.  Is where you can have sandwich and other items specially prepared to you - which I have not tried yet.There is a designed wine room.  The prices range as well as the flavors.  If you have any questions regarding wine just ask ... there are very acknowledgeable associates that will be able to assist you. Continuing around the market, you will find various coffees, teas, muffins, sweet items. You will definitely find something to eat.   The Raspberry Anglefood muffins are to die for (personal opinion).The staff has always been very pleasant and helpful.  Go and indulge.

40.description: Another great LEYE place that's close to work. I've visited Foodease numerous times, but always got too overwhelmed with the all the delicious stations and salad bars to actually buy anything.  Mostly because Mburger next door always wins me over...that burger...Today I stopped in again with a craving for something sweet and saw the freezer with Jeni's Spendid Ice cream and Homer's Homemade Ice Cream and I immediately reached for those and got in line.  There goes my plan to eat a healthy salad today!  They also sell frozen Lou Malnatis deep dish pizza and other Leye frozen favorites.  Oh and the wine bar is pretty nice, too.

53.description: This is a review for their first Chicago Brewery event hosted this past Friday night. Our interests were piqued when we found that a few of the Chicago breweries we'd been meaning to try were going to be at Foodease all at the same time. The event was only $10 and I would say we got our money's worth.Location: Foodease wasn't hard to find in the overly-packed, sometimes-confusing Water Tower Plaza. Up the escalator to the 2nd floor, then down the other set of escalators to get to the mezzanine. Once you're on the Mez, you'll see a bunch of other restaurants and it's a matter of time before your eyes are zoned in on Foodease. I was really excited to see they offer a ton of fresh and local food options and that was the first thing that caught my eye.There was a bar and also a small area with tables for people to come in and grab a quick bite. The event itself was back past the wine into a back room. The room was smallish and definitely not enough room for all of the people trying to grub and drink.Food: There were a few different things offered. Foodease offered homemade pretzels with beer cheese and also pork sliders braised in Revolution's Eugene Porter. I liked the beer cheese, but the pretzels didn't do it for me -- they could have been softer and warmer. The pork sliders were the highlight of my night though. The guy serving was really nice and didn't judge me when I asked for seconds. There was also a cheese tray in the middle of the room, where I found myself standing most of the night.I also got to discover Big Fork brands, which is bacon sausage made in Chicago. Holy cow - that stuff is good. No longer do you have to choose between bacon and sausage. You can have both! I checked out the website and there's a bunch of locations around the city and 'burbs that sell it, so I'll be buying it soon. (It's also sold at Foodease, but I didn't want to have to carry it around since we were going to be going a few places afterward.)Beer: Finch, Revolution, Two Brothers and Metropolitan all made it out. Half Acre was supposed to be there, but weren't for some reason -- boo! Getting to talk to all of the brewers was the best part. It's great to learn a little bit more about the tastes and history of the brewery and the beer itself. My favorite beer of the night was the banana beer from Two Brothers. I bought some that night :)Overall: the event was a lot of fun and I'm so glad I went. We only stayed about 40 minutes as I am a little bit of a people phobe and can only take being smushed for so long. Other than the lack of space, the event was a success! I got to try beers from 3 breweries I've never been to plus drink Revolution which always makes for a good evening.

30.description: I'm super impressed by this place, kind of the Gucci of salad bars, but somehow still affordable. I think it beats out even a Whole Foods, and given the dearth of affordable non-chain options in the area (especially for vegetarians and vegans), this place is a godsend. Lots of grain and noodle dishes, glorious roasted vegetables and every greenery you could desire. Of course their meat options also look delectable. This place is an improbable and welcome find.

46.description: There are so many things to like about Foodease, that I do not know where to start.  Maybe, it is the fact that its name is super punny!  Or, that it is the best hot food bar selection I have ever seen (outside of K-town).  Or, they have sports playing at their wine bar on a regular basis!Foodease is hard to miss because it is part of the food court in the Watertower Mall.  Needless to say, it is an upscale foodee place that has a ton of small specialty items on the side.  The food bar is pretty extensive, from salad stuff to italian (pastas and chicken parm) to american (meatloaf, chicken, etc) to chinese (pepper chicken from big bowl).  You can even get sushi and vegetarian selections.  If you do not like that (you must not like food), you can get a sandwich made or take a look at the bakery selection.For the sophisticated, you can grab a glass of wine from their extensive wine selection, while watching one of their cooking demonstrations.  I highly recommend it.You can get Jenni's Ice Cream here too! =)

1.description: Quick and convenient option if you're looking to grab a quick meal. Most of the options are priced by weight with lots of options in both the salad bar and hot entrees/sides bar. In addition, there's also a sandwich and sushi counter where you can order fresh food made to order. Be sure to stop by their wine shop to grab a bottle of wine if you please. Prices are pretty reasonable and you can have the bartender pop open the bottle for you if you choose to eat your food in their seating area. If you happen possess an out of state ID, stop by the Water Tower Place information desk and grab a visitor coupon book. Typically you can find a $5 off coupon in there!'Til next time, cheers!

55.description: Love this place for a quick mid-week lunch. I'm a sucker for the cold salad bar - they have a great variety of fresh toppings. They also have handy little snacks like single portion sized nuts, trail-mix and even angel food cake cupcakes. Tried their homemade white chocolate covered pretzels for the the first time yesterday and fell in love.

9.description: Sorry to say I was not impressed...I am not a fan of buffets but I thought this place might have better "fast food" fare for my flu-stricken body. Naw! The broccoli was too hard, i prefer my broccoli soft, but i guess thats the way they do it...Oh their Baked Chicken super dryyy! Like National Lampoons Turkey caving in on itself dry! Where the mashed potatoes? All this for $13? Noway!Perhaps because Im still not out of the flu zone this could have been better and therefore you will get 2 stars...But no mistake that chicken was dry as bones...Maybe next time Foodease but Im not racing back

26.description: I absolutely love the location and the variety of product you sell.  My one concern is over the hours of operations.  You seem to close early for a city as great as Chicago.  Overall, the food has me coming back at least every other time I visit the city.

25.description: I love this place.  It's my go-to for lunch.  They have a fresh variety of soups, sandwiches, and an extravagant salad bar that features hot items as well. They do small batch cooking so the food goes quick, which means it is always coming out fresh and often.  That is huge for a salad bar because most salad bars have items that have just been sitting there all day (gross).  It's always clean and the staff is friendly.  I'm a fan of their salads, soups, and even sushi - yes - it's good quality.  Tips:  There is extra seating around the side through the wine area. They are also part of the Lettuce Entertain You group so get some frequent diner points!

12.description: Another great LEYE place that's close to work. I've visited Foodease numerous times, but always got too overwhelmed with the all the delicious stations and salad bars to actually buy anything.  Mostly because Mburger next door always wins me over...that burger...Today I stopped in again with a craving for something sweet and saw the freezer with Jeni's Spendid Ice cream and Homer's Homemade Ice Cream and I immediately reached for those and got in line.  There goes my plan to eat a healthy salad today!  They also sell frozen Lou Malnatis deep dish pizza and other Leye frozen favorites.  Oh and the wine bar is pretty nice, too.

59.description: Why oh why are there not more of these!??? Reasonably priced (cheap actually), absolutely excellent selection, great location, and just a neat setup.  I love that I can get a Ham & Chesse Croissant, Mom's Chicken Salad, Sonoma Chicken Salad, Cinnamon Roll, Mexican Breakfast Chicquitos, Salmon Cakes with Spicy Mayo all in one seating!!! ... and its GOOD!! Love. Love. Love.

21.description: Hah! Love it Leave it to Chicago to do a mall right with a bad ass market restaurant with a wine bar.  27 restaurant appearances, enjoying a bottle of a San Francisco Pinot Noir ($9).  Hand washing station in lobby, tons of buffet style choices.  Trail mix nut section, bakery, chocolate closet (very tempting), sushi, sandwiches, soup bar, wine shop (great prices) quiet room, etc.  No need to leave the mall in the snow for a great fresh lunch.  At $5Per pound the buffet is a great value.  While mac n cheese, fried tofu and snow crab tomato and spinach was great the pork loin rocks!

17.description: Great. All kinds of foods. Seems like the only place to get healthy food. Taste good.

10.description: I remembered why I don't come here! I put a couple of leaves of salad on my plate and it came to nearly $12. EDM booming so loud you can't hear yourself think. People scrambling around the buffet lines in no particular order. A long, winding line. You make the mistake of making eye-contact with some salesman standing RIGHT NEXT TO THE LINE pimping bread and he throws an intense sales pitch at you.

5.description: Pleasantly surprised with the fresh salad bar and variety. If you are in water tower place and need a quick and healthier lunch option this is a must visit.

3.description: One of the things I have to get used to about Chicago is the bipolarity of the weather. In today's example, the sky immediately opened and poured down rain, so as to escape the muggy wetness, I decided to seek refuge in the Water Tower Place. It was then that I realized I hadn't eaten all day and as a new resident of the city, I chose to explore the building and the dining it had to offer.I was on a hunt to find a relatively inexpensive meal, quick, simple, yet fulfilling. One of their security guards informed me of Foodease in the Mezzanine, so I headed that way. At first I was super disappointed because I thought this was going to be disgusting cafeteria food (should've known better, considering this is CHICAGO) but to my surprise, this was probably the freshest, tasty buffet style cafeteria food I have had in my life.What also surpassed all expectations were the variety of food nationalities offered, and the health conscious options. I selected the herb roasted chicken breast, steamed broccoli, lemon mushrooms, and the tarragon turkey. Every single aspect of this lunch was perfection. What was even better was the PRICE! I got all of this for just under $10 with a cup of water. You can't beat that. You go in, pick your food, grab a drink,  check out, and within 10 minutes (if that) you're sitting down enjoying your meal.

35.description: If I lived in Chicago, I would stop by here pretty often as they had a nice to-go food counter, yummy bread, lots of gourmet food (I bought lemon sea salt popcorn that you pop yourself), lots of variety, fruit, vegetables - and it all looked so good and fresh.  Stylish, mostly reasonably priced and friendly help.

19.description: I wandered into this market after a long day of shopping.  I went in for soup to take back to my hotel room for a late dinner.  There were so many delicious looking items at the salad bar.  I could've easily walked out with a variety of food, but I stuck to my plan.  I selected the Mediterranean Lentil soup and Oyster Crackers.  The soup had a nice flavor and was very hearty due to the lentils. It was also Vegan! My cashier was Tyler T.  He was very friendly and made sure to pack up my soup carefully so I could carry it back to my hotel.  He also gave me suggestions for places that I should visit during my trip.  Excellent Food and Service!

28.description: I go there for lunch because one of perks for working at the Hancock is a 10% discount on their buffet items. Good food selection, gets very crowded between 11:30 and 2:00. The quality of food is very good! Very good and rich salad bar, very good hot buffet.

45.description: I've heard great things about this place from my friend who lives near Water Tower Place and goes to Foodease Market at least once a week. After hearing him constantly rave about this place I decided to try it out. Well I can tell you this place is pretty darn swanky compared to other eating establishments you tend to find in a mall.My eyes and stomach were working overtime trying to process all the different food options. I decided to try the chinese station and let me tell you I am glad I did. I helped myself to some fried rice, and three different types of meats....oh and a chicken egg roll as well. My friend got salmon, mashed potatoes and a crab cake. I figured I'd sample some of his food since I could use the excuse of having never been here so needing to try it. Everything that I ate here was really good and everything I didn't eat looked really good. However, when the cashier weighed my food and told me $22 I almost passed out. I mean $22 for Chinese food?!? $22 for food in a mall?!? I reluctantly gave her my credit card, but next time I know not to go crazy throwing everything into my to go container.

33.description: Cafeteria style done right! I find myself coming here quite often because of their great variety of food.  Their salad bar has tons of options and the yellow curry chicken from Big Bowl is delicious; I would suggest avoiding their tilapia though, I've had it twice and both times it has been dried out and not too tasty.  I always end up spending around $10 for my plate, so it is definitely not a cheap option.

43.description: a foodie's delightbright greens, crisp fruits, hot soups, galorethe name says it allmy first yelp haiku :) hope you enjoyed it, hah. if you don't want to read my detailed review (it is kinda long :)), i would say that i go to foodease because it's really close to where i work (convenient); i love their prepared salads (good value); and i just feel better about my day and my lunch choice after i go there. it has a kind of 'cool' vibe, if that makes sense--just a great mid-day pick-me-up. love it. try it. -----anyway, i'm a huge fan of all things 'lettuce entertain you.' if you haven't explored the massive variety the lettuce entertain you restaurant brand has to offer, start now! (google it).  i sometimes think of lettuce entertain you as the nordstrom of restaurants--consistently excellent customer service. great products. just generally great at what they're supposed to do--in the case of foodease, provide top notch food (including some from their other restaurants) with great 'ease'--hence the name. highlights: a) soup -- consistently have a nice (though not huge) variety of fresh-tasting soups. usually get the crazy chicken pasta soup (with unlimited free crackers) but opted for the indian daal the other day and was pleased. would be nice if they put nutrition facts on all the soups and not just the daal, though; b) prepared salads--they have 2 sizes, and the smaller $3.86 (with tax) size is perfect for a light lunch (most appetites might want something on the side too, though) and the walnuts, bleu cheese, green apple, chicken, greens, and a tasty vinaigrette is the perfect flavor combo. some salads taste just 'boring', and this one textually and taste-wise is wonderful and less sad 'desk salad' than others; c) you can't ignore the giant cold/hot salad bar when you walk into the store (oh, and can't ignore the great bar counter to the left!) -- reminiscent of whole foods (though smaller), and i always find i spend way too much money at those. even with the 10% student discount they offer on the weighed foods, it can be spendier than the prepared salads. (used to offer 10% on everything, but now just weighed foods which is a slight bummer); d) they seem to promote a generally 'healthy' food selection and have a lot of fresh fruit displayed right when you walk in. p.s. they have a back room area for overflow during the busy times--didn't find that out til a random staff member offered it. and they have a sink to wash your hands before eating--how public health of them!

2.description: Why no indicators or other Info for food ingredients? There are really nice options and a variety but was blown away that in this day and age you would not at least label dairy, nuts and maybe gluten too. It made navigating the salad bar and hot bar a lot more challenging than necessary. I was able to ask a random staff person stocking the cold bar and to his credit he was very happy to help me out, but it took a long time to see anyone I could ask. I do give them some points for offering plates and recycled box over the plastic Togo containers.

18.description: Good food at reasonable price. Perfect for lunch or breakfast. More then 68 local item to choose from.

41.description: The salad bar here is amazing with an unbelievable selection of options.  There are numerous types of leafy greens to get you started and about any toppings as you can imagine and many you never thought about.  From sprouts and shredded zucchini, diced cucumbers, carrots, peas, corn, edamame, chick peas, olives, peppers, etc... to meat and dairy options, you could go everyday for lunch and still find new things.  It also has many hot dishes like like potatoes, macaroni, meatloaf, cooked greens, chicken, etc..They have separate areas for sushi, soups, sandwiches and other preprepared options in case you need to grab and go.  I think the salad bar is better than the big Whole Foods in Old Town.  There will be fewer hot prepared items at Foodease, but the overall salad bar is wonderful.  It would be nice if Foodease, had a few more vegan soup options, but really, why have soup with that salad bar, anyway?

52.description: LETTUCE TAKE OVERHonestly our friends at "Lettuce Entertain You" have taken over all of the restaurants on this level of the Watertower. It doesn't matter where you eat because they are going to make money no matter what.This place reminds me of one of those small grocery stores you see on every New York City street corner. You know those stores that just have everything you could ever want for breakfast, lunch or dinner. This place has hot food, a salad bar, a bakery, sandwich counter, sushi counter, groceries, wine, a soup bar, gourmet deli and candy. Plus you can stop in the bar, at the exit and grab a few drinks. I must point out that the stores in New York do not have that bar feature but sometimes have packaged goods to enjoy out of a bag.I have grabbed a few bottles of wine here over time. In fact, when I joined there mailing list they sent me out a coupon for a bottle of wine for a few dollars. That was a great deal and a nice introduction to there wine selection.
